target: The significance of entrepreneurs in economic development of a nation cannot be overemphasised.

input: Bákan náà lótún rọ àwọn Akẹ́ẹ̀kọ́ láti jẹ́ Ọmọlúwàbí kí wọ́n siì jìnnà sí ẹgbẹ òkùnkùn nítorí pé ẹgbẹ́kẹ́gbẹ́ ń ba ìwà rere jẹ́.
target: He noted that the Academy recognised excellence and warned students to shun cultism and other vices.

input: Nínú ọ̀rọ̀ ti Ọ̀gá Àgbà fún gbogbo ẹ̀ka Abílekọ Nkiruka Okiche lòun ti ka ìlànà òfin iléìwé ọhún sí ẹtíìgbọ́ wọn.
target: Also speaking, representative of NBA Registrar, who is also head of administration, Mrs.Nkiruka Okiche, highlighted some of the rules and regulations and advised them to adhere strictly to them

input: Ọ̀gbẹ́ni Tanko Abdulahi tóun jẹ́ Ọ̀gá léka Ìgbẹ̀kọ́ naa gbà wọ́n níyànjú láti ní ẹ̀mí àti máa ṣe ìwádìí lóòrèkórè.
target: In a remark, Director of Academic Planning, Mr.Tanko Abdullahi advised the students to leave up to expectations and imbibe the spirit of embarking on research to broaden their horizon.

input: Ọ̀rọ̀ yìí ló jáde lásìkò tí àwọn ikọ̀ tí ń ṣàbẹ̀wò láti Àjọ FIFA tí alága àwọn agbábọ́ọ̀lù ní orílèdè yìí NFF Amaju Pinnik darí wọn lọ ṣe àbẹ̀wò sí gómìnà lọ́ọ́fìsì rẹ̀ ní Ìkẹjà.
target: Governor Sanwo-Olu stated this when the inspection team from FIFA led by the President Nigeria football Federation NFF Amaju Pinnick paid him a courtesy visit at the Lagos House, Ikeja.

input: Ó ní Ọriĺẹ̀-èdè yìí ti gbaradì fún eré Ìdárayá ẹlẹ́ẹ̀kẹrìndínlógún irú rẹ̀ tí wọ́n sì ti pèsè àyè sí ílu Benin city, Asaba àti Uyo.
target: Nigeria has put forward the cities, Benin City, Asaba, Uyo for hosting the sixteen nations final.

input: Sanwó-Olú ní ìpínlè Èkó pẹ̀lú ẹgbẹlẹmùkú ènìyàn tó lé ní Ogún mílíònù óní ìlú Èkó ní agbára, àti àwọn Ọ̀dọ́ lọ́lọ́kan òjòkan àti ọ̀yàyà láti gba àlejò, gẹ́gẹ́ bí ìlú kan gbòógì tí wọ́nti yà sọ́tọ̀ fún ìdíje tó ń bọ̀ yìí.
target: Governor Sanwo-Olu noted that with the population of over twenty million people the city of Lagos is full of energy, youthfulness and hospitable resourceful and dynamic people as one of the intended host cities for the competition.

input: Gómìnà, tún mú ẹnu ba ti ìpalẹ̀mọ́ Orin tó ń bò láìpẹ́ yìí, ó tún jẹ́ ọ̀nà ìmúgbòòrò ọrọ̀ ajé nípa ìrìn àjọ ìgbafẹ́.
target: According to the Governor, the state is billed to host the biggest global music festival next year and this will further boost and project its tourism, entertainment and cultural potential.

input: Amaju Picnic tó jẹ́ Ààrẹ fún Ẹgbẹ́ agbábóòlù ilẹ́ wa dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ Gómìnà fún ọ̀rọ̀ ìyànjù oníyebíye tóbá àwọn agbábọ́ọ̀lù Ọkùnrin àgbà sọ, ó tún fi kún pé àwọn ikọ̀ yìí wá fún ìrànwọ̀ ìjọba láti jẹ́ kí eré ìdárayá bọ́ọ̀lú aláfẹsẹ̀gbá ó tún mú òkè si.
target: The President of NFF, Amaju Pinnick who thanked governor Sanwo-Olu for encouraging the Male Senior National Team during the last AFCON tournament, said the team is in Lagos to seek support of the government in taking football to the highest level.

input: Àwọn Òǹkọ̀tàn wa ni wọ́n ti pè láti jígìrì kí Ìtàn, Àṣà àti Ìṣẹ̀ǹbáyé wa ó má bàá parun.
target: Authors in the country have been called to join the wagon of promoting the history, culture and tradition through their works, so as to protect the heritage of the nation.

input: Ọ̀rọ ̀ìrántí yìí ni Gómìnà Ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó Ọ̀gbẹ́ni Babájídé Sanwó-Olú pe gbogbo ènìyàn śi níbi ìfilọ́lẹ̀ ìwé mánigbàgbé kan tí wọ́n pè ní MÁTIKÚ tó wáyé ní Akọkà Yaba.
target: This call was made by the Governor of Lagos State, Mr Babajide Sanwo-Olu at the launching of historical book, Matiku, at Akoka, Lagos.

input: Gomina dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ òǹkọ̀tàn yìí fún bí o ṣe kọ ìwé ọ̀hún nípa ìtàn Ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó ó tún ṣe ìlérí pé ìjọba yóò ma lé iwájú nínú Ìfẹ́ Ìṣọ̀kan àti ṣíṣe àgbélárugẹ àṣà.
target: Mr.Sanwo-Olu, who applauded the author of the book for focusing the book on the history of Lagos, noted that it will help call attention to the need to uphold what the state stands for which are excellence, peace, selflessness and unity.

input: Ṣé oníìkàn laajẹ́ ó ṣe, Oǹkọ̀tàn yìí Ọ̀gbéni Ẹlésin tó kọ ìwé yìí ní ojúṣe àwọn oǹkọ̀tàn ni láti má kọ ìtàn mánigbàgbé àti èròńgbà lórí ìwé yìí pé yóò se àfihàn ojúlówó ọmọ èkó tòóótó.
target: In an address, the author of the book, Mr.Elesin explained that it is the responsibility of all authors to fight history erosion through their works hence his decision to write the book to teach and draw attention to the true identity of Lagos.

input: Bákán náà lótún rọ àwọn ọ̀dọ́ láti máṣe gbàgbé ìtán ibi tí wọ́n t́i ṣẹ̀ wá nítorí pé orírun wọn nìyẹn àti àmì ìdánimọ̀ wọn.
target: He also advised the youths not to forget their history as it is the source of their identity.

input: Ilé ẹjọ́ to ńgbọ́ ẹjó lẹ́yìn ìdìbò PEPT ni wọn yóò ṣe ìfilọ́lẹ̀ ìgbẹ́jọ́ ẹ̀ka ti olú ìlú Àbújá ní ilé ẹjọ́ kò tẹ́milọ́rùn.
target: The Presidential Election Petition Tribunal PEPT, will hold its inaugural session today at the Abuja Division of the Court of Appeal.

input: Tí wọ́n sì ti to ẹjọ́ mérin tí wọ́n kọ́kọ́ fé gbọ́ sì́lẹ̀ ,
target: The Tribunal listed four petitions for mention,

input: Àkọ́kọ́ ni ti Ẹgbẹ́ Òṣèlú Hope Democràtic Party HPD àti Ọ̀gbẹ́ni Ambrose Owuru, tó ń polongo ara rẹ̀ ní olùdíje fún Ààrẹ ẹgbẹ́ náà
target: The first was filed by Hope Democratic Party, HDP and Mr.Ambrose Owuru, who claimed to be the party’s presidential candidate.

input: Ẹlẹ́èkejì ni ti Ẹgbẹ́ Ọ̀ṣèlù PDP tí Alhaji Àtiku Abubakar sì jẹ́ Olùdíje fún ipo Ààrẹ.
target: The Second was filed by Peoples Democratic Party, PDP, and its candidate in the election Alhaji Atiku Abubakar.

input: Coalition for Change ni ejọ́ tóun jẹ́ ẹlẹ́èkẹ́ta, tí Jeff Ojinika Ẹni tó ń polongo ararẹ̀ gẹ́gẹ́ bíi olùdíje Ààrẹ ẹgbẹ́ náà
target: The third was filed by the Coalition for Change and Mr.Jeff Ojinika who claimed to be the party’s presidential candidate.

input: Ìgbẹ́jọ́ tó ṣìkẹrin ni ti Ẹgbẹ́ People’s Democràtic Movement PDM eleyìí ti òjíṣẹ́ Olúwa Aminchi Abu tóun náà ń polongo ara rẹ̀ gẹ́gẹ́ bíi olùdíje fún ipò Ààrẹ ẹgbẹ́ náà
target: The fourth petition was filed by the People’s Democratic Movement, PDM and Pastor Aminchi Habu who claimed to be the party’s presidential candidate.

input: Ààrẹ Buhari ti tún fi ọwọ́ sọ̀yà pé òun ò ní já ọmọ Orílẹ̀ èdè yìí kulẹ̀ ní ìgbà kan-kan lórí Ìdánilẹ́èkọ́ nípá ìwùwà sí asájú, Ètò ààbò tó péye àti ìgbé ayé ìrọ̀rùn fún gbogbo Ọmọ ilẹ̀ yìí.
target: President Muhammadu Buhari has assured Nigerians that his government will not let them down in providing effective and result-oriented leadership that safeguard and ensures a better life for citizens.

input: Ààrẹ rọ àwọn Mùsùlùmí láti máa ní Ìkóra ẹni ní Ìjánu làsìkò lámú-lánà.
target: The President urged Muslim faithful that discipline should be their watchword during this Ramadan.

input: Imam Mọshalashi yìí Sheik Abdul-Waheed Sulaimon naa tún pàrọwà fún ìrònúpìwàdà àti àdúrà kí orílẹ̀̀-edè wa ba lè ní ààbò tó peye.
target: In his remarks, the Chief Imam of the Mosque Sheik Abdulwaheed Suleiman called for prayers to curtail the current security challenges confronting the country.

input: Bí ọdún se n súnmọ́ ni àwọn olùgbé ìpínlẹ̀ Eko ti fajúro bí ojà se gbé owó lérí tó sì gaju agbára wọn lọ, tí kòsì mú ayé dẹrùn fún mùtúmùwà
target: As the Eid-El-Kabir draws near, Lagosians have expressed their displeasure over the increase in prices of goods in the market which has made life unbearable for them.

input: Lára àwọn ènìyàn tí ó bá iléṣe Bond FM sọ̀rọ̀ so pé ohun gbogbo ló gbe owó lórí kọ́já sísọ ní ọjà tí ósì jẹ́ kí àti la irúfẹ́ àkókò yìí kojá nira fún àwọn ènìyàn.
target: Some Lagosians who spoke with Bond FM said lack of fund to meet the excessive increase in prices of goods in the market has made survival difficult for them.

input: Wọ́n rawọ́ ẹ̀bẹ̀ sí ìjoba Àpapọ̀ láti wá nǹkan ṣe síi, àtipé lílọbíbọ̀ owó láàrin ìlú leè jẹ́ kí ọrọ̀ ajé lọ sókè síi, ásì tún jẹ́kí ìgbé ayé ìdẹ̀rùn wà fún gbogbo mùtúmùwà.
target: They appealed to the government to put in place measures to ensure free-flow of money in the nation so as to boost economic activity, improving their standard of living.

input: Akínrógun ìlú Èpé Ọ̀túnba Dẹngẹ Anífowóṣe ti késí gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀-èdè yìí ĺáti sowópọ pẹ̀lú Ààrẹ Buhari fún ìyípadà rere fún ilẹ̀ wa.
target: Akinrogun of Epe Land, Otunba Denge Anifowose has urged Nigerians to support President Muhammadu Buhari in his quest to transform the country.

input: Ó ní èròńgbà àti tún ìlú ṣe èyí tó ṣe ìrànwọ́ fún un láti wọlé lẹ́lẹ́kèejì.
target: He said that President Buhari has good intentions to make the country better which helped to win another election.

input: Ọ̀túnba Anífowóṣe ní sáà kejì yóò mú ìyípadà ọ̀tun wá bí Àarẹ ṣe ti fi ipa rẹ̀ lélẹ̀ fún orílèdè yìí.
target: Otunba Anifowose said the second term of President Muhammadu Buhari would witness rapid development because he had laid a solid foundation for the country.

input: Ó tún dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ àwọn olùgbé ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó bí wọ́n ṣe dìbò lópò yanturu fi gbé Gómìnà Sanwó-Olú wọlé àti pé gómìnà yìí ní ìmọ̀ ìjìnlẹ̀ láti leè ṣọ ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó di ìlú àpéwò fún àwọn Oníṣòwò.
target: He also commended Lagosians for voting for Mr.Babajide Sanwo-Olu as Governor of the state, noted that Mr.Sanwo-Olu has experience and skills that would help the state to be an investors friendly.

input: Ọ̀tùnba Dẹngẹ nígbà tó ń kí Gómìnà tó kógbá wọlé, ìyẹn Akinwunmi Ambọde pé ìtẹ̀síwájú rẹ̀ á dára àti pé Sanwó-Olú yóò ma tẹ̀síwájú nínú àlàálẹ̀ Asíwáju wọn.
target: Otunba Anifowosoe while wishing outgoing Governor Mr.Akinwunmi Ambode well in future endeavours said that Mr.Sanwo-Olu would continue from where he stopped to build on the legacy of the founding fathers of Lagos State.

input: Ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó ti ń ṣe ètò lábẹ́nú láti kọ́ ẹ̀kún ilé ìwòsán ìjọba tó wà ní ìdàgbàsókè Àmúwò-Ọdòfin.
target: Plans are underway by the Lagos State Government, to a General Hospital in the Amuwo Odofin Council Area.

input: Igbá kejì Ọ̀gá àgbà àjọ elétò ìlera Dókítà Olúfúnmilọla Èṣhọ́ ló sọ ọ̀rọ̀ yìí níbi ìpàdé tó lọ ṣe ní́ ilé ìwòsàn yìí lẹ́ka ti ìgbẹ̀bí àti ọmọ wẹ́wẹ́ ‘
target: An Assistant Director of Medical Services at the State Health Service Commission, Dr.Olufunmilola Esho, stated this at a stakeholders meeting of the Amuwo-Odofin Maternal and Child Centre.

input: Dókítà Ẹ̀shọ́ ní ìjọba ń gbèrò láti kọ́ ẹ̀kún ilé ìwòsàn yìí kí ó le tó lò fún àwọn olùgbé àgbègbè náà.
target: A statement issued by Dr.Esho says, the state government was planning to build the hospital, so as to cater for the growing population of residents in the area.

input: Bẹ́ẹ̀ lótún rọ àwọn tórí jájẹ lágbègbè ọ̀hún láti kún ìjọba lọ́wọ́, kí wọn fi leè pèsè ìwòsàn tó yanrantí, tí owó rẹ̀ kò sì gunpá fún àwọn ènìyàn
target: The medical expert however made a renewed call on corporate bodies and wealthy individuals in the country to support the government in providing qualitative and affordable health care for the people.

input: Ó ní ọjọ́ keje nínú oṣù kẹfà ni Àjọ tó ń ṣe àkóso ẹ̀kọ́ nílẹ̀yí ti fi ìwé ṣọwọ́ sí gbogbo Aláṣe ilé ẹ̀kọ́ pátá-pátá láti da àwọn Olùkọ́ tí kò kúnjú òṣùwọ̀n dúró jákè-jádò ilẹ̀ yìí.
target: According to him, the Federal Ministry of Education had on June 7 2019, sent a circular to all Principals on the December 31 deadline for unqualified teachers to leave the teaching profession in the country.The TRCN registrar noted that Nigeria needs quality teachers to deliver quality education.

input: Ó rọ àwọn tí kòì forúkọ sílẹ̀ láti lọ fi orúkọ sílẹ̀ kí àsìkò tí wọ́n fún wọn tó pé.
target: He urged those that had not registered to take the opportunity of the qualifying tests to do so before the deadline.

input: Wọ́n ti rọ àwọn Ọ̀gá nínú eré ìdárayá láti má mójútó àwọn ọ̀dọ́ agbábọ́ọ̀lùjẹun láti kìlò fún won nídi lílo egbògi olóró pàápàá bí wọ́n ṣe ń gbe láwọn ẹsẹ̀ kùkú àti pé kò le rorún fún ìjọba nìkan láti dáwọn lẹ́kun ìwà yìí.
target: Stakeholders in the sporting industry in the country have been charged to be more active in rescuing the youth from drug abuse and trafficking through sports especially at the grassroots level as government alone cannot fight the menace.

input: Ògbóntàrigì nínú ẹgbẹ́ òṣèlù APC Ọ̀gbẹ́ni Wálé Adélànà ló ké gbànjarè ọ̀rọ̀ yìí níbi àyájọ́ gbígbé Ogunti Oògùn olóró eléyìí tí àjọ àgbáyé yà sọ́tọ̀.
target: The plea was made by a chieftain of the ruling All Progressives Congress, APC in Lagos State Mr.Wale Adelana on the occasion of international day against drug abuse and trafficking, set aside by the United Nations.

input: Ọ̀gbẹ́ni Adélàná ní ilèkùn àjọ kàn lọ̀rọ̀ yìí tí ó sì ti dan-dan fún gbogbo ojúlówó ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè yìí láti sowọ́pọ̀ pẹ̀lú àjọ tó ń kìlọ̀ ìwà ìbàjẹ́ nítorí pé àwọn ọ̀dọ́ èní laṣiwajú orílẹ̀ èdè yìí tóbá di lọ́la.
target: Mr.Adelana said it became imperative for all well-meaning Nigerians to team up and find lasting solutions to the abuse of drugs especially among teenagers as they are the future of the nation.

input: Bákan náà lótún pe àwọn Òbí àti Alágbàtó sí àkíyèsí láti wo irúfẹ́ àwọn ọ̀rẹ́ tí ọmọ wọn ń bá rìn.
target: He also appealed to parents and guardians to be watchful of friends their children are moving with.

input: Ṣí́ṣe ìmójútó àṣà wa àti ṣíṣe àkọsílè ẹ̀ ni wọ́n ní ó tidi dan-dan fún ọmọ Nàìjíríà, láti leè fi ran àwọn ìran tó ńbọ̀ lọ́wọ́
target: The need for Nigerians to take their history and culture heritage seriously by documenting them so as to preserve it for generations to come, has been emphasized.

input: Igbákej̀i Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Ògun Onímọ̀-Ẹ̀rọ Noimọt Sàlàkọ́ Oyèdélé ló pe ìpè ìtaníjí yìí níbi ìfilọ́lẹ̀ ìwé tí wọ́n pè ní Ìlú Ọ̀tà Àwórì tó wáyé ní Maryland ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó.
target: The Deputy Governor of Ogun State, Mrs.Nayimot Oyedele stressed this a book launch on Ota Awori Kingdom in Maryland, Ikeja.

input: Oyèdélé to gbóṣùbà fún Òǹkọ̀wé tó sì tún ní kí àwọn òǹkọ̀wé tókù ó kọ́ṣe lára wọn káwọn náá ò kọ ìtàn mánigbàgbé tí yòò wúlò fún àṣà wa lọ́jọ́́ iwájú.
target: Mrs.Oyedele who lauded the authors of the book for deeming it fit to give proper documentation to the history of Awori’s said it will be wise for other authors in the country to join the wagon of history documentation to preserve the Nigerian history.

input: Lọ̀rọ̀ tí kábíyèsí Ọba Abdu Kabir Adéyẹmí Oba Lánlẹ́gẹ́ Ọlótà ti ilú Ọ̀tà tó ní ìlú Ọ̀tà ni àkọ́kọ́ nínú ilẹ̀ Àwórì tó kọ́kọ́ ṣe ìwé ìtàn.
target: In his address, the Olota of Ota, Oba Adeyemi Abudukabir who said that Ota is the foremost town among the Awori people, stated that the documentation of the history of Awori’s is apt for the preservation of history.

input: Nínú ọ̀rọ̀ tí Sínétọ̀ tó ń ṣojú fún Ìwọ̀-Oòrùn ìpínlẹ̀ Ogun Aṣòfin Tolú Ọdẹ́bíyìí lóti rọ àwọn ẹ́ka ètò ẹ̀kọ́ láti má kọ́ àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ̀ ní ìtàn ilẹ̀ wa tó sì tún késí àwọn òbi láti má sọ ìtàn fún àwọn ọmọ wọn.
target: On his part, the Senator representing Ogun West, Senator Olu Odebiyi who called on the stakeholders in education to give utmost priority to history in the nation’s educational curriculum, urged parents not to fail to project and teach their children.

input: Ọ̀gbẹ́ni Frank Akinọlá ní ó yẹ kí àwọn ẹ̀yà Àwórì ó mọ orírun àti Àṣa wọn èyí tó sì jẹ́ ìwúrí fún un láti ka ìwé òhun lákà tún kà.
target: On his part, a co-author of the book, Mr.Frank Akinola said the need to give the people of Awori Land an understanding of their origin and cultural heritage, inspired him to read the book.

input: Ìròyìn yájó yàjó tó désí yàrá ìròyìn wa ní pe, ilé Alájà méta kan tó ẁa ní agbègbè Fágbà ìjú ní ìpínlẹ̀ èkó ti dà wó lulẹ̀.
target: Reports reaching our newsroom, says a three-story building has collapsed at a popular farm yard in Fagba area, off Iju road of Lagos.

input: Nínú ìròyìn tó tẹ̀wá lọ́wọ́ ni pé àwọn ènìyàn tí ìjànbá náà kọlù ni wọ́n tikó kúrò níbẹ̀ tí wọn sìti gbé àwọn tó farapa lọsí ilé ìwòsàn níbi tí wọ́n tí ń gba ìtọ́jú.
target: According to the report, affected people have been evacuated while the injured people are rescued and responding to treatment.

input: Wọ́n ní ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ yìí kò gba ẹ̀mí kọkan tí àwọn ẹ̀ṣọ́ aláàbò ni ẹ̀ka elétò pàjáwìrì sì ti wà níbẹ̀
target: Though no casualty was recorded all agencies in charge of disaster management are reported to be on ground at the site.

input: Ìròyìn fiyé wa wí pé ilé ọ̀hún ni ìjọba máa wolulẹ̀ fún ìfọ̀kànbalẹ̀ àwọn olùgbé àgbègbè yìí.
target: Report revealed that the building will be pulled to ground zero for safety of the people living in the area.

target: This guide will teach you how to threat model, or how to assess your risks for your digital information and how to determine what solutions are best for you.

target: What might threat modeling look like Let’s say you want to keep your house and possessions safe, here are a few questions you might ask

input: Kí ni mo ní nínú iléè mi tí ó yẹ kí n dá ààbò bò
target: What do I have inside my home that is worth protecting

input: Nǹkan-ìní lè jẹ́ ẹ̀ṣọ́, ẹ̀rọ ilé gbogbo, ìwé-owó, ìwé-ìrìnnà tàbí àwòrán
target: jewelry, electronics, financial documents, passports, or photos

input: Nítorí tani ni mo ṣe fẹ́ ṣe ìdáààbòbò
target: Who do I want to protect it from

input: Ọ̀tá lè jẹ́ fọ́léfọ́lé, alábàágbé, tàbí àlejò.
target: burglars, roommates, or guests

input: Báwo ni ó ṣe pọn dandan tó fún mi láti dáàbò bò ó
target: How likely is it that I will need to protect it

input: Ǹjẹ́ aládùúgbò ní ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀-àtẹ̀yìnwáa ìfọ́lé
target: Does my neighborhood have a history of burglaries

input: Ǹjẹ́ alábàágbéè miàlejò jẹ́ olùfọkàntàn
target: How trustworthy are my roommatesguests

input: Báwo l’agbára ọ̀táà mi ṣe tó
target: What are the capabilities of my adversaries

input: Àwọn ewu wo ló yẹ kí n gbéyẹ̀wò
target: What are the risks I should consider

input: Báwo ni ìpalára yóò ṣe tó bí a bá kùnà
target: How bad are the consequences if I fail

input: Ǹjẹ́ mo ní nǹkankan nínú ilé tí n kò le è pààrọ̀ọ rẹ̀
target: Do I have anything in my house that I cannot replace

input: Ǹjẹ́ mo ní àkókò tàbí owó láti pààrọ̀ nǹkan wọ̀nyí
target: Do I have the time or money to replace these things

input: Ǹjẹ́ mo ní àǹfààní adójútòfò fún ẹrù tí a bá jí nínú iléè mi
target: Do I have insurance that covers goods stolen from my home

input: Wàhálà mélòó ni mo lè là kọjá láti fi ààbò fún ìpalára wọ̀nwọ̀nyí
target: How much trouble am I willing to go through to prevent these consequences

input: Ǹjẹ́ mo fẹ́ ra àpótí-ìpamọ́ fún ìwé tó ṣe kókó
target: Am I willing to buy a safe for sensitive documents

input: ṣe mo lè ra ojúlówó àgádángodo bí
target: Can I afford to buy a high-quality lock

input: Ǹjẹ́ mo ní ààyè láti ṣí àpótí ààbò sílé ìfowópamọ̀ fún ìkópamọ́ nǹkan owó iyebíyeè mi
target: Do I have time to open a security box at my local bank and keep my valuables there

input: Ní kété tí o bá ṣe ìbéèrè wọ̀nyí, ó ní ààyè láti díyelé ọ̀nà tí o ó gbà.
target: Once you have asked yourself these questions, you are in a position to assess what measures to take.

input: Bí nǹkan-ìníì rẹ bá jẹ́ iyebíye, ṣùgbọ́n ewu ìfọwọ́lé dínkù, o lè máà fẹ́ náwó tó pọ̀ sórí àgádángodo.
target: If your possessions are valuable, but the risk of a break-in is low, then you may not want to invest too much money in a lock.

input: Àmọ́, bí ewú bá gara tó bẹ́ẹ̀, o máa fẹ́ ra àgádángodo tó ń bẹ lọ́jà, àti ríra ẹ̀rọ ìdáààbòbò.
target: But, if the risk is high, you’ll want to get the best lock on the market, and consider adding a security system.

input: Kíkọ́ àwòṣe ìdẹ́rùbà yóò mú ọ lóye ìbẹ̀rù tí ó bá ọ mu àti láti ṣ'àyẹ̀wò nǹkan-ìníì rẹ, ọ̀táà rẹ àti akitiyan ọ̀táà rẹ, pẹ̀lú irú ewu tí ó ń kojúù rẹ.
target: Building a threat model will help you to understand threats that are unique to you and to evaluate your assets, your adversaries, and your adversaries' capabilities, along with the likelihood of risks you face.

input: Kín ni àwòṣe ìdẹ́rùbà àti níbo ni kí n ti bẹ̀rẹ̀
target: What is threat modeling and where do I start

input: Àwòṣe ìdẹ́rùbà á ràn ọ́ lọ́wọ́ láti dá ìdẹ́rùbàni mọ̀ àti pé yóò tọ́ka sí ẹni tí ó yẹ kí o pa araà rẹ mọ́ fún.Bí o bá ń kọ́ àwòṣe ìdẹ́rùbà, dáhùn ìbéèrè márùn-ún wọ̀nyí
target: Threat modeling helps you identify threats to the things you value and determine from whom you need to protect them.When building a threat model, answer these five questions

input: Kí ni mo fẹ́ fi ààbò bò
target: What do I want to protect

input: Ta ni mo fẹ́ pa á mọ́ fún
target: Who do I want to protect it from

input: Báwo ni ìpalára yóò ṣe tó bí n kò bá dá ààbò bò ó
target: How bad are the consequences if I fail

input: Báwo ló ṣe jẹ́ kókó fún mi láti dá ààbò bò ó
target: How likely is it that I will need to protect it

input: Wàhálà mélòó ni mo lè là kọjá láti máà jẹ́ kí ìpalára ó wáyé
target: How much trouble am I willing to go through to try to prevent potential consequences

input: Kí a gbé ìbéèrè yìí yẹ̀ wò fínnífínní.
target: Let’s take a closer look at each of these questions.

input: Kí ni mo fẹ́ dá ààbò bò
target: What do I want to protect

input: Ohun-ìní ni ohun tí ó jẹ́ ti iyebíye tí a sì fẹ́ dá ààbò bò.
target: An asset is something you value and want to protect.

input: Ní ti ààbò ẹ̀rọ-ayárabíàṣá, ohun-ìní jẹ́ oríṣi ìwífún kan.
target: In the context of digital security, an asset is usually some kind of information.

input: Fún àpẹẹrẹ, ímeèlì rẹ, alábàáṣe, iṣẹ́-ìjẹ́ esẹ̀kẹ̀sẹ̀, agbègbè rẹ àti fáìlì rẹ jẹ ohun-ìní tó ṣe kókó.
target: For example, your emails, contact lists, instant messages, location, and files are all possible assets.

input: Ohun-ìní ni ẹ̀rọ-ayárabíàṣá rẹ náà.
target: Your devices may also be assets.

input: Ka ohun-ìníì rẹ sílẹ̀ dátà tí o kọ pamọ́, ibi tí o kó o pamọ́ sí, ẹni tí ó lè lò ó àti àsémọ́ tí ò ní fi àyè gba ẹlòmíràn láti lò ó.
target: data that you keep, where it’s kept, who has access to it, and what stops others from accessing it.

input: Ta ni mo fẹ́ fi pamọ́ fún
target: Who do I want to protect it from

input: Láti dáhùn ìbéèrè yìí, ó pọn dandan láti dá ẹni tó lè fẹ́ takóró wọnú ìwífún-un rẹ ṣeṣẹ́ ibi.
target: To answer this question, it’s important to identify who might want to target you or your information.

input: Ọ̀tá ni ènìyàn tí ó jẹ́ ìdẹ́rùbà sí ohun-ìníì rẹ.
target: A person or entity that poses a threat to your assets is an adversary.

input: Àpẹẹrẹ ọ̀tá ni ọ̀gáà rẹ, olólùfẹ́ẹ̀ rẹ ti tẹ́lẹ̀, oníṣòwò ẹlẹgbẹ́ẹ rẹ̀, ìjọbaà rẹ, tàbí olè orí-ayélujára lórí ìṣàsopọ̀ gbogboògbò.
target: Examples of potential adversaries are your boss, your former partner, your business competition, your government, or a hacker on a public network.

input: Ṣe àkàsílẹ̀ ọ̀táà rẹ, tàbí àwọn tó máa fẹ́ jí ohun-ìníì rẹ.
target: Make a list of your adversaries, or those who might want to get ahold of your assets.

input: Àkàsílẹ̀ẹ rẹ lè ní ẹnìkọ̀ọ̀kan, àjọ ìjọba, tàbí àjọ-ìlú.
target: Your list may include individuals, a government agency, or corporations.

input: Ó ní íṣe pẹ̀lú ọ̀táà rẹ, nígbà mìíràn àkàsílẹ̀ yìí lè jẹ́ ohun tí ó fé mú ṣe ìparun lẹ́yìn tí o bá ti ṣe àwòṣe ìdẹ́rùbà.
target: Depending on who your adversaries are, under some circumstances this list might be something you want to destroy after you’re done threat modeling.

input: Báwo ni ìpalára ṣe burú tó bí n bá kùnà
target: How bad are the consequences if I fail

input: Ọ̀ná pọ̀ tí ọ̀tá lè dẹ́rùba dátà rẹ.
target: There are many ways that an adversary can threaten your data.

input: Fún àpẹẹrẹ, ọ̀tá lè ka ìtàkùrọ̀sọ ìkọ̀kọ̀ rẹ bí wọ́n bá wà lórí ìṣàsopọ̀, tàbí kí wọ́n pa dátà rẹ tàbí bà á jẹ́.
target: For example, an adversary can read your private communications as they pass through the network, or they can delete or corrupt your data.

input: Ètè ọ̀tá yàtọ̀ síra wọn, bẹ́ẹ̀ náà ni ìdojúkọ wọn.
target: The motives of adversaries differ widely, as do their attacks.

input: Ìjọba tó ń gbìyànjú láti pa àwòrán fídíò ọlọ́pàá tó ṣìṣe rẹ́ le jẹ ohun láti parun tàbí dín ìṣàbápàdée rẹ̀ kù.
target: A government trying to prevent the spread of a video showing police violence may be content to simply delete or reduce the availability of that video.

input: Ìdàkejì, olóṣèlú kejì lè rí ìwífún jí tí yóò sì tẹ̀ ẹ́ jáde, o ò sì ní mọ̀.
target: In contrast, a political opponent may wish to gain access to secret content and publish that content without you knowing.

input: Àwòṣe ìdẹ́rùbani ní í ṣe pẹ̀lú ìwòye bí ìpalára ṣe lè rí bí ọ̀tá bá yege níbi ìkọlù ohun-ìníì rẹ.
target: Threat modeling involves understanding how bad the consequences could be if an adversary successfully attacks one of your assets.

input: Láti mọ èyí, o ní láti gbé ipá ọ̀táà rẹ wò.
target: To determine this, you should consider the capability of your adversary.

input: Fún àpẹẹrẹ, ilé-iṣẹ́ ẹ̀rọ-ìbánisọ̀rọ̀ọ ní àkọsílẹ̀ gbogbo ìtàkùrọ̀sọọ̀ rẹ ní àrọ́wọ́tó àti pé wọ́n lè lo àkọsílẹ̀ yìí fún iṣẹ́ẹ láabi.
target: For example, your mobile phone provider has access to all your phone records and thus has the capability to use that data against you.

input: Olè orí ẹ̀rọ ayélujára lè fi ìṣàsopọ̀  WiFi ṣíṣísílẹ̀ r’áàyè wọ ìtàkùrọ̀sọọ̀ rẹ tí a kò yí-dátà-padà-sí-odù-ààbò.
target: A hacker on an open Wi-Fi network can access your unencrypted communications.

input: Ìjọbaà rẹ lè ní ààyè tí ó lágbára láti ṣèyí.
target: Your government might have stronger capabilities.

input: Kọ ète àti àwọn ohun tí ọ̀táà rẹ lè fẹ́ fi dátà ìkọ̀kọ̀ rẹ ṣe sílẹ̀.
target: Write down what your adversary might want to do with your private data.

input: Kí ni atọ́ka wípé n óò ní láti dá ààbò bò ó
target: How likely is it that I will need to protect it

input: Ewu jẹ́ atọ́ka wípé ìdẹ́rùbà kan ṣì ohun-ìní kan yóò wáyé.
target: Risk is the likelihood that a particular threat against a particular asset will actually occur.

input: Ó bá ìpójú òṣùwọ̀n mu.
target: It goes hand-in-hand with capability.

input: Bí ẹ̀rọ-ìbánisọ̀rọ̀ọ alágbèékáà rẹ ṣe pé ojú òṣùwọ̀n tó láti lo dátà rẹ gbogbo, ewu gbígbé dátà ìkọ̀kọ̀ rẹ sí gbangba lórí ayélujára láti ṣàkóbá fún ọ bíntín.
target: While your mobile phone provider has the capability to access all of your data, the risk of them posting your private data online to harm your reputation is low.

input: Ó pọn dandan láti ṣe ìyàsọ́tọ̀ láàárín ìdẹ́rùbà àti ewu.
target: It is important to distinguish between threats and risks.

input: Nígbà tí ìdẹ́rùbà jẹ́ nǹkan aburú tí ó lè ṣẹlẹ̀, ewú jẹ́ atọ́ka wípé ìdẹ́rùbà yóò wáyé.
target: While a threat is a bad thing that can happen, risk is the likelihood that the threat will occur.

input: Fún àlàyé, ó ní ìdẹ́rùbà wípé iléè rẹ yóò wó lulẹ̀, ṣùgbọ́n ewu yìí pọ̀ ní San Francisco níbi tí ìṣẹ́lẹ̀ ilẹ mímì ti wọ́pọ̀ ju Stockholm tí ò sí ìṣẹ́lẹ̀.
target: For instance, there is a threat that your building might collapse, but the risk of this happening is far greater in San Francisco where earthquakes are common than in Stockholm where they are not.

input: Ṣíṣe àyẹ̀wò ewu jẹ́ ìgbésẹ̀ olúkálùkù gbogbo ènìyàn kọ́ ló ní ìṣáájú kan náà tàbí ìwò ìdẹ́rùbà lójú wò kan náà.
target: Conducting a risk analysis is both a personal and a subjective process not everyone has the same priorities or views threats in the same way.

input: Ọ̀pọ̀ ènìyàn kì í gba àwọn ìdẹ́rùbà kan, kò sí bí ewu náà ò báà ṣe rí, nítorí ìwà ìdẹ́rùbà nígbàkugbà kò dára rárá.
target: Many people find certain threats unacceptable no matter what the risk, because the mere presence of the threat at any likelihood is not worth the cost.

input: Nígbà mìíràn, àwọn èèyàn á máa ṣe àìkàsí ewu ńlá nítorí wọ́n kò rí ìdẹ́rùbà gẹ́gẹ́ bí ìṣòro.
target: In other cases, people disregard high risks because they don't view the threat as a problem.

input: Kọ ìdẹ́rùbà tí o ní láti mú ní òkúnkúndùn, àti t'ó sunwọ̀n tàbí t'ó léwu tó bẹ́ẹ̀ tàbí tí ó nira láti kọju láti yọra ẹni lẹ́nu lé lórí.
target: Write down which threats you are going to take seriously, and which may be too rare or too harmless or too difficult to combat to worry about.

input: Ìyọnu mélòó ni mo lè là kọjá láti máà jẹ́ kí ìpalára ó wáyé
target: How much trouble am I willing to go through to try to prevent potential consequences

input: Ìdáhùn sí ìbéèrè yìí nílòo àyẹ̀wò ewu.
target: Answering this question requires conducting the risk analysis.

input: Gbogbo èèyàn kọ́ ló ní ìṣáájú tàbí ìrí ìdẹ́rùbà lọ́nà kan náà.
target: Not everyone has the same priorities or views threats in the same way.

input: Fún àpẹẹrẹ, aṣojú oníbàárà ní ìgbẹ́jọ́ ààbò ìjọba àpapọ̀ máa fẹ́ ṣe ju bó ṣe yẹ lọ láti dá ààbò bo ìjùmọ̀sọ̀rọ̀ ẹjọ́ náà, nípa lílo ímeelì ìyí-dátà-padà-sí-odù-ààbò, ju ìyá tí ó máa ń fi iṣẹ́-ìjẹ́ ímeelì àwòrán ológbò aláwàdà ránṣẹ́ sí ọmọ rẹ̀ obìnrin ní gbogbo ìgbà.
target: For example, an attorney representing a client in a national security case would probably be willing to go to greater lengths to protect communications about that case, such as using encrypted email, than a mother who regularly emails her daughter funny cat videos.

input: Kọ ìyàn tí o ní láti fi gbógunti ìdẹ́rùbà rẹ sílẹ̀.
target: Write down what options you have available to you to help mitigate your unique threats.

input: Ṣàkíyèsí bí o bá ní ìfàsẹ́yìn owó, ìfàsẹ́yìn ẹ̀rọ, tàbí ìfàsẹ́yìn ìkẹ́gbẹ́.
target: Note if you have any financial constraints, technical constraints, or social constraints.

input: Ìṣe àwòṣe ìdẹ́rùbà olóòrékóòrè
target: Threat modeling as a regular practice

input: Fi sọ́kàn wípé àwòṣe ìdẹ́rùbà lè yí padà nípa ìgbàtàkókò.
target: Keep in mind your threat model can change as your situation changes.

input: Sí bẹ́ẹ̀, ìṣàgbéyẹ̀wò àwòṣe ìdẹ́rùbà lóòrèkóòrè jẹ ìṣe tó dára.
target: Thus, conducting frequent threat modeling assessments is good practice.

input: Ṣẹ̀dáa àwòṣe ìdẹ́rùbà tìrẹ fún ìrẹ.
target: Create your own threat model based on your own unique situation.

input: Fa ilà sórí kàlẹ́ńdà rẹ fún ọjọ́ iwájú.
target: Then mark your calendar for a date in the future.

input: Èyí yóò ta ọ́ l'ólobó láti ṣe àtúnyẹ̀wò àwòṣe ìdẹ́rùbàà rẹ àti láti yẹ̀ ẹ́ wò bóyá ó ṣì wúlò fún ọ gẹ́gẹ́ bí òǹlò.
target: This will prompt you to review your threat model and check back in to assess whether it’s still relevant to your situation.

input: Dídáààbò Araà rẹ lórí Ẹ̀rọ-alátagbà
target: Protecting Yourself on Social Networks

input: Ẹ̀rọ-alátagbà jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára ìbùdó-ìtàkùn lórí ẹ̀rọ-ayélujára.
target: Social networks are among the most popular websites on the Internet.

input: Facebook ní bílíọ̀nù èèyàn tó ń lò ó, àti Instagram àti Twitter ní ẹgbẹẹgbẹ̀rún mílíọ̀nù èèyàn tó ń lò ó.
target: Facebook has over a billion users, and Instagram and Twitter have hundreds of millions of users each.

input: A gbé ẹ̀rọ-alátagbà kalẹ̀ fún pínpín àyọkà, àwòrán àti ìwífún nípa ara ẹni.
target: Social networks were generally built on the idea of sharing posts, photographs, and personal information.

input: Ní báyìí ó ti di ibi-ìpéjọ fún ìkójọ àti ọ̀rọ̀.
target: Now they have also become forums for organizing and speech.

input: Báyìí, ìbéèrè wọ̀nyí ṣe kókó bí a bá ń lo ẹ̀rọ-alátagbà Báwo ni mo ṣe lè lo ẹ̀rọ-alátagbà wọ̀nyí nípasẹ̀ bẹ́ẹ̀ dáàbò araà mi
target: Thus,How can I interact with these sites while protecting myself

input: Ibi-ìkọ̀kọ̀ mi
target: My basic privacy

input: Ìdánimọ̀ọ mi
target: My identity

input: Ọ̀rẹ́ àti alábàáṣe
target: My contacts and associations

input: Ìwífún wo ni kí n tọ́jú pamọ́ àti pé ta ni kí n tọ́júu rẹ̀ pamọ́ fún
target: What information do I want keep private and who do I want to keep it private from

input: Ó dá lórí ohun ṣíṣe, ó lè nílò láti dáàbòbo araà rẹ láti de ẹ̀rọ-alátagbà fúnra rẹ̀, òǹlò mìíràn lórí ibùdó náà, tàbí méjèèjì
target: Depending on your circumstances, you may need to protect yourself against the social network itself, against other users of the site, or both

input: Olobó ohun tí ó yẹ kí o kíyèsí bí o bá ń ṣí ìṣàmúlò
target: Tips to Keep in Mind When Creating an Account

input: Ǹjẹ́ ìwọ́ fẹ́ lo orúkọ àbísọ rẹ
target: Do you want to use your real name

input: Ibùdó ẹ̀rọ-alátagbà mìíràn ní ìlànà orúkọ tòótọ́, ṣùgbọ́n èyí kò rí bẹ́ẹ̀ mọ́.
target: Some social media sites have so-called real name policies, but these have become more lax over time.

input: Bí o bá fẹ́ lo orúkọ àbísọ nígbàtí o bá ń forúkọ-sílẹ̀ lórí ẹ̀rọ-alátagbà, máà ṣe bẹ́ẹ̀.
target: If you do not want to use your real name when registering for a social media site, do not.

input: Bí o bá forúkọsílẹ̀, máà fi ìwífún rẹpẹtẹ ju bí ó ṣe yẹ lọ sílẹ̀.
target: When you register, don't provide more information than is necessary.

input: Bí o bá ní àníyàn láti fi ìdánimọ̀ọ rẹ pamọ́, kí o lo àdírẹ́ẹ̀sì ímeèlì tó yàtọ̀ àti kí o kọ̀ láti fi ilà ẹ̀rọ-ìbánisọ̀rọ̀ọ rẹ sílẹ̀.
target: If you are concerned with hiding your identity, use a separate email address and avoid giving your phone number.

input: Ìwífún méjèèjì wọ̀nyí tó fún ìdánimọ̀ olúkúlùkù àti pé ó ṣe é so ìṣàmúlò ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀ pọ̀.
target: Both of these pieces of information can identify you individually and can link different accounts together.

input: Ṣọ́ra bí o bá ń yan àwòrán ìdánimọ̀.

target: With so many companies and websites offering tools geared towards helping individuals improve their own digital security, how do you choose the tools that are right for you

target: It begins with understanding the unique threats you face and how you can counter those threats.

target: The first thing to remember before changing the software you use or buying new tools is that no tool or piece of software will give you absolute protection from surveillance in all circumstances.

input: Nítorí bẹ́ẹ̀, ó ṣe pàtàkì láti wòye nípa ìwà ààbò ẹ̀rọ ayélujára porongodo.

input: Fún àpẹẹrẹ, bí o bá fẹ́ ẹ́ lo irinṣẹ́ ààbò lórí ẹ̀rọ-alágbèékáà rẹ, síbẹ̀ máà fi ọ̀rọ̀-ìfiwọlé sórí ẹ̀rọ-ayárabíàṣáà rẹ, irinṣẹ́ orí ẹ̀rọ ìbánisọ̀rọ̀ rẹ lè máà ràn ọ́ lọ́wọ́ tó bẹ́ẹ̀.
target: For example, if you use secure tools on your phone, but don’t put a password on your computer, the tools on your phone might not help you much.

input: Bí ẹnì kan bá fẹ́ ẹ́ wá ìwífún nípa ìrẹ, ó máa yan ọ̀nà tó rọrùn jù láti rí ìwífún náà gbà dípòo ọ̀nà líle.
target: If someone wants to find out information about you, they will choose the easiest way to obtain that information, not the hardest.

input: Lọ́nà kejì, kò ṣeéṣe láti dá ààbò bo onírúurú ẹ̀tàn tàbí àdojúkọni, nítorí náà o ní láti f'ọkàn sí irú ènìyàn tí o lè fẹ́ jí ìwífún-ùn rẹ, ohun tí wọ́n fẹ́ fi ṣe, àti bí wọ́n ṣe lè rí i.
target: Secondly, it’s impossible to protect against every kind of trick or attacker, so you should concentrate on which people might want your data, what they might want from it, and how they might get it.

input: Bí olúborí ìdẹ́rùbà rẹ bá jẹ́ ìbojúwò ojúkorojú láti ọ̀dọ aṣèwádìí ìkọ̀kọ̀ kan tí ò rí àyè láti lo irinṣẹ́ ìbojúwò ẹ̀rọ-ayélujára, o kò nílò láti ra ẹ̀rọ-ìbánisọ̀rọ̀ọ owó iyebíye tí ó ń sọ ìwífún di odù fún ààbò tí ó ní NSA-proof
target: If your biggest threat is physical surveillance from a private investigator with no access to internet surveillance tools, you don't need to buy some expensive encrypted phone system that claims to be NSA-proof.

input: Gbígbé àkójọpọ̀ ìdojúkọ tí o  lọ́kàn láti fi ààbò bò ni à ń pè ní àwòṣe ìdẹ́rùbà.
target: Coming up with a set of possible attacks you plan to protect against is called threat modeling.

input: Pẹ̀lú gbogbo ìwọ̀nyí, ìwọ̀nyí ni ìbéèrè tí o lè ṣe kí o tó gba ẹ̀dà irinṣẹ́ sílẹ̀, rà á, tàbí lò ó.
target: Given all that, here are some questions you can ask about a tool before downloading, purchasing, or using it.

input: Báwo ni mímọ́ gaara rẹ̀ ti rí
target: How Transparent is it

target: There's a strong belief among security researchers that openness and transparency leads to more secure tools.

input: Ọ̀pọ̀ nínú iṣẹ́-àìrídìmú tí àwọn òǹlò ẹ̀rọ ayárabíàṣá ń lò tí wọ́n sì fi òǹtẹ̀ lù ni irinṣẹ́ fún lílò.
target: Much of the software the digital security community uses and recommends is open-source.

input: Èyí túmọ̀ sí wípé odù tí ó fi ń ṣiṣẹ́ ń wà ní gbangba fún ẹlòmíràn láti yẹ̀wò, túnṣe, àti ṣe àtúnpín.
target: This means the code that defines how it works is publicly available for others to examine, modify, and share.

input: Nípa mímọ́-gaara irinṣẹ́ẹ wọn, oníṣọnà irinṣẹ́ wọ̀nyí fìwé pe ẹlòmíràn láti yẹ ààbò wọn wò bóyá ó kú díẹ̀ káàtó àti láti ṣe ìmúgbòrò irinṣẹ́ náà.
target: By being transparent about how their program works, the creators of these tools invite others to look for security flaws and help improve the program.

input: Iṣẹ́-àìrídìmú ìṣísílẹ̀ ń fún ni láǹfààní ààbò tó péye, ṣùgbọ́n èyí kò dájú.
target: Open-source software provides the opportunity for better security, but does not guarantee it.

input: Dídára iṣẹ́-àìrídìmú ìṣísílẹ̀ wà lọ́wọ́ àwọn onímọ̀ tó ń yẹ odù iṣẹ́-àìrídìmú ìṣísílẹ̀ wò, tí, fún iṣẹ́ kékeré àti èyí tó gbajúmọ̀, tó díjú, lè nìra láti ṣe.
target: The open source advantage relies, in part, on a community of technologists actually checking the code, which, for small projects and even for popular, complex ones, may be hard to achieve.

input: Bí o bá fẹ́ yan irinṣẹ́, wò ó bóyá odùu rẹ̀ wà lárọ̀ọ́wọ́tó àti bóyá ó ní ajẹ́rìí ààbò àdáni láti fẹsẹ̀ agbára ààbòo rẹ̀ múlẹ̀.
target: When considering a tool, see if its source code is available and whether it has an independent security audit to confirm the quality of its security.

input: Ó kéré jù, ó yẹ kí iṣẹ́-àìrídìmú tàbí iṣẹ́-àrídìmú ó ní àlàyé lẹ́kùnúnrẹ́rẹ́ nípa ìṣiṣẹ́ẹ rẹ̀ fún àtúnyẹ̀wò àwọn onímọ̀.
target: At the very least, software or hardware should have a detailed technical explanation of how it functions for other experts to inspect.

input: Ǹjẹ́ oníṣọnà sọ dáadáa àti àìdáa rẹ̀ yékéyéké
target: How Clear are its Creators About its Advantages and Disadvantages

input: Kò sí iṣẹ́-àìrídìmú tàbí irinṣẹ́-àrídìmú tí a lè sọ pé ààbòo rẹ̀ pé yanrantí.
target: No software or hardware is entirely secure.

input: Wá irinṣẹ́ tí oníṣọnà tàbí òǹtà fi ìpààlà àgbéjáde wọn hàn gbangba.
target: Seek out tools with creators or sellers who are honest about the limitations of their product.

input: Máà dé ibẹ̀, ewu ń bẹ ni gbólóhùn lásán tó ní odù náà jẹ́ military-grade tàbí NSA-proof.
target: Blanket statements that say that the code is military-grade or NSA-proof are red flags.

input: Gbólóhùn wọ̀nyí ń tọ́ka sí ìfọ̀nu tàbí àìbìkítà láti gbà wípé àgbéjáde wọn lè kùnà.
target: These statements indicate that the creators are overconfident or unwilling to consider the possible failings in their product.

input: Nítorí adojúkọni máa ń gbìdánwò ń gbogbo ìgbà láti wá ọgbọ́n mìíràn dá fi fọ́ ààbò irinṣẹ́, iṣẹ́-àìrídìmú àti iṣẹ́-àrídìmú nílò àtúnṣe láti dí àlàfo tó ń bẹ.
target: Because attackers are always trying to discover new ways to break the security of tools, software and hardware needs to be updated to fix vulnerabilities.

input: Ó lè jẹ́ ìṣòro nílá bí oníṣọnà ò bá fẹ́ ṣèyí, yálà nítorí ìbẹ̀rù ìkéde àìdára tàbí nítorí wọ́n kò ì kọ́ ohun tí yóò ṣe bẹ́ẹ̀.
target: It can be a serious problem if the creators are unwilling to do this, either because they fear bad publicity or because they have not built the infrastructure to do so.

input: Wá oníṣọnà tó ṣe tán láti ṣe àtúnṣe, àti tí ó jẹ́ ẹni tó ṣe é f'ọkàn tán, tí ohun gbogbo nípa ìdí tí ó fi ń ṣe bẹ́ẹ̀ hàn gbangba gbàngbà.
target: Look for creators who are willing to make these updates, and who are honest and clear about why they are doing so.

input: Atọ́ka pàtàkì nípa bí oníṣọnà irinṣẹ́ yóò ṣe hùwà lọ́jọ́ iwájú ni pípadà sí ìgbà àtijọ́.
target: A good indicator of how toolmakers will behave in the future is their past activity.

input: Bí irinṣẹ́ ibùdó-ìtàkùn bá to ìṣòro àtijọ́ lẹ́sẹẹsẹ àti ìsopọ̀ tí yóò dárí ẹni sí àtúnṣe àti ìwífún tó wọ́pọ̀ - bí i ní pàtó bí ó ti ṣe wà láti àtúnṣe tó kẹ́yìn - ó lè dáa lójú wípé wọn yóò túbọ̀ máa pèsèe rẹ̀ bẹ́ẹ̀ lọ́jọ́ iwájú.
target: If the tool's website lists previous issues and links to regular updates and information—like specifically how long it has been since the software was last updated—you can be more confident that they will continue to provide this service in the future.

input: Kí ló ṣẹlẹ̀ bí oníṣọnà bá níjà
target: What Happens if the Creators are Compromised

input: Bí oníṣẹ́ ọnà bá kọ́ irinṣẹ́-àìrídìmú àti irinṣẹ́-àrídìmú, àwọn gẹ́gẹ́ bí ì rẹ ní láti ní àwòṣe ìdẹ́rùbà tó dá ṣáṣá.
target: When security toolmakers build software and hardware, they just like you must have a clear threat model.

input: Oníṣọnà tó dára ré kọjá máa ń ṣàlàyé gbangba irú ọ̀tá tí wọ́n lè ṣe ìdáààbòbò lórí nínú àkọsílẹ̀ wọn.
target: The best creators explicitly describe what kind of adversaries they can protect you from in their documentation.

input: Ṣùgbọ́n ó ní adojúkọni kan tí ọ̀pọ̀ oníṣọnà ò fẹ́ ní èrò níara wọn
target: But there'themselves

input: Bí wọ́n bá ní ìjà tàbí pinnu láti kọjú òǹlòo wọn ńkọ́
target: What if they are compromised or decide to attack their own users

input: Fún àpẹẹrẹ, ilé-ẹjọ́ tàbí ìjọba lè pa á láṣẹ fún ilé-iṣẹ́ láti kó ìwífún-ti-ẹni tàbí gba ẹ̀yìn yọ ààbò tí irinṣẹ́ wọn fún-un.
target: For instance, a court or government may compel a company to hand over personal data or create a backdoor that will remove all the protections their tool offers.

input: Wádìí sàkání oníṣọnà.
target: So consider the jurisdictions where the creators are based.

input: Bí o bá níjayà nípa dídáààbò ìwọtìkaraàrẹ lọ́wọ́ ìjọba Iran fún àpẹẹrẹ, ilé-iṣẹ́ kan ní America yóò lè tako ìdájọ́ọ ilé-ẹjọ́ ìlú Iran, kódà bí ó bá jẹ́ gbígba òfin ìlú America.
target: If you’re worried about protecting yourself from the government of Iran, for example, a US-based company will be able to resist Iranian court orders, even if it must comply with US orders.

input: Bí oníṣọnà bá tàpá sí i ìfínnámọ́nilábẹ́ ìjọba, adojúkọni lè gbìdánwò láti wọnú ẹ̀rọ oníṣọnà irinṣẹ́ láti kọjú ìjà sí oníbàárà.
target: Even if a creator is able to resist government pressure, an attacker may attempt to break into the toolmakers' own systems in order to attack its customers.

input: Irinṣẹ́ tó dára jù lọ ni àwọn tí ó rí èyí gẹ́gẹ́ bí ìkọjú tí ó lè wáyé àti wípé a ṣe wọ́n láti dá ààbò irú ìdojúkọ báyìí.
target: The most resilient tools are those that consider this as a possible attack and are designed to defend against this.

input: Wá èdè tí ó fi múlẹ̀ wípé oníṣọnà ò le è rí àyè láti lo ìwífún ibi-ìkọ̀kọ̀, ó sàn ju ìlérí wípé oníṣọnà ò ní rí ìwífún ẹni.
target: Look for language that asserts that a creator cannot access private data, rather than promises that a creator will not.

input: Wá ilé-iṣẹ́ tí ó ní òkìkí nípa jíjà fún ìwífún-ti-ẹni ní ilé-ẹjọ́.
target: Look for institutions with a reputation for fighting court orders for personal data.

input: Ṣé wọ́n ti ṣe àtúnpè tàbí dá ẹnu èébú lù ú lórí ayélujára rí bí
target: Has it Been Recalled or Criticized Online

input: Ilé-iṣẹ́ atàgbéjáde àti onítara tó ń ṣe ìpolówó iṣẹ́-àìrídìmú wọn tuntun lè ṣìnà, ṣini lọ́nà, tàbí parọ́ ńlá.
target: Companies selling products and enthusiasts advertising their latest software can be misled, be misleading, or even outright lie.

input: Àgbéjáde tí ó ní ààbò tó péye lè ní àìmọye àṣìṣe lọ́jọ́ iwájú.
target: A product that was originally secure might have terrible flaws in the future.

input: Rí i dájú wípé ó ní ìmọ̀ kún ìmọ̀ lórí ìròyìn tuntun nípa irinṣẹ́ tí ò ń lò.
target: Make sure you stay well-informed on the latest news about the tools that you use.

input: Kò ṣe é ṣe fún ẹnìkan ṣoṣo láti mọ ìròyìn tuntun nípa irinṣẹ́.
target: It's a lot of work for one person to keep up with the latest news about a tool.

input: Bí ó bá ní ẹkẹgbẹ́ tí ó ń lo àgbéjáde tàbí iṣẹ́ kan pàtó, bá wọn ṣiṣẹ́ pọ̀ kí o ba ní àlékún ìmọ̀.
target: If you have colleagues who use a particular product or service, work with them to stay informed.

input: Ẹ̀rọ-ìbánisọ̀rọ̀ọ wo ni kí n rà Ẹ̀rọ-ayárabíàṣá wo
target: Which Phone Should I Buy Which Computer

input: A máa ń béèrè lọ́wọ́ akọni ni ààbò Èwo ni kí n rà nínú Android tàbí iPhone tàbí Èwo ni kí n lò PC tàbí Mac tàbí Irú ẹ̀rọ ìṣiṣẹ́ wo ni kí n lò .
target: Should I buy Android or an iPhone or Should I use a PC or a Mac or What operating system should I use

input: Kò sí ìdáhùn geere fún ìbéèrè wọ̀nyí.
target: There are no simple answers to these questions.

input: Ọpọ́n iṣẹ́-àìrídìmú àti ẹ̀rọ ayárabíàṣá ti ń sún látàrí àṣìṣe tuntun àti àtúnṣe sí ti àtijọ́.
target: The relative safety of software and devices is constantly shifting as new flaws are discovered and old bugs are fixed.

input: Ilé-iṣẹ́ lè figagbága pẹ̀lú ara wọn láti pèsè ààbò tó péye fún ọ, tàbí kí gbogbo wọn lè wá lábé ìfínnámọ́nilábẹ́ ìjọba láti sọ ààbò di òfúùtùfẹ́ẹ̀tẹ̀.
target: Companies may compete with each other to provide you with better security, or they may all be under pressure from governments to weaken that security.

input: Ìmọ̀ràn díẹ̀ lọ́pọ̀ ìgbá jẹ́ òdodo, síbẹ̀.Bí o bá ra ẹ̀rọ-ayárabíàṣá tàbí ẹ̀rọ ìṣiṣẹ́, máa fi àtúnṣe kún un.
target: Some general advice is almost always true, however.When you buy a device or an operating system, keep it up-to-date with software updates.

input: Àtúnṣe àfikún yìí yóò ṣe iṣẹ́ ìdáààbòbò tí ó ti mẹ́hẹ nínú odù àtijọ́ tí ìkojú lè yá lò.
target: Updates will often fix security problems in older code that attacks can exploit.

input: Ṣàkíyèsí wípé ẹ̀rọ-ìbánisọ̀rọ̀ọ àtijọ́ àti ẹ̀rọ ìṣiṣẹ́ lè máà wúlò mọ́, paapàá fún àfikún ààbò.
target: Note that some older phones and operating systems may no longer be supported, even for security updates.

input: Microsoft ní pàtó ti fi yé pé ẹ̀dà Windows Vista, XP, àti lọ sẹ́yìn ò ní rí àtúnṣe fún àìmọye ìṣòro ààbò.
target: In particular, Microsoft has made it clear that versions of Windows Vista, XP, and below will not receive fixes for even severe security problems.

input: Èyí já sí wípé bí o bá lo ìwọ̀nyí, o ò jẹ́ lérò wípé o ní ààbò lórí adojúkọni.
target: This means that if you use these, you cannot expect them to be secure from attackers.

input: Bákan náà ló rí fún OS X kí ó tó kan 10.11 tàbí El Capitan.
target: The same is true for OS X before 10.11 or El Capitan.

input: Ní báyìí tí o ti gbé ìdẹ́rùbà gbogbo tí ó ń kojúù rẹ, àti tí o ti mọ ohun tí o ní láti yẹ̀wò nínú irinṣẹ́ ààbò ẹ̀rọ-ayárabíàṣá, o lè fi Ògún-un rẹ̀ gbáyà láti yan irinṣẹ́ tí ó dára jù lọ fún ọ.
target: Now that you’ve considered the threats you face, and know what to look for in a digital security tool, you can more confidently choose tools that are most appropriate for your unique situation.

input: Àgbéjáde Tí A Dárúkọ ní Àyẹ̀wò Ìdáààbòbò-ara-ẹni
target: Products Mentioned in Surveillance Self-Defense

input: A gbìyànjú láti rí i wípé iṣẹ́-àìrídìmú àti iṣẹ́-àrídìmú tí a dárúkọ ní SSD bá ìlànà tí a kà sílẹ̀ lókè mu.
target: We try to ensure that the software and hardware mentioned in SSD complies with the criteria listed above.

input: A ti gbìyànjú ka àwọn àgbéjáde tó dára
target: We have made a good faith effort to only list products that

input: ní ìmọ̀ tó jinlẹ̀ nínú ààbò ẹ̀rọ ayárabíàṣá bó ṣe ń lọ lọ́wọ́,
target: have a solid grounding in what we currently know about digital security,

input: tí ó mọ́ gaara nípa iṣẹ́ wọn àti àṣìṣe wọn,
target: are generally transparent about their operation and their failings,

input: ní ààbò atakò aìíṣeémọ̀ bí oníṣọnà lè ní ìjàdù, àti
target: have defenses against the possibility that the creators themselves will be compromised, and

input: pípamọ́, pẹ̀lú òǹlò tó ní àlékún ìmọ̀ ẹ̀rọ.
target: are currently maintained, with a large and technically-knowledgeable user base.

input: Lákòókò àkọsílẹ̀, a gbàgbọ́ wípé wọ́n ní ọ̀kẹ́ àìmọye èèyàn tó ń ṣe àyẹ̀wò àìṣe déédéé wọn, èyí yóò gbé awuye sétí aráyé lẹ́sẹ̀kẹsẹ̀.
target: We believe that they have, at the time of writing, a wide audience who is examining them for flaws, and would raise concerns to the public quickly.

input: Jọ̀wọ́ wòye wípé a kò ní ohun èlò láti ṣàyẹ̀wò tàbí ṣe ìdánilójú aládàáni nípa ààbòo wọn.
target: Please understand that we do not have the resources to examine or make independent assurances about their security.

input: A kò fi òǹtẹ̀ lu àgbéjáde wọ̀nyí àti pé a kò le è jẹ́rìí wípé wọ́n ní ààbò pípéye.
target: We do not endorse these products and cannot guarantee complete security.

input: Títàkùrọ̀sọ Pẹ̀lú Ẹlòmíràn
target: Communicating with Others

input: Ẹ̀rọ ìgbọ́rọ̀sáfẹ́fẹ́ àti ayélujára ti mú ìtàkùrọ̀sọ pẹ̀lú ẹlòmíràn rọrùn ju ti àtẹ̀yìnwá lọ, ṣùgbọ́n ó ti mú iṣẹ́ alamí gbòòrò sí i láyé tí a wà yìí.
target: Telecommunication networks and the Internet have made communicating with people easier than ever, but have also made surveillance more prevalent than it has ever been in human history.

input: Láì gbégbèésẹ̀ to lààmìlaka tí yóò dáàbò bo ibi-ìkọ̀kọ̀ rẹ, àwọn elétí-ọfẹ lè máa tẹ́tí sí gbogbo ìpè, àtẹ̀jíṣẹ́, ímeelì, iṣẹ́-ìjẹ́ oníwàràǹṣesà, ìpè ohun lóríi IP, VoIP ìtàkùrọ̀sọ àwòrán fídíò, àti iṣẹ́-ìjẹ́ ẹ̀rọ-alátagbà rẹ.
target: Without taking extra steps to protect your privacy, every phone call, text message, email, instant message, voice over IP VoIP call, video chat, and social media message may be vulnerable to eavesdroppers.

input: Láyìmoye ìgbà ni ìtàkùrọ̀sọ ojúkorojú láàbò tó pé ju ẹ̀rọ-ayárabíàṣá tàbí ẹ̀rọ-ìbánisọ̀rọ̀ lọ.
target: Often the safest way to communicate with others is in person, without computers or phones being involved at all.

input: Nítorí bẹ́ẹ̀, ohun tó dára ní ṣíṣe ni láti lo ìyí-dátà-padà-sí-odù-ààbò òpin-dé-òpin bí o bá ń tàkùrọ̀sọ lórí ìṣàsopọ̀ fún ààbò ìtàkùrọ̀sọọ̀ rẹ.
target: Because this isn’t always possible, the next best thing is to use end-to-end encryption while communicating over a network if you need to protect the content of your communications.

input: Báwo ni Ìyí-dátà-padà-sí-odù-ààbò Òpin-dé-òpin ṣe ń ṣiṣẹ́
target: How Does End-to-End Encryption Work

input: Bí ẹni méjì bá fẹ́ tàkùrọ̀sọ tí wọn kò sì fẹ́ kí ẹnìkẹ́ta ó f'etíkó o fún àpẹẹrẹ, Akiko àti Boris wọn gbọdọ̀ ṣe àgbàjáde kọ́kọ́rọ́ àìrí.
target: When two people want to communicate securely for example, Akiko and Boris they must each generate crypto keys.

input: Kí Akiko ó tó fi iṣẹ́-ìjẹ́ ránṣẹ́ sí Boris, ó lo ìyódùpadàfáàbò sí kọ́kọ́rọ́ọ Boris tí ó fi jẹ́ wípé Boris nìkan ló lè tú ìyí-dátà-padà-sí-odù-ààbò yìí.
target: Before Akiko sends a message to Boris she encrypts it to Boris's key so that only Boris can decrypt it.

input: Lẹ́yìn ìgbà náà ni yóó fi iṣẹ́-ìjẹ́ tí a ti yí odùu rẹ̀ padà fún ààbò ránṣẹ́ lórí ẹ̀rọ ayélujára.
target: Then she sends the already-encrypted message across the Internet.

input: Bí Boris bá gbà á, ó ní láti lo kọ́kọ́rọ́ọ rẹ̀ láti fi tú u kí ó bá jẹ́ rírí kà.
target: When Boris receives it, he must use his key to decrypt it into a readable message.

input: Ìyódùpadàfáàbò òpin-dé-òpin gba akitiyan tó pọ̀, ṣùgbọ́n ó jẹ́ ọ̀nà kan ṣoṣo tí òǹlò fi lè ṣ'àyẹ̀wò ààbò ìtàkùrọ̀sọ láì ṣiyèméjì nípa ààbò gbàgede tí wọ́n ń lò.
target: End-to-end encryption involves some effort, but it's the only way that users can verify the security of their communications without having to trust the platform that they're both using.

input: Ìpèsè mìíràn, bíi Skype, fi yé wípé òun ń lo ìyódùpadàfáàbò òpin-dé-òpin síbẹ̀ ó jọ wípé wọn kò lò ó.
target: Some services, such as Skype, have claimed to offer end-to-end encryption when it appears that they actually don't.

input: Kí ìyódùpadàfáàbò òpin-dé-òpin ó tó ó ṣiṣẹ́ dáadáa, òǹló gbọdọ̀ ní aṣàyẹ̀wò tí yóó tú àṣìírí bóyá kọ́kọ́rọ́ àìrí tí wọn ń fi ń ṣe ìyódùpadàfáàbò iṣẹ́-ìjẹ́ jẹ́ ti ẹni tó yẹ kí ó jẹ́.
target: For end-to-end encryption to be secure, users must be able to verify that the crypto key they're encrypting messages to belongs to the people they believe they do.

input: Bí iṣẹ́-àìrídìmú ìtàkùrọ̀sọ ò bá leè ṣe irú iṣẹ́ yìí, èyíkéyìí ìyí-dátà-padà-sí-odù-ààbò tí ó lè máa lò lè ní ìkọlù apèsè gan-an, bóyá bí ìjọba bá pa á láṣẹ láti ṣe bẹ́ẹ̀.
target: If communications software doesn't have this ability built-in, then any encryption that it might be using can be intercepted by the service provider itself, for instance if a government compels it to.

input: O lè ka ìwé àpilẹ̀kọ Freedom of the Press Foundation, ìyí-dátà-padà-sí-odù-ààbò ṣiṣẹ́ fún ẹ̀kúnrẹ́rẹ́ àṣẹ lóríi bí a ṣe ń lo ìyódùpadàfáàbò òpin-dé-òpin fún ààbò iṣẹ́-ìjẹ́ oníwàràǹṣesà àti ímeelì.
target: You can read Freedom of the Press Foundation's whitepaper, Encryption Works for detailed instructions on using end-to-end encryption to protect instant messages and email.

input: Rí i dájú pé o yẹ SSD ìsàlẹ̀ yìí wò
target: Be sure to check out the following SSD modules as well

target: An Introduction to Public Key Cryptography and PGP

input: Bí a ṣe lè Lo OTR fún Windows
target: Use OTR for Windows

target: Use OTR for Mac

input: Bí o bá ń pè lóríi ẹ̀rọ-ìbánisọ̀rọ̀ọ oríi tábìlì tàbí lóríi ẹ̀rọ-ìbánisọ̀rọ̀ọ alágbèéká, a kò lo yí-dátà-rẹ̀-padà-sí-odù-ààbò òpin-dé-òpin fún ìpè rẹ.
target: When you make a call from a landline or a mobile phone, your call is not end-to-end encrypted.

input: Bí o bá ń lo ẹ̀rọ-ìbánisọ̀rọ̀ọ alágbèéká, ẹ̀rọ-ìléwọ́ àti òpó agbáfẹ́fẹ́-ọ̀rọ̀-ká lè máa lágbára tó lórí ìpèè rẹ.
target: If you're using a mobile phone, your call may be weakly encrypted between your handset and the cell phone towers.

input: Síbẹ̀ bí ìtàkùrọ̀sọọ̀ rẹ bá gba ìṣàsopọ̀ kọjá, o lè ní ìkọlù láti apá ilé-iṣẹ́ ìṣàsopọ̀ ẹ̀rọ-ìbánisọ̀rọ̀ àti pẹ̀lú ìtànká, ìjọbakíjọba tàbí àjọ tí ó ní agbára lóríi ilé-iṣẹ́ ẹ̀rọ-ìbánisọ̀rọ̀ọ rẹ.
target: However as your conversation travels through the phone network, it's vulnerable to interception by your phone company and, by extension, any governments or organizations that have power over your phone company.

input: Ọ̀nà tó rọrùn jù lọ fún àrídájú ìyí-dátà-padà-sí-odù-ààbò òpin-dé-òpin lórí ìtàkùrọ̀sọ ohun ni láti lo VoIP.
target: The easiest way to ensure you have end-to-end encryption on voice conversations is to use VoIP instead.

input: Kíyèsára Àwọn apèsè VoIP tó jẹ́ gbajúmọ̀, gẹ́gẹ́ bíi Skype àti Google Hangout, máa ń lo ìyí-dátà-padà-sí-odù-ààbò ìṣíkúrò kí àwọn atẹ́tí sí ìtàkùrọ̀sọ ó máà le è gbọ́, àmọ́ṣá apèsè tìkára wọn lè máa gbọ́.
target: Beware Most popular VoIP providers, such as Skype and Google Hangouts, offer transport encryption so that eavesdroppers cannot listen in, but the providers themselves are still potentially able to listen in.

input: Ó dá lórí, àwòṣe ìdẹ́rùbà rẹ, èyí lè jẹ́ ìṣòro, ó sì lè máà jẹ́sòro.
target: Depending on your threat model, this may or may not be a problem.

input: Fún ìtàkùrọ̀sọ VoIP tí a ti yí dátà rẹ̀ padà sí odùu fún ààbò, ẹni méjèèjì tó ń tàkùrọ̀sọ gbọdọ̀ lo iṣẹ́-àìrídìmú kan náà tàbí èyí tí ó bára wọn mu.
target: In order to have end-to-end encrypted VoIP conversations, both parties must be using the same or compatible software.

input: Àtẹ̀jíṣẹ́ tí a mọ̀ bí ẹní m'ọwọ́ SMS ò lo ìyí-dátà-padà-sí-odù-ààbò òpin-dé-òpin.
target: Standard text SMS messages do not offer end-to-end encryption.

input: Bí o bá fẹ́ fi iṣẹ́-ìjẹ́ tí a ti yí dátà rẹ̀ padà sí odùu ààbò ránṣẹ́ lórí ẹ̀rọ-ìbánisọ̀rọ̀ rẹ, o ò ṣe lo iṣẹ́-àìrídìmú ìyí-dátà-padà-sí-odù-ààbò fún iṣẹ́-ìjẹ́ oníwàràǹṣesà dípò àtẹ̀jíṣẹ́.
target: If you want to send encrypted messages on your phone, consider using encrypted instant messaging software instead of text messages.

input: Díẹ̀ nínú àwọn iṣẹ́-ìjẹ́ oníwàràǹṣesà tí a ti yí dátà rẹ̀ padà sí odùu ààbò ìfẹ́nukò ti wọn.
target: Some end-to-end encrypted instant messaging services use their own protocol.

input: Wàyí, ẹ wò ó báyìí, àwọn òǹlòo Signal lórí Android àti iOS lè sọ̀rọ̀ bótibòti pẹ̀lú ààbò lóríi gbàgede wọ̀nyí.
target: So, for instance, users of Signal on Android and iOS can chat securely with others who use those programs.

input: Áàpù tí máa ń yí odù ìtàkùrọ̀sọ padà fún ààbò pẹ̀lú OTR lórí èyíkéyìí ìṣàsopọ̀ tó ń lo XMPP ni ChatSecure, tí ó túmọ̀ sí wípé ó lè ṣ'àṣàyànan nínú oríṣiríṣi iṣẹ́-ìjẹ́ àdádúró tí ó hùn ọ́ nínú àìmọye tó wà.
target: ChatSecure is a mobile app that encrypts conversations with OTR on any network that uses XMPP, which means you can choose from a range of independent instant messaging services.

input: Ìfẹ́nukò  ìyí-dátà-padà-sí-odù-ààbò òpin-dé-òpin fún ìtàkùrọ̀sọ alátẹ̀jíṣẹ́ ojú-ẹsẹ̀ tó ṣe í lò lórí onírúurú iṣẹ́ ni Àìsí-lákọsílẹ̀ OTR.
target: Off-the-Record OTR is an end-to-end encryption protocol for real-time text conversations that can be used on top of a variety of services.

input: Àwọn irinṣẹ́ tó ní OTR nínú pẹ̀lú iṣẹ́-ìjẹ́ oníwàràǹṣesà ni
target: Some tools that incorporate OTR with instant messaging include

input: Ọ̀pọ̀ apèsè ímeèlì fún ọ láàyè láti yẹ ímeèlìi wò lórí ìtàkùn aṣàwáríkiri, gẹ́gẹ́ bíi Firefox tàbí Chrome.
target: Most email providers give you a way of accessing your email using a web browser, such as Firefox or Chrome.

input: Nínú apèsè wọ̀nyí, ìtìlẹ́yìn wà fún HTTPS, tàbí ìyí-dátà-padà-sí-odù-ààbò ìpele-ìṣíkúrò.
target: Of these providers, most of them provide support for HTTPS, or transport-layer encryption.

input: Ó lè mọ̀ bí apèsè ímeèlìi rẹ bá pèsè ìtìlẹ́yìn HTTPS fún ọ bí o bá wọlé sínú ìtàkùn-ímeèlì rẹ àti URL orí òkè aṣàwáríkiriì rẹ tí ó bẹ̀rẹ̀ pẹ̀lú lẹ́tà HTTPS nípò HTTP fún àpẹẹrẹ httpsmail.google.com
target: You can tell that your email provider supports HTTPS if you log in to your webmail and the URL at the top of your browser begins with the letters HTTPS instead of HTTP httpsmail.google.com.

input: Bí apèsè ímeèlì rẹ bá ní ìtìlẹ́yìn fún HTTPS, ṣùgbọ́n tí kò ṣe bẹ́ẹ̀, gbìyànjú kí o pààrọ̀ HTTP pẹ̀lú HTTPS nínú URL kí o sì tún ojúùwé náà tẹ̀.
target: If your email provider supports HTTPS, but does not do so by default, try replacing HTTP with HTTPS in the URL and refresh the page.

input: Bí o bá fẹ́ ìdánilójú wípé HTTPS lo máa ń lò ní gbogbo ìgbà lórí ibùdó tí ó bá wà, gba ẹ̀dà àfilé HTTPS Níbigbogbo sílẹ̀ fún lílò lóríi asàwáríkiri Firefox tàbí Chrome.
target: If you’d like to make sure that you are always using HTTPS on sites where it is available, download the HTTPS Everywhere browser add-on for Firefox or Chrome.

input: Apèsè imeèlì ìtàkùn àgbáyé tó máa ń lo ààtò-àbáwá HTTPS ni
target: Some webmail providers that use HTTPS by default include

input: Apèsè ìtàkùn-ímeèlì mìíràn fún ọ láàyè láti yan HTTPS gẹ́gẹ́ bí àbáwá tí o lè yàn nínú ààtò rẹ.
target: Some webmail providers that give you the option of choosing to use HTTPS by default by selecting it in your settings.

input: Èyí tó gbajúmọ̀ jù lọ ni Hotmail t'ó ṣì ń ṣe bẹ́ẹ̀ dòní.
target: The most popular service that still does this is Hotmail.

input: Kí ni ìyí-dátà-padà-sí-odù-ààbò ìpele-ìṣíkúrò ń ṣe àti ìdí tí o fi lè nílòo rẹ fún
target: What does transport-layer encryption do and why might you need it

input: HTTPS, tí a tún mọ̀ sí SSL tàbí TLS, máa ń yí dátà ìtàkùrọ̀sọọ̀ rẹ padà-sí-odù-ààbò kí ẹlòmíràn ó máà bá a rí i kà lóríi ìṣàsopọ̀ rẹ.
target: HTTPS, also referred to as SSL or TLS, encrypts your communications so that it cannot be read by other people on your network.

input: Èyí lè kan àwọn tí ẹ jọ ń lo WiFi kan náà ní pápákọ̀ òfuurufú tàbí ní ilé ìjẹun, àwọn ẹlòmíràn ní ibiiṣẹ́ tàbí ilé ìwé, alákòóso ilé-iṣẹ́ apèsèe ISP rẹ, olè apanilára, ìjọba, tàbí àjọ agbófinró.
target: This can include the other people using the same Wi-Fi in an airport or at a café, the other people at your office or school, the administrators at your ISP, malicious hackers, governments, or law enforcement officials.

input: Ìtàkùrọ̀sọ tí o fi ránṣẹ́ lóríi ìtàkùn aṣàwáríkiriì rẹ, títí kan ìtàkùn ojú-ìwé tí o lọ àti ohuninú ímeèlì rẹ, ìwé-ìrántí ibùdó-ìtàkùn-àgbáyé àti iṣẹ́-ìjẹ́, lílo HTTP dípò HTTPS f'ààyè gba adojúkọni láti dí ìtàkùrọ̀sọọ̀ rẹ lọ́wọ́ àti kà á.
target: Communications sent over your web browser, including the web pages that you visit and the content of your emails, blog posts, and messages, using HTTP rather than HTTPS are trivial for an attacker to intercept and read.

input: HTTPS ni ìpilẹ̀ṣẹ̀ ìyí-dátà-padà-sí-odù-ààbò ìtàkùn aṣàwáríkiriì rẹ tí a f'ọwọ́ sí fún ènìyàn gbogbo.
target: HTTPS is the most basic level of encryption for your web browsing that we recommend for everybody.

input: Ó dàbíi síso okùn ààbò ìjókòó bí o bá ń wa ọkọ̀.
target: It is as basic as putting on your seat belt when you drive.

input: Àmọ́ ó ní àwọn ohun tí HTTPS kì í ṣe.
target: But there are some things that HTTPS does not do.

input: Bí o bá fi ímeèlì ránṣẹ́ lórí HTTPS, apèsèe ímeèlì rẹ yóò ṣì rí ẹ̀dà ìtàkùrọ̀sọọ̀ rẹ tí data ò yí odù rẹ̀ padà fún ààbò.
target: When you send email using HTTPS, your email provider still gets an unencrypted copy of your communication.

input: Ìjọba àti agbófinró lè rí dátà rẹ pẹ̀lú ìwé àṣẹ.
target: Governments and law enforcement may be able to access this data with a warrant.

input: Apèsèe ímeèlì, gẹ́gẹ́ bíi Google, Yahoo, àti Microsoft, tẹ àtẹ̀jádé ìròyìn mímọ́ gaara tó ń s'àlàyé iye ìbéèrè fún dátà òǹlò tí wọ́n ti gbà, ìlú t'ó béèrè fún un, àti iye ìgbà tí ilé-iṣẹ́ náà ti fi dátà ṣọwọ́ sí ìjọba.
target: Some email providers, such as Google, Yahoo, and Microsoft, publish transparency reports, detailing the number of government requests for user data they receive, which countries make the requests, and how often the company has complied by turning over data.

input: PGP tàbí Ibi-Ìkọ̀kọ̀ tó Dára Jù ni ìyódùpadàfáàbò òpin-dé-òpin tí ó dára jù fún ímeèlì rẹ.Bí o bá lò ó lọ́nà tó yẹ, ó máa dá ààbò tó lágbára bo ìtàkùrọ̀sọọ̀ rẹ.
target: PGP or Pretty Good Privacy is the standard for end-to-end encryption of your email.Used correctly, it offers very strong protections for your communications.

input: Fún ẹ̀kúnrẹ́rẹ́ àlàyé lórí bí o ṣe lè fi àti lo ìyódùpadàfâbò PGP fún ímeèlì rẹ, wo
target: For detailed instructions on how to install and use PGP encryption for your email, see

target: Use PGP for Windows

input: Kí ni ìyí-dátà-padà-sí-odù-ààbò òpin-dé-òpin kì í ṣe
target: What End-To-End Encryption Does Not Do

input: Ìyódùpadàfâbò òpin-dé-òpin ń dáàbò bo ohuninú ìtàkùrọ̀sọ rẹ nìkan, kì í dáàbò bo ìtàkùrọ̀sọ tìkararẹ̀.
target: End-to-end encryption only protects the content of your communication, not the fact of the communication itself.

input: Kì í dáàbò bo mẹ́tádatà - tí í ṣ'àpèjúwe ohun gbogbo nípa dátà, tí ó fi kan ilà àkórí ímeèlì rẹ, tàbí ẹni tí ó ń tàkùrọ̀sọ pẹ̀lú àti ìgbà tí o tàkùrọ̀sọ.
target: It does not protect your metadata—which is everything else, including the subject line of your email, or who you are communicating with and when.

input: Mẹ́tádatà yìí lè pèsèe gbogbo àṣìírí nípaà rẹ nígbà tí ohuninúu ìtàkùrọ̀sọ rẹ ń bẹ níkọ̀kọ̀.
target: Metadata can provide extremely revealing information about you even when the content of your communication remains secret.

input: Mẹ́tádatà nípa ẹ̀rọ ìbánisọ̀rọ̀ rẹ lè kó ohun ìkọ̀kọ̀ àti àṣìíríì rẹ gbogbo síta.Fún àpẹẹrẹ
target: Metadata about your phone calls can give away some very intimate and sensitive information.For example

input: Wọ́n mọ̀ wípé o pe ilé iṣẹ́ ìbálòpọ̀ ẹ̀rọ-ìbánisọ̀rọ̀ọ láago 224 àárọ̀ àti pé o sọ̀rọ̀ fún ìṣẹ́jú 18, ṣùgbọ́n wọn kò mọ kókó ohun tí o sọ̀rọ̀ nípa.
target: They know you rang a phone sex service at 224 am and spoke for 18 minutes, but they don't know what you talked about.

input: Wọ́n mọ̀ wípé o pe ilà ẹ̀rọ-ìbánisọ̀rọ̀ọ pàjáwìrì adíparaẹnilọ́wọ́ láti orí afárá Golden Gate, ṣùgbọ́n kókó ọ̀rọ́ jẹ́ ìpamọ́.
target: They know you called the suicide prevention hotline from the Golden Gate Bridge, but the topic of the call remains a secret.

input: Wọ́n mọ̀ wípé o bá ilé iṣẹ́ aṣàyẹ̀wò kòkòrò HIV sọ̀rọ̀, àti oníṣègùn-ùn rẹ, àti ilé-iṣẹ́ adójútòfò ìleraà rẹ ní wákàtí kan náà, ṣùgbọ́n ohun tí ẹ jọ sọ ni wọn kò mọ̀.
target: They know you spoke with an HIV testing service, then your doctor, then your health insurance company in the same hour, but they don't know what was discussed.

input: Wọ́n mọ̀ wípé o gba ìpè láti NRA ìjọba ìbílẹ̀ lásìkò ìpolongo ìlòdì sí òfin ìbọn, àti ìpè tí o pe aṣòfin àti aṣojú ilé ìgbìmọ̀ ìjọba lẹ́yìnwá, ṣùgbọ́n ohuninú ìpè náà wà ní ìpamọ́ fún ìjọba.
target: They know you received a call from the local NRA office while it was having a campaign against gun legislation, and then called your senators and congressional representatives immediately after, but the content of those calls remains safe from government intrusion.

input: Wọ́n mọ̀ wípé o pe onímọ̀-nípa-nǹkan-ọmọbìnrin, o sọ̀rọ̀ fún wákàtí kan àbọ̀, o sì pe àjọ ìfètòsọ́mọbíbí ìbílẹ̀ lọ́jọ́ yẹn náà, ṣùgbọ́n kò s'ẹ́ni t'ó mọ ohun tí ẹ sọ̀rọ̀ nípa
target: They know you called a gynecologist, spoke for a half hour, and then called the local Planned Parenthood's number later that day, but nobody knows what you spoke about.

input: Bí o bá ń pè lórí ẹ̀rọ-ìbánisọ̀rọ̀ọ alágbèéká, ìwífún nípa ibi tí o ti ń pè ni mẹ́tádatà.
target: If you are calling from a cell phone, information about your location is metadata.

input: L'ọ́dún 2009, olóṣèlú Green Party, Malte Spitz pe Deutsche Telekom lẹ́jọ́ pẹ̀lú ipá kí wọ́n pèsè dátà ìtàkùrọ̀sọ òun lórí ẹ̀rọ-ìbánisọ̀rọ̀ọ fún oṣù mẹ́fà, ó sì gbé e fún ìwé ìròyìn German.
target: In 2009, Green Party politician Malte Spitz sued Deutsche Telekom to force them to hand over six months of Spitz’s phone data, which he made available to a German newspaper.

input: Kedere ni àlọ àtàbọ̀ ìgbẹ́sẹ̀ẹ Spitz hàn nínú àwòrán tí wọ́n fún un.
target: The resulting visualization showed a detailed history of Spitz’s movements.

input: Dídáààbò mẹ́tádatà gba kí o lo irinṣẹ́ mìíràn, gẹ́gẹ́ bíi Tor, bí o ṣe ń lo ìyí-dátà-padà-sí-odù-ààbò òpin-dé-òpin
target: Protecting your metadata will require you to use other tools, such as Tor, at the same time as end-to-end encryption.

target: For an example of how Tor and HTTPS work together to protect the contents of your communications and your metadata from a variety of potential attackers, you may wish to take a look at this explanation.

input: Nígbà kan rí, arẹwà ọmọbìnrin kan ní ìgbéyàwó òun àti ọkọ òun kò yé òun mọ́, ó sì pinnu láti pa ọkọ rẹ̀ pẹ̀lú májèlé.
target: Once upon a time, a pretty woman said that her marriage with her husband is not rewarding for her, so she decided to kill her husband with poison.

input: Ni òwúrọ̀ kùtùkùtù ọjọ́ kan, ó tọ́ ìyá-a rẹ̀ lọ láti ṣàlàyé ọ̀ràn náà tí ojú u rẹ̀ ń rí nílé ọkọ, ó sọ fún ìyá a rẹ̀, wípé ọ̀rọ̀ ọkọ òun ti sú òun wípé òun kò lè farada ìhùwàsíi rẹ̀ mọ́.
target: One early morning, she went to her mother to explain the matter about what she face in the house of her husband, she told her mother, that she is fed up with her husband’s behaviour.

input: Nàíjíríà yóò gba ikọ̀ ọmọ ogun tuntun.
target: Nigeria plans to recruit more troops

input: Orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà ti setán láti gba ikọ̀ ọmọ ogun tuntun láti fi kún àwọn ọmọ ogun tó wà nílẹ̀ láti le gbógun ti ìdúnkoòkò àti ètò ààbò tó ń ṣe sége-sège.
target: Nigeria is planning to recruit more troops and officers to beef up personnel of the security agencies, to contain the threats and security concerns in the land.

input: Igbákejì ààrẹ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n Yemí Òsínbàjò ló sọ̀rọ̀ yìí lásìkò ìpàdé tí ó se pẹ̀lú ẹgbẹ́ àwọn àlùfáà láti ìlà oòrùn, Arewa Pastors Forum for Peace, nílé ààrẹ tó wà nílùú Àbújá, lọ́jọ́ Ajé.
target: Vice President Yemi Osinbajo this when he received clergymen from the Northern part of Nigeria under the auspices of the Arewa Pastors Forum for Peace, on a courtesy visit to the Presidential Villa on Monday.

input: Ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n Òsínbàjò tún ní À ń sa ipá wa lórí ètò ààbò.
target: Professor Osinbajo said We are doing everything that needs to be done.

input: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí ẹ se mọ̀ pé, à ń sa ipá wa lórí ètò ààbò lórílẹ̀ èdè yìí, nípa kíkó àwọn ikọ̀ ọmọ ogun lọ sí ìlà oòrùn láti kojú ikọ̀ ọlọ̀tẹ̀ Boko Haram.
target: We are handling security well, and as you know, including military deployment in diverse fields, like the Boko Haram in the Northeast.

input: Ní báyìí, a fẹ́ gba àwọn ọmọ ogun tuntun láti fi kún àwọn tó wà nílẹ̀, a tún ti ya owó kan sọ́tọ̀ láti fi ra irinsẹ́ ogun.

input: A ò ní fowó kún ọkọ̀ ojú irin nítorí àwọn mẹ̀kúnù- Rotimi Amaechi.
target: Nigerian Government to maintain subsidy on rail transport fares – Minister

input: Amaechi, sọ̀rọ̀ yìí lásìkò tó ń bá àwọn akọrọ̀yìn sọrọ̀, pé ní gbogbo àgbáyé kò sí ibi tí wọ́n ti ń lo ọkọ̀ ojú irin láti pa owó sápò ìjọba.
target: But Amaechi, who spoke in an interview, said railways don’t make profits from passenger ticket prices across the world because they are usually subsidized.

input: Amaechi ní Tí a bá fi owó kún iye tí àwọn ènìyàn ń wọ ọkọ̀ ojú irin, Báwo ni àwọn mẹ̀kúnù tí wọn ń se isẹ́ ní Àbújá, sùgbọ́n tí wọn ń gbé ní Kàdúná nítorí owó ilé.
target: If we increase the cost of the tickets, what about the poor man that wants to move from Abuja to Kaduna, that lives in Kaduna to save the cost of accommodation, he said.

input: Nítorí náà, láti wá ojútùú sí ìpèníjà tó wà níbi ríra ìwé ìrìnnà ọkọ̀ ojú irin láti Àbújá sí Kàdúná, mínísítà ní ilé-isẹ́ tó ń mójútó ọkọ̀ ojú irin Nigeria Railway Corporation NRC yóò tún pèsè àwọn ọkọ̀ ojú irin tuntun.
target: Meanwhile, to solve the problem of ticket racketeering on the Abuja-Kaduna rail route, the Minister said the Nigeria Railway Corporation NRC is set to roll out new locomotives and coaches.

input: Sùgbọ́n wọ́n ní ìpèníjà.
target: But they ran into problems.

input: Wọn kò tí ì rí ẹrù wọn gbà láti èbúté ọkọ̀ ojú omi.
target: Their goods were yet to be cleared from the seaport.

input: Orílẹ̀ èdè Amerika àti Nàíjíríà yóò tọwọ́bọ ìwé àdéhùn láti da 321m padà.
target: Federal Govt., U.S to sign agreement on assets repatriation

input: Ìjọba orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà ti gbaradi láti tọwọ́bọ ìwé àdéhun pẹlu ilu New Jersey ati United States of America nípa dídá 321m owó orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà tí wọ́n jí kó pamọ́ si orílẹ̀ èdè naa.
target: The Federal Government of Nigeria is to sign a tripartite agreement with the Island of New Jersey and the United States of America on repatriation of looted assets worth 321million.

input: Ìwé àdéhùn náà wa lára ìgbìyànjú orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà láti rí i pé gbogbo owó tí àwọn ọ̀bàyéjẹ́ kan kó sálọ sí ilẹ̀ òkèèrè ni wọ́n dá padà sí orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà.
target: This is part of the Federal Government’s efforts to recover more stolen funds stashed abroad.

input: Mínístà fún ètò ìdájọ́ lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, Abubakar Malami ní yóò máa tọwọ́bọ ìwé àdéhùn ọ̀hún lórúkọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, ni ó ti fi orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà sílẹ̀ lọ sí orílẹ̀ èdè America, lọ́jọ́ Àìkú.
target: The Attorney-General of the Federation AGF and Minister of Justice, Abubakar Malami, SAN, is expected to sign on behalf of the Federal Republic of Nigeria, he has departed Nigeria to United States-Nigeria on Sunday

input: Ìpàdé ọ̀hún ló máa ń wáyé lọ́dọọdún láàrin orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà àti America láti se àgbéyẹ̀wò nípa ìbásepọ̀ orílẹ̀ èdè méjèèjì, lọ́nà tí ìbásepọ̀ wọn yóò tún se leè múná-dóko sii.
target: The meeting is an annual event between Nigeria and the U.S.aimed at reviewing bilateral relations and taking necessary steps to advance mutual interest in all diplomatic areas among the two countries.

input: Gómìnà pàsẹ láti mú àwọn adarí agbègbè, bí ẹ̀mí se ń sòfò ní ìpínlẹ̀ Plateau.
target: Plateau Governor orders arrest of community leaders as death toll increases

input: Ẹ̀mí tó ti sọnù ní ìpínlẹ̀ Plateau ti di méjìlélógún báyìí, bi ìwà ìpànìyàn se ń tẹ̀síwájú.
target: Death toll has risen to 22 in the killings in some communities in the central zone of Plateau State.

input: Gomina Simon Lalong lo sọ eleyii lasiko to n se ipade pẹlu awọn adari agbegbe lọjọ Ìsẹ́gun nile gomina to wa ni Jos, to jẹ olú-ìlú ipinlẹ Plateau.
target: Governor Simon Lalong confirmed the casualty figure on Tuesday when he met with the community leaders at the Government House in Jos, the state capital.

input: Ó wá fi àìdùnnú rẹ̀ hàn lori ọwọ́ tí àwọn ọlọ́pàá, agbófinró àti adarí agbègbè ọ̀hún se mú ìsẹ̀lẹ̀ náà, ní èyí tí ó tún jẹ́ kí ìwà ìpàìyàn náà tún fi lee si ́i ju ti àtẹ̀yìnwá lọ.
target: While appraising the security situation before it gets out of hand, he stated his displeasure with the efforts of the security agencies and the role of leaders in some of the communities that have been under severe attacks recently.

input: Gómìnà tún fi àìdùnnú rẹ̀ hàn sí bí àwọn agbébọn kan se kọlu àgbègbè Ruboi àti Marish ní ìjọba ìbílẹ̀ Bokkos tó wà ní ìpínlẹ̀ náà.
target: The governor decried the latest attacks where gunmen invaded Ruboi and Marish communities in Bokkos Local Government Area of the state.

input: Lásìkò ìsẹ̀lẹ̀ burúkú yìí ènìyàn mẹ́ẹ̀dógún ló pàdánù ẹ̀mí wọn, nígbà tí ènìyàn márùn ún farapa, tí ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ dúkìá àti ilé sì jóná.
target: During the unfortunate incident, at least 15 people were killed and five others injured with several buildings destroyed.

input: Lásìkò ìpàdé ọ̀hún ni Lalong wá ka ìwé òfin sí etí àwọn tó bá tún fẹ́ gbìmọ̀ràn láti dá wàhálà mííràn sílẹ̀.
target: Governor Lalong read the riot act at the meeting and condemned the activities of those he called elements who were bent on taking the state back to the dark days of chaos.

input: Ó wá pàsẹ pé kí wọn mú àwọn adarí àgbègbè níbi tí wàhálà náà ti wáyé, títí tí wọn yóò fi mú àwọn afurasí tó lọ́wọ́ nínú wàhálà náà.
target: He, therefore, ordered the arrest of community leaders in the affected areas until the suspects involved in the various attacks were produced.

input: Kọmísọ́nà ọlọ́pàá fún ìpínlẹ̀ Plateau, Isaac Akínmóyèdé, jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára àwọn tó wà níbi ìpàdé ọ̀hún.
target: The Commissioner of Police in Plateau, Mr Isaac Akinmoyede, was among the stakeholders present at the meeting.

input: Ó wá kìlọ̀ fún àwọn adarí àgbègbè ọ̀hún láti máa se gba ìwà ọ̀daràn láàyè ní agbègbè wọn.
target: In his briefing, he cautioned the community leaders against instigating members to take up arms in situations and not to harbour criminals in their domain.

input: Ìpàdé náà wáyé lẹ́yìn ìsẹ̀lẹ̀ tí ó gba ẹ̀mí àwọn ènìyàn mẹ́tàlá ní àgbègbè Kwatas ní ìjọba ìbílẹ̀ Bokkos ní ìpínlẹ̀ Plateau.
target: The meeting held two days after reports that 13 were killed in an attack by gunmen on Kwatas village also in Bokkos Local Government Area of the state.

input: Gẹ́gé bí àwọn ọlọ́pàá se sọ pé, àwọn ọ̀daràn daran-daran ló wá se ọsẹ́ ní agbègbè ọ̀hún ní àsálẹ́ ọjọ́ Àìkú.
target: According to police authorities in the state, the assailants suspected to be herdsmen attacked the village on Sunday night.

input: Ìjàḿbà iná ní ọjà Balogun nílùú Eko.
target: Fire guts sections of Lagos market

input: Ìjàḿbà iná ń sẹlẹ lọ́wọ́-lọ́wọ́ ní ọjà Balogun nílùú Eko báyìí,.
target: Some buildings at the Balogun market, located on Lagos Island are currently on fire.

input: Eléyìí wáyé lẹ́yìn ìjàm̀bá iná kan tí ó sẹlẹ̀ ni ọjà Mushin ní ọjọ karun un sẹ́yìn níbi tí àwọn ọlọ́jà ti pàdánù ọ̀kẹ́ àìmọye dúk̀ía wọn.
target: This incident comes about a week after a similar inferno razed a timber market in the Mushin area of Lagos.

input: Àwọn agbébọ́n pa ènìyàn mẹ́tàlá ní ìpínlẹ̀ Plateau.
target: President Buhari cautions against reprisal on Plateau attacks

input: Ààrẹ Buhari wá rọ àwọn ènìyàn náà pé kò sí ànfààní níbi ẹ̀san, ìkórìíra àti ìwà ipá níbi tí ẹlẹ́yà púpọ̀, ẹlẹ́sìn àti àṣà orísìírìsí bá wà, gẹ́gẹ́ bí orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, tí a wà yíí.
target: President Buhari reiterated that revenge, hatred and violent attacks should have no place in a multi-ethnic, multicultural and multi-religious society as we have in this country.’’

input: ’’ Ààrẹ wá rọ àwọn adarí ẹlẹ́sìn àti adarí agbègbè náà láti rọ àwọn ọ̀dọ́ wọn nípa ìbásepọ̀ àlááfíà.
target: The President called on community and religious leaders to counsel the youths on the need for peaceful co-existence.

input: Ààrẹ Buhari wá bá àwọn ẹbí àti ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀ Plateau kẹ́dùn lórí ìsẹ̀lẹ̀ burúkú ọ̀hún.
target: President Buhari sends condolences to families of the victims, government and people of Plateau State.

input: Nàíjíríà àti Netherland yóò fọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ lórí ètọ ẹ̀kọ́.
target: Nigeria partners with Netherlands on education

input: Ìjọba orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà àti Netherlands ti fohùnsọ̀kan láti fọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ lórí ètọ ẹ̀kọ́, kí ìbásepọ̀ orílẹ̀ èdè méjéèjì náà tún le fẹsẹ̀ múlẹ̀ síi.
target: The Nigerian Government and the Kingdom of the Netherlands are partnering to explore areas of partnership in the education sector as a means of deepening relationship.

input: Akọ̀wé ìjọba àjọ tó ń mójútó ètò ẹ̀kọ́, Sonny Echono, ló sọ̀rọ̀ nílùú Àbújá, lásìkò tí ikọ̀ ilé-ẹ̀kọ́ orílẹ̀ èdè Netherlands Institute of International Relations Clingendael, tí ọ̀gbẹ́ni Monika Sie Dhian Ho, jẹ́ adarí rẹ̀, yọjú síí.
target: The Permanent Secretary of the Ministry of Education, Sonny Echono, stated this in Abuja when a team from the Netherlands Institute of International Relations Clingendael, led by its General Director, Monika Sie Dhian Ho, paid him a working visit.

input: Akọ̀wé ìjọba fún àjọ ọ̀hún ní orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà yóò jẹ́ ànfààní púpọ̀ nípa ìfọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ náà.
target: The Permanent Secretary said Nigeria stands to gain a lot from the partnership.

input: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí akọ̀wé náà se sọ ó ní, Orísìírísìí ọ̀nà nípa ètò ẹ̀kọ́ ló nílò ìrànwọ́ láti ọ̀dọ̀ àwọn olókoòwò láti ilẹ̀ òkèèrè.
target: According to the Permanent Secretary, there are many aspects of the education sector that needs the intervention of investors from the advanced world.

input: Sonny Echono sọ pé ìjọba orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà ti ṣetán láti bá àwọn tó bá nífẹ̀ẹ́ sí ètò okòowó lórí ẹ̀kọ́ lórílẹ̀ èdè yìí ṣe.
target: Sonny Echono reiterated that the Nigerian Government was opened to all investment interventions in the sector.

input: Echono tún wá rọ ìjọba orílẹ̀ Dutch láti tún fọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ pẹ̀lú ìjọba orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà lórí ètò ọ̀gbìn, ìròyìn àti ị̀mọ̀ ẹ̀rọ àti ètò ẹ̀kọ́ nípa isẹ́ ọwọ́.
target: Echono urged the Dutch government to consider partnering with Nigeria in developing the Agricultural education, Information and Communication Technology and Vocational education subsectors.

input: Sáájú èyí ni, olùdarí ilé -ẹ̀kọ́ ọ̀hún, Monika Sie Dhian wá sọ pé ìjọba orílẹ̀ Dutch, ló rán àwọn wá sí orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà láti wá béèrè ọ̀nà tí ìjọba ọ̀hún yóò fi leè fọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ pẹ̀lú ìjọba orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà.
target: Earlier, the General Director of the Institute, Monika Sie Dhian said that the team was sent by the Dutch government to find areas of collaboration with the Nigerian government to help its developmental efforts.

input: Ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin yóò sàgbéyẹ̀wò ètò ààbò, òfin epo rọ̀bì àti ìdìbò.
target: Senate sets priorities ahead of resumption

input: Ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin lórilẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà ti se ìpinnu fún ọdún 2020, láti mójútó ètò ààbò, òfin fún epo rọ̀bì àti àtúnse òfin lórí ètò ìdìbò, ní kété tí wọ́n bá ti wọlé lọ́jọ́ Ìsẹ́gun.
target: The Nigerian Senate has set as top most on its agenda in 2020, the issues of security, Petroleum Industry Bill, PIB and electoral reforms as the Lawmakers reconvene in plenary this Tuesday after a month Christmas recess.

input: Abẹnugan ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin, Ahmad Lawan ní òhun wòye bí ẹsẹ̀ ètò ààbò lórílẹ̀ èdè yìí se ń se sége-sège bí ẹsẹ̀ télọ̀ jẹ́ ojúse gbogbo wọn yálà, ìjọba àpapọ̀, ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin àti gbogbo àwọn ìpele ìjọba tí ó wà, ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀ àti ìjọba ìbílẹ̀ ní láti mójútó.
target: President of the senate Dr.Ahmad Lawan observed that the heightening spate of insecurity was of growing concern that requires the collective effort of the Executive and Legislature, alongside all tiers of government at the State and Local levels.

input: Ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀ Cross River ń fẹ́ àtìlẹ́yìn fún ìbùdó omi òkun.
target: Cross River State seeks support for Deep Sea Port

input: Ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀ Cross River ti rọ ìjọba àpapọ̀ láti sàtìlẹyìn fún ojú ọ̀nà márosẹ̀ àti ìbùdó omi òkun tó wà ní Bakasi tí ìpínlẹ̀ náà ti dawọ́lé.
target: The Cross River State government has appealed to Nigerian government for assistance towards completing the super high way and Bakasi Deep Sea Port, which the State is currently constructing.

input: Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ ọ̀hún, ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n Ben Ayádé lọ bẹ̀bẹ̀ yìí lọ́jọ́ Ajé, nílé ààrẹ tó wà nílùú Àbújá, lẹ́yìn ìpàdé tí ó se pẹ̀lú ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari.
target: The State Governor, Professor Ben Ayade made the appeal on Monday, at the Presidential Villa, Abuja, after he met with President Muhammadu Buhari.

input: Gómìnà náà sọ pé isẹ́ àkànṣe méjì ní ìjọba òhun tí gùnlé, ní èyí tí ó se pàtàkì sí ìpínlẹ̀ Cross River àti orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà.
target: The Governor said the two projects were of significant importance to both Cross River State and the country at large.

input: Ó ní Mo gbóróyìn fún ààrẹ Buhari fún ètò ìrànlọ́wọ́ rẹ̀ sí gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà àti pàápàá jùlọ fún ìpínlẹ̀ Cross River.
target: I will like to commend Mr.President most especially for his usual kindness towards the people of Nigeria and Cross River in particular.
