input: Síbẹ̀síbẹ̀ ìjíròrò wa kìí se lórí ìgbàgbọ́ tí a ní nínú ìsèjọba yìí nìkan sùgbọ́n a tún jíròrò nípa ohun tí ó ju epo rọ̀bì lọ.
target: However, the discussion also went beyond that to his key trust, which is Nigeria beyond oil.

input: Gómìnà Ayade wá fọkàn gbogbo àwọn ́ọmọ ìpínlẹ̀ Rivers balẹ̀ pé, òun yóò túbọ̀ máa tẹpẹlẹ mọ́ àwọn isẹ́ àkànse tí àwọn ènìyàn yóò máa jẹ ìgbádùn rẹ̀.
target: Governor Ayade assured the people that he would continue to implement projects that would impact on their lives.

input: Ó tẹ̀síwájú pé ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀ náà tí pinnu láti fún ẹgbẹ̀rún méjì àwọn ọ̀dọ́ ní isẹ́ nípa ètò ìdàgbàsókè ohun ọ̀gbìn.
target: Employment Generation He announced that the State intends to generate employment for over two thousand young people through agriculture.

input: Gómìnà tún sọ pé ààrẹ Buhari kò ní pẹ́ wá sí ìpínlẹ̀ náà láti wá se ìfilọ́lẹ̀ àwọn ètò ìrónilágbára fún àwọn ọ̀dọ́ bí i ‘ètò G-Money ’.
target: The Governor said President Buhari would soon visit the State to inaugurate an empowerment scheme for the youth tagged ‘G-Money

input: Ilé-isẹ́ ogun òfurufú ti dáná sun ibùdó ikọ̀ ọlọ̀tẹ̀ ISWAP ní ìpínlẹ̀ Borno.
target: NAF destroys ISWAPs’ staging area in Borno

input: Ilé-isẹ́ ikọ̀ ọmọ ogun òfurufú Nigerian Air Force NAF ti dáná sun ibùdó ikọ̀ ọlọ̀tẹ̀, Islamic State of West Africa Province, ISWAP tó wà ní Gashigar ní ìpínlẹ̀ Borno.
target: The Nigerian Air Force NAF has destroyed an Islamic State of West Africa Province ISWAP staging area at Gashigar in Borno, and neutralised several of the insurgents.

input: Ilé-isẹ́ NAF sọ pé wọn tún se ìkọ̀lù sí ibi tí àwọn ikọ̀ ọlọ̀tẹ̀ ń sá pamọ́ sí ní àwọn agbègbè Tumbun Rego tó wà ní Lake Chad àti Bula Bello ní agbègbè igbó Sambisa ní ìpínlẹ̀ Borno.
target: NAF said it also took out terrorists’ hideouts at Tumbun Rego on the fringes of Lake Chad and at Bula Bello near Sambisa Forest all in Borno.

input: Air Commodore Ìbíkúnlé Dáramólá, NAF tó jẹ́ adarí ẹka ìbára-ẹni-sepọ̀ àti ìròyìn ló sọ̀rọ̀ yìí nílùú Àbújá láti sọ nípa ìkọlù orí afẹ́fẹ́ ti ikọ̀ ọmọ ogun òfurufú, Air Task Force ATF of Operation LAFIYA DOLE se láti fi dáná sun ikọ̀ ọlọ̀tẹ̀.
target: Air Commodore Ibikunle Daramola, NAF Director of Public Relations and Information who made this known in Abuja, added that it was achieved in air strikes conducted by the Air Task Force ATF of Operation LAFIYA DOLE on Friday and Saturday on the heels of credible intelligence reports.

input: Ìjọba àpapọ̀ kò nilò láti ya owó nílẹ̀ òkèèrè – SGF.
target: Tax revenue will reduce borrowing in Nigeria – SGF

input: Akọ̀wé àgbà fún ìjọba àpapọ̀ lórílẹ̀ èdè Naijiria, Boss Mustapha ti ní ti ìjọba bá leè máa rí owó nípa sísan owó –orí, wọn kò nílò láti tún yá owó mọ́.
target: Secretary to the Government of the Federation SGF, Mr.Boss Mustapha has stated that if more revenue could be generated from tax there would be less need for government to borrow.

input: Boss Mustapha sọ̀rọ̀ yìí ni ọ́fíìsì rẹ̀ lásìkò tí alága ilé-isẹ́ tó ń mójútó ètò bí owó se ń wọlé lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà FIRS, Mohammed M.Nami se ẹ́ -kááre, ẹ -ǹ- lẹ́- níbẹ̀ -yẹn sii.
target: Boss Mustapha made this known in his office when the Executive Chairman, Federal Inland Revenue Service FIRS, Mr.Mohammed M.Nami and Service’s Board paid him a courtesy visit.

input: Boss Mustapha tẹ̀síwájú pé ìjọba àpapọ̀ nílò gbogbo owó láti leè jẹ́ kí ó se ojú rẹ̀.
target: The SGF advised the FIRS Chairman to be proactive in his tax collection drive.

input: Ó wá kí alága àti ìgbìmọ̀ rẹ̀ kú orí –ire fún ipò tuntun wọn.
target: The SGF congratulated the FIRS Chairman on his recent appointment.

input: Ààrẹ Buhari pàsẹ láti kọlu jàǹdùkú,ọ̀daràn àti olè lórí afẹ́fẹ́ ní ìpínlẹ̀ Niger.
target: President Buhari authorises air raid on bandits’ hideouts in Niger State

input: Ààrẹ Buhari wá sàpèjúwe àwọn ìkọlù tó ń wáyé ní agbègbè ọ̀hún, ní èyí tí ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àwọn ènìyàn ti pàdánù ẹ̀mí wọn bí òfò fún orílẹ̀ èdè yìí.
target: President Buhari described the repeated attacks leading to the losses of several lives in the communities as a disaster for the nation.

input: Ní ìbámu ìlànà yìí, ilé-isẹ́ ọmọ ogun òfurufú àti agbófinró orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà ti setán láti bẹ̀rẹ̀ iṣẹ́ ní pẹrẹu láti ṣe ìkọlù sí àwọn ọ̀daràn nílùú Minna, ní ìpínlẹ̀ Niger láti pèsè ìrànwọ́ fún ikọ̀ ọmọ ogun òfurufú.
target: In line with this directive, the Nigerian Air Force is setting up refuelling facilities at Minna, Niger State to support the aircraft operations.

input: Ààrẹ Buhari wá bá ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀ Niger àti àwọn ọmọ ìpínlẹ̀ Niger kẹ́dùn lórí ìkọlù àti òfò ẹ̀mí tó sẹlẹ̀ ní ìpínlẹ̀ náà.
target: President Buhari commiserates with the government and people of Niger State following the attacks and the loss of lives that followed.

input: Ààrẹ wá fi dá àwọn tó farapa níbi ìsẹ̀lẹ̀ náà lójú pé orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà kò ní gbàgbé wọn.
target: The president assures that victim communities in the state will not be abandoned by the rest of the country.

input: India yóò ran Nàíjíríà lọ́wọ́ nípa ètò ajé, okòòwò, ààbò,ẹ̀kọ́.
target: Nigeria, India to strengthen bilateral ties

input: Orílẹ̀ èdè India ti sọ pé òhun setán láti túbọ̀ fọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ pẹ̀lú orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà nípa ètò ajé, okòòwò, ààbò, ẹ̀kọ́, ọkọ̀ òfurufú àti ètò ìgbafẹ́ nípa ìlera fún àǹfààní orílẹ̀ èdè méjéèjì.
target: India says it is ready to strengthen bilateral relations with Nigeria in the areas of Trade and investments, Security, Education, Aviation and medical tourism for the benefit of both countries.

input: Asojú orílẹ̀ èdè Inidia ní Nàíjíríà, Arákùnrin Abhay Thakur sọ̀rọ̀ yìí lásìkò tí orílẹ̀ èdè ọ̀hún ń se ayẹyẹ àádọ́rin ọdún tí wọń gba òmìnira àti ọgọ́ta ọdún tí orílẹ̀ èdè méjèèjì náà ń bá ara wọn se papọ̀, ní èyí tó wáyé nílùú Àbújá, lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà.
target: The Indian High Commissioner to Nigeria, Mr.Abhay Thakur, stated this, during the celebration of the Indian 70th year Republic Day and the 60th anniversary of the establishment of NigeriaIndia diplomatic relations, organized by the Commission in Abuja, the Nigeria’s capital.

input: Abhay Thakur sàlàyé pé India jẹ́ alábàáṣepọ̀ nínú ètò ìṣòwò tí ó tóbi jùlọ pẹ̀lú orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, àti Nàíjíríà náà sì jẹ́ alábàáṣepọ̀ tí ó tóbi jùlọ lórílẹ̀ èdè India ní Afirika.
target: Abhay Thakur explained that India is Nigeria’s largest trading partner, and Nigeria is Indian largest partner in Africa.

input: Àwọn pàṣípààrọ̀ lórí ètò okoòwò láàrin orílẹ̀ méjèèjì ọ̀hún ti gòkè àgbà láàrin oṣù mẹ́jọ àkọ́kọ́ lọ́dún 2019-20.
target: Nigeria has been the third largest supplier of crude oil and second largest supplier of Liquefied Natural Gas NLG to India in the year 2019-20.

input: Orílẹ̀ èdè India ti pèsè ètò ìrànlọ́wọ́ fún Nàíjíríà nípa gbígbógun ti ikọ̀ ọlọ̀tẹ̀ Boko Haram.
target: India stands together with Nigeria in its fight against Boko Hatam.

input: Mínísítà ìpínlẹ̀ fún ọ̀rọ̀ òkèèrè lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, Zubairu Dada, náà tẹpẹlẹ mọ́ ìfọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà pẹ̀lú India lọ́nà tí ìbásepọ̀ àwọn orílẹ̀ méjèèjì náà yóò se tún leè tẹ̀síwájú sii
target: The Nigerian State Minister of Foreign Affairs, Ambassador Zubairu Dada, reiterated Nigerias commitment to boost diplomatic relations with India for the mutual benefits of the two countries.

input: Láti osù kọkànlá, ọdún 1958 ni orílẹ̀ èdè India àti Nàíjíríà ti ń bá ara wọn se papọ̀.
target: India and Nigeria have been enjoying diplomatic relations since November 1958.

input: Àwọn àáfà gbàdúrà fún àlàáfíà orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà.
target: Clerics pray for peace in Nigeria

input: Àpèjọ àdúrà náà wáyé lásìkò ìgbéyàwó àbúrò ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari, Hajiya Hadiza Lawal àti Muhammad Tukur Ibrahim, tí ó wáyé ní Mọsalasi ìlú Àbújá, ní èyí tí ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari náà wà níbẹ̀.
target: The prayer session was conducted during a wedding Fathia attended by President Muhammadu Buhari between his niece, Hajiya Hadiza Lawal and Muhammad Tukur Ibrahim, at the National Mosque Abuja.

input: Ààrẹ Buhari lo àsìkò ayẹyẹ náà láti gbàdúrà fún tọkọ-taya, bákan náà ni àwọn àáfà lo ànfààní náà láti gba ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àdúrà fún ètò àlàáfíà, ìdúrósinsin àti ìdàgbàsókè orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà.
target: At the event, the President blessed the couple, while clerics used the opportunity to pray for extensively for peace and stability in the country.

input: Lára àwọn tó wà níbi ìgbéyàwó ọ̀hún tí wọn sojú ẹbí ààrẹ níbi ìgbéyàwó náà ni Mínísítà ìlú Àbújá, Muhammed Bello pẹ̀lú Dan Madamin Daura àti Alhaji Musa Haro.
target: The President’s family at the Islamic wedding was represented by Minister of the Federal Capital Territory, Muhammed Bello alongside the Dan Madamin Daura, Alhaji Musa Haro.

input: Nàíjíríà ti fẹnukò pẹ̀lú Marco láti dá àwọn ẹlẹ́wọ̀n padà sílé.
target: Nigeria legalizes agreement with Macao on transfer of sentenced persons

input: Ààrẹ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà Muhammadu Buhari ti fẹnukò pẹ̀lú ìjọba orílẹ̀ èdè Republic of China láti da àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà sùgbọ́n tí wọ́n wà lọ́gbà ẹ̀wọ̀n lórílẹ̀ èdè China padà sí orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà.
target: President Muhammadu Buhari has assented to the Instrument of Ratification of the Agreement on the Transfer of Sentenced Persons between the Government of the Federal Republic of Nigeria and the Government of the Macao Special Administrative Region of the People’s Republic of China.

input: Ìpinnu yìí wá lára ohun tí ìgbìmọ̀ ìjọba àpapọ̀ fẹnukò lé lórí ní ọjọ́ kínní, oṣù kejì, ọdún, 2018, ìgbìmọ̀ Ìjoba pàsẹ fún àdájọ́ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà tí ó tún jẹ́ mínísítà fún ètò ìdájọ́, Abubakar Malami láti se ìwé àdéhùn tí ààrẹ yóò bọwọ́lù.
target: This is sequel to the Federal Executive Council’s Decision of August 1, 2018, which approved and directed the Attorney-General of the Federation and Minister of Justice, Abubakar Malami, to prepare the Instrument of Ratification of the above Agreement for the President’s signature.

input: Olùràlọ́wọ́ ààrẹ fún ìròyìn àti ìkéde, Fémi Adésínà ti fi tó àwọn oníròyìn létí pé ààrẹ ti bọwọ́lu ìwé àdéhùn náà.
target: Special Adviser to the President on Media and Publicity, Femi Adesina revealed this to Journalists in a statement issued on Friday.

input: Àjọ EFCC yóò mu ́àwọn tó bá lọ́wọ́ nínú ìwà ìbàjẹ̀ padà sórílẹ̀ Nàíjíríà- Magu.
target: EFCC to repatriate high profile looters – Magu

input: Àjọ tó ń gbógun ti síse owó ìlú kúmọ-kúmọ lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, the Economic and Financial Crimes CommissionEFCC, ti ní gbogbo àwọn ènìyàn jàǹkàn-jàǹkàn tó bá lọ́wọ́ nínú ìwà ìbàjẹ́ sùgbọ́n tí wọ́n sálọ sókè òkun, ni àwọn yóò mú wá padà sórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà láti wá jẹ́jọ́.
target: The Economic and Financial Crimes Commission EFCC says it is set to repatriate high profiled looters on its watch list in some parts of the world.

input: Adelé àjọ EFCC, ọ̀gbẹ́ni Ibrahim Magu sọ̀rọ̀ yìí lọ́jọ́ Ìṣẹ́gun nílùú Ìlọrin, ní ìpínlẹ̀ Kwara pẹ̀lú àwọn akọ̀ròyìn.
target: The EFCC chairman, Mr Ibrahim Magu disclosed this on Tuesday in Ilorin, the Kwara state capital during a brief chat with newsmen.

input: Magun tún ṣàlàyé pé àjọ náà àti ẹgbẹ́ àwọn àgùnbánirọ̀ yóò ṣe ìkéde ìfẹ̀hónúhàn nípa ewu tó wà níbi ìwà ìbàjẹ́ káàkiri orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà lọ́jọ́ kẹrìnlá osù kejì ọdún.
target: He announced that a massive protest against corruption would be staged by the Commission and youth Corp members across the federation on the 14th of next month February to create awareness on the dangers of corruption.

input: Magun tún tẹ̀síwájú pé gbogbo ẹ̀sùn nípa ìwà ìbàjẹ́ tí àjọ náà gùnlé ni wọn yóò ri i pé wọn yanjú rẹ̀, tí àwọn afuarasí ọ̀hún yóò fojú balé ẹjọ́, ní kété tí wọn bá ti parí ìwádìí wọn.
target: He added that no ongoing corruption cases across the country would be abandoned midway, assuring that all such suspects would be charged to court as soon as investigations on their cases are completed.

input: Magu ní kìí se pé àwọn dá ọfíísì àjọ EFCC sílẹ̀ ní Ìlọrin láti máa mú àwọn aláìsẹ̀.
target: Magu, said the Ilorin Zonal Office was not established to witch-hunt anyone,

input: Ó wá rọ́ àwọn akọ̀ròyìn láti fọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ pẹ̀lú àjọ náà kí wọn leè se àseyọrí.
target: We need the cooperation of the media in making Nigeria corruption free.

input: Ilé -ẹjọ́ gíga da Simon Lalong láre gẹ́gẹ́ bi gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Plateau.
target: Supreme Court upholds Simon Lalong’s election as Plateau Governor

input: Ilé -ẹjọ́ gíga tó wà ní ìlú Àbújá, orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíria ti fòntẹ̀ lu Simon Lalong gẹ́gẹ́ bíi gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Plateau tí wọ́n dìbò yàn.
target: The Supreme Court has affirmed the election of Simon Lalong as the governor of Plateau State.

input: Ilé -ẹjọ́ gíga ọ̀hún ní wọn dá ẹjọ́ Jeremiah Useni tí ó jẹ́ olùdíje fún ipò gómìnà lábẹ́ ẹgbẹ̀ òsèlú Peoples Democratic Party PDP tí ó gbé wá sílé ẹjọ́ ọ̀hún nù, pé kò fẹsẹ̀ múlẹ̀ láti tako ìbò tó gbé Simon Lalong wọlè gẹ́gẹ́ bíi gómìnà ìpínlè ọ̀hún.
target: Jeremiah Useni of the Peoples Democratic Party PDP had filed an appeal at the apex court to challenge the victory of the candidate of the All Progressives Congress APC in the election.

input: Nínú ẹjọ́ tí adájọ́ Adamu Galinje dá ni ó ti sọ pé olùfẹ̀sùnkàn náà kò ní ẹ̀rí tó leè fi òtítọ́ ẹ̀sùn rẹ̀ múlẹ̀.
target: His appeal was, however, struck out in a unanimous judgment of the Supreme Court delivered by Justice Adamu Galinje.

input: Ilé ẹjọ́ gíga da ẹjọ́ kòtémilọ́rùn tí́ wọn pè tako àṣeyọrí Tambuwal’s gẹ́gẹ́ bíi gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ sokoto
target: Supreme Court dismisses appeal challenging Tambuwal’s victory as Sokoto Governor

input: Aminu Tambuwal olùdíje fún ipò gómìnà láti inú ẹgbẹ́ alábùradà PDP ní ilé ẹjọ́ gíga ti gbà gẹ́gẹ́ bíi ẹni tó jáwé olúborí nínú ìdìbò gómìnà ti ọdùn 2019
target: Aminu Tambuwal of the PDP has been affirmed as the winner of the 2019 governorship election in Sokoto State by Nigeria’s Supreme Court.

input: Nínú ìdájọ́ tí adájọ́ Abba-Aji kà sóde, Adájọ́ náà dá ẹjọ́ kòtẹ́milọ́rùn ti ẹgbẹ́ òṣèlú olóṣùṣùọwọ̀ APC àti olùdíje fún ẹgbẹ́ náà Ahmad Aliyu pè dànù látàrí pé ẹjọ́ náà kòmúnádóko tó.
target: In a judgment read by Justice Uwani Abba-Aji, the justices dismissed the appeal filed by the All Progressives Congress APC and its governorship candidate, Ahmad Aliyu for lacking in merit.

input: Ní ọjọ́ kejìlélógún osù kọkànlá ọdún 2019 àwọn ìgbìmọ̀ ẹlẹ́nu márùn ún ilé ẹjọ́ kòtẹ́milọ́rùn, tí Adájọ́ Usaini Murkhtar ṣe aládarí wọn da ẹjọ́ náà sígbó.
target: On Nov.22, 2019 a five-man panel of the Court of Appeal, presided over by Justice Usaini Murkhtar, dismissed the appeals.

input: Ilé ẹjọ́ kòtẹ́milọ́rùn náà sọ pé olùpẹ̀jọ́ náà kòní ẹ̀rí tó múnádóko láti fi yíí àwọn adájọ́ náà lọ́kàn padà ìdí nìyí tí wọn fi da ẹjọ́ náà sígbó.
target: The Appeal Court ruled that the appellant failed to prove his case beyond reasonable doubt, thereby dismissed the case.

input: Ilé -ẹjọ́ gíga da Abdullahi Ganduje láre gẹ́gẹ́ bi gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Kano.
target: Supreme court upholds Ganduje’s victory

input: Ilé -ẹjọ́ gíga lorílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà ti fòntẹ̀ lu Abdullahi Ganduje gẹ́gẹ́ bi gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Kano tí wọ́n dìbò yàn.
target: The Supreme court has declared Ganduje duly elected governor of Kano state.

input: Ilé -ẹjọ́ gíga ọ̀hún ni wọ́n dá ẹjọ́ tí Abba Yusuf tó jẹ́ olùdíje fún ipò gómìnà lábẹ́ ẹgbẹ́ òsèlú Peoples Democratic Party gbé wá sílé ẹjọ́ ọ̀hún ni pé kò fẹsẹ̀ múlẹ̀.
target: The panel dismissed the petitions filed by the PDP and Yusuf, governorship candidate of the opposition party, on the grounds that the petitions lack merit.

input: Ẹ jẹ́ onítara àti ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè NàíjíríàLai Mohammed.
target: Minister tasks Nigerians on patriotism, commitment to nation building

input: Mínísítà fún ìròyìn àti àsà, Alh.Lai Mohammed ti rọ gbogbo àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà láti jẹ olùfọkànsìn àti onítara, kí orílẹ̀ èdè leè ní ìdàgbàsókè tó ní ìtumọ̀.
target: The Minister of Information and Culture, Alh.Lai Mohammed has urged Nigerians to be patriotic so that the country could have meaningful development.

input: Mínísítà pe ìpè yìí lọ́jọ́ Àbámẹ́ta pẹ̀lú àwọn akọ̀ròyìn lásìkò ètò ìgbéyàwó tó wáyé ní ilé-isẹ́ àwọn ọmọ ológun orí afẹ́fẹ́, nílé ìjọ́sìn protestant tó wà nílùú Èkó.
target: The Minister made the call on Saturday while speaking with Newsmen on the sidelines of a wedding ceremony at the Nigerian Air Force Protestant Church, Lagos.

input: Ó ní ìyípadà tí àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà ń fẹ́ láti ọ̀dọ̀ ìjọba gbọdọ̀ bẹ̀rẹ̀ láti ilé ẹnìkọ̀ọ̀kan.
target: He said that Nigerians needed to know that the change they wanted to see in the government should begin from individual homes.

input: Mínísítà tún tẹ̀síwájú pé A mọ̀ rírì ohun tí àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà ń fẹ́, ìjọba kò sì ní káàrẹ́ láti mú gbogbo ìlérí tí ó se sẹ́, páàpáà jùlọ nípa ètò ọrọ̀ ajé àti láti pèsè isẹ́ lọ́pọ̀ janturu.
target: We quite appreciate the aspirations of Nigerians and the government remains focused and determined to ensure that all the promises regarding the economy and creating more jobs will come through.

input: Gbogbo ènìyàn gbọdọ̀ mọ ojúse rẹ̀ láti jẹ onítara àti láti máa dáwọ́le ohun tí ó le dá wàhálà sílẹ̀ láàrin ara wa tàbí sí ìjọba.
target: Everybody must play his or her own role by being patriotic and making sure we do not incite violence against ourselves or the government.

input: Ìdàgbàsókè ti dé bá orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà láti bí ogún ọdún sẹ́yìn- Lawan.
target: Nigeria has made substantial progress in 20 years – Senate President

input: Abẹnugan ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, Ahmad Lawan sọ pé ìyàtọ̀ ńlá àti ìdàgbàsókè ló ti dé bá orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà láti bí ogún sẹ́yìn , lẹ́yìn tí orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà ti padà sí ìjọba tiwa-n-tiwa lọ́dún 1999.
target: President of the Senate, Senator Ahmad Lawan, believes that Nigeria has made significant progress over the last twenty years since the country’s return to democracy in 1999.

input: Asòfin Ahmad Lawan sọ̀rọ̀ yìí nínú ìwé apilẹ̀kọ rẹ̀ níbi ìdánilẹ́kọ̀ọ́ ìkẹtàdínlógún ti ilé –isẹ́ akọ̀rọ̀yìn Daily Trust Dialogue se àgbékalẹ̀ rẹ̀, tí wọn pe àkòrí rẹ̀ ní Ogún ọdún ìjọba tiwa-n-tiwa lorílẹ̀ édé Nàíjíríà Agbára, Aláìlágbára àti àwọn ànfààní rẹ̀ , tí ó wáyé nílùú Àbújá lọ́jọ́BỌ̀.
target: Senator Lawan stated this in a speech delivered at the 17th Edition of the Daily Trust Dialogue with the theme Strengths, Weaknesses and Opportunities, which held in Abuja on Thursday.

input: Aliyu Sabi Abdullahi, tí ó jẹ́ igbákejì alámòjútó ètò, nílé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin ló sojú abẹnugan ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin, Lawan, tí ó jẹ́ àlejò pàtàkì níbi ayẹyẹ ọ̀hún.
target: The Senate President, who was the Special Guest of Honour at the event, was represented by the Deputy Chief Whip of the Senate, Senator Aliyu Sabi Abdullahi.

input: Abẹnugan ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin tún tẹpẹlẹ mọ́ àwọn ìgbésẹ̀ tí ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin ti gbé láti mú ìdàgbàsókè bá ètò ọ̀rọ̀ ajé orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà.
target: The Senate President while harping on the need to strengthen the country’s economy,

input: Ó ní ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin ti se ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ òfin, ní èyí tí ó ti jẹ́ kí owó tó ń wọlé sí àpò òsùwọ̀n orílẹ̀ èdè yìí tún pọ̀ síi.
target: He said the National Assembly passed legislations towards increasing Nigeria’s revenue base in addition to ensuring appropriate application.

input: Lára àwọn ènìyàn pàtàkì tó wà níbi ayẹyẹ ọ̀hún ni igbákejì ààrẹ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà tẹ́lẹ̀rí, Mohammed Namadi Sambo, tí ó jẹ́ alága ayẹyẹ náà Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Èkìtì àti alága àwọn gómìnà lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, Káyòdé Fáyemí, àti alága ẹgbẹ́ òsèlú All Progressive Congress APC tẹ́lẹ̀rí, olóyè John Oyegun.
target: Among the dignitaries who attended the event are the former Vice President of Nigeria, Mohammed Namadi Sambo who Chaired the occasion Governor of Ekiti State and Chairman of the Nigeria Governors’ Forum, Kayode Fayemi, and immediate past Chairman of the All Progressive Congress APC, Chief John Oyegun.

input: Ìpínlẹ̀ Nasarawa ti ń jẹ̀gbádùn ètò ààbò tó péye – Abdullahi Sule.
target: Nasarawa State is enjoying stability – Governor Sule

input: Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Nasarawa, Abdullahi Sule ti sọ pé ètò ààbò ti fẹsẹ̀ múlẹ̀ si ní ìpínlẹ̀ ọ̀hún, nípa ìgbésẹ̀ tí wọ́n gbé láti gbógun ti ìwà ọ̀daràn.
target: Governor Abdullahi Sule of Nasarawa State says security has greatly improved in his state, as a result of measures put in place to check the activities of criminals.

input: Ó sọ̀rọ̀ yìí lásìkò tó ń bá àwọn akọ̀ròyìn ilé akéde sọ̀rọ̀ nílùú Àbújá lẹ́yìn ìpàdé tí ó se pẹ̀lú ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari.
target: He made the disclosure, while speaking to State House correspondents, after he met with President Muhammadu Buhari.

input: Ó ní Gẹ́gẹ́ bí ọ̀kan lára ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ òsèlú APC, tí mo sì tún jẹ́ gómìnà tó ń sojú ẹgbẹ́ náà, mo wá láti rí adarí ẹgbẹ́ wa, ààrẹ Buhari láti sọ nípa bí ìpínlẹ̀ míì, tí ó ní ànfààní láti súnmọ́ ìlú Àbújá se ń lọ síi, ìyẹn Nasarawa.
target: As a member of the APC and as a governor representing the party, I came in to pay respect to the leader of our party, Mr.President and I came in also to brief him about a state that has the greatest proximity to the Federal Capital, that is Nasarawa.

input: Mo ní ànfààní láti sọ fún ààrẹ Buhari nípa bí ìpínlẹ̀ Nasarawa se ń lọ, bí i ètò ààbò àti ìdàgbàsókè tí ó ti dé bá ìpínlẹ̀ Nasarawa ‘’
target: It is very important for Mr.President to know what is happening in the state and I used the opportunity to brief him on certain issues, issues about security, issues about development that are taking place in Nasarawa.

input: Gómìnà Sule ní òun wá rí ààrẹ Buhari láti wá dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ rẹ̀ fún bí ó ṣe dá ilé-ẹkọ́ àwọn ọlọ́pàá sílẹ̀ ní ìpínlẹ̀ ọ̀hún.
target: Governor Sule said he was in the State House to thank President Buhari for establishing a Mobile Police Training Institute in Nasarawa State.

input: Ààrẹ Buhari yan Kingsley Obiora gẹ́gẹ́ bi igbákejì gómìnà CBN.
target: Nigerian President nominates Kingsley Obiora as CBN Deputy Governor

input: Ààrẹ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, Muhammadu Buhari ti forúkọ Kingsley Isitua Obiora ránsẹ́ sí ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin àgbà gẹ́gẹ́ bí igbákejì gómìnà fún ilé-ìfowópamọ́ ti ìjọba àpapọ̀ CBN.
target: President Muhammadu Buhari has sent the name of Dr Kingsley Isitua Obiora to the Senate for confirmation as Deputy Governor of the Central Bank of Nigeria.

input: Nínú ìwé tí ààrẹ Buhari fi ránsẹ́ sí abẹnugan ilé ìgbìmọ́ asòfin, Ahmad Lawan, láti yan Kingsley Isitua Obiora gẹ́gẹ́ bí igbákejì gómìnà fún ilé-ìfowópamọ́ ti ìjọba àpapọ̀ CBN wà ní ìbámu pẹ̀lú òfin 81 2 tí ó dá banki CBN sílẹ̀ Establishment Act 2007.
target: In a letter to President of the Senate, Ahmad Lawan, President Buhari said the nomination was in accordance with the provision of Section 81 2 of the Central Bank of Nigeria Establishment Act 2007.

input: Ọ̀mọ̀wé Obiora, ni yóò dípò Joseph Nnanna, tí ó fẹ̀yìntì ní ọjọ́ kejì, osú kejí, ọdún 2020.
target: Dr Obiora, upon confirmation by the Senate, replaces Dr Joseph Nnanna, who retires on February 2, 2020.

input: Ọ̀mọ̀wé Obiora gba oyè Bachelor’s degree nínú ìmọ̀ ètò ìnáwó Economics àti ìsirò láti fásitì Benin, ó tún ní ìmọ̀ ìjìnlẹ̀ nínú ètò ìnáwó Masters in Economics láti Fásitì ìlú Ìbàdàn, ó tún gba oyè ọ̀mọ̀wé nínú Monetary and International Economics, láti fásitì ìlú Ìbàdàn.
target: Dr Obiora holds a Bachelor’s degree in Economics and Statistics from the University of Benin, a Masters in Economics from the University of Ibadan, and a Doctorate in Monetary and International Economics, also from the University of Ibadan.

input: Ọ̀mọ̀wé Obioraje jé ọ̀kan lára àwọn adarí nílé ìfowópamọ́ àgbáyé International Monetary Fund IMF ni Washington DC, lórílẹ̀ èdè United States of America USA.
target: He is currently an Alternate Executive Director in the International Monetary Fund IMF In Washington DC, United States of America.

input: Ìdásilẹ̀ Àmọ́tẹ́kùn lòdì sí òfin orílẹ̀-èdè Nàíjiríà ọdún 1999 – Malami.
target: Nigerian Government declares Operation Amotekun an illegal outfit

input: Ìjọba orilẹ̀-èdè Naijiria ti ní ikọ̀ elétò ààbò tuntun ti àwọn gómìnà ẹkùn Gúsù orílẹ̀-èdè Nàíjiríà dá sílẹ̀ iyẹn, Àmọ̀tẹ́kùn lòdì sí òfin orílẹ̀-èdè Nàíjiríà.
target: The Federal Government has declared ‘Operation Amotekun’ an illegal outfit.

input: Nínú àtẹ̀jáde kàn tí olùbádámọ̀ràn pàtàkì lóri ìròyìn àti ìbára -ẹni sepọ̀, Umar Gwandu sọ pé, Àmọ̀tẹ́kùn dídásílẹ̀ ẹgbẹ́ kìí ṣe èyi to ba òfin orílẹ̀-èdè Nàíjiríà mu.
target: This was disclosed in a statement signed by the Special Assistant, Media and Public Relations Office of the Attorney-General of the Federation and Minister of Justice, Dr.The setting up of the paramilitary organization called Amotekun is illegal and runs contrary to the provisions of the Nigerian law, the statement read.

input: Agbẹjọ́rò àgbà fún ìjọba àpapọ̀ Abubakar Malami SAN sàlàyé pé, ọ̀rọ̀ ààbò jẹ ojúṣe ìjọba àpapọ níkàn ni.
target: The Attorney-General of the Federation Abubakar Malami SAN explained, security is the responsibility of the federal government.

input: Nítorí ìdí èyí kò si Gómìnà yálà ẹyọ kan tàbi lápapọ̀ to ni ẹ̀tọ tàbi agbára láti ṣe ìdásílẹ̀ ilé iṣẹ́ tàbí àjọ kankan to níṣe pẹ̀lú èètò ààbo.
target: According to the government, consequently, no other authority at the state level, whether the executive or legislature has the legal authority over defence.

input: Ilé -ẹjọ́ gíga orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà yọ gómínà Imo, Emeka Ihedioha.
target: Supreme Court declares Uzodinma winner

input: Ilé-ẹjọ́ gíga lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà ti ní kí wọ́n yọ gómínà ìpínlẹ̀ Imo , Emeka Ihedioha, kí àjọ elétò ìdìbò sí kéde Hope Uzodinma olùdíje fún ipò gómìnà lábẹ́ ẹgbẹ́ òṣèlú, All Progressive Party APC gẹ́gẹ́ bí gómìnà tuntun fún ìpínlẹ̀ náà.
target: The Supreme Court in a unanimous Judgment on Tuesday sacked Emeka Ihedioha as Governor of Imo State, declared Hope Uzodinma winner and ordered INEC to issue Uzodinma certificate of return.

input: Ìdájọ́ ètò ìdìbò ìpínlẹ̀Adájọ́ ilé-ẹjọ́ gíga subú lu àìsàn lójijì.
target: Supreme Court adjourns abruptly

input: Ilé-ẹjọ́ gíga tó wà nílùú Àbújá, ti sún ìdájọ́ lórí ètò ìdìbò gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Kano 2019 síwájú, nítorí ọ̀kan lára adájọ́ méje tó wà nílé-ẹjọ́ náà subú lu àìsàn lójijì lásíkò ti ẹjọ́ ń lọ lọ́wọ́.
target: The Supreme Court in Abuja, Nigeria has adjourned abruptly when one of the seven justices hearing the appeal in the 2019 Kano State Governorship Election suddenly fell ill during court sitting.

input: Adájọ́ àgbà fún ilé-ẹjọ́ gíga náà, Tanko Mohammad, ló kéde yìí lẹ́yìn tí agbẹjọ́rò fún Abbah Yusuf tó jẹ́ ọmọ ẹgbẹ́, peoples Democratic party, Gboyega Awomolo rọ ilé-ẹjọ́ náà láti dá ẹjọ́ ọ̀hún.
target: The Chief Justice of Nigeria, Justice Tanko Mohammad, told the crowded court that one of its justices hearing the case is critically ill shortly after Counsel for Abbah Yusuf of the peoples Democratic party, Gboyega Awomolo adopted his brief and urged the court to allow the appeal.

input: Tanko Mohammad ní ilé-ẹjọ́ nílò láti sún ẹjọ́ náà síwájú di ojó kerìnlá, osù kínní, odún 2020.
target: Justice Tanko Mohammad stated that the court will have to abruptly rise to reconvene shortly on January 14, 2020.

input: Ìrántí àwọn olóOsinbajo gbósùbà fún àwọn tó fẹ̀mí wọn lélẹ̀.
target: VP Osinbajo eulogises fallen heroes

input: Igbákejì ààrẹ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n Yemí Òsínbàjò ní oriĺẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà jẹ oriĺẹ̀ èdè tó ní ẹ̀yà, àsà àti èdè orísirísi, nítorí ipa tí àwọn akínkanjú kan tó fi ara wọn se ìrúbọ nígbà kan sẹ́yìn àti níbàyìí ti kó.
target: The Vice President of Nigeria, Professor Yemi Osinbajo has stated that the diverse people of Nigeria are a nation today because of the sacrifices of our heroes both past and present.

input: Igbákejì ààrẹ sọ̀rọ̀ yìí níbi ìsìn ayẹyẹ àyájọ́ ọdún fún àwọn ológun tó subú lójú ogun ti ọdún 2020, ní èyí tí ó wáyé nílé-ìjọ́sìn, National Christian Centre, tó wà nílùú Àbújá.
target: The Vice President stated this in his remark at the 2020 Armed Forces and Remembrance Day Inter-Denominational Church Serve held at the National Christian Centre, Abuja.

input: Igbákejì ààrẹ tún sọ pé, ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari kò ní káàrẹ́ láti túbọ́ máa mójútó ìgbáyé-gbádùn ilé-isẹ́ ológun.
target: He also reiterated President Muhammadu Buhari commitment to the wellbeing of the armed forces.

input: Nínú ìwásù tí àkòrí rẹ́ jẹ́ Ìpè láti sìn tí oníwàásù ìjọ Church of Christ in Nations COCIN Reverend Dr.Dachollom Chumang Datiri sọ pé ọlọ́run pe gbogbo wa lá́ti wa sìn òun àti àwọn ènìyàn.
target: Call to Serve Delivering the Message titled The Call to Serve Church Of Christ In Nations COCIN President, Reverend Dr.Dachollom Chumang Datiri said we are all called to serve God and to serve humanity.

input: Adarí ilé-isẹ́ ológun fún ètò ààbò lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, ọ̀gágun Gabriel Olanisakin, ni ó ka ẹ̀kọ́ kíkà àkọ́kọ́ láti Genesis 3-1-19, nígbà tí igbákejì abẹnugan ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin àgbà fún ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ tó kéré jùlọ, Peter Okpatasai, ka ẹ̀kọ́ kejì láti inú, John 11-19.
target: The 1st Reading of the service was taken from the book of Genesis 3-1-19 and read by the Chief of Defence Staff, General Gabriel Olanisakin.While the 2nd reading was taken from the book of John 11-19 by the Senate Deputy Majority Leader, Honourable Peter Okpatasai.

input: Alága ètò náà, arábìnrin, Olu Mustapha wá dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ Ọlọ́run àti àwọn ènìyàn pàtàkì tó wà níbi ayẹyẹ náà fún ìdàgbàsókè wọn lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà.
target: Nation Building Chairman Planning Committee, Mrs.Olu Mustapha expressed gratitude to God and all the dignitaries who honoured the invitation and for the commitment to developing the nation.

input: Ètò ìdájọ́ gómìnà ní ìpínlẹ̀Ọlọ́pàá pèsè ààbò tó nípọn.
target: Police beefs up security in Sokoto

input: Ilé-isẹ́ ọlọ́pàá tó wà ní ìpínlẹ̀ Sokoto, ti ní ọlọ́pàá tí kò dín ní ẹgbẹ̀rún kan, mọ́ èyí tí kò wọsọ ni àwọn ti pín káàkiri gbogbo orígun ìpínlẹ̀ Sokoto.
target: The Sokoto State Police Command says it has deployed no fewer than 1000 conventional and plain clothes Officers and men across Sokoto State.

input: Kọmísọ́nà ọlọ́pàá fún ìpínlẹ̀ náà, Ibrahim Kaoje, ni Ilé-isẹ́ ọlọ́pàá gbé ìgbésẹ̀ náà láti rí i pé ètò ààbò tó péye wà ní ìpínlẹ̀ náà lásìkò àti lẹ́yìn ìdájọ́ ọ̀hún, tí yóò wáyé lónìí yìí.
target: The State Commissioner of Police, Mr Ibrahim Kaoje, said the measure was to ensure that peace reigns before and after the hearing.

input: Àwọn àjòjì ló ń se fàyàwọ́ wọnú orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà Emir ti Yashkira.
target: The Emir of Yashkira

input: Emir sọ̀rọ̀ yìí ní ààfin rẹ̀ lásìkò tí adarí àwọn ikọ̀ tó ń mójútó ààlà orílẹ̀ èdè Comptroller Mohammed Uba Garba wá sí ààfin emir náà fún ìpolongo àti ìlanilọ́yẹ̀ nípa bí ìjọba se ti ààlà orílẹ̀ èdè yìí pa.
target: The Emir stated this in his palace when the Coordinator Joint Border Drill Operations, Comptroller Mohammed Uba Garba took his Campaign and sensitisation programmes to Border Communities in the state.

input: Ó tẹ̀síwájú pé orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà kò leè fọwọ́rọ́ ilé-iṣẹ́ asọ́bodè sẹ́yìn nípa pípa owó sí àpò òsùwọ̀n orílẹ̀ èdè yìí.
target: The monarch noted that the Nigeria Customs Service is almost the heart of the Nation when it comes to revenue generation in the country.

input: Emir náà tún tẹ̀síwájú pé ìgbésẹ̀ tí ìjọba gbé láti ti ààlà orílẹ̀ èdè yìí pa yóò jẹ́ kí ìdàgbàsókè bá ètò ọrọ̀ ajé orílẹ̀ èdè yìí.
target: Healthy Growth The Traditional ruler disclosed that the policy on border closure is for the healthy growth of the Nigerian economy and advised that traditional leaders should always be involved in decision making process as well.

input: Ó wá rọ ìjọba láti gbé ìgbésẹ̀ tó lágbára lórí àwọn ọ̀bàyéjẹ́ tó ń fa aago ètò ọrọ̀ ajé orílẹ̀ èdè yíí sẹ́yìn, kí ìjọba sì tún fi ọwọ́ òfin mú àwọn ilé-isẹ́ tó ń ta epo rọ̀bì ṣùgbọ́n tí wọn kò gba ìwé àsẹ láti bẹ̀rẹ̀ isẹ́ wọn.
target: He also advocated that strict measures be meted out to economic saboteurs and the licensed fuelling stations should be identified and those without license be closed.

input: Gómìnà Nasiru El-Rufai ti ilé –ìtajà afẹ́fẹ́ gáàsì pa.
target: Kaduna Governor orders closure of gas retail shops in residential areas

input: Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Kaduna, Nasiru El-Rufai ti pàsẹ pé kí ní kíákíá, ní wàrà-sesà ni kí wọn ti ilé –ìtajà afẹ́fẹ́ gáàsì tó wà ní agbègbè ibi tí àwọn ènìyàn kọ́lé wọn sih, pa.
target: Governor Nasiru El-Rufai of Kaduna State has ordered the closure of all gas refill stations located within residential areas.

input: Gómìnà tún wá rọ àwọn olùgbé àgbègbè náà láti máa fi ìròyìn náà tó àwọn alásẹ létí lórí irú ìgbésẹ̀ bẹ́ẹ̀.
target: The Governor, who gave the order appealed to residents to report such gas outlets to government for immediate action.

input: Nasiru El-Rufai sọ̀rọ̀ yìí lọ́jọ́ Àbámẹ́ta lásìkò tí ìjàmbá iná kan sẹlẹ̀ ní àgbègbè Sabon Tasha, ní ìpínlẹ̀ Kaduna.
target: While on a visit to the Saturday’s gas explosion at Sabon Tasha, Kaduna, he said the gas refill stations would be relocated to industrial layouts.

input: Ó ní ìjọba yóò gbé ilé-iṣẹ́ afẹ́fẹ́ gáàsì náà kúrò lọ sí ibi tí wọn pèsè fún àwọn ilé-isẹ́, Nasiru El-Rufai tún sọ péÓ seni láànú pé irú ìsẹ̀lẹ̀ báyìí tún wáyé.
target: It is most unfortunate that this incident has happened, it has further proven that.

input: Èyí ti fihàn pé afẹ́fẹ́ gáàsì léwu fún àwọn ènìyàn, ní èyí tí kò yẹ kí irú ilé-ìtajà bẹ́ẹ̀ wà ní àgbègbè tí àwọn ènìyàn ń gbé.
target: Gas retail is a high risk activity that should not be allowed to be located in residential areas.

input: A o ko wọn kúrò níbi tí wọn wà yìí, a ó fún wọn nílẹ̀ tí wọn yóò gbé máa ta afẹ́fẹ́ gáàsì, ní èyí tí yóò fi dènà irú ìsẹ̀lẹ̀ báyìí.
target: We will relocate them we will give them land in industrial areas where adequate precautions to prevent things like this will be put in place.For now, we have to get all these gas refilling plants within the metropolis and towns relocated and shut down, he stressed.

input: Gómìnà wá bá àwọn ẹbí, ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n Simon Mallam kẹ́dùn, tí ó kú níbi ìjàmbá iná afẹ́fẹ́ gáàsì ná, Ó tún kàn sí àwọn tó farapa níbi ìsẹ̀lẹ̀ ọ̀hún, tí wọn ń gba ìtọ́jú nílé ìwòsàn, Gerald hospital, tó wà ní ìpínlẹ̀ Kaduna.
target: The Governor also paid condolence visit to the family of Professor Simon Mallam who died in the incident and also visited victims of the gas explosion receiving treatment at St Gerald hospital, Kaduna.

input: Ó tún gbàdúrà fún àwọn tó pàdánù ẹ̀mí wọn níbi ìsẹ̀lẹ̀ ọ̀hún, pé kí Ọlọ́run tẹ́ wọn sí afẹ́fẹ́ ire.
target: He prayed for the souls of those who died and quick recovery of those in hospitals.

input: Kwara da mílííọ̀nù mọ́kànlélógún naira padà fún àwọn arìnrìnàjò Hajj.
target: Kwara approves disbursement of N21m to 2019 hajj pilgrims

input: Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Kwara, Mallam AbdulRahman AbdulRasaq ti fi mílííọ̀nù mọ́kànlélógún náírà sílẹ̀ fún àwọn arìnrìnàjò tó lọ sí ilẹ̀ mímọ́ Hajj lọ́dún 2019.
target: The Kwara State Governor, Mallam AbdulRahman AbdulRasaq has approved the disbursement of twenty one million naira to all the 2019 hajj pilgrims.

input: Akọ̀wé àgbà fún ìrìnàjò ilẹ̀ mímọ́ Hajj ní ìpínlẹ̀ Kwara, Alhaji Tunde Jimoh ló sọ̀rọ̀ yìí lọ́jọ́ Ajé lásìkò tó ń bá àwọn akọ̀ròyìn sọ̀rọ̀ nílùú Ìlọrin.
target: The Executive Secretary of the State Muslims Pilgrims welfare Board, Alhaji Tunde Jimoh stated this on Monday while speaking with newsmen in Ilorin.

input: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí ó sẹ sọ, ó ní ìjọba orílẹ̀ èdè Saudi Arabia ló dá owó náà padà fún wọn, nítorí pé wọn kùnà láti pèsè àwọn ètò tó yẹ kí wọn se fún àwọn arìnrìnàjò lọ́dún náà.
target: According to him, the amount is the refund by the Saudi Arabian government for the services not rendered to the pilgrims.

input: Alhaji Jimoh wá rọ́ àwọn arìnrìnàjò 2019 ọ̀hún láti wà pẹ̀lú àwọn ìwé ìdánimọ̀ ayélujára, ìwé ìrìnnà àti ẹ̀dà ìwé owó tí wọn fi sanwó ìrìnàjò lọ sí Hajj ti ọdún náà.
target: Alhaji Jimoh urged all the 2019 pilgrims to come along with their original e-passports, one photocopy of their e-passport and receipt of payment of Hajj fare.

input: Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀yọ́ sèfilọ́lẹ̀ ọjọ́ ìrántí àwọn ológun pẹ̀lú mílíọ̀nù Mẹ́ta naira.
target: Oyo Governor launches Armed Forces emblem with N3m

input: Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀yọ́, Seyi Makinde ti sèfilọ́lẹ̀ ọjọ́ ìrántí àwọn ológun ti ọdún 2020 àti àmì ẹ̀yẹ pẹ̀lú ẹ̀bùn owó mílííọ̀nù mẹ́ta náírà.
target: The Governor of Oyo State, Seyi Makinde, has launched the 2020 Armed Forces and Remembrance Day emblem appeal with a N3m donation.

input: Mákindé wá gbósùbà fún àwọn ọmọ -ogun orílẹ̀ èdè yìí, tí wọn fi ẹ̀mí wọn lélẹ̀ láti jẹ́ kí àlááfíà àti ìsọ̀kan jọba lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà.
target: Governor Makinde commended the efforts of those who paid the ultimate price while fighting for the peace and unity of Nigeria, enjoining all citizens to contribute towards supporting the families they left behind.

input: Ó wá rọ àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà láti túbọ̀ máa sàtìlẹyìn fún àwọn ẹbí tí àwọn olóògbé náà fi sílẹ̀.
target: Governor Makinde stated that the Oyo State government would continue to support the activities of the Nigerian Legion.

input: Ó yẹ kí á máa sàtìlẹyìn fún àwọn ọmọ -ogun tó farapa, àwọn opó àti ọmọ àwọn akínkanjú ọmọ-ogun tí wọn subú lójú ogun.
target: Especially those viable projects meant for the benefit of the dependants of the fallen heroes.

input: A ó mójútó ètò ààbò àti àlàáfíà nílẹ̀Buhari.
target: President Buhari restates desire for stability in West Africa

input: Ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari ti ní ohun yóò túbọ̀ tẹpẹlẹ mọ́ ètò ààbò, ìdàgbàsókè àti àseyọrí nílẹ̀ Afirika.
target: President Muhammadu Buhari has reiterated his desire for stability, peace, progress and prosperity in the entire West Africa.

input: Ààrẹ Buhari sọ̀rọ̀ yìí lásìkò tí ààrẹ Umaro Muhktar Sissoco Embalo ti orílẹ̀ èdè Guinea Bissau sẹ̀sẹ̀ yàn wá dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ rẹ̀.
target: Responding to Umaro Muhktar Sissoco Embalo, the President-elect of Guinea Bissau, who came to Nigeria on a thank you visit.

input: Ààrẹ Buhari tún wá gbósùbà fún ààrẹ, José Mário Vaz, tó ń sẹ̀sẹ̀ ń fi ipò sílẹ̀ fún àtìlẹyìn tí o sé fún ààrẹ tuntun ọ̀hún lásìkò ètò ìdìbò.
target: President Buhari commended the out-going President, José Mário Vaz, himself a candidate in the elections for supporting the emergence of Embalo in the second round of balloting in the interest of peace and stability.

input: Ààrẹ Buhari sọ pé ìtàn àti orílẹ̀ èdè Guinea Bissau kò ní gbàgbé ipa ribiribi tí ààrẹ Jose Mario Vaz kó lásìkò ètò ìdìbò, ní èyí tí ó gba láti jẹ́ kí ìfẹ́ orílẹ̀ èdè Guinea Bissau ju ìfẹ́ ọkàn rẹ̀ lọ.
target: He said history will remember President Mario Vaz for putting National interest above his own, emphasising that he cared for peace within the region.

input: Ààrẹ Embalo tí ó jẹ́ onísòwò, kí ó tó di olósèlú, ti fi ìgbà kan jẹ́ adarí ìjọba orílẹ̀ èdè Guinea Bissau lábẹ́ àkóso ààrẹ Jose Mario Vaz láàrin ọdún 2016 sí 2018.
target: President-elect Embalo, a businessman-turned politician, was Prime Minister of Guinea Bissau under incumbent President Jose Mario Vaz between 2016 and 2018.

input: Ó tún jẹ́ ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ òsèlú ruling African Party of Independence of Guinea àti Cape Verde PAIGC lásìkò tí ó dá ẹgbẹ́ Movement for Democratic Alternative MADEM-G15, sílẹ̀, ní èyí tí ó fí díje fún ipò ààrẹ, tí ó sì jáwé olúborí.
target: He was a member of the ruling African Party of Independence of Guinea and Cape Verde PAIGC when he founded the Movement for Democratic Alternative MADEM-G15 on which platform he won the elections.

input: Orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà yóò ti di ògbóntarìgì nípa ẹ̀rọ ìgbàlódé láàrin ọdún mẹ́wàá.
target: Nigerian government sets 10 year plan to achieve digital literacy

input: Ìjọba orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà ti ní láàrin ọdún mẹ́wàá tí a wà yìí, o dájú pé gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà ni yóò ti ní ìmọ̀ nípa ẹ̀rọ ìgbàlódé.
target: The Nigerian government has said that Nigeria would achieve digital literacy in the next 10 years.

input: Mínísítà tún tẹ̀síwájú pé gbogbo àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà ni yóò jẹ ànfààní ẹ̀kọ́ nípa ìmọ̀ ẹ̀rọ.
target: The Minister said that the digital literacy training would cut across several categories of Nigerians, and would be taken to all corners in the country.

input: Pa Adama Aduku di olóògbé.
target: Pa Adamu has passed away

input: Ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari ti bá ẹbí, ọ̀rẹ́ àti ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀ Kogi kẹ́dùn ikú Adama Aduku Adamu jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára àwọn ọmọ-ogun orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, tó ja ogun àgbáyé kejì,world war 11, ọmọ ọdún mọ́kànlélọ́gọ́rùn ún 101 Adama Aduku kó tó fi ayé sílẹ̀.
target: President Muhammadu Buhari has condoled with family of the oldest surviving soldier of the Nigerian Army and World War 11 Veteran, Pa Adama Aduku, who passed on at the age of 101, describing him as a soldier’s soldier and an epitome of honour.

input: Ààrẹ wá gbàdúrá pé kí Ọlọ́run tẹ́ olóògbé náà sí afẹ́fẹ́ ire, kí Ọlọ́run sì tu àwọn ẹbí́ olóògbé náà nínú.
target: The President prays that the almighty God will receive the soul of the departed, and comfort his family.

input: Ọlọ́pàá mẹ́rìnléláàdọ́rin gba ìgbéga lẹ́nu isẹ́ ní ìpínlẹ̀ Kaduna.
target: Police Force promotes 74 officers in Kaduna

input: Kọmísọ́nà àwọn ọlọ́pàá ní ìpínlẹ̀ Kaduna, Ali Janga ti ṣe àwọn ọlọ́pàá mẹ́rìnléláàdọ́rin 74 tí wọ́n sẹ̀sẹ̀ gba oyè ìgbéga lẹ́nu isẹ́, lọ́sọ̀ọ́.
target: The Commissioner of Police, CP, Kaduna State Command, Ali Janga decorated about 74 officers who had just been promoted.

input: Ali ní ìgbéga náà jẹ́ ara akitiyan adarí ilé-isẹ́ ọlọ́pàá lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, láti ṣe móríyá fún àwọn ọlọ́pàá tí o ti ṣe gudu gudu méje, yàyà mẹfà lẹ́nu iṣẹ́, nípa gbígbógun ti ìwà ọ̀daràn lorílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà.
target: The promotion of Ali was part of the Inspector-General of Police’s commitment to motivate personnel and strengthen the fight against crime in Nigeria.

input: Kọmísọ́nà náà tún sọ pé ìgbéga náà wà lára ìlànà ilé-isẹ́ ọlọ́pàá orílẹ̀ èdè yìí láti jẹ́ kí ètò ààbò tún fẹsẹ̀ múlẹ̀ síi lorílẹ́ èdè Nàíjíríà.
target: The Commissioner said the promotion was in line with the police agenda for improving security and stability.

input: Kọmísọ́nà náà wá gbósùbà fún àwọn ènìyàn ìpínlẹ̀ náà àti akọ̀ròyìn fún àtìlẹyìn wọn fún ilé-iṣẹ́ ọlọ́pàá pàápàá jùlọ fún ìròyìn àti ẹ̀sùn tí wọn fi ń tó wọn létí.
target: The CP commended the people of the State and the media for their continuous support to the command, especially in giving prompt information and complaints.

input: Amina Mohammed gba àmì ẹ̀yẹ àgbáyé.
target: Amina Mohammed wins Global Citizen Award

input: Ààrẹ Mohammadu Buhari ti kí mínísítà àná fún ètò àyíká, Amina Mohammed fún àmì ẹ̀yẹ àgbáyé lórí mímú ìgbé ayé ìdẹ̀rùn bá àwọn ènìyàn, pàápàá jùlọ fún ipa pàtàkì tí ó ń kó lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà nípa bí ó se ń ran àwọn tó kù díẹ̀ kí wọ́n fọwọ́-họrí lọ́wọ́.
target: President Muhammadu Buhari has felicitated with United Nations Deputy Secretary General, Amina Mohammed, for winning the World Leader Prize at the inaugural Global Citizen award ceremony held in London.

input: Ààrẹ Buhari wá gbósùbà fún igbákejì akọ̀wé àgbà fún àjọ àgbáyé UN fún ipa ribi-ribi tí ó ń kó láti mú ìpinnu àjọ àgbáyé wá sí ìmúsẹ, nípa mímú àwọn ènìyàn kúrò nínú ìsẹ́ àti òṣì, kí ó tó di ọdún 2030.
target: President Buhari extols the UN Deputy Secretary General for her contributions to global development, and relentless priming of world leaders to work towards achieving the UN’s Sustainable Development Goals and end extreme poverty by 2030.

input: Ààrẹ Buhari wá rọ igbákejì akọ̀wé àgbà náà láti máa káàrẹ́ẹ̀ nípa síse ìrànwọ́ fún àwọn ènìyàn lọ́nà àtiyọ wọn kúrò nínú ìṣẹ́.
target: President Buhari wishes the United Nations Deputy Secretary General more prosperous years of achievements.

input: Ènìyàn mọ́kàndínlógún pàdánù ẹ̀mí wọn ní ìpínlẹ̀ Kogi.
target: people loss of lives in Kogi attack

input: Ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari ti fi àìdùnnú rẹ̀ hàn lórí ìwà ìpànìyàn tó wáyé ní agbègbè Tawari ní ìpínlẹ̀ Kogi, níbi tí àwọn agbébọn kan ti pa àwọn ènìyàn mọ́kàndínlógún.
target: President Muhammadu Buhari has condemned the gruesome murder of 19 people by unknown gunmen in Tawari community of Kogi Local Government Area, Kogi State.

input: Nígbà tí ààrẹ Buhari ń sọ̀rọ̀ lórí ìsẹ̀lẹ̀ náà, ó ní Kò sí àwáwí tàbí ẹjọ́ kankan fún ẹnìkan tàbí ẹgbẹ́ nípa gbiǵba ẹ̀mí àwọn áláìsẹ̀.
target: Commenting on the sad incident,there is no excuse or justification for killing innocent people by anybody or group, and for whatever motive.’’

input: ’’ Gbígba ẹ̀mí tábi gbígbẹ̀san nípa gbígba ẹ̀mí máa ń jẹ́ kí ìwà ipá gbilẹ̀ sìí ni, ní èyí tí ó leè se àkóbá fún ètò ààbò.
target: The killings and revenge killings will only aggravate the cycle of violence, creating neither safety nor security for any side.

input: Ààrẹ wá rọ gbogbo àwọn ènìyàn láti máa yanjú aáwọ̀ wọn ni ìtùbí-ìnùbí dípò síse ara ẹni ní ìjàmbá.
target: The President called on citizens to always embrace dialogue in settling disputes.

input: Ẹ sàtìlẹ́yìn fún ìjọAbiola Ajimobi.
target: Support the administration of President Buhari

input: Gómìnà àná fún ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀yọ́ Abiola Ajimobi ti rọ gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà láti túbọ̀ máa sàtìlẹyìn fún ìjọba Muhammadu Buhari, kí wọ́n sì ní ìgbàgbọ́ nínú ìsejọba rẹ̀.
target: Former Governor of Oyo State, Abiola Ajimobi, has called on Nigerians to continue to place their trust in the administration of President Muhammadu Buhari.

input: Ajímọ̀bi ní ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari tí ń se gudu gudu méje, yàyà mẹfà láti rí i pé àtúnse débá ètò ọrọ̀ ajé orílẹ̀ èdè yìí.
target: He urged Nigerians to cooperate with his team, saying they are capable of ensuring the remarkable economic turn around that all Nigerians hope for.

input: Ajímòbi sọ̀rọ̀ yìí láti ẹnu agbẹnusọ rẹ̀, Bolaji Tunji, ó tún lo àsìkò náà lati rọ gbogbo ọmọ ẹgbẹ All Progressives Congress, APC, to wa ni ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀yọ́ láti gba àtúnse tí wọn fẹ́ se nínú ẹgbẹ́ náà láàyè fún ànfààní ẹgbẹ́ àti àwọn ọmọ ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀yọ́.
target: The former governor gave this charge in a new year message issued by his Spokesman, Mr Bolaji Tunji, where he also charged members of the Oyo State chapter of the All Progressives Congress, APC, to embrace true reconciliation in the interest of the Party and the people of the State.

input: Ó tún sọ pé, Ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn ènìyàn ló ti ṣẹ̀ mí, èmi náà sì ṣẹ ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn ènìyàn.
target: He said, Some people offended me and I offended some people too.

input: Ṣùgbọ́n kí á leè gba àtúnse láàyè, a gbọdọ̀ dáríjin ara wa, kí a sì jẹ́ kí ohun tí ó ti kọjá lọ, bá ọdún 2019 lọ.
target: But in the spirit of true reconciliation, we should forgive one another and allow the past to end with 2019, he said.

input: Mínísítà fún àwọn ọmọ ọgọ́fà tí wọ́n bí lọ́jọ́ ọdún tuntun lẹ́bùn.
target: Minister donates items to 120 Babies of the year

input: Minisita ìpínlẹ̀ fún, FCTA Nigerian Federal capital territory administration, Ramatu Tijjani Aliyu, ti fi ẹ̀bùn orísirísi àti owo fun awọn ọmọ ọgọ́fà ti wọn bi lasiko ọdún tuntun yìí ni àwọn ilé ìwòsàn alábọ́dé tó wà ní ni ìjọba ìbílẹ̀ mẹ́fẹ́ẹ̀fà tó wà nílùú Àbújá.
target: The Minister of State in the Nigerian Federal capital territory administration, FCTA , Dr.Ramatu Tijjani Aliyu, has donated baby items and cash to 120 babies delivered in selected Primary Health Care Centres across the six Area Councils of the territory, to celebrate the New Year.

input: Mínísítà ti adelé akọ̀wé àgbà fún ilé ìwòsàn alábọ́dé sojú rẹ̀, Iwot Ndaeyo dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ àwọn òbí fún ìtọ́jú ọmọ wọn, nígbà tí ó sì ń tẹnumọ pé ẹ̀bùn láti ọ̀dọ̀ Ọlọ́run ni ọmọ.
target: The minister who was represented by the Acting Executive Secretary of Primary Health Care Centre, Dr.Iwot Ndaeyo also tasked mothers on early training of their children, just as she emphasised that children are gifts from God.

input: Aliyu wá lo àsìkò náà láti fi ran àwọn òbí létí nípa gbígba abẹ́rẹ́ àjẹsára fún àwọn ọmọ lóòrè-kóòrè, kí wọn tó pé ọmọ ọdún méjì, kí wọn sì ri i pé wọn tọ́jú káàdì ọ̀hún.
target: Aliyu used the occasion to remind mothers of the need to ensure that their babies complete the routine immunization before the age of two years, just as she called on them to keep the immunization card safe.

input: Ọdún 2020 Ààrẹ Buhari bá Nàíjíríà yọ̀, ṣàlàyé nípa àṣeyọrí rẹ̀.
target: President Buhari felicitates with Nigerians, highlights successes

input: Ààrẹ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, Muhammadu Buhari ti bá àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà yọ àyájọ́ ọdún tuntun 2020
target: President Muhammadu Buhari has felicitated with all Nigerians as they celebrate the beginning of another year.

input: Nínú ìwé àtẹ̀jáde kan tí ààrẹ fi ránsẹ́ sí gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, lọ́jọ́ kínní, ọdún 2020, pé àtúnṣe ńlá ló ti dé bá iṣẹ́ àgbẹ̀ lórílẹ̀ èdè yìí lásìkò ìjọba rẹ̀.
target: In a special letter to the entire citizenry on Wednesday, January 1, 2020, he noted with satisfaction the agricultural transformation the nation has witnessed under his leadership.

input: Ààrẹ ní Bí a ṣe ń jẹ tàbí mu pẹ̀lú àwọn ọ̀rẹ́ àti ẹbí wa nínú àsìkò ìsinmi yìí, tí tábìlì ouńjẹ wa kún fún oúnjẹ tí à ń pèsè fúnra wa, fún ìgbà àkọkọ lórílẹ̀ èdè yìí, láìjẹ́ pé a kó àwọn ouńjẹ yìí wá láti òkè –òkun.
target: As we have sat down to celebrate with friends and family over this holiday season, for the first time in a generation our food plates have not all been filled with imports of products we know can easily be produced here at home.

input: Èyí jásí pé àyípadà àti àtúnse ti débá isẹ́ ọ̀gbìn ni gbogbo orígun mẹ́rẹ̀ẹ̀rin orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà.
target: The revolution in agriculture is already a reality in all corners of the country.

input: A tún ti tọwọ́bọ ìwé àdéhùn mííràn pẹ̀lú orílẹ̀ èdè Morocco, Russia àti àwọn orílẹ̀ èdè mííràn, láti ràn wá lọ́wọ́ nípa isẹ́ ọ̀gbìn lórílẹ̀ èdè yìí.
target: New agreements with Morocco, Russia and others will help us access on attractive terms the inputs we need to accelerate the transformation in farming that is taking place.

input: Ààrẹ tún sọ̀rọ̀ nípa ètò ìrìnnà lórílẹ̀ édé yìí Lórí ètò ìrìnnà, a ti gbìyànjú láti se àseyọrí lórí rẹ̀ bí i afárá kejì ti Niger,
target: Already, we are making key infrastructure investments to enhance our ease of doing business.

input: Ojú ọ̀nà márosẹ̀ tó wà ní Lagos – Ìbàdàn àti èyí tó wà ní ìlú Àbújá sí Kánò.
target: On transportation, we are making significant progress on key roads such as the Second Niger Bridge, Lagos – Ibadan Expressway and the Abuja – Kano highway.

input: A ó tún gbé ìgbésẹ̀ lọ́dún 2020 yìí láti se isẹ́ lórí ojú ìrìnnà ọkọ̀ ojú irin ti ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó sí Kánò.
target: will also see tangible progress on the Lagos to Kano Rail line.

input: isẹ́ ti lọ lójú pópó ti Àpápá-Òwòròǹshòkí.
target: Work is going on the Apapa-Oworonshoki Express way.

input: Àbújá àti Port Harcourt ti ní ibùdó ọkọ̀ ojú òfurufú tuntun, bákan náà ni á ò tún tẹ̀síwájú láti se èyí ní ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó àti Kánò lọ́dún 2020.
target: Abuja and Port Harcourt have new international airport terminals, as will Kano and Lagos in 2020.

input: Tí a bá parí àwọn isẹ́ àkànse yìí, yòó tún jẹ́ kí ètò ọrọ̀ ajé orílẹ̀ èdè gbóunjẹ fẹ́gbẹ́ -gbàwobọ̀.
target: When completed, all these projects will positively impact business operations in the country.

input: Wàhálà lórí ìná mọ̀nà-mọ́ná ti wà láti ìgbà ìwásẹ̀.
target: Power has been a problem for a generation.

input: A ti gbé ìgbésẹ̀ láti bá àwọn tí ọ̀rọ̀ náà kàn sọ̀rọ̀ láti wá ojútùú sí ìṣòro ọ̀hún.
target: We know we need to pick up the pace of progress.We have solutions to help separate parts of the value chain to work better together.

input: Ààrẹ Buhari tún sàlàyé lórí ìpinnu rẹ̀ láti gbógun ti ìsẹ́ àti òṣì lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà.
target: Poverty Alleviation President Buhari restated his commitment towards lifting 100 million Nigerians out of poverty.

input: Lásìkò àjọ̀dún ètò ìjọba tiwa-n-tiwa, mo sèlérí pé ọgọ́rùn ún mílíọ̀nù ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè yii ni maa yọ kuro ninu ìsẹ́ ati òṣì láàrin ọdún mẹ́wàá.
target: During my Democracy Day speech on June 12, 2019, I promised to lay the enduring foundations for taking a hundred million Nigerians out of mass poverty over the next 10 years.

input: A oò tún tẹ̀síwájú láti ṣe àwọn àtúnse tó mọ́nyán lórí nípa ètò ẹ̀kọ́, ilé-ìwòsàn alábọ́dé àti omi.
target: We shall continue reforms in education, health care and water sanitation.

input: A ó túbọ̀ máa fọwọ́sowọ̀pọ́ pẹ̀lú ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀ àti ìbílẹ̀.
target: I will continue to work with State and Local Governments to make sure that these partnerships deliver as they should.

input: Owó osù àwọn òsìsẹ́ yóò se wọ́n ní ànfààní, a ó sì tún mójútó àwọn òsìsẹ́ tó ti fẹ̀yìntì lẹ́nu isẹ́ wọn.
target: Workers will have a living wage and pensioners will be looked after.

input: A ti bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí ní máa san àwọn owó tí wọn jẹ àwọn òsìsẹ́ fẹ̀yìntì fún ìgbà pípẹ́ báyìí.
target: We are steadily clearing pensions and benefits arrears neglected for so long.

input: Ọdún 2020 Abẹnugan ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin ni ọrọ̀ ajé Nàíjíríà yóò búrẹ́kẹ́ síi.
target: will usher in peace, economic growth – Senate President

input: Abẹnugan ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà Ahmad Lawan ti ńi òun nígbàgbọ́ pé ọdún 2020 yóò tún jẹ́ kí ìsọ̀kan àti ìdàgbàsókè fẹsẹ múlẹ̀ síi lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà.
target: President of the Nigerian Senate Dr.Ahmad Lawan, believes the year 2020 will usher in robust peace and economic growth for the benefit of all Nigerians.

input: Nínú ìròyìn ọdún tuntun tí abẹnugan ọ̀hún gbé jáde láti kí gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà fún ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ ọdún 2020.
target: In his New Year message, Dr.Lawan congratulated Nigerians on witnessing the end of 2019 and the beginning of the year 2020.

input: Abẹnugan gbósùbà fún gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà fún ẹ̀mí ìsọ̀kan àti ìdàgbàsókè orílẹ̀ èdè ọ̀hún àti àtìlẹ́yìn wọn fún ìjọba Muhammadu Buhari.
target: He hailed the resilience of Nigerians in their commitment to the unity and prosperity of the country and support for the administration of President Muhammadu Buhari.

input: Abẹnugan wá fi dá gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà lójú pé, ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin kò ní káàrẹ́ẹ̀ láti máa sòfin tí yóò mú ìgbáyé-gbádùn bá gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà.
target: The Senate President assured Nigerians that National Assembly will continue to do its best to make things better for the people through enactment of people-oriented legislations.

input: Asòfin Lawan tún ní ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin yóò túbọ̀ máa fọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ pẹ̀lú ìjọba àpapọ̀ kí ìbásepọ̀ wọn tún leè gún régé fún ànfààní gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà.
target: Senator Lawan said the National Assembly will endeavour to sustain the harmonious working relationship with other arms of government for the smooth administration of the country and benefit of the people.

input: Abẹnuga wá kí gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà nílé, lóko àti lájò kú ọdún tuntun.
target: The President of the Senate wished every Nigerian at home and abroad a happy and prosperous 2020.

input: ỌdúAbẹnugan ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asojú bá Nàíjíríà yọ̀, ó pè fún ẹ̀mí ìsọkan.
target: Speaker felicitates with Nigerians, advocates unity

input: Abẹnugan ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asojú lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, Fẹmi Gbajabiamila ti bá gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà yọ ayọ̀ ọdún 2020.
target: The Speaker of the Nigerian House of Representatives Mr.Femi Gbajabiamila has felicitated with Nigerians for marking the beginning of the New Year, 2020.

input: Gbajabiamila ní ọpọ̀lọpọ̀ nǹkan ribi-ribi ló sẹlẹ̀ ní orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà lọ́dún 2019 , lára rẹ̀ ni ètò ìdìbò tó wáyé ni ìrọwọ́-ìrọsẹ̀, ó ní òun nígbàgbọ́ pé ọdún 2020 yóò dára fún orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà.
target: Mr.Gbajabiamila who noted that 2019 was remarkable in Nigeria’s history having witnessed the general elections peacefully, believes that 2020 would be better for the citizens.

input: Abẹnugan sọ̀rọ̀ yìí láti ẹnu olùrànlọ́wọ́ rẹ̀ fún ìròyìn àti ìkéde, Lanre Lasisi, ó wá rọ gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà láti gba ẹ̀mí ìsọ̀kan láàyè.
target: The Speaker in his New Year message through his Special Adviser on Media and Publicity, Lanre Lasisi, said God has been faithful to Nigerians in the outgoing year and called for more unity of purpose among the citizens.

input: Ó tẹ̀síwájú péA kò gbọdọ̀ dákẹ́ àdúrà wa pàápàá jùlọ fún ìsọ̀kan àti ìbágbépọ̀ orílẹ̀ èdè yìí.
target: We cannot relent in our prayers for continuous peaceful coexistence among us.Let this 2020 be a year of more prospects for the citizens.

input: Kí Ọdún 2020 jẹ́ ọdún àseyọrí fún gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà.
target: As an optimist, I have a strong belief that the year 2020 will be better for the country in all ramifications.

input: Abẹnugan Gbàjàbíàmílà tún sọ pé ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin kò ní káàrẹ́ẹ̀ láti máa ṣòfin tí yóò túbọ̀ mú ìgbáyé-gbádùn bá àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà.
target: While wishing Nigerians a prosperous New Year, Speaker Gbajabiamila pledged that the House will continue to provide legislations and legislative support for the welfare of citizens.

input: Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Benue bọwọ́lu àbádòfin ètò ìsúná ọdún 2020.
target: Benue Governor signs 2020 budget

input: Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Benue, Samuel Ortom ti tọwọ́bọ ìwé ètò ìsúná ọdún 2020 ti iye rẹ̀ lé ní biliọnu mọ́kàndínláàdọ́wàá.N189.43 billion láti sọọ́ di òfin.
target: Governor Samuel Ortom of Benue has signed the state’s N189.43 billion 2020 budget into law.

input: Lásìkò tí Ortom ń tọwọ́bọ ìwé ètò ìsúná ọdún 2020 ọ̀hún tí ó pè ní Ìtẹ̀síwájú, Ìdàgbàsókè àti ìmúgbòòrò lọ́jọ́ Ajé ni Makurdi, ó sèlérí láti jẹ́ ḱi gbogbo àwọn ènìyàn lọ́wọ́ nínú ìsejọba rẹ̀.
target: Ortom while signing the budget 2020 tagged Advancement, Growth and Development on Monday in Makurdi, pledged that the government would strive to implement the fiscal policy.

input: Ortom gbé àbádòfin ètò ìsúná lọ síwájú ìgbìmọ̀ asojú ìpínlẹ̀ náà ní ọjọ́ kejìlá, Osù kọkànlá.
target: Ortom had on Nov.12, 2019, presented the 2020 budget estimates to the state House of Assembly for approval.

input: Ortom ní ètò ìsúná náà yóò mú ìgbé ayé ìdẹ̀rùn àwọn ènìyàn àti ìdàgbàsókè bá ètò ẹ̀kọ́, ètò ìlera, omi àti àwọn ohun amáyédẹrùn.
target: According to him, the 2020 budget will promote education, healthcare delivery and other infrastructures for growth and development of the people.

input: Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀sun bọwọ́lu àbádòfin ètò ìsúná ọdún 2020.
target: Osun Governor signs 2020 appropriation bill into law

input: Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀sun Gboyega Oyetọla ti bọwọ́lu àbádòfin ètò ìsúná ọdún 2020 ti iye rẹ̀ lé ní díẹ̀ ní bílíọ̀nù mọ́kàndínlọ́gọ́fà N119.5 billion, ní èyí tí ó sèlérí láì mú ètò ìsúná náà lò.
target: Governor Gboyega Oyetola of Osun, on Monday, signed the 2020 budget of N119.5 billion into law, promising that the budget would be fully implemented.

input: Gómìnà tọwọ́bọ ìwé ètò ìsúná náà láti sọọ́ di òfin lẹ́yìn tí abẹnugan ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asojú ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀ṣun, Timothy Owóẹ̀yẹ gbé àbádòfin ètò ìsúná náà gbé fún un.
target: The governor signed the budget in his office in Osogbo shortly after it was formally presented to him by the Speaker of the state House of Assembly, Mr Timothy Owoeye.

input: Ọjọ́ kẹ́rìnlélógún, oṣú kejìlá, ọdún yìí ní ilé ìgbìmọ̀ aṣojú náà fẹnukò lórí ètò ìsúná náà.
target: The appropriation bill was passed into law by the Assembly on Dec.24.

input: Oyetola ní, ohun jẹ́ kí ètò ìṣúná náà wà ní ìbámu pẹ̀lú bí ètò ọrọ̀ ajé ìpínlẹ̀ náà se rí lásìkò yìí, lọ́nà àtimú ètò ìsúná náà wá sí ìmúsẹ.
target: Oyetola, who described the size of the budget as the most realistic, said the government would stop at nothing to ensure its full implementation.

input: Gómìnà Oyetola wá sèlérí láti mójútó àwọn ohun tí yóò mú ìdàgbàsókè bá ìpínlẹ̀ náà, ní èyí tí àwọn olùgbé ìpínlẹ̀ náà yóò leè jẹ ànfààní rẹ̀ lọ́dún 2020.
target: The governor, who promised to continue to do things that would make life more meaningful, worthwhile and abundant for the people of the state, assured them of better days in 2020 and beyond.

input: Ó tẹ̀síwájú pé ìjọba yóò gbìyànjú láti mú ètò ìdàgbàsókè bá gbogbo ẹka tó wà ní ìpínlẹ̀ náà.
target: He said that the state would do everything possible to bring about the desired development across all the sectors, as captured by the budget.

input: Ìjọba Nàíjíríà ti sanwó oúnjẹ àwọn ọmọ ilé –ìwé fún ọdún 2020.
target: Nigerian Government pays for January 2020 School Feeding Programme

input: Mínísítà fún ètò ọmọnìyàn, àjálù àti ìdàgbàsókè àwùjọ, Hajiya Sadiya Umar Farouq ló kéde yìí nílùú Àbújá pé, ìjọba ti san owó tí yóò pèsè ouńjẹ fún àwọn ọmọ ilé-ìwé tó wà ní ìpínlẹ̀ mẹ́tàlélọ́gbọ̀n lorílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà.
target: The Minister of Humanitarian Affairs, Disaster Management and Social Development, Hajiya Sadiya Umar Farouq who announced this in Abuja, explained that the payment covered the cost of feeding pupils in the 33 participating states.

input: Mínísítà tún sọ pe ijọba apapọ san owo naa ni osu kejila, ọdun yii fun awọn agbasẹse ti yoo pese ounjẹ ati eroja ounjẹ fun awọn akẹkọọ ọhun.
target: The Minister disclosed that the funds were released in December to give the suppliers and cooks adequate time to procure and stock foodstuff to ensure that pupils eat their meals timely.

input: Minista wá kìlọ̀ pé ìjọba kò ní fàyè gba ounjẹ ti eroja rẹ ko ba dara tó tàbí tí kò ní àwọn ohun a-fún-ara-lóore fun àwọn ọmọ ilé –iwé náà.
target: Nutritional Quality The Minister warned that the Government would not accept any drop in the nutritional quality of the meals given to the children.

input: Ààrẹ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà ń se ìpàdé pẹ̀lú àwọn adarí àjọ elétò ààbò.
target: Nigerian President presides over security briefing

input: Ààrẹ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, Muhammadu Buhari ń se ìpàdé pẹ̀lú àwọn adarí ilé –isẹ́ elétò ààbò lọ́wọ́-lọ́wọ́ báyìí nílé ààrẹ tó wà nílùú Àbújá.
target: Nigerian President, Muhammadu Buhari is currently presiding over a security briefing with Service Chiefs at the Presidential Villa in Abuja.

input: Ẹ jẹ́ ká wá ojú rere Ọlọ́run fún ìdàgbàsókè orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà NYCN.
target: Youth Council declares 3-day fasting for Nigeria’s unity

input: Ẹgbẹ́ àwọn ọ̀dọ́ lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, The National Youth Council of Nigeria NYCN ti rọ gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè yìí láti wà nínú àwẹ̀ àti àdúrà ọlọ́jọ́ mẹ́ta fún ìsọ̀kan, àlàáfíà àti ìdàgbàsókè orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà.
target: The National Youth Council of Nigeria NYCN has declared a three-day fasting and prayer for the unity, peace and progress of Nigeria.

input: Nínú àtẹ̀jáde kan tí ààrẹ ẹgbẹ́ náà, Solomon Adodo gbé jáde nílùú Àbújá, pé kí gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà wà nínú àdúrà àti àwẹ̀ ọlọ́jọ́ mẹ́ta láti ọjọ̀ kínní di ọjọ́ kẹta osù kínní, Jan.1 to Jan ọdún 2020.
target: A statement signed by the NYCN National President, Mr Solomon Adodo, in Abuja said that the prayer session would hold from Jan.1 to Jan.3, 2020.

input: Adodo tún wá rọ wọn láti jáwọ́ nínú ẹ̀sẹ̀, kí wọn sì wá ojú rere Ọlọ́run.
target: Adodo urged youths well meaning Nigerians and religious leaders to participate in the three-day exercise.

input: Gbogbo àwọn orílẹ̀ èdè tí wọn wá ojú rere ọlọ́run fún ìdàgbàsókè orílẹ̀ èdè wọn, ní ìdàgbàsókè ti dé bá.
target: He also advised them to turn away from all misdeeds and truly seek God’s face.

input: A ní ìgbàgbọ́ pé, tí a bá wá ojú rere Ọlọ́run nípa ìṣòro tó ń dójúkọ orílẹ̀ èdè yìí, ó dájú pé ìṣòro náà yóò di pẹ̀tẹ́lẹ̀.
target: We strongly believe that Nigeria’s problems can be addressed if we sincerely seek the help of God, while assiduously working to address same.

input: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí ó se sọ, ó ní kí àwọn ọmọ lẹ́yìn kristi péjọ nílé ìjọ́sìn wọn fún àdúrà lásìkò àwẹ̀, kí àwọn mùsùlùmí náà péjọ ní mọ́sálásí láti gbàdúrà lásìkó àwẹ̀ tíwọn náà.
target: According to him, while Christians are expected to gather in their respective churches during the fasting and prayer period, Muslims will meet at mosques within their areas to pray together and break their fast.

input: Adarí ilé-isẹ́ ológun lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, Lt.-Gen.Tukur Buratai ti rọ àwọn ikọ̀ ọmọ -ogun Operation Lafiya Dole OPLD tí wọ́n ń kó lọ sí Madagali ní ìpínlẹ̀ Adamawa láti máa fún àwọn ikọ̀ ọlọ̀tẹ̀ ní ìsinmi rárá.
target: The Chief of Army Staff, Lt.-Gen.Tukur Buratai, has charged troops of Operation Lafiya Dole OPLD deployed at Madagali in Adamawa not to give terrorists any breathing space.

input: Buratai, sọ̀rọ̀ yìí lásìkò tó ń kàn sí ikọ̀ ọmọ ogun náà lọ́jọ́ Àìkú, ó wá rọ wọn láti túbọ̀ máa gbógun ti ikọ̀ ọlọ̀tẹ̀ ni agbègbè náà, kí wọn máa sì rẹ̀wẹ̀sì rárá nínú ojúse wọn.
target: Buratai, while addressing the troops during a visit on Sunday, urged them to maintain the current tempo of onslaught against the insurgents.

input: Buratai tún ní ìjọba ti sèlérí láti sàtìlẹyìn fún wọn, ní èyí tí yóò fi leè ràn lọ́wọ́ láti borí ikọ̀ ọlọ̀tẹ̀ tó ń da omi àlàáfíà orílẹ̀ èdè yìí rú.
target: Buratai said that government would provide the needed supports to enable them prosecute the war against insurgency and other criminal activities in the country.

input: Ó tún wá gbósùbà fún ikọ̀ náà fún gudugudu méje, yàyà mẹfà tí wọn se láti gbógun ti ikọ̀ Boko Haram àti àwọn ọlọ̀tẹ̀ alákatakítí ẹlẹ́sìn mùsùlùmí, Islamic State of West Africa Province ISWAP ní ẹkùn náà.
target: He commended the troops for their gallantry in dealing with the boko haram and Islamic State of West Africa Province ISWAP terrorists in the region.

input: Inú mi dún ùn láti wà níbí yìí, nítorí àgbègbè yìí gan ni mo mọ̀ pé ó léwu púpọ̀ fún ikọ̀ Operation Lafiya Dole OPLD láti se isẹ́ wọn.
target: I am glad to be here with you because this is one of the areas that have been quite strategic in the operation of Operation Lafiya Dole OPLD.

input: Ẹ ti se gudu gudu méje, yàyà mẹfà láti gbógun ti ìwà ọ̀daràn,ikọ̀ Boko Haram àti ISWAP.
target: You have done great and I want to commend you for standing firm against all the criminals whatever name they called themselves whether Boko Haram, ISWAP or bandits.

input: Ẹ máa se fún wọn ní ìsinmi rárá.
target: Do not give them any breathing space.

input: Èyí ni pé ẹ ó máa gbógun tì wọ́n yálà ní òwúrọ̀, ọ̀sán àti àsálẹ́, nígbà òjò tábi nínú òòrùn.
target: That means you must go out at all times, day and night, whether rain or sun shine and make sure you deal with them.

input: Abẹnugan ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin, Ahmed Lawan ti sèlérí láti máa fa orí apá kan, dá apá kan sí níbi ìsàkoso rẹ̀.
target: The President of the Senate, Dr Ahmed Lawan, has pledged to run non-partisan leadership in the National Assembly.

input: Lawan sọ̀rọ̀ yìí lọ́jọ́ Àbámẹ́ta ni Damaturu níbi ayẹyẹ láti fi se àyẹ́sí fún abẹnugan ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin àti mínísítà ìpínlẹ̀ fún isẹ́ àkànse àti ilé lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, Abubakar Aliyu.
target: Lawan stated this on Saturday in Damaturu at the ‘Grand Reception’ ceremony to honour him and Minister of State for Works and Housing, Mr Abubakar Aliyu.

input: Lawan tún sọ pe Mo ti pinnu láti se ìsàkóso mi, ní èyí tí yóò kó gbogbo ọmọ ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin mọ́ra, ní èyí tí ẹgbẹ́ òsèlú kò ní leè nípa lórí ohun tí a bá se.
target: Lawan also said I can take it upon myself to run a non-partisan Senate, where party does not determine what we do.

input: Gbogbo ohun tí a bá fẹ́ se ni ó gbọdọ̀ jẹ́ èyí tí gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà yóò jẹ ànfààní rẹ̀.
target: What we do could be determined by the interest of Nigeria.

input: Gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, yálà ó wà nínú ẹgbẹ́ òsèlú kan tàbí kò sí níbẹ̀, ló fẹ́ kí ìdàgbàsókè bá ètò ọrọ̀ ajé orílẹ̀ èdè yìí.
target: Every Nigerian, regardless of his political party, wants to see an economy that works and also wants to live in peace, he said.

input: Lawan wá rọ gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà láti se àtìlẹyìn fún ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin lórí àseyọrí wọn.
target: Lawan appealed for the support of Nigerians to the lawmakers to enable them achieve success.

input: Ó tún wá dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin fún àtìlẹyìn tí wọn ń se fún un.
target: Lawan commended his colleagues for their cooperation and being focused in discharging their duties.

input: Nínú ọ̀rọ̀ rẹ̀ gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Yobe, Maimala Buni, ó gbósùbà fún abẹnugan ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin fún ìbásepọ̀ tó múná-dóko tó wà láàrin ọmọ ẹgbẹ ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin àti ìjọba àpapọ̀.
target: Harmonious Relationship Earlier in his speech, Gov.Maimala Buni of Yobe, commended Lawan for creating harmonious relationship between the legislative and executive arms of government.

input: Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Adamawa gbósùbà fún ilé-isẹ́ ológun fún ìpèsè àlàáfíà.
target: Adamawa Governor commends army for restoring peace

input: Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Adamawa, Fintiri ti gbósùbà fún ilé-isẹ́ ológun orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà láti gbógún ti ikọ̀ ọlọ̀tẹ̀ Boko Haram tó ń da omi àlà́afíà ìpínlẹ̀ náà láàmú pàápàá jùlọ ní ìwọ oòrùn Àríwá tó wà ní ìpínlẹ̀ Adamawa láti pèsè ètò àlà́afíà níbẹ̀.
target: Governor Ahmadu Fintiri of Adamawa State has commended the Nigerian Army for tackling the activities of Boko Haram terrorists in the north east and restoration of peace in Adamawa state.

input: Fintiri ẹni tí igbákejì rẹ̀, oloye Seth Crowther sojú fún, ló gbósùbà fún ilé-isẹ́ ológun náà lásìkò tí wọn ń se ìfilọ́lẹ̀ isẹ́ àkànse tí owó rẹ̀ lé ní ẹgbẹgbẹ̀rún mílíọ́nù fún ibùdó àwọn ọmọ ológun ọ̀hún, ní Gibson Jalo, tó wà ní Yola, lọ́jọ́ Àbámẹ́ta.
target: Fintiri, who was represented by his deputy, Chief Seth Crowther, gave the commendation during the inauguration of multi-million Naira projects in Gibson Jalo Cantonment on Saturday in Yola.

input: Nínú ọ̀rọ̀ tirẹ̀ adarí ilé-isẹ́ ológun orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, Lt.-Gen.Tukur Buratai, náà sọ pé isẹ́ àkànse náà wà lára ètò láti mú ìgbé ayé ìdẹ̀rùn bá gbogbo ọmọ ológun orílẹ̀ èdè yìí àti ẹbí wọn.
target: The Chief of Army Staff, Lt.-Gen.Tukur Buratai, said that the projects were part of efforts aimed at ensuring the welfare of officers and soldiers of Nigerian Army as well as their families.

input: Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Sokoto bọwọlu àbádòfin ètò ìsúná ọdún 2020.
target: Sokoto Governor signs 2020 Budget of N202.4bn

input: Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Sokoto, Aminu Waziri Tambuwal ti bọwọ́lu àbádòfin ètò ìsúnáọdún2020 ti iye rẹ̀ lé ní méjìlènígba biliọnu naira N202.4 billion tí ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asojú ìpínlẹ̀ náà fẹnukò lé lórí láti sọọ́ di òfin.
target: The Sokoto State Governor, Aminu Waziri Tambuwal, has signed the 2020 appropriation of N202.4 billion as passed by the State House of Assembly into law.

input: Lásìkò tí gómìnà náà ń tọwọ́bọ ìwé àbadòfin fún ètò ìsúná náà, Tambuwal wá gbósùbà fún ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asojú ìpínlẹ̀ náà, tí púpọ̀ nínú wọn jẹ́ ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ alátakò- All Progressive Congress APC, fún àtìlẹyìn wọn fún ìlọsíwájú ìpínlẹ̀ náà.
target: Appending his signature to the document, Governor Tambuwal gave kudos to the assembly members, majority of whom belong to the opposition political party- All Progressive Congress APC, for their patriotism and unflinching commitment to the collective good of the people of the state.

input: Gomina Tambuwal tún sọ pé Bó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé ẹgbẹ́ alátakò APC ló pọ̀jù nílé ìgbìmò asojú ìpínlẹ̀ yìí, síbẹ̀ wọ́n tún ń sàtìlẹyìn fún ìjọba láti rí i pé wọ́n se ojúṣe wọn fún ìlọsíwájú ìpínlẹ̀ yìí .
target: The assembly despite being controlled by the APC which is in the majority has rallied round the government and supported it in the interest of serving the people of the state, the Governor said.

input: Abẹnugan ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asojú ìpínlẹ̀ Sokoto, Aminu Muhammad Achida wá gbósùbà fún ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀ náà fún gbogbo akitiyan wọn láti rí i pé wọ́n se àseyọrí ní ìpínlẹ̀ náà, bó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé wọ́n ní ìjákulẹ̀ owó.
target: Financial Constraints Presenting the budget bill to the Governor at the council chamber of Government House, Sokoto, the Speaker of the Sokoto State House of Assembly, SOHA, Mr Aminu Muhammad Achida, noted that the Assembly was aware of the achievements of the administration despite financial constraints.

input: Ẹ máa jẹ́ kí àwọn ọlọ̀tẹ̀ pín Nàíjíríà yẹ́lẹ-yẹ̀lẹ – Ààrẹ Buhari.
target: Don’t let terrorists divide the country – President Buhari

input: Ààrẹ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà Muhammadu Buhari ti rọ àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè yìí láti máa jẹ́ kí ̀àwọn ọlọ̀tẹ̀ pín orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà yẹlẹ-yẹlẹ nitori ẹsin.
target: President Muhammadu Buhari has appealed to Nigerians not to let terrorists divide the country along religious lines.

input: Ààrẹ Buhari tún sọ pé Inú mi bàjẹ́ nípa ikú àwọn omọ orílẹ̀ èdè yìí tí wọ́n kú sí ibi ìhámọ́ láti ọwọ́ àwọn alákatakítí ẹlẹ́sìn, àwọn apanìyàn tí wọ́n ń ba orúkọ ẹ̀sìn mùsùlùmí jẹ́ nípa ìwà burúkú wọn.
target: I am profoundly saddened and shocked by the death of innocent hostages in the hands of remorseless, godless, callous gangs of mass murderers that have given Islam a bad name through their atrocities

input: Lábẹ́ bó ti wù kórí, a ò gbọdọ̀ gba àwọn ọlọ̀tẹ̀ láàyè láti da omi àlááfíà orílẹ̀ èdè yìí rú nípa dídá ìjà sílẹ̀ láàrin àwọn ẹlẹ́sìn mùsùlùmí àti ìgbàgbọ́, nítorí àwọn apànìyàn yìí kì í se ẹlẹ́sìn mùsùlùmí rárá.
target: We should, under no circumstance, let the terrorists divide us by turning Christians against Muslims because these barbaric killers don’t represent Islam and millions of other law-abiding Muslims around the world.

input: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí ààrẹ orílẹ̀ èdè yìí, ojúṣe mi ni láti mójútó ètò ààbò gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, nítorí náà ikú àwọn aláìsẹ̀ yálà mùsùlùmí tàbí onígbàgbọ́ máa ń bà mí nínú jẹ́.
target: As a President, the collective security of all Nigerians is my major preoccupation and the death of an innocent Christian or Muslim distresses me.’’

input: ’’Ààrẹ tún sọ pé ohun tí àwọn ọlọ̀tẹ̀ ní lọ́kàn ni láti máa ṣe iṣẹ́ ibi wọn, láti máa ta ẹ̀jẹ̀ àwọn aláìsẹ̀ sílẹ̀, ní èyí tí ó lòdì sí ìmọ̀ ẹ̀kọ́ ẹ̀sìn mùsùlùmí àti ìgbàgbọ́.
target: The President said the terrorists have no clearly defined agenda except the pursuit of evil through indiscriminate murder of innocent people, contrary to the teachings of Islam, which prohibits massacre.

input: Nàíjíríà yan ìgbìmọ̀ alámójútó fún iná mọ̀nà-mọ́ná.
target: Nigeria Inaugurates Ministerial Taskforce on power

input: Ìgbìmọ̀ alámójútó lábẹ́ ìsàkoso mínísítà ilé-isẹ́ mọ̀nà-mọ́ná lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, ni ìjọba ti yàn láti máa mójútó iná mọ̀nà-mọ́ná lórílẹ̀ èdè yìí, ní èròǹgbà láti rí i pé àtúnse tó mọ́nyán lórí bá iná mọ̀nà-mọ́ná.
target: A Ministerial Taskforce on Power has been inaugurated in Nigeria as a way of achieving the fight for increased and sustainable power supply in the country.

input: Lasiko ti Sale Mamman to jẹ minisita fun iná mọ̀nà-mọ́ná lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà n se ifilọlẹ ìgbìmọ̀ naa , ó rọ̀ wọ́n lati mojuto ọna ti atunse yoo se lee ba iná mọ̀nà-mọ́ná, ní èyí tí àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà yoo se maa jẹ̀gbádùn iná mọ̀nà-mọ́ná ọ̀hún.
target: The Minister of Power, Sale Mamman who inaugurated the Taskforce in Abuja, said the setting up of the Taskforce was as a result of the Government’s plan to accelerate the pace of reforms in the sector and increase power output and availability in the short and long term.

input: Mamman tún sọ pé ìgbìmọ̀ náà ni yoo tun jẹ olugbanimọran lori eto ilana ati imọ ẹrọ tuntun lori iná mọ̀nà-mọ́ná.
target: Mamman pointed out that that the Ministerial Taskforce on Power would serve as an Advisory Team on Policies and Innovative Technologies.

input: Ó tún tẹ̀síwájú pé ọdún méjì ni ìgbìmọ̀ náà, ní láti fi isé wọn, lára ojúṣe wọn sì ni láti sètò ìlànà, tí yóò mú àtúnse tó mọ́nyán lórí nípa iná mọ̀nà-mọ́ná, ní èyí tí ìjọba orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà yóò máa tẹ̀lé.
target: He explained that the Committee which has two year tenure was also saddled with the responsibility of developing, planning and driving forward the reform plan of the Nigerian Government in the power sector.

input: Ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n Abubakar Sani Sambo, ni alága ìgbìmọ̀ náà.
target: The Chairman of the Committee, Profesor Abubakar Sani Sambo.

input: Ààrẹ Buhari bọwọ́lu ètò ìsúná ọdún 2020.
target: President Buhari signs 2020 Budget

input: Ààrẹ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjírià Muhammadu Buhari ti tọwọ́bọ ètò ìsúná ọdún 2020 lọ́jọ́ Ìsẹgun, lati sọ́ di òfin, ní èyí tí iye rẹ̀ lé ní tiriọnu mẹ́wàá N10.594.
target: Nigeria’s President Muhammadu Buhari on Tuesday signed the 2020 Appropriation Bill of N10.594 trillion into law.

input: Ní ọjọ́ karùn ún, osù kejìlá ọdún yìí, ní ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin parí ìjíròrò wọn lórí ètò àbádòfin ìsúná láti sọọ́ di òfin, ní èyí tí wọn sì fẹnukò pé kí ìjọba àpapọ̀ kò gbọdọ̀ ná ju tírílíọ̀nù mẹ́wàá ló.
target: The National Assembly had, on December 5, passed the 2020 Appropriation Bill into law, authorizing the federal government to spend over N10.594 trillion for next year.

input: Ní ọjọ́ kẹwàá osù kẹjọ, ọdún 2020 ní ààrẹ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjírià Muhammadu Buhari gbé àbádòfin ètò ìsúná wá sí ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin.
target: This followed President Buhari’s presentation of the 2020 Budget estimates N10.33 trillion to a joint session of the National Assembly on October 8, 2019.

input: Bí ààrẹ Buhari ṣe tètè bọwọ́lu ètò ìṣúná 2019 ọ̀hún, ni yóò tún jẹ́ kí orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjírià tún padà sí osù kínní sí osù kejìlá tí ó jẹ́ ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ ọdún, tí ààrẹ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjírià máa ń bọwọ́lu ètò ìsúná ọ̀hún.
target: The passage of the budget and its signing within 2019 has returned Nigeria to the January to December Budget Cycle.

input: Lásìkò tí ayẹyẹ ètò ọ̀hún, ààrẹ ní ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin ti fi owó tó lé ní igba bílíọ̀nù N263.95 billion kún ìwé ìsúná tí òun gbé wá sílé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin.
target: Speaking at the brief ceremony, the Speaker of the House of Representatives noted that there was an increase of N263.95 billion over the proposal he submitted to the legislature.

input: Ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin yóò gbogun ti òsì àti ìsẹ́.
target: Senate reaffirms commitment to poverty alleviation

input: Ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin ti ní àwọn kò ní kàárẹ̀ láti túbọ̀ máa gbógun ti òsì àti ìsẹ́, kí ìgbé ayé ìdẹ̀rùn leè bá gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà.
target: Nigerian Senate has reaffirmed its commitment to fighting poverty to ensure a better living standard for the citizenry.

input: Abẹnugan ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin Ahmad Lawan ló sọ̀rọ̀ ìdánilòjù yìí, lọ́jọ́ Ajé lásìkò tó ń bá àwọn akọ̀ròyìn sọ̀rọ̀ nílùú Àbújá.
target: President of the Senate Dr.Ahmad Lawan gave this latest assurance at a news briefing held on Monday in Abuja.

input: Lawal, tún tẹ̀síwájú pé ilé ìgbìmọ̀ kẹsàn án yóò sètò òfin tí yóò gbógun ti òsì àti ìsẹ́, àjàkálẹ̀ ààrùn, ìwà ọ̀daràn, ìwà ìbajẹ́, ní èyí tí abẹnugan náà sàpèjúwe wọn, gẹ́gẹ́ bí ọ̀tá ìlú.
target: Lawal explained that the 9th Senate would enhance legislation to tackle challenges of poverty, disease, insecurity, corruption among others, which he described as the common enemies of the country.

input: Ó tún sọ pé ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin tètè se isẹ́ lórí ètò ìsúná ọdún 2020, tí ààrẹ Buhari gbé wá síwájú wọn, kí o lè bá ìgbà àti àkókò January and December tí orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà máa ṣètò lórí ìṣúná ọdọọdún wọn.
target: He further explained that the Senate gave expeditious passage to the 2020 budget in order to return the nation’s budget circle to the desirable January and December period for adequate planning and implementation.

input: Asòfin Lawan, ní gbogbo kùdìẹ̀-kudiẹ tó wá bí wọn se ta gbogbo ohun ìní orílẹ̀ èdè yìí, pàápàá jùlọ nípa iná mọ̀nà-mọ́ná ni àwọn yóò mójútó.
target: Senator Lawan gave assurance to Nigerians that the shortcomings identified in the privatisation of the nation’s assets such as in the power sector, would be adequately addressed for maximum benefit.

input: Abẹnugan ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin tún rọ àwọn akọ̀ròyìn láti máa fárí apá kan, dá apá kan sí, nínú ìròyìn wọn, ṣùgbọ́n kí wọn máa kọ ìròyìn tí ó leè mú ìdàgbàsókè bá orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà.
target: The president of the senate appealed to newsmen for balanced and more patriotic reportage that could fast track national development.

input: Adarí ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ tó kéré jùlọ nílé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin, asòfin Eyinanya Abaribe tún fi dá àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà lójú pé, bó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé ẹgbẹ́ ọ̀tọ̀tọ̀ ni àwọn asòfin wà, síbẹ̀.
target: The senate minority Leader, Senator Eyinanya Abaribe said the Senate would not relent in ensuring robust debate on issues of national interest.

input: Ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin kò ní jẹ́ kí ẹgbẹ́ ọ̀tọ̀tọ̀ náà da àárín wọn rú, láti máa se òfin tí yóò mú ìgbáyé –gbádùn bá gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ édé Nàíjíríà.
target: The present Senate would not be divided along party lines, adding that they would ensure legislation to improve the life of all citizens.

input: Boris Johnson di adarí́ ìjọba orílẹ̀ èdè United Kingdom, UK.
target: Boris Johnson is now the Prime Minister of UK

input: Ààrẹ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà Muhammadu Buhari ti kí adarí ìjọba tuntun fún orílẹ̀ èdè United Kingdom, Boris Johnson kú orí –ire bó se jáwé olúborí nínú ètò ìdìbò tí wọ́n dì kọjá lórílẹ̀ èdè náà.
target: Nigerian President, Muhammadu Buhari has congratulated Prime Minister Boris Johnson on his resounding election victory in the United Kingdom general election.

input: Ààrẹ Buhari ni òun fojúsọ́nà láti bá adarí ìjọba tuntun náà sisẹ́ papọ̀, ní èyí tí ìbásepọ̀ tó wà láàrin orílẹ̀ èdè méjéèjì náà, pàápàá jùlọ nípa bí ètò ọrọ̀ ajé, yóò se túbọ̀ ní ìdàgbàsókè síi.
