input: ÌKÉDE KÁRÍAYÉ FÚN Ẹ̀TỌ́ ỌMỌNÌYÀN
target: UNIVERSAL DECLARATION OF HUMAN RIGHTS

input: Bí ó ti jẹ́ pé ṣíṣe àkíyèsí iyì tó jẹ́ àbímọ́ fún ẹ̀dá àti ìdọ́gba ẹ̀tọ́ ṭí kò ṣeé mú kúrò tí ẹ̀dá kọ̀ọ̀kan ní, ni òkúta ìpìlẹ̀ fún òmìnira, ìdájọ́ òdodo àti àlàáfíà lágbàáyé,
target: Whereas recognition of the inherent dignity and of the equal and inalienable rights of all members of the human family is the foundation of freedom, justice and peace in the world,

input: Bí ó ti jẹ́ pé ó ṣe pàtàkì kí a dáàbò bo àwọn ẹ̀tó ọmọnìyàn lábẹ́ òfin, bí a kò bá fẹ́ ti àwọn ènìyàn láti kọjú ìjà sí ìjọba ipá àti ti amúnisìn, nígbà tí kò bá sí ọ̀nà àbáyọ mìíràn fún wọn láti bèèrè ẹ̀tọ́ wọn,
target: Whereas it is essential, if man is not to be compelled to have recourse, as a last resort, to rebellion against tyranny and oppression, that human rights should be protected by the rule of law,

input: Bí ó ti jẹ́ pé ó ṣe pàtàkì kí ìdàgbàsókè ìbáṣepọ̀ ti ọ̀rẹ́‐sí‐ọ̀rẹ́ wà láàrin àwọn orílẹ̀‐èdè,
target: Whereas it is essential to promote the development of friendly relations between nations,

input: Bí ó ti jẹ́ pé àwọn ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ Àjọ‐ìsọ̀kan orílẹ̀‐èdè àgbáyé ti jẹ́jẹ̀ẹ́ láti fọwọ́ṣowọ́ pọ̀ pẹ̀lú Àjọ náà, kí won lè jọ ṣe àṣeyege nípa àmúṣẹ àwọn ẹ̀tọ́ ọmọnìyàn àti òmìnira ẹ̀dá tó jẹ́ kò‐ṣeé‐má‐nìí àti láti rí i pé à ń bọ̀wọ̀ fún àwọn ẹ̀tọ́ náà káríayé,
target: Whereas Member States have pledged themselves to achieve, in cooperation with the United Nations, the promotion of universal respect for and observance of human rights and fundamental freedoms,

input: Bí ó ti jẹ́ pé àfi tí àwọn ẹ̀tọ́ àti òmìnira wọ̀nyí bá yé ènìyàn nìkan ni a fi lè ní àmúṣẹ ẹ̀jẹ́ yìí ní kíkún,
target: Whereas a common understanding of these rights and freedoms is of the greatest importance for the full realization of this pledge,

input: Gbogbo ènìyàn ni a bí ní òmìnira iyì àti ẹ̀tọ́ kọ̀ọ̀kan sì dọ́gba.
target: All human beings are born free and equal in dignity and rights.

input: Wọ́n ní ẹ̀bùn ti làákàyè àti ti ẹ̀rí‐ọkàn, ó sì yẹ kí wọn ó máa hùwà sí ara wọn gẹ́gẹ́ bí ọmọ ìyá.
target: They are endowed with reason and conscience and should act towards one another in a spirit of brotherhood.

input: Ẹnì kọ̀ọ̀kan ló ní ẹ̀tọ́ láti wà láàyè, ẹ̀tọ́ sí òmìnira àti ẹ̀tọ́ sí ààbò ara rẹ̀.
target: Everyone has the right to life, liberty and the security of person.

input: A kò gbọdọ̀ mú ẹnikẹ́ni ní ẹrú tàbí kí a mú un sìn ẹrú níní àti ò wò ẹrú ni a gbọdọ̀ fi òfin dè ní gbogbo ọ̀nà.
target: No one shall be held in slavery or servitude slavery and the slave trade shall be prohibited in all their forms.

input: A kò gbọdọ̀ dá ẹnì kẹ́ni lóró tàbí kí a lò ó ní ìlò ìkà tí kò yẹ ọmọ ènìyàn tàbí ìlò tó lè tàbùkù ẹ̀dá ènìyàn.
target: No one shall be subjected to torture or to cruel, inhuman or degrading treatment or punishment.

input: Ẹnì kọ̀ọ̀kan ló ní ẹ̀tọ́ pé kí a kà á sí gẹ́gẹ́ bí ènìyàn lábẹ́ òfin ní ibi gbogbo.
target: Everyone has the right to recognition everywhere as a person before the law.

input: Gbogbo ènìyàn ló dọ́gba lábẹ́ òfin.Wọ́n sì ní ẹ̀tọ́ sí àà bò lábẹ́ òfin láìsí ìyàsọ́tọ̀ kankan.
target: All are equal before the law and are entitled without any discrimination to equal protection of the law.

input: Gbogbo ènìyàn ló ní ẹ̀tọ́ sí ààbò tó dọ́gba kúrò lọ́wọ́ ìyàsọ́tọ̀ yòówù tí ìbáà lòdì sí ìkéde yìí àti ẹ̀tọ́ kúrò lọ́wọ́ gbogbo ohun tó bá lè ti ènìyàn láti ṣe irú ìyàsọ́tọ̀ bẹ́ẹ̀.
target: All are entitled to equal protection against any discrimination in violation of this Declaration and against any incitement to such discrimination.

input: Ẹnì kọ̀ọ̀kan lórílẹ̀‐èdè, ló ní ẹ̀tọ́ sí àtúnṣe tó jọjú ní ilé‐ẹjọ́ fún ìwà tó lòdì sí ẹ̀tọ́ ọmọnìyàn, tó jẹ́ kò‐ṣeé‐má‐nìí gẹ́gẹ́ bó ṣe wà lábẹ́ òfin àti bí òfin‐ìpìlẹ̀ ṣe là á sílẹ̀.
target: Everyone has the right to an effective remedy by the competent national tribunals for acts violating the fundamental rights granted him by the constitution or by law.

input: A kò gbọdọ̀ ṣàdédé fi òfin mú ènìyàn tàbí kí a kàn gbé ènìyàn tì mọ́lé, tàbí kí a lé ènìyàn jáde ní ìlú láìnídìí.
target: No one shall be subjected to arbitrary arrest, detention or exile.

input: Ẹnì kọ̀ọ̀kan tí a bá fi ẹ̀sùn kàn ló ní ẹ̀tọ́ tó dọ́gba, tó sì kún, láti ṣàlàyé ara rẹ̀ ní gban̄gba, níwájú ilé‐ẹjọ́ tí kò ṣègbè, kí wọn lè ṣe ìpinnu lórí ẹ̀tọ́ àti ojúṣe rẹ̀ nípa irú ẹ̀sùn ọ̀ràn dídá tí a fi kàn án.
target: Everyone is entitled in full equality to a fair and public hearing by an independent and impartial tribunal, in the determination of his rights and obligations and of any criminal charge against him.

input: A kò gbọdọ̀ dá ẹ̀bi ẹ̀ṣẹ̀ fún ẹnìkẹ́ni fún pé ó hu ìwà kan tàbí pé ó ṣe àwọn àfojúfò kàn nígbà tó jẹ́ pé lásìkò tí èyí ṣẹlẹ̀, irú ìwà bẹ́ẹ̀ tàbí irú àfojúfò bẹ́ẹ̀ kò lòdì sí òfin orílẹ̀‐èdè ẹni náà tàbí òfin àwọn orílẹ̀‐èdè àgbáyé mìíràn.
target: No one shall be held guilty of any penal offence on account of any act or omission which did not constitute a penal offence, under national or international law, at the time when it was committed.

input: Bákan náà, ìjẹníyà tí a lè fún ẹni tó dẹ́ṣẹ̀ kò gbọdọ̀ ju èyí tó wà ní ìmúlò ní àsìkò tí ẹni náà dá ẹ̀ṣẹ̀ rẹ̀.
target: Nor shall a heavier penalty be imposed than the one that was applicable at the time the penal offence was committed.

input: Ẹnì kọ̀ọ̀kan ló ní ẹ̀tọ́ pé kí a má ṣàdédé ṣe àyọjúràn sí ọ̀rọ̀ ìgbésí ayé rẹ̀, tàbí sí ọ̀rọ̀ẹbí rẹ̀ tàbí sí ọ̀rọ̀ ìdílé rẹ̀ tàbí ìwé tí a kọ sí i a kò sì gbọdọ̀ ba iyì àti orúkọ rẹ̀ jẹ́.
target: No one shall be subjected to arbitrary interference with his privacy, family, home or correspondence, nor to attacks upon his honour and reputation.

input: Ẹnì kọ̀ọ̀kan ló ní ẹ̀tọ́ sí ààbò lábẹ́ òfin kúrò lọ́wọ́ irú àyọjúràn tàbí ìbanijẹ́ bẹ́ẹ̀.
target: Everyone has the right to the protection of the law against such interference or attacks.

input: Ẹnì kọ̀ọ̀kan ló ní ẹ̀tọ́ láti rìn káàkiri ní òmìnira kí ó sì fi ibi tó bá wù ú ṣe ìbùgbé láàrin orílẹ̀‐èdè rẹ̀.
target: Everyone has the right to freedom of movement and residence within the borders of each State.

input: Ẹnì kọ̀ọ̀kan ló ní ẹ̀tọ́ láti kúrò lórílẹ̀‐èdè yòówù kó jẹ́, tó fi mọ́ orílẹ̀‐èdè tirẹ̀, kí ó sì tún padà sí orílẹ̀‐èdè tirẹ̀ nígbà tó bá wù ú.
target: Everyone has the right to leave any country, including his own, and to return to his country.

input: Ẹnì kọ̀ọ̀kan ló ní ẹ̀tọ́ láti wá ààbò àti láti jẹ àn fàní ààbò yìí ní orílẹ̀‐èdè mìíràn nígbà tí a bá ń ṣe inúnibíni sí i.
target: Everyone has the right to seek and to enjoy in other countries asylum from persecution.

input: A kò lè lo ẹ̀tọ́ yìí fún ẹni tí a bá pè lẹ́jọ́ tó dájú nítorí ẹ ṣẹ̀ tí kò jẹ mọ́ ọ̀rọ̀ ìṣèlú tàbí ohun mìíràn tí ó ṣe tí kò bá ète àti ìgbékalẹ̀ Ajọ‐ìsọ̀kan orílẹ̀‐èdè àgbáyé mu.
target: This right may not be invoked in the case of prosecutions genuinely arising from non-political crimes or from acts contrary to the purposes and principles of the United Nations.

input: Ẹnì kọ̀ọ̀kan ló ní ẹ̀tọ́ láti jẹ́ ọmọ orílẹ̀‐èdè kan.
target: Everyone has the right to a nationality.

input: A kò lè ṣàdédé gba ẹ̀tọ́ jíjẹ́ ọmọ orílẹ̀‐èdè ẹni lọ́wọ́ ẹnìkẹ́ni láìnídìí tàbí kí a kọ̀ fún ẹnìkẹ́ni láti yàn láti jẹ́ ọmọ orílẹ̀‐èdè mìíràn.
target: No one shall be arbitrarily deprived of his nationality nor denied the right to change his nationality.

input: Tọkùnrin tobìnrin tó bá ti bàlágà ló ní ẹ̀tọ́ láti fẹ́ ara wọn, kí wọ́n sì dá ẹbí ti wọn sílẹ̀ láìsí ìkanilápá‐kò kankan nípa ẹ̀yà wọn, tàbí orílẹ̀‐èdè wọn tàbí ẹ̀sìn wọn.
target: Men and women of full age, without any limitation due to race, nationality or religion, have the right to marry and to found a family.

input: Ẹtọ́ wọn dọ́gba nínú ìgbeyàwó ìbáà jẹ́ nígbà tí wọn wà papọ̀ tàbí lẹ́yìn tí wọ́n bá kọ ara wọn.
target: They are entitled to equal rights as to marriage, during marriage and at its dissolution.

input: A kò gbọdọ̀ ṣe ìgbeyàwó kan láìjẹ́ pé àwọn tí ó fẹ́ fẹ́ ara wọn ní òmìnira àtọkànwá tó péye láti yàn fúnra wọn.
target: Marriage shall be entered into only with the free and full consent of the intending spouses.

input: Ẹbí jẹ́ ìpìlẹ̀ pàtàkì àdánidá ní àwùjọ, ó sì ní ẹ̀tọ́ pé kí àwùjọ àti orílẹ̀‐èdè ó dáàbò bò ó.
target: The family is the natural and fundamental group unit of society and is entitled to protection by society and the State.

input: Ẹnì kọ̀ọ̀kan ló ní ẹ̀tọ́ láti dá ohun ìní ara rẹ̀ ní tàbí láti ní in papọ̀ pẹ̀lú àwọn mìíràn.
target: Everyone has the right to own property alone as well as in association with others.

input: A kò lè ṣàdédé gba ohun ìní ẹnì kan lọ́wọ́ rẹ̀ láìnídìí.
target: No one shall be arbitrarily deprived of his property.

input: Ẹnì kọ̀ọ̀kan ló ní ẹ̀tọ́ sí òmìnira láti pé jọ pọ̀ àti láti dara pọ̀ mọ́ àwọn mìíràn ní àlàáfíà.
target: Everyone has the right to freedom of peaceful assembly and association.

input: A kò lè fi ipá mú ẹnìkẹ́ni dara pọ̀ mọ́ ẹgbẹ́ kankan.
target: No one may be compelled to belong to an association.

input: Ẹnì kọ̀ọ̀kan ló ní ẹ̀tọ́ láti kópa nínú ìṣàkóso orílẹ̀‐èdè rẹ̀, yálà fúnra rẹ̀ tàbí nípasẹ̀ àwọn aṣojú tí a kò fi ipá yàn.
target: Everyone has the right to take part in the government of his country, directly or through freely chosen representatives.

input: Ẹnì kọ̀ọ̀kan ló ní ẹ̀tọ́ tó dọ́gba láti ṣe iṣẹ́ ìjọba ní orílẹ̀‐èdè rẹ̀.
target: Everyone has the right to equal access to public service in his country.

input: Ẹnì kọ̀ọ̀kan ló ní ẹ̀tọ́ láti ṣiṣẹ́, láti yan irú iṣẹ́ tí ó wù ú, lábẹ́ àdéhùn tí ó tọ́ tí ó sì tún rọrùn, kí ó sì ní ààbò kúrò lọ́wọ́ àìríṣẹ́ ṣe.
target: Everyone has the right to work, to free choice of employment, to just and favourable conditions of work and to protection against unemployment.

input: Ẹnì kọ̀ọ̀kan ló ní ẹ̀tọ́ láti gba iye owó tí ó dọ́gba fún irú iṣẹ́ kan náà, láìsí ìyàsọ́tọ̀ kankan.
target: Everyone, without any discrimination, has the right to equal pay for equal work.

input: Ẹnì kọ̀ọ̀kan ló ní ẹ̀tọ́ láti dá ẹgbẹ́ òṣìṣẹ́ sílẹ̀ àti láti dara pọ̀ mọ́ irú ẹgbẹ bẹ́ẹ̀ láti dáàbò bo àwọn ohun tí ó jẹ ẹ́ lógún.
target: Everyone has the right to form and to join trade unions for the protection of his interests.

input: Ẹnì kọ̀ọ̀kan ló ní ẹ̀tọ́ sí ìsinmi àti fàájì pẹ̀lú àkókò tí kò pọ̀ jù lẹ́nu iṣẹ́ àti àsìkò ìsinmi lẹ́nu iṣẹ́ láti ìgbà dé ìgbà tí a ó sanwó fún.
target: Everyone has the right to rest and leisure, including reasonable limitation of working hours and periodic holidays with pay.

input: A ní láti pèsè ìtọ́jú àti ìrànlọ́wọ́ pàtàkì fún àwọn abiyamọ àti àwọn ọmọdé.
target: Motherhood and childhood are entitled to special care and assistance.

input: Gbogbo àwọn ọmọdé yóò máa jẹ àwọn àn fàní ààbò kan náà nínú àwùjọ yálà àwọn òbí wọn fẹ́ ara wọn ni tàbí wọn kò fẹ́ ara wọn.
target: All children, whether born in or out of wedlock, shall enjoy the same social protection.

input: Ẹnì kọ̀ọ̀kan ló ní ẹ̀tọ́ láti kọ́ ẹ̀kọ́.
target: Everyone has the right to education.

input: Ó kéré tán, ẹ̀kọ́ gbọdọ̀ jẹ́ ọ̀fẹ́ ní àwọn ilé‐ẹ̀kọ́ alákọ̀ọ́bẹ̀rẹ̀.
target: Education shall be free, at least in the elementary and fundamental stages.

input: Ẹkọ́ ní ilé‐ẹ̀kọ́ alákọ̀ọ́bẹ̀rẹ̀ yìí sì gbọdọ̀ jẹ́ dandan.
target: Elementary education shall be compulsory.

input: A gbọdọ̀ pèsè ẹ̀kọ́ iṣẹ́‐ọwọ́, àti ti ìmọ̀‐ẹ̀rọ fún àwọn ènìyàn lápapọ̀, àn fàní tó dọ́gba ní ilé‐ẹ̀kọ́ gíga gbọdọ̀ wà ní àrọ́wọ́tó gbogbo ẹni tó bá tọ́ sí.
target: Technical and professional education shall be made generally available and higher education shall be equally accessible to all on the basis of merit.

input: Ohun tí yóò jẹ́ ète ẹ̀kọ́ ni láti mú ìlọsíwájú tó péye bá ẹ̀dá ènìyàn, kí ó sì túbọ̀ rí i pé àwọn ènìyàn bọ̀wọ̀ fún ẹ̀tọ́ ọmọnìyàn àti àwọn òmìnira wọn, tó jẹ́ kò‐ṣeé‐má‐nìí.
target: Education shall be directed to the full development of the human personality and to the strengthening of respect for human rights and fundamental freedoms.

input: E tò ẹ̀kọ́ gbọdọ̀ lè rí i pé ẹ̀mí ìgbọ́ra‐ẹni‐yé, ìbágbépọ̀ àlàáfíà, àti ìfẹ́ ọ̀rẹ́‐sí‐ọ̀rẹ́ wà láàrin orílẹ̀‐èdè, láàrin ẹ̀yà kan sí òmíràn àti láàrin ẹlẹ́sìn kan sí òmíràn, etò‐ẹ̀kọ́ sì gbọdọ̀ kún àwọn akitiyan Àjọ‐ìsọ̀kan orílẹ̀‐èdè àgbáyé lọ́wọ́ láti rí i pé àlàáfíà fìdí múlẹ̀.
target: It shall promote understanding, tolerance and friendship among all nations, racial or religious groups, and shall further the activities of the United Nations for the maintenance of peace.

input: Àwọn òbí ló ní ẹ̀tọ́ tó ga jù lọ láti yan ẹ̀kọ́ tí wọ́n bá fẹ́ fún àwọn ọmọ wọn.
target: Parents have a prior right to choose the kind of education that shall be given to their children.

input: Ẹnì kọ̀ọ̀kan ló ní ẹ̀tọ́ láìjẹ́ pé a fi ipá mú un láti kópa nínú àpapọ̀ ìgbé ayé àwùjọ rẹ̀, kí ó jẹ ìgbádùn gbogbo ohun àmúṣẹ wà ibẹ̀, kí ó sì kópa nínú ìdàgbàsókè ìmọ̀ sáyẹ́n sì àti àwọn àn fàní tó ń ti ibẹ̀ jáde.
target: Everyone has the right freely to participate in the cultural life of the community, to enjoy the arts and to share in scientific advancement and its benefits.

input: Ẹnì kọ̀ọ̀kan ló ní ẹ̀tọ́ sí ààbò àn fàní ìmọyì àti ohun ìní tí ó jẹ yọ láti inú iṣẹ́ yòówù tí ó bá ṣe ìbáà ṣe ìmọ̀ sáyẹ́n sì, ìwé kíkọ tàbí iṣẹ́ ọnà.
target: Everyone has the right to the protection of the moral and material interests resulting from any scientific, literary or artistic production of which he is the author.

input: Ẹnì kọ̀ọ̀kan ló ní ẹ̀tọ́ sí ètò nínú àwùjọ rẹ̀ àti ní gbogbo àwùjọ àgbáyé níbi tí àwọn ẹ̀tọ́ òmìnira tí a ti gbé kalẹ̀ nínú ìkéde yìí yóò ti jẹ́ mímúṣẹ.
target: Everyone is entitled to a social and international order in which the rights and freedoms set forth in this Declaration can be fully realized.

input: Ẹnì kọ̀ọ̀kan ló ní àwọn ojúṣe kan sí àwùjọ, nípasẹ̀ èyí tí ó fi lè ṣeé ṣe fún ẹni náà láti ní ìdàgbàsókè kíkún gẹ́gẹ́ bí ẹ̀dá ènìyàn.
target: Everyone has duties to the community in which alone the free and full development of his personality is possible.

input: A kò gbọdọ̀ lo àwọn ẹ̀tọ́ àti òmìnira wọ̀nyí rárá, ní ọ̀nà yòówù kó jẹ́, tó bá lòdì sí àwọn ète àti ìgbékalẹ̀ Ajọ‐àpapọ̀ orílẹ̀‐èdè agbáyé.
target: These rights and freedoms may in no case be exercised contrary to the purposes and principles of the United Nations.

input: A kò gbọdọ̀ túmọ̀ ohunkóhun nínú ìkéde yìí gẹ́gẹ́ bí ohun tí ó fún orílẹ̀‐èdè kan tàbí àkójọpọ̀ àwọn ènìyàn kan tàbí ẹnìkẹ́ni ní ẹ̀tọ́ láti ṣe ohunkóhun tí yóò mú ìparun bá èyíkéyìí nínú àwọn ẹ̀tọ́ àti òmìnira tí a kéde yìí.
target: Nothing in this Declaration may be interpreted as implying for any State, group or person any right to engage in any activity or to perform any act aimed at the destruction of any of the rights and freedoms set forth herein.

input: Nígbà tí wọ́n bá ń dúkokò mọ́ àwọn aṣíkiri pẹ̀lú ìkójọpọ̀, ìtì-mọ́lé àti ìdápadà-sílé, àwọn òṣìṣẹ wọn mọ̀ pé wọ́n lè bú wọn, pé wọ́n lè sọ fún wọn pé tí wọ́n bá jà padà, wọ́n lè fàwón fún ICE.
target: When immigrants are threatened with roundups, detention and deportations, their employers know that they can be abused, that they can be told that if they fight back, they'll be turned over to ICE.

input: Nígbà tí àwọn agbanisíṣẹ́ bá mọ pé àwọn lè dúkokò mọ́ aṣíkiri pẹ̀lú àìníwè rẹ̀, ó máa ń jẹ́ kí wọ́n lo òṣìṣẹ́ yẹn nílò kulò kọjá àyè, ìyẹn sì ti nípa kìí ṣe fún àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ aṣíkiri nìkan ṣùgbọ́n fún gbogbo àwọn òṣìṣẹ́.
target: When employers know that they can terrorize an immigrant with his lack of papers, it makes that worker hyper-exploitable, and that has impacts not only for immigrant workers but for all workers.

input: Ìkejì, a nílò láti bèrè ìbéèrè nípa ojúṣe.
target: Second, we need to ask questions about responsibility.

input: Kíni ipa tí àwọn orílẹ̀-èdè tó lówó, tó lágbára bíi orílẹ̀-ède United State ń kó láti jẹ́ kó le tàbí kó má ṣe é ṣe fún àwọn aṣíkiri láti dúró sí orílè-èdè abínibí wọn
target: What role have rich, powerful countries like the United States played in making it hard or impossible for immigrants to stay in their home countries

input: Ìdìde àti gbígbéra láti orílẹ̀-ède yín nira ó sì léwu, ṣùgbọ́n ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àwọn aṣíkiri ò ní àǹfààní ìdúró sílé tí wọ́n bá fẹ́ yè.
target: Picking up and moving from your country is difficult and dangerous, but many immigrants simply do not have the option of staying home if they want to survive.

input: Ogun, àdéhùn òwò àti ìwa oníbárá tó gbilẹ̀ ní Global North ń kópa pàtàkì àti aléwu níbí.
target: Wars, trade agreements and consumer habits rooted in the Global North play a major and devastating role here.

input: Ojúṣe wo ni orílẹ̀-ède United State àti China -- àwọn tí wọ́n ń léwájú níbi ìgbéjáde òyì-èédú lágbàáyé -- ní sí ẹgbẹ̀rún-lọ́nà-ẹgbẹ̀rún àwọn ènìyàn tí ìgbóná àgbáyé ti ṣí nídì
target: What responsibilities do the United States, the European Union and China -- the world's leading carbon emitters -- have to the millions of people already uprooted by global warming

input: Ìkẹ́ta, a nílò láti bèrè ìbéèrè nípa ìdọ́gba.
target: And third, we need to ask questions about equality.

input: Aìdọ́gba àgbáyé jẹ́ ìṣòro tó ń rún nǹkan, t’ó sì lágbára.
target: Global inequality is a wrenching, intensifying problem.

input: Àlàfo ìpawó-wọlé àti ọrọ̀ ń fẹjú jákèjádò àgbáyé.
target: Income and wealth gaps are widening around the world.

input: Ní àlékún, nǹkan tó ń sọ bóyá ẹ lówó tàbí tòṣì, ju nǹkan mìíràn lọ, ni orílé-èdè wo ni wọ́n bíi yín sí, tó lè dàbi ẹni pé ó lágbára tí ẹ bá wá láti orílẹ̀-èdè tó làmìlaaka.
target: Increasingly, what determines whether you're rich or poor, more than anything else, is what country you're born in, which might seem great if you're from a prosperous country.

input: Ṣùgbọ́n ó túmọ sí ìpín àìṣedédé alágbára àwọn àǹfààní fún ìgbeayé pípẹ́, alálàáfíà, onítẹ́lọ́rùn.
target: But it actually means a profoundly unjust distribution of the chances for a long, healthy, fulfilling life.

input: Nígbà tí àwọn aṣíkiri bá fi owó tàbí ẹrù ránṣẹ́ sílé sí ẹbí wọn, ó máa ń kó ipa tó ṣe pàtàkì níbi ṣíṣe àdínkù àwọn àlàfo wọ̀nyí, tí ó bá jẹ́ èyí tí ò pé.
target: When immigrants send money or goods home to their family, it plays a significant role in narrowing these gaps, if a very incomplete one.

input: Ó ṣe ju gbogbo àwọn ètò ìrànwọ́ ilẹ̀ òkèèrè ní àgbáríjọpọ̀ àgbáyé lọ.
target: It does more than all of the foreign aid programs in the world combined.

input: A bẹ̀rẹ̀ pẹ̀lú ìbéèrè àwọn alátìlẹyìn ọmọ-ìlú, nípa àwọn aṣíkiri gẹ́gẹ́ bi irinṣẹ́, gẹ́gẹ́ bi àwọn tó kù àti ajọ̀fẹ́.
target: We began with the nativist questions, about immigrants as tools, as others and as parasites.

input: Níbo ni àwọn ìbéèrè tuntun wọ̀nyí nípa ẹ̀tọ́ àwọn òṣìṣẹ́, nípa ojúṣe àti nípa ìdógba ń múwa lọ
target: Where might these new questions about worker rights, about responsibility and about equality take us

input: Àwọn ìbéèrè wọ̀nyí kọ ìkáàánú, wọ́n sì gba ìṣedédé.
target: These questions reject pity, and they embrace justice.

input: Àwọn ìbéèrè wọ̀nyí kọ ìpínyà àwọn alátìlẹyìn ọmọ-ìlú àti àwọn alátìlẹyìn àpapọ̀ nípa àwa kojú àwọn.
target: These questions reject the nativist and nationalist division of us versus them.

input: Wọn yóò rànwá lọ́wọ́ láti múra sílẹ̀ fún àwọn ìṣòro tó ń bọ̀ àti àwọn ìṣòro bíi ìgbóná àgbáyé t’ó ti wà lórí wa.
target: They're going to help prepare us for problems that are coming and problems like global warming that are already upon us.

input: Kò ní rọrùn láti yí kúrò níbi àwọn ìbéèrè tí a ti ń bérè nípa sẹ́ẹ́tì àwọn ìbéèrè tuntun yìí.
target: It's not going to be easy to turn away from the questions that we've been asking towards this new set of questions.

input: Kì í ṣe ìdojúkọ kékeré láti kojú k’á sì fẹ àwọn enubodè wa.
target: It's no small challenge to take on and broaden the borders of us.

input: Ó máa gba ọgbọ́n, ìṣẹ̀dá àti ìgbóyà.
target: It will take wit, inventiveness and courage.

input: Àwọn ìbéèrè àtijọ́ ti wà pẹ̀lu wa fún ìgbà pípẹ́, wọn ò sì ní bìlà fúnra wọn, tí wọn ò sì ní bìlà lọ́sàán-kan óru-kan.
target: The old questions have been with us for a long time, and they're not going to give way on their own, and they're not going to give way overnight.

input: Kódà tí a bá gbìyànjú láti ṣe àyípadà àwọn ìbéèrè náà, àwọn ìdáhùn náà máa jẹ́ àmúdijú, wọ́n sì máa gba ìfarajìn àti ìṣedédé.
target: And even if we manage to change the questions, the answers are going to be complicated, and they're going to require sacrifices and tradeoffs.

input: Ní orílẹ̀-èdè àgbáyé tí ò dọ́gba, a máà nílò láti fi ọkàn sí ìbéèrè pé ta ló ní agbára láti darapọ̀ mọ́ àsọgbà náà àti eni tí ò ní.
target: And in an unequal world, we're always going to have to pay attention to the question of who has the power to join the conversation and who doesn't.

input: Ṣùgbọ́n àwọn enubòdè àríyànjiyàn ìwọlé látókèrè lè di sísún.
target: But the borders of the immigration debate can be moved.

input: Ó dọwọ́ gbogbo wa láti sún wọn.
target: It's up to all of us to move them.

input: Nǹkan tí mo kò nípa òmìnira lẹ́yìn tí mo sá kúrò ní orílẹ̀-ède North Korea.
target: What I learned about freedom after escaping North Korea

input: Wọ́n bí mi ní ọdún 1993 ní apá àríwá orílẹ̀-ède North Korea, ní agbègbè kan tí wọ́n ń pè ní Hyesan, tó wà pààlà pẹ̀lú orílẹ̀-ède China
target: I was born in 1993 in the northern part of North Korea, in a town called Hyesan, which is on the border with China.

input: Mo ní àwọn òbí tí wọ́n nífẹ̀ẹ́ àti ẹ̀gbọ́n obìnrin kan.
target: I had loving parents and one older sister.

input: Kí n tiẹ̀ tó pé ọmọ ọdún mẹ́wà, wọ́n rán bàbá mi lọ sí ìpàgọ́ àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ fún kíkópa nínú ìṣòwò àìbófinmu.
target: Before I was even 10 years old, my father was sent to a labor camp for engaging in illegal trading.

input: Ní báyìí, pẹ̀lú ìṣòwò àìbófinmu-- ó ń ta bàtà, ṣúgà, ìrẹsì lẹ́yìn náà kọ́pà láti fi bọ́ wa.
target: Now, by illegal trading -- he was selling clogs, sugar, rice and later copper to feed us.

input: Ní ọdún 2007, èmi àti ọmọ ìyá mi lóbìnrin pinnu láti sálọ.
target: In 2007, my sister and I decided to escape.

input: Ó jẹ́ ọmọ ọdún mẹ́rìn-dín-lógún, èmí sì jẹ́ ọmọ ọdún mẹ́tàlá.
target: She was 16 years old, and I was 13 years old.

input: Mo nílò láti jẹ́ kí ẹ mọ nǹkan tí ọ̀rọ̀ yìí sálọ túmọ̀ sí ní ní ọ̀gangan ipò orílẹ̀-ède North Korea.
target: I need you to understand what the word escape means in the context of North Korea.

input: Gbogbo wa ni ebi ń pa, ebí sì túmọ̀ sí ikú ní orílẹ̀-ède North Korea,
target: We were all starving, and hunger means death in North Korea.

input: Ó jẹ́ àǹfààní kan ṣoṣo fún wa.
target: So it was the only option for us.

input: Mi ò ti lẹ̀ lóye nípa èrò sísálọ, ṣùgbọ́n mo máa ń rí àwọn iná náà láti China lálẹ́, mo sì rò ó pé bóyá tí mo bá lọ síbi tí iná náà wà, mo lè rí abọ́ ìrẹsì kan.
target: I didn't even understand the concept of escape, but I could see the lights from China at night, and I wondered if I go where the light is, I might be able to find a bowl of rice.

input: Kì í ṣe wí pé a ní ìpinnu alágbára tàbí àwòrán kankan.
target: It's not like we had a grand plan or maps.

input: A ò mọ nǹkankan nípa nǹkan tí yóò ṣẹlẹ̀.
target: We did not know anything about what was going to happen.

input: Ẹ wòye pé ilé ìgbe yín gbaná.
target: Imagine your apartment building caught fire.

input: Mò ń sọ nípa pé, kí lẹ máa se
target: I mean, what would you do

input: Ṣé ẹ máa dùró síbẹ̀ kí ẹ jóná ni, àbi ṣé ẹ máa fò jáde kúrò látojú fèrèsé kí ẹ sì wá wo ohun tí yóó ṣelẹ̀
target: Would you stay there to be burned, or would you jump off out of the window and see what happens

input: Nǹkan tí a ṣe nìyẹn.
target: That's what we did.

input: A fò jáde kúrò nínú ilé náà dípò iná.
target: We jumped out of the house instead of the fire.

input: North Korea jẹ́ ibi tí ẹ ò leè ronú nípa rẹ̀.
target: North Korea is unimaginable.

input: Ó máa nira fún mi nígbà tí àwọn ènìyàn bá bi mí bó ṣe rí láti gbé nígbẹ̀.
target: It's very hard for me when people ask me what it feels like to live there.

input: Ká sọ tòótọ́, mo sọ fún yíẹ ò lè ronú nípa rẹ̀.
target: To be honest,you can't even imagine it.

input: Àwọn ọ̀rọ̀ inú èyíkéyìí èdè ò lè ṣàpèjúwe rẹ̀, nítorí àgbáyé tó yátọ̀ pátápátá ni, bí ẹ ò ṣe lè ronú ìgbésíayé yín nínú Ìsọ̀ngbè-oòrùn-kẹ́rin lọ́wọ́lọ́wọ́ yìí.
target: The words in any language can't describe, because it's a totally different planet, as you cannot imagine your life on Mars right now.

input: Fún àpẹẹrẹ, ọ̀rọ yìí ìfẹ́ ní ìtumọ̀ kan ṣoṣìfẹ́ fún adarí wa ọ̀wọ́n.
target: For example, the word lovelove for the Dear Leader.

input: Kò sí èrò ìfẹ́ ẹlẹ́yẹlé ní orílẹ̀-ède North Korea
target: There's no concept of romantic love in North Korea.

input: Tí ẹ ò bá mọ àwọn ọ̀rọ náà, ìyẹ́n túmọ̀ sí wí pé èrò náà ò ye yín, nítorí náà, ẹ ò ní mọ̀ pé èrò yẹn gan-an jẹ́ a ṣe é ṣe.
target: And if you don't know the words, that means you don't understand the concept, and therefore, you don't even realize that concept is even a possibility.

input: Ẹ jẹ́ kí n fún yín ní àpẹẹrẹ mìíràn.
target: Let me give you another example.

input: Nígbà tí mò ń dàgbà ní orílẹ̀-ède North Korea, a nígbàgbọ́ lódodo wí pé adarí wa ọ̀wọ́n jẹ́ òòṣà tó lágbára tó lè mọ èro ọkàn wa.
target: Growing up in North Korea, we truly believed that our Dear Leader is an almighty god who can even read my thoughts.

input: Èrú tún bàmí láti ronú nípa orílẹ̀-ède North Korea.
target: I was even afraid to think in North Korea.

input: Wọ́n sọ fún wa pé ó ń f’ebi panú fún wa, ó sì ń ṣiṣẹ́ láìkáàrẹ̀ fún wa, ọkàn mí sì gbọgbẹ́ fún-un.
target: We are told that he's starving for us, and he's working tirelessly for us, and my heart just broke for him.

input: Nígbà tí mo sálọ sí orílẹ̀-ède South Korea, àwọn ènìyán sọ fún mi wí pé apàṣẹ wàá ni, ó ní àwọn ọkọ̀, oríṣiríṣi ilé-ìgbafẹ́, ó sì ń gbé ìgbeayé olówó ńlá.
target: When I escaped to South Korea, people told me that he was actually a dictator, he had cars, many, many resorts, and he had an ultraluxurious life.

input: Nígbà náà ni mo bá rántí wíwo àwòran rẹ̀ kan, mímọ̀ fún ìgbà àkọ́kọ́ pé òun lẹni tó tóbi jù nínú àwòrán náà.
target: And then I remember looking at a picture of him, realizing for the first time that he is the largest guy in the picture.

input: Ló bá yémi.
target: And it hit me.

input: Nígbẹ́yìn, mo mọ̀ wí pé ebi ò pa á.
target: Finally, I realized he wasn't starving.

input: Ṣùgbọ́n mi ò ní àǹfààní láti rí èyí tẹ́lẹ̀, àyàfi ìgbà tí ẹnìkan sọ fún mi wí pé òún sanra.
target: But I was never able to see that before, until someone told me that he was fat.

input: Lóòótọ́, ẹnìkán ní láti kọ́ mi pé òún sanra.
target: Really, someone had to teach me that he was fat.

input: Tí ẹ ò bà tíì ṣe ìfikọ́ra ìrònú jinlẹ̀ rí, nǹkan tí wọ́n bá ní kí ẹ rí lẹ máa rìí.
target: If you have never practiced critical thinking, then you simply see what you're told to see.

input: Ìbéèrè tó tóbi jù tí àwọn èniyàn máa ń bi míKí ló dé tí ò sí ìjàngbara nínú orílẹ̀-ède North Korea
target: Why is there no revolution inside North Korea

input: Ṣé odi niwá ni
target: Are we dumb

input: Kí ló dé tí ò sí ìjàngbara fún ìnira àádọ́rin ọdún yìí
target: Why is there no revolution for 70 years of this oppression

input: Ti mo bá sọ wí pé tí ẹ ò bá mọ̀ wí pé ẹrú niyín, tí ẹ ò bá mọ̀ wí pé wọ́n yà yín sọ́tọ̀ tàbí wọ́n ń fara niyín, báwo lẹ ṣe fẹ́ jà láti gba ìtúsílẹ̀
target: If you don't know you're a slave, if you don't know you're isolated or oppressed, how do you fight to be free

input: Mò ń sọ nípa pé, tí ẹ bá mọ̀ wí pé wọ́n yà yín sọ́tọ̀, ó túmọ̀ sí wí pé wọn ò yà yín sọ́tọ̀.
target: I mean, if you know you're isolated, that means you are not isolated.

input: Àìmọ̀ ni ìtumọ̀ ìyanisọ́tọ̀ lódodo, ìdí nìyẹn tí mi ò fi mọ̀ wí pé wọ́n yàmí sọ́tọ̀ ni nígbà tí mo wà ní orílẹ̀-ède North Korea.
target: Not knowing is the true definition of isolation, and that's why I never knew I was isolated when I was in North Korea.

input: Mo rò wí pé mo wà láàrín-gbùgbun àgbáyé ni.
target: I literally thought I was in the center of the universe.

input: Èrò mi tó yẹ fún ìfọ́nká rè é ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àwọn ènìyán rò wí pé ọmọ ènìyàn mọ nǹkan tó yẹ àti èyí tó burú jáì, ìyàtọ̀ tó wà láàárín ìṣedédé àti àìṣedédé, nǹkan tó tọ́ síwa àti nǹkan tí ò tọ́ síwa.
target: a lot of people think humans inherently know what is right and wrong, the difference between justice and injustice, what we deserve and we don't deserve.

input: Gbogbo ẹ̀, gbogbo ẹ̀ gbọ́dọ̀ di kíkọ́, tó fi kan àánú.
target: Everything, everything must be taught, including compassion.

input: Bí mo bá rí enìkan tó ń kú lọ láàárín adúgbò nísìyìí, mà á ṣe ohun-kóhun láti dóòlà ẹni náà.
target: If I see someone dying on the street right now, I will do anything to save that person.

input: Ṣùgbọ́n nígbà ti mo wà ní orílẹ̀-ède North Korea, mo rí àwọn ènìyàn tí wọ́n ń kú àti òkú káàkiri àdúgbò.
target: But when I was in North Korea, I saw people dying and dead on the streets.

input: Mi ò ní ìmọ̀lára kankan.
target: I felt nothing.

input: Kìí ṣe nítorí mo jẹ́ ọlọ́dẹ-orí, ṣùgbọ́n nítorí mi ò kẹ́kọ̀ọ́ nípa èrò ìkáànú rí.
target: Not because I'm a psychopath, but because I never learned the concept of compassion.

input: Mo ní ìmọ̀láa àánú, ìbánikẹ́dùn àti ìkáànú nínú ọkàn mi lẹ́yìn ìgbà tí mo kọ́ nípa ọ̀rọ̀ yìí àánú àti èro rẹ̀ nìkan, mo sì ní ìmọ̀lára wọn báyìí.
target: Only, I felt compassion, empathy and sympathy in my heart after I learned the word compassion and the concept, and I feel them now.

input: Ní báyìí mò ń gbé ní orílẹ̀-ède United State gẹ́gẹ́ bi olómìnira ènìyàn.
target: Now I live in the United States as a free person.

input: Láìpẹ́ yìí, àwọn adarí orílẹ̀-èdè olómìnira, Ààrẹ wa Trump, ṣe ìpàdé pẹ̀lú òòsa mi tẹ́lẹ̀.
target: And recently, the leader of the free country, our President Trump, met with my former god.

input: Ó sì pinnu pé ẹ̀tọ ọmọ ènìyàn ò ṣe pàtàkì tó láti fi kún ìpinnu rẹ̀, kò sì sọ̀rọ̀ nípa rẹ̀.
target: And he decided human rights is not important enough to include in his agendas, and he did not talk about it.

input: Ó bà mí lẹ́rù.
target: And it scares me.

input: Lọ́wọ́lọ́wọ́ yìí à ń gbé nínú ayé níbi tí wọ́n ti lè gbóríyìn fún apàṣe-wàá kan pé ó pa ọmọ ìya bàba rẹ̀ lọ́kùrin, fún pípa ọmọ ìyàwo bàba rẹ̀, pípa ẹgbẹ̀rún àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀-ède North korea.
target: We live in a world right now where a dictator can be praised for executing his uncle, for killing his half brother, killing thousands of North Koreans.

input: Ìyẹn sì tó nǹkan à ń gbóríyìn fún.
target: And that was worthy of praise.

input: Bákan náà ó múmi ronú bóyá gbogbo wa la nílò láti kọ́ nǹkan tuntun nípa òmìnira báyìí.
target: perhaps we all need to be taught something new about freedom now.

input: Nǹkan ẹlẹgẹ́ ni òmìnira
target: Freedom is fragile.

input: Mi ò fẹ́ fun yín lára, ṣùgbọ́n bẹ́ẹ̀ ni.
target: I don't want to alarm you, but it is.

input: Ìran mẹ́ta péré ló gbà láti sọ orílẹ̀-ède North Korea di 1984 ti Goorge Orwell
target: It only took three generations to make North Korea into George Orwell's 1984.

input: Ìran mẹ́ta péré ló gbà.
target: It took only three generations.

input: Bí a ò bá jà fún ètọ ọmọnìyàn fún àwọn ènìyàn tí wọ́n ń fìyà jẹ lọ́wọ́lọ́wọ́ yìí tí wọn ò lè fohùn, gẹ́gẹ́ bí àwọn ènìyàn tí wọ́n lómìnira níbí, ta ló máa jà fún wa nígbà tí a ò bá ní òmìnira
target: If we don't fight for human rights for the people who are oppressed right now who don't have a voice, as free people here, who will fight for us when we are not free

input: Mi ò mọ̀.
target: I don't know.

input: Mo rò wí pé ó dára pé a káràmásìkí mọ́ àyípadà ojú-ọjọ́, ẹ̀tọ́ ẹranko, ìṣedédé láàárín akọ àti abo, gbogbo àwọn nǹkan wọ̀nyí.
target: I think it's wonderful that we care about climate change, animal rights, gender equality, all of these things.

input: Òtítọ́ pé a káràmásìki nípa ẹ̀tọ́ ẹranko, ìyẹ́n túmọ̀ sí wí pé bí ọkàn wa ṣe rewà sí nìyẹn, pé a káràmásìkí nípa enìkan tí ò le fi ẹnu arawọn sọ̀rọ̀.
target: The fact that we care about animals' rights, that means that's how beautiful our heart is, that we care about someone who cannot speak for themselves.

input: Àwọn ọmọ ilẹ̀ North Korea ò lè fi ẹnu arawọn sọ̀rọ̀ lọ́wọ́lọ́wọ́ yìí.
target: And North Koreans right now cannot speak for themselves.

input: Wọn ò ní ẹ̀rọ-ayélukára-bí-ajere ní ọ̀rún ọdún kọkàn-lé-lógún.
target: They don't have internet in the 21st century.

input: A ò ní iná mọ̀nàmọ́ná, òhun sì ni àyè tó ṣókùnkùn jù lórí ilẹ̀ eèpẹ̀ lọ́wọ́lọ́wọ́ yìí.
target: We don't have electricity, and it is the darkest place on earth right now.

input: Báyìí mo fẹ́ sọ nǹkankan fún àwọn tí a jìjọ jẹ́ ọmọ ilẹ̀ North Korea tí wọ́n ń gbé nínú òkùkùn yẹn.
target: Now I want to say something to my fellow North Koreans who are living in that darkness.

input: Wọ́n lè má gba èyí gbọ́, ṣùgbọ́n mo fẹ́ sọ fún wọn pé ìpààrọ ìgbésí-ayé ṣe é ṣe.
target: They might not believe this, but I want to tell them that an alternative life is possible.

input: Látara ìrírí mi, gbogbo nǹkan ló ṣe é ṣe.
target: From my experience, literally anything is possible.

input: Wón rà mí, wọ́n tà mí gẹ́gẹ́ bí ẹrú.
target: I was bought, I was sold as a slave.

input: Ṣùgbọ́n ní báyìí mo ti wà níbí, ìyẹn ló sì fà á tí mo fi nígbàgbọ́ nínú iṣẹ́-ìyanu.
target: But now I'm here, and that is why I believe in miracles.

input: Nǹkan kan tí mo kọ́ nínú ìtàn ni wí pé kò sí nǹkankan tó lọ títí nínú ayé yìí.
target: The one thing that I learned from history is that nothing is forever in this world.

input: Ìdí nìyẹn tí a fi ní gbogbo ẹ̀tọ́ láti ní ìrètí.
target: And that is why we have every reason to be hopeful.

input: Ìmọ̀-ẹ̀rọ ìṣègùn tí wọ́n ṣẹ̀dá láti pèse ohun tí ilẹ̀ Adúláwò nílò.
target: Medical tech designed to meet Africa's needs

input: Bíi gbogbo onímọ̀-ẹ̀rọ nípa ohun-èlo ẹ̀rọ-ayárabíàṣá tí ò ṣe é fọwọ́ kàn tí wọ́n wà níta níbẹ̀ yẹn, mo máa ń tẹ̀lé alwọn ilé-iṣẹ́ ìmọ̀-ẹ̀rọ ní Silicon Valley típẹ́-típẹ́, ní ọ̀nà kan náà tí àwọn olólùfẹ́ eré bólù aláfẹsẹ̀gbá ṣe ń tẹ̀lé ikọ̀ wọn nílẹ̀ Europe.
target: Like every passionate software engineer out there, I closely follow technology companies in Silicon Valley, pretty much the same way soccer fans follow their teams in Europe.

input: Mo máa ń ka àròkọ lórí ìkànnì ìmọ̀-ẹ̀rọ mo sì máa ń tẹ́ti sí àkáálẹ̀ ẹ̀rọ-agbagbe lórí ẹ̀rọ-ìbánisọ̀rọ̀ mi.
target: I read articles on tech blogs and listen to podcasts on my phone.

input: Ṣùgbọ́n lẹ́yìn tí mo bá parí átíkù náà, tí mo ti ẹ̀rọ-ìbánisọ̀rọ̀ mi tí mo sì yọ àgbékarí, mo ti padà sí ìwò oòrun ilẹ̀ Adúláwò, níbi ti ààla-ilẹ̀ ò ti jọra wọn.
target: But after I finish the article, lock my phone and unplug the headphones, I'm back in sub-Saharan Africa, where the landscape is not quite the same.

input: Iná máa ń lọ fún ìgbà pípé lọ́pọ̀-ìgbà, àìlo ẹ̀rọ-ayárabíàṣá púpọ̀, ìkàni ayélukára tí ò yára àti ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àwọn aláìsàn tí wọ́n lọ sílé ìwòsàn tí kò sí òṣìṣẹ́ púpọ̀.
target: We have long and frequent power outages, low penetration of computers, slow internet connections and a lot of patients visiting understaffed hospitals.

input: Látìgbà àjàkálẹ̀ àrun kòkòro apa òkì àjẹsára àìfààyègba-àìsàn ara, àwọn ilé ìwòsàn tí ń tiraka láti ṣàmójútó àkọsílẹ̀ ìtọ́jú kòkòro apa sójà ara lóòrèkóòrè fún àlékún abala àwọn aláìsàn.
target: Since the HIV epidemic, hospitals have been struggling to manage regular HIV treatment records for increasing volumes of patients.

input: Fún irú àwùjọ bẹ́ẹ̀, gbigbé èto ìmọ̀-ẹ̀rọ tí wọ́n ṣẹ̀dá níbòmíràn ò tíì ṣiṣẹ́, ṣùgbọ́n ní ọdún 2006, mo darapọ̀ mọ́ Baoba Health, ikọ̀ kan tó máa ń lo àwọn onímọ̀-ẹ̀rọ lábẹ́lé láti ṣẹ̀da àwọn ìdásí tó yẹ tí wọ́n ń yanjú àwọn ìdojúkọ ajẹmọ ìtọ́jú ní orílẹ̀-ède Malawi
target: For such environments, importing technology systems developed elsewhere has not worked, but in 2006, I joined Baobab Health, a team that uses locally based engineers to develop suitable interventions that are addressing health care challenges in Malawi.

input: A ṣẹ̀da ẹ̀rọ tó ń ṣe àkọsílẹ̀ ìlera onínọ́ tí àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ ìlera ń lò nígbà tí wọ́n bá ń rí àwọn aláìsàn.
target: We designed an electronic health record system that is used by health care workers while seeing patients.

input: Nínú ìgbésẹ̀ náà a mọ̀ pé a ò ní láti ṣẹ̀da ohun-èlo ẹ̀rọ-ayárabíàṣá tí ò ṣe é fọwọ́ kàn nìkan, a ní láti ṣàmúlò ohun amáyédẹrùn náà bákan náà.
target: And in the process we realized that we not only had to design the software, we had to implement the infrastructure as well.

input: Gbogbo wa la ní ọjọ́ ìbí, ṣùgbọ́n kìí ṣe gbogbo ènìyàn ló mọ ọjọ́ ìbi wọn, nítorí náà a kọ àwọn ètò láti mójútó àpapọ̀ àwọn ọjọ́ ìbí gẹ́gẹ́ bi déétì tó pé.
target: Everyone has a birthday, but not everyone knows their birthday, so we wrote algorithms to handle estimated birthdates as complete dates.

input: Báwo la ó ṣe ṣe ìtẹ̀lé àwọn aláìsàn tí wọ́n ń gbé ní àdúgbò elérò tí ò ní nọ́mbà àdúgbò àti ilé
target: How do we follow up patients living in slums with no street and house numbers

input: A lo ààla-ilẹ̀ láti ṣe àròpọ̀ àdírẹ́sì àfojúrí wọn.
target: We used landmarks to approximate their physical addresses.

input: Orílẹ̀-ède Malawi ò ní ID láti ṣe ìdánimọ̀ àwọn aláìsàn yàtọ̀, nítorí náà a ní láti ṣàmúlò ID àwọn aláìsàn tó yátọ̀ láti ṣe àsopọ̀ àkọsílẹ̀ àwọn aláìsàn jákèjádò àwọn ilé ìtọ́jú.
target: Malawi had no IDs to uniquely identify patients, so we had to implement unique patient IDs to link patient records across clinics.

input: A ṣe àtẹ̀jáde àwọn ID náà gẹ́gẹ́ bi ẹ̀nà onílà òòró tí wọ́n lè mọ́ àwọn ìwé ìlera àdáni tí aláìsàn kọ̀ọ̀kan ń tọ́jú.
target: The IDs are printed as barcodes on labels that are stuck on personal health booklets kept by each patient.

input: Pẹ̀lú ID tó ní ẹ̀nà onílà òòró yìí, ìfojúwò gara tíò le pẹ̀lú ẹ̀rọ tó ń ka ẹ̀nà onílà òòró yóò tètè gbé àkọsílẹ̀ aláìsàn náà síta.
target: With this barcoded ID, a simple scan with a barcode reader quickly pulls up the patient's records.

input: Wọn ò nílò láti ṣe àtúnkọ àlàyé nípa ara wọn sóri ewé ìforúkọsílẹ̀ ní gbogbo ìgbà tí wọ́n bá wá.
target: No need to rewrite their personal details on paper registers at every visit.

input: Lójijì, àwọn ilà-ìtò bá di kúkurú
target: And suddenly, queues became shorter.

input: Èyí túmọ̀ sí wí pé àwọn aláìsàn, àwọn ìyá tí wọ́n lọ́mọ lẹ́yìn wọn nìkan, yóò lo àsìkò díẹ̀ ní ìdúró de ìrànlọ́wọ́
target: This meant patients, typically mothers with little children on their backs, had to spend less time waiting to be assisted.

input: Bí wọ́n bá ṣe àfẹ́kù ìwe wọn, àkọsílẹ̀ wọn ṣì lè di gbígbà pẹ̀lú wíwá orúkọ wọn.
target: And if they lose their booklets, their records can still be pulled by searching with their names.

input: Ní báyìí, ònà tí à ń gbà pè àti kọ orúkọ yátọ̀ gidi gan-an.
target: Now, the way we pronounce and spell names varies tremendously.

input: A ṣe àdàpọ̀ R àti L láìsídìwọ́, ẹ̀dà ède gẹ̀ẹ́sì àti ède abínibí àwọn orúkọ wọn.
target: We freely mix R's and L's, English and vernacular versions of their names.

input: Kódà ìjọra-ìró, ìlànà àwòkọ́ṣe fún ìpín-sísọ̀rí àwọn ọ̀rọ̀ pẹ̀lú bí wọ́n ṣe jọra ní ìró, kò dára tó.
target: Even soundex, a standard method for grouping words by how similar they sound, was not good enough.

input: Nítorí náà a ní láti ṣe àtúnṣe sí i láti lè bá wa ṣe àsopọ̀ àti ìbámu àwọn àkọsílẹ̀ tó ti wà tẹ́lẹ̀.
target: So we had to modify it to help us link and match existing records.

input: Ṣíwájú iPhone, àwọn onímọ̀-ẹ̀rọ nípa ohun-èlo ẹ̀rọ-ayárabíàṣá tí ò ṣe é fọwọ́ kàn ṣẹ̀da rẹ̀ fún ẹ̀rọ-ayárabíàṣá àdáni, ṣùgbọ́n látara ìrírí wa, a mọ̀ pé èto agbára wa ò ṣe é gbáralé fún ẹ̀rọ-ayárabíàṣá àdáni.
target: Before the iPhone, software engineers developed for personal computers, but from our experience, we knew our power system is not reliable enough for personal computers.

input: Nítorí náà a ṣe àmúyẹ àwọn ẹ̀rọ ibi-ìtajà agbàwòrán-tàn-aláfọwọ́tẹ̀ tí wọ́n wà fún àwọn ìsọ̀ alárà-tún-tà láti di ẹ̀rọ-iṣẹ́ ajẹmọ́wòsàn.
target: So we repurposed touch screen point-of-sale terminals that are meant for retail shops to become clinical workstations.

input: Ní àsìkò náà, a ṣe ìkówọlé àwọn ohun-èlò ayélukára-bí-ajere tí wọ́n pè ní i-Opener tí wọ́n ṣe sànmání ìtakùn ẹ̀rọ ayélukára-bí-ajere àmì ti ìṣe òwò ní ilé-iṣẹ́ kan tí ó fìdí rẹmi ní orílẹ̀-ède US.
target: At the time, we imported internet appliances called i-Openers that were manufactured during the dot-com era by a failed US company.

input: A ṣe àtúnṣe àtẹ agbàwòrán tàn wọn láti ṣe àfikún iyè ìfọwọ́kàn àti èto agbára-mànàmáná wọn láti lè ṣiṣẹ́ lára òkúta-agbagbará-iná-àsọdọ̀tun.
target: We modified their screens to add touch sensors and their power system to run from rechargeable batteries.

input: Nígbà tí a bẹ̀rẹ̀, a ò rí ojú-òpó-ìsopọ̀ ayélukára-bí-ajere tó ṣe é gbáralé láti ta àtagbà ìwífún-alálàyé, pàápàá jùlọ láti àwọn ilé-ìwòsàn tí wọ́n wà ní ìgbèríko.
target: When we started, we didn't find a reliable network to transmit data, especially from rural hospitals.

input: Nítorí náà a kọ́ ilé-agbára tiwa, a ṣẹ̀dá àwọn òpó-ìsopọ̀ ayélukára-bí-ajere àìlokùn-agbé-òyì-iná tí a sì so ilé-ìwòsàn alábọ́dé ní Lilongwe, olú ìlu orílẹ̀-ède Malawi pọ̀.
target: So we built our own towers, created a wireless network and linked clinics in Lilongwe, Malawi's capital.

input: Pẹ̀lú ikọ̀ àwọn onímọ̀-ẹ̀rọ tí wọ́n ń ṣiṣẹ́ láàárín ọgbà ilé-ìwòsàn kan, a ṣe àkíyèsí wí pé àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ ìlera ń lo ètò náà wọ́n sì ń ṣẹ̀da ètò ìfitóni t’ó ń ṣe àmójútó àkọsílẹ̀ HIV báyìí ní gbogbo àwọn ilé-ìwòsàn gbogbogbò t’ó tóbi jù ní orílẹ̀-ède Malawi.
target: With a team of engineers working within a hospital campus, we observed health care workers use the system and iteratively build an information system that is now managing HIV records in all major public hospitals in Malawi.

input: Àwọn wọ̀nyí ni ilé-ìwòsàn tí ń ṣe ìtọ́jú àwọn aláìsan HIV tí ó lé ní ẹgbẹ̀rún méjì, ní ibi ilé-ìwòsàn kọ̀ọ̀kan.
target: These are hospitals serving over 2,000 HIV patients, each clinic.

input: Ní báyìí, àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ ìlera tí wọ́n máa lo àìmọye ọjọ́ láti ṣe àpapọ̀ àti láti ṣèto ìjábọ̀ olóṣù mẹ́ta-mẹ́ta ń ṣe ìjábọ̀ kan náà láàárín ìṣẹ́jú díẹ̀, àwọn àgbà-ọ̀jẹ̀ oníṣẹ́-ìlera káàkiri àgbáyé ti ń wá sí orílẹ̀-ède Malawi láti kọ́ nípa bí a ṣe ṣe é.
target: Now, health care workers who used to spend days to tally and prepare quarterly reports are producing the same reports within minutes, and health care experts from all over the world are now coming to Malawi to learn how we did it.

input: Kí ló sọnù nínú ìtan àwọn aṣíkiri-lọ-sí-ìlú-mìíràn ilẹ̀ America
target: What's missing from the American immigrant narrative

input: Ẹ ǹlẹ́, gbogbo ènìyàn, orúkọ mi ni Elizabeth, mo sì ń ṣiṣẹ́ ní àjà ìṣòwò.
target: Hi, everyone, my name is Elizabeth, and I work on the trading floor.

input: Ṣùgbọ́n ojú mi ò tíì ṣálẹ̀ sí i dáadáa.
target: But I'm still pretty new to it.

input: Mo kẹ́kọ̀ọ́ jáde nílé-ẹ̀kọ́ ní bíi odún kan àbọ̀ sẹ́yìn, k’á sì sọ òtítọ́, mo sì ń padà bọ̀ sípò látàrí ìgbésẹ̀ ìgbaniwọlé tí mo ní láti là kọjá láti débí.
target: I graduated from college about a year and a half ago, and to be quite honest, I'm still recovering from the recruiting process I had to go through to get here.

input: Ní báyìí, mi ò mọ tiyín, ṣùgbọ́n èyí ni nǹkan tó burú jù tí mo ṣì ń rántí nípa gbogbo ìgbésẹ̀ náà, mò ń bèrè lọ́wọ́ àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ tí ọkàn wọn ò balẹ̀ ohun tí ìfẹ́ gidigidi wọn t’ó tóbi jù jẹ́.
target: Now, I don't know about you, but this is the most ridiculous thing that I still remember about the whole process, was asking insecure college students what their biggest passion was.

input: Bíi, ṣé e ń retí kí n ní ìdáhùn fún ìyẹn
target: Like, do you expect me to have an answer for that

input: Bẹ́ẹ̀ni mo níi.
target: Of course I did.

input: Wọ́n fẹ́ràn ìtan ara ẹni t’ó dára.
target: They love a good personal story.

input: Ṣùgbọ́n ṣé ẹ mọ nǹkan
target: But you know what

input: Kì í ṣe nítorí àwọn nǹkan tí mo sọ kì í ṣe ododo -- mò ń sọ nípa pé, àwọn òbí mi ń sọ̀rọ̀ nípa kiní yìí.
target: And not because the things I said weren't true -- I mean, my parents were talking about this stuff.

input: Ṣùgbọ́n nǹkan t’ó mú mi pinnu láti ta kọ́sọ́sọ́ sí ìsúná gangan kọ́ nìyẹn.
target: But that's not really why I decided to jump into finance.

input: Mo kọ̀ fẹ́ san owó ilé mi lásán ni.
target: I just really wanted to pay my rent.

input: Nǹkan náà rèé.
target: And here's the thing.

input: Òótọ́ nípa sísan owó ilé mi kín sì ṣe àwọn nǹkan agbàlagbà tòótọ́ jẹ́ nǹkan tí a ò férẹ̀ nífẹ̀ sí láti sọ fún àwọn olùgbanisíṣẹ́, fún àwọn tókù àti fún ara wa bákan náà.
target: The reality of having to pay my rent and do real adult things is something that we're rarely willing to admit to employers, to others and even to ourselves.

input: Mo mọ̀ wí pé mi ò ṣetán láti sọ fún olùgbanisíṣẹ́ mi pé torí owó ni mo ṣe wá síbẹ̀.
target: I know I wasn't about to tell my recruiters that I was there for the money.

input: Ìdi rẹ̀ sì ni wí pé fún ẹ̀yà tó pọ́jù, a fẹ́ rí ara wa gẹ́gẹ́ bi oníròrí àti bí ènìyàn tó mọ nǹkan tó nígbàgbọ́ nínú rẹ̀ tó sì ń ṣiṣẹ́ tọ àwọn nǹkan tó máa ń dùn wọ́n nínú jù.
target: And that's because for the most part, we want to see ourselves as idealists and as people who do what they believe in and pursue the things that they find the most exciting.

input: Ṣùgbọ́n òtítọ́ ni wí pé díẹ̀ nínú wa ló ní àǹfààní láti ṣe ìyẹn.
target: But the reality is very few of us actually have the privilege to do that.

input: Ní báyìí, mi ò le sọ ti gbogbo ènìyàn, ṣùgbọ́n èyí jẹ́ pàáp̀àá òtítọ́ fún ọ̀dọ́ akọṣẹ́mọṣẹ́ aṣíkiri bíi tèmi.
target: Now, I can't speak for everyone, but this is especially true for young immigrant professionals like me.

input: Ìdí tí èyí fi jẹ́ òdodo ní nǹkan ṣe pẹ̀lú àwọn ìtàn tí àwùjọ ti fín gbá wa nínú ìròyìn, níbi iṣẹ́ àti àwọn ohùn líle tó ń bíni nínú wọ̀nyẹn nínú orí wa.
target: And the reason this is true has something to do with the narratives that society has kept hitting us with in the news, in the workplace and even by those annoyingly self-critical voices in our heads.

input: Torí náà ìtàn wo ni mò ń tọ́ka sí
target: So what narratives am I referring to

input: Ó dáa, awọn méjì kan máa ń wá sórí ẹ̀mí tí ó bá di ọ̀rọ̀ àwọn aṣíkiri.
target: Well, there's two that come to mind when it comes to immigrants.

input: Àkọ́kọ́ ni èrò nípa àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ aṣíkiri.
target: The first is the idea of the immigrant worker.

input: Ẹ mọ̀, àwọn ènìyàn tí wọ́n máa ń wá iṣẹ́ wá sí orílẹ̀-ède US gẹ́gẹ́ bi lébírà, tàbí òsìṣẹ́ orí oko, afọbọ́.
target: You know, people that come to the US in search of jobs as laborers, or field workers, dish washers.

input: Ẹ mọ̀, àwọn nǹkan tí àwá lè rí gẹ́gẹ́ bi iṣẹ́ tí owó-iṣẹ́ rẹ̀ kéré ṣùgbọ́n àwọn aṣíkiri
target: You know, things that we might consider low-wage jobs but the immigrants

input: Àǹfààní gidi nìyẹn.
target: That's a good opportunity.

input: Àwọn ìròyìn lásíkò yìí ti sọ gbobo nǹkan yẹn di àmúdijú díẹ̀.
target: The news nowadays has convoluted that whole thing quite a bit.

input: Ẹ lè sọ wí pé ó ti jẹ́ kí àjọṣepọ̀ láàárín àwọn ọmọ ilẹ̀ America àti àwọn aṣíkiri di àmúdijú.
target: You could say that it's made America's relationship with immigrants complicated.

input: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí àgbà-ọ̀jẹ̀ nípa àwọn aṣíkiri George Borjas yóò ti ṣe sọ ọ́, ó dàbi ẹni pé ilẹ̀ America fẹ́ àwọn òṣìṣẹ́, ṣùgbọ́n síbẹ̀, ó dàrú mọ́wọn lójú nígbà tí wọ́n rí àwọn ènìyàn dípò bẹ́ẹ̀.
target: And as immigrant expert George Borjas would have put it, it's kind of like America wanted workers, but then, they got confused when we got people instead.

input: Mò ń sọ nípa pé, abínibí ni pé àwọn ènìyàn fẹ́ tirika láti nílé lórí kí wọ́n sì gbé ìgbeayé gidi, àbí
target: I mean, it's natural that people want to strive to put a roof over their heads and live a normal life, right

input: Fún àwọn ìdí tó fojú hàn, ìtàn yìí ti ń sín mi níwín díẹ̀.
target: So for obvious reasons, this narrative has been driving me a little bit crazy.

input: Ṣùgbọ́n kì í ṣe òhun nìkan.
target: But it's not the only one.

input: Ìtàn mìíràn tí màá sọ nípa rẹ̀ jẹ́ nípa èrò àwọn aṣíkíri-alágbára.
target: The other narrative that I'm going to talk about is the idea of the superimmigrant.

input: Ní ilẹ̀ America, a fẹ́ràn láti sọ àwọn aṣíkiri-alágbára di òòṣà-àkúnlẹ̀bọ gẹ́gẹ́ bi àrokò tó yẹ fún àṣeyọrí ilẹ̀ America.
target: In America, we love to idolize superimmigrants as the ideal symbols of American success.

input: Mo dagbà lẹ́ni tó ń nífẹ̀ sí àwọn aṣíkiri-alágbára, nítorí ìṣẹ̀mi wọn ṣe ìrànwọ́ fún àlá mi ó sì fúnmi nírètí.
target: I grew up admiring superimmigrants, because their existence fueled my dreams and it gave me hope.

input: Ìṣòro tó wà pẹ̀lú ìtàn yìí ni wí pé ó tún dàbi ẹni pé wọ́n ń ṣọ́ àwọn tí wọn ò láṣeyọrí tàbí tí wọn ò rí ṣe lọ́nà yẹn.
target: The problem with this narrative is that it also seems to cast a shadow on those that don't succeed or that don't make it in that way, as less than.

input: Fún àìmọye ọdún, mo bára mi ní àwọn ọ̀nà tó dàbi ẹni pé wọ́n ń gbóríyìn fún aṣíkiri kan nígbà tí wọ́n sọ ìkejì dí aṣebi.
target: And for years, I got caught up in the ways in which it seemed to celebrate one type of immigrant while villainizing the other.

input: Mò ń sọ nípa pé, ṣé ìfarajìn àwọn òbí mi ò tó ni
target: I mean, were my parents' sacrifices not enough

input: Ṣé ọ̀títọ́ pé bàbá mi wálé láti ilé-iṣọ̀pọ̀ àlùrọ tí eruku àlùrọ bòó, ṣé ìyẹn ò lágbára tó
target: Was the fact that my dad came home from the metal factory covered in corrosive dust, was that not super

input: Ẹ má ṣìmí gbọ́, mo ti ro ìtàn méjééjì dé ìpele kan, ní ọ̀nà tó pọ̀, rírí àṣeyọrí àwọn akọni mi, ó ti tìmí láti ṣe bẹ́ẹ̀.
target: Don't get me wrong, I've internalized both of these narratives to some degree, and in many ways, seeing my heroes succeed, it has pushed me to do the same.

input: Ṣùgbọ́n àwọn ìtàn méjéjì yìí ní akùdé ní àwọn ọ̀nà tí wọ́n fi ń ba ìjẹ́ ọmọ ènìyàn àwọn èyàn jẹ́ tí wọn ò bá yẹ ní ìmọ kan tàbí ní àwọn ọ̀nà kan
target: But both of these narratives are flawed in the ways in which they dehumanize people if they don't fit within a certain mold or succeed in a certain way.

input: Kí ló dé tí mo yàn láti tà nígbà tí mò ń wo wàhálà bó ṣe ń ṣẹlẹ̀ níwájú mi
target: So why did I choose to sell out while watching tragedies unfold right in front of me

input: Ní báyìí, ó gbàmí lásíkò púpọ̀ láti ṣe àdéhùn pẹ̀lú ìpinnu mi.
target: Now, it took me a long time to come to terms with my decisions.

input: Mo ní láti dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ àwọn ènìyàn tí wọ́n ń ṣe agbátẹrù Etò Ẹ̀kọ́ Òfẹ́ Hispanic, tàbí HSF, fún ìfọwọ́sí ìgbésẹ̀ yìí láti ìbẹ̀rẹ̀.
target: And I really have to thank the people running the Hispanic Scholarship Fund, or HSF, for validating this process early on.

input: Àti ọ̀nà tí HSF -- àjọ kan tó ń tiraka láti ran àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ lọ́wọ́ láti ṣe àṣeyọrí ilé-ẹ̀kọ́ gíga nípasẹ̀ ìgbani nímọ́ràn àti ètò ẹ̀kọ́ ọ̀fẹ́ -- ọ̀nà tí wọ́n ti gbà láti ṣe ìsilẹ̀ ààbalẹ̀-ọkàn, pẹ̀lú sísọ nǹkan tó tó jọ ọ́ gidi gan-gan.
target: And the way that HSF -- an organization that strives to help students achieve higher education through mentorship and scholarships -- the way that they helped calm my anxiety, it was by telling me something super familiar.

input: Nǹkan tí ẹ lérò pé ẹ ti gbọ́ tẹ́lẹ̀ ní ìṣẹ̀jú díẹ̀ àkọ́kọ́ lẹ́yìn tí ẹ ti wọ ọkọ̀ òfuurufú.
target: Something that you all probably have heard before in the first few minutes after boarding a flight.

input: Fún ìṣẹ̀lẹ pàjáwírì, ẹ kọ́kọ́ wọ ìbòjú èémí-àmísínú yin ná kí ẹ tó máa ran àwọn tí wọ́n rọkiriká yín lọ́wọ́.
target: In case of an emergency, put your oxygen mask on first before helping those around you.

input: Báyìí ó yémi pé èyí túmọ̀ sí oríṣiríṣi nǹkan sí oríṣiríṣi ènìyàn.
target: Now I understand that this means different things to different people.

input: Ṣùgbọ́n fún èmi, ó túmọ̀ sí wí pé àwọn aṣíkiri ò lè wọn ò sì ní yẹ nínú ìtàn Kankan láyéláye, nítorí ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ wa kọ̀ ń bá afẹ́fẹ́ rìn ni, à sì ń gbìyànjú láti yè.
target: But for me, it meant that immigrants couldn't and would never be able to fit into any one narrative, because most of us are actually just traveling along a spectrum, trying to survive.

input: Ṣùgbọ́n ọ̀nà tí gbogbo àgbáyé ń gbàá rí àwọn aṣíkiri, ó ń ṣàkóbá púpọ̀ ju àwọn ìtàn tí wọ́n ń gbé nínú rẹ̀ lọ.
target: But the ways in which the world sees immigrants, it affects more than just the narratives in which they live.

input: Ó tún nípa lára ọ̀nà tí òfin àti àwọn ètò lè sàkóbá fún àwọn àwùjọ, àwọn ẹbí àti àwọn ènìyàn.
target: It also impacts the ways laws and systems can affect communities, families and individuals.

input: Mo mọ eléyìí tààrà, nítorí àwọn òfin àti ètò wọ̀nyí, ó dáa, wọ́n máa ń tú ẹbí ká, wọ́n sì mú kí àwọn òbí mi padà sí orílẹ̀-ède Mexico.
target: I know this firsthand, because these laws and systems, well, they broke up my family, and they led my parents to return to Mexico.

input: Ní ọmọ odún mẹ́ẹ̀dógún, èmi àti àbúrò mi ọkùnrin ọmọ ọdún mẹ́jọ, a bárawa ní àwa nìkan láaìsí ìtọ́sọ́nà tí àwọn òbi wa máa ń fún wa ní gbogbo ìgbà.
target: And at 15, my eight-year-old brother and I, we found ourselves alone and without the guidance that our parents had always provided us with.

input: Pẹ̀lú pé a jẹ́ ọmọ ilẹ̀ America, àwa méjééjì dàbi ẹni tó rí ìjákulẹ̀ pẹ̀lú nǹkan ti a ti mọ̀ tẹ́lẹ̀ pé ilẹ̀ àǹfààní ni.
target: Despite being American citizens, we both felt defeated by what we had always known to be the land of opportunity.

input: Ní báyìí, ní ọ̀sẹ̀ tó tẹ̀lé èyí tí àwọn òbí mi padà sí orílẹ̀-ède Mexico, nígbà tí ó hàn kedere pé wọn ò nílè padà wá, mo ní láti máa wo bí àbúrò mi ọmọ ọdún mẹ́jọ ṣe kúrò nílé-ẹ̀kọ́ kó lè wà pẹ̀lú ẹbí rẹ̀.
target: Now, in the weeks that followed my parents' return to Mexico, when it became clear that they wouldn't be able to come back, I had to watch as my eight-year-old brother was pulled out of school to be with his family.

input: Ní àsìkò yìí kan náà, mò ń rò ó bóyá pípadà yóò ṣe àtìlẹyìn fún ìfarajìn àwọn òbí mi.
target: And during this same time, I wondered if going back would be validating my parents' sacrifices.

input: Mo ṣáà yí àwọn òbí mi lọ́kàn padà pé kí wọ́n jẹ́ kí n dúró, láìlè fún wọn ní ìdánilójú pé màá rí ibìkan láti gbé tàbí pé màá wà lálàáfíà.
target: And so I somehow convinced my parents to let me stay, without being able to guarantee them that I'd find somewhere to live or that I'd be OK.

input: Ṣùgbọ́n di òní, mi ò ní gbàgbe bó ṣe le tó láti sọ pé ó dábọ̀ láyéláyé.
target: But to this day, I will never forget how hard it was having to say goodbye.

input: Mi ò sì ní gbàgbe bó ṣe le tó láti máa wo àbúrò mi bó ṣe ń yọ́bọ́rọ́ lọ́wọ́ wọn bí mo ṣe ń juwọ́ síwọn láti ẹ̀gbé kejì ilẹ̀kùn onírin.
target: And I will never forget how hard it was watching my little brother crumble in their arms as I waved goodbye from the other side of steel grates.

input: Ní báyìí, kò ní mópọlọ dání láti gbóríyìn fún àfojúsùn gẹ́gẹ́ bi èrèdí kan ṣoṣo tí mo fi ṣàmúlò ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àǹfààní láti ọjọ́ náà.
target: Now, it would be naive to credit grit as the sole reason for why I've been able to take advantage of so many opportunities since that day.

input: Mò ń sọ nípa pé, mo lórí lọ́wọ́ ni, mo sì fẹ́ kí ẹ mọ̀ bẹ́ẹ̀.
target: I mean, I was really lucky, and I want you to know that.

input: Nítorí ká sọ̀rọ̀ pẹ̀lú ìṣirò, àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ tí ò nílé tàbí tí wọ́n gbé ìgbeayé tí ò ṣe déédéé, ó dáa, wọn kìí fi bẹ́ẹ̀ figa-gbága ní ilé-ẹ̀kọ́ gíga.
target: Because statistically speaking, students that are homeless or that have unstable living conditions, well, they rarely complete high school.

input: Ṣùgbọ́n mo máa ń rò ó wí pé nítorí àwọn òbí mi nígbàgbọ́ láti fimí sílẹ̀ ló jẹ́ kín nígboyà àti agbára láti ṣàmúlò àǹfààní kódà nígbà tí kò dámilójú tàbi pé mi ò peregedé.
target: But I do think that it was because my parents had the trust in letting me go that I somehow found the courage and strength to take on opportunities even when I felt unsure or unqualified.

input: Ní báyìí, a ò lè parọ́ pé kò sí ẹ̀jẹ́ fún gbígbé ìgbeayé àla ilẹ̀ America.
target: Now, there's no denying that there is a cost to living the American dream.

input: Ẹ ò nílò láti jẹ́ aṣíkiri tàbí ọmọ aṣíkiri láti mọ ìyẹn.
target: You do not have to be an immigrant or the child of immigrants to know that.

input: Ṣùgbọ́n mo mọ ìyẹn báyìí, mò ń gbé nǹkan tó súnmọ́ nǹkan tí àwọn òbí mi rí gẹ́gẹ́ bi àla America wọn.
target: But I do know that now, today, I am living something close to what my parents saw as their American dream.

input: Nítorí bí mo ṣe ń kẹ́kọ̀ọ́ jáde ní ilé-ẹ̀kọ́, mo gbé àbúrò mi wá sí orílẹ̀-ède United States láti gbé pẹ̀lú mi, kí ohun náà, bákan náà, lè ṣiṣẹ́ tọ ẹ̀kọ rẹ̀.
target: Because as soon as I graduated from college, I flew my younger brother to the United States to live with me, so that he, too, could pursue his education.

input: Síbẹ̀, mo mọ̀ wí pé gbígbé àbúrò mi padà wá máa le.
target: Still, I knew that it would be hard flying my little brother back.

input: Mo mọ̀ wí pé yóò le láti ṣe ìdọ́gba àwọn ìbéèrè àti ìwa-akọ́ṣẹ́mọṣẹ́ tí wọ́n ń retí látọ̀dọ onísẹ́ ipele-ìwọlé àti ṣíṣẹ̀tọ́ fún ọmọ kan tó ní àlá àti ìpinnu tirẹ̀.
target: I knew that it would be hard having to balance the demands and professionalism required of an entry-level job while being responsible for a child with dreams and ambitions of his own.

input: Ṣùgbọ́n tí ẹ bá lè ronú bóṣe dùn tó láti jẹ́ ọmọ ọdún mẹ́rìn-lé-lógún, tí mo wa ní òpin ìjẹ́ ọ̀dọ́ mi, tí mò ń gbé ní New York, pẹ̀lú alájọgbé tó ń bẹ lábẹ́ ogún ọdún oníbẹ́rù tó kórìra abọ́ fífọ̀.
target: But you can imagine how fun it is to be 24 years old, at the peak of my youth, living in New York, with an angsty teenage roommate who hates doing the dishes.

input: Ṣùgbọ́n nígbà tí mo rí àbúrò mi tó ń kẹ́kọ̀ọ́ láti jẹ́ agbenusọ fún ara rẹ̀, nígbà ti mo ri pé inú rẹ̀ ń dùn nípa kílásì rẹ̀ àti ilé-ẹ̀kọ́ rẹ̀, mi ò ṣeyèméjì kankan.
target: But when I see my brother learning how to advocate for himself, and when I see him get excited about his classes and school, I do not doubt anything.

input: Torí mo mọ̀ pé ìgbeayé tó yátọ̀, tó rewà tó sì jẹ́ àǹfààní tí mò ń gbé lọ́wọ́ yìí ni ìdí tóòtọ́ tí mo fi pinnu láti ṣiṣẹ́ tọ iṣẹ́ kan tí yóò bá èmi àti ẹbí mi wá owó geere.
target: Because I know that this bizarre, beautiful and privileged life that I now live is the true reason for why I decided to pursue a career that would help me and my family find financial stability.

input: Mi ò mọ̀ nígbà náà, ṣùgbọ́n láàárín odún mẹ́jọ tí mo fi gbé láìsí ẹbi mi yẹn, mo wọ ìbòjú èémí-amísínú mi mo sì gbájúmọ́ ìmóríbọ́.
target: I did not know it back then, but during those eight years that I lived without my family, I had my oxygen mask on and I focused on survival.

input: Láàárín ọdún mẹ́jọ yẹn, mo ní láti máa wo ìnira àti ọgbé tó fà fún ẹbí mi láti pínyà láìlè ṣe nǹkankan.
target: And during those same eight years, I had to watch helplessly the pain and hurt that it caused my family to be apart.

input: Nǹkan tí àwọn ọkọ̀-òfuurufú ò ní sọ fún yín ni wí pé wíwọ ìbòjú èémí-amísínú yín lákọ̀kọ́ nígbà tí ẹ bá ń wo àwọn tí wọ́n rọkiriká yín tí wọ́n ń tiraka -- ó gba ìgboyà.
target: What airlines don't tell you is that putting your oxygen mask on first while seeing those around you struggle -- it takes a lot of courage.

input: Ṣùgbọ́n kí ènìyán lè ní ìmáradúró nígbà mìíràn ni ọ̀nà kan ṣoṣo tí a lè fi ran àwọn tí wọ́n rọkiriká wa lọ́wọ́.
target: But being able to have that self-control is sometimes the only way that we are able to help those around us.

input: Ní báyìí orí mi sọre pé mo wà ní àyè kan ti mo lè ṣe ìrànlọ́wọ́ fún àbúrò mi kó lè ní ìgboyà kó si gbaradì láti kojú ohun-kóhun tó bá yàn láti ṣe léyìn ẹ̀.
target: Now I'm super lucky to be in a place where I can be there for my little brother so that he feels confident and prepared to take on whatever he chooses to do next.

input: Ṣùgbọ́n mo tún mọ̀ wí pé mo wà nípò àǹfààní yìí, mo sì tún ní ojúṣe láti ríi dájú pé àwùjọ mi rí àyè níbi ti wọ́n ti lè rí ìtọ́sọ́nà, àǹfààní àti ìrànlọ́wọ́.
target: But I also know that because I am in this position of privilege, I also have the responsibility to make sure that my community finds spaces where they can find guidance, access and support.

input: Mi ò lè sọ wí pé mo mọ ibi tí ìkọ̀ọ̀kan nínú yín wà nínú ìrìnàjo yín nínú ayé, ṣùgbọ́n mo mọ̀ wí pé àgbáyé wa jẹ́ èyí tí yóò dàgbàsókè nigbà tí oríṣiríṣi ohùn bá parapọ̀.
target: I can't claim to know where each and every one of you are on your journey through life, but I do know that our world is one that flourishes when different voices come together.

input: Ìrètí mi ni wí pé ẹ máa rí ìgboyà láti wọ ìbòjú èémí-amísínú yín nígbà tí ẹ bá nílò rẹ̀, pé ẹ ó sì rí agbára láti ran àwọn tó wà láyìká yín lọ́wọ́ tí ẹ bá lè ṣe bẹ́ẹ̀.
target: My hope is that you will find the courage to put your oxygen mask on when you need to, and that you will find the strength to help those around you when you can.

input: Irìnàjo afẹ́ sí ilé-ìwòsàn ní orílẹ̀-ède Nigeria.
target: A hospital tour in Nigeria

input: Mo kẹ́kọ̀ọ́ jáde ní ilé-ẹ̀kọ́ mẹ́wàá Cleveland, Ohio, ọdún 1975
target: I graduated high school in Cleveland, Ohio, 1975.

input: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí àwọn òbí mi ṣe ṣe nígbà tí wọ́n parí ẹ̀kọ́ nílẹ̀-òkèèrè, a padà sílé.
target: And just like my parents did when they finished studying abroad, we went back home.

input: Mo parí ẹ̀kọ fásitì, mo gba oyè àkọ̀kọ́ nínú ìmọ̀-ìṣègùn, ọdún 1986.
target: Finished university education, got a medical degree, 1986.

input: Nígbà tí mo máa fi di akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ nídìí iṣẹ́, tipátipá ni mo fi lè ṣàmójútó ọkọ̀ ọlọ́dún mẹ́tàlá ìyá mi -- mo sì jẹ́ oníṣègùn-òyìnbó tó ń gbowó.
target: And by the time I was an intern house officer, I could barely afford to maintain my mother's 13-year-old car -- and I was a paid doctor.

input: Èyí l’ó mú wa dé ìdí tí ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ wa, tí a jẹ́ akọ́ṣẹ́mọṣẹ́, ní báyìí, gẹ́gẹ́ bí wọ́n ṣe sọ, wà nílẹ̀ òkèèrè
target: This brings us to why a lot of us, who are professionals, are now, as they say, in diaspora.

input: Ní báyìí, ṣé a ó sọ ìyẹn di nǹkan aláìyípadà ni, níbi tí wọ́n ti kọ́ wa, a sì kúrò, a ò sì padà
target: Now, are we going to make that a permanent thing, where we all get trained, and we leave, and we don't go back

input: Bóyá bẹ́ẹ̀kọ́, kí n lérò wí pé kò rí bẹ́ẹ̀ -- nítorí kì í ṣe ìran tèmi nìyẹn.
target: Perhaps not, I should certainly hope not -- because that is not my vision.

input: Ó dára, fún òdiwọ̀n tó dára, ibi tí orílẹ̀-ède Nigeria wà lórí àwòran ilẹ̀ Adúláwọ̀ nìyẹn, níbẹ̀ yẹn ni agbègbe Delta tó dámilójú pé gbogbo wa lati gbọ́ nípa rẹ̀.
target: All right, for good measure, that's where Nigeria is on the African map, and just there is the Delta region that I'm sure everybody's heard of.

input: Wọ́n ń jí àwọn ènìyàn gbé, níbi tí epo ti ń wá, epo tó ṣe wí pé nígbà mìíràn mo rò wí pé ó ti sínwa níwín.
target: People getting kidnapped, where the oil comes from, the oil that sometimes I think has driven us all crazy in Nigeria.

input: Ṣùgbọ́n, òṣì alágbáìdàndán àsúnsí yìí jẹ́ ti ìdánilẹ́kọ̀ọ́ kan tí mo ṣe ní kòpẹ́ yìí.
target: But,this slide is from a presentation I gave not that long ago.

input: org ń sọ ìtàn nípa àlàfo tó wà láàárín ilẹ̀ Adúláwọ̀ àti àwọn tókù lágbàyé nípa ìtọ́jú ìlera.
target: org tells the story of the gap between Africa and the rest of the world in terms of health care.

input: Ènìyàn mélòó lẹ lérò pé ó wà nínú kabúkabú yẹn
target: How many people do you think are on that taxi

input: Ẹ gbà á gbọ́ tàbí bẹ́ẹ̀ kọ́, ọkọ̀-akérò kan nìyẹn lórílẹ̀-ède Nigeria.
target: And believe it or not, that is a taxi in Nigeria.

input: Olú ìlú náà -- ó dáa, ibi tó jẹ́ olú-ìlu orílẹ̀-ède Nigeria tẹ́lẹ̀ -- Èkó, kabúkabú kan nìyẹn, ọlọ́pàá sì wà nínú wọn.
target: And the capital -- well, what used to be the capital of Nigeria -- Lagos, that's a taxi, and you have police on them.

input: Torí náà, ẹ sọ fún mi, ọlọ́pàá mélòó lẹ lérò pé ó wà nínú kabúkabú yìí
target: So, tell me, how many policemen do you think are on this taxi

input: Báyìí ńkọ́
target: And now

input: Nítorí náà, nígbà tí irú àwọn ènìyàn báyìí -- àti, ẹ gbà mí gbọ́, kì í ṣe ọlọ́pàá nìkan ni wọ́n ń lo àwọn kabúkabú wọ̀nyí ní Èkó.
target: So, when these kind of people -- and, believe me, it's not just the police that use these taxis in Lagos.

input: Gbogbo wa ni.
target: We all do.

input: Mo ti wà nínú ọ̀kan nínú àwọn wọ̀nyí rí, mi ò sì ní akoto, bákan náà.
target: I've been on one of these, and I didn't have a helmet, either.

input: Ó sì ránmi léti nípa èrò nǹkan tó sẹlẹ̀ nígbà tí ọ̀kan nínú wa lórí ọkọ̀-akérò bí èyí jábọ́, ó ní ìjàmbá ó sì nílò ilé ìwòsàn.
target: And it just reminds me of the thought of what happens when one of us on a taxi like this falls off, has an accident and needs a hospital.

input: Ẹ gbà á gbọ́ tàbí bẹ́ẹ̀ kọ́, àwọn kan nínú wa máa ń móríbọ́.
target: Believe it or not, some of us do survive.

input: Ní ìgbà àti àkókò yìí, gbogbo wa ni atẹ̀wétà, a sì ní ojúṣe.
target: In this day and age, we're all publishers, and we have responsibility.

input: Nínú iṣẹ́ mi gẹ́gẹ́ bi akọ̀ròyìn, mo máa ń ṣáyẹ̀wò, mo máa ń ṣe ìfesẹ̀múlẹ̀.
target: In my job as a journalist, I check, I verify.

input: Mo jẹ́ri ìgboyà mi, ṣùgbọ́n mo béére àwọn ìbéèrè alágbára.
target: I trust my gut, but I ask tough questions.

input: Kíló dé tí ẹni yìí ń sọ ìtàn yìí fún mi
target: Why is this person telling me this story

input: Kíni wọ́n fẹ́ jẹ lérè pẹ̀lú ṣíṣe àtagbà ìfitónilétí yìí
target: What do they have to gain by sharing this information

input: Ṣé ẹ ní ipinnu Kankan tí ẹ fi ń pamọ́
target: Do they have a hidden agenda

input: Mo nígbàgbọ́ gidi gan-an wí pé a gbogbo wá gbọ́dọ̀ bẹ̀rẹ̀ síni béérè ìbéèrè alágbára nípa àwọn ìfitóniléti tí a bá ṣàwárí rẹ̀ lórí òpo ayélukára.
target: I really believe that we must all start to ask tougher questions of information that we discover online.

input: Ìwádìí fi hàn pé àwọn kan nínú wa ò kí ń kà ju àkòrí lọ kí a tó ṣe àtagbà awọn ìròyìn.
target: Research shows that some of us don't even read beyond headlines before we share stories.

input: Ta ni ẹni náà níbí tó ti ṣe ìyẹn
target: Who here has done that

input: Mo mọ̀ mo ti ṣe é.
target: I know I have.

input: Ṣùgbọ́n tí a bá jáwọ́ mínú àwọn ìfitóniléti tí a ṣàwárí pẹ̀lú ìṣojúlọ́yìn ńkọ́
target: But what if we stopped taking information that we discover at face value

input: Bí a bá dúró láti ronú nípa ìpadàbọ àwọn ìfitónilétí tí à ń tì síwájú àti ìkápá rẹ̀ láti fa rògbòdìyàn tàbí ọ̀tá ńkọ́
target: What if we stop to think about the consequence of the information that we pass on and its potential to incite violence or hatred

input: Bí a bá dúró láti ronú nípa àwọn ìpadàbọ ojú aye àwọn afitóni tí à ń ṣe àtagbà rẹ̀ ńkọ́
target: What if we stop to think about the real-life consequences of the information that we share

input: Ẹ ṣeun gidi gan-an fún ìtẹ́tíi yín.
target: Thank you very much for listening.

input: Bí a ṣe lè dèna ìgbọ́ngbẹ ọpọlọ ìmọ-ìjìnlẹ̀ nílẹ̀ Adúláwò.
target: How we can stop Africa's scientific brain drain

input: Ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ nínú wa tó nífẹ̀ sí ìdàgbàsókè alálòpẹ́ àti ìgbáyégbádùn àwọn enìyàn ìgbèríko ń ṣe é fún àǹfààní ara ẹni ni.
target: So many of us who care about sustainable development and the livelihood of local people do so for deeply personal reasons.

input: Mo dàgbà ní orílẹ̀-ède Cameroon, orílẹ̀-èdè tó kún fún ẹwà àti oríṣiríṣi ojúlówó àṣà, ṣùgbọ́n tó ń ṣàìsàn pẹ̀lú ìṣèjọba tí ò da, bíba àwùjọ jẹ́, àti òṣì.
target: I grew up in Cameroon, a country of enchanting beauty and rich biodiversity, but plagued by poor governance, environmental destruction, and poverty.

input: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí ọmọde, bí a ṣe ń rí pẹ̀lú ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ọmọ ní ìwò oòrun ilẹ̀ adúláwò lónì, mo máa ń ní iba ní gbogbo ìgbà.
target: As a child, like we see with most children in sub-Saharan Africa today, I regularly suffered from malaria.

input: Títí di òní, ó lé ní àádọ́ta-ọ̀kẹ́ kan àwọn ènìyàn tí wọ́n ń kú látara ibà lọ́dọọdún, pàápàá jùlọ àwọn ọmọdé lábẹ́ ọdún márùn-ún, tí ìdá àádọ́rùn sì ń ṣẹlẹ̀ ní ìwọ̀ oòrun ilẹ̀ Adúláwọ̀
target: To this day, more than one million people die from malaria every year, mostly children under the age of five, with 90 percent occurring in sub-Saharan Africa.

input: Nígbà tí mo wà lọ́mọ ọdún méjì-dín lógún, mo fi orílẹ̀-ède Cameroon sílẹ̀ léni tó ń wá àǹfààní ètò-ẹ̀kọ́ tó dára.
target: When I was 18, I left Cameroon in search of better educational opportunities.

input: Ní àsìkò náà, fásitì kan ṣoṣo ló wà ní Cameroon níbẹ̀, Sùgbọ́n orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà tí ó jẹ́ amúlétì wọn fún àwon ọmò Kamẹrúùnù tí wọn gbọ́ ède gẹ̀ẹ́sì ní ànfàní láti gba orísìrísì ìdánilẹ́ẹ̀kọ́
target: At the time, there was just one university in Cameroon, but Nigeria next door offered some opportunities for Cameroonians of English extraction to be trained in various fields.

input: Ṣùgbọ́n ṣíṣe òwò mi, lẹ́yìn tí mo kẹ́kọ̀ọ́ jáde gẹ́gẹ́ bí onímọ̀ nípa ọjọ̀ ní orílẹ̀-ède Nigeria, tún jẹ́ ìdojúkọ tó tún tóbi.
target: So I moved there, but practicing my trade, upon graduation as an ecologist in Nigeria, was an even bigger challenge.

input: Nítorí náà mo fi ẹkùn náà sílẹ̀ nígba tí wọ́n fún mi ní ẹ̀kọ́ ọ̀fẹ́ sí Fásitì Boston fún oyè ọ̀mọ̀wé mi.
target: So I left the continent when I was offered a scholarship to Boston University for my PhD.

input: Ó sì ti fi hàn pé fún gbogbo ọmọ ilẹ̀ Adúláwọ̀ tó ní ìmọ̀ọ́ṣe tó padà sílé, iṣẹ́ tuntun mẹ́sàn yóò di dídásílẹ̀ ní ẹ̀ka gbẹ̀fẹ́ àti àìgẹ̀fẹ́.
target: And it has been shown that for every skilled African that returns home, nine new jobs are created in the formal and informal sectors.

input: À ń lo ọnà ìmúṣe oríṣiríṣi ẹ̀ka láti ṣàfihan bí àwọn fásitì, àjọ tí kìí ṣe ti ìjọba àti àwọn òwò aládàni lè ní àjọṣepọ̀ nínú ìdàgbàsókè ilẹ̀-òkèèrè.
target: We are using our interdisciplinary approach to show how universities, NGOs and private business can partner in international development.

input: Dípò gbígbé àwọn òjìnì láti ọ̀dọ̀ awọn aláwọ̀ funfun fún ìgbà díẹ̀, à ń pèse ìdúró aláìyípadà nílẹ̀ Adúláwọ̀, ìsọ̀ kan ṣoṣo fún ohun-èlò, ilé-ìgbé àti ìdàgbàsókè àwọn iṣẹ́-àkànṣe alájọṣepọ̀ láàárín àwọn ọmọ ilẹ̀ Adúláwọ̀ àti àwọn oníṣẹ́ ìwádìí ilẹ̀ òkèèrè.
target: So instead of parachuting in experts from the West for short stays, we are building a permanent presence in Africa, a one-stop shop for logistics, housing and development of collaborative projects between Africans and international researchers.

input: Èyí ti jẹ́ kí àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ ó gba ojúlówó ẹ̀kọ́ nílẹ̀ Adúláwọ̀.
target: So this has allowed students like Michel to receive high-quality training in Africa.

input: Michel ń ṣiṣẹ́ lọ́wọ́lọ́wọ́ ní àyè fún ìmọ̀-ìjìnlẹ wa láti ṣe ìwádìí àkóbá àyípadà ojú-ọjọ́ lára kòkòrò, fún oyè ọ̀mọ̀we rẹ̀, ó sì ti gba ìwé-ẹ̀rí oyè ọ̀mọ̀we rẹ̀ tí yóò fun ní àǹfààní láti dúró sí ẹkùn náà.
target: Michel is currently working in our labs to investigate the effects of climate change on insects, for his PhD, and has already secured his post-doctorate fellowship that will enable him to stay on the continent.

input: Lóòótọ́, Gbenga ń ṣe àwòṣe tí wọn yóò lò gẹ́gẹ́ bi ètò ìkìlọ̀ ìpìlẹ̀ láti sọ àsọtẹ́lẹ̀ àkóràn ibà nílẹ̀ Adúláwọ̀.
target: Indeed, Gbenga is currently developing models that will be used as an early warning system to predict malaria transmission in Africa.

input: Dípò ka máa gbé àwọn tó dára àtí àwọ́n ọlọpọlọ wa kúrò nílẹ̀ Adúláwọ̀, à ń rè a sì ń ṣe àtìlẹ́yìn ẹ̀bùn abẹ́lé nílẹ̀ Adúláwọ̀.
target: So rather than exporting our best and brightest out of Africa, we are nurturing and supporting local talent in Africa.

input: Fún àpẹẹrẹ, bí èmi náà, orílẹ̀-ède US ni Ọ̀mọ̀wé Eric Fokan ti gba ìkọ́ni.
target: For example, like me, Dr.Eric Fokam was trained in the US.

input: Ó padà sílé ní Cameroon, ṣùgbọ́n kò rí owó ìrànwọ́ tó ṣe pàtàkì gbà, ó sì ríi gẹ́gẹ́ bi ìdojúkọ tó lágbára láti ṣe àti láti mọ ìmọ̀-ìjìnlẹ̀ tó mọ̀ pé òún lè ṣe.
target: He returned home to Cameroon, but couldn't secure the necessary grants, and he found it incredibly challenging to practice and learn the science he knew he could.

input: Nígbà tí mo pàde Eric, ó ń múra láti padà sí orílẹ̀-ède US ni.
target: So when I met Eric, he was on the verge of returning to the US.

input: Ṣùgbọ́n a yí ọkàn rẹ̀ padà láti bẹ̀rẹ àjọṣepọ̀ pẹ̀lú ilé-ẹ̀kọ́ Congo Basin.
target: But we convinced him to start collaborating with the Congo Basin Institute.

input: Dípò kí a gba èro kí ilẹ̀ Adúláwọ̀ máa gba owó ìrànwọ́, à ń lo ònà ìmúṣe oríṣiríṣi-ẹ̀ka láti ró àwọn ọmọ ilẹ̀ Adúláwọ̀ lágbára láti wá ọ̀nà àbáyọ tiwọn.
target: So rather than buy into the ideas of Africa taking handouts, we are using our interdisciplinary approach to empower Africans to find their own solutions.

input: Lásíkò yìí, à ń ṣiṣẹ́ pẹ̀lú àwọn àwùjọ àti àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́, oníṣòwò US kan, àwọn onímọ̀-ìjìnlẹ̀ láti orílẹ̀-ède US àti ilẹ̀ Adúláwọ̀ láti wá ọ̀nà láti gbin kanran alálòpẹ́, akọni igi-líle nílẹ̀ Adúláwọ̀.
target: Right now, we are working with local communities and students, a US entrepreneur, scientists from the US and Africa to find a way to sustainably grow ebony, the iconic African hardwood.

input: Àwọn kanran, bíi ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àwọn igi-líle ilẹ̀ Adúláwọ, ni wọ́n ń lò fún gẹdú, ṣùgbọ́n díẹ̀ la mọ̀ nípa àjọṣepọ̀ wọn, nǹkan tó ń pín wọn ká, bí wọ́n ṣe ń yè nínú igbó wa fún ọgọ́rin sí igba ọdún.
target: Ebonies, like most African hardwood, are exploited for timber, but we know very little about their ecology, what disperses them, how they survive in our forest 80 to 200 years.

input: Arvin rè é, ọdọ́mọdé akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ oyè ọ̀mọ̀wé t’ó ń ṣiṣẹ́ ní yàrá ìṣèwádìí ọgbọ́n-ìjìlẹ̀ wa, tó ń ṣe nǹkan tó ti di iṣẹ́ àṣà pádi-ààyè tó ń léwájú báyìí.
target: This is Arvin, a young PhD student working in our labs, conducting what is turning out to be some cutting-edge tissue culture work.

input: Igi kanran àkọ́kọ́ tí wọ́n ṣẹ̀dá látara pádi-ààyè ni Arvin mú lọ́wọ́ yìí.
target: Arvin is holding in her hands the first ebony tree that was produced entirely from tissues.

input: Ilẹ̀ Adúláwọ̀ nìkan l’ó ní èyí.
target: This is unique in Africa.

input: A wá lè ṣe àfihàn pé ẹ lè hu àwọn igi gẹdú ilẹ̀ Adúláwọ̀ látara pádi-ààyè oríṣiríṣi nǹkan ọ̀gbìn -- ewé, ìtí, gbòngbò -- ní àfikún sí ìdásílẹ̀ wọn látara èso, èyí tó jẹ́ iṣẹ́ t’ó le gidi gan-an.
target: We can now show that you can produce African timber from different plant tissues -- leaves, stems, roots -- in addition from generating them from seeds, which is a very difficult task.

input: Lónìí à ń gbin ẹgbẹ̀rún 15 igi kanran ní orílẹ̀-ède Cameroon, fún ìgbà àkọ́kọ́, wọn ò ní kórè igi kanran láti àárín gbùngbun igbó.
target: Today we are planting 15,000 ebony trees in Cameroon, and for the first time, ebony won't be harvested from the middle of a pristine forest.

input: Àwòṣe fún àwọn igi-líle ilẹ̀ Adúláwọ̀ wa rè é, a sì ń fa èyí lọ títí láti ṣàfikún igi gẹdú sápẹ́lẹ́ àti igi bubíńga, àwọn igi-líle mìíràn t’ó lówó lórí gidi gan-an.
target: This is the model for our African hardwoods, and we are extending this to include sapele and bubinga, other highly prized hardwoods.

input: Bí àwọn àpẹẹrẹ wọ̀nyí bá ti wà nígbà tí mo wà lọ́mọdún méjì-dín-lógún, mi ò ní kúrò rárá, ṣùgbọ́n nítorí ọgbọ́n àtinúdá ilé-ẹ̀kọ Agbègbè-adágúndò Congo, mò ń padà bọ̀, ṣùgbọ́n mi ò ní padà wá lémi nìkan.
target: So if these examples existed when I was 18, I would never have left, but because of initiatives by the Congo Basin Institute, I am coming back, but I'm not coming back alone.

input: Mò ń kó àwọn onímọ̀-ìjìnlẹ̀ ènìyàn Aláwọ̀-funfun, àwọn olókòwò kékèèké àti àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́, àwọn ìmọ̀-ìjìnlẹ̀ t’ó dára jù lo láti àwọn fásitì t’ó dárajù lágbàyé bọ̀ pẹ̀lú mi, láti ṣiṣẹ́ àti gbé nílẹ̀ Adúláwọ̀.
target: I'm bringing with me Western scientists, entrepreneurs and students, the best science from the best universities in the world, to work and to live in Africa.

input: Ṣùgbọ́n gbogbo wá nílò láti ṣe àfikún ọ̀nà-ìgbésẹ̀ agbègbè, alágbára àti arónilágbára yìí.
target: But we all need to scale up this local, powerful and empowering approach.

input: Di àsìkò yìí a ti ní àwọn fásitì àti àwọn ilé-iṣẹ́-tí-kìí-ṣe-ti-ìjọba mẹ́fà gẹ́gẹ́ bí alájọṣe.
target: So far we have half a dozen universities and NGOs as partners.

input: À ń gbèrò láti kọ́ àwọn ilé tí yóò dẹ́kun ipa búburú àyípadà ojú ọjọ́ tí yóò fẹ àwọn ilé ìṣèwádìí ọgbọ́n ìjìnlẹ̀ wa lójú tí yóò sì ṣe àfikún àwọn ilé-gbèé àti ohun-èlò àpérò láti ṣe ìgbédìde ọ̀nà-ìmúṣe ìbáwí ọlọ́jọ́ pípẹ́.
target: We are planning to build a green facility that will expand on our existing laboratory space and add more housing and conference facilities to promote a long-term disciplinary approach.

input: Mo fẹ́ kó fún àwọn ọ̀dọ́ ọmọwé nílẹ̀ Adúláwọ̀ ní àǹfààní sí i, yóó sì ṣe ìgbéfúkẹ́ rẹ̀ sí i nípa títẹpẹlẹ mọ́ àǹfààní ìsopọ̀ àwọn ilé-iṣẹ́ ìwádìí 17 ti Ilé-ẹ̀kọ́ Ilẹ̀-òkèèrè ti Iṣẹ́-Àgbẹ̀ Agbègbè Ìgbóná-Oòrùn t’ó ti wà tẹ́lẹ̀ káàkiri Gúúsù-aṣálẹ̀ ilẹ̀ Adúláwọ̀.
target: I want it to offer more opportunities to young African scholars, and would scale it up by leveraging the International Institute of Tropical Agriculture's existing network of 17 research stations across sub-Saharan Africa.

input: Àwọn ìyípadà rere náà ti ń dé mo sì lérò pé wọn yóò tẹ̀síwájú, kí ó dé ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn orílẹ̀-èdè Ilẹ̀-adúláwọ̀ bi Côte d'Ivoire, Tanzania àti Senegal, lára àwọn tí ìdágbàsókè ètò ọrọ̀-ajé wọ́n wà lókè ténté t’ó lè ṣe ìgbàmọ́ra àǹfààní tó pọ̀ fún ìdókòwò ẹ̀ka-aládàni.
target: The tables are starting to turn and I hope they keep turning, to reach several African nations like Côte d'Ivoire, Tanzania and Senegal, among the top fastest growing economies that can attract several opportunities for private-sector investment.

input: Ní 50 ọdún sí àsìkò yìí, mo lérò wí pé ẹnìkan yóò ṣe àgbékalẹ̀ Ọ̀rọ̀ sísọ TED nípa ìfimọ ìgbọ́ngbẹ ọpọlọ ẹ̀yin ènìyàn Aláwọ̀-funfun tí ẹ̀ ń fi ilé yín sílẹ̀ láti lọ ṣiṣẹ́ àti gbé ní Ilẹ̀-Adúláwọ̀.
target: And in 50 years, I hope someone will be giving a TED Talk on how to stop the brain drain of Westerners leaving your homes to work and live in Africa.

input: Àwọn Àpéjọ Tá A Ṣe Ní Orílẹ̀-Èdè Àǹgólà Ní Ibùdó Àwọn Tó Ń Wá Ibi Ìsádi Ní Èdè Lingala àti Tshiluba
target: Assemblies Held in Angola Refugee Camp in Lingala and Tshiluba Languages

input: Ní May 25 àti 26, 2019, a ṣé àpéjọ àyíká Jẹ́ Alágbára ní èdè Lingala àti Tshiluba ní ibùdó àwọn tó ń wà ibi ìsádi to wà nílùú Lóvua.
target: On May 25 and 26, 2019, the Be Strong circuit assembly program in the Lingala and Tshiluba languages was held within the Lóvua refugee camp.

input: Ibùdó yìí fi kìlómítà ẹgbẹ̀rún kan àti méjìlélógún 1,022 jìn sí Luanda, tó jẹ́ olú ìlú Àǹgólà.
target: This camp is 1,022 kilometers 635 mi from Angola’s capital, Luanda.

input: Nígbà tá a ṣe àpéjọ yẹn, akéde ọgọ́rùn-ún kan àti mẹ́tàdínlọ́gọ́rin 177 tó fi mọ́ àwọn ìdílé wọn ló wà ní ibùdó Lóvua.
target: At the time of the program, there were 177 publishers and their families living in the Lóvua camp.

input: Síbẹ̀, ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́ta àti ọgọ́rin 380 èèyàn ló gbádùn àpéjọ tá a ṣe ní èdè Lingala, àwọn mẹ́ta sì ṣe ìrìbọmi, nígbà tó jẹ́ pé ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́fà àti ọgbọ̀n 630 èèyàn ló gbádùn ìtòlẹ́sẹẹsẹ tá a ṣe ní èdè Tshiluba, àwọn mẹ́fà sì ṣe ìrìbọmi.
target: Yet, some 380 people attended the Lingala-language program with 3 baptized, and 630 people attended the Tshiluba-language program with 6 baptized.

input: Ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn ará wa tó sá wá sí Lóvua ṣe bẹ́ẹ̀ torí ìwà ipá tí ò mú kí ìlú fara rọ ní orílẹ̀-èdè Kóńgò.
target: Most of the brothers who fled to Lóvua did so because of violent unrest in the Democratic Republic of the Congo.

input: Àwọn ará wa tó wà ní Lóvua ò lè lọ́ sí àwọn ìlú míì láti ṣe ìpàdé, torí wọ́n fòfin de àwọn tó wà ní ibùdó láti rìnrìn àjò.
target: Our brothers in Lóvua are unable to attend spiritual events in other cities, due to camp travel restrictions.

input: Torí náà, ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì ṣètò pé kí wọ́n ṣe àpéjọ yẹn nínú ibùdó náà, wọ́n sì tún kọ́ Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba méjì tó ṣe é lò fúngbà díẹ̀.
target: Therefore, the branch arranged to hold the assemblies within the camp and also constructed two temporary Kingdom Halls.

input: Ìjọ mẹ́rin ló ń lo Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba méjèèjì yìí, mẹ́ta ní èdè Tshiluba àti ọ̀kan ní èdè Lingala
target: These Kingdom Halls accommodate four congregations—three Tshiluba and one Lingala.

input: Ní May 24, 2019, alábòójútó àyíká àti aṣojú láti ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì rìnrìn àjò lọ sí ibùdó Lóvua kí wọ́n lè rí i pé pèpéle àti ẹ̀rọ tá a fi ń gbóhùn sáfẹ́fẹ́ wà létòlétò.
target: On May 24, 2019, the circuit overseer and a branch representative traveled to the Lóvua camp to help set up the sound and stage equipment.

input: Láìka àwọn ìpèníjà tí àwọn ara wa tó wà ni ibùdó àwọn tó ń wà ibi ìsádi ń kojú sí, síbẹ̀ wọ́n fi àwọn nǹkan bíi tapólì, òpó, okùn, ìṣó àtàwọn ohun èlò míì tí wọ́n nílò ṣètìlẹ́yìn.
target: Despite our brothers’ challenges as refugees, they contributed tarpaulins, poles, rope, nails, and other needed materials.
