input: Torí pé àwọn ọ̀dọ́ ni eré ìdárayá náà wà fún, àwọn ará lo ìwé Awọn Ìbéèrè Tí Awọn Ọ̀dọ́ Ń Béèrè​—Awọn Ìdáhùn Tí Ó Gbéṣẹ́ apá méjèèjì àti ìwé pẹlẹbẹ Ìdáhùn Àwọn Ìbéèrè 10 Táwọn Ọ̀dọ́ Ń Béèrè.
target: Since the event is oriented to young people, the brothers featured the Questions Young People Ask—Answers That Work volumes and the brochure Answers to 10 Questions Young People Ask.

input: Àwọn ìwé náà wà níbẹ̀ lóríṣiríṣi èdè, irú bíi Lárúbáwá, Chinese, Gẹ̀ẹ́sì, Faransé, German, Korean, Potogí, Russian, Sípáníìṣì àti Èdè Àwọn Adití Lọ́nà ti Ajẹntínà.Nǹkan bí ọgọ́rùn-ún méje ó lé àádọ́rùn-ún 790 ìtẹ̀jáde làwọn èèyàn ń gbà lójoojúmọ́ lásìkò eré ìdárayá náà.
target: Literature was available in multiple languages, including Arabic, Chinese, English, French, German, Korean, Portuguese, Russian, Spanish, and Argentinean Sign Language.An average of 790 publications were distributed every day of the campaign.

input: Inú àwọn ará tó kópa nínú iṣẹ́ ìwàásù náà dùn gan-an láti sọ ìrètí tó wà nínú Bíbélì fún tọmọdé tàgbà.—Sáàmù 1103.
target: The brothers and sisters who participated in the campaign were happy to share the Bible’s hope with young and old alike.—Psalm 1103.

input: Orílẹ̀-èdè Argentina ni wọ́n bí Arábìnrin Cecilia Alvarez sí.
target: Sister Cecilia Alvarez, from Argentina, has dealt with severe health problems her entire life.

input: Ó sì ti kojú ọ̀pọ̀ ìṣòro àìlera tó le gan-an.
target: Her first procedure was when she was only 16 days old.

input: Kò ju ọmọ ọjọ́ mẹ́rìndínlógún 16 lọ nígbà tó ṣe iṣẹ́ abẹ àkọ́kọ́.Ní May 18, 1994, àwọn dókítà ní orílẹ̀-èdè Argentina ṣiṣẹ́ abẹ láti ṣàtúnṣe sí àléébù kan tó wà lórí ọ̀pá ẹ̀yìn àti awọ fẹ́lẹ́ tó bo egungun ẹ̀yìn rẹ̀.
target: On May 18, 1994, doctors in Argentina repaired birth defects on her spine and spinal membranes.

input: Ní báyìí, Cecilia ti pé ẹni ọdún mẹ́ẹ̀ẹ́dọ́gbọ̀n 25, ó ti ṣe iṣẹ́ abẹ mẹ́tàlélógójì 43, ọ̀pọ̀ nínú rẹ̀ ló sì jẹ́ nígbà tó wà lọ́mọdé.
target: Since that day 25 years ago, Cecilia has endured a remarkable 42 additional surgeries, the majority of which were when she was a child.

input: Ó tiẹ̀ ṣe iṣẹ́ abẹ kan láìpẹ́ yìí níbi tí wọ́n ti ṣàtúnṣe egungun ìbàdí apá òsì rẹ̀.
target: The most recent procedure was earlier this year to repair her left hip.

input: Bíi tàwọn iṣẹ́ abẹ míì tó ti ṣe tẹ́lẹ̀, wọ́n ṣe èyí náà láṣeyọrí láì fa ẹ̀jẹ̀ sí i lára.
target: Like all of her prior surgeries, this one was successfully performed without a blood transfusion.

input: Cecilia nígbà tó wà lọ́mọ ọdún márùn-ún ní ilé ìwòsàn àwọn ọmọdé, ìyẹn Juan P.Garrahan Children’s Hospital
target: Five-year-old Cecilia at Juan P.Garrahan Children’s Hospital

input: Cecilia sọ pé Ọ̀pọ̀ iṣẹ́ abẹ tí mo ti ṣe sẹ́yìn àtàwọn ìtọ́jú tí mo ti gbà tán mi lókun gan-an.
target: It has been very stressful to have my body exposed to so many surgeries and treatments.

input: Àmọ́, ọkàn ẹ̀ balẹ̀, ó sì gbára lé Jèhófà.
target: However, she has tried to remain positive and has relied on Jehovah.

input: Pẹ̀lú ìrànlọ́wọ́ àwọn òbí rẹ̀, ó ń sapá láti ṣe àwọn ohun tí àwọn dókítà bá sọ pé kó ṣe.
target: Additionally, she, along with the support of her parents, has made every effort to listen to the doctors’ recommendations.

input: Cecilia sọ pé Ohun kan tí mo máa ń fọwọ́ pàtàkì mú ni pé, mó máa ń múra sílẹ̀ fún iṣẹ́ abẹ.
target: To prepare my body in advance for surgery was a key point, states Cecilia.

input: Ìyẹn gba pé kí n lo àwọn oògùn ẹ̀jẹ̀, kí n sì jẹ àwọn oúnjẹ tí á mú kí sẹ́ẹ̀lì pupa inú ẹ̀jẹ̀ pọ̀ sí i.
target: This included taking iron, folic acid, erythropoietin treatment, and a diet with plenty of iron-rich foods, which increased red blood cell production.

input: Dókítà Ernesto Bersusky, ẹni tó ti fẹ̀yìn tì lẹ́nu iṣẹ́ ìṣègùn egungun ẹ̀yìn tó lábùkù
target: Dr.Ernesto Bersusky, retired spinal pathologist

input: Àwọn onímọ̀ ìṣègùn tó tọ́jú Cecilia bọ̀wọ̀ fún òun àtàwọn ará tó ràn án lọ́wọ́.
target: The clinicians that worked with Cecilia have expressed a mutual respect for her and the brothers who assisted her.

input: Mo ti bá a sọ̀rọ̀ láìmọye ìgbà, tí màá sì ṣàlàyé àwọn ohun tí mo fẹ́ ṣe, ìyẹn nìkan kọ́, máà tún fi í lọ́kàn balẹ̀ pé a ò ní fàjẹ̀ sí i lára.
target: I spoke with her many times, explaining what I was going to do and reassuring her that no blood transfusion would be administered.

input: Dókítà Susana Ciruzzi, agbẹjọ́rò àti onímọ̀ nípa ìlànà ìwà híhù nílé ìwòsàn
target: Dr.Susana Ciruzzi, lawyer and bioethicist

input: Dókítà Susana Ciruzzi, tó jẹ́ agbẹjọ́rò àti ọkàn lára ìgbìmọ̀ tó ń rí sí ìwà tó yẹ káwọn oníṣègùn máà hù ní ilé ìwòsàn ọmọdé tó ń jẹ́ Juan P.Garrahan Children’s Hospital sọ pé Ìfọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ tó wà láàárín àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà àtàwọn onímọ̀ ìṣègùn kì í ṣe kékeré.
target: Dr.Susana Ciruzzi, a lawyer and member of the bioethics committee at Juan P.Garrahan Children’There has been a coordinated effort between Jehovah’s Witnesses and the medical community.

input: A ti ṣiṣẹ́ pọ̀ pẹ̀lú àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà, a sì ti fi ara wa jìn láti yí èrò, ọgbọ́n àti ìmọ̀ ìjìnlẹ̀ pa dà, nípa bẹ́ẹ̀, èyí ti jẹ́ ká ṣàwárí àwọn ìtọ́jú míì téèyàn lè yàn dípò fífa ẹ̀jẹ̀ síni lára.
target: We have worked together with Jehovah’s Witnesses and have committed ourselves to evolve—not only our minds but also our techniques and scientific knowledge—thus developing alternative methods to blood transfusion.

input: Láìka pé àwọn arákùnrin yìí ní ìdílé tiwọn àtàwọn nǹkan míì tí wọ́n ń bójú tó sí, síbẹ̀ wọ́n ló okun àti àkókò wọn, torí kò sígbà tá a nílò wọn tí wọ́n sọ pé ó sú àwọn rí, mo mọyì wọn gan-an.
target: Their self-sacrificing and unconditional availability, despite having family and other responsibilities, is a priceless treasure.

input: July 2019 Cecilia wà lóde ẹ̀rí pẹ̀lú aṣáájú ọ̀nà ẹlẹgbẹ́ rẹ̀
target: July 2019 Cecilia in the ministry with a fellow pioneer sister

input: Kò sígbà tí mi ò kì í rántí àwọn ọ̀rọ̀ yìí.
target: That text has stuck forever in my mind and heart.

input: Ní May 1, 2019, Arábìnrin Cecilia rí ìbùkún àrà ọ̀tọ̀ kan gbà nígbà tí ètò Ọlọ́run fọwọ́ sí i pé kó di aṣáájú-ọ̀nà déédéé.
target: On May 1, 2019, our sister Cecilia received a very special blessing when she was appointed to serve as a regular pioneer.

input: Ó hàn kedere pé, Jèhófà ti tu arábìnrin wa ọ̀wọ́n yìí nínú, ó sì tún fún un lókun.
target: Clearly, Jehovah has comforted and strengthened our dear sister.

input: Nípa bẹ́ẹ̀, òun náà ń fi tayọ̀tayọ̀ sọ̀rọ̀ ìtùnú tó wà nínú Ọ̀rọ̀ Ọlọ́run fún àwọn ẹlòmíì.
target: As a result, she, in turn, joyfully shares the comforting message of God’s Word with others.

input: A nígbàgbọ́ pé bí Jèhófà ṣe tú Cecilia nínú, bẹ́ẹ̀ náà láá máa tu gbogbo wa nínú láìka onírúurú ìpọ́njú tó lè dé bá wa sí.​—2 Kọ́ríńtì 14.
target: We trust Jehovah will continue to comfort all of us in our various trials just as he has done for Cecilia.—2 Corinthians 14.

input: Ilẹ̀ tó ya ní ìlú La Paz lórílẹ̀-èdè Bolivia ba nǹkan jẹ́ gan-an lágbègbè San Jorge Kantutani ní April 30, 2019.
target: A landslide destroyed a large part of the San Jorge Kantutani neighborhood of La Paz, Bolivia, on April 30, 2019.

input: Ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ èèyàn ló ní láti kúrò níbi tí wọ́n ń gbé.
target: Hundreds of people were displaced.

input: Bó tiẹ̀ jẹ́ pé kò sí ìkankan lára àwọn ará wa tí àjálù yìí pa tàbí tó ṣe léṣe, ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa ní Bolivia sọ pé ó ba ilé méjì tó jẹ́ tàwọn ará wa jẹ́ pátápátá.
target: While none of our brothers died or were injured, the Bolivia branch reports that two of our brothers’ homes were completely destroyed in the landslide.

input: Bákan náà, ìdílé mọ́kànlá 11 àwọn ará wa ló ń gbé lágbègbè tọ́rọ̀ yìí ti ṣẹlẹ̀, àmọ́ kò fi bẹ́ẹ̀ sí nǹkan kan tó ṣe àwọn ilé wọn.
target: Additionally, 11 other Witness families live in the affected area, but their homes sustained little or no damage.

input: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì ṣètò Ìgbìmọ̀ Tó Ń Ṣètò Ìrànwọ́ Nígbà Àjálù, ìgbìmọ̀ yìí pẹ̀lú àwọn alábòójútó àyíká àtàwọn alàgbà tó wà lágbègbè náà ń fáwọn ará níṣìírí, wọ́n sì ń pèsè àwọn ohun tí wọ́n nílò.
target: Under the direction of the branch office, the Disaster Relief Committee, circuit overseers, and local elders are providing spiritual and practical support.

input: Àwọn ará tó wà lágbègbè yìí wà lójúfò gan-an, torí ó ṣeé ṣe kí ilẹ̀ tún ya níbẹ̀ tí òjò míì bá rọ̀.
target: The brothers in the affected areas remain alert to the continued threat of landslides if there is more rainfall.

input: A dúpẹ́ pé àwọn ará wa ò fara pa, wọ́n sì ti ń rí ìrànlọ́wọ́ tí wọ́n nílò.—Gálátíà 610.
target: We are thankful that our brothers were not injured and are receiving the assistance they need.—Galatians 610.

input: Déètì July 12 sí 14, 2019
Ibi Tá A Ti Ṣe É São Paulo Expo ní São Paulo, Brazil
target: São Paulo Expo in São Paulo, Brazil

input: Èdè Èdè Adití ti Brazil, Gẹ̀ẹ́sì, Faransé, Italian, Potogí, Sípáníìṣì
target: Brazilian Sign Language, English, French, Italian, Portuguese, Spanish

input: Áwọn Ẹ̀ka Ọ́fíísì Tó Wá Àǹgólà, Ajẹntínà, Belgium, Czech-Slovak, Faransé, Ítálì, Mòsáńbíìkì, Pọ́túgà, Scandinavia, Suriname, Trinidad and Tobago, Amẹ́ríkà, Fẹnẹsúélà
target: Angola, Argentina, Belgium, Czech-Slovak, France, Italy, Mozambique, Portugal, Scandinavia, Suriname, Trinidad and Tobago, United States, Venezuela

input: Jálẹ̀ ọdún ni wọ́n sì máa ń wá, àmọ́ tiyín yàtọ̀, mi ò tíì ráwọn tó pọ̀, síbẹ̀ tí wọ́n lọ́yàyà, tí wọ́n sì wà létòlétò bíi tiyín rí.
target: We receive tourists year-round, but I have never seen such a large, warm, and organized group.

input: Ẹ mà nífẹ̀ẹ́ ara yín ò Ó hàn nínú bẹ́ ẹ ṣe ń gbáni mọ́ra, bẹ́ ẹ ṣe ń ṣe síra yín àti nínú àwọn orin yín.
target: You have a lot of love to give We can see the love you show in the hugs, in the affection, and in the songs.

input: Láti January 18, 2020 ni àrọ̀ọ̀rọ̀dá òjò ti ń rọ̀ ní ìpínlẹ̀ Espírito Santo àti Minas Gerais lórílẹ̀-èdè Brazil, ìyẹn sì fa àkúnya omi tó lágbára gan-an.
target: Since January 18, 2020, the Brazilian states of Espírito Santo and Minas Gerais have been experiencing an extraordinary amount of rainfall, which has caused destructive flooding.

input: Omi tó ń ya wọnú ìlú ba ọ̀pọ̀ ilé jẹ́, ó gbé ọ̀pọ̀ ọkọ̀ lọ, ó sì hú àwọn igi dà nù.
target: The floodwaters rushing through the streets have damaged homes, swept away cars, and uprooted trees.

input: Àwọn aláṣẹ sọ pé, ẹgbẹẹgbẹ̀rún èèyàn ló ti sá fi ilé wọn sílẹ̀, ó sì ju ọgọ́ta 60 èèyàn tó ti pàdánù ẹ̀mí wọn.
target: According to authorities, thousands have had to evacuate their homes and more than 60 people have died.

input: Nílùú Iconha àti Alfredo Chaves, àkúnya omi náà ba ilé àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà mẹ́sàn-án jẹ́, àwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin mẹ́tàdínlọ́gbọ̀n 27 ló sì ń gbébẹ̀.
target: In the towns of Iconha and Alfredo Chaves, the flooding damaged nine homes of Jehovah’s Witnesses, affecting 27 of our brothers and sisters.

input: Inú wá dùn pé kò sí ará wa kankan tó fara pa tàbí tó kú nínú ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ náà.
target: Thankfully, none of our fellow worshippers were injured or killed.

input: Nǹkan bí ọgọ́rùn-ún 100 èèyàn tí wọ́n jẹ́ Ẹlẹ́rìí láti agbègbè yẹn ló yọ̀ǹda ara wọn kí wọ́n lè ṣèrànwọ́ fáwọn ará tí àkúnya omi náà ba ilé wọn jẹ́.
target: Some 100 Witnesses from the region volunteered to assist the brothers affected by the flooding.

input: Àwọn alàgbà bójú tó bí wọ́n ṣe pín oúnjẹ, omi àti aṣọ táwọn ará fi ṣètìlẹ́yìn.
target: Under the supervision of the elders, brothers donated food, water, and clothing.

input: Yàtọ̀ síyẹn, àwọn ará tún ilé àwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin wọn ṣe, títí kan ilé àwọn aládùúgbò tí kì í ṣe Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà.
target: They also helped to clean and remove mud from the homes of both our brothers and their non-Witness neighbors.

input: Kò sí ará wa kankan tó fara pa tàbí tó kú nínú ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ náà.
target: None of our brothers and sisters were injured or killed.

input: Àmọ́, Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba márùn-ún ló bà jẹ́, ó sì fẹ́rẹ̀ẹ́ tó àádọ́ta 50 ìdílé Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà tó sá kúrò nílé wọn.
target: However, five Kingdom Halls were damaged and about 50 Witness families had to evacuate their homes.

input: Àkúnya omi náà ká àwọn ará wa kan mọ́ débi pé ọkọ ojú omi ni wọ́n fi gbé wọn láti àjà kejì ilé wọn.
target: Some brothers were trapped by the rising floodwaters and had to be rescued by boat from the second floor of their homes.

input: Gbogbo àwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin tí àkúnya omi náà ba ilé wọn jẹ́ ni àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà míì gbà sílé.
target: All of the evacuated brothers and sisters were accommodated by fellow Jehovah’s Witnesses.

input: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì yan Ìgbìmọ̀ Tó Ń Ṣètò Ìrànwọ́ Nígbà Àjálù ní ìpínlẹ̀ Espírito Santo àti Minas Gerais, ìgbìmọ̀ yìí ló ń ṣètò bí wọ́n ṣe máa pèsè ìrànwọ́ fáwọn tí àjálù náà bá.
target: Disaster Relief Committees have been appointed in both Espírito Santo and Minas Gerais to coordinate the relief work.

input: Ìgbìmọ̀ Tó Ń Ṣètò Ìrànwọ́ Nígbà Àjálù láwọn ìpínlẹ̀ yìí máa ṣiṣẹ́ pẹ̀lú àwọn alábòójútó àyíká àtàwọn alàgbà láti pèsè ohun táwọn ará tí àjálù náà bá nílò nípa tara, kí wọ́n sì fi Bíbélì tù wọ́n nínú.
target: The Disaster Relief Committees are working with circuit overseers and local elders to care for the physical and spiritual needs of the affected publishers.

input: A ò ní jẹ́ kó sú wa láti máa gbàdúrà fáwọn ará tí àkúnya omi náà fìyà jẹ.
target: We continue to pray for our brothers affected by the flooding.

input: A dúpẹ́ pé Jèhófà ń lo ẹgbẹ́ ará wa láti fún wọn lókun, láti tù wọ́n nínú àti láti máa pèsè àwọn ohun tí wọ́n nílò.​—Sáàmù 287.
target: We thank Jehovah for giving them strength, comfort, and practical help through our Christian brotherhood.—Psalm 287.

input: Ní Friday, January 25, 2019, ibi tó ń gba omi dúró fáwọn tó ń wa kùsà ya lulẹ̀ ní ìlú Brumadinho, ìpínlẹ̀ Minas Gerais, lórílẹ̀-èdè Brazil, ó sì mú kí àbàtà tó pọ̀ gan-an ya wọ̀lú.
target: On Friday, January 25, 2019, a mining dam collapsed in the city of Brumadinho, located in the state of Minas Gerais, Brazil, causing a deadly mudslide.

input: Ó kéré tán àádọ́jọ 150 èèyàn ló kú, àwọn méjìlélọ́gọ́sàn-án 182 míì sì wà tí wọ́n ṣì ń wá títí di báyìí.
target: At least 150 people were killed, and an additional 182 people are still missing.

input: Ìjọ méjì ló wà ní ìlú Brumadinho, àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí tó wà níbẹ̀ ń lọ sí bí ọgọ́sàn-án 180, ilé iṣẹ́ tó ń wa kùsà náà sì ni púpọ̀ wọn ti ń ṣiṣẹ́.
target: There are two congregations in Brumadinho, with about 180 Witnesses, many of whom work for the mining company.

input: Àwọn arákùnrin mẹ́wàá ló ń ṣiṣẹ́ níbi tó ń gba omi dúró náà nígbà tó ya lulẹ̀.
target: Ten brothers were working at the dam when it ruptured.

input: Mẹ́sàn-án lára wọn ò fara pa, àmọ́ ó dùn wá pé a ò tíì rí ẹnì kan tó kù tó jẹ́ alàgbà títí di báyìí.
target: While nine are confirmed unharmed, sadly, one brother, who serves as an elder, is still missing.

input: Yàtọ̀ síyẹn, ìdílé márùn-ún ó kéré tán ló ní láti kúrò ní ilé wọn, kódà ńṣe ni ọ̀kan lára àwọn ilé náà bà jẹ́ pátápátá.
target: Additionally, at least five Witness families had to evacuate their homes and one home was completely destroyed.

input: Ọ̀kan lára Ìgbìmọ̀ Ẹ̀ka ní Brazil àtàwọn alábòójútó àyíká tó wà lágbègbè náà lọ wo àwọn tí ọ̀rọ̀ yìí ṣẹlẹ̀ sí, kí wọ́n lè fún wọn níṣìírí nípa tẹ̀mí, kí wọ́n sì pèsè ohun tí wọ́n nílò.
target: A member of the Brazil Branch Committee and circuit overseers in the region have visited those affected by the tragedy to encourage them spiritually and offer practical assistance.

input: Àdúrà wa ni pé kí Baba wa ọ̀run tu àwọn tí àjálù yìí kan nínú kó sì pèsè ohun tí wọ́n nílò fún wọn.—Róòmù 155.
target: We pray that our heavenly Father will continue to supply the needed comfort and support to all those affected by this tragedy.—Romans 155.

input: Láàárọ̀ kùtù December 18, iná sọ nínú ìlú Manaus lórílẹ̀-èdè Brazil, ó sì ba ó kéré tán ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́fà 600 ilé jẹ́.
target: In the early morning of December 18, a fire blazed through the city of Manaus, Brazil, destroying at least 600 homes.

input: Bó tiẹ̀ jẹ́ pé a ò gbọ́ pé iná náà pa ẹnì kankan, àwọn mẹ́rin fara pa, ó sì lé ní ẹgbẹ̀rún méjì 2,000 èèyàn tó ní láti kúrò níbi tí wọ́n ń gbé.
target: Although there were no reported fatalities, 4 people were injured and more than 2,000 were displaced.

input: Ìròyìn tá a gbọ́ láti ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa ní Brazil fi hàn pé kò sí ìkankan lára àwọn ará tí iná náà pa tàbí tó ṣe léṣe.
target: The Brazil branch reports that no brothers or sisters were killed or injured by the fire.

input: Àmọ́, ilé mẹ́wàá tó jẹ́ tàwọn ará wa ló bà jẹ́, ìyẹn sì mú kí akéde méjìdínlógún 18 pẹ̀lú àwọn mọ̀lẹ́bí wọn tí kì í ṣe Ẹlẹ́rìí kúrò níbi tí wọ́n ń gbé.
target: However, 10 of our brothers’ homes were destroyed, resulting in the displacement of 18 publishers and their non-Witness relatives.

input: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì ti dá Ìgbìmọ̀ Tó Ń Ṣètò Ìrànwọ́ Nígbà Àjálù sílẹ̀ kí wọ́n lè pèsè ohun táwọn akéde tí ọ̀rọ̀ náà kàn nílò.
target: Under the direction of the branch, a Disaster Relief Committee is caring for the needs of the publishers who have been impacted.

input: Ó dá wa lójú pé àwọn ará wa tí ìjàǹbá iná yìí kàn ní Brazil kò ní jẹ́ kó sú wọn bí wọ́n ṣe ń gbẹ́kẹ̀ lé Jèhófà tó jẹ́ ‘ibi ààbò wa ní àkókò wàhálà.’—Sáàmù 99, 10.
target: We are confident that our brothers and sisters affected by this fire in Brazil will continue to trust in Jehovah, our secure refuge in times of distress.—Psalm 99, 10.

input: Ní May 31, 2018, Ilé Ẹjọ́ Gíga Jù Lọ ní ilẹ̀ Kánádà sọ ìpinnu tí wọ́n fẹnu kò sí pé wọ́n fàyè gba àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà pé a lè yọ ẹnì kan lẹ́gbẹ́ láìsí pé à ń gbàyè nílé ẹjọ́.
target: In a unanimous decision released on May 31, 2018, the Supreme Court of Canada recognized that the disfellowshipping arrangement should remain free from court intervention.

input: Inú wa dùn gan-an sí bí wọ́n ṣe dá àwọn ìlànà òdodo Jèhófà láre yìí.​—Aísáyà 3322.
target: We rejoice in this vindication of Jehovah’s righteous standards.—Isaiah 3322.

input: Ilé Ẹjọ́ Gíga Jù Lọ ti Kánádà àwòrán apá òsì ní Ottawa.
target: The Supreme Court of Canada building pictured left in Ottawa.

input: Kò sí agbára lọ́wọ́ ilé ẹjọ́, bẹ́ẹ̀ ni wọn ò láṣẹ láti ṣèpinnu lórí irú àwọn ọ̀rọ̀ báyìí tó jẹ mọ́ ọ̀rọ̀ ẹ̀sìn torí wọn ò mọ kúlẹ̀kúlẹ̀ nípa ohun tí wọ́n gbà gbọ́.
target: The courts have neither legitimacy nor institutional capacity to deal with contentious matters of religious doctrine.

input: Látilẹ̀, kò lè rọrùn rárá fún èyí tó pọ̀ lára àwọn tí wọ́n ń kọ́ lẹ́kọ̀ọ́ Bíbélì láti wá sí Ìrántí Ikú Kristi, ó tiẹ̀ lè má ṣeé ṣe rárá ni.
target: For most of the students, attending the Memorial in person would be a challenge, if not impossible.

input: Ìdí sì ni pé ìpínlẹ̀ ìwàásù ìjọ náà tóbí gan-an, ó bẹ̀rẹ̀ láti ìlú Kimmirut lọ sí ìyànníyàn ìlú Grise Fiord tó jẹ́ apá ibi tó jìnnà jù lọ ní apá àríwá orílẹ̀-èdè Kánádà.
target: They live in remote parts of the congregation’s territory, which spans some two million square kilometers 772,204 sq mi from Kimmirut to Grise Fiord—Canada’s northernmost community.

input: Ọdún yìí ni ìgbà àkọ́kọ́ táwọn tá à ń kọ́ lẹ́kọ̀ọ́ Bíbélì dara pọ̀ mọ́ wa láti ṣe Ìrántí Ikú Kristi.
target: This year, for the first time, we were able to have our Bible students join us for the Memorial program.

input: Ẹnì kan tá à ń kọ́ lẹ́kọ̀ọ́ Bíbélì ní agbègbè Grise Fiord pe àwọn mẹ́rin míì, bó ṣe di pé àwọn márùn-ún ló dara pọ̀ mọ́ wa láti ṣe Ìrántí Ikú Kristi, bó tiẹ̀ jẹ́ pé ọ̀nà wọn jìn gan-an sí wa.
target: One Bible student in Grise Fiord invited four others to tie in, so a total of five people at the very top of the world joined us for the Memorial, states Brother Isaac Demeester, an elder in the Iqaluit Congregation.

input: Bí nǹkan ṣe rí lásìkò tí àrùn COVID-19 gbòde yìí mú kí ọ̀pọ̀ lára àwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin tó wà ní ìjọ Iqaluit rí bó ti ṣe pàtàkì tó pé ká mọ onírúurú ọ̀nà tá tún lè gbà wàásù.
target: The unusual circumstances brought on by restrictions from the COVID-19 pandemic have helped many brothers and sisters in the Iqaluit Congregation to see the benefits of being adaptable.

input: Arábìnrin Kathy Burechailo sọ pé À ń pe àwọn èèyàn tó wà láwọn agbègbè oníyìnyìn ní ìlà òòruń orílẹ̀-èdè yìí lórí fóònù, a sì ń báwọn sọ̀rọ̀.
target: We reached out to people across the eastern Arctic by phone.

input: Inú mi dùn gan-an pé mo lè bá àwọn èèyàn tó wà làwọn ọ̀nà jíjìn yẹn sọ̀rọ̀ Jèhófà Ìdí sì ni pé wọn ò lè jáde nílé, wọ́n nílò ẹni tó máa tù wọ́n nínú.
target: I had some amazing calls with people in the remotest parts of our territory.People are at home and they need comfort.

input: Arábìnrin Laura McGregor sọ pé Nǹkan ò rọrùn rárá fún wa ní ìlú Iqaluit látìgbà tí oníkálùkù wa ti wà nílé nítorí àrùn tó gbòde yìí.
target: Being so isolated has been particularly stressful for us in Iqaluit as we cope with financial setbacks and uncertainties of this pandemic, states Sister Laura McGregor.

input: Kò sówó lọ́wọ́, ẹ̀rù sì tún ń bà ọ̀pọ̀ èèyàn torí pé wọn ò mọ ohun tó lè ṣẹlẹ̀ bọ́jọ́ ṣe ń gorí ọjọ́.
target: It was our first time making the Memorial bread for our family.

input: Ìgbà àkọ́kọ́ rèé tá a màá ṣe búrẹ́dì Ìrántí Ikú Kristi ní ìdílé wa.
target: We enjoyed a wonderful time together.

input: Àmọ́ a gbádùn bá a ṣe jọ wà pa pọ̀, ó jẹ́ ká túbọ̀ mọyì bí ètò Ìrántí Ikú Kristi ṣe rọrùn tó àti bí kò sì la ariwo lọ, a dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ Jèhófà pé ohun tá a nílò wà lárọ̀ọ́wọ́tó, kò sì ṣòro ṣe.
target: It helped us to appreciate more deeply how simple a ceremony it is, and what a blessing it was to have something so simple and accessible.

input: Arákùnrin Demeester fi kún un pé Òótọ́ ni pé àrùn COVID-19 yìí kò jẹ́ ká lè wà pa pọ̀ bá a ṣe máa ń ṣe látẹ̀yìn wá, síbẹ̀ ìyàlẹ́nu ló jẹ́ pé a túbọ̀ sún mọ́ra gan-an lásìkò Ìrántí Ikú Kristi yìí.
target: Although the COVID-19 outbreak has distanced us in many ways, it has been amazing to see how during this Memorial season our congregation has grown even closer.

input: Mánigbàgbé ni Ìrántí Ikú Kristi tọdún yìí jẹ́
target: This year’s Memorial has been life changing

input: Àwọn ará tó wà ní ìjọ Iqaluit nírètí pé àwọn náà máa ní Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba tiwọn láìpẹ́, tí ipò nǹkan bá ti yí pa dà sí rere.
target: The Iqaluit Congregation anticipates building their own Kingdom Hall in the near future, when circumstances allow.

input: Ní báyìí ná, ó dá wa lójú pé Jèhófà máa bù kún gbogbo ìsapá wọn láti rí i pé ìhìn rere Ìjọba Ọlọ́run dé àwọn ibi tó jìnnà jù lọ lápá àríwá orílẹ̀-èdè Kánádà, tó jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára ibi tó jìnnà jù lọ ní ayé ​—Ìṣe 18.
target: In the meantime, we know that Jehovah will bless their diligent efforts to bring the good news to the northernmost regions of Canada—one of the most distant parts of the earth —Acts 18.

input: Lórílẹ̀-èdè Kánádà, ẹgbẹẹgbẹ̀rún àwọn tó ń gbé ní agbègbè New Brunswick, Ontario, àti Quebec ni omíyalé ti lé kúrò nílé.
target: Thousands of people in the Canadian provinces of New Brunswick, Ontario, and Quebec have been displaced because of flooding.

input: Lágbègbè Quebec nìkan, nǹkan bí ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́sàn-án 9,000 èèyàn ló ní láti kó kúrò níbi tí wọ́n ń gbé.
target: In the province of Quebec alone, some 9,000 people have been evacuated from their homes.

input: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa ní Kánádà sọ pé ní Quebec, ilé mẹ́rìnlélógójì 44 àwọn ará wa ló bà jẹ́.
target: The Canada branch reports that in Quebec, a total of 44 of our brothers’ homes sustained damage.

input: Ní New Brunswick àti Ontario, a ò tíì gbọ́ pé ó ba nǹkan kan jẹ́, àmọ́ omíyalé náà kò tíì dáwọ́ dúró.
target: In New Brunswick and Ontario, no damage has been reported as yet but flooding continues.

input: Àwọn alábòójútó àyíká tó wà láwọn agbègbè tọ́rọ̀ kàn ń ṣiṣẹ́ pẹ̀lú àwọn alàgbà tó wà níbẹ̀ láti tu àwọn ará nínú.
target: The circuit overseers in the affected areas of Quebec are working with the local elders to shepherd the publishers.

input: Bákan náà, aṣojú kan láti ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì lọ ṣẹ̀bẹ̀wò sáwọn apá ibi tí omíyalé náà ti pọ̀ gan-an kó lè fún wọn níṣìírí nípa tẹ̀mí.
target: Additionally, a branch representative visited the worst-hit areas to provide spiritual support.

input: Ní agbègbè Beauce, àwọn ará ti palẹ̀ ìdọ̀tí àti àbàtà mọ́ kúrò nínú ogún 20 ilé tó jẹ́ tàwọn ará wa.
target: In the Beauce region, brothers and sisters have already completed the initial cleanup and removed mud from 20 flooded homes of our brothers.

input: Ìgbìmọ̀ Tó Ń Ṣètò Ìrànwọ́ Nígbà Àjálù ti bẹ̀rẹ̀ iṣẹ́ ní Sainte-Marthe-sur-le-Lac, wọ́n ń ran àwọn tí ilé wọn bà jẹ́ lọ́wọ́.
target: A Disaster Relief Committee was set up in Sainte-Marthe-sur-le-Lac to assist those whose homes were damaged.

input: Àdúrà wa ni pé kí àwọn ará wa tí àjálù yìí kàn má ṣe dẹ́kun láti gbẹ́kẹ̀ lé Jèhófà, ẹni tó jẹ́ ‘okun àti agbára wọn.’—Ẹ́kísódù 152.
target: We pray that our brothers who have been impacted by the recent flooding will continue to trust in Jehovah, who is ‘their strength and their might.’—Exodus 152.

input: Arákùnrin Jean-Yves Mudaheranwa àti ìyàwó rẹ̀ tó ń jẹ́ Vasthie wà lára àwọn oníṣègùn tó ń bójú tó àwọn tó ní àrùn Corona nílùú Montreal lórílẹ̀-èdè Kánádà.
target: Brother Jean-Yves and his wife, Vasthie Mudaheranwa, are on the front lines of the coronavirus pandemic in Montreal, Canada.

input: Arákùnrin Mudaheranwa jẹ́ dókítà tó ń tọ́jú àwọn tó níṣòro èémí, ọ̀kan lára ilé ìwòsàn tó wà nílùú Montreal ló sì ti ń ṣiṣẹ́, ní ti ìyàwó rẹ̀, nọ́ọ̀sì ni, ọ̀kan lára ibi tí wọ́n ti ń tọ́jú àwọn tó ní àrùn COVID-19 lòun ti ń ṣiṣẹ́ ní tiẹ̀.
target: Brother Mudaheranwa is a respiratory therapist at a community hospital, and Sister Mudaheranwa works as a nurse at a designated COVID-19 treatment center.

input: Ẹ̀yìn náà mọ bí àrùn yìí ṣe ń mú káwọn èèyàn kọ́kàn sókè, àmọ́ ọ̀kan tọkọtaya yìí balẹ̀ torí pé Jèhófà ń fún wọn lókun, ó sì ń mú kí ayọ̀ kún inú ọkàn wọn bó ti ṣèlérí nínú Bíbélì Ọ̀rọ̀ rẹ̀.​—Àìsáyà 6514.
target: During this time of great emotional tension, they are drawing strength from Jehovah and benefiting from the good condition of the heart Jehovah promised.—Isaiah 6514.

input: Arákùnrin Mudaheranwa sọ pé Ńṣe lẹ̀rù ń bá àwọn tá a jọ ń ṣiṣẹ́, bóyá ni mo rí kí wọ́n bẹ̀rù bẹ́ẹ̀ rí.
target: Many of my colleagues seem really scared, like I’ve never seen before, Brother Mudaheranwa says.

input: Àdúrà tún wà lára ohun tó fi wá lọ́kàn balẹ̀.
target: Prayer plays a big part too.

input: Kí n tó kúrò nílé lọ síbi iṣẹ́, mo kọ́kọ́ máa ń gbàdúrà, ìyẹn sì máa ń jẹ́ kára tù mí pẹ̀sẹ̀.
target: Before I go to work and start my day, I pray and I have peace.

input: Arákùnrin àti arábìnrin Mudaheranwa dara pọ̀ mọ́ àwọn ará yòókù nípàdé látorí ẹ̀rọ
target: The Mudaheranwas participate in a congregation meeting

input: Arákùnrin Mudaheranwa sọ pé Orílẹ̀-èdè Rùwáńdà ni mo ti wá, ojú mi sì rí màbo nígbà ogun kan tí wọ́n ti fẹ́rẹ̀ẹ́ pa odindi ẹ̀yà kan run.
target: I’m from Rwanda, and I lived through the genocide, Brother Mudaheranwa explains.

input: Lórílẹ̀-èdè Kánádà tá a wà yìí, kò sóhun tó jọ bẹ́ẹ̀, téèyàn ò bá sì ṣọ́ra èèyàn lè má rántí pé ọjọ́ ìkẹyìn la wà yìí.
target: In Canada, we have never had anything like that, so sometimes we can forget that we are living in the last days.

input: Kí n sòótọ́, kì í ṣe ìgbà gbogbo ni mo máa ń rántí pé ọjọ́ Jèhófà ti sún mọ́lé.Àmọ́, àrùn tó gbòde yìí ti mú kó túbọ̀ dá mi lójú pé ọjọ́ ìkẹyìn la wà yìí.
target: I have to admit, that even for me, the day of Jehovah wasn’t always as close in mind as it should be.

input: Yàtọ̀ síyẹn, ó ti mú kí n túbọ̀ mọyì Bíbélì, ó sì ti mú kí n túbọ̀ gbà gbọ́ pé kò sí àsọtẹ́lẹ̀ Bíbélì kan tó máa lọ láìṣẹ.
target: The pandemic has strengthened my conviction that we are living in the last days, and it has strengthened my faith in the Bible and in the Bible’s prophecies.

input: Ojú tí Arákùnrin àti Arábìnrin Mudaheranwa fi wo ohun tó ń ṣẹlẹ̀ làwọn èèyàn Jèhófà níbi gbogbo láyé náà fi ń wò ó, ìyẹn sì mú kí ọkàn gbogbo wọn balẹ̀ láìka àrùn COVID-19 tó gbayé kan sí.​—Àìsáyà 4818.
target: Brother and Sister Mudaheranwa’s conviction is being echoed around the world as Jehovah’s people continue to have peace during this crisis.—Isaiah 4818.

input: Déètì July 19-21, 2019
Ibi Tí A Ti Ṣe É Exhibition Place, Toronto, Ontario, Canada
target: Exhibition Place, Toronto, Ontario, Canada

input: Èdè Gẹ̀ẹ́sì, Potogí, Sípáníìṣì
target: English, Portuguese, Spanish

input: Àwọn Ẹ̀ka Ọ́fíísì Tá A Pè Amẹ́ríkà, Brazil, Britain, Central America, Finland, India, Japan, Korea, Philippines, Ukraine
target: Brazil, Britain, Central America, Finland, India, Japan, Korea, Philippines, Ukraine, United States

input: Ìrírí Laura Purdy tó jẹ́ ọ̀gá àgbà ní ẹ̀ka tó ń pawó wọlé tó sì ń bójú tó ayẹyẹ ní gbọ̀ngàn tá a lò sọ pé Gbogbo ohun tí ìgbìmọ̀ àpéjọ àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà sọ pé àwọn máa ṣe nínú gbọ̀ngàn yìí láti buyì kún un ni wọ́n ṣe pátá.
target: Everything that the Jehovah’s Witnesses’ convention committee talked about as to what they would bring to the venue—the level of service they would bring to the venue—has come true, stated Laura Purdy, general manager of sales and events at Exhibition Place.

input: A ṣe ìwádìí díẹ̀ fúnra wa nípa àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà, a sì bá àwọn olùdarí àwọn gbọ̀ngàn ayẹyẹ tí wọn ti lò rí fún àpéjọ wọn sọ̀rọ̀.Irú ìrírí kan náà tá a ní pẹ̀lú wọn báyìí làwọn náà ní.
target: We did a little bit of research on our own and spoke to other venues that the convention had been at, and in fact, they had the same experience we are having now.

input: Ms.Purdy tún sọ pé Àpéjọ náà gbádùn mọ́ni ó sì tuni lára.
target: Ms.The environment has been warm and welcoming.

input: Tọkàntọkàn ni màá fi gba àwọn míì tó ń bójú tó ibi ayẹyẹ bí irú èyí níyànjú láti gba àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà tọwọ́tẹsẹ̀ sí ìlú wọn kí wọn lè ṣe àpéjọ wọn níbẹ̀.
target: I would highly encourage any other venue organizer to welcome the JW convention to their city.

input: Ìwé ẹ̀rí tí àjọ Paulo Freire Educational Center fi mọyì ẹ̀kọ́ Bíbélì tá à ń ṣe ní ọgbà ẹ̀wọ̀n tó wà ní ìlú Valledupar.
target: The certificate from the Paulo Freire Educational Center recognizing the benefits of the Bible education classes held in the Valledupar prison facility.

input: Ó ti lé ní ogun 20 ọdún báyìí táwọn ará wa ti ń kọ́ àwọn ẹlẹ́wọ̀n lẹ́kọ̀ọ́ Bíbélì lọ́fẹ̀ẹ́ ní kòlóńbíà.
target: For over 20 years, our brothers in Colombia have been offering free Bible education to prisoners.

input: Ní November 30, 2018, àjọ Paulo Freire Educational Center fún àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ní ìwé ẹ̀rí kan láti kan sáárá sí wa torí bá a ṣe ń kọ́ àwọn ẹlẹ́wọ̀n lẹ́kọ̀ọ́ Bíbélì ní ọgbà ẹ̀wọ̀n tó wà ní ìlú Valledupar.
target: On November 30, 2018, the Paulo Freire Educational Center presented a certificate of recognition to Jehovah’s Witnesses for their Bible education work in a prison facility in the city of Valledupar.

input: Lọ́wọ́lọ́wọ́ báyìí, àádọ́ta 50 lára àwọn ẹlẹ́wọ̀n tó wà níbẹ̀ ló ń kẹ́kọ̀ọ́ Bíbélì.
target: Currently, 50 inmates participate in the Bible classes.

input: Káàkiri orílẹ̀-èdè Kòlóńbíà, ọgbà ẹ̀wọ̀n márùndínláàádọ́rin 65 làwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ti ń kọ́ àwọn èèyàn lẹ́kọ̀ọ́ Bíbélì, iye àwọn tá a sì ń kọ́ lẹ́kọ̀ọ́ jẹ́ ọgọ́rùn-ún méje àti méjìlélọ́gọ́rin 782.
target: Throughout Colombia, Jehovah’s Witnesses hold classes in 65 prisons, where they conduct 782 Bible studies.

input: Látọdún 1996, iye àwọn tó ṣèrìbọmi lára wọn ti di ọgọ́ta 60.
target: A total of 60 individuals have progressed to baptism since 1996.

input: Ọgbà ẹ̀wọ̀n ni Néver Antonio Cavadía ti kẹ́kọ̀ọ́ Bíbélì, ó sì ti di alàgbà nínú ìjọ rẹ̀ báyìí.
target: Néver Antonio Cavadía studied the Bible while in prison and now serves as a congregation elder.

input: Òun rèé pẹ̀lú ìyàwó rẹ̀, Lety Cavadía.
target: He is pictured here with his wife, Lety Cavadía.

input: Ọgbà ẹ̀wọ̀n ni Néver Antonio Cavadía ti kẹ́kọ̀ọ́ Bíbélì, ó sì ṣèrìbọmi ní 1998.
target: Néver Antonio Cavadía accepted a Bible study while in prison and was baptized in 1998.

input: Nígbà tó yá, wọ́n tú u sílẹ̀ ní ọgbà ẹ̀wọ̀n tó wà ní ìlú Valledupar lọ́dún 2007.
target: He was later released from Valledupar prison in 2007.

input: Nígbà tó ń mẹ́nu kan àǹfààní tí ẹ̀kọ́ Bíbélì ṣe fóun, ó ní Àwọn ìlànà Bíbélì dáàbò bò mí, ó sì jẹ́ kí n ní ọgbọ́n tó wúlò nígbà tí mo wà lẹ́wọ̀n.
target: Commenting on the benefits of his education,Bible principles protected and helped me to have practical wisdom while I was in prison.

input: Ó tún mú kí n ṣe àwọn ìyípadà tó lágbára nínú ayé mi, kí n sì nírètí.
target: They also motivated me to make big changes in my life and maintain hope.

input: Gbogbo ìsapá wa láti kọ́ àwọn ẹlẹ́wọ̀n lẹ́kọ̀ọ́ kárí ayé bá ìfẹ́ Jèhófà mu pé, ká gba onírúurú èèyàn là, kí wọ́n sì ní ìmọ̀ tó péye nípa òtítọ́.—1 Tímótì 24.
target: Worldwide, our efforts to reach those in prisons are in harmony with Jehovah’s will that all sorts of people should be saved and come to an accurate knowledge of truth.—1 Timothy 24.

input: Ní January 27, 2019, ìjì líle kan jà nílùú Havana tó jẹ́ olú ìlú orílẹ̀-èdè Cuba.
target: On January 27, 2019, a tornado pummeled Havana, the capital of Cuba.

input: Ó kéré tán, èèyàn mẹ́rin ló kú, àwọn ọgọ́rùn-méjì ó dín márùn-ún 195 sì fara pa.
target: At least 4 people have been killed, and 195 were injured.

input: Kò sí arákùnrin tàbí arábìnrin tó kú tàbí tó ṣèṣe nínú ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ náà.
target: No brothers or sisters were injured or killed by the storm.

input: Síbẹ̀, ilé mẹ́rìndínlọ́gbọ̀n 26 tó jẹ́ tàwọn ará wa ni ìjì náà bà jẹ́, wọ́n sì máa ń lo mẹ́ta lára àwọn ilé náà fún ìpàdé.
target: However, 26 homes of our brothers sustained damage, 3 of which are used to hold congregation meetings.

input: Ètò ti bẹ̀rẹ̀ ní pẹrẹu láti ṣàtúnṣe ilé àwọn ará tí ìjì náà bà jẹ́.
target: Arrangements are underway to care for the needed repair work.

input: Àwọn alábòójútó arìnrìn àjò ti ń pèsè ìrànwọ́ tẹ̀mí fáwọn ará tí àjálù yìí dé bá.
target: Traveling overseers have been providing spiritual support to fellow worshippers who have endured the tornado and its aftereffects.

input: Àdúrà wa ni pé kí Jèhófà tu àwọn ará yìí nínú kó sì fún wọn lókun kí wọ́n lè fara da àdánù ńlá yìí.​—Nọ́ńbà 626.
target: We pray that Jehovah will grant our brothers and sisters peace as they recover from this disaster.—Numbers 626.

input: Ní Friday, May 18, 2018, ọkọ̀ òfuurufú kan tí wọ́n ń pè ní Boeing 737 já bọ́ láìpẹ́ sígbà tó gbéra nílùú Havana lórílẹ̀-èdè Cuba.
target: On Friday, May 18, 2018, a Boeing 737 crashed shortly after takeoff from Havana, Cuba.

input: Nínú gbogbo àwọn mẹ́tàléláàádọ́fà 113 tó wọkọ̀ òfuurufú náà, ẹnì kan péré ló yè é.Ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ yìí ni jàǹbá ọkọ̀ òfuurufú tó burú jù tó tíì wáyé lórílẹ̀-èdè yìí láti ọ̀pọ̀ ọdún sẹ́yìn.
target: Of the 113 people on board, only one person survived, making this the country’s worst airline accident in many years.

input: Ó dùn wá pé ìdílé ẹlẹ́ni mẹ́ta kan tí wọ́n jẹ́ Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ìyẹn bàbá, ìyá àti ọmọkùnrin wọn ọlọ́dún méjìlélógún 22 wà lára àwọn tó bá ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ náà lọ.
target: Sadly, included in the death toll was a family of three of Jehovah’s Witnesses a father, mother, and 22-year-old son.

input: A ti sin òkú wọn ní Saturday, May 26, 2018.
target: A funeral was held for the family on Saturday, May 26, 2018.

input: Àwọn alàgbà tó wà nílùú náà ò fi tẹbí-tọ̀rẹ́ àwọn tí àjálù ṣẹlẹ̀ sí sílẹ̀, wọ́n sì ń fi ọ̀rọ̀ Bíbélì tù wọ́n nínú.Bẹ́ẹ̀ náà làwọn aláṣẹ ìlú ń fìfẹ́ ṣèrànwọ́.
target: Along with the emotional and spiritual support that is being provided by the local elders to the friends and family of the victims, local authorities have also kindly offered practical assistance.

input: Ó dá wa lójú pé Jèhófà ò ní yéé ‘tu gbogbo àwọn tó ń ṣọ̀fọ̀ nínú’ lásìkò tí nǹkan nira yìí.​—Aísáyà 611, 2.
target: We are confident that Jehovah will continue to bring ‘comfort to all who mourn’ during this difficult time.—Isaiah 611, 2.

input: Déètì June 14 sí16, 2019
Ibi Tá A Ti Ṣe É Pápá ìṣeré Estadio Monumental Banco Pichincha ní ìlú Guayaquil, Ecuador
target: Estadio Monumental Banco Pichincha in Guayaquil, Ecuador

input: Èdè Èdè Adití ti Ecuador, Gẹ̀ẹ́sì, Sípáníìṣì
target: Ecuadorian Sign Language, English, Spanish

input: Áwọn Ẹ̀ka Ọ́fíísì Tó Wá Ajẹntínà, Belgium, Bolivia, Central America, Kòlóńbíà, Cuba, Kazakhstan, Korea, Moldova, Myanmar, Poland, Sípéènì, Amẹ́ríkà
target: Argentina, Belgium, Bolivia, Central America, Colombia, Cuba, Kazakhstan, Korea, Moldova, Myanmar, Poland, Spain, United States

input: Ìrírí José Francisco Cevallos, ààrẹ ẹgbẹ́ agbábọ́ọ́lù Barcelona tó ni pápá ìṣeré tá a ti ṣe àpéjọ náà sọ pé Ẹ ò fún wa ní wàhálà kankan nígbà tẹ́ ẹ ṣe àpéjọ yín láwọn ọdún tó kọjá, tọdún yìí náà ò sì yàtọ̀.
target: José Francisco Cevallos, president of the Barcelona Sporting Club that owns the stadium,We have never had issues related to your conventions, neither this one nor in previous years.

input: Èyí fi hàn pé oníwà tútù ni yín àti pé gbogbo àpéjọ yín ló máa ń wà létòlétò.
target: That speaks highly of your good behavior and the orderliness that we see in all your conventions.

input: Kò rọrùn, àmọ́ ẹ máa ń sapá gan-an láti ṣètò kí nǹkan lè lọ bó ṣe yẹ láwọn àpéjọ yín.
target: It is not an easy task, yet it’s in your culture to organize and thoroughly prepare for all your events.

input: Èèyàn dáadáa ni yín​—ẹ gbẹ̀kọ́, ìwà yín dáa, ẹ sì wà létòlétò.
target: You are good people—very educated, well-mannered, and well-organized.

input: Ìmọ̀ràn wa ni pe káwọn ìlú àtàwọn orílẹ́-èdè míì máa gba àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà lálejò.
target: We strongly recommend any city and country to host Jehovah’s Witnesses.

input: Ibi gbogbo láyé làwọn ará wa ti ń lo àwọn ọ̀nà míì láti máa wàásù nítorí àrùn COVID-19 tí kò jẹ́ kí wọ́n lè máa wàásù bí wọ́n ti ń ṣe tẹ́lẹ̀.
target: Our brothers and sisters around the world continue to adapt their ministry as the COVID-19 pandemic progresses.

input: Àwọn ará wa tó wà ní orílẹ̀-èdè Ecuador ń lo onírúurú ọ̀nà láti wàásù ìhìn rere fún ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ èèyàn.
target: Publishers in Ecuador are having success using a variety of preaching methods to reach people with the good news.

input: Àpẹẹrẹ kan ni ti ọ̀dọ́bìnrin ọlọ́dún méje kan tó ń gbé ní ìlú Ambato, pẹ̀lú ìrànlọ́wọ́ màmá rẹ̀, ó kọ àtẹ̀jíṣẹ́, ó sì fi ránṣẹ́ sáwọn tíṣà ilé ìwé rẹ̀.
target: In the city of Ambato, a seven-year-old publisher, along with her mother, sent text messages to her school teachers.

input: Lára ohun tó kọ nìyí Ẹ káàárọ̀.
target: Good morning, teacher.

input: Mò fi àtèjíṣẹ́ yìí ránṣẹ́ sí yín láti tù yín nínú nítorí pé àsìkò tá a wà yìí nira gan-an.
target: I’m writing to send you a comforting message because of the times we are living in.

input: Bíbélì fi wá lọ́kàn balẹ̀ nínú ìwé Ìfihàn 214 pé ọ̀la máa dáa.
target: The Bible offers us a better future in Revelation 214.

input: Ìlujá tí mo fi ránṣẹ́ máa gbé yín lọ síbi tẹ́ ẹ ti máa rí àlàyé tó pọ̀ sí i.
target: I’m sending you a link with more information.

input: Ọ̀kan lára àwọn tíṣà rẹ̀ dá èsì pa dà, ó ní O ṣeun gan-an ni, ọmọ dáadáa.
target: Thank you, my lovely girl.

input: Ọmọdé ni ẹ́, àmọ́ ọ̀rọ̀ tó o sọ yìí mọ́gbọ́n dání gan-an.
target: Even at your young age, your words are very wise.

input: Ẹlòmíì dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ rẹ̀ gan-an, ó sì béèrè bóyá òun lè rí Ìwé Ìtàn Bíbélì, èyí tó wà lórí ẹ̀rọ.
target: Another teacher thanked her and asked if there is a digital version of My Book of Bible Stories.

input: Ó sọ fún ọmọ náà pé òun ní ìwé yẹn tẹ́lẹ̀ àmọ́ òun yá ọmọ iléèwé kan.
target: The teacher explained that she used to have a copy but loaned it to another student.

input: Ọ̀dọ́bìnrin náà wá ṣàlàyé fún tíṣà yẹn pé ó lè rí ìwé náà lórí ìkànnì jw.org.
target: The young publisher explained to her teacher that she could download the book from jw.org.

input: Àpẹẹrẹ míì ni tọkọtaya kan tó ń gbé nílùú Quevedo, wọ́n wá orúkọ àwọn tí kì í ṣe Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà tó wà lórí fóònù wọn, wọ́n sì fi àtẹ̀jíṣẹ́ ránṣẹ́ sí wọn, ohun tí wọ́n sọ rèé Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ni mí
target: I am one of Jehovah’s Witnesses.

input: Kò ṣeé ṣe fún wa láti máa wàásù láti ilé dé ilé bá a ti máa ń ṣe nítorí àrùn tó ń jà ràn-ìn nílẹ̀ wa àti kárí ayé, síbẹ̀, inú wa máa dùn tá a bá lè bá yín sọ̀rọ̀ lórí ẹ̀rọ ayélujára.
target: Because of the crisis that is affecting the country and the entire world, we aren’t able to preach from house to house, but we would like very much to talk to you by videoconference.

input: Ọ̀pọ̀ ló gbà láti ṣe bẹ́ẹ̀.
target: The majority agreed to such a meeting.

input: Obìnrin kan tí kì í gbà káwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà bá òun sọ̀rọ̀ Ọlọ́run gbóríyìn fáwọn tọkọtaya náà pé òun mọrírì bí wọ́n ṣe ń gbìyànjú láti tu àwọn èèyàn nínú.
target: One contact, a woman who had not been receptive when Witnesses preached to her in the past, thanked the couple and commended their initiative.

input: Ó sọ fún wọn pé ọ̀kan òun ò balẹ̀ nítorí ìṣòro tó gbòde kan yìí.
target: The woman explained that she feels stressed over the current situation.

input: Ni tọkọtaya náà bá fi ìwé ìròyìn wa kan ránṣẹ́ sí i, ìyẹn Jí , No.1 2020, tó ní àkòrí náà, Bó O Ṣe Lè Ní Ìbàlẹ̀ Ọkàn.
target: The couple sent the woman the Awake , No.1 2020, entitled Find Relief From Stress, in PDF format.

input: Nígbà tí wọ́n tún jọ ráyè sọ̀rọ̀, obìnrin náà sọ pé òun gbádùn ìwé náà gan-an, ó sì jẹ́ kí wọ́n mọ̀ pé òun ti ka ìwé náà lọ́pọ̀lọpọ̀ ìgbà.
target: In a subsequent conversation, the woman expressed her appreciation for the magazine and revealed that she had read it multiple times.

input: Àpẹẹrẹ ẹlòmíì ni arábìnrin adití kan tó ń jẹ́ Johana tó ń gbé ní Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas.Arábìnrin yìí fi àwòrán kọ̀wé sáwọn èèyàn.
target: A deaf sister named Johana, from the province of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, wrote a letter using pictures.

input: Ó fọwọ́ ya onírúuru àwòrán, ó ya fọ́tò àwọn àwòrán náà, ó sì fi í ránṣẹ́ sáwọn ojúlùmọ̀ ẹ̀ tó jẹ́ adití.
target: She then took a photograph of it and sent it via text message to all of her contacts who are deaf.

input: Àmọ́, obìnrin kan tí kì í ṣe adití wà lára àwọn tó fi àtẹ̀jíṣẹ́ náà ránṣẹ́ sí.
target: However, among the recipients was a hearing woman.

input: Kò pẹ́ tí obìnrin yẹn rí àtẹ̀jíṣẹ́ náà gbà ló fèsì pa dà, tó sì ń béèrè ọ̀pọ̀ ìbéèrè.
target: The woman quickly wrote back asking questions.

input: Àmọ́ Johana ò lóyé àwọn ìbéèrè yẹn, torí náà ó sọ fún arábìnrin aṣáájú-ọ̀nà kan tí kì í ṣe adití tí orúkọ rẹ̀ ń jẹ́ Rhonda pé kó dáhùn àwọn ìbèérè obìnrin náà.
target: Since Johana didn’t understand the questions, a hearing pioneer sister named Rhonda followed up on the interest.

input: Obìnrin yẹn sọ fún Arábìnrin Rhonda pé àwọn àwòrán tí Johana fi ránṣẹ́ sí òun ya òun lẹ́nu gan-an.
target: The interested woman explained to Rhonda that the drawings that Johana had sent to her caught her attention.

input: Ó wá béèrè bóyá àwọn ẹsẹ Ìwé Mímọ́ míì tún wà tó ṣàlàyé ìdí táwọn nǹkan burúkú fi ń ṣẹ̀lẹ̀ láyé.
target: She asked whether there are other verses in the Bible that also speak about what is happening on the earth.

input: Arábìnrin Rhonda ka Lúùkù 21​10, 11 fún un, ó sì fi ìlujá fídíò Kí Nìdí Tí Ọlọ́run Fi Gbà Pé Ká Máa Jìyà àti Kí Ni Ìdí Tí Ọlọ́run Fi Dá Ayé ránṣẹ́ sí i.Obìnrin náà sọ pé òun á fẹ́ káwọn tún jọ sọ̀rọ̀ Bíbélì nígbà míì.
target: Rhonda read to her Luke 2110, 11 and sent the woman links to the videos Why Does God Allow Suffering and Why Did God Create the Earth The woman is willing to have another conversation.

input: Bíi ti àpọ́sítélì Pọ́ọ̀lù tí kò dẹ́kun àtimáa jẹ́rìí kúnnákúnná nípa Ìjọba Ọlọ́run bó tiẹ̀ wà lẹ́wọ̀n, àwọn ará wa náà ń ṣe gbogbo ohun tí wọ́n lè ṣe láti máa wàásù báwọn náà ò tiẹ̀ lè jáde nílé.​—Ìṣe 2823.
target: Just as the apostle Paul continued bearing thorough witness concerning the Kingdom of God while he was imprisoned, our brothers continue taking advantage of every opportunity to preach, even though they cannot leave their homes.—Acts 2823.

input: ìpínrọ̀ 7 Ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn adití ló máa ń ṣòro fún láti lóyé ìwé téèyàn bá kọ, torí náà dípò káwọn ará wa tó gbọ́ èdè adití kọ̀wẹ́ sílẹ̀ fún ẹni tó jẹ́ adití, àwòrán ni wọ́n sábà máa ń yà láti fi ṣàlàyé ọ̀rọ̀ fẹ́ni tó jẹ́ adití.
target: par.7 Since many deaf people struggle to understand written text, in the sign-language field a number of publishers draw illustrations to represent concepts rather than write out words.

input: Ní Sunday, June 3, 2018, òkè ayọnáyèéfín tí wọ́n ń pè ní Volcan de Fuego bú gbàù ní orílẹ̀-èdè Guatemala.
target: On Sunday, June 3, 2018, Guatemala’s Volcan de Fuego, or volcano of fire, erupted, spewing a river of molten lava and sending plumes of smoke nearly six miles 9 km high.

input: Eérú gbígbóná tú jáde, èéfín tó ń jáde níbẹ̀ sì fẹ́rẹ̀ẹ́ ga tó kìlómítà mẹ́sàn-án.
target: There are at least ten congregations in the affected region.

input: Ó kéré tán, ìjọ mẹ́wàá ló wà níbi tí ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ yìí ti wáyé.Àmọ́ a dúpẹ́ pé ìkankan nínú àwọn ará wa lọ́kùnrin àti lóbìnrin ò fara pa, bó tiẹ̀ jẹ́ pé àwọn mẹ́jọ nínú wọn la ti ní kí wọ́n kúrò níbi tí wọ́n ń gbé torí àtidáàbò bò wọ́n.
target: Thankfully, none of our brothers and sisters have been harmed, although eight have been evacuated as a preventative safety measure.

input: Ọ̀rọ̀ inú 2 Kọ́ríńtì 814 àti 15 ti mú kí àwọn àyíká tó wà nítòsí ṣèrànwọ́ láti pèsè oúnjẹ, ilé àti ohun ìrìnnà fáwọn tí àjálù ṣẹlẹ̀ sí.
target: In the spirit of 2 Corinthians 814, 15, neighboring circuits have offered supplies, shelter, and transportation.

input: Ní Saturday, October 6, 2018, ìmìtìtì ilẹ̀ kan tó lágbára wáyé ní agbègbè àríwá ilẹ̀ Haiti, ó pa èèyàn mẹ́tàdínlógún 17, ó sì ju ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́ta 300 tó fara pa.
target: On Saturday, October 6, 2018, a magnitude 5.9 earthquake struck the northern region of Haiti, killing 17 and injuring over 300.

input: Ìròyìn tá a gbọ́ fi hàn pé kò sí ìkankan lára àwọn ará wa tó kú àmọ́ àwọn méjì ṣèṣe.
target: No deaths have been reported among the brothers however, two publishers sustained minor injuries.

input: Ìròyìn tá a kọ́kọ́ gbọ́ látọ̀dọ̀ àwọn alábòójútó àyíká fi hàn pé ilé mẹ́rìnlélógójì 44 àti Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba mẹ́rin ló bà jẹ́.
target: Initial reports from the circuit overseers indicate that 44 homes and 4 Kingdom Halls have been damaged.

input: Ní ìlú Port-de-Paix, nǹkan bí àádọ́ta 50 àwọn ará àti ìdílé wọn ló ní láti kúrò níbi tí wọ́n ń gbé torí àwọn ilé náà lè wó nígbàkigbà.
target: In the city of Port-de-Paix, about 50 of our brothers and their immediate family members have been displaced because the safety of their homes has been compromised.

input: Àwọn ará inú ìjọ tó wà lágbègbè náà ló ń tójú àwọn ìdílé yìí.
target: These families are being cared for by their local congregation.

input: Ọ̀kan lára Ìgbìmọ̀ Ẹ̀ka nílẹ̀ Haiti pẹ̀lú arákùnrin méjì tó ń ṣiṣẹ́ ní Ẹ̀ka Tó Ń Yàwòrán Ilé Tó sì Ń Kọ́ Ọ lọ sáwọn ibi tí àjálù náà ti ṣẹlẹ̀ kí wọ́n lè mọ bó ṣe tó, kí wọ́n sì fún àwọn ara níṣìírí.
target: A member of the Haiti Branch Committee along with two brothers working with the Local DesignConstruction Department visited the affected area to assess the damage and to provide encouragement.

input: Ìgbìmọ̀ Tó Ń Ṣètò Ìrànwọ́ Nígbà Àjálù ti bẹ̀rẹ̀ iṣẹ́ níbẹ̀ láti pèsè àwọn nǹkan tó ṣe pàtàkì.
target: A Disaster Relief Committee has been established to organize necessary relief aid.

input: Ọkàn wa wà lọ́dọ̀ àwọn ará wa ní Haiti, a sì ń gbàdúrà fún wọn.
target: Our thoughts and prayers continue to be with our brothers in Haiti.

input: Ìjì kan tí wọ́n pè ní Lidia jà ní Ìyawọlẹ̀ Omi Baja California lórílẹ̀-èdè Mẹ́síkò ní September 1.
target: Tropical Storm Lidia hit Mexico’s Baja California Peninsula on Friday, September 1.

input: Bó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé ó ti rọlẹ̀ nígbà tó fi máa di ọjọ́ Saturday, síbẹ̀ òjò tó rọ̀ pọ̀ gan-an, kò tíì sí irú ẹ̀ láti ọdún 1933.
target: Although weakening to a depression by Saturday, the storm dropped about 27 inches 69 cm of rain, the largest amount reported since 1933.

input: Ó kéré tán, èèyàn márùn-ún ló kú nínú ìjì náà.
target: At least five people died in the storm.

input: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà tó wà ní Mexico City fi tó wa létí pé arábìnrin Ẹlẹ́rìí kan kú, ọ̀gbàrá òjò tó ń ya mù-ún mù-ún ló gbé e lọ nígbà tó ń rìn lọ sílé.
target: The branch office of Jehovah’s Witnesses located in Mexico City, reports that one Witness was killed when she was swept away by rushing water as she walked home.

input: Ọ̀gbàrá yẹn gbé àwọn mẹ́ta míì lọ, àmọ́ wọ́n rí wọn yọ nínú ẹ̀.
target: Three others were also caught in the floodwaters, but were rescued.

input: Láfikún sí i, ìjì náà ba ilé mẹ́jọ jẹ́ pátápátá.
target: Additionally, eight homes were severely damaged by the storm.

input: Gbogbo àwọn tí àjálù yìí ṣẹlẹ̀ sí ló rí ìtọ́jú gbà látọ̀dọ̀ àwọn mọ̀lẹ́bí wọn tàbí látọ̀dọ̀ àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà tó wà ládùúgbò wọn.
target: All the affected victims are being cared for by their family members or by local Witnesses.

input: Ìgbìmọ̀ Olùdarí àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ló ń bójú tó ètò ìrànwọ́ nígbà àjálù láti oríléeṣẹ́ wọn, ọrẹ táwọn èèyàn fi ṣètìlẹ́yìn fún iṣẹ́ kárí ayé ni wọ́n sì ń lò.
target: The Governing Body of Jehovah’s Witnesses coordinates disaster relief efforts from their world headquarters, using funds donated to the Witnesses’ global ministry work.

input: Agbẹnusọ fún Àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà Kárí Ayé David A.Semonian, Ọ́fíìsì Agbéròyìnjáde, 1-845-524-3000Gamaliel Camarillo, 52-555-133-3048
target: David A.Semonian, Office of Public Information, 1-845-524-3000Gamaliel Camarillo, 52-555-133-3048

input: Ní September 19, 2017, ìmìtìtì ilẹ̀ tó lágbára gan-an tí ìwọ̀n rẹ̀ jẹ́ 7.1 wáyé ní àárín gbùngbùn orílẹ̀-èdè Mẹ́síkò, ó sì pa èèyàn tó lé ní ọgọ́rùn-ún méjì 200.
target: On September 19, 2017, a magnitude 7.1 earthquake struck central Mexico, killing over 200 people.

input: Ìròyìn tá a kọ́kọ́ gbọ́ láti ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì Central America rèé Ó dùn wá gan-an pé ọ̀kan lára àwọn arábìnrin wa ní Mexico City kú sínú ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ náà.
target: Initial reports have been received from the Central America branch office with the following information.Unfortunately, it has been confirmed that one of our sisters in Mexico City was killed in the quake.

input: Arábìnrin kan tún wà tí a ṣì ń wá títí di báyìí lẹ́yìn tí ilé rẹ̀ wó.
target: Additionally, one sister is still missing after her building collapsed.

input: Arábìnrin kan fara pa yánayàna ní ìlú kan tó ń jẹ́ Puebla, a tún gbọ pé arábìnrin míì fara gbọgbẹ́ ó sì wà nílé ìwòsàn ní State of Mexico.
target: In the city of Puebla, a sister was severely injured, and in the State of Mexico, another sister was hospitalized with injuries.

input: A kọ́kọ́ kó ìdílé Bẹ́tẹ́lì kúrò ní ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa, àmọ́ wọ́n ti pa dà sẹ́nu iṣẹ́ báyìí.
target: The branch office had to be temporarily evacuated but has returned to normal operations.

input: A dúpẹ́ pé ẹnikẹ́ni ò fara pa, ọ́fíìsì náà ò sì bà jẹ́.
target: There were no injuries and there was no structural damage to the facility.

input: À ń bá a lọ láti máa gbàdúrà fún àwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin wa bá a ṣe ń gbé ní àkókò tó le koko yìí, ó dájú pé Jèhófà mọ wàhálà ọkàn wọn, á sì bójú tó wọn.—Sáàmù 317.
target: We continue to pray for our brothers and sisters during this difficult time, knowing that Jehovah will support them and is aware of their deep distress.—Psalm 317.

input: Agbẹnusọ fún Àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà Kárí Ayé David A.Semonian, Ọ́fíìsì Agbéròyìnjáde, 1-845-524-3000Gamaliel Camarillo, 52-555-133-3048
target: David A.Semonian, Office of Public Information, 1-845-524-3000Gamaliel Camarillo, 52-555-133-3048

input: Ní September 14, 2017, ìjì ńlá kan tí wọ́n pè ní Hurricane Max jà ní gúùsù etíkun Pàsífíìkì lórílẹ̀-èdè Mẹ́síkò, ó sì fa ìjì líle.
target: On September 14, 2017, the southern Pacific coast of Mexico was hit by Hurricane Max, which eventually weakened into a tropical storm.

input: Ìjì náà mú kí atẹ́gùn tó lágbára fẹ́, ó sì tún fa omíyalé tó ba ọ̀pọ̀ nǹkan jẹ́.
target: The hurricane brought strong winds and rains that caused damaging floods.

input: Ìwádìí ṣì ń lọ lọ́wọ́ láti mọ bí ìjì náà ṣe ṣọṣẹ́ tó.
target: Its impact on local communities is still being assessed.

input: Àmọ́, ó bani nínú jẹ́ láti gbọ́ pé ìjì náà pa ọ̀kan lára àwọn arákùrin wa níbi tó ti ń gbìyànjú láti ran aládùúgbò rẹ̀ kan lọ́wọ́.
target: Sadly, however, it has been confirmed that one of our brothers was killed during the storm as he was attempting to assist his neighbor.

input: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa tó wà ní Mexico ṣètò ìrànwọ́, wọ́n sì ṣiṣẹ́ pọ̀ pẹ̀lú àwọn ìjọ àdúgbò láti pèsè ìrànwọ́ fún àwọn tí ìjì náà ṣe lọ́ṣẹ́.
target: The branch office in Mexico is coordinating relief activities and working with local congregations to provide support to those affected by the hurricane.

input: Agbẹnusọ fún Àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà Kárí Ayé David A.Semonian, Ọ́fíìsì Agbéròyìnjáde, 1-845-524-3000Gamaliel Camarillo, 52-555-133-3048
target: David A.Semonian, Office of Public Information, 1-845-524-3000Gamaliel Camarillo, 52-555-133-3048

input: Lọ́dún 2017, ìmìtìtì ilẹ̀ méjì tó lágbára wáyé lórílẹ̀-èdè Guatemala àti Mẹ́síkò.
target: Two powerful earthquakes struck Guatemala and Mexico in 2017.

input: Àwọn ará wa parí ètò ìrànwọ́ tí wọ́n ṣe ní gbogbo agbègbè náà lóṣù December 2018.
target: In December 2018, our brothers completed their vast relief efforts in the region.

input: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa ní Amẹ́ríkà Àárín bẹ̀rẹ̀ ètò ìrànwọ́ yìí nígbà tí wọ́n ṣe onírúurú ìpàdé láti fún àwọn ará tí àjálù náà ṣẹlẹ̀ sí níṣìírí.
target: The Central America branch began the relief work by organizing several meetings to encourage the brothers and sisters affected by the disasters.

input: Wọ́n ṣe ìpàdé náà ní ìpínlẹ̀ Chiapas, Morelos, Oaxaca, àti Puebla, kódà wọ́n tún ṣe é ní ìlú Mexico City.
target: These meetings were held in the states of Chiapas, Morelos, Oaxaca, and Puebla, as well as in Mexico City.

input: Ìgbìmọ̀ Ẹ̀ka dá ìgbìmọ̀ mọ́kàndínlógójì 39 tó ń ṣètò ìrànwọ́ sílẹ̀, àwọn ìgbìmọ̀ yìí ló sì ṣètò bí wọ́n ṣe tún gbogbo àwọn nǹkan tó bà jẹ́ ṣe.
target: A total of 39 Disaster Relief Committees worked under the direction of the Branch Committee to organize the rebuilding work.

input: Arákùnrin Jesse Pérez, ọ̀kan lára Ìgbìmọ̀ Ẹ̀ka ní Amẹ́ríkà Àárín bá àwọn akéde tí àjálù náà kàn ṣèpàdé ní ìpínlẹ̀ Morelos.
target: A member of the Central America Branch Committee, Jesse Pérez, meets with affected publishers in the state of Morelos.

input: Arákùnrin méjì ń ṣiṣẹ́ lórí òrùlé Gbọ̀ngàn Àpéjọ kan tí wọ́n tún kọ́ nígbà ètò ìrànwọ́ náà.
target: Two brothers work on the roof frame of an Assembly Hall that was rebuilt during the relief work.

input: Lórílẹ̀-èdè Mẹ́síkò, ó ju ẹgbẹ̀rún méjìlélógójì 42,000 akéde tó yọ̀ǹda ara wọn láti ìpínlẹ̀ mẹ́wàá kí wọ́n lè bá àwọn tó ń ṣètò ìrànwọ́ ṣiṣẹ́.
target: In Mexico, over 42,000 publishers from ten different states volunteered to assist with the relief efforts.

input: Àwọn ará yìí tún ilé ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́fà ó lé mọ́kàndínlógún 619 kọ́ pẹ̀lú Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba márùn-ún àti Gbọ̀ngàn Àpéjọ méjì.
target: The brothers and sisters rebuilt 619 homes, 5 Kingdom Halls, and 2 Assembly Halls.

input: Wọ́n tún ṣàtúnṣe sí ọgọ́rùn-ún márùn-ún ó lé méjì 502 ilé àti Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba mẹ́tàléláàádọ́ta 53.
target: They also repaired another 502 homes and 53 Kingdom Halls.

input: Yàtọ̀ síyẹn, wọ́n tún ilé mẹ́wà kọ́ ní Guatemala.
target: In Guatemala, an additional ten homes were rebuilt.

input: Ara àwọn tí wọ́n ṣèrànlọ́wọ́ fún ni ìdílé Hernández àti Santiago.
target: Among the Witnesses who received assistance were the Hernández and Santiago families.

input: Ìdílé Hernández níwájú ilé wọn, àwọn tó ṣètò ìrànwọ́ ló bá wọn tún ilé náà kọ́.
target: The Hernández family standing in front of their home, which was rebuilt by relief workers.

input: Ìlú Chalco ni ìdílé Hernández ń gbé, ibẹ̀ ò ju ogójì 40 kìlómítà sí ìlú Mexico City.
target: The Hernández family lives in the city of Chalco, just 40 kilometers 25 mi outside of Mexico City.

input: Ìmìtìtì ilẹ̀ tó wáyé ní September 19, 2017 ba ilé wọn jẹ́ kọjá àtúnṣe.
target: The earthquake that struck on September 19, 2017, damaged their home beyond repair.

input: Arábìnrin Ana María Hernández sọ pé Ní gbogbo àsìkò wàhálà yìí, a ò ṣaláìní ohunkóhun tá a nílò.
target: Sister Ana María HernáThroughout this ordeal, we never lacked a single thing.

input: Àwọn ará tọ́jú wa gan-an.
target: Our brothers took very good care of us.

input: Mo ṣì rántí bí ilé wa tẹ́lẹ̀ ṣe rí nígbà tó wó, àmọ́ tí nǹkan bí àádọ́ta àwọn tó yọ̀ǹda ara wọn wá láti bá wa kọ́ ilé wa tuntun.
target: I still remember the site where our house formerly stood, with 50 or more volunteers working to build our new home.

input: Títí dòní, ohun táwọn ará yẹn ṣe fún wa ṣì máa ń ya àwọn ará àdúgbò wa lẹ́nu.Yàtọ̀ sí ìrànlọ́wọ́ tí ìdílé Hernández rí gbà yìí, aṣojú kan láti ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì ní Amẹ́ríkà Àárín wá sọ́dọ̀ wọn, ó sì fi Bíbélì fún wọn níṣìírí.
target: To this day, our neighbors are amazed at what our brothers did for us.In addition to this practical assistance, a representative of the Central America branch visited the Hernández family and provided Bible-based encouragement.

input: Ìdílé Santiago níwájú ilé wọn tuntun.
target: The Santiago family pictured in front of their new home.

input: Ìmìtìtì ilẹ̀ tó wáyé ní September 7, 2017 kan ìdílé Santiago tó ń gbé ní ìlú Juchitán, ìpínlẹ̀ Oaxaca.
target: The Santiago family, who lives in the city of Juchitán in the state of Oaxaca, was affected by the earthquake that struck on September 7, 2017.

input: Ó ba ilé wọn jẹ́ débi pé kò ṣeé gbé mọ́.
target: The damage to their home rendered it uninhabitable.

input: Àmọ́ láàárín oṣù mẹ́fà, àwọn tó ń ṣiṣẹ́ ìrànwọ́ bá wọn kọ́ ilé tuntun míì.
target: However, in less than six months, relief workers built them a new home.

input: Olórí ìdílé náà, Arákùnrin Victor Santiago sọ pé Bí ètò Jèhófà ṣe yára pèsè àwọn ohun tá a nílò fún wa wú mi lórí púpọ̀.
target: The father of the family, Brother Victor Santiago,I was so impressed by how quickly Jehovah’s organization provided us with support.

input: Mo rí i pé ọwọ́ Jèhófà la wà, òun ló sì ń bójú tó wa.Arákùnrin Jesse Pérez, ọ̀kan lára Ìgbìmọ̀ Ẹ̀ka ní Amẹ́ríkà Àárín, sọ pé Ọṣẹ́ ti ìmìtìtì ilẹ̀ méjèèjì tó wáyé ṣe pọ̀ gan-an.
target: I saw that Jehovah had everything under control.Brother Jesse Pérez, a member of the Central America Branch Committee,The destruction caused by the two earthquakes was widespread.

input: Àmọ́ ètò ìrànwọ́ tó wúlò tá a ṣe tẹ̀ lé e fún àwọn ará láǹfààní láti yọ̀ǹda ara wọn.
target: However, the long-term relief work that followed provided an opportunity for brothers and sisters to show their volunteer spirit.

input: Ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àwọn akéde ló ṣèrànlọ́wọ́, èyí sì fi hàn pé wọ́n nífẹ̀ẹ́ àwọn ará.
target: Numerous publishers assisted, demonstrating their brotherly love.

input: December 1 ni ìṣẹ́ ìrànwọ́ yìí bẹ̀rẹ̀, a máa ná tó mílíọ̀nù mẹ́wàá dọ́là 10 million.
target: December 1 marks the start of a large-scale relief project, which will cost an estimated 10 million.

input: A máa tún ilé tó tó ọgọ́rùn-ún márùn-ún 500 àti Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba mẹ́rìndínlógún 16 ṣe, àtàwọn ilé míì tí ìjì lílé tó wáyé lẹ́ẹ̀mejì ti bà jẹ́ ní Guatemala àti Mexico lóṣù September.
target: The work includes rebuilding nearly 500 homes and 16 Kingdom Halls, and repairing numerous other structures affected by two earthquakes, which struck Guatemala and Mexico in September.

input: MEXICO CITY—Ìgbìmọ̀ Ẹ̀ka ti Central America máa bẹ̀rẹ̀ àtúnṣe tó pọ̀ gan-an ní Guatemala àti Mexico ní December 1, 2017, láti pèsè ìrànwọ́ síwájú sí i nítorí ìmìtìtì ilẹ̀ méjì tó wáyé ní oṣù September.
target: MEXICO CITY—The Central America Branch Committee will initiate a large-scale rebuilding work in Guatemala and Mexico on December 1, 2017, as part of their ongoing relief efforts following the two earthquakes that struck in September.

input: Gbàrà lẹ́yìn tí ìmìtìtì ilẹ̀ yẹn ti wáyé ni ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì ti ṣètò ìrànwọ́, wọ́n pèsè omi, oúnjẹ, oògùn àti aṣọ fáwọn arákùnrin wa tí àjálù yẹn dé bá.
target: The branch organized initial relief efforts immediately following the quakes, providing water, food, medicine, and clothing to our affected brothers.

input: Ohun míì tí wọ́n tún máa bẹ̀rẹ̀ báyìí ni bí wọ́n ṣe máa tún Gbọ̀ngàn Àpéjọ, Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba àti ilé àwọn arákùnrin wa kọ́.
target: The next wave of relief work will focus on reconstructing Assembly Halls, Kingdom Halls, and homes of our brothers.

input: Ní ìpínlẹ̀ Chiapas àti Oaxaca ní Mexico, àwọn arákùnrin àti arábìnrin ọgọ́rùn mẹ́fà àti àádọ́ta lé ní márùn-ún 655 ni kò nílé lórí mọ́ lẹ́yìn tí ìjì líle kan wáyé ní September 7.
target: In the Mexican states of Chiapas and Oaxaca, there were 655 brothers and sisters displaced after the magnitude 8.2 earthquake that occurred on September 7.

input: Ohun tí wọ́n gbèrò láti ṣe ni pé kí wọ́n tún ilé ọgọ́rùn mẹ́ta àti mẹ́ẹ̀ẹ́dógún 315 kọ́, wọ́n sì máa tún Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba mẹ́ẹ̀ẹ́dógún 15 kọ́.
target: The planned relief work for the two states includes rebuilding 315 homes and 15 Kingdom Halls.

input: Yàtọ̀ sáwọn yẹn, àwọn ilé tó bàjẹ́ tí wọ́n fẹ́ tún ṣe tó ẹgbẹ̀rún kan àti mọ́kàndínlógójì 1,039, Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba tó tó ọgọ́rùn kan ó lé mẹ́jọ 108 àti Gbọ̀ngàn Àpéjọ mẹ́ta.
target: Additionally, damaged structures scheduled to be repaired include 1,039 homes, 108 Kingdom Halls, and 3 Assembly Halls.

input: Ní Mexico City àti ní Morelos àti Puebla, àwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin ọgọ́rùn mẹ́rin ó lé ọgọ́ta àti mẹ́ta 463 ni ìjì líle tó wáyé ní September 19 ba ilé wọn jẹ́.
target: In Mexico City and the states of Mexico, Morelos, and Puebla, the 7.1-magnitude earthquake that struck on September 19 displaced 463 brothers and sisters.

input: Ilé tó tó méjìdínlọ́gọ́jọ 158 ni wọ́n máa tún kọ́, wọ́n tún máa tún ilé ọgọ́rùn mẹ́fà 600 ṣe, wọ́n á sì tún ṣàtúnṣe sí Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba mọ́kàndínlógójì 39 àti Gbọ̀ngàn Àpéjọ kan.
target: A total of 158 homes will be rebuilt, and an additional 600 homes, 39 Kingdom Halls, and one Assembly Hall will be repaired.

input: Ìjì líle tó wáyé ní September 7 ní Guatemala sọ àwọn arákùnrin àti arábìnrin mẹ́rìndínlógójì 36 di aláìnílé lórí.
target: In Guatemala, the September 7 earthquake displaced 36 brothers and sisters.

input: Láàárín oṣù díẹ̀ sí i, àwọn ìránṣẹ́ ìkọ́lé àti àwọn arákùnrin tó wà ládùúgbò máa tún ilé mẹ́sàn-án àti Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba kan kọ́.
target: In the coming months, construction servants and local volunteers will rebuild nine homes and one Kingdom Hall.

input: Wọ́n máa tún ilé ogún 20 kọ́, wọ́n sì máa tún Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba mẹ́rin kọ́.
target: They will also repair 20 homes and 4 Kingdom Halls.

input: Ìgbìmọ̀ Ẹ̀ka sọ pé àwọn ìgbìmọ̀ tó ń bójú tó ètò ìrànwọ́ mọ́kàndínlógójì 39 ló máa bójú tó iṣẹ́ yìí, ó máa ná wọn tó mílíọ̀nù mẹ́wàá owó dọ́là 10 million iṣẹ́ náà sì máa gbà tó oṣù márùn-un sí mẹ́fà.
target: The Branch Committee estimates that the relief work, which involves 39 disaster relief committees, will cost nearly 10 million and will span five to six months.

input: Àwọn ìránṣẹ́ ìkọ́lé ọgbọ̀n 30 ló ti ń gbara di láti lọ sí àwọn ibi tí àjálù yẹn ti wáyé, àwọn ará tó tó ẹgbẹ̀rún kan ó dín ọgbọ̀n 970 ló sì ti yọ̀ǹda ara wọn láti lọ́wọ́ sí iṣẹ́ àtúnṣe yìí.
target: Some 30 construction servants have made plans to move to the affected areas, and an additional 970 have volunteered to assist with the rebuilding work.

input: Ó dá wa lójú pé Jèhófà máa bù kún iṣẹ́ yìí àtàwọn tó yọ̀ǹda ara wọn láti ní ìpín nínú ètò ìrànwọ́ tá a ṣe fáwọn ará wa tí àjálù yìí dé bá.—2 Kọ́ríńtì 84.
target: We are confident that Jehovah will bless the work and volunteer spirit of all who share in the relief ministry on behalf of our brothers in the affected areas.—2 Corinthians 84.

input: Déètì June 7 sí 9, 2019
Ibi Tá A Ti Ṣe É Pápá ìṣeré BBVA Bancomer Stadium ní ìlú Monterrey, Mẹ́síkò
target: BBVA Bancomer Stadium in Monterrey, Mexico

input: Èdè Gẹ̀ẹ́sì, Èdè Adití ti Mẹ́síkò, Sípáníìṣì
target: English, Mexican Sign Language, Spanish
