input: Omíyalé náà mú kí àwọn odò tó wà lágbègbè náà kún kọjá ààlà, àwọn ibi tó ń gba omi dúró ya lulẹ̀, ó ba ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ilé jẹ́, ó sì pa ó kéré tán èèyàn mẹ́rin.
target: As rivers in the area rose to historic levels, water breached dams and levees, damaging hundreds of homes and killing at least four people.

input: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa ní Amẹ́ríkà sọ pé kò sí ìkankan lára ẹgbẹ̀rún márùn-ún àti mẹ́tàlélọ́gọ́fà 5,123 akéde tó wà níbẹ̀ tó kú tàbí tó fara pa.
target: The United States branch reports that none of the 5,123 publishers in the area died or suffered injuries.

input: Àmọ́ akéde mẹ́rìnlélọ́gọ́rin 84 ní láti kúrò níbi tí wọ́n ń gbé.
target: However, 84 publishers were displaced.

input: Yàtọ̀ síyẹn, ilé mẹ́jọ àwọn ará wa bà jẹ́ gan-an, ilé mẹ́rìnlélọ́gbọ̀n 34 míì sì bà jẹ́ díẹ̀.
target: Additionally, 8 of the brothers’ homes sustained major damage and 34 sustained minor damage.

input: Àwọn ará ìjọ lágbègbè náà ti bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí í yọ̀ǹda ara wọn láti palẹ̀ ìdọ̀tí mọ́, wọ́n sì ń ṣiṣẹ́ pẹ̀lú àwọn ará tó wà ní Ẹ̀ka Tó Ń Yàwòrán Ilé Tó sì Ń Kọ́ Ọ.
target: Volunteers in nearby congregations have begun the cleanup efforts with the support of Local DesignConstruction personnel.

input: Àwọn alábòójútó àyíká tó wà lágbègbè tí àjálù náà ti ṣẹlẹ̀ ń fáwọn ará tọ́rọ̀ kàn níṣìírí.
target: The circuit overseers in the impacted areas are coordinating shepherding for those affected.

input: Àdúrà wa ni pé kí ìrànlọ́wọ́ táwọn ará wa rí gbà nípa tara àti nípa tẹ̀mí tù wọ́n nínú lásìkò ìṣòro yìí.
target: We pray that our brothers will continue to be comforted by the practical and spiritual support they are receiving during this trial.

input: Ní January 9 lórílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà, ìjì líle kan jà ní gúúsù ìpínlẹ̀ California.Ìjì yẹn ló fa ọ̀gbàrá púpọ̀ gan-an tó sì han àwọn ará ìlú léèmọ̀.
target: On January 9, a powerful storm resulting in widespread mudslides wreaked havoc on residents in the southern part of California, United States.

input: Ìròyìn jẹ́ ká mọ̀ pé àwọn mọ́kànlélógún 21 ló pàdánù ẹ̀mí wọn sínú ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ burúkú yẹn, ọ̀pọ̀ ilé ló wó, àwọn míì sì bàjẹ́.
target: News reports indicate that at least 21 people were killed and hundreds of homes were damaged or destroyed.

input: Kò sí ọ̀kankan nínú àwọn ará wa tó kú sínú ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ náà.
target: No publishers were among those killed by the disaster.

input: Àmọ́ ní ìlú Burbank, ìjì yẹn ba ilé àtàwọn nǹkan ìní akéde kan jẹ́.Bákan náà, ní ìlú Ventura ìdílé mẹ́jọ ló ti sá kúrò nílé.
target: In Burbank, the home and property of one publisher was damaged, and an additional eight families were evacuated in Ventura.

input: Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba kankan kò bàjẹ́.
target: No Kingdom Halls were damaged by the mudslides.

input: Àwọn Alábòójútó àyíká pẹ̀lú Ìgbìmọ̀ Tó Ń Ṣètò Ìrànwọ́ Nígbà Àjálù àti àwọn aṣojú láti Ẹ̀ka Tó Ń Yàwòrán Ilé Tó sì Ń Kọ́ Ọ jọ ń ṣiṣẹ́ pọ̀ láti ṣèrànwọ́ fáwọn tí àjálù dé bá.
target: The circuit overseers and the Disaster Relief Committee, along with Local DesignConstruction representatives, continue to support publishers who have been affected by the mudslides and the recent wildfires.

input: Ní irú àsìkò tí nǹkan nira yìí, àá máa báa lọ láti rántí àwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin wa nínú àwọn àdúrà wa, ó dá wa lójú pé Jèhófà máa fún wọn lókun tí wọ́n nílò.​
target: During this time, we continue to keep our brothers in our prayers, confident that Jehovah will keep them strong.

input: Ọdún 1935 ni ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ amọ́kànyọ̀ yìí kọ́kọ́ wáyé.
target: Joseph F.Rutherford, then serving as president of the Watch Tower Society, was present when construction began on the Kingdom Hall located at 1228 Pensacola Street, Honolulu, Hawaii.

input: Arákùnrin Joseph F.Rutherford, tó jẹ́ ààrẹ Watch Tower Society nígbà yẹn wà níbẹ̀ nígbà tí wọ́n bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí í kọ́ Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba tó wà ní ojúlé 1228 ní Pensacola Street, ìlú Honolulu, ìpínlẹ̀ Hawaii.
target: The year was 1935.

input: Ní báyìí, àwọn ìjọ mẹ́rin ló ń ṣèpàdé nínú Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba yẹn, èdè márùn-ún ni wọ́n sì fi ń ṣèpàdé níbẹ̀, títí kan èdè Hawaii Pidgin.
target: Today, 85 years later, the Pensacola Street Kingdom Hall is used by four congregations that support meetings held in five languages, including Hawaii Pidgin.

input: Àwọn ará wa mú àwọn àlejò náà rìn yí ká ilé náà, kí wọ́n lè rí onírúurú fọ́tò àtàwọn àkọ́sílẹ̀ ìtàn nípa ilé náà.Yàtọ̀ síyẹn, àwọn arákùnrin tún ṣàlàyé àwọn nǹkan táwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ń gbé ṣe lóde òní fún wọn.
target: Visitors were escorted on a tour of the building, viewed historical displays, and listened to presentations by the brothers that highlighted the activities of Jehovah’s modern-day organization.

input: Nígbà tó di February 16, Arákùnrin David H.Splane tó jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára Ìgbìmọ̀ Olùdarí àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà wá fọba lé e pẹ̀lú àsọyé ìyàsímímọ́.
target: The event culminated on February 16, with a dedication talk by Brother David H.Splane, a member of the Governing Body of Jehovah’s Witnesses.

input: ìpínrọ̀ 2 Lásìkò tí àrùn COVID-19 gbòde, orí ẹ̀rọ ayélujára ni gbogbo ìjọ àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà lórílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà ti ń ṣèpàdé dípò kí wọ́n máa kóra jọ nínú Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba.
target: par.2 During the current COVID-19 pandemic, all congregation meetings in the United States are temporarily being held via videoconference rather than in Kingdom Halls.

input: Ní oṣù díẹ̀ sẹ́yìn, àwọn iná kan jó ní ìpínlẹ̀ California, ó sì ba agbègbè tó tó ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́ta ó lé ọgọ́ta àti méjì kìlómítà jẹ́ níbùú àti lóòró 362 square kilometers.
target: In recent months, multiple wildfires have blazed across the state of California, charring some 362 square kilometers 140 sq mi and leaving a massive burn scar on the landscape.

input: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa ní Amẹ́ríkà ròyìn pé àwọn ará tó lé ní ẹgbẹ̀rún kan ó lé ọgọ́rùn-ún méje 1,700 ló ti sá kúrò nílé nítorí àwọn iná tó jó léraléra náà.
target: The United States branch reports that more than 1,700 brothers and sisters had to evacuate due to the various fires.

input: A ò tíì gbọ́ pé ẹnikẹ́ni fara pa tàbí kú.
target: No injuries or fatalities have been reported.

input: Ní October 10, 2019, iná tó jó àdúgbò Sandalwood tó wà ní Calimesa ba ilé ọ̀kan lára àwọn arákùnrin wa jẹ́.
target: The Sandalwood Fire in Calimesa that started on October 10, 2019, destroyed the home of one of our brothers.

input: Bákan náà, èéfín ba àwọn ilé kan jẹ́ díẹ̀.
target: Also, some homes have sustained minor smoke damage.

input: Ó fẹ́rẹ̀ẹ́ jẹ́ gbogbo àwọn tó sá kúrò nílé ló ti pa dà sílé.
target: Almost all who evacuated have been able to return home.

input: Ọ̀kan lára àwọn alàgbà tó ń gbé láwọn ibi tí iná náà ti jó sọ pé Ó ṣe pàtàkì gan-an pé ká máa tẹ̀ lé ìtọ́ni tí irú nǹkan báyìí bá ṣẹlẹ̀, kódà, ó yẹ ká tẹnu mọ́ ọn dáadáa.
target: We can’t overstate the importance of obeying direction in these cases, stated one elder who lives in one of the affected areas.

input: Ìfẹ́ àti ẹ̀mí ọ̀làwọ́ tí àwọn akéde tó ń gbé lágbègbè yìí fi hàn bùáyà.
target: The loving concern and hospitality demonstrated by publishers in the surrounding areas have been outstanding.

input: Torí ìfẹ́ tó jinlẹ̀ táwọn ará fi hàn, alábòójútó àyíká kan sọ pé Kò ṣòro fún wa rárá láti rí ilé táwọn tó sá kúrò nílé máa gbé.A dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ Jèhófà torí àwọn tó ti di orísun ìtùnú fún àwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin wa tí iná yìí lé kúrò nílé.
target: Regarding this outpouring of Christian love, one circuit overseer noted, We had no problem finding housing for all those displaced.We are grateful to Jehovah for those who have become a source of great comfort for our brothers and sisters affected by these wildfires.

input: Ní November 14, 2019, ọmọ ilé ìwé kan dàbọn bolẹ̀ láàárín àwọn ọmọ kíláàsì rẹ̀ ní ilé ẹ̀kọ́ girama tó wà nílùú Santa Clarita, ní California.
target: On November 14, 2019, a student opened fire on fellow classmates at a high school in Santa Clarita, California.

input: Ọmọ náà pa ọmọ ilé ìwé méjì, ó sì ṣe àwọn mẹ́ta léṣe, kó tó wá pa ara ẹ̀.
target: The gunman killed two students and wounded three, before shooting himself.

input: Ó bani nínú jẹ́ pé Dominic Blackwell, ọmọ arábìnrin wa kan wà lára àwọn ọmọ ilé ìwé tó yìnbọn pa.
target: Sadly, Dominic Blackwell, the son of one of our sisters, was one of the students killed.

input: Ọmọ ọdún mẹ́rìnlá 14 ni, ó sì máa ń lọ sí ìpàdé déédéé pẹ̀lú ìyá rẹ̀ tó ń jẹ́ Nancy Blackwell.
target: He was 14 years old and regularly attended meetings with his mother, Sister Nancy Blackwell.

input: Bàbá, ìyá àti àbúrò mẹ́ta ni Dominic fi sílẹ̀.
target: Dominic is survived by his parents and three younger siblings.

input: Àwọn alàgbà ń pèsè ìtùnú látinú Ìwé Mímọ́ fún ìdílé yìí àtàwọn ará ìjọ wọn.
target: The elders are providing Scriptural comfort and support to the family and the local congregation.

input: Ó bà wá nínú jẹ́ gan-an pé irú àjálù burúkú yìí ṣẹlẹ̀.
target: We are deeply saddened to hear about this tragedy.

input: À ń retí ìgbà tí Ọlọ́run máa ‘nu gbogbo omijé kúrò tí ikú ò ní sí mọ́, tí kò sì ní sí ọ̀fọ̀ tàbí ẹkún tàbí ìrora mọ́.’
target: We long for the time when God will wipe out every tear .

input: Déètì August 9 sí 11, 2019
target: August 9-11, 2019

input: Ibi Tó Ti Wáyé Chase Field ní Phoenix, Arizona, Orílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà
target: Chase Field in Phoenix, Arizona, United States

input: Àwọn Ẹ̀ka Ọ́fíìsì Tá A Pè Australasia, ilẹ̀ Gẹ̀ẹ́sì, Kánádà, Central Europe, Chile, Faransé, Gíríìsì, Íńdíà, Ítálì, Kòríà, Micronesia, Scandinavia, Sri Lanka, Tahiti, Thailand, Trinidad and Tobago, Tọ́kì
target: Australasia, Britain, Canada, Central Europe, Chile, France, Greece, India, Italy, Korea, Micronesia, Scandinavia, Sri Lanka, Tahiti, Thailand, Trinidad and Tobago, Turkey

input: Ìrírí Steve Moore tó jẹ́ ààrẹ àti Ọ̀gá àgbà iléeṣẹ́ kan tí wọ́n ń pè ní Visit Phoenix, ló bá wa ṣètò ibi tá a ti ṣe àpéjọ náà, àwọn òtẹ́ẹ̀lì àti ibi ìgbafẹ́ tá a ṣeré lọ ní ìlú Phoenix, ó sọ pé
target: Steve Moore, the president and CEO of Visit Phoenix, which helps book conventions, hotels, and resorts in the Phoenix area, commented

input: Ọjọ́ pẹ́ gan-an tí mo ti ń ṣiṣẹ́ yìí, àmọ́ àpéjọ yín ló ṣì wà létòletò jù látìgbà tí mo ti ń ṣiṣẹ́ yìí.Inú mi dùn pé a jọ ṣiṣẹ́.
target: This convention is the most professionally organized convention I’ve ever had the pleasure of working with in a very long career.

input: Yàtọ̀ síyẹn, ẹ ṣèlérí pé ẹ máa jẹ́ kí pápá ìṣeré yìí wà ní mímọ́ kẹ́ ẹ tó kúrò, kò sẹ́ni tó sọ bẹ́ẹ̀ rí, àfẹ̀yin nìkan.
target: And on top of that, you promise to clean the stadium before you leave—no one else does that.

input: Bẹ̀rẹ̀ láti January 2019, ó ti ṣeé ṣe fáwọn tó gbọ́ Èdè Adití ti Amẹ́ríkà ASL láti túbọ̀ gbádùn ìbẹ̀wò wọn sí oríléeṣẹ́ wa.
target: In January 2019, the museum exhibits at world headquarters were officially made available in American Sign Language ASL.

input: Arákùnrin Enrique Ford, tó jẹ́ alábòójútó Ẹ̀ka Àwọn Nǹkan Ìṣẹ̀ǹbáyé sọ pé Iṣẹ́ kékeré kọ́ ni ẹ̀ka ìtúmọ̀ èdè àti ti kọ̀ǹpútà ṣe láti mú káwọn ará wa lóye àwọn nǹkan ìṣẹ̀ǹbáyé yìí ní Èdè Adití ti Amẹ́ríkà ASL
target: Enrique Ford, who oversees the Museum Department,The translation and computer programming effort that went into making the museum content available to the ASL community was extraordinary

input: Ẹ gbọ́ ohun tó sọ Nígbà tí mò ń wo àlàyé nípa àtẹ náà lédè adití lórí ẹ̀rọ tí wọ́n gbé fún mi, orí mi wú
target: Getting the device with ASL content was thrilling

input: Bí mo ṣe bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí í gbọ́ àlàyé náà lédè mi làwọn nǹkan wá túbọ̀ ṣe kedere sí mi.
target: After watching a few tracks in ASL, I started to get a sense of Jehovah’s name in a way that I never had before.

input: Mẹ́tàlélógún 23 làwọn arákùnrin àti arábìnrin tó kópa nínu rẹ̀, adití ni mẹ́fà lára wọn, mẹ́fà míì sì láwọn òbí tó jẹ́ adití.Gbogbo wọn ló lọ́wọ́ nínú iṣẹ́ títúmọ̀ àwọn àlàyé yẹn sí ASL, wọ́n sì tún kópa nínú àwọn fídíò náà.
target: A total of 23 brothers and sisters, including 6 deaf and 6 hearing publishers who grew up with deaf parents, helped with the translation and production of the museum content into ASL.

input: Fídíò tí wọ́n ṣe lé ní ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́sàn-án 900, wọ́n sì gùn tó nǹkan bíi wákàtí mẹ́sàn-án, kó lè bá àlàyé tá a ti gba ohùn rẹ̀ sílẹ̀ mu.
target: The translation group filmed over 900 videos, about nine hours of content, to match the museum audio tracks.

input: Ilé ìgbohùnsílẹ̀ mẹ́ta tó wà fún èdè adití la ti ṣe iṣẹ́ náà Ọ́fíìsì àwọn atúmọ̀ Èdè Adití ASL ní Fort Lauderdale, ìpínlẹ̀ Florida èyí tó wà ní ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì orílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà ní Wallkill, ìpínlẹ̀ New York àtèyí tó wà ní oríléeṣẹ́ wa ní Warwick, ìpínlẹ̀ New York.
target: the ASL remote translation office in Fort Lauderdale, Florida the United States branch facilities in Wallkill, New York and the world headquarters offices in Warwick, New York.

input: Díẹ̀ rèé lára àwọn arákùnrin àti arábìnrin tó túmọ̀ sí èdè adití nípa àwọn ohun ìṣẹ̀ǹbáyé tá a pàtẹ sí Warwick.
target: Some of the brothers and sisters who assisted with the production of the ASL content for the Warwick museum.

input: Yàtọ̀ sáwọn ẹ̀rọ téèyàn lè mú dání, Ẹ̀ka Ìṣẹ̀ǹbáyé tún ṣètò ohun tá a lè pè ní tẹlifíṣọ̀n gàdàgbà mẹ́rìnlá míì tó ń ṣàgbéyọ àwọn ohun ìṣẹ̀ǹbáyé náà, tó sì ń ṣàlàyé wọn lédè ASL.
target: The Museum Department also enabled the existing 14 touch screens in the exhibits to accommodate ASL videos.

input: Mark Sanderson, tó jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára Ìgbìmọ̀ Olùdarí Àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà sọ pé Kí nìdí tá a fi ṣètò ìpàtẹ àwọn ohun ìṣẹ̀ǹbáyé yìí A fẹ́ kó fún gbogbo àwọn tó ń ṣèbẹ̀wò sí oríléeṣẹ́ wa níṣìírí, kó sì fún ìgbàgbọ́ wọn lókun.
target: Mark Sanderson, a member of the Governing Body of Jehovah’s Witnesses,The purpose of the Warwick museum is to encourage and build up the faith of all who visit world headquarters.

input: Kò sí àní-àní, gbogbo àwọn tó ti wá síbí lo pinnu pé títí láé làwọn á máa gbẹ́kẹ̀ lé Ọlọ́run.—Sáàmù 787.
target: All who do so will be encouraged to continue to put their confidence in God.—Psalm 787.

input: A ṣí i ní April 3, 2017, ìpàtẹ yìí pín sọ́nà mẹ́ta ní oríléeṣẹ́ wa tó wà nílùú Warwick, ní New York.Kò sí pé ẹnì kan ń mú èèyàn kiri ibẹ̀ tàbí kó máa ṣàlàyé fúnni.
target: Opened since April 3, 2017, the self-guided tours at world headquarters in Warwick, New York, are comprised of three exhibits.

input: The Bible and the Divine Name ṣàlàyé báwọn kan ṣe sapá fún ọ̀pọ̀ ọdún láti tẹ Ọ̀rọ̀ Ọlọ́run àti orúkọ rẹ̀ rì àtohun tí kò jẹ́ kí wọ́n ṣàṣeyọrí.
target: The Bible and the Divine Name highlights that both God’s Word and his name have been preserved throughout history.

input: Àìsáyà 408 Èèyàn á rí àwọn Bíbélì tó ṣọ̀wọ́n, tó lé lọ́gọ́rùn-ún 100 àtàwọn ohun ìṣẹ̀ǹbáyé míì tó jẹ mọ́ Bíbélì.
target: Isaiah 408 Over 100 rare Biblical scrolls, leaves, manuscripts, and books are showcased.

input: A People for Jehovah’s Name ṣe àfihàn ohun táwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà gbé ṣe àtohun tó ṣẹlẹ̀ sí wa látọdún yìí wá.
target: A People for Jehovah’s Name includes a visual history of Jehovah’s Witnesses.

input: Àwọn ohun ìṣẹ̀ǹbáyé àti ìrírí àwọn tọ́rọ̀ ṣojú wọn jẹ́ ká rí bí Jèhófà ṣe ń darí àwa èèyàn rẹ̀ látọdún yìí wá.
target: Artifacts and first-person accounts showing how Jehovah has progressively guided his people are featured.

input: World Headquarters—Faith in Action ṣàlàyé ojúṣe ìgbìmọ̀ mẹ́fẹ̀ẹ̀fà ti Ìgbìmọ̀ Olùdarí àti bí wọ́n ṣe ń bójú tó onírúurú iṣẹ́ táwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ń ṣe kárí ayé.
target: World Headquarters—Faith in Action explains the work of the six committees of the Governing Body and how they organize the worldwide activities of Jehovah’s Witnesses.

input: Courage to Stand Firm in a Time of Trial.Wọ́n máa ń pààrọ̀ ohun tí wọ́n kó síbi ìpàtẹ yìí látìgbàdégbà.
target: Courage to Stand Firm in a Time of Trial is a special rotational exhibit.

input: Ó jẹ́ ká mọ bí nǹkan ṣe rí láàárín ọdún 1914 sí 1919, àdánwò ìgbàgbọ́ táwọn Akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ Bíbélì kojú lẹ́nì kọ̀ọ̀kan àti lápapọ̀.
target: It covers the time period of 1914 to 1919, and shows how the Bible Students faced tests of their faith, both individually and as an organization.

input: Ìpàtẹ yìí ń jẹ́ káwọn tó ṣèbẹ̀wò rí àwọn fọ́tò tá a ti yà látọjọ́ gbọ́nhan, àwọn àkọsílẹ̀, àwòrán àtàwọn ìfọ̀rọ̀wánilẹ́nuwò tá a ti gbà sílẹ̀ tipẹ́tipẹ́.Àwọn tó ṣèbẹ̀wò lè tẹ́tí sí i tàbí kí wọ́n wò ó ní fídíò.
target: The interactive experience allows visitors to enjoy rare original photographs, documents, and graphics, as well as audio and video interviews.

input: October 3, 2018 nibi ìpàtẹ yìí ti di àpéwò.
target: It has been open since October 3, 2018.

input: A máa fàwọn nǹkan tá a kó síbi ìpàtẹ yìí ránṣẹ́ sáwọn ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa míì káwọn náà lè pàtẹ wọn, àá wá pàtẹ àwọn nǹkan míì sí Warwick.
target: The exhibit content will eventually be transported and put on display at other branches and a new special exhibition will be opened at Warwick.

input: Déètì May 24 sí 26, 2019
Ibi Tá A Ti Ṣe É Marlins Park nílùú Miami, ìpínlẹ̀ Florida, Amẹ́ríkà
target: Marlins Park in Miami, Florida, United States

input: Áwọn Ẹ̀ka Ọ́fíísì Tó Wá Ajẹntínà, Bolivia, Brazil, Britain, Kánádà, Central America, Central Europe, Chile, Kòlóńbíà, Cuba, Ecuador, Paraguay, Peru, Philippines, Sípéènì
target: Argentina, Bolivia, Brazil, Britain, Canada, Central America, Central Europe, Chile, Colombia, Cuba, Ecuador, Paraguay, Peru, Philippines, Spain

input: Ní Saturday, July 13, 2019, ìjì líle kan rọ́ lu ìlú Louisiana, kó tó di pé ọwọ́ wà rọlẹ̀ díẹ̀ tí wọ́n fi wá ń pè é ní Barry.
target: On Saturday, July 13, 2019, a Category 1 hurricane made landfall in Louisiana before quickly downgrading to a tropical storm known as Barry.

input: Ìjì líle yìí ba nǹkan jẹ́, ó fa àkúnya omi, ó sì jẹ́ kí iná mànàmáná lọ ní ibi púpọ̀ yí ká ìpínlẹ̀ Alabama, Louisiana, àti Mississippi.
target: This tropical storm caused wind damage, flooding, and widespread power outages across the states of Alabama, Louisiana, and Mississippi.

input: Bí o tì lẹ́ jẹ́ pé kò sí akéde kankan tó fara pa tàbí kú nínú ìjì náà, àwọn mẹ́tàlélọ́gọ́fà 123 ni wọ́n di aláìnílé lórí.
target: Although no publishers were injured or killed by this storm, 123 were displaced.

input: Láfikún, ìjì líle náà ba ilé mẹ́tàdínlọ́gọ́rùn-ún 97 tó jẹ́ ti àwọn arákùnrin àti arábìnrin wa jẹ́, pẹ̀lú Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba márùn-ún.
target: Additionally, the storm damaged 27 homes of our brothers and sisters, as well as 5 Kingdom Halls.

input: Àwọn alábòójútó àyíká àti àwọn alàgbà ìjọ ń lọ bẹ àwọn tọ́rọ̀ náà kàn wò kí wọ́n lè fún wọn níṣìírí.
target: Circuit overseers and local elders are shepherding those affected by the storm.

input: Bákan náà làwọn akéde láti àwọn ìjọ tó wà nítòsí ń pèsè omi, oúnjẹ àti ibùgbé níbi tí wọ́n ti nílò wọn.
target: Also, publishers in neighboring congregations are providing water, food, and shelter where needed.

input: Wọ́n ti ń ṣètò bí wọ́n á ṣe tún àwọn ilé tó nílò àtúnṣe ṣe.
target: Efforts to stabilize properties and perform repairs locally are already underway.

input: Àá máa fi àwọn arákùnrin àti àwọn arábìnrin wa ní Gúúsù Amẹ́ríkà tí ìjì líle Barry ṣe lọ́ṣẹ́ sínú àdúrà wa, àá sì máa tì wọ́n lẹ́yìn.
target: Our prayers and support will continue to be with our brothers and sisters in the southern United States as they cope with the aftermath of Tropical Storm Barry.

input: Ní May 31, 2019, ọkùnrin kan bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí í ròjọ̀ ọta ìbọn lu àwọn tó ń ṣiṣẹ́ ní ọ́fíìsì ìlú Virginia Beach, ìpínlẹ̀ Virginia, lórílẹ̀-èdè United States.
target: On May 31, 2019, a gunman opened fire on employees working in a municipal office building in Virginia Beach, Virginia, United States.

input: Èèyàn méjìlá ló kú, àwọn mẹ́rin sì fara pa.
target: Twelve people were killed and four were injured.

input: Ìròyìn tá a gbọ́ láti ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa ní Amẹ́ríkà fi hàn pé, ó ṣeni láàánú pé arábìnrin wa kan tó ń jẹ́, LaQuita Brown, wà lára àwọn tó kù nínú ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ burúkú yìí.
target: The United States branch reports that sadly, one of our sisters, LaQuita Brown, was among those killed in this attack.

input: Ẹni ọdún mọ́kàndínlógójì 39 ni Arábìnrin Brown, aṣáájú-ọ̀nà sì ni nínú Ìjọ Seaview tí wọ́n ti ń sọ èdè Faransé nílùú Norfolk, ìpínlẹ̀ Virginia.
target: Sister Brown was 39 years old and a regular pioneer in the Seaview French Congregation in Norfolk, Virginia.

input: Arábìnrin yìí máa ń yọ̀ǹda ara rẹ̀ láti ṣisẹ́ pẹ̀lú Ẹ̀ka Tó Ń Yàwòrán Ilé Tó sì Ń Kọ́ Ọ.
target: She also served as a LocalDesign Construction volunteer.

input: Àwọn alàgbà tó wà lágbègbè náà àti alábòójútó àyílká wọn ń fún tẹbítọ̀rẹ́ Arábìnrin Brown níṣìírí, wọ́n sì ń tù wọ́n nínú.
target: The local elders, along with the circuit overseer, are providing Scriptural encouragement and emotional support to Sister Brown’s friends and family.

input: Ikú arábìnrin yìí dùn wá gan-an.
target: We are deeply saddened to hear about the loss of our sister.

input: À ń retí àsìkò tí irú ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ burúkú yìí ò ní wáyé mọ́, tí ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àlàáfíà á sì wá káàkiri ayé.
target: We look forward to the time when tragedies like this will no longer occur and there will be an abundance of peace on the earth.

input: Ní April 12 àti 13, 2020, ó lé ní ọgọ́rùn-ún 100 ìgbà tí ìjì líle tí wọ́n ń pè ní tornado ṣoṣẹ́ ní apá gúúsù ìlà oòrùn orílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà.
target: A series of more than 100 tornadoes tore through the southeastern United States from April 12 to April 13, 2020.

input: Àjọ Tó Ń Bójú Tó Ipò Ojú Ọjọ́ sọ pé ọ̀kan lára ìjì líle náà fẹ̀ tó kílòmítà mẹ́ta, ó wà lára àwọn ìjì líle tó tóbi jù tó tíì jà rí.
target: The National Weather Service reported that one tornado, which spanned some two miles in width, was one of the largest in recorded history.

input: Ẹsẹ̀kẹsẹ̀ ni ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì kàn sí àwọn alábòójútó àyíká tó wà ní agbègbè yẹn kí wọ́n lè mọ bí nǹkan ṣe ń lọ sí pẹ̀lú àwọn ará wa.
target: The branch immediately contacted circuit overseers in the area to determine how our brothers were affected.

input: Kò sí ìkankan nínú àwọn ará wa tí ìjì náà pa.Àmọ́, arábìnrin kan fara pa díẹ̀ nígbà tí ìjì náà fẹ́ lu ilé rẹ̀.
target: No brothers or sisters were killed by the severe weather.One sister suffered minor injuries when a tornado hit her home.

input: Àwọn akéde mẹ́tàlélọ́gọ́ta 63 ló ní láti kúrò nílé, ilé méjìlá 12 ló wó, ilé méjìdínlọ́gọ́ta 58 ló sì bà jẹ́.
target: In total, 63 publishers were displaced, 12 homes were destroyed, and 58 homes sustained damage.

input: Láfikún síyẹn, Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba márùn-ún ló bà jẹ́ díẹ̀, àmọ́ igi kan wó lu Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba kan, ó sì bà á jẹ́ gan-an.
target: Additionally, five Kingdom Halls were lightly damaged and one Kingdom Hall sustained major damage from a falling tree.

input: Àwọn alàgbà àtàwọn alábòójútó àyíká ṣì ń kíyè sí bí nǹkan ṣe rí.
target: Local elders and circuit overseers are continuing to evaluate the situation.

input: Wọ́n ń bójú tó ohun táwọn ará nílò nípa tara àti nípa tẹ̀mí, wọ́n sì ń pèsè ìtùnú fáwọn tí àjálù náà bá.​
target: They are caring for the immediate practical and spiritual needs of our brothers and sisters, providing much-needed comfort to those who suffered loss.

input: Ìjì líle kan tí wọ́n pè ní Florence jà lọ́pọ̀ ibi ní ìpínlẹ̀ North Carolina, South Carolina àtàwọn ìpínlẹ̀ míì lórílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà, omíyalé sì tún ṣẹlẹ̀ níbẹ̀.
target: Tropical Depression Florence has inundated large parts of North Carolina, South Carolina, and other states with floodwaters.

input: Ìgbà kan wà tí ìjì líle tí wọ́n ń pè ní Florence yìí pa ó kéré tán, èèyàn méjìlélọ́gbọ̀n 32, tó sì sọ ẹgbẹẹgbẹ̀rún èèyàn di aláìrílégbé.
target: Initially a Category 4 hurricane, Florence has killed at least 32 people and displaced thousands.

input: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa ní Amẹ́ríkà sọ pé kò sí ìkankan lára àwọn akéde wa tó bá ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ náà lọ tàbí tó fara pa ju bó ṣe yẹ, bó tiẹ̀ jẹ́ pé ó lé ní ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́rin 4,000 Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà tí ìjì náà lé kúrò níbi tí wọ́n ń gbé.
target: The United States branch reports that no publishers have been killed or seriously injured by the storm, although over 4,000 Witnesses have been displaced.

input: Lóòótọ́, ìjì náà ti jà tán, síbẹ̀ àwọn ibì kan ò tíì ṣeé dé torí omi tó bo gbogbo ibẹ̀.
target: Though conditions are improving, some areas are still not accessible due to high floodwaters.

input: Àyẹ̀wò tí wọ́n ṣe gbẹ̀yìn fi hàn pé ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́ta àti mọ́kànléláàádọ́ta 351 ilé àwọn ará wa pẹ̀lú Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba mọ́kànlélógún 21 ni ìjì náà bà jẹ́.
target: Current assessments indicate that the storm damaged 351 homes of our brothers and sisters and 21 Kingdom Halls.

input: Ìgbìmọ̀ Tó Ń Ṣètò Ìrànwọ́ Nígbà Àjálù ń ṣiṣẹ́ lórí bí àwọn ará ṣe máa rí oúnjẹ, omi, ibùgbé àti ìtọ́jú ìṣègùn tí wọ́n nílò.
target: Food, water, clothing, shelter, and basic medical needs are being coordinated through a Disaster Relief Committee DRC.

input: Àwùjọ méjì kan tún wà tó ń ṣèrànwọ́ láti kó àwọn igi tó wó lulẹ̀ kúrò lágbègbè náà.
target: Relief efforts include the work of two tree removal crews who are assisting with the widespread damage.

input: Ohun tó kù báyìí ni bí wọ́n ṣe máa tún àwọn nǹkan tí omíyalé ti bà jẹ́ ṣe.Àwọn ará láwọn ìjọ tó wà níbẹ̀ àtàwọn tó wá láti ibòmíì ń yọ̀ǹda ara wọn láti bá Ìgbìmọ̀ Tó Ń Ṣètò Ìrànwọ́ Nígbà Àjálù náà ṣiṣẹ́.
target: With flooding now becoming the major concern, volunteers from local congregations and others invited from elsewhere are coming to assist and will be working under the direction of the DRC.

input: Àwọn alàgbà ìjọ àti àwọn alábòójútó àyíká tó wà níbẹ̀ sì ń lọ sọ́dọ̀ àwọn tọ́rọ̀ náà kàn láti fún wọn níṣìírí.
target: Local elders and circuit overseers are making shepherding visits on those affected.

input: À ń gbàdúrà fún àwọn ará wa tí nǹkan nira fún nítorí ìjì líle tó jà lẹ́nu àìpẹ́ yìí, a sì ń retí ìgbà tí ‘ẹ̀rù kankan’ ò ní bà wá mọ́.
target: We pray for our brothers and sisters who are dealing with difficult circumstances as a result of the recent storm and look forward to the time when we will feel no dread.

input: Ní Sunday March 3, 2019, ìjì tó le gan-an jà láwọn apá ibì kan ní ìpínlẹ̀ Alabama, Florida àti Georgia, ó gbẹ̀mí èèyàn mẹ́tàlélógún 23, ọ̀pọ̀ èèyàn ló sì fara pa.
target: Deadly tornadoes ripped through portions of Alabama, Florida, and Georgia, on Sunday, March 3, 2019, resulting in 23 fatalities and dozens of injuries.

input: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa ní Amẹ́ríkà sọ pé kò sí ìkankan lára àwọn ará wa tó kú.
target: The United States branch reports that there were no deaths among our brothers.

input: Àmọ́ arábìnrin wa kan fara pa nígbà tí ìjì líle ba ilé rẹ̀ jẹ́ pátápátá ní ìlú Fort Valley, ìpínlẹ̀ Georgia.
target: However, one of our sisters was injured when a tornado completely destroyed her home in Fort Valley, Georgia.

input: Wọ́n ti ń tọ́jú rẹ̀ nílé ìwòsàn kan tó wà nítòsí.
target: She is getting the necessary medical attention at a nearby hospital.

input: Yàtọ̀ síyẹn, ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì sọ pé ilé mẹ́fà àwọn ará wa ni ìjì náà bà jẹ́, ó sì wó ilé mẹ́rin míì pátápátá.
target: Additionally, the branch reports that six of our brothers’ homes sustained damage and four others were totally destroyed.

input: Àwọn alábòójútó àyíká tó wà lágbègbè náà ń ṣètò báwọn ará ṣe ń rí oúnjẹ, ibi tí wọ́n á gbé àti aṣọ, àwọn alàgbà sì ń fi Bíbélì fún wọn níṣìírí.
target: Under the direction of circuit overseers in the area, publishers have supplied food, shelter, and clothing to the affected brothers, and local elders are providing spiritual comfort.

input: Àdúrà wa ni pé kí àwọn ará wa tí àjálù yìí kàn rí ìtùnú nínú ẹṣin ọdún wa ti 2019 tó sọ pé, Má wò yí ká, nítorí èmi ni Ọlọ́run rẹ.
target: We pray that our brothers who have been impacted by this disaster are comforted by our yeartext for 2019, Do not be anxious, for I am your God.

input: Bí ètò ọrọ̀ ajé ṣe túbọ̀ ń dẹnu kọlẹ̀ ní Fẹnẹsúélà nípa lórí àwọn ará wa lọ́kùnrin àti lóbìnrin.
target: The ongoing economic crisis in Venezuela continues to affect our brothers and sisters.

input: Ọ̀sọ̀ọ̀sẹ̀ ni ìròyìn nípa àwọn ará wa tí wọ́n hùwà ọ̀daràn sí ń dé ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa ní Fẹnẹsúélà.
target: Every week, the branch office in Venezuela receives reports of publishers who have been victims of crimes.

input: Bákan náà, ọ̀pọ̀ Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba lórílẹ̀-èdè náà ni wọ́n ti jí àwọn nǹkan tó wà nínu rẹ̀ kó lọ.
target: Also, numerous Kingdom Halls in the country have been burglarized.

input: Àwọn ará wa ń fara dà á bó tiẹ̀ jẹ́ pé gbogbo nǹkan ló ti gbówó lérí, bẹ́ẹ̀ ni kò sí oúnjẹ, oògùn àtàwọn nǹkan tó ṣe pàtàkì míì.
target: Our brothers face hyperinflation as well as shortages of food, medicine, and other basic goods.

input: Látọdún 2013, ó lé ní ọ̀kẹ́ kan 20,000 akéde tó ti sá lọ́ sáwọn orílẹ̀-èdè míì bíi, Ajẹntínà, Brazil, Chile, Kòlóńbíà, Ecuador, Ítálì, Peru, Pọ́túgà, Sípéènì àti Amẹ́ríkà.
target: Since 2013, over 20,000 publishers have fled to other countries, including Argentina, Brazil, Chile, Colombia, Ecuador, Italy, Peru, Portugal, Spain, and the United States.

input: Láìka gbogbo ìṣòro yìí sí, nǹkan bí ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà ogóje 140,000 Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà tó wà ní Fẹnẹsúélà báyìí ń bá ìjọsìn wọn lọ.
target: Despite these difficult circumstances, the approximately 140,000 Jehovah’s Witnesses who remain in Venezuela are active in their spiritual activities.

input: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa ní Fẹnẹsúélà kò dáwọ́ dúró láti máa ṣètò ìrànwọ́ lórílẹ̀-èdè náà.
target: The branch office in Venezuela continues to organize the ongoing relief work within the country.

input: Lọ́wọ́lọ́wọ́ báyìí, ọgọ́ta 60 ìgbìmọ̀ tó ń ṣètò ìrànwọ́ ló ń ṣiṣẹ́ kára láti pín oúnjẹ fáwọn ará lọ́kùnrin àti lóbìnrin.
target: There are now 60 relief committees, which have primarily been tasked with distributing food to the brothers and sisters.

input: Títí di báyìí, ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa ní Fẹnẹsúélà pẹ̀lú èyí tó wà nílẹ̀ Brazil ti pín oúnjẹ tí àwọn ará kó jọ, tó sì kún ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ọkọ̀ akẹ́rù fún àwọn akéde tó lé ní ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́rìnlélọ́gọ́ta 64,000 láwọn ìjọ ẹgbẹ̀rún kan, ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́rin àti mẹ́tàdínlọ́gọ́rùn-ún 1,497.
target: To date, the Venezuela branch, with the assistance of the Brazil branch, has distributed hundreds of tons of donated food to over 64,000 publishers in 1,497 congregations.

input: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa ní Fẹnẹsúélà tún ń pèsè àwọn ohun táwọn ará nílò láti máa bá ìjọsìn wọn lọ.
target: The Venezuela branch also continues to help care for the spiritual needs of the brothers and sisters.

input: Lọ́dún yìí, Àpéjọ Agbègbè Jẹ́ Onígboyà méjìlélọ́gọ́fà 122 ni wọ́n ṣe káàkiri orílẹ̀-èdè náà, September 2, 2018 ni wọ́n parí èyí tó kẹ́yìn lára wọn.
target: This summer, there were 122 Be Courageous Regional Conventions held throughout the country, the last of which concluded on September 2, 2018.

input: Àpéjọ Agbègbè yìí túbọ̀ fún àwọn ará lókun gan-an nípa tẹ̀mí, ọ̀pọ̀ lára wọn ló sì tiraka gan-an kí wọ́n tó lè wá sí àpéjọ náà.
target: The conventions provided a vital spiritual boost to the brothers and sisters, many of whom had to overcome severe economic challenges to attend.

input: Àwọn ará ní Fẹnẹsúélà ń ṣiṣẹ́ kára láti fi ọ̀rọ̀ Bíbélì tu ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn tí wàhálà ti bá lórílẹ̀-èdè náà nínú.
target: Witnesses in Venezuela are actively comforting the many distressed people in the country with the Bible’s message.

input: Ní báyìí, iye ìkẹ́kọ̀ọ́ Bíbélì táwọn akéde ń darí lóṣooṣù fẹ́rẹ̀ẹ́ tó ọ̀kẹ́ mẹ́wàá 200,000.
target: Currently, publishers conduct close to 200,000 Bible studies each month.

input: Iye àwọn tó ń kẹ́kọ̀ọ́, tí wọ́n sì ń wá sípàdé ti pọ̀ sí i, àwọn ẹgbẹ̀rún méje ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́jì àti mọ́kàndínlọ́góta 7,259 ló sì ṣèrìbọmi.
target: There has also been an increase of newly interested ones attending congregation meetings, and 7,259 individuals were baptized.

input: Àwọn ìtẹ̀síwájú tí à ń rí yìí fi hàn pé ẹ̀mí Ọlọ́run ló ń fún àwọn ará wa ní Fẹnẹsúélà lágbára.
target: These positive spiritual developments demonstrate that God’s spirit is fortifying our Venezuelan brothers and sisters.

input: Àdúrà wa ni pé kí wọ́n gbára lé Jèhófà títí dìgbà tí Ìjọba rẹ̀ máa fòpin sí gbogbo wàhálà tí à ń kojú báyìí.—Òwe 35, 6.
target: We pray that they continue to trust in Jehovah until his Kingdom ends all present distresses.—Proverbs 35, 6.

input: Tó o bá fẹ́ mọ̀ sí i nípa ohun tó ń ṣẹlẹ̀ ní Fẹnẹsúélà, wo fídíò Fẹnẹsúélà—Wọ́n Ní Ìfẹ́ àti Ìgbàgbọ́ Bí Nǹkan Tiẹ̀ Nira.
target: For more information on the situation in Venezuela, watch the video Venezuela—Love and Faith During Difficult Times.

input: ìpínrọ̀ 2 Láwọn àkókò tí ọrọ̀ ajé àti ètò ìṣèlú ò bá fara rọ, akéde kọ̀ọ̀kàn ló máa pinnu bóyá kí òun kúrò lórílẹ̀-èdè tóun ń gbé tàbí kóun dúró.
target: par.2 In times of economic, social, or political crisis, each publisher must decide whether or not to flee their country of residence.

input: Ètò Ọlọ́run kì í pinnu fáwọn èèyàn bóyá kí wọ́n kúrò tàbí kí wọ́n dúró.
target: The organization does not promote or encourage one’s decision to either leave or remain.

input: Ìlú ò fara rọ, ọrọ̀ ajé sì ti dẹnu kọlẹ̀ lórílẹ̀-èdè Fẹnẹsúélà.
target: The social and economic crisis in Venezuela continues.

input: Àwọn èèyàn ò rí oúnjẹ, omi, epo pẹtiróòlù, ati oògùn tí wọ́n máa lò torí kò sí lárọ̀ọ́wọ́tó, èyí tó wà sì gbówó lérí.
target: Access to food, water, fuel, and medicine is severely limited because of shortages and high prices.

input: Àìsí iná ti mú kí oúnjẹ túbọ̀ ṣọ̀wọ́n, torí kò sí bí wọ́n á ṣe tọjú rẹ̀ kó má bàa bà jẹ́.
target: Frequent power outages have intensified the food shortages, as the lack of power interferes with refrigeration.

input: Ìwà ọ̀daràn sì ń peléke sí i.
target: Crime is a constant concern.

input: Síbẹ̀, lójú gbogbo ìṣòro yìí, àwọn akéde ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́rìndínlógóje àtààbọ̀ 136,500 tó wà ní Fẹnẹsúélà ó yéé fìtara wàásù.
target: Despite these difficult conditions, the over 136,500 publishers in Venezuela continue to share zealously in the ministry.

input: Bí àpẹẹrẹ, ní January 2019, bó tiẹ̀ jẹ́ pé iye àwọn akéde lórílẹ̀-èdè náà fi ẹgbẹ̀rún méje 7,000 dín sí tọdún tó kọjá, wákàtí tí wọ́n fi wàásù fi ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà àádọ́rùn-ún 90,000 ju ti tẹ́lẹ̀ lọ.
target: For example, in January 2019, although there were 7,000 fewer publishers in the country compared to the previous year, they dedicated 90,000 more hours in the field ministry.

input: Ní April 2019, ìkẹ́kọ̀ọ́ Bíbélì tí wọ́n ṣe fẹ́rẹ̀ẹ́ tó ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà ọgọ́rùn-ún méjì 195,600.
target: In April 2019, more than 195,600 Bible studies were being conducted.

input: Àwọn aṣáájú-ọ̀nà déédéé pọ̀ sí i, wọ́n ti lé ní ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà ọgbọ̀n 30,000.
target: The number of regular pioneers rose to over 30,000.

input: Àwọn ará kọ́wọ́ ti ẹ̀tò tá a ṣe kárí ayé láti pe àwọn èèyàn wá síbi Ìrántí Ikú Kristi, ìyẹn sì mú kí iye àwọn aṣáájú-ọ̀nà olùrànlọ́wọ́ di ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà ogún ó lé ọgọ́rùn mẹ́rin 20,400.
target: In response to the special worldwide effort to invite others to the Memorial of Christ’s death, the number of auxiliary pioneers increased to 20,400.

input: Ìsapá tí wọ́n ṣe yìí mú kí nǹkan bí ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́rin ó lé mọ́kànléláàádọ́rin 471,000 èèyàn wá síbi Ìrántí Ikú Kristi, èyí sì ju ìlọ́po mẹ́ta iye àwọn akéde tó wà lórílẹ̀-èdè náà.
target: These efforts no doubt contributed to almost 471,000 people attending the Memorial—more than triple the number of publishers.

input: Bákan náà, ọ̀pọ̀ èèyàn ló ń wá sípàde, torí pé àwọn ará ò yéé kọ́ àwọn tó ń wá ojútùú sí ìṣòro wọn lẹ́kọ̀ọ́ Bíbélì.
target: Additionally, congregation meetings are well supported, in part, because our brothers continue to provide the Bible’s message to people searching for a trustworthy solution to their problems.

input: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa ní Fẹnẹsúélà ṣètò iṣẹ́ ìrànwọ́ kí àwọn ará wa lè rí ohun tí wọ́n nílò jẹ.
target: The Venezuela branch continues to coordinate relief efforts to help our brothers receive basic food items to supplement their diet.

input: Lọ́lá ìrànwọ́ láti àwọn ẹ̀ka tó wà láyìíká àti owó ìtìlẹyìn kárí ayé, oṣooṣù ni ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa ní Fẹnẹsúélà ń pín ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ẹrù oúnjẹ fún ẹgbẹ̀rún márùndínlọ́gọ́rin 75,000 akéde ní ìjọ ẹgbẹ̀rún kan ọgọ́rùn márùn-ún ó lé márùndínlọ́gọ́rùn-ún 1,595.
target: Each month, with the assistance of neighboring branches and generous donations to the worldwide work, the Venezuela branch distributes hundreds of tons of donated food to 75,000 publishers in 1,595 congregations.

input: Ọ̀pọ̀ ìṣoro làwọn ará wa ní Fẹnẹsúélà ń fara dà, àmọ́ inú wa dùn pé wọ́n ń ‘yọ̀ gidigidi nínú Jèhófà, inú wọn sì ń dùn nínú Ọlọ́run ìgbàlà wọn.
target: Our brothers in Venezuela face many difficulties, but we are encouraged that they continue ‘exulting in Jehovah and being joyful in the God of their salvation.

input: ÌLÚ NEW YORK— Kárí ayé ni àwọn oníròyìn ti ń sọ nípa wàhálà tó ń bá orílẹ̀-èdè Fẹnẹsúélà nítorí ọrọ̀ ajé tó dẹnu kọlẹ̀.
target: NEW YORK—International media outlets have been reporting on deteriorating conditions in Venezuela set off by economic troubles.

input: Ìgbìmọ̀ Ẹ̀ka Ọ́fíìsì orílẹ̀-èdè Fẹnẹsúélà sọ pé wàhálà náà ò yọ àwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin wa sílẹ̀.
target: The Venezuela Branch Committee reports that our brothers and sisters have also been affected by this crisis.

input: Àwọn ìròyìn yìí ò múnú Ìgbìmọ̀ Olùdarí dùn rárá.
target: The Governing Body of Jehovah’s Witnesses is deeply concerned by these reports.

input: Àwọn adigunjalè wọ àwọn Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba kan nígbà tí ìpàdé àárín ọ̀sẹ̀ ń lọ lọ́wọ́, wọ́n sì jí àwọn ẹ̀rọ̀ abánáṣiṣẹ́ àtàwọn nǹkan iyebíye míì.
target: Armed criminals have entered some Kingdom Halls during weekly meetings to steal electronic devices and other valuables.

input: Yàtọ̀ síyẹn, àwọn ìgbà míì wà tí àwọn ará máa ṣèpàdé ní ilé àdáni, torí pé àwọn tó ń bára wọn jà ò jẹ́ kí wọ́n rọ́nà dé Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba.
target: Additionally, in some cases, meetings are held in private homes because violent conflicts block access to Kingdom Halls.

input: Ọ̀pọ̀ lára àwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin wa ló wà lára àwọn tí iṣẹ́ bọ́ mọ́ lọ́wọ́ torí pé ibi tí wọ́n ti ń ṣiṣẹ́ kógbá wọlé.
target: A number of our brothers and sisters are among those who have lost their jobs because their place of employment closed down.

input: Ṣe ni àwọn ọ̀daràn àtàwọn jàǹdùkú tún ń dájú sọ àwọn tó níṣẹ́ ara wọn, ìyẹn lò fà á táwọn kan fi gbé okòwò wọn tà, tí wọ́n sì sá kúrò nílùú kí wọ́n lè rímú mí.
target: Some who own businesses have been targeted by criminals and gangs and, as a result, have been forced to sell their business and flee the country for their safety.

input: Èyí tó burú jù ni ohun tí ìròyìn tó dé ní August 10, 2017 sọ, pé àwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin mẹ́tàdínláàádọ́ta 47 ni wọ́n ti pa.
target: Tragically, reports as of August 10, 2017, indicate that 47 of our brothers and sisters have been murdered.

input: Àwọn míì tiẹ̀ tún gbẹ́mìí mì torí pé wọn ò rí ìtọ́jú tó yẹ gbà.
target: Some have also died because they could not obtain needed medical treatment.

input: Ìgbìmọ̀ Olùdarí ń wo bí nǹkan ṣe ń lọ sí lójú méjèèjì, wọ́n ń lo lára owó táwọn èèyàn fi ṣètọrẹ láti ran àwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin tí wọ́n nílò oúnjẹ, ilé gbígbé àtàwọn nǹkan míì lọ́wọ́.
target: The Governing Body continues to closely monitor the situation, utilizing donated funds allocated to assist brothers and sisters who are in need of basic relief supplies.

input: Ìgbìmọ̀ Olùdarí tún ń bá àwọn Ẹ̀ka Ọ́fíìsì kárí ayé sọ̀rọ̀ kí wọ́n lè rí ọ̀nà tó dáa jù láti ran àwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin wa ní Fẹnẹsúélà lọ́wọ́, torí pé ó léwu kéèyàn sọ pé òun fẹ́ lọ síbẹ̀ lọ ràn wọ́n lọ́wọ́.
target: The Governing Body is also communicating with other branches around the world to ascertain the most appropriate means of providing support for our brothers and sisters in Venezuela, since individual efforts to provide direct assistance can be dangerous.

input: Ìgbìmọ̀ Ẹ̀ka orílẹ̀-èdè Fẹnẹsúélà ti yan ìgbìmọ̀ tó ń bójú tó ètò ìrànwọ́ pàjáwìrì sí ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì náà, ìgbìmọ̀ tí wọ́n yàn yìí sì ń bójú tó ìgbìmọ̀ kéékèèké mẹ́rìnlélógún 24 míì káàkiri orílẹ̀-èdè náà láti pèsè ohun tí àwọn ará nílò.
target: The Venezuela Branch Committee has set up an emergency relief committee at the branch office that oversees 24 subcommittees throughout the country to care for the needs of our brothers.

input: Tímótì 31-5 2 Tímótì 42 Luis R.Navas tó jẹ́ agbẹnusọ láti ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì orílẹ̀-èdè Fẹnẹsúélà sọ pé A ò tíì lọ́rọ̀ nípa tẹ̀mí báyìí rí.
target: Timothy 31-5 2 Timothy 42 Luis R.Navas, a spokesman from the Venezuela branch office,Spiritually, we have never been so prosperous.

input: Àwọn tó ń wá sípàdé ìjọ ti pọ̀ sí i.
target: Our congregation meeting attendance has increased.

input: Ọ̀pọ̀ akéde ló ti bẹ̀rẹ̀ aṣáájú-ọ̀nà déédéé, wọ́n sì ń ṣọ́ra ṣe bí wọ́n ń wàásù.
target: More publishers are regular pioneering while at the same time exercising greater caution in the ministry.

input: Kárí ayé, àwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin bíi tiwọn á máa tì wọ́n lẹ́yìn nìṣó, wọn ò sì ní dákẹ́ àdúrà lórí wọn.
target: Around the world, their fellow brothers and sisters will continue to support them and pray in their behalf.

input: Ní Wednesday, August 23, ìjì líle tó léńkekà kan tó ń jẹ́ Hato, jà ní apá gúúsù orílẹ̀-èdè Ṣáínà, ó sì dé ìlu Hong Kong àti Macau.
target: On Wednesday, August 23, Hato, a Category 10 typhoon, battered southern China, including the cities of Hong Kong and Macau.

input: Kò sí ẹni kankan tá a gbọ́ pé ó kú nílùú Hong Kong, àmọ́ àwọn mẹ́tàlélógbọ̀n 34 ló fara pa.
target: No deaths were reported in Hong Kong, but 34 people were injured.

input: Nílùú Macau, ó kéré tán àwọn mẹ́sàn-án ló kú, àwọn mẹ́tàléláàdọ́jọ 153 sì fara pa.
target: In Macau, at least 9 people died and 153 were injured.

input: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì àwa Ẹlẹ́rìi Jèhófa ní ìlu Hong Kong, tó tún ń bójú tó iṣẹ́ àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí nílùú Macau, ròyìn pé kò sí Ẹlẹ́rìi kankan tó bá ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ yìí lọ.
target: The branch office of Jehovah’s Witnesses in Hong Kong, which also coordinates the Witnesses’ work in Macau, reported that no Witnesses were killed by the typhoon.

input: Àmọ́, ọ̀pọ̀ ni kò ní iná àti omi tí wọ́n máa lò nílùú Macau.
target: However, many are without power and potable water in Macau.

input: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì ń ṣètò pẹ̀lú àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí lágbègbè yẹn láti pèsè omi àti àwọn ohun míì tí àwọn ará wọn tí àjálù yìí dé bá nílò.
target: The branch office is coordinating with local Witnesses to provide their fellow believers in need with drinking water and other supplies.

input: Àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìi Jèhófa tó ju ẹgbẹ̀rún márùn-ún àti ọgọ́rùn márùn-ún 5,500 ló ń gbé nílùú Hong Kong, àwọn ọgọ́rùn-un mẹ́ta àti ógún 320 ló sì ń gbé nílùú Macau.
target: Over 5,500 Jehovah’s Witnesses live in Hong Kong, and another 320 live in Macau.

input: Ìjì líle tó máa ń bá òjò rìn jà ní ìpínlẹ̀ Kerala, lórílẹ̀-èdè Íńdíà, ó sì mú kí òkè ya lulẹ̀ níbi mẹ́ẹ̀ẹ́dọ́gbọ̀n 25, ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ yìí gbẹ̀mí ó kéré tán, èèyàn márùndínlọ́gọ́rin 75.
target: Heavy monsoon rains in Kerala, India, triggered some 25 landslides, killing at least 75 people.

input: Ẹ̀ka Tó Ń Ṣèwádìí Nípa Ojú Ọjọ́ Nílẹ̀ Íńdíà India Meteorological Department sọ pé ìjì líle tó máa ń jà lápá gúúsù ìwọ̀ oòrùn ayé ló tíì rọ òjò tó rinlẹ̀ jù lọ lápá ibí yìí nínú ìtàn.
target: According to the India Meteorological Department, the current southwest monsoon has produced some of the heaviest rains in the area’s history.

input: Yàtọ̀ síyẹn, arákùnrin wa kan tó jẹ́ ọmọ ọdún mẹ́tàdínlógún 17 bómi lọ níbi tó ti fẹ́ ran ará àdúgbò rẹ̀ lọ́wọ́.
target: Additionally, a 17-year-old brother drowned while trying to save his neighbor.

input: A dá Ìgbìmọ̀ Tó Ń Ṣètò Ìrànwọ́ Nígbà Àjálù DRC sílẹ̀ kí wọ́n lè wo ibi tí nǹkan bà jẹ́ dé, kí wọ́n sì ṣètò ìrànwọ́.
target: A local Disaster Relief Committee DRC was formed to assess the damage and organize the relief effort.

input: Àwọn Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba kan ni wọ́n lò láti ṣe iṣẹ́ ìrànwọ́ yìí.
target: Some Kingdom Halls have been designated to serve as relief centers.

input: Ìròyìn tá a sì kọ́kọ́ gbọ́ fi hàn pé ó kéré tán, mẹ́rìndínláàádọ́ta 46 lára ilé àwọn ará wa ló wó tàbí tó bà jẹ́.
target: Preliminary reports regarding our brothers’ homes indicate that at least 46 have been damaged or destroyed.

input: Nǹkan bí ìdílé márùnlélọ́gọ́rin 85 ìyẹn akéde 475 ni ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ yìí mú kí wọ́n kúrò níbi tí wọ́n ń gbé, tí wọ́n sì lọ ń gbé nílé àwọn ará tàbí àwọn mọ̀lẹ́bí wọn.
target: Some 85 families 475 publishers have been temporarily relocated to the homes of brothers or relatives.

input: A gbọ́ pé omi ọ̀gbàrá ti mu àwọn Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba kan débì kan.
target: It is reported that some Kingdom Halls have been partially submerged in the flood waters.

input: Ìgbìmọ̀ DRC ṣì wà ní sẹpẹ́ torí ìròyìn tá a gbọ́ ni pé òjò tó rinlẹ̀ ṣì máa tún rọ̀ láìpẹ́.
target: The DRC remains on alert as heavy rains have been forecast for the coming days.

input: Àwọn aṣojú láti ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì àti alábòójútó àyíká kan lágbègbè náà pẹ̀lú àwọn alàgbà ìjọ ṣèbẹ̀wò sọ́dọ̀ àwọn ará lọ́kùnrin àti lóbìnrin kí wọ́n lè tù wọ́n nínú, kí wọ́n sì fún wọn níṣìírí nípa tẹ̀mí.
target: Representatives from the branch office, along with a local circuit overseer and congregation elders, visited our brothers and sisters to provide comfort and Scriptural encouragement.

input: Ọkàn wa wà lọ́dọ̀ gbogbo àwọn tí ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ yìí kàn, a sì ń gbàdúrà fún wọn.
target: Our thoughts and prayers are with all those affected by this devastating monsoon.

input: À ń retí ìgbà tí gbogbo irú àjálù yìí àti gbogbo ìrora tó máa ń bá a rìn á dohun ìgbàgbé.​
target: We look forward to the time when all such natural disasters and the resulting pain, will be no more.

input: Ní October 25, 2019, Arákùnrin Ashok Patel tó jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára Ìgbìmọ̀ Ẹ̀ka orílẹ̀-èdè Íńdíà mú Bíbélì Mímọ́ ti Ìtumọ̀ Ayé Tuntun jáde lédè Telugu ní àpéjọ agbègbè tá a ṣe ní International Convention Centre tó wà nílùú Hyderabad, lórílẹ̀-èdè Íńdíà.
target: On October 25, 2019, Brother Ashok Patel, a member of the India Branch Committee, released the New World Translation of the Holy Scriptures in Telugu at a regional convention held in the Hyderabad International Convention Centre in Hyderabad, India.

input: Àwọn tó fẹ́rẹ̀ẹ́ tó mílíọ̀nù mọ́kànléláàádọ́rùn-ún 91,900, 000 ló ń sọ èdè Telugu, ìyẹn ló mú kó jẹ́ èdè kẹta tí àwọn èèyàn ń sọ jù ní Íńdíà lẹ́yìn èdè Hindi àti Bengali.
target: An estimated 91.9 million people speak Telugu, making it the third most spoken language in India after Hindi and Bengali.

input: Ní báyìí, àwọn akéde tó tó ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́fà 6,000 ló ń sìn láwọn agbègbè tí wọ́n ti ń sọ èdè Telugu, àmọ́ ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́jọ àti méjìdínláàádọ́rin 8,868 làwọn tó wá sí àpéjọ náà.
target: Currently, there are about 6,000 publishers who serve in the Telugu-language field, but the total attendance for the convention was 8,868.

input: Èyí fi hàn pé ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn èèyàn ló wà ní agbègbè yẹn tí wọ́n nífẹ̀ẹ́ sí òtítọ́, kódà àyíká méjì la ti dá sílẹ̀ lọ́dún yìí.
target: These facts underscore the potential growth in this field, which has already seen the formation of two new circuits this year.

input: Ọ̀kan lára àwọn atúmọ̀ èdè tó wà lára àwọn tó túmọ̀ Bíbélì Telugu náà fún odindi ọdún márùn-ún kíyè sí i pé kì í rọrùn fáwọn ọ̀dọ́ láti lóye àwọn èdè àtijọ́ tí wọ́n lò nínú àwọn Bíbélì Telugu míì.
target: One translator, who assisted with the five-year Telugu Bible project, observed that younger people in particular struggle with the archaic language used in other Telugu Bible translations.

input: Ó wá sọ pé Pẹ̀lú ìtumọ̀ tuntun yìí, Jèhófà máa bá àwọn ọ̀dọ́ sọ̀rọ̀ ní tààràtà lọ́nà tó máa yé wọn dáadáa tí kò sì ní lọ́jú pọ̀.
target: With this new translation, it can be said that Jehovah will now speak to the young ones using a straightforward and contemporary vocabulary that can be easily understood.

input: Atúmọ̀ èdè míì tún fi kún un pé Lóde ẹ̀rí, àwọn èèyàn á máa tètè lóye ẹsẹ Ìwé Mímọ́ tá a bá kà fún wọn torí pé ó rọrùn.
target: Another translator added, In the ministry, people will easily understand the scripture as soon as we read it to them at the door.

input: Láfikún síyẹn, ọ̀pọ̀ lára àwọn Bíbélì tó wà lédè Telugu ló ti yọ orúkọ Ọlọ́run, ìyẹn Jèhófà kúrò nínú Bíbélì wọn, torí náà Bíbélì Ìtumọ̀ Ayé Tuntun máa ran ọ̀pọ̀ lọ́wọ́ láti mọ orúkọ Ọlọ́run Olódùmarè.
target: Additionally, since most Bibles in Telugu have omitted the Divine name, Jehovah, throughout the text, the New World Translation will help Telugu readers to know the name of the Almighty God.

input: Ó tún máa jẹ́ kí wọ́n mọ ìtumọ̀ àwọn ọ̀rọ̀ bí ọkàn àti ẹ̀mí.Ìdí sì ni pé ìgbàgbọ́ ẹ̀sìn Hindu làwọn tó tú àwọn Bíbélì míì gbé ìtumọ̀ wọn kà.
target: It will also help readers to understand the original meaning of terms, such as soul and spirit, that other Telugu Bibles render in accordance with local Hindu beliefs.

input: Bí ìròyìn kan ṣe sọ, ó kéré tán, ọgọ́rùn-ún kan àti mọ́kàndínláàádọ́rin 169 èèyàn ló bá àkúnya omi tó ṣẹlẹ̀ láwọn ìpínlẹ̀ kan ní Ìwọ̀ Oòrùn Íńdíà lọ.Àwọn ìpínlẹ̀ tọ́rọ̀ kàn ni ìpínlẹ̀ Gujarat, Maharashtra, Karnataka àti Kerala.
target: According to a media outlet, floods in India have killed at least 169 people in the western states of Gujarat, Maharashtra, Karnataka, and Kerala.

input: Ìròyìn tó tẹ̀ wá lọ́wọ́ láti ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa lórílẹ̀-èdè Íńdíà fi yé wa pé kò sí ìkankan nínú àwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin wa tó bá àkúnya omi náà lọ tàbí tó fara pa.
target: The India branch office reports that none of our brothers and sisters were killed or injured by the flooding.

input: Àlàyé tí ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì ṣe rèé
target: The branch has provided the following details.

input: Ìpínlẹ̀Ní ìlú Vadodara, àwọn akéde márùnlélógóje ni àkúnya omi náà ba ilé wọn jẹ́.
target: In the city of Vadodara, a total of 145 publishers were affected by the floodwaters.

input: Àmọ́, mìmì kan ò mi ọ́fíìsì àwọn atúmọ̀ èdè Gujarati tó wà ní ìlú Vadodara.
target: The Gujarati remote translation office, which is located in Vadodara, was not damaged.

input: Ìpínlẹ̀Ní ìlú Mumbai, ìdílé mẹ́fà ni àkúnya omi náà ba ilé wọn jẹ́.
target: In Mumbai, the homes of six families were affected.

input: Ní ìlú Sangli, tó wà ní nǹkan bíi 378 kìlómítà sí ìlú Mumbai, àwọn akéde mẹ́ẹ̀ẹ́dọ́gbọ̀n 25 ló sá fi ilé wọn sílẹ̀.
target: In the city of Sangli, located some 378 kilometers 235 mi southeast of Mumbai, 25 publishers were displaced.

input: Àwọn ará ní ìlú kan tó wà nítòsí gbà wọ́n sílé.
target: Brothers in a nearby city provided temporary accommodations.

input: Ìpínlẹ̀Ìdílé mẹ́fà ni àkúnya omi náà ti mú kí wọ́n sá fi ilé wọn sílẹ̀.
target: Six families were displaced by the floods.

input: Ìpínlẹ̀ yìí ni ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wà, àmọ́ àkúnya omi yìí ò ṣe jàǹbá èyíkéyìí fún ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì náà.
target: The branch office is located in this state, but it was not affected by the heavy rains or flooding.

input: Ìpínlẹ̀Nǹkan bíi ọgọ́rùn-ún kan 100 ìdílé ló ti ṣí lọ sáwọn ibi tó ga, wọ́n ń gbé pẹ̀lú àwọn ará wa tó wà níbẹ̀.
target: Some 100 families have moved to higher ground and are temporarily staying with other Witnesses.

input: Ìgbìmọ̀ Tó Ń Ṣètò Ìrànwọ́ Nígbà Àjálù ti ń bójú tó ọ̀rọ̀ náà.
target: A Disaster Relief Committee is assessing the situation.

input: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì ti ń darí ètò ìrànwọ́ láwọn ibi tọ́rọ̀ kàn.
target: The branch office is coordinating the relief efforts in the affected areas.

input: Àwọn alábòójútó àyíká àtàwọn aṣojú Ẹ̀ka Tó Ń Yàwòrán Ilé Tó Sì Ń Kọ́ Ọ náà sì ti ń ṣiṣẹ́ takuntakun lórí ọ̀rọ̀ yìí kí wọ́n lè ran àwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin wa tọ́rọ̀ kàn lọ́wọ́.
target: Circuit overseers and Local DesignConstruction field personnel have been working hard to evaluate and help our affected brothers and sisters.

input: Wọ́n fún wọn láwọn ohun kòṣeémáàní bíi omi tó ṣé e mu, wọ́n ń fún wọn níṣìírí, wọ́n sì ń fi Ọ̀rọ̀ Ọlọ́run tù wọ́n nínú.
target: This includes providing material support, such as the distribution of basic supplies like potable water, and spiritual encouragement.

input: Àdúrà wa ni pé kí Jèhófà má ṣe fi àwọn ará wa yìí sílẹ̀.
target: We pray that Jehovah will continue to be with our brothers affected by the flooding.

input: À ń fojú sọ́nà fún ìgbà tó jẹ́ pé ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àlàáfíà ló máa wà níbi gbogbo dípò àjálù.​
target: We look forward to the time when natural disasters will be replaced by an abundance of peace.

input: Ó ti lé ní ọgọ́rùn-ún 100 ọdún báyìí tí ojú ọjọ́ ti yí pa dà láwọn ibì kan lórílẹ̀-èdè Íńdíà, èyí sì ti mú kí mànàmáná tó léwu gan-an máa kọ, kí òjò àrọ̀ọ̀rọ̀dá sì máa rọ̀, kódà àwọn ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n sọ pé òjò ò rọ̀ tó bẹ́ẹ̀ rí lórílẹ̀-èdè náà.
target: An especially severe monsoon season has resulted in deadly lightning storms and what experts consider the heaviest rainfall in some parts of India in over a century.

input: Omi àti yẹ̀pẹ̀ tó ya ti ba nǹkan jẹ́ lọ́pọ̀ ìlú lórílẹ̀-èdè náà àwọn tí ẹ̀mí wọn lọ sí i tó ọgọ́rùn-ún méje 700, ọ̀pọ̀ mílíọ̀nù èèyàn ni ò sì nílé lórí mọ́.
target: Several states have sustained damage from flooding and landslides as many as 700 people have died and millions have been displaced.

input: Títí di July 31, 2017, a ò tíì gbọ́ pé Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà kankan ṣèṣe tàbí pé wọ́n fara pa yánnayànna.
target: As of July 31, 2017, there have been no casualties or serious injuries reported among Jehovah’s Witnesses.

input: Àmọ́, ó kéré tán, ilé mẹ́ta tó jẹ́ tàwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí ni omi ya wọ̀, ṣùgbọ́n kò bà jẹ́ kọjá àtúnṣe.
target: However, the homes of at least three Witness families were flooded but did not sustain serious damage.

input: Àwọn ìjọ àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà tó wà ní Íńdíà ń ṣèrànwọ́ fáwọn ará wọn tí àjálù ṣẹlẹ̀ sí.
target: Congregations of Jehovah’s Witnesses within India are providing necessary relief aid to their fellow worshippers.

input: Ní November 16, 2018, ìjì tí wọ́n pè ní Gaja ṣọṣẹ́ gan-an ní ìpínlẹ̀ Tamil Nadu lórílẹ̀-èdè Íńdíà.
target: On November 16, 2018, Cyclone Gaja devastated the southern Indian state of Tamil Nadu.

input: Ó kéré tán, èèyàn mẹ́rìndínláàádọ́ta 46 ló kú, nǹkan bí ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà igba ó lé àádọ́ta 250,000 ló sá fi ilé wọn sílẹ̀, ilé tó sì lé ní ẹgbẹ̀rún márùndínláàádọ́rùn-ún 85,000 ló bà jẹ́ díẹ̀ tàbí tó bà jẹ́ pátápátá.
target: At least 46 individuals were killed, an estimated 250,000 were displaced, and over 85,000 homes were damaged or destroyed.

input: Ilé ọ̀kan lára àwọn ará wa nílùú Mannargudi, ní Tamil Nadu rèé.Igi wó lu ilé náà.
target: The home of one of our brothers in Mannargudi, Tamil Nadu, that was damaged by a fallen tree.

input: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì tó wà ní Íńdíà jábọ̀ pé ìjì náà ò pa ìkankan nínú àwọn ará wa, kò sì ṣe wọ́n léṣe.
target: The India branch office reports that none of our brothers and sisters were injured or killed by the storm.

input: Àmọ́, ilé àwọn ará wa méjìdínlógójì 38 àti Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba méjì ló bà jẹ́.
target: However, 38 homes of our brothers and 2 Kingdom Halls were damaged.

input: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì ṣètò Ìgbìmọ̀ Tó Ń Ṣètò Ìrànwọ́ Nígbà Àjálù kí wọ́n ṣèrànlọ́wọ́ fún àwọn akéde tí àjálù náà ṣẹlẹ̀ sí, wọ́n pín oúnjẹ, omi àtàwọn nǹkan míì.
target: The branch established a Disaster Relief Committee to organize the relief work, including the distribution of food and water to affected publishers.

input: Àdúrà wa ni pé kí àwọn ará wa tí Ìjì Gaja ṣèpalára fún ní Íńdíà rí ìtùnú gbà látọ̀dọ̀ Jèhófà nípasẹ̀ àwọn alàgbà onífẹ̀ẹ́.
target: We pray that our brothers and sisters in India affected by Cyclone Gaja will be comforted by Jehovah through the loving oversight of the elders.

input: Heavy monsoon rains fell on Mumbai, India, during the week of August 28, leading to the deaths of 14 individuals.
target: Òjò alátẹ́gùn tó lágbára gan-an rọ̀ ní Mumbai, lórílẹ̀-èdè Íńdíà, ní ọ̀sẹ̀ August 28, ó sì yọrí sí ikú àwọn èèyàn mẹ́rìnlá 14.

input: The branch office of Jehovah’s Witnesses in India reports that there have been no casualties or serious injuries among Jehovah’s Witnesses.
target: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà tó wà ní Íńdíà ròyìn pé kò sí ẹni tó kú tàbí tó fara pa gan-an lára àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà tó wà níbẹ̀.

input: However, several homes of Witnesses were flooded.
target: Àmọ́, ọ̀pọ̀ ilé àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ni omi ya wọ̀.

input: Local Witnesses provided food and assisted in cleaning up the damaged homes of their fellow believers.
target: Àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà tó wà ládùúgbò yẹn fún àwọn ará wọn tí ilé wọn bàjẹ́ ní oúnjẹ, wọ́n sì bá wọn palẹ̀ ìdọ̀tí ilé wọn tó bàjẹ́ mọ́.

input: The branch office continues to monitor the situation in Mumbai as well as other parts of India that have been affected by the floods.
target: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa ní orílẹ̀-èdè Íńdíà ń kíyè sí bí nǹkan ṣe lọ sí ní Mumbai àti àwọn apá ibòmíì ní Íńdíà tí omíyalé náà dé.

input: Àrùn COVID-19 tó gbòde kan yìí kò fẹ́ mú nǹkan rọrùn fáwọn tó ń ṣiṣẹ́ ní ọ́fíìsì àwọn atúmọ̀ èdè RTO mọ́kànlá, níbi tí wọ́n ti ń túmọ̀ àwọn ìtẹ̀jáde wa sí èdè mẹ́rìndínlógójì 36.
target: The COVID-19 pandemic has created unique challenges for the 11 remote translation offices RTOs in India, which translate our publications into 36 languages.

input: Àmọ́ pẹ̀lú ìrànlọ́wọ́ Jèhófà, àwọn atúmọ̀ èdè yìí ń rí ojútùú sáwọn ìṣòro tó ń yọjú yẹn, wọ́n sì ń báṣẹ́ wọn nìṣó.
target: With Jehovah’s help, the translation teams are surmounting these obstacles and continuing their work.

input: Iṣẹ́ ìtúmọ̀ èdè kì í ṣe iṣẹ́ tí ẹnì kan lè dá ṣe.
target: Translation work depends heavily on collaboration.

input: Àmọ́ bí àrùn COVID-19 ṣe túbọ̀ ń tàn kálẹ̀, ìjọba orílẹ̀-èdè India ṣe òfin kónílégbélé, wọ́n ò sì fọ̀rọ̀ náà ṣeré rárá, èyí ló wá mú kó ṣòro fún àwọn atúmọ̀ èdè yẹn láti wà papọ̀ níbi kan náà.
target: But as COVID-19 spread, India went into strict lockdown, making it impossible for translators to meet in person.

input: Bákàn náà, àwọn amojú ẹ̀rọ tó máa ń ṣiṣẹ́ lórí àwọn fídíò wa, tí wọ́n sì máa ń gba ohùn àwọn èèyàn sílẹ̀ kò lè ṣiṣẹ́ wọn nínú ọ́fíìsì àwọn atúmọ̀ èdè mọ́ bíi ti tẹ́lẹ̀.
target: Also, those responsible for audio and video recording could not hold recording sessions within the RTOs.

input: Àtorí ẹ̀rọ ayélujára làwọn atúmọ̀ èdè yẹn ti máa ń bára wọn ṣiṣẹ́ báyìí dípò kí wọ́n jọ wà níbì kan náà, kódà tí wọ́n bá fẹ́ gba ohùn àwọn èèyàn sílẹ̀, ọ̀tọ̀ nibi tí ẹni tó ń mojú ẹ̀rọ àtẹni tó ń kàwé máa wà.
target: In the RTOs, in-person collaboration was replaced with videoconferencing and remote recording sessions.

input: Èyí ló wá jẹ́ kó ṣeé ṣe fún àwọn ará tó wà ní àwọn orílẹ̀-èdè míì bíi Bangladesh àti Amẹ́ríkàláti ràn àwọn atúmọ̀ èdè tó wà ní India lọ́wọ́ lẹ́nu iṣẹ́ wọn.
target: These methods have expanded the resources available to the translators as they can now be assisted by brothers and sisters from other countries, such as Bangladesh and the United States.

input: Àwọn ará yẹn tún ti wá rí àwọn ọ̀nà míì tí wọ́n lè gbà ṣe àwọn fídíò tó wà fún àwọn adití, láì jẹ́ pé àwọn tó ń ṣiṣẹ́ náà sún mọ́ra wọn.
target: The brothers have also found creative ways to produce sign-language videos while maintaining physical distancing.

input: Àmọ́ yàtọ̀ sóhun táwọn atúmọ̀ èdè yẹn ṣe, ṣe ni wọ́n gbára lé Jèhófà pé ó máa ran àwọn lọ́wọ́ láti má ṣe rẹ̀wẹ̀sì,ó sì máa fún wọn lókun láti máa báṣẹ́ náà lọ.
target: Along with these practical innovations, translators in the RTOs are depending on Jehovah to help them stay positive and productive during this time.

input: Ní ìparí oṣù July àti ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ oṣù August, ilẹ̀ mì tìtì léraléra ní erékùṣù Lombok lórílẹ̀-èdè Indonéṣíà, ó gbẹ̀mí ó kéré tán, ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́rin ó lé mẹ́rìndínlógójì 436 èèyàn, nǹkan bí ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́ta àti àádọ́ta 350,000 ló sì ní láti kúrò níbi tí wọ́n ń gbé.
target: At the end of July and the beginning of August, a series of earthquakes and aftershocks struck the island of Lombok, Indonesia, claiming the lives of at least 436 people and displacing about 350,000.

input: Ọ̀kan lára ìmìtìtì tó wáyé náà lágbára gan-an, ṣe ni àwọn ilé wọlẹ̀ ráúráú, ọgọ́rọ̀ọ̀rún mílíọ̀nù owó dọ́là sì làwọn nǹkan tó bà jẹ́.
target: One of the earthquakes, a magnitude 7.0, flattened buildings and caused hundreds of millions of dollars in damage.

input: Ìròyìn tá a gbọ́ láti ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa nílùú Jakarta ni pé ìkankan nínú àwọn ará wa ò fara pa, ìkankan ò sì kú, bó tiẹ̀ jẹ́ pé ilé àwọn akéde kan bà jẹ́.
target: Reports from our branch office in Jakarta indicate that there have been no injuries or deaths among our brothers, although some publishers’ homes were damaged.

input: Bákan náà, ilé tí ìjọ kan ṣoṣo tó wà ní erékùṣù náà ti ń ṣèpàdé bà jẹ́, ogójì 40 akéde ló sì wà nínú ìjọ.
target: Additionally, the facility used for meetings by the 40 publishers who make up the only congregation on the island was damaged.

input: Aṣojú méjì láti ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì rìnrìn àjò lọ síbi tí àjálù ti ṣẹlẹ̀ yìí kí wọ́n lè mọ ìrànlọ́wọ́ tí àwọn ará ibẹ̀ máa nílò, kí wọ́n sì lè tù wọ́n nínú.
target: Two representatives from the branch office traveled to the affected area to evaluate any existing need for relief aid and to provide comfort.

input: A ò dákẹ́ àdúrà lórí àwọn ará wa lásìkò tí nǹkan nira yìí, torí a mọ̀ pé Jèhófà lè ‘tù wọ́n nínú nínú gbogbo ìpọ́njú wọn.
target: Our prayers continue to be with our brothers during this difficult time, knowing that Jehovah is able to ‘comfort them in all their trials.

input: Ní Friday, September 28, ìmìtìtì ilẹ̀ tó lágbára wáyé ní erékùṣù Sulawesi lórílẹ̀-èdè Indonéṣíà.
target: A magnitude 7.5 earthquake struck the Indonesian island of Sulawesi on Friday, September 28.

input: Ó ju ẹgbẹ̀rún kan ó lé ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́ta 1,300 èèyàn tí ìmìtìtì ilẹ̀ náà àti omíyalé tó tẹ̀ lé e pa, púpọ̀ lára wọn ló ń gbé ní ìlú Palu ní àárín erékùṣù Sulawesi.
target: The earthquake, and a tsunami that followed, has killed over 1,300 people, the majority of whom were in the city of Palu in Central Sulawesi.

input: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì tó wà ní ìlú Jakarta ní Indonéṣíà sọ pé kò sí ìkankan tó kú lára ọgọ́rin 80 àwọn ará wa tó wà níbi tí àjálù yìí ti ṣẹlẹ̀.
target: The Indonesia branch office, located in Jakarta, reports that all 80 publishers living in the affected area have been accounted for.

input: Àwọn díẹ̀ ló fara pa, wọ́n sì ní láti lọ sílé ìwòsàn.
target: A few publishers sustained injuries and needed to be treated at a hospital.

input: Ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ yìí ba ilé arákùnrin wa kan jẹ́ pátápátá, ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn ará wa míì sì wà tó ba ilé wọn jẹ́ gan-an.
target: One brother’s home was destroyed by the disaster and several other homes of Witnesses were severely damaged.

input: Ilé tí Ìjọ Palu ti ń ṣèpàdé náà tún bà jẹ́.
target: The building that the Palu Congregation uses to hold their meetings was also damaged.

input: Ẹ̀ka Tó Ń Ṣètò Ìrànwọ́ Nígbà Àjálù ní ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa ti ń ṣiṣẹ́ pẹ̀lú àwọn alábòójútó àyíká àtàwọn ìjọ tó wà nítòsí láti ṣètò bí wọ́n ṣe máa ran àwọn ará lọ́wọ́.
target: The Disaster Relief Desk at the branch office is working with the circuit overseer and nearby congregations to coordinate the relief efforts.

input: Torí pé àwọn ará tó wà níbi tí àjálù náà ti ṣẹlẹ̀ ò fi bẹ́ẹ̀ ní oúnjẹ, omi àtàwọn nǹkan míì tó ṣe pàtàkì, ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì ṣètò ìjọ mẹ́ta tí á máa pèsè àwọn nǹkan yìí fáwọn ará tó wà ní Palu.
target: Since the publishers in the affected area have limited food, water, and other necessities, the branch has arranged for three congregations to supply these items to their brothers in Palu.

input: Àwọn alàgbà ń pèsè ìrànlọ́wọ́ tẹ̀mí fáwọn ará, wọ́n ń tù wọ́n nínú, wọ́n sì ń jẹ́ kí wọ́n rí ohun tí wọ́n nílò láti gbé ẹ̀mí wọn ró.
target: Local elders are caring for the publishers’ spiritual, emotional, and physical needs.

input: Arákùnrin tó jẹ́ alábòójútó Ẹ̀ka Tó Ń Yàwòrán Ilé Tó sì Ń Kọ́ Ọ, tó sì tún jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára Ìgbìmọ̀ Ẹ̀ka pẹ̀lú alábòójútó àyíká ibẹ̀ máa dé ọ̀dọ̀ àwọn ará tí ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ náà kàn kí wọ́n lè tù wọ́n nínú, kí wọ́n sì fún wọn níṣìírí.
target: A member of the Branch Committee, the overseer of the Local DesignConstruction Department, and the circuit overseer for the area will also be visiting the affected publishers to provide comfort and support.

input: À ń gbàdúrà fún àwọn ará wa ní Indonéṣíà, torí a mọ̀ pé Jèhófà á máa jẹ́ ibi ìsádi àti okun fún wọn lásìkò wàhálà yìí.
target: We pray for our brothers and sisters in Indonesia, knowing that Jehovah will continue to be their refuge and strength during this time of distress.

input: Òjò tó rọ̀ ní agbègbè Papua tó wà ní ìlà oòrùn orílẹ̀-èdè Indonesia ní March 16, 2019 kọjá wẹ́rẹwẹ̀rẹ.
target: Torrential rains pounded the eastern province of Papua, Indonesia, on March 16, 2019.

input: Òjò yìí fa omíyalé, àwọn tó pa lé ní ọgọ́rùn-ún kan 100, ọ̀pọ̀ ilé ló sì gbá lọ.
target: The rains triggered a flash flood that killed more than 100 people and washed away several homes.

input: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa ní Indonesia sọ pé omíyalé yìí náà dààmú ọ̀pọ̀ lára àwọn ará tó ń gbé ní ìlú Sentani lágbègbè Papua.
target: The Indonesia branch reports that many of our brothers living in the town of Sentani, located in the province of Papua, have been impacted by this disaster.

input: Ó dùn wá pé arákùnrin wa kan kú nígbà tí omi gbé ilé rẹ̀ lọ.
target: Sadly, one of our brothers died when his home was swept away in the flood.

input: Omi náà sì tún ba ilé mẹ́ta míì tó jẹ́ ti àwọn ará wa jẹ́.
target: Three other homes of Witness families were severely damaged.

input: Ó ju ogójì 40 akéde tó ní láti kúrò níbi tí wọ́n ń gbé, ọ̀dọ̀ àwọn ará lèyí tó pọ̀ jù nínú wọ́n sì ń gbé báyìí.
target: More than 40 publishers have been evacuated, and most are now staying with local Witnesses.

input: A ti dá Ìgbìmọ̀ Tó Ń Ṣètò Ìrànwọ́ Nígbà Àjálù sílẹ̀ láti pèsè ohun táwọn ará nílò.
target: A Disaster Relief Committee has been formed to organize the relief work.

input: Àwọn aṣojú ẹ̀ka àti alábòójútó àyílá tó wà lágbègbè náà lọ sáwọn apá ibi tí àjálù náà ti ṣẹ̀lẹ̀ láti fún àwọn ará ní ìṣírí látinú Bíbélì.
target: Branch representatives, along with the circuit overseer in the area, have visited the affected regions to provide spiritual comfort.

input: Wọ́n sì tún wo bí ìránlọ́wọ́ táwọn ará nílò ṣe máa pọ̀ tó.
target: They are also evaluating the extent of relief aid needed.

input: À ń rántí gbogbo àwọn ará tí àjálù yìí ṣẹlẹ̀ sí nínú àdúrà wa.
target: Our prayers are with all the brothers who have been affected by this disaster.

input: A retí pé láìpẹ́, Jèhófà máa máa gbé ikú mì títí láé, á sì nu omijé kúrò ní ojú gbogbo èèyàn.
target: We long for the day in the near future when Jehovah will swallow up death forever and wipe away the tears from all faces.

input: Ìjì líle kan tí wọ́n pè ní Trami jà ní gúúsù ilẹ̀ Japan nírọ̀lẹ́ ọjọ́ Sunday, September 30, 2018.Ọwọ́ ìjì náà lágbára gan-an, òjò tó sì rọ̀ pọ̀ púpọ̀.
target: Typhoon Trami, a Category 1 storm, struck southern Japan on Sunday evening, September 30, 2018, bringing high winds and heavy rainfall.

input: Àmọ́ ìjì náà bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí í rọlẹ̀ kó tó dé apá àríwá lópin ọ̀sẹ̀ náà.Nígbà tó fi máa dọjọ́ Monday, October 1, ó dé ìlú Tokyo.
target: The storm reduced intensity as it continued north over the weekend, eventually reaching Tokyo by Monday, October 1.

input: Èèyàn mẹ́ta ló kú, nǹkan bíi igba 200 ló fara pa, ó sì lé ní mílíọ̀nù kan àti ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́ta 1,300,000 ilé tí ìjì náà ba iná wọn jẹ́.
target: Three people were killed, some 200 were injured, and over 1.3 million homes were left without power.

input: Ìròyìn tá a gbọ́ látọ̀dọ̀ àwọn alábòójútó àyíká fi hàn pé erékùṣù Okinawa, ní gúúsù ilẹ̀ Japan ni ìjì náà ti ba nǹkan jẹ́ jù.
target: According to reports from circuit overseers, the island of Okinawa, in southern Japan, was the most affected.

input: Àyẹ̀wò àkọ́kọ́ tí wọ́n ṣe láwọn àyíká mẹ́tẹ̀ẹ̀ta tó wà ní Okinawa àtàwọn ibi tó wà nítòsí fi hàn pé kò sí ìkankan lára àwọn ará wa tó kú nínú àjálù yìí, àmọ́ àwọn mẹ́sàn-án fara pa.
target: The initial investigation from the three circuits in Okinawa and surrounding areas revealed that none of our brothers were killed but nine suffered injuries.

input: Ìjì líle náà tún ba nǹkan bí ọgọ́fà 120 ilé àwọn ará wa jẹ́ àti Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba márùn-ún ní erékùṣù Okinawa.
target: The typhoon also damaged some 120 homes of our brothers and 5 Kingdom Halls on the island of Okinawa.

input: Bákan náà, ọwọ́ ìjì yìí ba Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba mọ́kànlélógójì 41 jẹ́ káàkiri àwọn agbègbè míì nílẹ̀ Japan.
target: An additional 41 Kingdom Halls sustained damage as the storm passed through other regions of Japan.

input: À ń gbàdúrà fún àwọn ara wa tí ìjì líle yìí kàn àtàwọn àjálù míì tó wáyé nílẹ̀ Japan.
target: Our prayers continue to be with our fellow worshippers affected by this storm and other natural disasters that have recently struck Japan.

input: Ó dá wa lójú pé Baba wa ọ̀run máa tu ọkàn àwọn ará wa yìí lára, á sì mú kí wọ́n mọ́kàn le.
target: We trust that our heavenly Father will continue to comfort the hearts of our brothers and make them firm.

input: Ó lé ní ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́tàdínláàádọ́ta 47,000 àwọn ará wa tó ń gbé láwọn agbègbè tó wà ní ìwọ̀ oòrùn orílẹ̀-èdè Japan tí omíyalé ti ṣọṣẹ́ lóṣù July 2018.
target: Over 47,000 of our brothers and sisters live in the regions of western Japan that were devastated by floods in July 2018.

input: Kò pẹ́ lẹ́yìn náà tí àwọn ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́rin ó lé ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́sàn 4,900 tó yọ̀ǹda ara wọn láti ṣèrànwọ́ fi bẹ̀rẹ̀ iṣẹ́, wọ́n palẹ̀ ìdọ̀tí mọ́ kúrò nínú ilé àwọn ará àtàwọn Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba tó bà jẹ́, wọ́n sì tún wọn ṣe.
target: Soon after the disaster, some 4,900 volunteer relief workers swung into action to clean and repair damaged homes of Witnesses and Kingdom Halls.

input: Àwọn ará yọ̀ǹda ara wọn láti palẹ̀ ìdọ̀tí mọ́ kúrò nínú Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba tó wà lókè.
target: Volunteers remove debris from the Kingdom Hall pictured in the lead image.

input: Àwọn Ìgbìmọ̀ Tó Ń Ṣètò Ìrànwọ́ Nígbà Àjálù ṣètò bí àwọn ará ṣe palẹ̀ ìdọ̀tí mọ́ kúrò nínú Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba mẹ́sàn-án tí omíyalé náà bà jẹ́, wọ́n sì tún àwọn Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba náà ṣe.
target: Under the direction of three Disaster Relief Committees, our brothers and sisters have cleaned and repaired nine Kingdom Halls that were damaged by floodwaters.

input: Ní báyìí, àtúnṣe ń lọ lọ́wọ́ lórí Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba kan.
target: An additional Kingdom Hall is in the process of being repaired.

input: Bákan náà, ilé mẹ́rìnlélọ́gọ́sàn-án 184 àwọn ará wa ni wọ́n ti parí àtúnṣe rẹ̀ tàbí tí wọ́n ti tún ṣe díẹ̀ kó lè ṣeé gbé, àwọn ilé mọ́kànlá míì sì wà tí wọ́n ṣètò láti tún ṣe lọ́dún yìí.
target: Also, 184 homes of Witnesses have been repaired or stabilized, and another 11 homes are scheduled to be repaired this year.

input: Àwòrán Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba kan ṣáájú àti lẹ́yìn tí wọ́n tún un ṣe.
target: Before and after photographs of a Kingdom Hall in Ehime.

input: Àwòrán ìdílé Abe láti agbègbè Ehime lẹ́yìn táwọn ará parí títún ilé wọn tí omíyalé bà jẹ́ ṣe.
target: The Abe family from Ehime pictured after the brothers completed repairs on their flood-damaged home.

input: Ìdílé Taro àti Keiko Abe wà lára àwọn tí wọ́n ràn lọ́wọ́, ọmọ mẹ́ta ni wọ́n bí, agbègbè Ehime ni wọ́n sì ń gbé.
target: Taro and Keiko Abe, who have three children, were one of the families in Ehime who received assistance.

input: Ọjọ́ mẹ́ta péré lẹ́yìn tí omíyalé ba ilé wọn jẹ́, àwọn ará láti àyíká ibẹ̀ dé, wọ́n sì tún ilé náà ṣe, kódà wọ́n tún ilẹ̀ ilé náà ṣe torí omíyalé ti bà á jẹ́.
target: Just three days after the family’s house was flooded, brothers from the local circuit arrived and started to repair their home, which included replacing the damaged flooring.

input: Kò mọ síbẹ̀ o, àwọn ará lágbègbè náà tún fún àwọn ọmọ wọn ní àwọn bẹ́ẹ̀dì àtàwọn tábìlì tuntun.
target: Additionally, local Witnesses donated new beds and desks for the children.

input: Ní September 20, 2018, Arákùnrin Geoffrey Jackson tó jẹ́ ara Ìgbìmọ̀ Olùdarí wá sí orílẹ̀-èdè Japan fún iṣẹ́ kan, ó sì fìyẹn sọ àsọyé kan níbi ìpàdé àkànṣe láti fún àwọn ará níṣìírí, Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba kan ní ìlú Okayama ni wọ́n ti ṣèpàdé náà.
target: On September 20, 2018, Governing Body member Geoffrey Jackson, who was in Japan for an assignment, took the opportunity to deliver an encouraging talk at a special meeting originating in a Kingdom Hall in Okayama.

input: Arákùnrin Jackson tún fi àsìkò náà bá ọ̀kọ̀ọ̀kan àwọn tí àjálù náà kàn sọ̀rọ̀ ìtùnú.
target: Brother Jackson also took time to speak consolingly to individual victims of the disaster.

input: Àwa àtàwọn ará wa ní Japan ń dúpẹ́ pé a wà nínú ètò Jèhófà, tó ń fìfẹ́ ṣe nǹkan, tó sì jẹ́ ká mọ bí ọ̀rọ̀ wa ṣe jẹ Baba wa ọ̀run lọ́kàn tó.—2 Kọ́ríńtì 13, 4.
target: Along with our brothers and sisters in Japan, we are grateful to be a part of Jehovah’s organization, which demonstrates love in action and reflects the care of our heavenly Father.—2 Corinthians 13, 4.

input: Arákùnrin Geoffrey Jackson tó wà lára Ìgbìmọ̀ Olùdarí wà pẹ̀lú arábìnrin kan ní Okayama tí omíyalé ti ba nǹkan jẹ́ ní ìwọ̀ oòrùn Japan lóṣù July 2018.
target: Brother Geoffrey Jackson, a member of the Governing Body, meets with a sister in Okayama who was affected by the flooding that devastated western Japan in July 2018.

input: Ó kéré tán, èèyàn mọ́kàndínláàádọ́sàn-án 169 ló ṣòfò ẹ̀mí ní ìwọ̀ oòrùn orílẹ̀-èdè Japan, kódà títí di báyìí, ó lé ní 255,000 agboolé tí ò rí omi tó dáa lò látàrí òjò àrọ̀ọ̀rọ̀dá tó fa omíyalé àti ilẹ̀ tó ya.
target: At least 169 people have been killed in western Japan, and more than 255,000 households are still without water after torrential rains caused destructive flooding and landslides.

input: Bó tiẹ̀ jẹ́ pé kò sí Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà kankan lára àwọn tó bá ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ náà lọ, a kó ọgọ́rùn-ún méjì 200 lára wa kúrò níbi tí wọ́n ń gbé tẹ́lẹ̀, arábìnrin wa kan sì ṣèṣe.
target: Although none of Jehovah’s Witnesses were killed in this disaster, 200 were evacuated and one sister was injured.

input: Wọ́n tọ́jú arábìnrin wa tó fara pa yìí nílé ìwòsàn, ara rẹ̀ sì ti ń balẹ̀ báyìí.
target: The injured sister was treated at a hospital and is now recovering.

input: Ó kéré tán ilé mẹ́tàlélọ́gọ́rùn-ún 103 àwọn ará wa ló bà jẹ́, kódà ọ̀kan tiẹ̀ wà tó jẹ́ pé ńṣe ló bà jẹ́ pátápátá.
target: At least 103 homes of our brothers were damaged, and one was completely destroyed.

input: Kò mọ síbẹ̀ o, omíyalé yìí tún ba Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba mọ́kànlá àti Gbọ̀ngàn Àpéjọ kan jẹ́.
target: Also, 11 Kingdom Halls and an Assembly Hall were damaged by the floodwaters.

input: A dá ìgbìmọ̀ mẹ́rin sílẹ̀ tó ń ṣètò ìrànwọ́ nígbà àjálù, kí wọ́n lè tu àwọn ará tọ́rọ̀ kàn nínú, kí wọ́n fún wọn níṣìírí nípa tẹ̀mí, kí wọ́n sì pèsè àwọn ohun tí wọ́n nílò lójú ẹsẹ̀, irú bí oúnjẹ, aṣọ àti omi tó ṣeé mu.
target: Four Disaster Relief Committees DRCs have been formed to provide comfort and Scriptural encouragement to the affected brothers and sisters, as well as immediate practical help, which includes supplying food, clothing, and clean water.

input: Àwọn ìgbìmọ̀ yìí á sì tún ṣètò ìrànlọ́wọ́ táwọn ará máa nílò lẹ́yìn náà, irú bí wọ́n ṣe máa fọ ilé àwọn ará, tí wọ́n á da oògùn apakòkòrò sí i, tí wọ́n á sì tún àwọn ibi tó bà jẹ́ níbẹ̀ ṣe.
target: The DRCs will also organize long-term relief efforts, which will involve cleaning, disinfecting, and repairing the damaged homes of our brothers.

input: À ń gbàdúrà fún àwọn ará wa tí àjálù yìí dé bá nílẹ̀ Japan bá a ṣe ń retí ìgbà tí Jésù máa fi agbára rẹ̀ fòpin sí gbogbo àjálù tó ń ṣẹlẹ̀ láyé pátápátá.​
target: We pray for our brothers and sisters affected by this disaster in Japan as we look forward to the time when Jesus will use his power to rid the earth of all disasters permanently.

input: Ní September 6, 2018, ìmìtìtì ilẹ̀ tó lágbára wáyé ní Hokkaido, erékùṣù kan ní gúúsù orílẹ̀-èdè Japan.
target: A magnitude 6.7 earthquake struck Hokkaido, the northern island of Japan, on September 6, 2018.

input: Ìmìtìtì ilẹ̀ náà gbẹ̀mí èèyàn mọ́kànlélógójì 41, ó sì ba iná ìjọba jẹ́ gan-an, èyí mú kó ṣòro láti rí ọkọ̀ èrò wọ̀, ó sì tún mú kó ṣòro láti kàn sí àwọn tó wà ní erékùṣù náà.
target: The earthquake killed 41 people and caused massive power outages, limiting public transportation and communications on the island.

input: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa ní Japan so pé bó tiẹ̀ jẹ́ pé kò sí ìkankan lára àwọn ará wa tó bá ìmìtìtì ilẹ̀ náà lọ, àwọn ará wa méje ló fara pa.
target: The branch office in Japan reports that although none of our brothers or sisters were killed, seven were injured in the earthquake.

input: Ọgọ́rùn-ún 100 ilé àwọn ará wa àti Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba mẹ́rin ló bà jẹ́.
target: A total of 100 homes of Witnesses and 4 Kingdom Halls were damaged.

input: Gẹ́rẹ́ lẹ́yìn ìmìtìtì ilẹ̀ náà, ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì ṣètò pé kí àwọn ará kó oúnjẹ, omi àtàwọn nǹkan míì tó ṣe pàtàkì lọ fún àwọn ará tó wà lágbègbè tí àjálù yìí ti ṣẹlẹ̀.
target: Soon after the earthquake, under the direction of the branch office, publishers supplied our brothers in the affected areas with food, water, and other necessities.

input: A ṣètò Ìgbìmọ̀ Tó Ń Ṣètò Ìrànwọ́ Nígbà Àjálù láti wá bí àwọn ará wa níbẹ̀ ṣe máa rí àwọn nǹkan tí wọ́n máa nílò lọ́jọ́ iwájú.
target: A Disaster Relief Committee was formed to organize the long-term relief efforts.

input: Àdúrà wa ni pé kí Jèhófà máa fún àwọn ará wa tó wà níbi tí àjálù yìí ti ṣẹlẹ̀ ní ìbàlẹ̀ ọkàn.—Fílípì 46, 7.
target: We pray that Jehovah will continue to give our brothers and sisters affected by this earthquake peace of mind and heart.—Philippians 46, 7.

input: Ní August 28, ọdún 2019, òjò àrọ̀ọ̀rọ̀dá tó rọ̀ ní àgbègbè Kyushu lórílẹ̀-èdè Japan fa àkúnya omi tó lágbára gan-an.
target: On August 28, 2019, heavy rainfall in the Kyushu region of Japan caused widespread flooding.

input: Ṣe làwọn odò kún àkúnya, àwọn àgbègbè míì sì léwu torí pé ó ṣeé ṣe kí àwọn òkè ya lulẹ̀.Ìdí nìyẹn tí wọ́n fi sọ fún àwọn èèyàn tó ju ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́jọ 800,000 pé kí wọ́n kúrò lágbègbè yẹn.
target: Overflowing rivers and the potential for landslides led to evacuation orders for over 800,000 people.

input: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì tó wà lórílẹ̀-èdè Japan ròyìn pé, àwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin méjìlélọ́gọ́rin 82 ló fi ilé wọn sílẹ̀.
target: The Japan branch reports that 82 publishers were displaced.

input: Ìròyìn tó dé kẹ́yìn sọ pé ogójì 40 ilé àwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin ló bà jẹ́ àti Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba kan tí kò fi bẹ́ẹ̀ bà jẹ́ púpọ̀.
target: According to the latest report, a total of 40 homes of our brothers were damaged and one Kingdom Hall sustained minor damage.

input: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì náà dá Ìgbìmọ̀ Tó Ń Ṣètò Ìrànwọ́ Nígbà Àjálù sílẹ̀ kí wọ́n lè bójú tó àwọn akéde tí àjálù náà kàn.
target: The branch has established a Disaster Relief Committee to care for the affected publishers.

input: Àwọn alábòójútó àyíká, àwọn alàgbà àtàwọn akéde pèsè ìtùnú àti ìṣírí látinú Bíbélì, wọ́n sì fún wọn láwọn nǹkan míì bí oúnjẹ àti aṣọ.
target: Circuit overseers, along with local elders and publishers, are caring for the immediate spiritual and physical needs of our brothers.

input: Inú wa dùn pé ìfẹ́ ń mú kí ọ̀pọ̀ èèyàn ran àwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin wa lọ́wọ́.​—2 Kọ́ríńtì 84.
target: We are grateful that love is moving so many to respond to the needs of our fellow believers.—2 Corinthians 84.

input: Ní September 21 sí 23, 2019, ìjì líle tí wọ́n ń pè ní Tapah rọ́ lu apá gúúsù orílẹ̀-èdè Japan pẹ̀lú atẹ́gùn àti òjò tó lágbára.
target: From September 21 to 23, 2019, Typhoon Tapah struck southern Japan with powerful winds and rain.

input: Ìjì yìí ò jẹ́ káwọn ọkọ̀ òfúrufú àtàwọn ọkọ̀ ojú irin lè rìn, kódà, àwọn ilé tó lé ní ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà ọgbọ̀n 30,000 ni ìjì náà ba iná mànàmáná wọn jẹ́.
target: The storm caused flight cancellations, railway suspensions, and left over 30,000 homes without electricity.

input: Ní ìlú Okinawa àti Kyushu, àwọn tó ju àádọ́ta 50 lọ ló fara pa.
target: In Okinawa and Kyushu, more than 50 people were injured.

input: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì Japan ròyìn pé àwọn akéde márùn-ún ló fara pa, wọ́n sì ní láti gbé arábìnrin kan lára wọn lọ sílé ìwòsàn.
target: The Japan branch office reports that five publishers were injured, including one sister who was hospitalized.

input: Yàtọ̀ síyẹn, ilé àwọn arákùnrin wa tó bà jẹ́ lé ní àádọ́ta 50.
target: Over 50 homes of our brothers sustained damage.

input: Ìgbìmọ̀ Tó Ń Ṣètò Ìrànwọ́ Nígbà Àjálù àti àwọn arákùnrin tó tóótun ti ń bójú tó ohun táwọn ará yìí nílò nípa tara àti nípa tẹ̀mí.
target: A Disaster Relief Committee and responsible brothers are responding to the immediate physical and spiritual needs of the affected publishers.

input: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì Japan á máa báa lọ láti ṣàyẹ̀wò àwọn ohun tí ìjì yìí bà jẹ́, wọ́n á sì máa pèsè ìrànwọ́ táwọn ará nílò.
target: The Japan branch will continue to monitor the effects of this typhoon and provide needed support.

input: Àdúrà wa ni pé kí àwọn ará wa ní Japan máa bá a lọ láti gbára lé Jèhófà, Ọlọ́run ìtùnú ní àkókò wàhálà yìí.​—Sáàmù 9419.
target: We pray that our brothers in Japan continue to rely on Jehovah for comfort during this trial.—Psalm 9419.

input: Ní Tuesday, September 4, 2018, ìjì líle kan jà ní ìwọ̀ oòrùn orílẹ̀-èdè Japan, ó ti lé lógún ọdún tírú ẹ̀ ti jà kẹ́yìn nílẹ̀ náà.
