target: On Tuesday, September 4, 2018, western Japan suffered the effects of what is being reported as the most powerful typhoon to hit the country in over two decades.

input: Àwọn aláṣẹ ní kí ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ kúrò níbi tí wọ́n wà.Bó sì ṣe máa ń rí lọ́pọ̀ ìgbà, ohun tí ìjì líle náà bà jẹ́ kì í ṣe kékeré.
target: Authorities ordered a massive evacuation, and as anticipated, the deadly typhoon caused widespread damage.

input: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa ní Japan sọ pé kò sí Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà kankan tó bá ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ náà lọ.
target: The Japan branch has confirmed that no Jehovah’s Witnesses died.

input: Àmọ́ ó kéré tán, àwọn ará mẹ́ẹ̀ẹ́dógún 15 ló fara pa, ilé tó sì bà jẹ́ tó ọgọ́rùn-ún márùn-ún àti méjìdínlógójì 538, ó kéré tán.
target: However, at least 15 brothers and sisters were injured, and at least 538 homes were damaged.

input: Àyẹ̀wò àkọ́kọ́ tí wọ́n ṣe fi hàn pé Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba mẹ́rìnlélógójì 44 ló bà jẹ́.
target: Initial assessments also indicate that 44 Kingdom Halls have been damaged.

input: Ìgbìmọ̀ Tó Ń Ṣètò Ìrànwọ́ Nígbà Àjálù, tó wà ní ìlú Osaka àti ní Sakai ti jọ ń ṣiṣẹ́ lórí bí wọ́n á ṣe ṣèrànlọ́wọ́, títí kan bí wọ́n á ṣe tún àwọn ilé tó bà jẹ́ ṣe, tí wọ́n á sì bẹ àwọn tọ́rọ̀ náà kàn wò.
target: The Osaka and Sakai Disaster Relief Committees are collaborating to care for the relief work, which will include repairing the damaged homes as well as the important work of shepherding.

input: A dúpẹ́ pé Jèhófà mọ ìṣòro tí àwọn ará wa ń ní, ó sì ń lo ẹgbẹ́ ará láti ràn wọ́n lọ́wọ́.—Sáàmù 3419.
target: We are thankful that Jehovah is aware of the difficulties our fellow worshippers are facing and is giving them support by means of the brotherhood.—Psalm 3419.

input: Ní Saturday, April 13, 2019, Arákùnrin Stephen Lett tó jẹ́ ara Ìgbìmọ̀ Olùdarí mú Bíbélì Mímọ́ ti Ìtumọ̀ Ayé Tuntun tá a tún ṣe jáde lédè Japanese.
target: On Saturday, April 13, 2019, Brother Stephen Lett of the Governing Body released the revised Japanese-language edition of the New World Translation of the Holy Scriptures.

input: Inú àkànṣe ìpàdé kan tí wọ́n ṣe ní Gbọ̀ngàn ìwòran tí wọ́n ń pè ní Noevir Stadium Kobe ní ìlú Kobe lórílẹ̀-èdè Japan la ti mú Bíbélì náà jáde, àwọn ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà ogún ó lé ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́jọ àti méjìndínláàádọ́rin 20,868 ló sì wá síbẹ̀.
target: The revision was released during a special meeting held at the Noevir Stadium Kobe in Kobe, Japan, with 20,868 in attendance.

input: A ta àtagbà ìpàdé náà sí Gbọ̀ngàn Àpéjọ mẹ́jọ àti ọ̀pọ̀ Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba káàkiri àwọn agbègbè tó wà lábẹ́ ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì Japan.
target: The program was livestreamed to eight Assembly Halls and many Kingdom Halls in the branch territory.

input: Àwọn ará tí kò láǹfààní láti wo ìpàdé náà bó ṣe ń lọ lọ́wọ́ wò ó lọ́sàn-án ọjọ́ náà tàbí lọ́jọ́ kejì láwọn Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba.
target: Later that day and the next day, a video recording of the meeting was shown at Kingdom Halls for those who were not tied in to the original program.

input: Àpapọ̀ iye àwọn tó gbádùn ìpàdé yìí lópin ọ̀sẹ̀ náà jẹ́ ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà ọgọ́rùn-ún méjì ó lé ogún, ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́rin àti mọ́kànléláàádọ́rùn-ún 220,491.
target: A grand total of 220,491 were able to enjoy the special meeting over the weekend.

input: Gbọ̀ngàn ìwòran Noevir Stadium Kobe
target: The Noevir Stadium Kobe

input: Inú àwọn ará ń dùn bí wọ́n ṣe gba Bíbélì Ìtumọ̀ Ayé Tuntun tiwọn
target: Brothers and sisters happy to receive their personal copy of the revised New World Translation

input: Ọdún márùndínláàádọ́ta 45 sẹ́yìn la kọ́kọ́ mú Bíbélì Ìtumọ̀ Ayé Tuntun jáde lórílẹ̀-èdè Japan.
target: The New World Translation has a history in Japan that goes back 45 years.In 1973, Brother Lyman Swingle, who served on the Governing Body, released the Japanese-language New World Translation of the Christian Greek Scriptures at the Divine Victory International Assembly in Osaka, Japan.

input: Arákùnrin Lyman Swingle tó jẹ́ ara Ìgbìmọ̀ Olùdarí nígbà yẹn ló mú Ìwé Mímọ́ Kristian Lédè Griki ní Ìtumọ̀ Ayé Titun jáde lédè Japanese ní Àpéjọ Àgbáyé Ìsẹ́gun Àtọ̀runwá tí wọ́n ṣe ní ìlú Osaka, lórílẹ̀-èdè Japan lọ́dún 1973.
target: During the nine years following its release, 1,140,000 copies were distributed, approximately 75 times more than the number of publishers in Japan at the time.

input: Ní báyìí tá a ti mú Bíbélì tá a tún ṣe jáde lédè Japanese, ọdún 2019 yìí jẹ́ mánigbàgbé nínú ìtàn iṣẹ́ ìtumọ̀ Bíbélì táwa èèyàn Jèhófà ṣe ní Japan.
target: Now, with the release of the revised Japanese-language edition, the year 2019 marks another milestone for Bible translation by Jehovah’s people in Japan.

input: A ti mú Bíbélì Ìtumọ̀ Ayé Tuntun jáde lódindi tàbí lápá kan ní èdè mọ́kàndínlọ́gọ́sàn-án 179, méjìlélógún 22 lára rẹ̀ sì jẹ́ odindi Bíbélì tá a tún ṣe látinú ẹ̀dà tó jáde lédè Gẹ̀ẹ́sì lọ́dún 2013.
target: The New World Translation has been translated in whole or in part into 179 languages, including 22 complete revisions based on the 2013 revised English edition.

input: Ní October 25 àti 26, 2019, ìjì líle kan tí wọ́n pè ní Typhoon Bualoi ṣọṣẹ́ ní apá ìlà oòrùn etíkun Japan.
target: On October 25 and 26, 2019, Typhoon Bualoi battered the eastern coast of Japan.Notably, Bualoi is the third in a series of typhoons that have struck eastern Japan since September, following typhoons Faxai and Hagibis.

input: Ohun tó gba àfiyèsí ni pé, ìjì yìí ni ìkẹta nínú àwọn ìjì tó jà ní ìlà oòrùn Japan láti September, lẹ́yìn tí ìjì líle tí wọ́n pè ní Typhoon Faxai àti Hagibis jà.
target: This latest typhoon caused rivers to overflow their banks, resulting in heavy regional flooding.

input: Ìjì líle tó ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ jà yìí mú kí àwọn odò kún àkúnya, èyí sì fa ọ̀pọ̀ omíyalé ní agbègbè náà.
target: At least 81 homes of our brothers sustained damage.

input: Ó kéré tán, ilé mọ́kànlélọ́gọ́rin 81 tó jẹ́ tàwọn ará wa ló bà jẹ́.
target: There are no reports of fatalities among our brothers however, one sister was injured.

input: A ò gbọ́ pé ará wa kankan kú, àmọ́ arábìnrin kan fara pa.Ìjì yìí ti kó àwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin wa tó ń gbé ní ìpínlẹ̀ Chiba sí ìdààmú gan-an.
target: The brothers and sisters in Chiba Prefecture have suffered as a result of all three typhoons.

input: Ìgbìmọ̀ mẹ́ta tó ń pèsè ìrànwọ́ nígbà àjálù ló ṣètò ìrànwọ́ láwọn agbègbè yìí nígbà tí ìjì Faxai àti Hagibis jà, àwọn náà ló sì ń pèsè ìrànwọ́ báyìí lẹ́yìn tí ìjì Bualoi jà.
target: Three Disaster Relief Committees DRCs in the affected area were already spearheading the relief efforts in connection with typhoons Faxai and Hagibis.

input: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa tó wà ní Japan ń ti àwọn ìgbìmọ̀ yìí lẹ́yìn kí wọ́n lè pèsè ìtọ́jú ní kíákíá fáwọn ará wa.
target: These DRCs are now also caring for those affected by Bualoi.

input: Wọ́n ń bá wọn tún àyíká wọn ṣe, wọ́n ń pèsè àwọn oògùn tó ń pa kòkòrò, wọ́n sì ń tún àwọn ilé wọn tó bà jẹ́ ṣe.
target: The Japan branch is assisting the DRCs to care for the immediate needs of our brothers, such as providing assistance for cleaning, disinfecting, and repairing homes.

input: Àwọn alábòójútó àyíká ń ṣe gbogbo ohun tí wọ́n lè ṣe láti fún àwọn ará ní ìṣírí, kí wọ́n sì tù wọ́n nínú.
target: Circuit overseers are coordinating efforts to encourage the brothers and sisters.

input: Lákòókò tí nǹkan le yìí, à ń gbàdúrà fún àwọn ará wa tó wà ní Japan, a sì mọ̀ pé Jèhófà máa bójú tó àwọn ìránṣẹ́ ẹ̀ tí àárẹ̀ bá ẹ̀mí wọn nítorí àjálù yìí.—Sáàmù 3418.
target: During this difficult time, we pray for our brothers in Japan, confident that Jehovah cares for his worshippers who are crushed in spirit by this series of natural disasters.—Psalm 3418.

input: Ní September 9, 2019 ìjì líle tó ń jẹ́ Faxai jà nítòsí Tokyo, lórílẹ̀-èdè Japan.
target: On September 9, 2019, powerful Typhoon Faxai made landfall near Tokyo, Japan.

input: Afẹ́fẹ́ ìjì náà lágbára débi pé ó fẹ́ dé ibi tó jìnnà tó ọgọ́sàn-án 180 kìlómítà láàárín wákàtí kan péré, ó sì ba iná mànàmáná ilé tó tó ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà ọgọ́rùn-ún márùn-ún ó lé ọgọ́rin 580,000 jẹ́.
target: The typhoon packed winds of up to 180 kilometers per hour approx.112 mph and left 580,000 homes without electricity.

input: Ó kéré tán èèyàn mẹ́ta ló pàdánù ẹ̀mí wọn.
target: At least three people were killed.

input: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa ní Japan ròyìn pé kò sí akéde kankan tó kú, àmọ́ méje lára àwọn ará wa fara pa.
target: The Japan branch office reports that no publishers were killed but seven of our brothers and sisters suffered injuries.

input: Àyẹ̀wò tí wọ́n kọ́kọ́ ṣe fi hàn pé ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́jọ àti márùndínlọ́gọ́rùn-ún 895 ilé àwọn ará ló bà jẹ́, Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba méjìdínlọ́gbọ̀n 28 àti Gbọ̀ngàn Àpéjọ kan tó wà ni Chiba sì bà jẹ́.
target: Initial assessments indicate that the storm damaged 895 homes of our brothers, 28 Kingdom Halls, and one Assembly Hall located in Chiba.

input: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì ṣì ń ṣàyẹ̀wò àwọn ohun tí ìjì náà bà jẹ́ kí wọ́n lè pèsè ohun táwọn ará nílò.
target: The branch continues to assess Typhoon Faxai’s impact on our brothers.

input: A gbàdúrà pé kí Jèhófà, Ọlọ́run tó ń fúnni ní ìfaradà àti ìtùnú máa tu àwọn ará wa yìí nínú, kó sì dúró tì wọ́n lásìkò àjálù yìí.​—Róòmù 155
target: We pray that Jehovah, the God who supplies endurance and comfort, will continue to support our brothers and sisters affected by this disaster.—Romans 155.

input: Nursultan Nazarbayev tó jẹ́ ààrẹ orílẹ̀-èdè Kazakhstan ní kí wọ́n dá Teymur Akhmedov sílẹ̀, wọ́n sì mú un kúrò látìmọ́lé ní April 4, 2018.
target: The president of Kazakhstan, Nursultan Nazarbayev, pardoned Teymur Akhmedov, and he was released from custody on April 4, 2018.

input: Ṣáájú àkókò yẹn, ní March 27, 2018, àwọn aláṣẹ gba Arákùnrin Akhmedov láyè pé kó lọ ṣiṣẹ́ abẹ pàjáwìrì nílé ìwòsàn kan tó wà nílùú Almaty.
target: Earlier, on March 27, 2018, authorities permitted Brother Akhmedov to receive urgent surgical care in a hospital in Almaty, where he is currently recuperating.

input: Ibẹ̀ ló wà báyìí, tí ara rẹ̀ ti ń yá díẹ̀díẹ̀.
target: Brother Akhmedov, 61, has been in prison since January 18, 2017, for merely practicing his faith.

input: Arákùnrin Akhmedov, ẹni ọdún mọ́kànlélọ́gọ́ta 61, ti wà lẹ́wọ̀n láti January 18, 2017, torí pé ó kàn ń ṣe ohun tó gbà gbọ́.Inú ẹ̀ dùn pé òun ti pa dà sílé báyìí lọ́dọ̀ àwọn mọ̀lẹ́bí òun.
target: He is glad to finally be reunited with his family.

input: Gbogbo wa là ń yọ̀ torí pé Jèhófà ti gba ìránṣẹ́ rẹ̀ olóòótọ́ sílẹ̀.​—2 Sámúẹ́lì 222.
target: We all rejoice that Jehovah rescued his loyal servant.—2 Samuel 222.

input: Bẹ̀rẹ̀ láti May 11 sí November 10, 2018, àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ní Kazakhstan pe àwọn èèyàn pé kí wọ́n wá ṣèbẹ̀wò sí Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba.
target: From May 11 to November 10, 2018, Jehovah’s Witnesses in Kazakhstan invited their neighbors to seven open houses, which they held in select cities throughout the country.

input: Lára àwọn tó tẹ́wọ́ gba ìkésíni náà ni àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ ìjọba, àwọn akọ̀ròyìn, àwọn ọ̀mọ̀wé àtàwọn míì, ètò yìí sì jẹ́ kí gbogbo wọn mọ púpọ̀ sí i nípa àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà.Lápapọ̀, àwọn tó lé ní ẹgbẹ̀rún kan ààbọ̀ 1,500 ló lọ.
target: These events provided an opportunity for government officials, journalists, and academics, along with the public, to learn about Jehovah’s Witnesses.In total, over 1,500 people attended.

input: Àwọn ìlú tí Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba náà wà 1 Öskemen, 2 Qaraghandy, 3 Qostanay, 4 Semey, 5 Shymkent, 6 Taldyqorghan àti 7 Taraz.
target: Öskemen, 2 Qaraghandy, 3 Qostanay, 4 Semey, 5 Shymkent, 6 Taldyqorghan, and 7 Taraz.

input: Àwọn Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba kan ni wọ́n ṣètò pé káwọn èèyàn náà wá, àwọn Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba náà sì wà ní ìlú méje ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀, ìyẹn ní ìlú Öskemen, Qaraghandy, Qostanay, Semey, Shymkent, Taldyqorghan àti Taraz.
target: The open houses were hosted at Kingdom Halls in the cities of Öskemen, Qaraghandy, Qostanay, Semey, Shymkent, Taldyqorghan, and Taraz.

input: Àwọn tó wá síbẹ̀ rí àwọn nǹkan tó jẹ́ kí wọ́n mọ púpọ̀ sí i nípa ìtàn àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ní Kazakhstan, èyí tó ti bẹ̀rẹ̀ láti ọdún 1892.
target: Attendees enjoyed displays detailing the history of our activities in Kazakhstan, which began as far back as 1892.

input: Wọ́n tún rí àwọn nǹkan tó jẹ́ kí wọ́n mọ̀ nípa ohun tá à ń gbé ṣe lóde òní, irú bíi Bíbélì Mímọ́ ti Ìtumọ̀ Ayé Tuntun tá a mú jáde lédè Kazakh lọ́dún 2014.
target: Displays also highlighted more modern achievements, such as the release of the New World Translation of the Holy Scriptures in Kazakh in 2014.

input: Lára àwọn tó wá síbẹ̀ ni àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ láti Ẹ̀ka Tó Ń Rí sí Ọ̀rọ̀ Ẹ̀sìn lórílẹ̀-èdè Kazakhstan, àtàwọn akọ̀ròyìn láti ilé iṣẹ́ oníròyìn Kazakhstan-Öskemen, títí kan aṣojú láti ilé iṣẹ́ ìwé ìròyìn Rudnyi Altai àti Semei Vesti.
target: Among the notable visitors were officials from the Department of Religious Affairs and journalists from the Kazakhstan-Öskemen news outlet, the Rudnyi Altai newspaper, and the Semei Vesti newspaper.

input: Ẹnì kan tó jẹ́ olórí ní Ẹ̀ka Tó Ń Bójú Tó Ọ̀rọ̀ Ẹ̀sìn ní àgbègbè kan, pẹ̀lú àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ méjì míì láti ẹ̀ka yẹn wà lára àwọn tó wá sí Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba tó wà ní ìlú Taldyqorghan.
target: At the open house in Taldyqorghan, the administrative center of the Almaty region, the brothers welcomed the head of the Regional Department of Religious Affairs and two other officials from the department.

input: A tún rí ẹnì kan tó jẹ́ olóòtú ilé iṣẹ́ ìwé ìròyìn Zhetysu Dialog, nígbà tó yá, ẹni yìí gbé àpilẹ̀kọ kan jáde nínú ìwé ìròyìn níbi tó ti ṣe ìfọ̀rọ̀wánilẹ́nuwò fún àwọn kan tó yọ̀ǹda ara wọn ní Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba náà.
target: Also in attendance was the editor-in-chief of the Zhetysu Dialog newspaper, who later published an article based on interviews with some of the volunteers at the event.

input: Yàtọ̀ síyẹn, àwọn ará wa tún pín Bíbélì Mímọ́ ti Ìtumọ̀ Ayé Tuntun tó lé ní ọgọ́rùn-ún márùn-ún ó lé lọ́gọ́ta 560 fáwọn èèyàn ní èdè Kazakh àti Russian, àwọn èdè tí wọ́n ń sọ jù ní Kazakhstan.
target: Additionally, our brothers and sisters distributed over 560 copies of the New World Translation in both Kazakh and Russian, the principal languages of Kazakhstan.

input: Inú wa dùn pé gbogbo nǹkan lọ bó ṣe yẹ, èyí sì mú ìyìn bá orúkọ Jèhófà, ó tún jẹ́ káwọn èèyàn mọ̀ nípa àwọn iṣẹ́ rere wa.—Mátíù 516.
target: We appreciate the positive results of these arrangements, which bring praise to Jehovah and allow our neighbors to see our fine works.—Matthew 516.

input: Lẹ́yìn tí Ààrẹ Nursultan Nazarbayev tó jẹ́ olórí orílẹ̀-èdè Kazakhstan dá Arákùnrin Teymur Akhmedov sílẹ̀, wọ́n mú un kúrò látìmọ́lé ní April 4, 2018.Gbogbo ọjọ́ tó lò lẹ́wọ̀n jẹ́ ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́rin ó lé mọ́kànlélógójì 441.
target: Following an official pardon from the president of Kazakhstan, Nursultan Nazarbayev, Brother Teymur Akhmedov was released from custody on April 4, 2018.He had been imprisoned for a total of 441 days.

input: Torí pé ó kàn ń sọ ohun tó gbà gbọ́ fáwọn míì ni àwọn aláṣẹ ṣe mú un.
target: Authorities had arrested him merely for sharing his religious beliefs with others.

input: A ti gé e kúrú, a sì kọ́ ọ lọ́nà tó máa jẹ́ kó ṣe kedere.
target: This is a condensed transcript of the conversation that has been edited for clarity.

input: Arákùnrin Akhmedov, a máa kọ́kọ́ fẹ́ mọ̀ sí i nípa yín.
target: To begin with, we would like to learn more about you, Brother Akhmedov.

input: Ìgbà wo lẹ di Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà
target: When did you become one of Jehovah’s Witnesses

input: October 9, 2005 ni mo ṣèrìbọmi.
target: I was baptized on October 9, 2005.

input: Kí n tó kẹ́kọ̀ọ́ òtítọ́, mi ò gbà pé Ọlọ́run wà.
target: Before I learned the truth, I was an atheist.

input: Ọ̀pọ̀ ọdún ni mi ò fi gba Ọlọ́run gbọ́, mi ò sì ṣe ẹ̀sìn kankan.
target: For many years, I didn’t believe in anyone or anything.

input: Nígbà tó yá, àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí í kọ́ ìyàwó mi lẹ́kọ̀ọ́, ó sì wù mí kí n mo ohun tí wọ́n jọ máa ń sọ.
target: Later, when my wife started to study, I was curious about the discussions she was having with the Witnesses.

input: Mo bá bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí í dúró sẹ́yìn ilẹ̀kùn, kí n lè máa fetí kọ́ ohun tí wọ́n ń sọ.
target: I used to stand behind the door and eavesdrop on their conversations.

input: Nígbà tí mo mọ ohun tí wọ́n ń kọ́ ọ, ó yà mí lẹ́nu torí pé kìkì àwọn nǹkan rere-rere ni wọ́n jọ ń sọ.
target: When I learned about what they were studying, I was intrigued because they talked only about kind and good things.

input: Nígbà tó yá, àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí fi mí mọ Arákùnrin Veslav tó wá láti Poland àmọ́ tó ń gbé ní Kazakhstan.
target: Eventually, the Witnesses introduced me to Brother Veslav, who was originally from Poland but was serving in Kazakhstan.

input: Lọ́jọ́ tá a kọ́kọ́ jọ sọ̀rọ̀, mo sọ fún un pé ‘Ìbéèrè kan ṣoṣo ni màá bi ẹ́.
target: During our first discussion,‘I am going to ask you only one question.

input: Tí ìdáhùn rẹ bá tẹ́ mi lọ́rùn, àá dọ̀rẹ́, àá sì jọ máa bá ọ̀rọ̀ wa lọ.
target: If I’m satisfied with your answer, we’ll be friends and continue our discussions.

input: Àmọ́ tí mi ò bá gba ti ìdáhùn tó o fún mi, a ò ní lè jọ máa bọ́rọ̀ yìí lọ mọ́.O ò ní bínú sí mi, èmi náà ò sì ní bínú sí ẹ.’
target: If, on the other hand, I don’t like your answer, no hard feelings but I will not continue our discussions.’

input: Mo wá bi Arákùnrin Veslav léèrè ohun tó máa ń ṣẹlẹ̀ sí àwọn tó ti kú.
target: I then asked Brother Veslav what happens to the dead.

input: Ó ṣí Bíbélì sí Oníwàásù 9​5, ó sì sọ pé, ‘Tó o bá ka ẹsẹ Bíbélì yìí, wàá mọ ohun tó máa ń ṣẹlẹ̀ sáwọn tó ti kú.’
target: He opened the Bible to Ecclesiastes 95 and said, ‘Read this verse and you’ll know what happens.’

input: Nígbà tí mo kà á, mo rí i pé òtítọ́ nìyí.
target: When I read the verse, I realized that this was the truth.

input: Torí náà mo gbà pé kó máa wá, kó sì máa kọ́ mi kẹ́kọ̀ọ́ Bíbélì.
target: I agreed to meet him again and study the Bible.

input: Bẹ́ ẹ ṣe kẹ́kọ̀ọ́ Bíbélì nìyẹn, tẹ́ ẹ sì ṣèrìbọmi lọ́dún 2005.
target: So, you studied the Bible and were eventually baptized in 2005.

input: Ẹ jẹ́ ká fi ìyókù lẹ̀ ná, ká sọ̀rọ̀ nípa ohun tó ṣẹlẹ̀ káwọn aláṣẹ tó mú yín.
target: Now let’s fast forward to the events that preceded your arrest.

input: Ní May 2016, ẹ pàdé àwọn ọkùnrin kan tí wọ́n láwọn nífẹ̀ẹ́ sí ohun táwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà gbà gbọ́.
target: In May 2016, you met a group of men who claimed to be interested in the beliefs of Jehovah’s Witnesses.

input: Láàárín oṣù mélòó kan, ẹ máa ń lọ bá wọn jíròrò látinú Bíbélì.
target: Over the course of a few months, you met with them several times to discuss the Bible.

input: Tẹ́ ẹ bá ronú pa dà sẹ́yìn sí àwọn ìgbà tẹ́ ẹ jọ máa ń jíròrò yẹn, ǹjẹ́ ẹ rántí ohunkóhun tí wọ́n sọ tàbí tí wọ́n ṣe tó mú ìfura lọ́wọ́
target: Looking back on those conversations, was there anything they said or did that appeared suspicious

input: Bẹ́ẹ̀ ni, mo sọ fún wọn pé tá a bá ń ṣe ìkẹ́kọ̀ọ́ Bíbélì, a sábà máa ń fẹ́ kó jẹ́ ẹnì kọ̀ọ̀kan làá máa kọ́ lẹ́kọ̀ọ́ dípò kó jẹ́ àwọn kan tó kóra jọ.
target: Yes, I mentioned that Bible studies like this are typically conducted with individuals rather than a group.

input: Mo sọ pé á dáa kí kálukú wọn máa ṣe ìkẹ́kọ̀ọ́ yìí lọ́tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀, àmọ́ gbogbo ìgbà tí mo bá ti sọ bẹ́ẹ̀ ni wọ́n máa ń sọ pé rárá, ìjíròrò aláwùjọ yẹn làwọn fẹ́.
target: I recommended that they each study separately, but every time I suggested it, they refused and said that they liked the group discussions.

input: Yàtọ̀ síyẹn, ẹ̀ẹ̀mélòó kan wà tí wọ́n pe àwọn míì wá síbi tá a ti ń kẹ́kọ̀ọ́ pé kí wọ́n wá dara pọ̀ mọ́ wa, wọ́n á sì ní kí n tún ohun tá a jíròrò nígbà tá a kẹ́kọ̀ọ́ gbẹ̀yìn sọ.
target: Also, on a number of occasions, they would invite others to join the study and ask me to repeat what we had already discussed on the previous visit.

input: Ìgbà kan wà témi náà wà níbi tí wọ́n ti ń ṣe ìkẹ́kọ̀ọ́.
target: Once, I also sat in on their Bible study.

input: Mo kíyè sí i pé wọ́n ń sọ̀rọ̀ nípa ẹ̀sìn ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀, bó tiẹ̀ jẹ́ pé ó ti ṣe díẹ̀ tí wọ́n ti ń kẹ́kọ̀ọ́.
target: I noticed that they were discussing different religions, although they had been studying for quite some time.

input: Mo tún kíyè sí i pé ilé tí wọ́n ń gbé gbówó lórí ju ilé tí ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ máa ń lè sanwó ẹ̀.
target: I also noticed that the apartment they lived in was more expensive than most students could afford.

input: Mo sọ fún wọn pé ìgbésí ayé olówó tí wọ́n ń gbé yàtọ̀ sí èyí tí ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ ń gbé.
target: I commented that they lived a rather opulent life for students.

input: Àmọ́ mo rí i pé ohun tí mo sọ bà wọ́n, ara wọn ò sì lélẹ̀.
target: My comments clearly made them uncomfortable.

input: Nígbà tá à ń kúrò níbẹ̀ lọ́jọ́ yẹn, ṣe ni wọ́n pe Teymur sẹ́gbẹ̀ẹ́ kan, èmi lọ dúró dè é níta, wọ́n sì sọ fún un pé kó má mú mi wá síbẹ̀ mọ́ nígbàkigbà tó bá fẹ́ wá kọ́ àwọn lẹ́kọ̀ọ́.
target: When we were leaving, they pulled Teymur aside and, while I was waiting outside, told him not to bring me to the study anymore.

input: Ìgbà wo lẹ wá mọ̀ pé kì í ṣe pé àwọn ọkùnrin tẹ́ ẹ̀ ń kọ́ lẹ́kọ̀ọ́ Bíbélì fẹ́ràn àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà, pé àwọn ọlọ́pàá ọ̀tẹlẹ̀múyẹ́ ilẹ̀ Kazakhstan ìyẹn KNB ni wọ́n ń bá ṣiṣẹ́
target: When did you find out that the men you were studying with weren’t interested in Jehovah’s Witnesses but were actually working with Kazakhstan’s secret police, the National Security Committee KNB

input: Ìgbà tí ìgbẹ́jọ́ bẹ̀rẹ̀ ni mo tó mọ̀ pé àwọn ọlọ́pàá KNB ni wọ́n ń bá ṣiṣẹ́.
target: I only learned that they were cooperating with the KNB during the court hearing.

input: Báwo ló ṣe rí lára yín nígbà tí wọ́n mú yín, tí wọ́n sì fẹ̀sùn kàn yín pé ẹ̀ ń mú kí àwọn èèyàn kórìíra ẹ̀sìn míì ẹ sì ń gbé ẹ̀sìn kan ga ju ẹ̀sìn míì lọ
target: What was your reaction when you were arrested and then later charged with inciting religious discord and advocating religious superiority

input: Ká sòótọ́, nígbà tí wọ́n mú mi, ṣe ni mo rò pé bí wọ́n ṣe sọ, wọ́n máa mú mi lọ sí àgọ́ ọlọ́pàá kí n lè ṣàlàyé tẹnu mi, kí wọ́n sì dá mi sílẹ̀.
target: Honestly, when I was arrested, I thought that they would escort me, as they said, to the police station in order to clarify the matter and then I would be released.

input: Mo ṣe tán láti gbèjà ara mi, kí n sì ṣàlàyé ohun tí mo bá àwọn ọkùnrin náà sọ.
target: I was ready to defend myself and explain what I discussed with them.

input: Àmọ́ ohun tó wá ṣẹlẹ̀ yà mí lẹ́nu, síbẹ̀ mi ò bẹ̀rù.
target: I was quite surprised by the turn of events, but I was not afraid.

input: Ẹ̀sùn tí wọ́n fi kàn mí pé mò ń mú kí àwọn èèyàn kórìíra ẹ̀sìn míì, pé mo sì ń lọ́wọ́ sí iṣẹ́ agbawèrèmẹ́sìn yà mí lẹ́nu gan-an.
target: The accusations of inciting religious hatred and extremism were a big surprise to me.

input: Ọ̀rọ̀ nípa Jèhófà làwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà máa ń sọ, a ò sì fìgbà kankan ní ohunkóhun ṣe pẹ̀lú ìkórìíra tàbí ìyapa.
target: Jehovah’s Witnesses are people who share their knowledge of Jehovah and have never been associated with hatred or discord.

input: Ó dá mi lójú hán-ún hán-ún pé mi ò mọwọ́ mẹsẹ̀, mo sì mọ̀ pé Jèhófà máa ràn mí lọ́wọ́.
target: I was firmly convinced that I was innocent and that Jehovah would support me.

input: Òótọ́ ni pé ọkàn mi ò balẹ̀, àmọ́ mo rántí ìmọ̀ràn tó wà nínú Bíbélì, tó sọ pé, ẹ .kó gbogbo àníyàn yín lé Jèhófà, nítorí ó bìkítà fún yín.​—1 Pétérù 57.
target: It’s true that I was worried, but I remembered the advice from the Bible, throw all your anxiety on him Jehovah, because he cares for you.—1 Peter 57.

input: Nígbà tó di May 2, 2017, lẹ́yìn tẹ́ ẹ ti lo ohun tó lé ní oṣù mẹ́ta ní àtìmọ́lé, ilé ẹjọ́ kan nílùú Astana rán yín lọ sí ẹ̀wọ̀n ọdún márùn-ún, wọ́n sì tún fòfin dè yín pé ẹ ò gbọ́dọ̀ ṣe iṣẹ́ ìkọ́nilẹ́kọ̀ọ́ Bíbélì fún ọdún mẹ́ta.
target: As things developed, on May 2, 2017, after being in pretrial detention for over three months, a district court in Astana sentenced you to a five-year prison term and added a three-year ban on your participation in Bible education activities.

input: Báwo ló ṣe rí lára yín
target: How did that verdict affect you

input: Nígbà tí ilé ẹjọ́ sọ bẹ́ẹ̀, mo gbà lọ́kàn ara mi pé tó bá pọn dandan, màá lo ọdún márùn-ún tí wọ́n dá fún mi pé.
target: When the court announced its decision, I resigned myself to accept the fact that I will have to serve the full term if necessary.

input: Ohun tí mo rò ni pé ‘Tó bá jẹ́ pé àdánwò ló délẹ̀ yìí, Jèhófà ń rí gbogbo ẹ̀, ó mọ bó ṣe máa pẹ́ tó àtìgbà tó máa dópin.’
target: ‘If this is a test, then Jehovah is in control of the timetable and he knows when it will end.’

input: Torí náà, mo pinnu pé bó ti wù kó pẹ́ tó, màá dúró.
target: I was determined to wait as long as it took.

input: Ilé tí wọ́n ti ń tún ìwà ẹni ṣe nílùú Pavlodar ní Kazakhstan, ibẹ̀ ni Arákùnrin Akhmedov ti ṣẹ̀wọ̀n.
target: The correctional facility in the city of Pavlodar, Kazakhstan, where Brother Akhmedov was imprisoned.

input: Àmọ́ nígbà tí wọ́n fi yín sẹ́wọ̀n yẹn, a mọ̀ pé ẹ̀ ń bá àìsàn kan tó le fínra.Àbí bẹ́ẹ̀ kọ́
target: We understand, though, that at the time you were imprisoned, you were battling a serious health condition.Is that correct

input: Bẹ́ẹ̀ ni, ara mi ò yá, mo sì ń gbàtọ́jú kó tó di pé wọ́n rán mi lọ sẹ́wọ̀n.
target: Yes, I was sick and undergoing treatments before being imprisoned.

input: Àmọ́ nígbà tí wọ́n ti mú mi, wọ́n dá ìtọ́jú tí mò ń gbà dúró, àìsàn tó ń ṣe mí wá bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí í le sí i.
target: When I was arrested, my treatments were terminated and my disease started to progress.

input: Arábìnrin Mafiza, báwo lọ̀rọ̀ yìí ṣe rí lára yín lásìkò yẹn
target: Mafiza, how did you feel during this time

input: Ẹ̀rù bà mí gan-an, ìbànújẹ́ sì dorí mi kodò.
target: I was terrified and deeply depressed.

input: Kódà, ó nira fún mi láti máa dá ìpinnu ṣe látìgbà tí wọ́n ti fi Teymur sẹ́wọ̀n, torí pé láti ọdún méjìdínlógójì 38 tá a ti ṣègbéyàwó, nǹkan kan ò yà wá rí.
target: It was even difficult for me to make decisions after Teymur was imprisoned because for the 38 years that we had been married, we’d never been separated from each other.

input: Àmọ́ Teymur sọ̀rọ̀ kan tó tù mí nínú, ó ní ‘Fọkàn balẹ̀, ṣó o gbọ́ Ṣó o rí ọdún márùn-ún tá a máa fi pín yà yìí, ọdún mẹ́ẹ̀ẹ́dọ́gbọ̀n 25 ni Jèhófà máa fi rọ́pò ẹ̀ fún wa kí Ìjọba Ọlọ́run tó dé ’
target: But Teymur comforted me,‘Don’t worry Jehovah will replace these 5 years of separation with 25 more years – even in this system of things ’

input: Kí lohun míì tó tún ràn yín lọ́wọ́ nígbà tí ọkọ yín wà lẹ́wọ̀n
target: What else helped you during the time your husband was imprisoned

input: Àwọn ará lọ́kùnrin lóbìnrin ràn mí lọ́wọ́ gan-an.
target: The brothers and sisters really helped me.

input: Nígbà tí wọ́n fi Teymur sẹ́wọ̀n, kí n má parọ́, ṣe ni mo rò pé ẹ̀rù á máa ba gbogbo wọn láti wá wò mí torí ohun tó fà á táwọn aláṣẹ fi mú Teymur.
target: When Teymur was put into prison, I honestly thought that everyone would be afraid to visit me because of the circumstances surrounding Teymur’s arrest.

input: Kódà, àwọn ọ̀tẹlẹ̀múyẹ́ ń ṣọ́ ilé wa, wọ́n sì ń ṣọ́ àwọn nǹkan tá à ń ṣe.
target: The KNB were monitoring our house and activities.

input: Àmọ́ lọ́jọ́ kan, alàgbà kan àti ìyàwó ẹ̀ wá wò mí, ìṣírí ńlá gbáà ló jẹ́ fún mi.
target: Then one day, an elder and his wife came to visit, and it was a tremendous boost for me.

input: Mo bi wọ́n pé, ‘Ṣé ẹ̀rù ò bà yín láti wá síbí ni ’
target: When I asked them, ‘Aren’t you afraid to come here ’

input: Wọ́n dáhùn pé, ‘Kí ló fẹ́ máa bà wá lẹ́rù
target: They responded, ‘Why would we be afraid

input: Níbi táyé dé yìí, kò ṣòro rárá fáwọn aláṣẹ láti rí wa mú.
target: Nowadays, the authorities can track us through our phones.

input: Tí wọ́n bá fẹ́ mú wa, kò ju kí wọ́n fi kọ̀ǹpútà wá àdírẹ́sì ibi tá a ti ń pè lórí fóònù.’
target: So if they want to, they can easily find us.’

input: Àwọn alàgbà wá ṣèbẹ̀wò olùṣọ́ àgùntàn sọ́dọ̀ mi, wọ́n sì rọ̀ mí pé kí n má jẹ́ kí àdánwò tó délẹ̀ yìí kó ìrẹ̀wẹ̀sì bá mi, àmọ́ kí n jẹ́ kí ìgbàgbọ́ mi àti àjọṣe mi pẹ̀lú Jèhófà túbọ̀ lágbára.
target: On a shepherding visit, the elders encouraged me to avoid being overcome by the test and be spiritually strong.

input: Arákùnrin Teymur, kí ló ràn yín lọ́wọ́ tẹ́ ẹ fi fara da àdánwò yìí, tẹ́ ò sì sọ̀rètí nù
target: Teymur, what helped you to endure this particular test and remain positive

input: Wọ́n de Arákùnrin Akhmedov mọ́ bẹ́ẹ̀dì nílé ìwòsàn ní Almaty kó tó di pé wọ́n tú u sílẹ̀.
target: Brother Akhmedov chained to a hospital bed in Almaty shortly before his release.

input: Bó tiẹ̀ jẹ́ pé wọn ò kọ́kọ́ jẹ́ kó gbàtọ́jú, nígbà tí ìlera ẹ̀ di pé ó ń burú sí i, àwọn aláṣẹ gbà kí wọ́n tọ́jú rẹ̀.
target: Although he was initially denied medical care, authorities permitted him to have treatment when his health situation became urgent.

input: Àdúrà ni Ojoojúmọ́ ni mo máa ń gbàdúrà pé kí Jèhófà tọ́ mi sọ́nà, kó fún mi lóye, kó sì jẹ́ kí n lókun kí n lè máa láyọ̀, kí n lè jẹ́ olóòótọ́, kí n má sì bọ́hùn lásìkò ìṣòro yìí.
target: Prayer to Jehovah Every day I prayed for guidance, understanding, and strength so that I could remain joyful, loyal, and faithful during my difficulty.

input: Mo sì rí bó ṣe dáhùn àdúrà mi.
target: His answers to my prayers were obvious.

input: Kò fi mí sílẹ̀, torí mi ò mọ̀ ọ́n lára pé mo dá wà nínú ẹ̀wọ̀n.
target: He supported me, and I did not feel that I was alone in prison.

input: Kíka Bíbélì náà ràn mí lọ́wọ́.
target: Bible reading also assisted me.

input: Nínú ọ̀kan lára àwọn ọgbà ẹ̀wọ̀n yẹn, Bíbélì wà lárọ̀ọ́wọ́tó mi ní gbogbo ìgbà.
target: In one of the prisons, I had a Bible available to me at all times.

input: Ní ọgbà ẹ̀wọ̀n míì tí wọ́n gbé mi lọ, wọ́n fi Bíbélì kan síbi ìkówèésí ní ọgbà náà, mo sì lè lọ máa kà á lẹ́ẹ̀kan lọ́sẹ̀.
target: In another facility, a Bible was kept in the prison library, and I could go and read it once a week.

input: Mo tún rántí ọ̀rọ̀ arákùnrin tó kọ́ mi lẹ́kọ̀ọ́ Bíbélì.
target: I also remembered the words of the brother who studied the Bible with me.

input: Ó máa ń sọ pé kò yẹ kí ìṣòro tá à ń kojú máa dẹ́rù bà wá.
target: He used to say that we should not be afraid of the challenges we face.‘Why should I not be afraid

input: Mo rántí pé mo bi wọ́n pé ‘Báwo ni mi ò ṣe ní bẹ̀rù
target: What if the challenge is difficult and terrifying ’

input: Tí ìṣòro yẹn bá le ńkọ́, tó sì ń dáyà já mi ’ Ó ní, Jèhófà ò ní jẹ́ ká dán wa wò kọjá ohun tá a lè mú mọ́ra, á sì fún wa lókun ká lè borí ìṣòro èyíkéyìí.1 Kọ́ríńtì 1013
target: He said that Jehovah will not allow us to be tested beyond what we can bear and he will give us the strength to overcome any trial.1 Corinthians 1013

input: Torí náà, nígbà tí mo wà lẹ́wọ̀n, mi ò gbàgbé ọ̀rọ̀ tí wọ́n fà yọ látinú Ìwé Mímọ́ yẹn.
target: So while in prison, I never forgot that Scriptural thought.

input: Báwo ló ṣe rí lára yín nígbà tẹ́ ẹ gbọ́ pé gbogbo àwọn ará kárí ayé ló ti gbọ́ ohun tó ṣẹlẹ̀ sí yín, àti pé gbogbo wọn lọ́kùnrin lóbìnrin ló ń gbàdúrà fún yín
target: How did it make you feel when you found out that the brotherhood was aware of your situation and that brothers and sisters around the world were praying for you

input: Ó dá mi lójú pé Jèhófà ló lọ́wọ́ sí ọ̀rọ̀ yẹn torí pé òun náà ló ni ètò yìí.
target: I definitely felt that it was Jehovah’s hand because the organization belongs to him.

input: Ìyẹn fi mí lọ́kàn balẹ̀ pé àwọn ará ò ní pa mí tì, àti pé lọ́jọ́ kan, Jèhófà máa kó mi yọ.
target: This assured me that I wouldn’t be abandoned and one day Jehovah would rescue me.

input: Kẹ́ ẹ sì máa wò ó o, ohun tó bà mí lẹ́rù jù ni kí wọ́n fi mí sẹ́wọ̀n.
target: Interestingly, prison was actually the thing that I feared the most.

input: Mo bẹ̀rù ọgbà ẹ̀wọ̀n gan-an.
target: I was terrified of prisons.

input: Tí mo bá ń ka ìtàn àwọn ará wa tó wà lẹ́wọ̀n, ṣe ni mo máa ń gbàdúrà pé, ‘Jèhófà jọ̀ọ́, gbogbo nǹkan ni mo lè mú mọ́ra, àmọ́ bíi ti ẹ̀wọ̀n kọ́ ’
target: When I would read about our brothers in prisons, I used to pray, ‘Jehovah, please, anything but prison ’

input: Síbẹ̀, lẹ́sẹ̀ kan náà, ó máa ń wù mí gan-an láti lọ sọ́dọ̀ àwọn tó wà lẹ́wọ̀n, kí n lè kọ́ wọn lẹ́kọ̀ọ́ òtítọ́.
target: But at the same time, I had a very strong desire to visit people in jail and talk to them about the truth.

input: Mo béèrè nígbà kan bóyá a lè lọ máa wàásù lọ́gbà ẹ̀wọ̀n, àmọ́ àwọn àrá ṣàlàyé pé lọ́wọ́lọ́wọ́ báyìí, ìjọba ò fún wa láṣẹ láti máa lọ sáwọn ẹ̀wọ̀n tó wà ní Kazakhstan.
target: When I asked about engaging in prison witnessing, the brothers explained that at this time, we do not have permission to visit prisons in Kazakhstan.

input: Nígbà tó wá di pé nǹkan yí bìrí fún mi, ẹ́rù ṣe ń bà mí náà ni mo tún ń rò ó pé ohun tó máa ń wù mí láti ṣe, ìyẹn láti máa wàásù fáwọn ẹlẹ́wọ̀n, máa wá di ṣíṣe báyìí.
target: So when I faced my trial, I had mixed feelings, on the one hand, I was afraid, but at the same time, I felt like my dream of being able to preach to prisoners was going to come true.

input: Ṣé àǹfààní ẹ̀ wá yọ láti wàásù fún àwọn kan nígbà tẹ́ ẹ wà lẹ́wọ̀n
target: So did you get a chance to witness to some while you were in prison

input: Ó wá bi mí pé, ‘Kí lorúkọ Ọlọ́run ’ Mo ní, ‘Jèhófà lorúkọ Ọlọ́run.’
target: When I came into his office, he said, ‘I know that you are one of Jehovah’s Witnesses, so don’t even think about preaching to me ’ To which I replied, ‘I have no such intention.’

input: Ó tún bi mí pé, ‘Ta wá ni Jésù Ṣé òun kọ́ ni Ọlọ́run ni ’ Mo dáhùn pé, ‘Rárá, ọmọ Ọlọ́run ni.’
target: Then he asked, ‘What is God’s name ’ I said, ‘God’s name is Jehovah.’

input: Ó wá béèrè pé, ‘Kí ló wá dé táwọn Oníṣọ́ọ̀ṣì Ọ́tọ́dọ́ọ̀sì fi gbà pé òun ni Ọlọ́run ’
target: He continued, ‘Then, who is Jesus Isn’t he God ’ I said, ‘No, he is God’s son.’

input: Mo ní, ‘Àwọn náà ni wọ́n máa lè dáhùn ẹ̀.’
target: He then asked, ‘Why, then, do Orthodox Christians believe he is God ’ And I said, ‘You should ask them about that.’

input: Nǹkan míì tún ṣẹlẹ̀ lọ́jọ́ kan tó jẹ́ kí n lè bá àwọn tó tó ogójì 40 tàbí jù bẹ́ẹ̀ lọ sọ̀rọ̀ lẹ́ẹ̀kan náà.
target: On another occasion, I was able to speak to about 40 or more people at the same time.

input: Dókítà kan tó jẹ́ afìṣemọ̀rònú ẹ̀dá wá ṣèbẹ̀wò sọ́dọ̀ àwọn ẹlẹ́wọ̀n.
target: A psychologist had come to the prison to visit the inmates.

input: Ọ̀rọ̀ nípa ìgbéyàwó là ń sọ lọ́jọ́ yẹn, ló bá bi wá pé kí lèrò wa nípa kéèyàn fẹ́yàwó púpọ̀.
target: We were discussing marriage when she asked what we thought about polygamy.

input: Gbogbo wa la láǹfààní láti sọ èrò wa.
target: Everyone had an opportunity to share their opinion.

input: Nígbà tí wọ́n ní kí n sọ èrò mi, mo sọ fún wọn pé èmi fúnra mi ò ní nǹkan kan sọ sí i, àmọ́ á wù mí kí n sọ ohun tẹ́nì kan rò nípa ọ̀rọ̀ yìí fún gbogbo wọn.
target: When it came time for me to speak, I said that I don’t have a personal opinion on this, but I really like the opinion of another person on this topic, which I would like to share.

input: Mo wá sọ pé ‘Ìdí nìyẹn tí ọkùnrin yóò ṣe fi baba rẹ̀ àti ìyá rẹ̀ sílẹ̀ tí yóò sì fà mọ́ aya rẹ̀, wọn yóò sì di ara kan.’ Jẹ́nẹ́sísì 224
target: ‘That is why a man will leave his father and his mother and he will stick to his wife, and they will become one flesh.’ Genesis 224

input: Dókítà náà béèrè pé, ‘Èrò ta nìyẹn ’ Mo ní, ‘Èrò Jèhófà Ọlọ́run ni, ẹni tó dá ọmọ aráyé.
target: The psychologist asked, ‘Whose opinion is that ’ To which I replied, ‘It is the opinion of Jehovah God, the one who created mankind.

input: Èèyàn méjì ló sọ pé wọ́n á ṣègbéyàwó wọn ò ju méjì lọ.’
target: It mentions only two people no more.’

input: Dókítà náà wá bi mí pé, ‘Ṣé ìdí míì wà tó o fi rò pé ìyàwó kan ṣoṣo ló yẹ kí ọkùnrin ní ’
target: She then asked, ‘Do you have any other reasons why you think that a man should have only one wife ’

input: Mo fa ọ̀rọ̀ yọ látinú Mátíù 7​12, tó sọ pé Nítorí náà, gbogbo ohun tí ẹ bá fẹ́ kí àwọn ènìyàn máa ṣe sí yín, kí ẹ̀yin pẹ̀lú máa ṣe bẹ́ẹ̀ gẹ́gẹ́ sí wọn.
target: I quoted Matthew 712,All things, therefore, that you want men to do to you, you also must do to them.

input: Mo ní ‘Jésù ló sọ̀rọ̀ yìí.
target: ‘These are the words of Jesus.

input: Ẹ jọ̀ọ́, ẹ bi àwọn ọkùnrin tó jókòó síbí bóyá ó máa wù wọ́n kí àwọn àti ọkùnrin míì jọ máa fẹ́ ìyàwó wọn.
target: Please ask these gentlemen who are sitting in the hall if they would like to share their wife with somebody else.

input: Tó bá jẹ́ pé àwọn ọkùnrin ò fẹ́ kí ìyàwó àwọn ní ọkọ míì, nígbà náà, ó dájú pé àwọn ìyàwó náà ò ní fẹ́ kí ọkọ àwọn níyàwó míì.’
target: If men do not want their wives to have another husband, then certainly women do not want their husbands to have multiple wives.’

input: Dókítà náà sọ pé nínú ọ̀rọ̀ tí gbogbo àwọn tó wà níbẹ̀ sọ, ọ̀rọ̀ tèmi lòun gbádùn jù.
target: The psychologist said that out of all the responses she liked my answer the most.

input: Ìṣírí ló jẹ́ fún wa pé láìka bí nǹkan ṣe nira fún yín tó, ẹ ṣì wá àǹfààní láti wàásù fún àwọn tó wà nítòsí yín
target: How encouraging to know that despite your difficult circumstances, you found opportunities to preach to those around you

input: Lẹ́yìn táwọn ilé ẹjọ́ kọ̀ lọ́pọ̀ ìgbà láti fọwọ́ sí i pé kí wọ́n dá yín sílẹ̀, tó fi mọ́ Ilé Ẹjọ́ Gíga Jù Lọ ti Kazakhstan pàápàá, ṣe ló dà bíi pé kò sọ́nà àbáyọ mọ́ lábẹ́ òfin.
target: After the courts rejected multiple appeals for your release, including an appeal to Kazakhstan’s Supreme Court, it appeared that from a legal standpoint, all options had been exhausted.

input: Síbẹ̀, wọ́n fún yín láǹfààní láti buwọ́ lùwé kan tẹ́ ẹ bá fẹ́ kí wọ́n dá yín sílẹ̀.
target: Yet, you did have an opportunity to be released if you signed a confession.

input: Ṣé ẹ lè sọ ohun tó ṣẹlẹ̀ fún wa àti ìdí tẹ́ ẹ fi kọ̀ láti buwọ́ lù ú
target: Would you tell us about that opportunity and why you refused to sign

input: Òótọ́ ni pé àwọn ìgbà kan wà tí wọ́n ní kí n buwọ́ lùwé.
target: Well, they actually offered the proposal a few times.

input: Ó jọ bíi pé ìrànlọ́wọ́ ni wọ́n fẹ́ ṣe fún mi, àmọ́ ohun tó wà nínú ìwé yẹn ni pé mo jẹ̀bi ẹ̀sùn tí wọ́n fi kàn mí àti pé mo tọrọ àforíjì fún ohun tí mo ṣe.
target: Although it appeared to be an act of kindness, it was actually a document that stated I was guilty of the charges brought against me and that I apologized for my actions.

input: Nígbà tó yá, wọ́n ní kí n kọ̀wé míì fúnra mi láti jẹ́wọ́ ohun tí mo ṣe, kí n sì bẹ̀bẹ̀ pé kí wọ́n tú mi sílẹ̀.
target: Later, I was offered the option of writing my own confession and requesting a pardon.

input: Mo kọ̀ láti kọ àwọn ọ̀rọ̀ yẹn, mo sì sọ fáwọn aláṣẹ pé ó pé mi kí n wà lẹ́wọ̀n pẹ̀lú ẹ̀rí ọkàn tó mọ́, ju kí wọ́n tú mi sílẹ̀ àmọ́ kí ẹ̀rí ọkàn mi máa dá mi lẹ́bi.
target: I refused all such confessions of guilt and told the authorities that I would rather sit in prison with a clear conscience than be released with a guilty one.

input: A mọyì àpẹẹrẹ ìgbàgbọ́ tẹ́ ẹ ní gan-an àti bẹ́ ẹ ṣe kọ̀ láti ṣe ohun tó máa ba ẹ̀rí ọkàn yín jẹ́.
target: We certainly appreciate your example of faith and refusal to violate your conscience.

input: Nígbà tó yá, ohun tá ò retí ṣẹlẹ̀.Ṣé ẹ lè sọ fún wa nípa bẹ́ ẹ ṣe mọ̀ pé ìjọba fẹ́ tú yín sílẹ̀ lẹ́wọ̀n
target: Eventually, though, there was an unexpected turn of events.Would you please tell us how you learned that you would be pardoned and released from prison

input: Lọ́jọ́ kan, ẹ̀ṣọ́ kan wá sí yàrá mi, ó sọ fún mi pé ẹnì kan fẹ́ bá mi sọ̀rọ̀ lórí fóònù.
target: One day a guard came to my ward to inform me that I had a phone call.

input: Mo rò ó pé, ‘Ta ló lè fẹ́ bá mi sọ̀rọ̀ ’
target: I remember thinking, ‘Who would call me ’ When I picked up the phone, a woman introduced herself and said that she would be coming to the prison to release me.

input: Nígbà tí mo gbé fóònù, obìnrin lẹni náà, ó sọ bóun ṣe jẹ́ fún mi, ó sì sọ pé òun ń bọ̀ wá tú mi sílẹ̀.
target: I really didn’t know how to react to the phone call.

input: Kí n má parọ́, mi ò mọ ohun tí mi ò bá ṣe.
target: So after she hung up, I decided to tell my son about it, since I didn’t want to shock my wife with the news or give her a false hope.

input: Nígbà tá a sọ̀rọ̀ tán lórí fóònù, mo pinnu pé màá sọ fún ọmọ mi ọkùnrin, mi ò fẹ́ sọ fún ìyàwó mi torí kí n má bàa kó o lọ́kàn sókè, a ò sì mọ̀ bóyá wọ́n á tú mi sílẹ̀ lóòótọ́, kí n má lọ fojú ẹ̀ sọ́nà.
target: After I hung up the phone, the guard asked me, ‘What did they tell you on the phone ’

input: Bí mo ṣe gbé fóònù náà kalẹ̀, ẹ̀ṣọ́ yẹn bi mí pé, ‘Kí ni wọ́n sọ fún ẹ lórí fóònù ’ Mo ní ẹnì kan ló ń bá mi dá àpárá jàre, torí ṣe ni obìnrin tí mo bá sọ̀rọ̀ kàn sọ pé òun ń bọ̀ wá tú mi sílẹ̀.
target: I told him that someone must be playing a joke on me, since the woman on the phone just told me that she is coming to the prison to release me.

input: Mark Sanderson, tó jẹ́ ara Ìgbìmọ̀ Olùdarí, pẹ̀lú Teymur àti Mafiza Akhmedov lẹ́yìn tí wọ́n dá Arákùnrin Akhmedov sílẹ̀.
target: Mark Sanderson, a member of the Governing Body, with Teymur and Mafiza Akhmedov shortly after Brother Akhmedov was released from custody.

input: Ẹ̀ṣọ́ yẹn sọ fún mi pé kì í ṣọ̀rọ̀ eré o, òótọ́ lobìnrin yẹn ń sọ o.
target: The guard replied that she was not joking and that what she said was true.

input: Arábìnrin Mafiza, báwo ni ìròyìn amóríyá yìí ṣe rí lára yín
target: Mafiza, how did you react to this exciting news

input: Nígbà tí ọmọ mi sọ fún mi, èmi náà rò pé ó ń ṣeré ni.Ọjọ́ pẹ́ tá a ti ń retí irú ìròyìn bẹ́ẹ̀
target: When my son relayed the news to me, I also thought it was a joke.We had been waiting for this news for so long

input: Àwa ò lè mọ bínú ẹ̀yin méjèèjì ṣe máa dùn tó nígbà tí Arákùnrin Teymur pa dà sílé lẹ́yìn ohun tó lé ní ọdún kan táwọn aláṣẹ ti mú wọn lọ
target: We can only imagine how you both must have felt when you were reunited over a year after Teymur was arrested

input: Tẹ́ ẹ bá ronú pa dà sẹ́yìn nípa àdánwò ìgbàgbọ́ tẹ́ ẹ kojú yìí, ẹ̀kọ́ wo lẹ lè sọ pé ẹ kọ́
target: Now, looking back, what have you learned from this test of your faith

input: Mo rántí bí ọ̀rọ̀ Arákùnrin Bahram Hemdemov àti Arábìnrin Gulzira Hemdemov ṣe máa ń pa mí lẹ́kún tó.
target: I remember how I used to cry about the situation of Brother Bahram Hemdemov and Sister Gulzira Hemdemov.

input: Àwọn aláṣẹ ní Turkmenistan mú Arákùnrin Hemdemov ní March 2015.
target: Brother Hemdemov was arrested in March 2015 by authorities in Turkmenistan.

input: Nígbà tó di May 19, 2015, wọ́n rán an lọ sí ẹ̀wọ̀n ọdún mẹ́rin lórí ẹ̀sùn èké tí wọ́n fi kàn án pé ó ń mú kí àwọn èèyàn kórìíra ẹ̀sìn míì, wọn ò sì tíì tú u sílẹ̀ lẹ́wọ̀n di báyìí.
target: On May 19, 2015, he was sentenced to four years in prison on fabricated charges of inciting religious hatred and has yet to be released.

input: Kódà, kí wọ́n tó mú Teymur, mo ronú nípa bó ṣe máa nira tó fún Gulzira.
target: Even before Teymur’s arrest, I thought about how difficult it must be for Gulzira.

input: Ní báyìí, á wù mí báyìí kí n rí i, kí n gbá a mọ́ra, kí n sì jẹ́ kó mọ̀ pé mo nífẹ̀ẹ́ ẹ̀, mo sì wà lẹ́yìn ẹ̀.
target: Now, I would like to hug her and send her my warm love and support.

input: Torí ohun tí ojú èmi àti Teymur ti rí yìí, á wù mí kí n sọ fún Gulzira pé mo bá a kẹ́dùn torí ohun tójú tiẹ̀ náà rí.
target: Having been through this challenge with Teymur, I would like to tell her that I sympathize with her pain.

input: Mo mọ̀ pé bíi tèmi, Jèhófà àtàwọn ará lòun náà gbára lé.
target: I know that, like me, she depends on the support of Jehovah and the brothers.

input: Ọpẹ́ púpọ̀ lọ́wọ́ gbogbo àwọn ará tó tì wá lẹ́yìn, látorí àwọn ará ìjọ wa àti gbogbo ìjọ kárí ayé, tó fi mọ́ Ìgbìmọ̀ Olùdarí, àwọn agbẹjọ́rò àtàwọn ọmọkùnrin wa.
target: I am very grateful to all of the brothers who supported us, the brothers in our congregation and in all the congregations around the world, the Governing Body, the lawyers, and our sons.

input: Arákùnrin Akhmedov di ìwé ẹ̀rí tí wọ́n fi dá a sílẹ̀ mú lẹ́yìn tó kúrò lẹ́wọ̀n.
target: Brother Akhmedov holding his certificate of pardon after being released from custody.

input: Ohun kan tí mo fẹ́ sọ ni pé gbogbo wa la máa kojú àdánwò.
target: I can say only one thing, everyone has tests that they must face.

input: Ó lè má jẹ́ gbogbo wa la máa lọ sẹ́wọ̀n.
target: Of course, not everyone will have a test of imprisonment.

input: Àdánwò táwọn míì máa kojú lè jẹ́ inúnibíni látọ̀dọ̀ mọ̀lẹ́bí wọn tó jẹ́ aláìgbàgbọ́.
target: For some, the test may be persecution from an unbelieving family member.

input: Ní tàwọn míì, ó lè jẹ́ arákùnrin tàbí arábìnrin kan nínú ìjọ tó ṣòroó bá lò.
target: For others, maybe it is dealing with a brother or sister in the congregation who is difficult to get along with.

input: Ìṣòro tàbí àdánwò yòówù ká máa kojú, gbogbo wa la máa pinnu ohun tá a máa ṣe, bóyá ìlànà Ọlọ́run la fẹ́ rọ̀ mọ́ àbí ìdàkejì ẹ̀ la fẹ́ ṣe.
target: Whatever our challenge or test, we each have a choice whether to stand by God’s principles or ignore them.

input: Tá a bá rọ̀ mọ́ àwọn ìlànà yẹn, a máa lè borí àdánwò.
target: If we stand by the principles, then we can get through the test successfully.

input: Ohun tó dáa jù tá a le ṣe tá a bá ń kojú àdánwò ni pé, ká gbà pé àdánwò ló délẹ̀ yìí, ká sì máa rántí pé Jèhófà máa fún wa lókun ti àá fi borí ẹ̀.
target: The best thing to do is to accept our tests and remember that Jehovah will give us the strength to get through them.

input: Mo dúpẹ́ gan-an lọ́wọ́ ìdílé mi àtàwọn ọmọ mi, wọ́n kú àdúrótì.
target: I am very thankful to my family and my sons, who supported me.

input: Gbogbo àǹfààní tó bá yọ ni wọ́n fi ń wá wò mí, ìyẹn ò sì jẹ́ kí n rẹ̀wẹ̀sì.
target: They used every opportunity to visit me, and it helped me to remain strong.

input: Bákan náà, mo fẹ́ dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ ẹgbẹ́ ará fún gbogbo ohun tí wọ́n ṣe.
target: Additionally, I want to thank our brotherhood for all that they did.

input: Mo mọrírì àdúrà wọn àtàwọn lẹ́tà tó ń gbéni ró tí wọ́n kọ sí mi.
target: I appreciated their prayers, and their encouraging letters.

input: Mi ò mọ̀ ọ́n lára pé wọ́n pa mí tì fún ìṣẹ́jú kan.
target: I did not feel abandoned for one minute.

input: Ohun tó ṣẹlẹ̀ sí mi ti jẹ́ kí ìfẹ́ tí mo ní sí ẹgbẹ́ ará pọ̀ sí i, ó sì ti jẹ́ kí àjọṣe tí mo ní pẹ̀lú Jèhófà lágbára sí i.
target: What has happened to me has increased my love for the brotherhood and strengthened my relationship with Jehovah.

input: Ní November 30, 2018, Ilé Iṣẹ́ Ètò Ìdájọ́ lórílẹ̀-èdè Kyrgyzstan forúkọ ọ́fíìsì àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà tó wà ní ìlú Osh sílẹ̀, ìlú yìí ló tóbi ṣèkèjì lórílẹ̀-èdè Kyrgyzstan.
target: On November 30, 2018, the Kyrgyzstan Ministry of Justice registered an office for Jehovah’s Witnesses in the city of Osh, the second-largest city in Kyrgyzstan.

input: Nípa bẹ́ẹ̀, ńṣe làwọn aláṣẹ ìlú bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí í ka ìpàdé àwọn ará wa àti iṣẹ́ ìwàásù wọn sí ohun tí kò bófin mu.
target: As a result, city authorities have often viewed our brothers’ Christian meetings and public ministry as illegal.

input: Láwọn ìgbà kan àwọn ọlọ́pàá ya wọnú ilé tàbí ibi táwọn ará gbà láti pé jọ sí fún jọ́sìn.
target: On occasion, the police have raided private homes or rented facilities where our brothers were gathering for worship.

input: Inú wa dùn pé ìyípadà yìí máa mú kí àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà túbọ̀ lẹ́tọ̀ọ́ lórílẹ̀-èdè Kyrgyzstan láti máa pé jọ fún ìjọsìn ká sì máa báwọn èèyàn sọ̀rọ̀ nípa Bíbélì láìsí wàhálà.—1 Tímótì 21-4.
target: We rejoice that this positive development will help further establish the right for Witnesses in Kyrgyzstan to meet freely for worship and peacefully share the Bible’s message with others.—1 Timothy 21-4.

input: Ní June 14, 2018, àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà tó wà nílùú Ulaanbaatar tó jẹ́ olú-ìlú orílẹ̀-èdè Mòǹgólíà, gba ìwé ẹ̀rí kan látọ̀dọ̀ Àjọ Tó Ń Rí sí Ọ̀rọ̀ Ìlú, pé ìjọba ti pa dà forúkọ ẹ̀sìn wọn sílẹ̀ lábẹ́ òfin lórílẹ̀-èdè náà.
target: Jehovah’s Witnesses in the capital of Mongolia, Ulaanbaatar, received a certificate from the City Council’s office on June 14, 2018, officially granting permission to renew their religious entity.

input: Ìwé ẹ̀rí tó jẹ́ káwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà lè máa ṣe ẹ̀sìn wọn ní Ulaanbaatar.
target: Renewal certificate allowing Jehovah’s Witnesses to legally operate in Ulaanbaatar.

input: Ìjọba sọ fáwọn ẹlẹ́sìn pé ọdọọdún ni kí wọ́n máa forúkọ ẹ̀sìn wọn sílẹ̀ ní Mòǹgólíà, àtìgbà táwọn ará wa sì ti kọ́kọ́ forúkọ ẹ̀sìn wọn sílẹ̀ lábẹ́ òfin lọ́dún 1999 ni wọ́n ti ń ṣe bẹ́ẹ̀.
target: Religious organizations in Mongolia are required to renew their registrations annually, and our brothers had successfully done this since first being registered in 1999.

input: Àmọ́ lọ́dún 2015, Àjọ Tó Ń Rí sí Ọ̀rọ̀ Ìlú ò gbà káwọn ará wa forúkọ ẹ̀sìn wọn sílẹ̀ ní Ulaanbaatar.
target: However, in 2015, the City Council withheld the renewal of our legal entity in Ulaanbaatar.

input: Nígbà tó di January 2017, Àjọ Tó Ń Rí sí Ọ̀rọ̀ Ìlú sọ pe ìjọba fagi lé àǹfààní tí àwọn ará ní láti ṣe ẹ̀sìn wọn.
target: Then, in January 2017, the City Council issued a ruling that officially annulled permission for the legal entity to carry out its religious activity.

input: Àwọn tó ṣojú fún Àjọ náà ò sọ ohunkóhun tó mú kí wọ́n ṣe ìpinnu yìí.
target: Council representatives refused to disclose the evidence they used to support their decision.

input: Làwọn ará bá sọ pé àwọn máa gbé ọ̀rọ̀ náà lọ sílé ẹjọ́.
target: The brothers decided to legally challenge the City Council’s decision.

input: Àmọ́ àwọn agbẹjọ́rò wa jẹ́ kó ṣe kedere pé ọ̀pọ̀ orílẹ̀-èdè ni ò fara mọ́ ẹjọ́ tí ilé ẹjọ́ dá ní Rọ́ṣíà àti pé ọ̀rọ̀ náà ti dé àwọn ilé ẹjọ́ àgbáyé.
target: Our attorneys argued that this ruling has been the subject of international criticism and has been challenged in international courts.

input: Wọ́n tún rán ilé ẹjọ́ létí pé ẹ̀yìn tí Àjọ Tó Ń Rí sí Ọ̀rọ̀ Ìlú ṣèpinnu tiwọn ni ọ̀rọ̀ ti Rọ́ṣíà wáyé, torí náà, Àjọ náà ò lè sọ pé ohun tó ṣẹlẹ̀ ní Rọ́ṣíà ló mú káwọn ṣèpinnu táwọn ṣe.
target: Additionally, the court was reminded that Russia’s ruling came after the City Council’s decisions and therefore could not be used as justification for its conclusions.

input: Ilé Ẹjọ́ fagi lé ìpinnu tí Àjọ Tó Ń Rí sí Ọ̀rọ̀ Ìlú ṣe, wọ́n ní àhesọ ọ̀rọ̀ lásán ni Àjọ náà gùn lé tí wọ́n fi ṣèpinnu, wọn ò sì rí ẹ̀rí kankan mú wá pé àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ṣe ohunkóhun tó léwu.
target: The Administrative Court reversed the City Council’s decision, concluding that the council had acted out of hearsay and failed to provide evidence of any harmful activity.

input: Ilé Ẹjọ́ náà tún rí i pé Àjọ Tó Ń Rí sí Ọ̀rọ̀ Ìlú fi ẹ̀tọ́ táwọn ará wa ní lábẹ́ òfin dù wọ́n, tó fi mọ́ òmìnira láti ṣe ẹ̀sìn wọn tàbí ohun tí wọ́n gbà gbọ́.
target: It also found that the City Council had violated the brothers’ fundamental rights, including the freedom to manifest one’s religion or beliefs.

input: Ara àwọn àǹfààní tá à ń rí bá a ṣe forúkọ ẹ̀sìn wa sílẹ̀ ni pé ó ń jẹ́ kó rọrùn fún wa láti kó Bíbélì àtàwọn ìwé tó dá lórí Bíbélì wọ̀lú, ká lè ní ibi ìjọsìn, ká sì lè yá àwọn ibi tá a ti máa ṣe àpéjọ.
target: Among other things, our legal entity facilitates importing Bibles and Bible literature, owning places of worship, and renting convention facilities.

input: Inú wa dùn pé Ilé Ẹjọ́ fagi lé ìpinnu tí Àjọ Tó Ń Rí sí Ọ̀rọ̀ Ìlú ṣe nílùú Ulaanbaatar, tí wọ́n sì gbà pé irú ìpinnu bẹ́ẹ̀ máa ṣàkóbá fún òmìnira tá a ní láti ṣe ẹ̀sìn wa àti òmìnira tá a ní láti pé jọ ní Mòǹgólíà.
target: We are pleased that the Administrative Court overturned the City Council’s decision in Ulaanbaatar and recognized that such rulings would negatively affect our freedom of religion and association in Mongolia.

input: Òjò àrọ̀ọ̀rọ̀dá kan rọ̀ lórílẹ̀-èdè Nepal, ó sì fa àkúnya omi àti ilẹ̀ yíya, ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ yìí sọ ẹgbẹẹgbẹ̀rún àwọn èèyàn di aláìnílé, ó sì pa àwọn èèyàn tó lé ní ogóje 140.
target: Heavy monsoon rains led to floods and landslides in Nepal, displacing thousands of people and killing more than 140.

input: Àkúnya omi náà ba àwọn ojú títì jẹ́, ó sì ba iná mànàmáná jẹ́, èyí wá mú kó nira láti ran àwọn tọ́rọ̀ kàn lọ́wọ́.
target: The flooding damaged highways and power lines, hampering relief efforts.

input: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà tó wà lórílẹ̀-èdè Japan náà ló ń bójú tó iṣẹ́ àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà tó wà ní Nepal, wọ́n sì sọ pé kò sí Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà kankan tó fara pa tàbí tó kú nínú jàǹbá náà.
target: The branch office of Jehovah’s Witnesses in Japan, which also coordinates the Witnesses’ activities in Nepal, reports that no Witnesses were injured or killed in the incident.

input: Àmọ́, ó di dandan fún ìdílé àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà mẹ́rin láti filé wọn sílẹ̀, torí pé àkúnya omi tí bá àwọn ilé ọ̀hún jẹ́.
target: However, at least four Witness families were forced to evacuate from their homes, which were damaged by the floodwaters.

input: Àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà tó wà lágbègbè náà ti ń ran àwọn ará bíi tiwọn lọ́wọ́, ìyẹn àwọn tómi gbalé wọn.
target: Local Witnesses have been caring for their fellow believers who were displaced.

input: Kárí Ayé David A.Semonian, Ọ́fíìsì Agbéròyìnjáde, 1-845-524-3000
target: David A.Semonian, Office of Public Information, 1-845-524-3000

input: Ní August 28, 2019, àrọ̀ọ̀rọ̀dá òjò kan mú kí odò Talomo kún àkúnya, omi náà sí ya wọ ìlú Davao.
target: On August 28, 2019, heavy rains caused the Talomo River to overflow in Davao City.

input: Ìròyìn látọ̀dọ̀ àwọn aláṣẹ fi hàn pé omíyalé tó tẹ̀ lé òjò yìí lé ìdílé tó tó nǹkan bí ọgọ́rùn-ún márùn-ún àti márùndínláàádọ́ta 545 kúrò nílé wọn.
target: According to government data, the subsequent flooding forced some 545 families to evacuate.

input: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì Philippines ròyìn pé ọgọ́fà 120 akéde látì ìjọ márùn-ún ni àkúnya omi yìí ṣàkóbá fún.
target: The Philippines branch office reports that 120 publishers from five congregations were impacted by this disaster.

input: Ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn akéde yìí ló fara pa mọ́ sí Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba.
target: Many of the publishers had to take refuge at the local Kingdom Hall.

input: Àkúnya omi náà wó ilé mẹ́ta, ó sì ba ilé mẹ́rin tó jẹ́ ti àwọn ará wa jẹ́.
target: Floodwaters destroyed three of our brothers’ homes and damaged four.

input: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì gbé Ìgbìmọ̀ Tó Ń Ṣètò Ìrànwọ́ Nígbà Àjálù dìde láti bójú tó àìní àwọn arákùnrin àti arábìnrin tí ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ yìí ṣàkóbá fún.
target: The branch established a Disaster Relief Committee DRC to care for the needs of the affected brothers and sisters.

input: Ìgbìmọ̀ yìí rí i dájú pé àwọn tí ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ náà ṣàkóbá fún rí àwọn ohun tí wọ́n nílò, wọ́n sì ṣètò láti ṣé ìmọ́tótó àwọn ilé tí omi ya wọ̀.
target: The DRC has already coordinated the delivery of relief supplies and organized the cleaning of the flooded homes.

input: Àdúrà wa ni pé kí ìfẹ́ táwọn ará ń fi hàn máa tu àwọn arákùnrin àti arábìnrin wa nílùú Davao nínú, pàápàá ní àkókò tó le koko yìí.​—Róòmù 1210.
target: We pray that our brothers and sisters in Davao City will continue to be comforted by the brotherly love that abounds even during difficult times.—Romans 1210.

input: Ọjọ́ November 1-3, 2019
target: November 1-3, 2019

input: Ibi Tí Wọ́n Ti Ṣe é Gbọ̀ngàn Mall of Asia Arena àti SMX Convention Center ní Manila, Philippines
target: Mall of Asia Arena and SMX Convention Center in Manila, Philippines

input: Àwọn Ẹ̀ka Ọ́fíìsì Tá a Pè Australasia, Central Europe, France, Indonesia, Italy, Japan, Kazakhstan, Madagascar, Malaysia, Myanmar, Papua New Guinea, Solomon Islands, South Africa, Sri Lanka, Taiwan, Thailand, United States
target: Australasia, Central Europe, France, Indonesia, Italy, Japan, Kazakhstan, Madagascar, Malaysia, Myanmar, Papua New Guinea, Solomon Islands, South Africa, Sri Lanka, Taiwan, Thailand, United States

input: Àwọn Ìrírí Rogelio Jolongbayan tó jẹ́ máníjà tó ń rí sí ọ̀rọ̀ àwọn oníbàárà ní gbọ̀ngàn Asia Arena sọ pé Ẹ̀yin lẹ níwà ọmọlúwàbí jù nínú gbogbo àwọn tó ti ń lo ibí.
target: Rogelio Jolongbayan, regional manager of customer relations for the Mall of Asia Arena,You are so far the most disciplined group among those that we have interacted with.

input: Inú wa dùn pé ẹ wá síbí.
target: It’s been a pleasure having you in our arena.

input: Ọ̀gá ọlọ́pàá kan lórílẹ̀-èdè Philippines náà sọ pé Ṣe làwọn àlejò náà tò lọ́wọ̀ọ̀wọ́ wọnú gbọ̀ngàn náà, ó sì wúni lórí gan an.
target: Nolasco Bathan, brigadier general and district director of the southern police district,The delegates all nicely queued up entering the venue.

input: Mi ò rò pé wọ́n nílò wa níbí tó bá jẹ́ pé báyìí ni nǹkan ṣe ń lọ
target: When things are this organized, we are not even needed here

input: Teofilo Labe Jr.tó jẹ́ olùrànlọ́wọ́ fún alábòójútó fún ọ̀rọ̀ ààbò ní Manila Hotel ni wọ́n ní kó rí sí bí àwọn àlejò ṣe máa rìnrìn àjò afẹ́.
target: Teofilo Labe Jr., assistant security manager at the Manila Hotel, was assigned to monitor the management of the delegates for their tours.

input: Lẹ́yìn tó kíyè sí bí nǹkan ṣe ń lọ fúngbà díẹ̀, ó wá sọ pé Tí àwọn aláṣẹ bá ní kí n díwọ̀n bí ẹ ṣe ṣètò ara yín sí, màá sọ pé ẹ̀yin lẹ ṣe dáadáa jù.
target: After observing for a while,If the management asks me to rate how you manage your tour departures, .I will rate you more than excellent.

input: Ẹ wà létòlétò gan an ni.
target: Your group is very organized.

input: Ìjì líle Vongfong tí wọ́n tún ń pè ní Ambo jà ní erékùṣù Samar ní May 14, 2020.
target: Typhoon Vongfong locally known as Ambo made landfall on the island of Samar on May 14, 2020.

input: Ìgbà àkọ́kọ́ tí irú ìjì líle yìí máa jà lọ́dún 2020 nìyẹn, Ìwọ̀ Oòrùn Òkun Pàsífíìkì ló sì ti jà, ìjì náà ṣọṣẹ́ gan-an ní erékùṣù Samar.
target: The Category 3 typhoon, the first tropical storm of 2020 in the Western Pacific Ocean, battered Samar with winds of up to 185 kilometers per hour 115 mph.

input: Kódà, ẹgbẹẹgbẹ̀rún èèyàn ló kó kúrò lágbègbè yẹn, èyí ò sì rọrùn rara torí ìjọba ti ṣòfin pé káwọn èèyàn máa jìnnà síra torí àrùn tó wà lóde.
target: Hundreds of thousands of people were evacuated, a process that proved to be especially complicated because of government-mandated physical distancing.

input: Bó tiẹ̀ jẹ́ pé kò sí ìkankan nínú àwọn ará wa tó fara pa, àwọn mọkàndínlọ́gọ́ta 59 ló ní láti fi ilé wọn sílẹ̀.
target: While none of our brothers and sisters were injured, 59 of them had to evacuate their homes.

input: Àwọn kan lọ ń gbé ní iléèwé tí wọ́n ṣètò pé káwọn èèyàn sá sí, àwọn míì sì lọ ń gbé ní ilé àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà bíi tiwọn.
target: They were accommodated either in schools, which are being used as shelters, or in the homes of fellow Witnesses.

input: Yàtọ̀ síyẹn, ilé àwọn ará méjìlélọ́gọ́rin 82 ni ìjì náà bà jẹ́.
target: Additionally, 82 of our brothers’ homes were either destroyed or damaged.

input: Kódà, Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba márùn-ún ló bà jẹ́, ìkan sì wó lulẹ̀ pátápátá.
target: Five Kingdom Halls were also damaged, and one was completely destroyed.

input: Ìgbìmọ̀ Ẹ̀ka orílẹ̀-èdè Philippines dá Ìgbìmọ̀ Tó Ń Pèsè Ìrànwọ́ Nígbà Àjálù sílẹ̀, kí wọ́n lè fún àwọn ará wa tí ìjì náà ṣàkóbá fún ní ohun tí wọ́n nílò nípa tara, kí wọ́n sì tún fún ìgbàgbọ́ wọn lókun.
target: The Philippines Branch Committee has formed two Disaster Relief Committees to respond to the physical and spiritual needs of our affected brothers and sisters.

input: A ò ní dákẹ́ àdúrà lórí àwọn ará wa ní Philippines, tí wọ́n ń fara da ọṣẹ́ tí ìjì líle àti àrùn corona ń fà.
target: We will continue to pray for our brothers in the Philippines who are enduring the dual disasters of a typhoon and a pandemic.

input: Ó dá wa lójú pé Jèhófà tó jẹ́ àpáta ayérayé á máa pèsè ohun táwọn ará wa nílò lásìkò tí nǹkan le koko yìí.​—Àìsáyà 264.
target: We are fully confident that Jehovah, our eternal Rock, will continue to care for their needs.—Isaiah 264.

input: Ní ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ August 2019, òjò alátẹ́gùn bẹ̀rẹ̀ lórílẹ̀-èdè Philippines pẹ̀lú òjò rẹpẹtẹ àti ìjì líle, èyí sì fa àkúnya omi àti ilẹ̀ ríri.
target: In early August 2019, monsoon weather struck the Philippines with heavy rains and strong winds, causing flooding and landslides.

input: Ó bani nínú jẹ́ pé ilẹ̀ tó rì náà pa arákùnrin kan tó ń sìn gẹ́gẹ́ bí aṣáájú-ọ̀nà àkànṣe onígbà díẹ̀ nílùú Natonin, lágbègbè Mountain Province.
target: Sadly, one brother who was serving as a temporary special pioneer was killed by a landslide in Natonin, Mountain Province.

input: Arákùnrin míì tí òun náà ń sìn gẹ́gẹ́ bí aṣáájú-ọ̀nà àkànṣe onígbà díẹ̀ fara pa díẹ̀ nínú ilẹ̀ ríri kan náà.
target: Another brother, who also serves as a temporary special pioneer, sustained minor injuries in the same landslide.

input: Nínú ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ míì, àwókù pàǹtírí ṣe ọmọkùnrin ọlọ́dún mẹ́wàá kan léṣe, àmọ́ ó rí ìtọ́jú tó yẹ gbà.
target: In a separate incident, a ten-year old boy was injured by debris but received appropriate medical care.

input: Kò sí ilé àwọn arákùnrin wa tò bàjẹ́ jù.
target: None of our brothers’ homes were seriously damaged.

input: Àmọ́, ìjì líle tó ṣọṣẹ́ ní Negros Occidental ba Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba kan jẹ́, ó sì ya lára òrùlé ilé náà lulẹ̀.
target: However, one Kingdom Hall in Negros Occidental suffered minor damage from strong winds that caused a portion of the ceiling to fall.

input: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì Philippines àti alábòójútó àyíká ń pèsè ìtùnú fún àwọn ìdílé tí ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ náà kàn, wọ́n sì ń fi Bíbélì tù wọ́n nínú.
target: The Philippines branch office and the local circuit overseer are providing spiritual and emotional support to the families of our affected brothers.

input: Ó bani nínú jẹ́ láti gbọ́ nípa àdánù ńlá yìí, à sì ń gbàdúrà fún àwọn tó ń ṣọ̀fọ̀ ikú arákùnrin wa.
target: We are saddened to hear of this tragic loss and pray for those grieving the death of our brother.

input: À ń retí ọjọ́ iwájú kan nígbà tí àwọn ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ burúkú ò ní wá sí ìrántí.​—Àìsáyà 6517.
target: We look forward to the day when painful events will not even be called to mind.—Isaiah 6517.

input: Ìjì Líle Yutu tó ṣọṣẹ́ gan-an ní Àwọn Erékùṣù Northern Mariana ní October 24 tún jà ní erékùṣù Luzon ní Tuesday, October 30.
target: Typhoon Yutu, which previously had struck the Northern Mariana Islands as a super typhoon on October 24, made landfall on Luzon, the largest island of the Philippines, on Tuesday, October 30.

input: Erékùṣù yìí ló tóbi jù lórílẹ̀-èdè Philippines.
target: Heavy rainfall from the storm caused flooding and fatal landslides.

input: Òjò àrọ̀ọ̀rọ̀dá tó bá ìjì yẹn rìn fa omíyalé, ó mú kí ilẹ̀ ya, èyí sì pa àwọn èèyàn.Ẹgbẹẹgbẹ̀rún èèyàn ni wọ́n kó kúrò lágbègbè náà, èèyàn mọ́kànlá 11 ló sì kú.
target: Thousands of people were evacuated, and 11 people were killed.

input: Ìròyìn tá a gbọ́ láti ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa ní Philippines ni pé kò sí ìkankan lára àwọn ará wa tí ìjì náà pa tàbí tó ṣe léṣe.
target: The Philippines branch reports that no brothers or sisters were killed or injured by the storm.

input: Àmọ́ ilé mẹ́tàléláàádọ́rin 73 tó jẹ́ ti àwọn ará wa ló bà jẹ́, títí kan Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba mẹ́fà.
target: However, 73 homes of our brothers were damaged as well as 6 Kingdom Halls.

input: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa ní Philippines ti ń ṣètò ìrànwọ́ fáwọn tí àjálù náà ṣẹlẹ̀ sí.
target: The Philippines branch is coordinating the relief work.

input: A ò dákẹ́ àdúrà lórí àwọn ará wa ní Philippines, torí ó ti di ìjì líle méjìdínlógún 18 báyìí tó jà níbẹ̀ lọ́dún yìí.
target: We continue to pray for our brothers and sisters in the Philippines, who have been affected by 18 typhoons this year.

input: Bí wọ́n ṣe gbẹ́kẹ̀ lé Jèhófà làwa náà gbẹ́kẹ̀ lé e, a sì mọ̀ pé ó máa gbé wa ró.—Sáàmù 5522.
target: Along with them, we trust in Jehovah, knowing that he will sustain us.—Psalm 5522.

input: Nílùú Davao lórílẹ̀-èdè Philippines, ó ju ẹgbẹ̀rún mọ́kànlélọ́gbọ̀n 31,000 èèyàn tí kì í ṣe Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà tó dara pọ̀ mọ́ ìjọ́ kan láti wo Ìrántí Ikú Kristi tí wọ́n ṣètò látorí ẹ̀rọ.
target: In Davao City, Philippines, over 31,000 non-Witnesses linked in to one congregation’s Memorial commemoration.

input: Kò ṣeé ṣe fún àwọn ìjọ náà láti wà pa pọ̀ torí òfin tí ìjọba gbé kalẹ̀, torí náà wọ́n ṣàtagbà Ìrántí Ikú Kristi látorí ẹ̀rọ.
target: In obedience to governmental restrictions, the congregation was not able to meet together, so they held their observance via videoconference.

input: Ọ̀pọ̀ èèyàn ló dara pọ̀ mọ́ Ìrántí Ikú Kristi yìí torí pé ọ̀dọ́ kan tó jẹ́ aṣáájú-ọ̀nà sapá láti ké sí wọn.
target: The extraordinary turnout was the result of one young pioneer’s invitation.

input: Aṣáájú-ọ̀nà déédéé ni Daphane Jane tó jẹ́ ọmọ ọdún mẹ́tàdínlógún 17, tó ń gbé nílùú Davao.
target: Seventeen-year-old Daphane Jane is a regular pioneer in Davao City.

input: Ọ̀pọ̀ ọdún ló ti ń bá àìsàn ojú tó lágbára fínra, èyí sì ti mú kó má ríran dáadáa mọ́.
target: She has been battling the early onset of glaucoma for several years, which has degenerated her eyesight.

input: Daphane wá pinnu pé òun máa sọ fún dókítà tó ń tọ́jú òun pé kó wo àkànṣe àsọyé àti Ìrántí Ikú Kristi tá a ṣàtagbà látorí ẹ̀rọ.
target: Daphane was determined to invite the doctor who has been treating her glaucoma to view the special talk and the Memorial via videoconference.

input: Ó wú dókítà náà lórí bí Daphane ṣe fi Bíbélì dáhùn àwọn ìbéèrè rẹ̀ àti bó ṣe bá a sọ̀rọ̀ nípa àwọn àpilẹ̀kọ tó wà lórí ìkànnì jw.org, torí náà dókítà náà gbà láti wo àwọn àsọyé náà.
target: The doctor was impressed that Daphane could answer his questions using the Bible and direct him to articles from jw.org, so he accepted her invitation.

input: Ní Sunday, April 5, dókítà yìí wo àkànṣe àsọyé náà, dókítà náà tún ké sáwọn dókítà àtàwọn nọ́ọ̀sì méjìlá 12 tí wọ́n jọ ń ṣiṣẹ́ pé kí wọ́n wo àsọyé náà.
target: On Sunday, April 5, not only was the doctor tied in to the special talk but 12 of his colleagues were tied in as well.

input: Àwọn dókítà àtàwọn nọ́ọ̀sì yìí tún sọ fáwọn ẹlòmíì pé kí wọ́n wo àsọyé yìí.
target: Those colleagues, in turn, had invited yet more people.

input: Torí náà, èèyàn ọgọ́rùn-ún kan ó lé méjìdínlọ́gbọ̀n 128 ló wo àkànṣe àsọyé ọ̀hún.
target: As a result, 128 people linked in to the special talk.

input: Lẹ́yìn àsọyé yẹn, ọ̀kan lára àwọn dókítà náà sọ pé òun kórìíra àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà tẹ́lẹ̀, òun sì máa ń ta kò wọ́n tí wọ́n bá ń wàásù.
target: After the program, one of the doctors admitted that he previously hated Jehovah’s Witnesses and opposed our ministry.

input: Àmọ́, lẹ́yìn tó gbọ́ àkànṣe àsọyé yẹn, ó sọ pé Mo fẹ́ tọrọ àforíjì, torí pé mo jágbe mọ́ obìnrin kan lára yín, mo sì kàn-án lábùkù.
target: But having heard the special talk,I would like to apologize because I shouted at one of your sisters and humiliated her.

input: Ẹ ṣeun pé ẹ fún mi láǹfààní láti gbọ́ àsọyé yín.
target: Thank you so much for the privilege of listening to your talk.

input: Mo rọ̀ yín pé kẹ́ ẹ máa bá iṣẹ́ ìwàásù yín lọ.
target: Please continue your preaching work.

input: Dókítà tó ń tọ́jú Daphane tún pinnu pé òun máa wo àsọyé Ìrántí Ikú Kristi àti pé òun máa ké sí ọ̀pọ̀ dókítà tí wọ́n jọ ń ṣiṣẹ́ láti wò ó.
target: Daphane’s doctor decided to also watch the Memorial program and invite even more of his colleagues.

input: Torí pé ètò ìṣiṣẹ́ tí ìjọ náà fi ń ṣàtagbà kò fàyè gba ọ̀pọ̀ èèyàn láti wo àsọyé yìí, dókítà náà gbà láti bójú tó bí àwọn èèyàn ṣe máa dara pọ̀ mọ́ àsọyé náà, èyí sì mú kó ṣeé ṣe fún ọ̀pọ̀ èèyàn láti wò ó.
target: Since the congregation’s videoconferencing system could not handle the added number of people, the doctor even assisted in hosting the videoconference.

input: Nígbà tó di ọjọ́ Ìrántí Ikú Kristi, àwọn dókítà, àwọn nọ́ọ̀sì, àwọn ọlọ́pàá àtàwọn tó jẹ́ ọ̀gá lẹ́nu iṣẹ́ ìjọba wá wo àsọyé náà.
target: On the day of the Memorial, medical professionals, policemen, and high government officials were linked in to the meeting.

input: Kí àsọyé náà tó parí, ó ti ju ẹgbẹ̀rún mọ́kànlélọ́gbọ̀n èèyàn 31,000 tó wo ìtòlẹ́sẹẹsẹ náà látorí ẹ̀rọ tàbí ohùn tá a gbà sílẹ̀.
target: By the end of the Memorial, over 31,000 had connected to the program either by video or audio.

input: Dókítà kan dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ Daphane àtàwọn ará wa pé wọ́n ké sí òun, ó wá sọ pé A ò tiẹ̀ mọ̀ pé àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà máa ń wàásù lórí ìkànnì.
target: We had no idea that Jehovah’s Witnesses preach online.

input: Bẹ́ ẹ ṣe ń lo ẹ̀rọ ìgbàlódé dára gan-an.
target: You are using technology in a very good way.

input: Ẹlòmíì sọ pé Ó ṣeé ṣe fún ọ̀pọ̀ àwa dókítà àti nọ́ọ̀sì láti gbọ́ àsọyé yìí.
target: Many of us, doctors and nurses, were able to join.

input: Ó ti pẹ́ gan-an tá a ti gbọ́ àsọyé Bíbélì kẹ́yìn, ìgbà àkọ́kọ́ sì rèé tá a máa gbádùn rẹ̀ lórí ẹ̀rọ.
target: It’s been a long time since we have listened to a Bible talk, and this is the first time we had it through videoconference.

input: Ó yà wá lẹ́nu láti rí i pé àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ń jọ́sìn Ọlọ́run pa pọ̀ lọ́nà yìí.
target: We were surprised that the Witnesses have this way of worship.

input: A retí pé kẹ́ ẹ máa bá a nìṣó láti jẹ́ káwọn èèyàn wo àwọn àsọyé Bíbélì yín látorí ẹ̀rọ.
target: We hope that you continue these arrangements.

input: Ètò tẹ́ ẹ ṣe yìí ràn wá lọ́wọ́ gan-an, pàápàá lákòókò tí nǹkan túbọ̀ ń burú yìí.
target: It is a very big help especially during these times when things are getting worse.

input: Àkànṣe àsọyé àti àsọyé Ìrántí Ikú Kristi wọ ọ̀pọ̀ èèyàn lọ́kàn gan-an.
target: For some, the special talk and Memorial were especially moving.

input: Ọ̀kan lára àwọn tó wò ó sọ pé Ìgbà àkọ́kọ́ rèé tí màá sunkún bí mo ṣe ń gbọ́ àsọyé tó dá lórí Bíbélì.
target: It was my first time to cry while listening to a Bible-based talk.

input: Mo dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ ẹ, Daphane Jane pé o ké sí dókítà rẹ láti gbọ́ àsọyé yìí, àwa náà sì wà lára àwọn tó rí ìtùnú gbà.
target: I am very thankful to you, Daphane Jane, that you invited your doctor, and we too were included among those comforted.

input: Mo ti wá gbà báyìí pé Ọlọ́run wà, mo sì dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ ẹ fún bó o ṣe ràn mí lọ́wọ́ láti mọ̀ bẹ́ẹ̀.
target: Now, I believe that there is a God, and I thank you, because my point of view was changed.

input: Lẹ́yìn tí Daphane Jane rí ọ̀nà tí Jèhófà gbà ràn án lọ́wọ́, ó wá pinnu pé òun á máa bá a lọ láti wàásù láìka ti àìsàn tó ń bá òun fínra àti òfin tí ìjọba ṣe torí àjàkálẹ̀ àrùn tó gbòde yìí.
target: Having seen how Jehovah has helped her, Daphane Jane is determined to keep on preaching despite her physical limitations and the challenges of the pandemic.

input: Ìrírí Daphane yìí rán wa létí pé kò yẹ kí a jáwọ́ nínú ṣíṣe rere, torí tí àkókò bá tó, a máa kórè rẹ̀ tí a ò bá jẹ́ kó rẹ̀ wá.​—⁠Gálátíà 6⁠9.
target: Her experience reminds us that we should not give up in doing what is fine, for in due time we will reap if we do not tire out.—Galatians 69.

input: Ní oṣù January 2019, Arákùnrin Mark Sanderson tó jẹ́ ara Ìgbìmọ̀ Olùdarí mú Bíbélì jáde lédè Cebuano, Tagalog àti Waray-Waray láwọn ibi àkànṣe ìpàdé kan.
target: At special events held during January 2019, Brother Mark Sanderson, a member of the Governing Body, released the Bible in Cebuano, Tagalog, and Waray-Waray.

input: Gbọ̀ngàn ìwòran Hoops Dome tó wà ní ìlú Lapu-Lapu ni wọ́n ti mú Bíbélì èdè Cebuano jáde ní January 12.
target: The Cebuano edition was released at the Hoops Dome in Lapu-Lapu City on January 12.

input: Lọ́jọ́ kejì, a mú ti èdè Waray-Waray jáde, wọ́n sì pín in ní Gbọ̀ngàn Leyte Academic Center tó wà ní ìlú Palo lágbègbè Leyte.
target: The following day, the Waray-Waray edition was distributed at the Leyte Academic Center in Palo, Leyte.

input: Ní January 20, a mú Bíbélì jáde lédè Tagalog ní Gbọ̀ngàn Àpéjọ Metro Manila tó wà ní ìlú Quezon City.
target: On January 20, the Tagalog edition was released at the Metro Manila Assembly Hall in Quezon City.

input: Ìdílé kan ń ka Bíbélì Ìtumọ̀ Ayé Tuntun tá a tún ṣe tí wọ́n ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ gbà lédè Cebuano.
target: A family enjoys their new copy of the revised New World Translation in Cebuano.

input: Ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba la ta àtagbà àwọn àkànṣe ìpàdé náà sí, ó sì lé ní ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́tàlélọ́gọ́jọ 163,000 Bíbélì Ìtumọ̀ Ayé Tuntun tá a pín fáwọn tó wá.
target: Hundreds of Kingdom Halls were tied in to these programs, and over 163,000 copies of the New World Translation were distributed.

input: Arákùnrin Dean Jacek tó wà ní ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì ní Philippines sọ pé Bíbélì Ìtumọ̀ Ayé Tuntun tá a tún ṣe la mú jáde lédè Cebuano àti Tagalog.
target: Brother Dean Jacek, at the Philippines branch office,The Cebuano and Tagalog editions are revised versions of the New World Translation.

input: Ó lé lọ́dún mẹ́ta kí wọ́n tó parí iṣẹ́ lórí ọ̀kọ̀kan wọn.
target: Each took over three years to develop.

input: A ti ní Ìwé Mímọ́ Kristẹni Lédè Gíríìkì tẹ́lè lédè Waray-Waray, àmọ́ ìgbà àkọ́kó nìyí táwọn tó ń ka èdè yìí máa ní odindi Bíbélì Ìtumọ̀ Ayé Tuntun.
target: The Waray-Waray language previously only had the Christian Greek Scriptures, so this is the first time readers can enjoy the complete New World Translation.

input: Ó lé lọ́dún márùn-ún tí wọ́n fi ṣiṣẹ́ ìtúmọ̀ rẹ̀.
target: This project took over five years to complete.

input: Tá a bá pín àwọn tó ń gbé ní Philippines sọ́nà mẹ́wàá, àwọn tó ń sọ èdè Cebuano, Tagalog tàbí Waray-Waray lé ní ìdá mẹ́fà.
target: In the Philippines, over 60 percent of the population speaks Cebuano, Tagalog, or Waray-Waray.

input: Lára wọn ni nǹkan bí ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà ọgọ́jọ 160,000 àwọn ará wa àti ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà ọgọ́rùn-ún méjì ó dín mẹ́ta 197,000 àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ Bíbélì.
target: That number includes nearly 160,000 of our brothers and sisters, as well as over 197,000 Bible students.

input: Yàtọ̀ síyẹn, ní báyìí, ẹgḅẹẹgbẹ̀rún àwọn ọmọ ilẹ̀ Philippines tó ń gbé láwọn ilè míì náà máa lè gbádùn gbogbo ohun tó wà nínú Bíbélì Ìtumọ̀ Ayé Tuntun láwọn èdè yìí.
target: Additionally, there are tens of thousands of Filipinos who reside outside of the Philippines who will now be able to enjoy all the features of the New World Translation in these languages.

input: Ọ̀rọ̀ tó rọrùn tó wà nínú ẹ̀ ń jẹ́ kó ṣe wá bíi pé Jèhófà ń bá wa sọ̀rọ̀ lẹ́nì kọ̀ọ̀kan, ó sì mú kí ohun tó wà nínú Bíbélì túbọ̀ wọ̀ni lọ́kàn.
target: The use of simple words helps us to feel like Jehovah is talking to us on a more personal level, making it easier for the Bible’s message to touch our hearts.

input: Ní lọ́wọ́lọ́wọ́ báyìí, àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ti mú Bíbélì Ìtumọ̀ Ayé Tuntun jáde lódindi tàbí lápá kan ní èdè mọ́kàndínlọ́gọ́sàn-án 179.
target: To date, Jehovah’s Witnesses have made the New World Translation available in whole or in part in 179 languages.

input: A dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ Jèhófà tó ń mú kí Ọ̀rọ̀ rẹ̀ tí wọ́n túmọ̀ lọ́nà tó ṣe kedere dé ọ̀dọ̀ àwọn ará wa àtàwọn tí wọ́n ń kọ́ lẹ́kọ̀ọ́ Bíbélì.—Ìṣe 1348.
target: We thank Jehovah for making clear translations of his Word available for our brothers and sisters and to those with whom they share the Bible’s message.—Acts 1348.

input: Ní July 27, 2019, ìmìtìtì ilẹ̀ méjì tó jà ba ọ̀pọ̀ nǹkan jẹ́ ní erékùṣù kékeré Itbayat tó fẹ́rẹ̀ẹ́ tó ọgọ́rùn-ún méje ó dín mẹ́wàá 690 kìlómità sí Manila, lórílẹ̀ èdè Philippines.
target: On July 27, 2019, two earthquakes ravaged the small island of Itbayat in the Philippines, some 690 kilometers 430 mi north of Manila.

input: Ìmìtìtì ilẹ̀ yìí kọjá kékeré, èèyàn mẹ́sàn-án ló kú, ò ṣe èèyàn mérìnlélọ́gọ́ta 64 léṣe, ó sì ba ilé ọgọ́rùn-ún méjì àti mẹ́rìndínláàádọ́rin 266 jẹ́.
target: The earthquakes registered at 5.4 and 6.4 in magnitude, killed 9 people, injured 64, and destroyed 266 homes.

input: Àwọn aláṣẹ ròyìn pé, ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́ta ó dín méjìlélọ́gbọ̀n 2,968 èèyàn ló fara gbá nínú ìmìtìtì ilẹ̀ náà.
target: Officials report that 2,968 people were affected by the earthquakes.

input: Kò sí ìkankan lára àwọn ará wa tó kú nínú ìmìtìtì ilẹ̀ yìí.
target: None of our brothers were killed in the earthquakes.

input: Àmọ́ arábìnrin kan fara pa díẹ̀.
target: However, one sister suffered a minor injury.

input: Bákan náà, àwọn arákùnrin wa méjì ni ilé wọn bàjẹ́ gan-an.
target: Also, two homes of our brothers were heavily damaged.

input: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì gbé Ìgbìmọ̀ Tó Ń Ṣètò Ìrànwọ́ Nígbà Àjálù dìde, àwọn ló sì ń bójú tó rírà àti pínpín àwọn ohun kòséémàní bí i oúnjẹ àti omi.
target: The branch office set up a Disaster Relief Committee, and it is facilitating the purchase and distribution of basic supplies such as food and water.

input: Àwọn aṣojú ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì máa ṣèbẹ̀wò sí àwọn arákùnrin àti arábìnrin tí ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ yìí kan láti fi ọ̀rọ̀ Ọlọ́run tù wọ́n nínú àti láti pèsè ohun tí wọn nílò fún wọn.
target: Representatives from the branch office will be visiting the affected brothers and sisters to provide spiritual comfort and practical assistance.

input: Gbogbo ìgbà là ń gbàdúrà fún àwọn arákùnrin àti arábìnrin wa tó fara gbá nínú àwọn ìmìtìtì ilẹ̀ tó ṣẹlẹ̀ láìpẹ́ yìí.
target: We pray for our brothers and sisters affected by the recent earthquakes.

input: A mọ̀ pé Jèhófà, Ọlọ́run ìtùnú gbogbo, á máa báa lọ láti bójú tó àìní àwọn ará wa.​—2 Kọ́ríńtì 13.
target: We know that Jehovah, the God of all comfort, will continue to care for our brothers’ needs.—2 Corinthians 13.

input: Ní March 2019, iná ńlá kan sọ ní ìlú Calbayog City ní erékùṣù Samar Island lórílẹ̀-èdè Philippines, ó sì jó ilé méjìdínláàádóje 128.
target: In March 2019, a fire in the Philippines burned 128 homes in Calbayog City on Samar Island.

input: Lóṣù kan sáájú àkókò yẹn, iná sọ láwọn ibì kan ní ìlú Taguig City tó wà ní erékùṣù Luzon.
target: The previous month, fires broke out in Taguig City on the island of Luzon.

input: Lápapọ̀, ilé àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà méje ni iná náà jó.
target: In total, seven homes of Jehovah’s Witnesses were destroyed by these fires.

input: Ọ̀dọ̀ àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí míì tí iná náà ò dé làwọn ará wa yìí ń gbé báyìí.
target: Our displaced brothers and sisters are currently staying with other Witnesses whose homes were unaffected.

input: Ẹsẹ̀kẹsẹ̀ ni ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì ṣètò tó yẹ, wọ́n sì pèsè oúnjẹ, omi àti aṣọ fáwọn tọ́rọ̀ kàn.
target: The branch office responded promptly by organizing efforts to supply food, water, and clothing.

input: Àwọn alàgbà tó wà lágbègbè náà ń ṣèbẹ̀wò sọ́dọ̀ àwọn ará tí àjálù yìí kàn, wọ́n sì ń ràn wọ́n lọ́wọ́.
target: The local elders shepherded the affected brothers and provided practical assistance.

input: Ìgbìmọ̀ méjì tó ń ṣètò ìrànwọ́ nígbà àjálù àtàwọn tó ń ṣiṣẹ́ ní Ẹ̀ka Tó Ń Yàwòrán Ilé Tó sì Ń Kọ́ Ọ ti ń ṣètò bí wọ́n ṣe máa tún ilé àwọn ará wa tó bà jẹ́ kọ́.
target: Two Disaster Relief Committees, with the support of Local DesignConstruction personnel, are preparing to rebuild the homes of our fellow worshippers.

input: Ó dá wa lójú pé Jèhófà ò ní yé jẹ́ ibi ààbò fún àwọn ará wa tí àjálù iná yìí ṣẹlẹ̀ sí.—Sáàmù 628.
target: We trust that Jehovah will continue to be a refuge for our brothers impacted by these fires.—Psalm 628.

input: Ní January 12, 2020, òkè ayọnáyèéfín tó ń jẹ́ Taal ní ìlú Batangas lórílẹ̀-èdè Philippines tú eérú gbígbóná jáde, eérú gbígbóná náà rìn jìnnà sókè nínú òfúrufú gan-an, kódà ó fẹ́ẹ̀ tó òpó iná kan àtààbọ̀ tó fi lọ sókè.
target: On January 12, 2020, the Taal volcano in Batangas, Philippines, spewed ash some fourteen kilometers 9 mi into the sky, prompting warnings of a possible hazardous explosive eruption.

input: Torí pé òkè Taal yìí ló burú jù lára àwọn òkè tó sábà máa ń bú gbàù ní orílẹ̀-èdè náà, ìjọba ti pàṣẹ pé kí gbogbo àwọn tó ń gbé lágbègbè tí òkè náà wà kúrò níbẹ̀ pátápátá.
target: The authorities have ordered a total evacuation of tens of thousands of people living near the volcano, one of the most active in the country.

input: Títí di àkókò yìí, àwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin wa tó lé ní ọgọ́rùn-ún márùn-ún 500 ló ti kó kúrò lágbègbè yẹn tí wọ́n sì lọ síbi tí kò séwu.
target: To date, over 500 brothers have been evacuated to safe locations that included Kingdom Halls and private homes of other Witnesses.

input: Ìròyìn fi hàn pé kò sí ìkankan nínú àwọn ará wa tó fara pa.
target: None of our brothers have been injured.

input: Kára lè tu àwọn ará wa yìí, Ìgbìmọ̀ Ẹ̀ka ti yan Ìgbìmọ̀ Tó Ń Ṣèrànwọ́ Nígbà Àjálù láti bójú tó ohun táwọn ará tó kúrò nílé wọn máa nílò.
target: The Branch Committee has appointed a Disaster Relief Committee to address the immediate needs of the evacuees.

input: Àdúrà wa ni pé kí ìgbàgbọ́ àwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin wa lórílẹ̀-èdè Philippines lágbára sí i, kó sì túbọ̀ dá wọn lójú pé Jèhófà ni Ọlọ́run ààbò wa àti okun wa.​—Sáàmù 46​1-3.
target: We pray that our brothers and sisters in the Philippines will continue to trust in Jehovah, our refuge and strength.—Psalm 461-3.

input: Ìjì líle typhoon Kammuri táwọn èèyàn Philippines tún ń pè ní Tisoy jà lórílẹ̀-èdè Philippines ní December 2, ọdún 2019.
target: Typhoon Kammuri, also known in the Philippines as Tisoy, made landfall on December 2, 2019, in the Bicol region of southern Luzon.

input: Àgbègbè Bicol ní ìpínlẹ̀ Luzon ni ìjì náà ti jà.Bó tiẹ̀ jẹ́ pé kò sí Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà kankan tó kú tàbí tó fara pa, ilé àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí méjìdínláàádọ́fà 108 ló bà jẹ́ gan-an, nígbà tí ilé ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́rin ó lé méjìdínlọ́gọ́rin 478 bà jẹ́ díẹ̀.
target: Although none of Jehovah’s Witnesses were killed or injured, 108 homes of Witness families sustained heavy damage and 478 were partially damaged.
