input: Yàtọ̀ síyẹn, Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba mẹ́ẹ̀ẹ́dógún 15 ló bà jẹ́.
target: Additionally, 15 Kingdom Halls were damaged.

input: Torí bí ìjì náà ṣe ba nǹkan jẹ́ ní ibi tó pọ̀ gan-an, ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì orílẹ̀-èdè Philippines ṣètò Ìgbìmọ̀ mẹ́jọ Tó Ń Pèsè Ìrànwọ́ Nígbà Àjálù, kí wọ́n lè fi Ọ̀rọ̀ Ọlọ́run gbé àwọn ará ró kí wọ́n sì tún ràn wọ́n lọ́wọ́ nípa tara.
target: Because of the widespread impact of the storm, the Philippines branch formed eight Disaster Relief Committees to provide spiritual and material help to the brothers.

input: À ń gbàdúrà fún àwọn ará wa lórílẹ̀-èdè Philippines, à ń bẹ Jèhófà bíi ti onísáàmù tó sọ pé Kí Jèhófà dá ọ lóhùn ní ọjọ́ wàhálà.Kó ràn ọ́ lọ́wọ́ láti ibi mímọ́.—Sáàmù 201, 2.
target: We pray for our brothers in the Philippines,May Jehovah answer you in the day of distress.May he send you help from the holy place.—Psalm 201, 2.

input: Ní August 5, 2017, iná sọ ní àgbègbè Agdao nílùú Davao tó wà ní etíkun erékùṣù Mindanao, ní gúúsù orílẹ̀-èdè Philippines.
target: A fire broke out on August 5, 2017, in the Agdao section of Davao City, located on the coast of Mindanao Island in the southern Philippines.

input: Bó tiẹ̀ jẹ́ pé kò sí Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà kankan tí iná yìí pa, ilé àwọn ìdílé mẹ́tàlá 13 ni iná náà ṣe báṣubàṣu, ó sì sọ àwọn mọ́kàndínlọ́gbọ̀n 29 tó ń gbé àwọn ilé náà di aláìnílélórí.
target: Although there were no casualties among Jehovah’s Witnesses, the homes where 13 families were living sustained major fire damage, affecting 29 individuals.

input: Àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ti gba àwọn ará wọn tí iná yìí sọ di aláìnílé sílé.
target: The victims displaced by the fire have been accommodated in the residences of fellow Witnesses.

input: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà tó wà nílùú Manila ti yan ìgbìmọ̀ tó ń ṣètò ìrànwọ́ nígbà àjálù láti bójú tó bí wọ́n á ṣe pín àwọn nǹkan tó wà fún ìrànwọ́.
target: The branch office of Jehovah’s Witnesses in Manila appointed a disaster relief committee to coordinate the distribution of relief supplies.

input: Ìgbìmọ̀ Olùdarí àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ló ń bójú tó iṣẹ́ ìrànwọ́ nígbà àjálù láti oríléeṣẹ́ wọn, owó táwọn èèyàn fi ṣètìlẹyìn fún iṣẹ́ ìwàásù àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà kárí ayé ni wọ́n sì ń lò.
target: The Governing Body of Jehovah’s Witnesses facilitates disaster relief efforts from their world headquarters, using funds donated to the Witnesses’ global ministry work.

input: Kárí Ayé David A.Semonian, Ọ́fíìsì Agbéròyìnjáde,
target: David A.Semonian, Office of Public Information,

input: Ní December 29, 2018, Ìjì Líle tí wọ́n pè ní Usman jà ní erékùṣù Samar, òun ni erékùṣù tó tóbi ṣèkẹta ní Philippines.
target: On December 29, 2018, Tropical Depression Usman made landfall over Samar, the third largest island in the Philippines.

input: Ìjì náà fa òjò àrọ̀ọ̀rọ̀dá, ó mú kí ilẹ̀ ya, ó sì fa omíyalé.
target: The storm brought torrential rain, causing landslides and flash flooding.

input: Ó kéré tán, èèyàn mẹ́ẹ̀ẹ́dọ́gbọ̀n 25 ló kú, àwọn méjìlélógójì 42sì fara pa.
target: At least 25 people have been killed, and 42 were injured.

input: Gbogbo ilé tó bà jẹ́ fẹ́rẹ̀ẹ́ tó ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́tàlélógún 22,835.
target: A total of 22,835 homes sustained damage.

input: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa ní Philippines ròyìn pé, kò sí ìkankan lára àwọn ará wa tí ìjì líle náà pa.
target: The Philippines branch reports that no brothers or sisters were killed by the storm.

input: Àmọ́ ó ba mẹ́ta lára ilé àwọn ará wa jẹ́ gan-an, ó sì ba ilé mẹ́rin míì jẹ́ díẹ̀.
target: However, three homes of our brothers were destroyed, and four were partially damaged.

input: Yàtọ̀ síyẹn, ó tún ba Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba kan jẹ́.
target: Additionally, one Kingdom Hall was damaged.

input: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa yan Ìgbìmọ̀ Tó Ń Ṣètò Ìrànwọ́ Nígbà Àjálù, ìgbìmọ̀ yìí sì pèsè ohun táwọn tí ọ̀ràn kàn nílò títí kan ibi tí wọ́n lè gbé fúngbà díẹ̀.
target: Under the direction of the branch, a Disaster Relief Committee provided relief supplies and temporary housing to the affected families.

input: Ó dá wa lójú pé àwọn ará wa tí àjálù yìí ṣẹlẹ̀ sí o ní yé gbẹ́kẹ̀ lé Jèhófà torí wọ́n mọ̀ pé ó máa fún wọn lókun, á sì sọ wọ́n di alágbára.—1 Pétérù 510.
target: We are confident that our brothers and sisters affected by this storm will continue to put their trust in Jehovah, knowing that he will make them firm and strong.—1 Peter 510.

input: Ìjì gbẹ̀mígbẹ̀mí méjì tí wọ́n ń pè ní Kai-tak táwọn aráàlú mọ̀ sí Urduja àti Tembin táwọn aráàlú mọ̀ sí Vinta jà lórílẹ̀-èdè Philippines, ó sì lé ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ èèyàn kúrò nílé.Àwọn ìjì náà mú kí omi yalé, kí ẹrẹ̀ sì ya wọ̀lú lápá ìparí oṣù December.
target: Tens of thousands of people were forced to evacuate their homes as two deadly tropical storms, Kai-tak known locally as Urduja and Tembin known locally as Vinta, caused flooding and mudslides in the Philippines at the close of December.

input: Àwọn ìjì náà ba Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba méjì àti ilé mẹ́fà tó jẹ́ tàwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà jẹ́, ó sì di dandan káwọn igba ó lé mọ́kàlélọ́gọ́rin 281 ìdílé kó kúrò nílé wọn.
target: The storms damaged two Kingdom Halls and six private homes owned by Jehovah’s Witnesses, and 281 families had to evacuate.

input: Ó dùn wá gan-an láti sọ pé nílùú Lanao del Norte, arábìnrin kan tó jẹ́ ọmọ ọdún mẹ́rìnlélógún 24 mumi yó, ó sì kú.
target: We are saddened to report that, in Lanao del Norte, one 24-year-old sister drowned in floodwaters.

input: Àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà tó wà lágbègbè náà ti dìde ìrànwọ́ fáwọn èèyàn.
target: Basic relief supplies have been provided by fellow Witnesses in the local area.

input: Àwọn aṣojú láti ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì orílẹ̀-èdè Philippines ti ń múra láti lọ ṣèbẹ̀wò sí ibi tí àjálù ti ṣẹlẹ̀ kí wọ́n lè mọ àwọn nǹkan míì táwọn ará tún máa nílò, kí wọ́n sì lè fi Bíbélì tù wọ́n nínú kínú wọn lè máa dùn.
target: Representatives of the Philippines branch office are preparing to visit the affected area to assess further the needs of the brothers and to provide spiritual and emotional support.

input: A bá gbogbo àwọn tọ́rọ̀ kàn, tí àjálù sì ṣẹlẹ̀ sí kẹ́dùn.
target: Our hearts go out to all those who are affected and suffered loss.

input: Bí iṣẹ́ ìrànwọ́ náà ṣe ń tẹ̀ síwájú, ó dá wa lójú pé Jèhófà ò ní yéé fi ẹ̀mí rẹ̀ àti ètò rẹ̀ tu àwọn èèyàn nínú, kó sì rà wọ́n lọ́wọ́.—Sáàmù 99 Aísáyà 5112.
target: We are confident that Jehovah will continue to provide comfort and practical help through his spirit and organization as the recovery work moves forward.—Psalm 99 Isaiah 5112.

input: Kárí Ayé David A.Semonian, Ọ́fíìsì Agbéròyìnjáde, 1-845-524-3000
target: David A.Semonian, Office of Public Information, 1-845-524-3000

input: Láti October 16, 2019, léraléra ni ìmìtìtì ilẹ̀ tó lágbára wáyé ní apá gúúsù orílẹ̀-èdè Philippines, àwọn èèyàn mọ́kànlélógún 21 ló kú, àwọn tó lé ní irínwó 400 ló fara pa, àwọn tó lé ní ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà márùndínlógójì 35,000 ló sì ní láti fi ilé wọn sílẹ̀.
target: A series of powerful earthquakes have rocked the southern Philippines since October 16, 2019, killing 21 people, injuring over 400, and displacing more than 35,000.

input: Mẹ́ta lára àwọn ìmìtìtì ilẹ̀ náà lágbára gan-an, kódà ilẹ̀ ṣì ń mì lẹ́yìn ọ̀pọ̀ ọjọ́ tí ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ náà ṣẹlẹ̀.
target: At least three of these quakes registered above magnitude 6.0.

input: Bó tiẹ̀ jẹ́ pé arábìnrin kan fara pa díẹ̀, a dúpẹ́ pé kò sí ìkankan lára àwọn ará wa tó kú.
target: Aftershocks continue to occur in the area.

input: Ilé ìpàdé àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà mẹ́rin àti igba ó dín márùn-ún 195 ilé àwọn ará wa ló bà jẹ́ gan-an.
target: None of our brothers were killed, although one sister experienced a minor injury.

input: Ilé ìpàdé àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà mẹ́sàn-án 9 àti ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́ta ó lé mọ́kànléláàádọ́ta 351 ilé àwọn ará ló sì bà jẹ́ díẹ̀.
target: Four Kingdom Halls and 195 of our brothers’ homes were heavily damaged 9 Kingdom Halls and 351 homes sustained partial damage.

input: Torí pé ó léwu gan-an láti wà nínú ilé, inú àgọ́ lọ̀pọ̀ àwọn ará lọ forí pa mọ́ sí.
target: Many of our brothers are living in tents because it is unsafe to be inside their homes.

input: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa lórílẹ̀-èdè Philippines ti yan Ìgbìmọ̀ Tó Ń Ṣètò Ìrànwọ́ Nígbà Àjálù méjì láti bójú tó iṣẹ́ ìrànwọ́ náà.
target: The Philippines branch office has appointed two Disaster Relief Committees to coordinate the relief efforts.

input: Àwọn mẹ́fà tó jẹ́ aṣojú láti ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì tí mẹ́ta lára wọn wà lára Ìgbìmọ̀ Ẹ̀ka ti ṣèbẹ̀wò sí agbègbè náà kí wọ́n lè pèsè ìtùnú àti ìṣírí nípa tẹ̀mí.
target: Six branch representatives, including three Branch Committee members, have visited the affected area to provide spiritual encouragement.

input: A gbàdúrà pé kí Jèhófà máa ran àwọn ará tí àjálù bá yìí lọ́wọ́.​—Sáàmù 705.
target: We pray that Jehovah will continue to help our brothers affected by this earthquake.—Psalm 705.

input: Ohun kan ṣẹlẹ̀ fún ìgbà àkọ́kọ́ nínú ìtàn orílẹ̀-èdè South Korea.Àwọn agbẹjọ́rò ìjọba pàrọwà fún ilé ẹjọ́ kòtẹ́milọ́rùn pé kí wọ́n wọ́gi lé ẹ̀sùn tí wọ́n fi kan márùn-ún lára àwọn arákùnrin wa kí wọ́n sì dá wọn sílẹ̀ lómìnira.
target: For the first time in South Korean history, government prosecutors requested an appeals court to issue not-guilty verdicts in the cases of five of our brothers who refused military service.

input: Wọ́n gba àrọwà àwọn agbẹjọ́rò ìjọba, wọ́n sì dá àwọn arákùnrin náà sílẹ̀ lómìnira.
target: In turn, the court acquitted the brothers and closed their cases completely.

input: Ìpinnu tí ilé ẹjọ́ yìí ṣe ló wọ́gi lé ìdájọ́ àwọn ilé ẹjọ́ ti tẹ́lẹ̀, ó sì fi ìdí ẹ̀ mulẹ̀ pé àwọn arákùnrin náà kò ní ẹ̀sùn lọ́rùn mọ́.
target: These rulings forcefully quash, or overturn, lower-court rulings that had charged our brothers with evading military service.

input: December 14, 2018 ni ilé ẹjọ́ kòtẹ́milọ́rùn ṣe ìpinnu tá à ń sọ yìí, ó sì ti wá di ìlànà òfin tá à ń tọ́ka sí láti fi pàrọwà fún àwọn ilé ẹjọ́ míì ní Korea pé kí wọ́n dá ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́sàn-án 900 àwọn arákùnrin wa sílẹ̀ lómìnira.
target: The not-guilty verdicts, announced on December 14, 2018, set a clear precedent to acquit over 900 brothers with similar cases pending in the Korean court system.

input: Ní báyìí, àwọn arákùnrin tí wọ́n dá sílẹ̀ ń retí kí ìjọba ṣètò iṣẹ́ àṣesìnlú tí wọ́n lè ṣe dípò kí wọ́n ṣiṣẹ́ ológun.
target: Brothers who are acquitted will await the implementation of an alternative service arrangement that can be undertaken instead of military duty.

input: Ohun tí ilé ẹjọ́ kòtẹ́milọ́rùn wò ṣe ìpinnu wọn ni ìdájọ́ mánigbàgbé tí ilé ẹjọ́ méjì kan ṣe lọ́dún 2018, ìyẹn Ilé Ẹjọ́ Gíga Jù Lọ lórílẹ̀-èdè Korea àti Ilé Ẹjọ́ Tó Ń Rí Sí Ẹ̀tọ́ Ọmọnìyàn Nílẹ̀ Korea.
target: The appeals court based its verdicts on two historic decisions by Korea’s Constitutional and Supreme Courts in 2018.

input: Àmọ́ ní báyìí, kò sohun tó jọ bẹ́ẹ̀ mọ́ .Àfi ká máa dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ àwọn tó ti fara da ìyà láti ọ̀pọ̀ ọdún yìí wá, a mọyì wọn gan-an, a sì dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ ìdílé wọn.
target: We express our deepest respect for the sacrifices conscientious objectors and their families have had to endure.

input: Ohun tí ìjọba ń ṣe báyìí ni pé kẹ́nì kan tó lè sọ pé ẹ̀rí ọkàn òun ò gba òun láyè láti ṣiṣẹ́ ológun, ó gbọ́dọ̀ fi ẹ̀rí ohun tó gbà gbọ́ múlẹ̀ dáadáa.
target: Now, conscientious objectors are asked to prove that their refusal to perform military service is based on deep, firm and genuine beliefs.

input: Wọ́n ti fún àwọn adájọ́ ní ìtọ́ni pé kí wọ́n rí i dájú pé òótọ́ lọ̀rọ̀ ẹni náà, kì í ṣe pé ó kàn ń fi ẹ̀sìn bojú.
target: Judges have been instructed to look for evidence of the objector’s sincerity.

input: Ẹ gbọ́ bí Ilé Ẹjọ́ Gíga Jù Lọ ṣe sọ ọ́, ó ní Ó gbọ́dọ̀ hàn ní gbogbo apá ìgbésí ayé onítọ̀hún .pé òótọ́ ló ń fi ìlànà ẹ̀sìn rẹ̀ sílò.
target: In the words of the Supreme Court, All aspects of his life .should be influenced by the deeply held conviction.

input: Bí adájọ́ ṣe ń bi àwọn arákùnrin wa léèrè ọ̀rọ̀, ṣe nìyẹn mú kí wọ́n ṣàlàyé ohun tó mú kí wọ́n pinnu pé àwọn ò ní ṣiṣẹ́ ológun àti ìdí tí wọn ò fi ní jagun.—1 Pétérù 315.
target: As they answer the judges’ probing questions, our brothers thus have a fine opportunity to testify about their personal decision to abstain from war and military service.—1 Peter 315.

input: Ní Thursday, August 30, 2018, Ilé Ẹjọ́ Gíga Jù Lọ Nílẹ̀ South Korea ṣe àpérò kan lórí ẹjọ́ àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà mẹ́ta kan tí ẹ̀rí ọkàn wọn ò jẹ́ kí wọ́n ṣiṣẹ́ ológun, àwọn adájọ́ mẹ́tàlá ló sì gbọ́ ẹjọ́ náà.
target: On Thursday, August 30, 2018, South Korea’s Supreme Court held a full-bench public hearing on the cases of three Jehovah’s Witnesses who are conscientious objectors to military service.

input: Wákàtí mẹ́rin ni gbogbo àwọn adájọ́ mẹ́tàlá náà fi béèrè ọ̀rọ̀ lọ́wọ́ àwọn agbẹjọ́rò àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà àtàwọn míì nípa ọ̀rọ̀ tó ti ń jà ràn-ìn nílẹ̀ tipẹ́tipẹ́ torí bí wọ́n ń ṣe ju àwọn tí ẹ̀rí ọkàn ò jẹ́ kí wọ́n ṣiṣẹ́ ológun sẹ́wọ̀n ní Korea.
target: Reflecting the intense public debate over Korea’s long history of imprisoning objectors, all 13 justices spent four hours questioning the Witnesses’ attorneys and others about the issue.

input: Àwọn agbẹjọ́rò náà ní kí Ilé Ẹjọ́ dá àwọn arákùnrin mẹ́ta yìí láre, kí ọ̀rọ̀ wọn lè jẹ́ àpẹẹrẹ tó máa ṣeé tẹ̀ lé nígbà táwọn ilé ẹjọ́ míì bá fẹ́ yanjú irú ẹjọ́ yìí tó lé ní ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́sàn-án 900 tó ṣì wà nílẹ̀.
target: The attorneys asked the Court to declare our three brothers not guilty, setting a strong precedent that will clarify how lower courts should decide on over 900 similar pending cases.

input: Ní báyìí, ó kù sọ́wọ́ Ilé Ẹjọ́ Gíga Jù Lọ láti sọ ìgbà tí wọ́n máa dá ẹjọ́ mẹ́tẹ̀ẹ̀ta tó lápẹẹrẹ tí wọ́n gbé yẹ̀ wò yìí àti ibi tí wọ́n máa jẹ́ kí ọ̀rọ̀ náà já sí.
target: It is now up to the Supreme Court to decide when and how to rule in the three representative cases they considered during the hearing.

input: Àwa àti àwọn arákùnrin wa olóòótọ́ tó lé ní ọgọ́rùn-ún 100 tó ṣì wà lẹ́wọ̀n kò ní jẹ́ kó sú wa bá a ṣe ń fi sùúrù dúró dé Ọlọ́run ìgbàlà wa.—Míkà 77.
target: With full confidence, we along with more than 100 of our faithful brothers still in prison will continue to wait patiently for the God of our salvation.—Micah 77.

input: Ní February 28, 2019, wọ́n dá ẹni tó gbẹ̀yìn lára àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà tó wà lẹ́wọ̀n torí àìdá sọ́rọ̀ òṣèlú sílẹ̀ ní South Korea.
target: On February 28, 2019, the last one of Jehovah’s Witnesses in South Korea imprisoned for neutrality was released.

input: Gbogbo àwọn tí wọ́n dá sílẹ̀ náà dúpẹ́ torí òmìnira tí wọ́n rí gbà àti bí wọ́n ṣe sapá láti jẹ́ olóòótọ́ sí Jèhófà Ọlọ́run.
target: All the brothers who have been set free have expressed deep gratitude for their newfound freedom and the opportunity they had to prove their loyalty to Jehovah God.

input: Lẹ́yìn ìdájọ́ tí Ilé Ẹjọ́ Gíga Jù Lọ ṣe ní November 1, 2018, tó fi hàn pé ẹni tí ẹ̀rí ọkàn rẹ̀ ò bá gbà láyè láti ṣiṣẹ́ ológun kì í ṣe ọ̀daràn, wọ́n ti dá arákùnrin márùndínláàádọ́rin 65 sílẹ̀.
target: A total of 65 brothers have been released since the historic Supreme Court decision on November 1, 2018, which declared that conscientious objection to military service is not a crime.

input: Ìdájọ́ yìí ló fòpin sí bí wọ́n ṣe ń ju àwọn tí ẹ̀rí ọkàn wọn ò jẹ́ kí wọ́n ṣiṣẹ́ ológun sẹ́wọ̀n látọdún márùndínláàádọ́rin sẹ́yìn.
target: The ruling brought to an end the 65-year-old practice of imprisoning conscientious objectors.

input: Ìgbàgbọ́ àti ìṣòtítọ́ àwọn ará wa ní Korean jẹ́ kóríyá fún gbogbo wa láti ‘túbọ̀ máa fi ìgboyà’ àti òtítọ́ sin Ọba wa àti ìjọba rẹ̀.
target: The faith and integrity of our Korean brothers motivates us to ‘show all the more courage’ in our own loyal service to our King and his Kingdom.

input: Fílípì 114 À ń gbàdúrà fún àwọn ará wa tó ṣì wà lẹ́wọ̀n ní Eritrea, Rọ́ṣíà, Singapore àti Turkmenistan.—Hébérù 1034.
target: Philippians 114 We pray for our brothers who remain imprisoned in Eritrea, Russia, Singapore, and Turkmenistan.—Hebrews 1034.

input: Láti nǹkan bí ọdún márùndínláàádọ́rin 65 báyìí làwọn ọ̀dọ́kùnrin tí wọ́n jẹ́ Kristẹni lórílẹ̀-èdè South Korea ti ń fi ẹ̀wọ̀n gbára torí pé ẹ̀rí ọkàn wọn ò jẹ́ kí wọ́n ṣiṣẹ́ ológun.
target: For some 65 years, young Christian men in South Korea have faced the certain prospect of imprisonment for their conscientious objection to military service.

input: Àwọn oníròyìn rèé níwájú ìta Ilé Ẹjọ́ Tó Ń Rí Sọ́ràn Ẹ̀tọ́ Ọmọnìyàn.
target: Journalists outside the Constitutional Court.

input: Kárí ayé làwọn oníròyìn ti ń tọ pinpin ibi tọ́rọ̀ náà dé.
target: The case was closely followed by the international media.

input: Àwọn aṣojú àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ní Korea rèé nínú Ilé Ẹjọ́ Ìjọba kó tó di pé Ilé Ẹjọ́ náà ṣèpinnu.
target: Representatives of Jehovah’s Witnesses in Korea inside the Constitutional Court moments before the Court’s decision.

input: Iye àwọn tí orílẹ̀-èdè South Korea ń fi sẹ́wọ̀n lọ́dọọdún torí pé wọn ò ṣiṣẹ́ ológun nítorí ẹ̀rí ọkàn wọn ju àpapọ̀ àwọn tó ń lọ sẹ́wọ̀n ní gbogbo orílẹ̀-èdè yòókù torí pé ẹ̀rí ọkàn ò jẹ́ kí wọ́n ṣiṣẹ́ ológun.
target: South Korea has annually imprisoned more conscientious objectors than all other countries combined.

input: Ìgbà kan wà tó jẹ́ pé nǹkan bí ọgọ́rùn-ún márùn-ún 500 sí ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́fà 600 àwọn arákùnrin wa ló ń ṣẹ̀wọ̀n lọ́dọọdún.
target: At one point, an average of 500 to 600 of our brothers went to prison every year.

input: Tí wọ́n bá sì dá wọn sílẹ̀ lẹ́wọ̀n, gbogbo wọn ni wọ́n máa ń níṣòro láwùjọ torí ẹ̀sùn ọ̀daràn tó ti wà lọ́rùn wọn, tí kò sì lè pa rẹ́.
target: Upon their release, all conscientious objectors carried with them a lifelong stigma due to their criminal record, which among other challenges limited their employment opportunities.

input: Ara ohun tó sì máa ń yọrí sí ni pé kìí jẹ́ kí wọ́n ríṣẹ́ bọ̀rọ̀.
target: Starting in 2011, however, some brothers filed complaints with the Constitutional Court because the law provided no option other than imprisonment for their stand of conscience.

input: Àmọ́ nígbà tó di ọdún 2011, àwọn arákùnrin kan kọ̀wé sí Ilé Ẹjọ́ Tó Ń Rí Sọ́ràn Ẹ̀tọ́ Ọmọnìyàn láti fẹjọ́ sùn torí pé òfin ò ṣètò àfidípò fáwọn tí ẹ̀rí ọkàn ò jẹ́ kí wọ́n ṣiṣẹ́ ológun, àfi kí wọ́n ṣẹ̀wọ̀n.
target: Likewise, since 2012, even some judges who were troubled by the practice of punishing sincere objectors decided to refer their cases to the Constitutional Court for review of the Military Service Act.

input: Àtọdún 2012 làwọn adájọ́ kan ti bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí í wò ó pé kò tọ́ láti máa fìyà jẹ àwọn tó jẹ́ pé òótọ́ ni ẹ̀rí ọkàn wọn ò gbà á kí wọ́n ṣiṣẹ́ ológun.
target: Hong Dae-il, a spokesman for Jehovah’s Witnesses in Korea, is interviewed outside the courtroom after the decision The role of the Constitutional Court is to determine if a law harmonizes with Korea’s Constitution or not.

input: Ni wọ́n bá bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí í gbé ẹjọ́ wọn lọ sí Ilé Ẹjọ́ Tó Ń Rí Sọ́ràn Ẹ̀tọ́ Ọmọnìyàn, kí ilé ẹjọ́ náà lè tún Ìlànà Iṣẹ́ Ológun gbé yẹ̀ wò.
target: After having twice ruled in 2004 and 2011 to uphold the Military Service Act, the Constitutional Court has finally agreed that change is needed.

input: Lára àwọn iṣẹ́ àṣesìnlú tí wọ́n lè ní káwọn èèyàn máa ṣe ni pé kí wọ́n máa ṣiṣẹ́ nílé ìwòsàn tàbí láwọn àjọ míì tó ń ṣèrànwọ́ fún aráàlú, àmọ́ tí kò sí lábẹ́ àwọn ológun.
target: Alternative types of service that they may implement could include hospital work and other non-military social services that contribute to the betterment of the community.

input: Ìpinnu mánigbàgbé tí Ilé Ẹjọ́ Tó Ń Rí Sọ́ràn Ẹ̀tọ́ Ọmọnìyàn ṣe máa jẹ́ kó túbọ̀ ṣeé ṣe fún Ilé Ẹjọ́ Gíga Jù Lọ láti dá àwọn tí wọ́n bá gbọ́ ẹjọ́ wọn lórí ọ̀rọ̀ yìí láre.
target: The historic decision of the Constitutional Court provides a firmer basis for the Supreme Court to rule favorably in cases of individual objectors.

input: Ibi tí gbogbo àwọn adájọ́ Ilé Ẹjọ́ Gíga Jù Lọ bá fẹnu kò sí máa pinnu ohun tí ilé ẹjọ́ máa ṣe lórí ọ̀kọ̀ọ̀kan àwọn tọ́rọ̀ kàn.
target: A full bench ruling of the Supreme Court will influence how these individual criminal cases should be handled.

input: A retí pé tó bá di August 30, 2018, Ilé Ẹjọ́ Gíga Jù Lọ máa ṣe àpérò kan láti jíròrò ọ̀rọ̀ náà, tó bá sì yá, wọ́n á ṣèpinnu.
target: The Supreme Court is expected to hold a public hearing on August 30, 2018, and will issue a ruling some time thereafter.

input: Ìgbà àkọ́kọ́ nìyẹn máa jẹ́ láti ọdún mẹ́rìnlá 14 sẹ́yìn tí gbogbo àwọn adájọ́ Ilé Ẹjọ́ Gíga Jù Lọ máa gbé ọ̀rọ̀ àwọn tí ẹ̀rí ọkàn ò jẹ́ kí wọ́n ṣiṣẹ́ ológun yẹ̀ wò.
target: It will be the first time in 14 years that the Supreme Court’s full bench will review the issue of conscientious objection.

input: Kó tó dìgbà yẹn, Ilé Ìgbìmọ̀ Aṣòfin Ilẹ̀ Korea ti ń báṣẹ́ lọ lórí bí wọ́n ṣe máa ṣàtúnṣe sí Ìlànà Iṣẹ́ Ológun.
target: Meanwhile, the National Assembly, Korea’s legislature, is already working on revisions to the Military Service Act.

input: Arákùnrin Mark Sanderson tó jẹ́ ara Ìgbìmọ̀ Olùdarí sọ pé Ara wa ti wà lọ́nà láti gbọ́ ìpinnu tí Ilé Ẹjọ́ Gíga Jù Lọ máa ṣe.
target: We keenly anticipate the Supreme Court’s upcoming hearing.

input: Ní Thursday, November 1, 2018, Ilé Ẹjọ́ Gíga Jù Lọ Nílẹ̀ South Korea dájọ́ pé ẹni tí ẹ̀rí ọkàn rẹ̀ ò bá jẹ́ kó ṣiṣẹ́ ológun ò hùwà ọ̀daràn kankan.
target: On Thursday, November 1, 2018, South Korea’s Supreme Court decided in a 9-4 decision that conscientious objection does not constitute a crime.

input: Àwọn adájọ́ mẹ́rin ò fara mọ́ ìdájọ́ yìí, àmọ́ àwọn mẹ́sàn-án ló fara mọ́ ọ.Ní báyìí, wọ́n máa fàyè gba ẹni tí ẹ̀rí ọkàn rẹ̀ ò bá gbà á láyè láti ṣiṣẹ́ ológun nítorí ẹ̀sìn rẹ̀.
target: Religious conscience is now considered justifiable grounds for refraining from military enlistment.

input: Àwọn ilé ẹjọ́ lóríṣiríṣi nílẹ̀ Korea sì lè tẹ̀ lé ìdájọ́ mánigbàgbé tí Ilé Ẹjọ́ Gíga Jù Lọ ṣe yìí, kí wọ́n sì dá àwọn ará wa tó lé ní ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́sàn 900 láre nígbà tí wọ́n bá ń gbọ́ ẹjọ́ wọn tó wà nílẹ̀.
target: This landmark decision by South Korea’s highest court lays the groundwork for issuing not guilty verdicts for the over 900 brothers with cases pending in all levels of Korea’s court system.

input: Ní oṣù mélòó kan sẹ́yìn, Ilé Ẹjọ́ Ìjọba Korea dájọ́ pé tó bá fi máa di oṣù December 2019, kí ìjọba ti ṣètò iṣẹ́ àṣesìnlú míì fún àwọn tí ẹ̀rí ọkàn wọn ò jẹ́ kí wọ́n ṣiṣẹ́ ológun.
target: Earlier in the year, the Constitutional Court of Korea ruled that there must be a provision for conscientious objectors to have alternative service options by December 2019.

input: Inú wa dùn, a sì yin Jèhófà nítorí ìdájọ́ tó ṣàrà ọ̀tọ̀ yìí.
target: We rejoice and praise Jehovah for this historic decision

input: Ní April 4, 2019, iná ńlá kan sọ létí ìlà oòrùn orílẹ̀-èdè South Korea ní agbègbè tí wọ́n ń pè ní Gangwon Province.
target: On April 4, 2019, a large forest fire broke out along the eastern coast of South Korea in the Gangwon Province.

input: Kò pẹ́ rárá tí iná náà fi ràn, èyí sì mú kí ìjọba kéde pé wàhálà ti wọ̀lú káàkiri orílẹ̀-èdè náà.
target: The fire spread rapidly, prompting the government to declare a national emergency.

input: Kí wọ́n tó lè kápá iná náà, ó ti jó ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́rin 4,000 eékà ilẹ̀, ó sì ti pa èèyàn méjì.
target: Before the blaze was brought under control, over 1,600 hectares 4,000 acres were scorched and two people lost their lives.

input: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa ròyìn pé kò sí ìkankan lára àwọn ará wa tó kú.
target: Branch reports indicate that there were no casualties among our brothers.

input: Àmọ́ iná náà jó ilé mẹ́jọ tí àwọn ará wa mẹ́tàdínlọ́gbọ̀n 27 ń gbé.
target: However, eight homes were damaged, affecting 27 of our brothers and sisters.

input: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì dá Ìgbìmọ̀ Tó Ń Ṣètò Ìrànwọ́ Nígbà Àjálù sílẹ̀, àwọn alábòójútó àyíká tó wà lágbègbè náà àtàwọn alàgbà ìjọ ń fáwọn tí àjàlù yìí kàn níṣìírí, wọ́n sì ń pèsè ohun tí wọ́n nílò fún wọn.
target: Under the direction of the branch, the Disaster Relief Committee and the circuit overseer in the region are working with the congregation elders to provide spiritual and practical support to those impacted by this disaster.

input: Ó dá wa lójú pé Jèhófà máa jẹ́ ‘ibi ààbò àti okun pẹ̀lú ìrànlọ́wọ́ tó wà lárọ̀ọ́wọ́tó ní àkókò wàhálà’ fáwọn ará wa yìí.—Sáàmù 461.
target: We are confident that Jehovah will be for our brothers a refuge and strength, a help that is readily found in times of distress.—Psalm 461.

input: Ìdájọ́ tó ṣàrà ọ̀tọ̀ yìí ló máa yí ìlànà MSA tó ti wà látọdún márùndínláàádọ́rin 65 sẹ́yìn pa dà, ìyẹn ìdájọ́ tó sọ pé kí àwọn tí ẹ̀rí ọkàn wọn ò jẹ́ kí wọ́n ṣiṣẹ́ ológun máa lọ sẹ́wọ̀n.
target: The landmark ruling is the key to reversing a 65-year-old policy of imprisoning conscientious objectors under the MSA.

input: Láti ọdún 1953, ó ju ẹgbẹ̀rún mọ́kàndínlógún ó lé ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́ta 19,300 àwọn ará wa tí wọ́n ti rán lẹ́wọ̀n ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́rìndínlógójì ó lé ọgọ́rùn-ún méje 36,700 ọdún lápapọ̀.
target: Since 1953, over 19,300 of our brothers have been sentenced to a combined total of more than 36,700 years in prison.

input: Ilé Ẹjọ́ Gíga Jù Lọ Nílẹ̀ Korea á lè lo ìdájọ́ tí Ilé Ẹjọ́ yìí ṣe nínú ọ̀rọ̀ ọ̀kọ̀ọ̀kan àwọn tí ẹ̀rí ọkàn wọn ò jẹ́ kí wọ́n ṣiṣẹ́ ológun.
target: The Constitutional Court’s decision now opens the door for the Supreme Court of Korea to apply this ruling to specific cases involving conscientious objectors.

input: Yàtọ̀ síyẹn, ó ti wá di dandan pé káwọn tó wà nílé ìgbìmọ̀ aṣòfin ilẹ̀ Korea dá iṣẹ́ míì téèyàn lè fi sìnlú sílẹ̀, ó pẹ́ tán December 31, 2019.
target: In addition, Korean lawmakers are now obligated to institute alternative service for conscientious objectors by December 31, 2019.

input: Gbogbo wa la bá àwọn ará wa ní Korea yọ̀ pé ohun tó máa fòpin sí ìwà ìrẹ́jẹ tí wọ́n ti ń hù sí wọn láti ọ̀pọ̀ ọdún ti ṣeé ṣe.​—Òwe 1530.
target: We all rejoice with our brothers in Korea that the foundation has been laid to end decades of injustice.—Proverbs 1530.

input: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa ní Korea ti fi tó wa létí pé ní November 30, 2018, mẹ́tàdínlọ́gọ́ta 57 nínú àwọn ará wa ni ìjọba dá sílẹ̀ lẹ́wọ̀n, tí wọ́n sì pa dà sọ́dọ̀ àwọn mọ̀lẹ́bí wọn.
target: The Korea branch reports that on November 30, 2018, 57 brothers were freed from prison and reunited with their families.

input: Gbogbo ẹgbẹ́ ará kárí ayé ló ń yọ̀ torí ohun tá a ti ń retí tipẹ́ ló ṣẹlẹ̀ yìí, a dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ Jèhófà tó ṣojúure sí wa, tó sì bù kún wa.​—Nọ́ńbà 6​24-26.
target: The worldwide brotherhood rejoices with this highly-anticipated development and praises Jehovah for granting his favor and blessing.—Numbers 624-26.

input: À ń gbàdúrà fún àwọn arákùnrin mẹ́jọ tó kù lẹ́wọ̀n, a retí pé àwọn aláṣẹ máa dá wọn sílẹ̀ tí wọ́n bá ti lo oṣù mẹ́fà nínú ẹ̀wọ̀n ọdún kan ààbọ̀ tí ìjọba dá fún wọn.
target: We pray for the eight brothers remaining in prison, who are expected to be released sometime after they have served 6 months of their 18-month sentences.

input: Àwọn arákùnrin tí wọ́n ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ dá sílẹ̀ pa dà sọ́dọ̀ àwọn òbí wọn lọ́tùn-ún, lósì.
target: Recently released brothers reunite with their parents left, right.

input: Àwọn oníròyìn ń fọ̀rọ̀ wá arákùnrin kan lẹ́nu wò níwájú ìta ọgbà ẹ̀wọ̀n náà àárín.
target: A brother is interviewed by the media outside of the prison center.

input: Ó lé ní ẹgbẹ̀rún méje àti ọgọ́rùn-ún kan 7,100 àwọn ará lọ́kùnrin lóbìnrin káàkiri orílẹ̀-èdè náà tó kópa nínú àkànṣe ìwàásù yẹn.
target: Over 7,100 brothers and sisters from throughout the country participated in the campaign.

input: Ọ̀pọ̀ nínú wọn ló wá láti ìlú Busan, Gwangju, Incheon, Seoul àti Suwon àwọn kan tiẹ̀ wá láti Erékùṣù Jeju lọ́hùn-ún lọ́hùn-ún, ibi tó lé ní ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́ta 300 máìlì sí gúúsù Pyeongchang táwọn èèyàn ti sábà máa ń lọ gbafẹ́.
target: Many of them came from the cities of Busan, Gwangju, Incheon, Seoul, and Suwon some even came from as far away as Jeju Island, a popular tourist destination located over 300 miles south of Pyeongchang.

input: Àwọn ará wa gbé àtẹ méjìléláàádọ́jọ 152 síbi méjìdínláàádọ́ta 48 ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀, títí kan ibi ìgbafẹ́ Gangneung Olympic Park àti Pyeongchang Olympic Plaza.
target: Our brothers set up 152 public witnessing carts in 48 locations, including the Gangneung Olympic Park and the Pyeongchang Olympic Plaza.

input: Wọ́n tún gbà wọ́n láyè kí wọ́n pàtẹ díẹ̀ lára àwọn ìwé wọn síbi àbáwọlé ọ̀kan lára àwọn ibi ìjọsìn tó wà ní Olympic Village.
target: They were also permitted to display some of their publications at the entrance to one of the Olympic Village religious centers.

input: Wọ́n gbé àtẹ ìwé méjì sí tòsí ẹnubodè àríwá ní Gangneung Olympic Park.
target: Two carts near the north gate of Gangneung Olympic Park.

input: Lọ́jọ́ tí wọ́n bẹ̀rẹ̀ ìdíje òlíńpíìkì, ó lé ní ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà méjìdínlọ́gbọ̀n 28,000 èèyàn tó gba ibùdókọ̀ Gangneung Station kọjá.
target: On the opening day of the Olympic Games, over 28,000 people traveled through Gangneung Station.

input: Bákan náà, àwọn ará lọ́kùnrin lóbìnrin tó gbọ́ Èdè Àwọn Adití Lédè Korea dáadáa lo àwọn àtẹ tó ní móhùn-máwòrán lára láti máa fi àwọn fídíò èdè adití han ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn adití tó wá síbi Ìdíje Fáwọn Aláàbọ̀ Ara.
target: Additionally, brothers and sisters fluent in Korean Sign Language used carts featuring sign-language videos to welcome the many deaf persons who came to the Paralympics.

input: Ìwé tí wọ́n pín lé ní ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà mọ́kànléláàádọ́rin àti igba 71,200, títí kan ohun tó lé ní ẹgbẹ̀rún méjìlélógún 22,000 ìwé ìkésíni wá síbi Ìrántí Ikú Kristi.
target: Over 71,200 pieces of literature were distributed, including more than 22,000 Memorial invitations.

input: Kárí ayé, àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ń lo àtẹ ìwé tó lé ní ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́ta 300,000 láti pàtẹ ìwé wọn láwọn orílẹ̀-èdè tó lé ní márùndínlógójì 35.
target: Worldwide, Jehovah’s Witnesses use over 300,000 carts to display their literature in over 35 countries.

input: Èyí ń jẹ́ kí wọ́n lè wàásù fáwọn èèyàn níbikíbi tí wọ́n bá ti lè rí wọn, kí wọ́n sì ṣàṣeparí iṣẹ́ òjíṣẹ́ wọn ní kíkún.​—2 Tímótì 45.
target: In this way, they are able to preach to people wherever they may be found and fully accomplish their ministry.—2 Timothy 45.

input: Ẹgbẹẹgbẹ̀rún àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ló wá láti orílẹ̀-èdè méje ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀ láti wá bá àwọn ará wọn lọ́kùnrin lóbìnrin ní orílẹ̀-èdè Siri Láńkà ṣe àkànṣe àpéjọ.Ìgbà àkọ́kọ́ tírú ẹ̀ máa wáyé nìyẹn ní orílẹ̀-èdè náà.
target: Thousands of Jehovah’s Witnesses from seven countries joined their brothers and sisters in Sri Lanka for a special convention, the first ever in Sri Lanka.

input: September 2017 ni wọ́n fi tó àwọn ará ní Siri Láńkà létí pé àkànṣe àpéjọ kan máa wáyé lọ́dún tó tẹ̀ lé e, àtìgbà yẹn ni ètò sì ti bẹ̀rẹ̀.
target: Preparations began in September 2017 when congregations in Sri Lanka were informed that a special convention would be held the following year.

input: Yàtọ̀ sí gbogbo ètò tí wọ́n ṣe láti gbàlejò àwọn tó máa wá sí àpéjọ náà, pápá ìṣeré tí wọ́n fẹ́ lò nílò àtúnṣe tó pọ̀.
target: In addition to all the arrangements that were needed to host the event, the stadium was in need of significant repair and cleaning.

input: Ó máa gba pé kí wọ́n kùn ún, kí wọ́n kó ìdọ̀tí ibẹ̀, kí wọ́n tún àwọn àga tó ti bà jẹ́ ṣe, kí wọ́n sì dí àwọn ihò ojú ọ̀nà.
target: This effort included painting, removing garbage, fixing broken chairs, and repairing holes in the road.

input: Nígbà tí àpéjọ náà ku ọ̀sẹ̀ mẹ́ta, ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ló wá kọ́wọ́ ti iṣẹ́ àtúnṣe náà.
target: Three weeks before the convention began, hundreds of Witnesses arrived to assist in the effort.

input: Ẹ̀ṣọ́ kan tiẹ̀ sọ pé ó máa gba àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ pápá ìṣeré náà ní ọdún mẹ́rin láti ṣe ohun táwọn ará wa ṣe láàárín àkókò kúkúrú yẹn.
target: One security officer remarked that it would have taken the maintenance staff up to four years to accomplish what the brothers were able to do in such a short time.

input: Yàtọ̀ sí àwọn àsọyé Bíbélì tí wọ́n sọ ní àpéjọ náà, wọ́n mú àwọn àlejò lọ wo oríṣiríṣi ibi, wọ́n sì ṣe àwọn nǹkan lóríṣiríṣi tó jẹ mọ́ àṣà ìbílẹ̀ Siri Láńkà.
target: The spiritual program was complemented by a variety of tours and activities highlighting the Sri Lankan culture.

input: Àwọn ará ṣe ohun kan tó jẹ́ mánigbàgbé nírọ̀lẹ́ ọjọ́ kan, wọ́n jó ijó ìbílẹ̀, wọ́n sì kọrin ìbílẹ̀.Àwọn ọ̀dọ́ kan tó jẹ́ Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà náà kọ àwọn orin Ìjọba Ọlọ́run.
target: An evening performance of traditional dancing and singing was a memorable aspect of the program, which also included a group of young Witnesses singing Kingdom songs.

input: Ashley Ferdinands tó jẹ́ aṣojú ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì tó wà ní Siri Láńkà sọ pé Ohun ńlá ni ètò Ọlọ́run ṣe fáwọn ará wa lórílẹ̀-èdè yìí pẹ̀lú bí wọ́n ṣe ṣètò pé ká ṣe àkànṣe àpéjọ, àǹfààní ló sì jẹ́ láti gba àwọn ará wa tó pọ̀ lálejò.
target: Ashley Ferdinands, a representative at the branch office in Sri Lanka,This special convention was a true gift to the brothers and sisters in our country and it was a privilege to host so many delegates.

input: A mọyì ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn tó yọ̀ǹda ara wọn láti ṣèrànwọ́ kí nǹkan lè lọ dáadáa ní àpéjọ yìí.
target: We are very appreciative for the help of the many volunteers who made this convention a success.

input: Àmọ́ Baba wa ọ̀run ni gbogbo ọpẹ́ yẹ, torí àtọ̀dọ̀ ẹ̀ ni gbogbo ẹ̀bùn rere ti ń wá.—Jémíìsì 117.
target: Of course, we give all praise to our heavenly Father who is the source of all good gifts and presents.—James 117.

input: Ní July 5, 2019, a mú Bíbélì Ìtumọ̀ Ayé Tuntun tá a tún ṣe jáde lédè Chinese ní àpéjọ agbègbè kan tá a ṣe ní ìlú Taoyuan lórílẹ̀-èdè Taiwan.
target: On July 5, 2019, the revised edition of the New World Translation of the Holy Scriptures in Chinese was released at a regional convention in Taoyuan City, Taiwan.

input: Arákùnrin Kenneth Cook tó jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára Ìgbìmọ̀ Olùdarí ló mú Bíbélì náà jáde nígbà tó ń sọ àsọyé kan nínú Gbọ̀ngàn National Taiwan Sport University.
target: Brother Kenneth Cook, a member of the Governing Body, delivered the release talk at the National Taiwan Sport University Stadium.

input: Àwọn ẹgbẹ̀rún-ún méjìlá, ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́fà àti mẹ́wàá 12,610 ló gbádùn ètò yìí.Àwọn kan gbádùn ẹ̀ nínú gbọ̀ngàn yẹn, wọ́n sì ta àtagbà ẹ̀ sáwọn àpéjọ agbègbè mẹ́rin míì.
target: A total of 12,610 people, including viewers tied in at four other conventions, attended this momentous occasion.

input: Lọ́dún 2001, wọ́n mú odindi Bíbélì Ìtumọ̀ Ayé Tuntun jáde.Ẹ̀dà méjì ni wọ́n tún fi ṣe, àkọ́kọ́ jẹ́ ọ̀nà ìkọ̀wé tó jẹ́ ti ìbílẹ̀, ìkejì sì jẹ́ ọ̀nà ìkọ̀wé tá a mú kó túbọ̀ rọrùn láti lóye.
target: The complete New World Translation in Chinese was released in 2001, again in two editions, one in traditional and the other in simplified.

input: Nígbà tó dọdún 2004, a tẹ ẹ̀dà kẹta jáde.Ọ̀nà ìkọ̀wé tá a mú kó túbọ̀ rọrùn láti lóye ni wọ́n lò nínú ẹ̀dà yìí, yàtọ̀ síyẹn, wọ́n tún lo ọ̀nà ìkọ̀wé kan tá à ń pè ní Pinyin kí wọ́n lè fi álífábẹ́ẹ̀tì èdè Róòmù kọ ọ̀rọ̀ kọ̀ọ̀kan.
target: A third edition, containing simplified Chinese characters along with Pinyin, text rendered in the Roman alphabet, was published in 2004.

input: Wọ́n wá mú Bíbélì Ìtumọ̀ Ayé Tuntun tá a tún ṣe jáde ní ẹ̀dà mẹ́ta ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀.
target: The revised New World Translation was also released in three editions.

input: Ti èdè ìbílẹ̀ àti èdè tá a mú kó túbọ̀ rọrùn láti lóye ni wọ́n tẹ̀ sínú ìwé àti sórí ẹ̀rọ, nígbà tí ẹ̀dà Pinyin wà lórí ÀKÁ ÌWÉ ORÍ ÍŃTÁNẸ́Ẹ̀TÌ™ ti Watchtower.
target: Traditional and simplified Chinese are available both in printed and digital format, while the edition including Pinyin is available on Watchtower ONLINE LIBRARY™.

input: Ní gbogbo ayé, àwọn èèyàn tó lé ní bílíọ̀nù kan ló ń sọ èdè Chinese Mandarin.Òun sì ni èdè ìbílẹ̀ táwọn èèyàn ń sọ jù lọ láyé.
target: Chinese Mandarin is the largest primary language in the world and has a total of over 1.1 billion speakers.

input: Ní àfikún sí àwọn tó ń sọ èdè Mandarin, ọ̀pọ̀ mílíọ̀nù èèyàn ló wà tó ń sọ àwọn èdè ìbílẹ̀ Chinese míì, wọ́n sì lè ka àwọn ọ̀rọ̀ tá a kọ lọ́nà ìkọ̀wé Chinese.
target: In addition to those who speak Mandarin, Chinese characters are read by millions who speak other dialects.

input: Ní báyìí, àwọn ará wa tó ń ṣiṣẹ́ ní ìpínlẹ̀ ìwàásù tó gbòòrò yìí lè fi Bíbélì Ìtumọ̀ Ayé Tuntun tá a tún ṣe ran ọ̀pọ̀ èèyàn láti mọ Jèhófà, kí wọ́n sì ní ìmọ̀ tó péye nípa Ọ̀rọ̀ rẹ̀.​—1 Tímótì 24.
target: Our brothers and sisters working in this vast field can now use the revised New World Translation to help more people come to know Jehovah and gain accurate knowledge of his Word.—1 Timothy 24.

input: Ní alẹ́ Tuesday, February 6, ìmìtìtì ilẹ̀ tó lágbára gan-an wáyé ní etíkun tó wà ní ìlà oòrùn orílẹ̀-èdè Taiwan.
target: During the night of Tuesday, February 6, a magnitude 6.4 earthquake struck near the east coast of Taiwan.

input: Ìròyìn fi hàn pé àwọn mẹ́fà ló kú sí inú ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ yìí, àwọn tó ju àádọ́talénígba 250 ló sì fara pa yánnayànna.
target: Media reports indicate that at least 6 people have been confirmed dead and over 250 were injured.

input: Yàtọ̀ síyẹn, àwọn mẹ́rìndínlọ́gọ́rin 76 míì ni wọ́n ṣì ń wá.
target: An additional 76 people are still missing.

input: Kò sí arákùnrin tàbí arábìnrin wa kankan tó kú sínú ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ náà, wọn ò sì fara pa.Àmọ́, ìmìtìtì ilẹ̀ yẹn ba ilé kan tí Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba àti ọ́fíìsì àwọn atúmọ̀ èdè Taiwanese jẹ́.
target: No publishers were killed or injured in the earthquake.

input: Ilé náà wà ní ìlú Hualien, ibẹ̀ wà lára àwọn ibi tí ìmìtìtì ilẹ̀ náà ti ṣọṣẹ́ jù.
target: However, a building that houses both the Amis an indigenous Taiwanese language remote translation office and a Kingdom Hall located in Hualien, one of the worst-hit areas, was damaged.

input: Yàtọ̀ síyẹn, ilé tí àwọn kan lára àwọn atúmọ̀ èdè ń gbé bà jẹ́ gan-an, torí náà wọ́n ní láti kúrò ní ilé yẹn.
target: Additionally, an apartment where some members of the translation team live was severely damaged, requiring them to evacuate.

input: Ẹsẹ̀kẹsẹ̀ ni àwọn ará tó wà ní ìtòsí bá wọn ṣètò ibi tí wọ́n lè forí pamọ́ sí fúngbà díẹ̀, ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì tó wà ní Taiwan náà ń pèsè àwọn nǹkan míì tí wọ́n nílò fún wọn.
target: Local brothers immediately arranged for temporary accommodations for those affected, and the Taiwan branch is helping to provide other necessities.

input: Àdúrà wa ni pé, kí Ọlọ́run fún àwọn ará wa tí àjálù náà dé bá ní ìbàlẹ̀ ọkàn ní àsìkò tí nǹkan dojú rú yìí, kí àwọn tí wọ́n sì yàn láti bójú tó wọn dà bí ibi ìfarapamọ́sí kúrò lọ́wọ́ ẹ̀fúùfù.—Aísáyà 322.
target: We pray that our affected brothers and sisters will have peace of mind during this distressing time, and that the brothers entrusted with caring for them will prove to be like a hiding place from the wind.—Isaiah 322.

input: Ní April 2, 2020, ilé ẹjọ́ àwọn ológun tàwọn ará Tajik, tó wà ní ìlú Dushanbe tó jẹ́ olú ìlú orílẹ̀-èdè Tajikistan fi Arákùnrin Jovidon Bobojonov sẹ́wọ̀n ọdún méjì tórí pé ẹ̀rí ọkàn rẹ̀ kò gbà á láyè láti wọṣẹ́ ológun.
target: On April 2, 2020, a Tajik military court in the capital city of Dushanbe sentenced Brother Jovidon Bobojonov to two years in prison for his conscientious objection to military service.

input: Ó máa pe ẹjọ́ kòtẹ́milọ́rùn.
target: He will appeal his conviction.

input: Ní September 10, 2019, ilé ẹjọ́ ìlú Khujand ní Tajikistan fi Arákùnrin Shamil Khakimov sí ẹ̀wọ̀n ọdún méje àtààbọ̀ kìkì nítorí pé ó ń sọ ohun tó gbà gbọ́ fún àwọn míì.
target: On September 10, 2019, the Khujand City Court in Tajikistan sentenced Brother Shamil Khakimov to seven and a half years in prison for merely sharing his religious beliefs with others.

input: Àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ti pe ẹjọ́ kòtẹ́milọ́rùn lórí ọ̀rọ̀ yìí.
target: Jehovah’s Witnesses are appealing this case.

input: Ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ ọdún 2019 ni wọ́n bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí í fojú Arákùnrin Khakimov rí màbo.
target: Brother Khakimov’s ordeal began in early 2019.

input: Ní February 26, 2019, àwọn aláṣẹ mú Shamil, ẹni ọdún méjìdínláàádọ́rin 68, wọ́n sì fẹ̀sùn kàn án pé ó ń mú kí àwọn èèyàn kórìíra ẹ̀sìn míì.Ni ilé ẹjọ́ bá fi sí àtìmọ́lé láì tíì gbọ́ ẹjọ́ rẹ̀, oṣù mẹ́fà ló lò níbẹ̀.
target: On February 26, authorities arrested 68-year-old Shamil, charging him with inciting religious hatred.Afterward, the court placed him in pretrial detention, which eventually was extended for six months.

input: Yàtọ̀ sí wàhálà ti pé wọ́n sọ Arákùnrin Khakimov sẹ́wọ̀n lọ́nà àìtọ́, àìsàn ẹ̀jẹ̀ ríru ń bá a fínra, èyí tó ṣì ń gba ìtọ́jú rẹ̀ lọ́wọ́.
target: In addition to dealing with this unjust prison term, Brother Khakimov suffers from high blood pressure and is still recovering from a medical procedure.

input: Èyí ni ìgbà àkọ́kọ́ tí wọ́n máa ju ọ̀kan lára àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà sẹ́wọ̀n ní Tajikistan látọdun 2017.Nígbà yẹn wọ́n ju Danil Islamov tó jẹ́ ẹni ọdún méjìdínlógún 18 sí ẹ̀wọ̀n oṣù mẹ́fà torí pé ó kọ̀ láti wọ aṣọ ológun.
target: This is the first time one of Jehovah’s Witnesses has been imprisoned in Tajikistan since 2017, when 18-year-old Daniil Islamov was given a six-month prison sentence for refusing to wear a military uniform.

input: Tajikistan náà ti wà lára àwọn orílẹ̀-èdè márùn-ún tó ti ju ó kéré tán, ọ̀kan lára àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà sẹ́wọ̀n.
target: Tajikistan is now one of five countries that have imprisoned at least one of Jehovah’s Witnesses.

input: Àwọn orílẹ̀-èdè mẹ́rin tó kù ni Eritrea, Rọ́ṣíà, Singapore àti Turkmenistan.
target: The other four are Eritrea, Russia, Singapore, and Turkmenistan.

input: Àdúrà wa ni pé kí Jèhófà máa báa lọ láti fún Arákùnrin Khakimov ní gbogbo ohun tó nílò láti fara da àdańwò yìí.​—Róòmù 155.
target: We pray that Jehovah will continue to supply Brother Khakimov everything that he needs to endure this trial.—Romans 155.

input: Àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà mú Ìwé Mímọ́ Kristian Lédè Griki ní Ìtumọ̀ Ayé Titun jáde lédè Laotian níbi àpéjọ agbègbè tí a ṣe ní Nong Khai, lórílẹ̀-èdè Thailand, ní August 16, 2019.
target: Jehovah’s Witnesses released the New World Translation of the Christian Greek Scriptures in the Laotian language at a regional convention held in Nong Khai, Thailand, on August 16, 2019.

input: Arákùnrin Plakorn Pestanyee tó jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára Ìgbìmọ̀ Ẹ̀ka orílẹ̀-èdè Thailand, ló mú Bíbélì náà jáde lọ́jọ́ àkọ́kọ́ àpéjọ náà.
target: Brother Plakorn Pestanyee, a member of the Thailand Branch Committee, released the Bible on the first day of the convention.

input: Ìgbìmọ̀ ẹlẹ́ni-mẹ́ta tó túmọ̀ Bíbélì náà lo ọdún kan ààbọ̀ lórí iṣẹ́ náà.
target: The three-person translation team worked for one and a half years on the project.

input: Bíbélì tuntun yìí ní àwọn ohun èlò ìwádìí bí atọ́ka, tó máa ran àwọn tó ń kà á lọ́wọ́ láti tètè rí àwọn ẹsẹ Bíbélì àti àlàyé ọ̀rọ̀ tó ń ṣàlàyé àwọn ọ̀rọ̀ Bíbélì.
target: The translation features useful study tools, such as an index that assists readers to easily locate specific verses and a glossary that explains the meaning of Bible expressions.

input: Ní November 12, 2019, Ilé ẹjọ́ kan ní orílẹ̀-èdè Turkmenistan dá Arákùnrin Serdar Dovletov lẹ́bi, ó sì fi sẹ́wọ̀n ọdún mẹ́ta.Ẹni ọdún mẹ́rìndínlọ́gbọ̀n 26 ni Arákùnrin Dovletov.
target: A court in Turkmenistan convicted 26-year-old Brother Serdar Dovletov and sentenced him to three years in prison on November 12, 2019.

input: Arákùnrin Dovletov wà lára àwọn arákùnrin mẹ́wàá ní orílẹ̀-èdè náà tí wọ́n fi sẹ́wọ̀n nítorí pé ẹ̀rí ọkàn wọn ò gbà wọ́n láyè láti ṣiṣẹ́ ológun.
target: Brother Dovletov is one of ten brothers in the country who has been sentenced to prison for conscientious objection.

input: Àwọn méje ni wọ́n fi sẹ́wọ̀n ní 2019, wọ́n ti fi àwọn mẹ́ta yòókù sẹ́wọ̀n ní 2018.
target: Seven have been convicted in 2019 and three were convicted in 2018.

input: Àkókò tí wọ́n ní kí wọ́n lò lẹ́wọ̀n jẹ́ láàárín ọdún kan sí mẹ́rin.
target: Their prison terms range from one to four years.

input: Ìlú Baýramaly ni Arákùnrin Dovletov ti wá, ní agbègbè Mary tó wà ní apá gúúsù ìlà oòrùn Turkmenistan.
target: Brother Dovletov is from the city of Baýramaly, Mary Region, in southeastern Turkmenistan.

input: Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ni Surya ìyàwó ẹ̀ àti Sonya màmá rẹ̀.
target: His wife, Surya, and mother, Sonya, are also Jehovah’s Witnesses.

input: November 11, 2019 ni ìgbẹ́jọ́ Arákùnrin Dovletov bẹ̀rẹ̀.
target: Brother Dovletov’s trial began on November 11, 2019.

input: Arákùnrin Dovletov sọ fún ilé ẹjọ́ náà pé ìsìn òun ló mú kí ẹ̀rí ọkàn òun kọ̀ láti ṣiṣẹ́ ológun.
target: Brother Dovletov told the court that he conscientiously objects to military service based on his personal religious beliefs.

input: Ní àfikún, àwọn dókítà mẹ́ta ló jẹ́rìí pé Arákùnrin Dovletov ní ọgbẹ́ inú ọlọ́jọ́ pípẹ́, ìyẹn náà sì wà lára ìdí tó fi yẹ kí wọ́n yọ̀ǹda ẹ̀ láti má ṣiṣẹ́ ológun.
target: Additionally, three doctors testified under oath that Brother Dovletov has a chronic duodenal ulcer that warrants an exemption from military service.

input: Láìka àwọn ẹ̀rí yìí sí, adájọ́ náà sọ pé Arákùnrin Dovletov jẹ̀bi fífi ọgbọ́n jìbìtì sá fún iṣẹ́ ológun, ó sì sọ pé kí wọ́n fi sí àhámọ́.
target: Despite the facts presented, the judge ruled Brother Dovletov guilty of fraudulently evading the draft and had him placed in a local detention center.

input: Láìpẹ́, ó máa dara pọ̀ mọ́ àwọn arákùnrin mẹ́sàn-an tí wọ́n fi sẹ́wọ̀n ní àgọ́ ìṣẹ́niníṣẹ̀ẹ́ tó wà nílùú Seydi nínú aṣálẹ̀ kan lágbègbè Lebap.
target: It is expected that soon he will join the other nine brothers imprisoned in the harsh Seydi labor camp in the desert of Lebap Region.

input: Arákùnrin Dovletov máa pe ẹjọ́ kòtẹ́milọ́rùn lórí ìdájọ́ náà.
target: Brother Dovletov will appeal the conviction.

input: Bí àwọn arákùnrin wa ní Turkmenistan ṣe ń fara da ìwà ìrẹ́jẹ lórílẹ̀-èdè wọn, à ń gbàdúrà fún wọn pẹ̀lú ìgbàgbọ́ kíkún nínú ìlérí Jèhófà pé á tì wọ́n lẹ́yìn bí wọ́n ṣe ń fi ìgboyà di ìṣòtítọ́ wọn mú.​—Sáàmù 3718, 24.
target: As our brothers in Turkmenistan continue to face injustice, we pray for them with full faith in the inspired promise that Jehovah will support their courageous stand of integrity.—Psalm 3718, 24.

input: Látọdún bíi mélòó kan báyìí, April 19, 2019 nìgbà àkọ́kọ́ táwọn ará wa káàkiri orílẹ̀-èdè Uzbekistan ṣe Ìrántí Ikú Kristi tí ọ̀pọ̀ èèyàn sì láǹfààní láti wá síbẹ̀.
target: On April 19, 2019, for the first time in recent years, our brothers throughout the entirety of Uzbekistan were able to commemorate the Memorial of Christ’s death publicly.

input: Ìlú Chirchik tó wà nítòsí ìlú Tashkent nìkan ló forúkọ ẹ̀sìn àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà sílẹ̀ lábẹ́ òfin ní gbogbo orílẹ̀-èdè Uzbekistan.
target: Jehovah’s Witnesses in Uzbekistan are officially registered only in Chirchik, a city near Tashkent.

input: Láwọn ọdún tó kọjá, ńṣe làwọn ará wa tí kò sí ní ìlú Chirchik máa ń ṣe Ìrántí Ikú Kristi ní bòókẹ́lẹ́ káwọn ọlọ́pàá má bàa dà wọ́n láàmú.
target: In previous years, our brothers living outside of Chirchik would commemorate the Memorial in secret so as to avoid potential police interference.

input: Àmọ́ lọ́dún yìí, àwọn ará sọ fáwọn Ọlọ́pàá pé àwọn fẹ́ ṣe Ìrántí Ikú Kristi, wọ́n sì pè wọ́n pé kí wọ́n wá.
target: This year, the brothers informed the police of the Memorial observance and invited them to attend.

input: Àwọn ọlọ́pàá náà fèsì tó dáa, wọ́n sì gbé ìgbésẹ̀ láti pèsè ààbò tó yẹ fáwọn tó wá síbi Ìrántí Ìkú Kristi.
target: The police officers responded amicably and even took measures to ensure the safety of attendees.

input: Àní láwọn ibì kan, àwọn ọlọ́pàá wà lára àwọn tó wá gbọ́ àsọyé.
target: In some areas, police officers attended the program.

input: Arákùnrin Mark Sanderson tó jẹ́ ara Ìgbìmọ̀ Olùdarí ló sọ àsọyé Ìrántí Ikú Kristi ní Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba tó wà ní ìlú Chirchik, bẹ́ ẹ ṣe rí i nínú àwòrán tó wà lókè yìí.
target: Brother Mark Sanderson of the Governing Body delivered the Memorial discourse in a Kingdom Hall complex in Chirchik, as shown in the lead photograph.

input: Wọ́n túmọ̀ àsọyé náà sí èdè Russian.
target: The program was translated into Russian.

input: Àwọn tó wá jẹ́ ogọ́rùn-ún méje àti mọ́kànlélọ́gọ́rin 781.
target: The total attendance was 781.

input: Lẹ́yìn ìpàdé àkọ́kọ́ yìí, wọ́n ṣe ìpàdé méjì míì nínú Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba náà.
target: Later in the evening, two more Memorial observances were held at the same complex.

input: Lásìkò ìbẹ̀wò yìí, Arákùnrin Sanderson pẹ̀lú Arákùnrin Paul Gillies láti oríléeṣẹ́ wa àtàwọn arákùnrin méjì láti Central Asia ṣèpàdé pẹ̀lú àwọn ọ̀gá ní Ilé Iṣẹ́ Ètò Ìdájọ́ àti ní Ọ́fíìsì Àwọn Tó Ń Bójú Tó Ẹ̀tọ́ Ọmọnìyàn.
target: During the visit, Brother Sanderson, accompanied by Paul Gillies from world headquarters and two brothers from Central Asia, met with senior officials from the Ministry of Justice and the National Centre for Human Rights.

input: Nínú ìpàdé náà, wọ́n ní kí àwọn ará wa ṣàlàyé àwọn ohun tá a gbà gbọ́ àti ètò wa.
target: During the meetings, our brothers were allowed to present accurate information about our faith and organization.

input: A retí pé ohun táwọn aláṣẹ náà ti mọ̀ nípa wa máa mú kí wọ́n ṣèrànwọ́ láti forúkọ ẹ̀sìn wa sílẹ̀ láwọn agbègbè tó kù lẹ́yìn ìlú Chirchik, èyí sì máa mú kó rọrùn fáwọn ará láti lè ní àwọn ibi tí wọ́n á ti máa jọ́sìn.
target: It is hoped that well-informed officials will support registration in communities beyond Chirchik, which will help the brothers acquire appropriate facilities for worship.

input: Arákùnrin Mark Sanderson pẹ̀lú àwọn ará tí wọ́n rán lọ rèé ní ìta Ilé Iṣẹ́ Ètò Ìdájọ́ Orílẹ̀-èdè Uzbekistan Ìrántí Ikú Kristi tí ọ̀pọ̀ èèyàn wá àti ìpàdé tá a ṣe pẹ̀lú àwọn aláṣẹ yìí jẹ́ ohun tuntun tó wáyé ní Uzbekistan.
target: Brother Mark Sanderson with fellow members of the delegation outside the Ministry of Justice of the Republic of Uzbekistan The public Memorial observance and the respectful meetings with officials are the latest positive developments in Uzbekistan.

input: Láti oṣù mẹ́fà báyìí, kò sí Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà kankan tí wọ́n ya wọlé rẹ̀ tàbí tí wọ́n ní kó sanwó ìtanràn tàbí táwọn ọlọ́pàá mú.
target: During the past six months, there have been no raids, fines, or arrests of Jehovah’s Witnesses.

input: Àdúrà wa ní pé kí Jèhófà bù kún ìsapá àwọn ará wa ní Uzbekistan bí wọ́n ṣe ń ‘gbé ìgbé ayé tó pa rọ́rọ́ nìṣó pẹ̀lú ìbàlẹ̀ ọkàn, tí wọ́n sì ń fi gbogbo ọkàn wọn sin Ọlọ́run.—1 Tímótì 22.
target: We look to Jehovah to bless the efforts of our brothers in Uzbekistan as they continue to lead a calm and quiet life with complete godly devotion and seriousness.—1 Timothy 22.

input: Láàárín oṣù mẹ́fà, bẹ̀rẹ̀ láti March 2018, Ilé Ẹjọ́ Gíga Jù Lọ ní Uzbekistan àti Ilé Ẹjọ́ Ìjọba Karakalpakstan, agbègbè kan tó ní ìjọba tiẹ̀ lọ́tọ̀ ní Uzbekistan, sọ nínú àwọn ẹjọ́ kan tí wọ́n dá pé àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà lómìnira lábẹ́ òfin láti jọ́sìn.
target: In a six-month period beginning in March 2018, the Supreme Court of Uzbekistan and the Administrative Court of Karakalpakstan, an autonomous republic in Uzbekistan, decided in favor of Jehovah’s Witnesses in cases related to our freedom of worship.

input: Ilé Ẹjọ́ Gíga Jù Lọ yí ìdájọ́ mẹ́rin táwọn ilé ẹjọ́ kan ti ṣe fáwọn ará wa tẹ́lẹ̀ pa dà, Ilé Ẹjọ́ Ìjọba sì tún yí ẹjọ́ kan pa dà láfikún sí àwọn ẹjọ́ mẹ́rin náà.
target: The Supreme Court reversed four lower court rulings against our brothers, and the Administrative Court reversed a fifth decision.

input: Timur Satdanov, ọ̀kan lára àwọn ará wa tí Ilé Ẹjọ́ Gíga Jù Lọ dá láre ní Uzbekistan.
target: Timur Satdanov, one of our brothers exonerated by a Supreme Court victory in Uzbekistan.

input: Ohun tó ṣẹlẹ̀ ni pé àwọn aláṣẹ gba àwọn ìwé tó dá lórí Bíbélì àtàwọn ẹ̀rọ alágbèéká tí Bíbélì wà nínú wọn lọ́wọ́ àwọn èèyàn, àwọn ọlọ́pàá ṣèwádìí nípa wọn, wọ́n sì gbé ọ̀rọ̀ náà lọ sí ilé ẹjọ́.
target: Several of the cases involving our brothers resulted from police investigations in which authorities seized Bible-based literature, as well as electronic devices that contained copies of the Bible.

input: Àwọn ilé ẹjọ́ tó kọ́kọ́ gbọ́ ẹjọ́ náà dá àwọn ará wa lẹ́bi, wọ́n sì bu owó ìtanràn lé wọn, torí wọ́n gbà pé àwọn ará náà ti rú òfin táwọn kan sọ pé ó kà á léèwọ̀ fún ẹnikẹ́ni láti máa pín ìwé ẹ̀sìn kiri.
target: As a result, lower courts found the brothers guilty and imposed fines on the basis of a law that can be interpreted as prohibiting the distribution of religious material.

input: Àmọ́ a dúpẹ́ pé, ilé ẹjọ́ gíga dá àwọn ará wa láre lẹ́nu àìpẹ́ yìí, wọn ò sì ní sanwó ìtanràn náà mọ́.
target: Thankfully, these recent high court decisions exonerate our brothers from these guilty verdicts and exempt them from the fines.

input: Ọjọ́ Tí A Ṣe É November 22 sí 24, 2019
target: November 22-24, 2019

input: Ibi Tí A Ti Ṣe É Pápá Ìṣeré Marvel ní Melbourne, Ọsirélíà
target: Marvel Stadium in Melbourne, Australia

input: Èdè Tí A Lò fún Ìtòlẹ́sẹẹsẹ Èdè Àwọn Adití Lọ́nà ti Ọsirélíà, Chinese Cantonese, Chinese Mandarin, Gẹ̀ẹ́sì, Korean, Sípáníìṣì, Tagalog, Vietnamese
target: Australian Sign Language, Chinese Cantonese, Chinese Mandarin, English, Korean, Spanish, Tagalog, Vietnamese

input: Àwọn Ẹ̀ka Tí Aṣojú Ti Wá Ajẹntínà, Kánádà, Hong Kong, Íńdíà, Ítálì, Japan, Kòríà, Philippines, Solomon Islands, South Africa, Taiwan, Amẹ́ríkà
target: Argentina, Canada, Hong Kong, India, Italy, Japan, Korea, Philippines, Solomon Islands, South Africa, Taiwan, United States

input: Mo dúpẹ́ púpọ̀ lọ́wọ́ yín àti lọ́wọ́ àwọn tó mú àwọn èèyàn káàkiri.Ọ̀gá àgbà ilé ìtura tí àwọn àlejò bí ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́ta ó lé ogójì 340 dé sí sọ pé Gbogbo wọn máa ń kóra jọ láti yanjú ìṣòro.
target: A huge thanks to you and all of your wonderful guides.A reservations manager commented about the 340Everyone collaborates to solve problems.

input: Ṣe ni wọ́n dà bí ìdílé kan lójú mi tí gbogbo wọn jọ ń sọ̀rọ̀, tí wọ́n sì ń ti ara wọn lẹ́yìn.
target: It looks to me like it is just a giant family and everyone is talking to and supporting each other.

input: Ká sòótọ́, inú mi dùn gan-an pé mo wà pẹ̀lú wọn.
target: Seriously, it has been a joy to deal with everyone.

input: Ọdún kọkànlá 11 tí mo ti ń ṣiṣẹ́ ìgbàlejò rèé, síbẹ̀ àwùjọ wọn ló jọ mí lójú jù.Torí ohun tí ọ̀gá náà rí, ó lọ sí àpéjọ tá a ṣe lọ́jọ́ Saturday pẹ̀lú àwọn ará.
target: I have been working in the hospitality industry for 11 years, and this is the only group that I have found like this.As a result of his interactions with Jehovah’s Witnesses, the manager attended the convention on Saturday.

input: Àrọ̀ọ̀rọ̀dá òjò ti mú kí alagbalúgbú omi ya bo apá àríwá-gúúsù orílẹ̀-èdè Ọsirélíà.
target: Heavy rainfall has caused severe flooding in northeast Australia.

input: Omíyalé yìí lé ẹgbẹẹgbẹ̀rún èèyàn nílé, ọ̀pọ̀ nǹkan ló sì bà jẹ́ títí kan iná ìjọba.
target: The floodwaters have displaced thousands of residents and caused major property damage and power outages.

input: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa ní Ọsirélíà ròyìn pé akéde méjìdínlọ́gọ́ta 58 láti ìjọ mẹ́ta ni omíyalé yìí mú kí wọ́n lọ máa gbé lọ́dọ̀ àwọn mọ̀lẹ́bí wọn tàbí àwọn ará.
target: The Australasia branch reports that, as a result of the flooding, 58 publishers from three congregations needed to relocate to the homes of family members or other Witnesses.

input: Ilé mẹ́wàá tó jẹ́ tàwọn ará wa ni àgbàrá ya wọ̀, ó sì ba méjì lára wọn jẹ́ pátápátá.
target: A total of ten homes of our brothers were flooded, two of which were destroyed.

input: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì ti yan Ìgbìmọ̀ Tó Ń Ṣètò Ìrànwọ́ Nígbà Àjálù, alábòójútó àyíká àtàwọn alàgbà tó wà lágbègbè náà sì ń bójú tó àwọn akéde tọ́rọ̀ yìíkan.
target: The branch has established a Disaster Relief Committee, and the circuit overseer and local elders are shepherding the affected publishers.

input: Àdúrà wa ni pé kí àwọn araá wa máa fara dà á nìṣó, kí wọ́n sì rí ìtùnú lọ́dọ̀ àwọn alábòójútó onífẹ̀ẹ́ yẹn.—1 Pétérù 52
target: We pray that our brothers and sisters continue to endure and be comforted under the care of these loving shepherds.—1 Peter 52

input: Tọkọtaya Ẹlẹ́rìí kan pàdánù ilé wọn nígbà tí iná tó jó léraléra nínú igbó sun mílíọ̀nù kan hẹ́kítà ilẹ̀ nǹkan bíi mílíọ̀nù méjì ààbọ̀ éékà jákèjádò ìpínlẹ̀ New South Wales àti ìpínlẹ̀ Queensland ní Ọsirélíà.
target: A Witness couple lost their home as a series of bushfires has burned more than one million hectares approximately 2.5 million acres across New South Wales and Queensland, Australia.

input: Kò sí ìkankan nínú àwọn ará wa tó kú tàbí tó fara pa nínú ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ náà.
target: None of our brothers have been killed or injured in the fires.

input: Kò sì sí Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba tàbí Gbọ̀ngàn Àpéjọ kankan tó bà jẹ́.
target: Kingdom Halls and Assembly Halls have been spared damage.

input: Àwọn aláṣẹ ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀ sọ pé ó ṣeé ṣe kó jẹ́ pé àwọn tó ń dáná sun ilé ló bẹ̀rẹ̀ àwọn kan lára iná náà.
target: Local authorities suspect arsonists may have started some of the fires.

input: Láti oṣù September tí iná náà ti bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí í jó, ó ti pa èèyàn mẹ́fà, ó sì ti jó ilé ó kéré tán ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́fà àti ààbọ̀ 650 run pátápátá.
target: Since September, the fires have killed six people and destroyed at least 650 homes.

input: Àwọn ará tó tó igba 200 lọ́kùnrin àti lóbìnrin ló ní láti fi ilé wọn sílẹ̀, àmọ́ wọ́n ti pa dà sílé báyìí.
target: About 200 brothers and sisters had to evacuate, but they have since returned to their homes.

input: Àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí kan ti ń bójú tó tọkọtaya tí ilé wọn bà jẹ́.
target: The couple whose home was destroyed are being cared for by other Witnesses.

input: Àwọn alàgbà ń fi Ọ̀rọ̀ Ọlọ́run tu àwọn tí ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ náà kàn nínú.—Ìṣe 2028.
target: The congregation elders are giving spiritual support to those affected by the fires.—Acts 2028.

input: Ìjì líle kan tó lágbára tí wọ́n ń pè ní Cyclone Harold jà ní apá àríwá àwọn erékùṣù tó wà ní Vanuatu ní April 5, 2020, ó sì ba ọ̀pọ̀ nǹkan jẹ́.
target: Tropical Cyclone Harold, a Category 5 storm, moved through the northern islands of Vanuatu on April 5, 2020, causing extensive devastation.

input: Lẹ́yìn ìyẹn, ní April 8, ó tún ṣọṣẹ́ ní àwọn erékùṣù tó wà ní Fíjì, ó sì tún ba ọ̀pọ̀ nǹkan jẹ́ níbẹ̀ náà.
target: The cyclone continued southeast and struck the southwest parts of the Fiji islands on April 8, causing similar damage.

input: Nínú ìròyìn tá a kọ́kọ́ gbọ́, kò sí èyíkéyìí lára àwọn arákùnrin wa tó ṣèṣe, a ò sì gbọ́ pé ẹnì kankan lára wọn kú.
target: According to initial reports, none of our brothers have been injured or killed.

input: Àwọn akéde tó tó ọgọ́rùn-ún méjì àti ọgọ́rin 280 ló ń gbé ní erékùsù Espiritu Santo, ìyẹn erékùṣù tó tóbi jù lápá àríwá Vanuatu.
target: Some 280 publishers live on Espiritu Santo, the largest and most northern island of Vanuatu.

input: Ńṣe làwọn ilé sùn lọ bẹẹrẹbẹ, ó sì ba àwọn nǹkan ọ̀gbìn jẹ́, ohun kan náà ló ṣe láwọn erékùṣù míì tó wà nítòsí.
target: The island sustained major destruction of buildings and crops, as did other nearby islands.

input: Ní Fíjì, ó bá ilé àwọn ará wa bí ọgọ́rùn-ún méjì àti ọgọ́ta 260 jẹ́ gan-an.
target: In Fiji, the properties of approximately 260 publishers sustained major damage.

input: Ohun tó ṣẹlẹ̀ yẹn ṣàkóbá gan-an, débi pé tipátipá ni wọ́n fi ń rí omi lo, iná ò sì, bẹ́ẹ̀ sì ni oúnjẹ ṣọ̀wọ́n.
target: Water, electricity, and food supplies are limited.

input: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa tó wà ní Fíjì ń ṣètò báwọn ará wa ṣe máa rí àwọn ohun tí wọ́n nílò.
target: The Fiji branch is coordinating the distribution of essential relief supplies.

input: Bákan náà, àwọn alàgbà ìjọ ń ṣèbẹ̀wò sọ́dọ̀ àwọn ará lọ́kùnrin àti lóbìnrin kí wọ́n lè tù wọ́n nínú kí wọ́n sì fún wọn níṣìírí.
target: Local elders are shepherding the affected brothers and sisters.

input: Inú wa dùn pé àwọn ará wa tó wà níbi tí ìjì ti jà yìí ń rí àbójútó torí pé wọ́n ń rí ìtùnú látinú Ọ̀rọ̀ Ọlọ́run, àwọn ohun kòṣeémáàní tí wọ́n nílò sì ń tẹ̀ wọ́n lọ́wọ́.​—Òwe 1717.
target: We are glad that our brothers affected by this cyclone are being cared for physically and spiritually.—Proverbs 1717.

input: Ní May 10 sí 19, àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà lórílẹ̀-èdè Israel sapá gan-an láti túbọ̀ wàásù láwọn ibi térò pọ̀ sí ní ìlú Tel Aviv.
target: From May 10 to 19, Jehovah’s Witnesses in Israel made a concerted effort to participate in public witnessing in Tel Aviv.

input: Wọ́n fẹ́ ṣe àwọn ọdún ìbílẹ̀ kan ní ìlú náà, èyí sì mú kí àwọn tó ń wá sí ìlú náà ń pọ̀ sí i, torí náà a ṣètò láti wàásù láwọn ibi térò pọ̀ sí.
target: The initiative was in response to the increased number of tourists who came to attend various cultural events in the city.

input: Bí àpẹẹrẹ, ní May 14 sí 18, wọ́n ṣe ìdíje orin Eurovision Song Contest ní ìlú Tel Aviv, àwọn tó sì wá síbẹ̀ tó ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́wàá.
target: For example, from May 14 to 18, Tel Aviv hosted the Eurovision Song Contest, a music competition, which drew about ten thousand tourists.

input: Arákùnrin Gennadi Korobov tó bójú tó iṣẹ́ ìwàásù náà sọ pé Nígbà tá a gbọ́ pé ẹgbẹẹgbẹ̀rún èèyàn ló ń bọ̀ níbi ìdíje orin tó máa wáyé ní ìlú Tel Aviv, a gbà pé ó máa fún wa láǹfààní láti túbọ̀ wàásù láwọn ibi térò pọ̀ sí.
target: Brother Gennadi Korobov, who assisted in coordinating the initiative,When we learned that there would be thousands of visitors to Tel Aviv for the music event, we saw this as a wonderful opportunity to increase our public witnessing activity.

input: Ó wúni lórí láti rí àwọn akéde méjìdínláàádọ́sàn-án 168 tí wọ́n yọ̀ǹda ara wọn láti ìjọ méjìlélógún 22 lórílẹ̀-èdè Israel.Ojoojúmọ́ làwọn ará yìí pàtẹ àwọn ìwé wa síbi mẹ́jọ ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀ láti aago mẹ́sàn-án àárọ̀ títí di aago mẹ́sàn-án alẹ́.
target: We were thrilled to have a total of 168 publishers from 22 congregations throughout Israel volunteer.The brothers set up literature display carts at eight locations from 900 a.m.until 900 p.m.each day.

input: Torí pé oríṣiríṣi orílẹ̀-èdè làwọn àlejò tí wá síbẹ̀, àwọn ará kó àwọn ìwé wa ní èdè mẹ́wàá síbi ìpàtẹ náà, ìyẹèdè Lárúbáwá, Chinese, Gẹ̀ẹ́sì, Faransé, Gámánì, Hébérù, Italian, Japanese, Russian àti Sípáníìṣì.
target: To accommodate the many international tourists,Arabic, Chinese, English, French, German, Hebrew, Italian, Japanese, Russian, and Spanish.

input: Ó dá wa lójú pé iṣẹ́ ìwàásù tá a mú gbòòrò sí i lórílẹ̀-èdè Israel yìí máa sèso rere.
target: We are confident that there will be good results from this increased activity in Israel.

input: Ó sì tún jẹ́ ẹ̀rí tó túbọ̀ ń fi hàn pé àwọn èèyàn Jèhófà ń yìn ín nígbà gbogbo.—Sáàmù 341, 2.
target: This effort is further evidence that Jehovah’s people praise him at all times.—Psalm 341, 2.

input: Ní December 5, 2019, Ilé Ẹjọ́ Ẹ̀tọ́ Ọmọnìyàn ti Ilẹ̀ Yúróòpù dájọ́ pé àwọn arákùnrin méjìlélógún 22 láti orílẹ̀-èdè Armenia tí wọ́n dá lẹ́bi pé wọ́n sá fún iṣẹ́ ológun kò jẹ̀bi rárá.
target: On December 5, 2019, the European Court of Human Rights ECHR unanimously ruled in favor of 22 of Jehovah’s Witnesses from Armenia who were wrongly convicted of evading compulsory military service.

input: Ilé Ẹjọ́ náà sì ní kí wọ́n san owó gbà-má-bínú tó lé ní ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà ọgọ́rùn-ún méjì ó lé méjìdínláàádọ́rin dọ́là 267,000 fún àwọn arákùnrin náà.
target: The ECHR awarded them a total of over 267,000 EUR 242,000.

input: Èyí ni owó tó pọ̀ jù tí Ilé Ẹjọ́ Ẹ̀tọ́ Ọmọnìyàn ti Ilẹ̀ Yúróòpù tíì bù rí pé kí wọ́n san fún àwọn arákùnrin wa tí wọ́n pè lẹ́jọ́ nítorí ẹ̀rí ọkàn wọn tí kò jẹ́ kí wọn ṣiṣẹ́ ológun.
target: This is the highest monetary value the ECHR has awarded our brothers in a case involving conscientious objection.

input: Ní 2012, wọ́n dá àwọn arákùnrin yìí lẹ́bi torí ẹ̀rí ọkàn wọn ò jẹ́ kí wọ́n ṣiṣẹ́ ológun àti pé wọ́n tún kọ̀ láti ṣiṣẹ́ míì tí kì í ṣe iṣẹ́ ológun.
target: In 2012, the brothers were convicted for conscientiously objecting to military service and for refusing alternative civilian service ACS.

input: Ìdí tí wọ́n fi kọ̀ láti ṣiṣẹ́ míì tí kì í ṣe iṣẹ́ ológun ni pé lákòókò yẹn, àwọn ológun ló ń bójú tó iṣẹ́ náà.Torí náà, a ò lè sọ pé kì í ṣe iṣẹ́ ológun.
target: The brothers refused ACS because, at the time, it was under military supervision and was not truly civilian.

input: Nítorí náà, méjì péré nínú àwọn arákùnrin náà ni wọn ò jù sẹ́wọ̀n ṣáájú ọdún 2013, ìyẹn ọdún tí orílẹ̀-èdè Armenia ṣòfin pé kí iṣẹ́ míì wà, tó jẹ́ iṣẹ́ àṣesìnlú lóòótọ́, tí kì í ṣe iṣẹ́ ológun.
target: Therefore, all but two of the brothers served terms in prison prior to 2013, when Armenia enacted ACS that was truly civilian and stopped imprisoning our brothers for conscientious objection.

input: Nígbà tí Ilé Ẹjọ́ Ẹ̀tọ́ Ọmọnìyàn ti Ilẹ̀ Yúróòpù fẹ́ gbé ìdájọ́ ẹ̀ kalẹ̀ ní December 5, ó tọ́ka sí ìdáláre tí àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà rí gbà ní 2017 nínú ẹjọ́ tó wà láàárín orílẹ̀-èdè Armenia àti Adyan pẹ̀lú àwọn ìyókù ẹ̀ Adyan and Others v.Armenia.
target: In handing down its December 5 decision, the ECHR relied on a victory Jehovah’s Witnesses obtained in 2017, the case of Adyan and Others v.Armenia.

input: Ilé Ẹjọ́ Ẹ̀tọ́ Ọmọnìyàn ti Ilẹ̀ Yúróòpù sọ pé orílẹ̀-èdè Armenia mọ̀ dáadáa pé ẹjọ́ 2017 yìí jọra gan-an pẹ̀lú ti àwọn arákùnrin méjìlélógún yìí àti pé ṣe ló yẹ kí orílẹ̀-èdè Armenia fìfẹ́ yanjú ọ̀rọ̀ náà.
target: The ECHR stated that Armenia was well-aware of that case with a similar fact pattern and should have entered into a friendly settlement with the 22 brothers.

input: Síbẹ̀, pẹ̀lú gbogbo bí àwọn arákùnrin wa ṣe sapá tó láti bí ọdún kan sẹ́yìn, ìjọba orílẹ̀-èdè Armenia kọ̀ láti fi wọ́n sílẹ̀.
target: Despite our brothers’ attempts over the past year, the government refused to accept a friendly settlement.

input: Àmọ́ ní báyìí, Ilé Ẹjọ́ Ẹ̀tọ́ Ọmọnìyàn ti Ilẹ̀ Yúróòpù ti dá àwọn arákùnrin wa láre.
target: Thus, the ECHR unanimously ruled in favor of the brothers.

input: A dúpẹ́ pé ojú tí ìjọba orílẹ̀-èdè Armenia fi ń wo àwọn tó kọ̀ láti ṣiṣẹ́ ológun nítorí ẹ̀rí ọkàn wọn ti yàtọ̀ sí i láti 2013.
target: Thankfully, Armenia’s position on conscientious objection has vastly improved since 2013.

input: Wọn ò fi àwọn arákùnrin wa sẹ́wọ̀n mọ́, kò sì sí àkọsílẹ̀ mọ́ pé wọ́n jẹ́ ọ̀daràn nítorí wọn ò dá sí tọ̀tún-tòsì.
target: Our brothers are no longer imprisoned or saddled with criminal records for their neutral stand.

input: Láti bí ọdún méje sẹ́yìn, orílẹ̀-èdè Armenia ti ṣètò iṣẹ́ míì tí àwọn tí ẹ̀rí ọkàn wọn ò jẹ́ kí wọ́n ṣiṣẹ́ ológun lè ṣe, tí kò sì sí lábẹ́ ìdarí àwọn ológun rárá.
target: For the past seven years, Armenia’s truly civilian ACS has been a model for other nations to adopt.

input: Àmọ́ ṣá o, Ilé Ẹjọ́ Ẹ̀tọ́ Ọmọnìyàn ti Ilẹ̀ Yúróòpù dá orílẹ̀-èdè Armenia lẹ́bi ní December 5 pé wọn ò tẹ̀ lé òfin àgbáyé ti ọdún 2012.
target: However, the ECHR’s December 5 judgment holds Armenia accountable for its failure to comply with international law in 2012.

input: Pẹ̀lú ìdájọ́ yìí, Ilé Ẹjọ́ Ẹ̀tọ́ Ọmọnìyàn ti Ilẹ̀ Yúróòpù ń sọ fún gbogbo ayé pé òun máa fìyà tó tó ìyà jẹ orílẹ̀-èdè èyíkéyìí tó bá tẹ òfin ẹ̀tọ́ ọmọnìyàn àgbáyé lójú.
target: With this decision, the ECHR sends a clear message that it is willing to heavily penalize a country for violating international human rights laws.

input: A dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ Jèhófà pé ó fún àwọn arákùnrin wa tó wà lórílẹ̀-èdè Armenia ní ìdáláre tó ṣàrà ọ̀tọ̀ yìí.
target: We thank Jehovah for granting our brothers in Armenia this extraordinary legal victory.

input: A gbàdúrà kí Jèhófà ṣí ọ̀nà sílẹ̀ fún àwọn arákùnrin wa lórílẹ̀-èdè míì láti má ṣe lọ́wọ́ nínú iṣẹ́ ológun tó jẹ́ dandan, kí wọ́n sì lè ní àǹfààní láti ṣe iṣẹ́ míì dípò iṣẹ́ ológun ní àwọn orílẹ̀-èdè tí kò tíì sí, bí Azerbaijan, South Korea, Turkey àti Turkmenistan.
target: We pray that it opens the way for our brothers in other lands to conscientiously object to compulsory military service and to have the option for alternative civilian service where it is not yet available, such as in Azerbaijan, South Korea, Turkey, and Turkmenistan.

input: Ní July 6, 2018, Ilé Ẹjọ́ Barda lórílẹ̀-èdè Azerbaijan fìyà jẹ ọ̀kan lára àwọn arákùnrin wa tó ń jẹ́ Emil Mehdiyev, wọ́n sì fún un láwọn òfin tó gbọ́dọ̀ máa tẹ̀ lé fún ọdún kan gbáko tí kò bá fẹ́ ṣẹ̀wọ̀n.
target: On July 6, 2018, the Barda District Court of Azerbaijan ordered a one-year conditional sentence for one of our brothers, Emil Mehdiyev.

input: Ilé ẹjọ́ sọ pé ọmọ ọlọ́dún méjìdínlógún 18 tó ń jẹ́ Emil yìí jẹ̀bi torí pé ó lóun ò wọṣẹ́ ológun, àmọ́ wọn ò rán an lọ sẹ́wọ̀n.
target: The court found 18-year-old Emil guilty of evading military service, but did not impose a prison sentence.

input: Ní báyìí, kò lè kó kúrò níbi tó ń gbé láìsọ fáwọn aláṣẹ, wọn ò sì jẹ́ kó kúrò lórílẹ̀-èdè Azerbaijan.
target: However, he cannot change his permanent address without notifying the authorities, and he is not allowed to leave Azerbaijan.

input: Ní December 2017, wọ́n ránṣẹ́ pe Arákùnrin Mehdiyev ní Ẹ̀ka Tó Ń Gbani Síṣẹ́, Tó sì Ń Fani Wọṣẹ́ ní Agbègbè Barda.
target: In December 2017, Brother Mehdiyev reported to the Barda District Department of the State Service for Mobilization and Conscription.

input: Àmọ́ ó kọ̀ láti tọwọ́ bọ̀wé ìwọṣẹ́ ológun, torí ẹ̀rí ọkàn rẹ̀ ò jẹ́ kó ṣiṣẹ́ ológun.
target: He refused to sign the draft notice, as his conscience would not permit him to perform military service.

input: Nígbà tí wọ́n tún ránṣẹ́ sí i, ó pa dà lọ ṣàlàyé fún wọn pé ẹ̀rí ọkàn òun ò ní jẹ́ kóun ṣiṣẹ́ ológun, ó sì ní kí wọ́n jẹ́ kóun ṣiṣẹ́ àṣesìnlú míì dípò iṣẹ́ ológun.
target: In response to a summons, he returned to explain his conscientious stand and requested alternative civilian service in lieu of military service.

input: Wọ́n sọ fún un pé kò sírú iṣẹ́ yẹn, wọ́n sì sọ pé àwọn máa gbé ọ̀rọ̀ ẹ̀ lọ sí ọ́fíìsì olùpẹ̀jọ́ ìjọba ní Àgbègbè Barda.
target: He was told that this option was not available and that his case would be sent to the Barda District prosecutor’s office.

input: Lẹ́yìn ọ̀pọ̀ atótónu nílé ẹjọ́ àti àìmọye sísún ẹjọ́ náà síwájú, Ilé Ẹjọ́ Barda dá a lẹ́bi, wọ́n sì fòfin dè é láwọn ọ̀nà kan.
target: After numerous hearings and adjournments, the Barda District Court convicted him and ordered the conditional arrangement.

input: Inú wa dùn pé Arákùnrin Mehdiyev ò yẹhùn lórí ìpinnu rẹ̀ láìka bí nǹkan ṣe nira fún un báyìí tó.—1 Pétérù 219.
target: We are happy that Brother Mehdiyev is maintaining his neutral stand in the face of this difficult situation.—1 Peter 219.

input: Ní November 8, 2018, Àjọ Tó Ń Rí sí Ọ̀rọ̀ Iṣẹ́ pẹ̀lú Àwọn Ẹlẹ́sìn ní orílẹ̀-èdè Azerbaijan fọwọ́ sí i káwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà forúkọ ẹ̀sìn wọn sílẹ̀ lábẹ́ òfin délẹ̀délẹ̀ nílùú Baku, tó jẹ́ olú-ìlú Azerbaijan.
target: On November 8, 2018, Azerbaijan’s State Committee for Work with Religious Associations granted Jehovah’s Witnesses full legal registration in Baku, the capital city of Azerbaijan.

input: Àwọn ará wa ti wá ní ẹ̀rí tó lẹ́sẹ̀ nílẹ̀ lábẹ́ òfin láti máa jọ́sìn ní gbangba, kí wọ́n sì máa wàásù fàlàlà ní ìlú náà.
target: Our brothers now enjoy a stronger legal basis to openly worship and preach in the city.

input: Àdúrà wa ni pé àṣeyọrí tá a ṣe lábẹ́ òfin yìí máa jẹ́ káwọn aláṣẹ gbà káwọn ará wa tó wà láwọn ibòmíì lórílẹ̀-èdè náà forúkọ ẹ̀sìn wọn sílẹ̀ lábẹ́ òfin.
target: We hope that this positive development will provide a precedent for our fellow worshippers in other parts of the country to receive legal registration.

input: A dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ Jèhófà pé àwọn aláṣẹ fojúure hàn sí wa, wọ́n sì fọwọ́ sí i kí òfin gbà wá láyè láti máa ṣe ìjọsìn wa nílùú Baku.​—Fílípì 17.
target: We are thankful to Jehovah that favorable government officials have legally established our worship in Baku.—Philippians 17.

input: Ní July 26 sí 28 2019, àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà tó wà ní orílẹ̀-èdè Azerbaijan ṣe àpéjọ tí wọ́n máa ń ṣe lọ́dọọdún ní Darnagul Ceremony House ní olú ìlú orílẹ̀-èdè náà tí wọ́n ń pé ní Baku.
target: From July 26 to 28, 2019, Jehovah’s Witnesses in Azerbaijan held their annual convention at the Darnagul Ceremony House in the capital city of Baku.

input: Lọ́dún yìí tí ọ̀wọ́ àpéjọ àgbáyé mánigbàgbé wáyé, àpéjọ agbègbè tó wáyé ní Baku pẹ̀lú jẹ́ mánigbàgbé ní ti pé òun ni àpéjọ tó tóbi jù lọ tá a ṣe ní Azerbaijan.
target: In this year of memorable international conventions, the regional convention in Baku was historic.

input: Bákan náà, fún ìgbà àkọ́kọ́, àwọn ìjọ tó ń sọ èdè Azerbaijan àti ti Rọ́ṣíà ní orílẹ̀ èdè yẹn pàdé pọ̀ fún àpéjọ kan ṣoṣo.
target: It was the largest public convention ever held in Azerbaijan and the first time Azerbaijani and Russian congregations from the entire country attended a convention at the same time.

input: Bó tiẹ̀ jẹ́ pé gbogbo akéde tó wà ni Azerbaijan kò ju ẹgbẹ̀rún kan àtààbọ̀ 1,500 lọ, síbẹ̀ ẹgbẹ̀rún kan, ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́sàn àti méjìdínlógójì 1,938 ló wá sí àpéjọ yìí.
target: Although Azerbaijan only has about 1,500 publishers, the peak attendance for the convention was 1,938.

input: Èèyàn mẹ́tàlélọ́gbọ́n 33 ló sì ṣe ìrìbọmi.
target: A total of 33 were baptized.

input: Wọ́n fún Arákùnrin Mark Sanderson ní àǹfààní àrà ọ̀tọ̀ láti wọlé sí orílẹ̀-èdè yìí kó lè sọ àsọyé ní àpéjọ náà.
target: Brother Mark Sanderson was allowed special entry into the country to deliver talks at the convention.

input: Èyí ni ìgbà àkọ́kọ́ tí ọ̀kan lára Ìgbìmọ̀ Olùdarí máa ṣe àpéjọ pẹ̀lú àwọn ará ní Azerbaijan.
target: It was the first time a member of the Governing Body served a convention in Azerbaijan.

input: A dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ àwọn aláṣẹ fún ànfààní yìí.
target: We are grateful to the authorities for granting this permission.

input: Ìṣọ̀kan tó wà láàárín àwọn arákùnrin àti arábìnrin wa ń jẹ́rìí lọ́nà tó wúni lórí.
target: The unity of the brothers and sisters gave an excellent witness.

input: Olùdarí ibi tá a lò fún àpéjọ náà kíyè sí i pé àlàáfìà, ìfẹ́ àti inú rere jọba láàárin àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà nígbà àpéjọ náà àti pé wọ́n ń fi ohun tí wọn ń wàásù ṣèwà hù.
target: The administrator of the venue observed that during this convention he saw peace, love, and kindness among the Witnesses and that they really do practice what they preach.

input: Bó tìẹ̀ jẹ́ pé, wọ́n ṣì ń fojú òmìnira ìsìn àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà gbolẹ̀ ní Azerbaijan, látìgbàdégbà làwọn aláṣẹ ń fún àwọn ará wa lómìnira tó pọ̀ sí i láti jọ́sìn.
target: Although Jehovah’s Witnesses still experience violations of religious freedom in Azerbaijan, authorities have progressively granted our brothers greater freedom to practice their faith.

input: Ní November 2018, ìjọba Azerbaijan fún àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà láàyè láti forúkọ ẹ̀sìn wọn sílẹ̀ lábẹ́ òfin ní Baku.
target: In November 2018, Azerbaijan gave Jehovah’s Witnesses full legal registration in Baku.

input: Èyí ló sì fún àwọn ará wa ní òmìnira tó pọ̀ sí i lábẹ́ òfin láti jọ́sin ní gbangba ní ìlú náà.
target: This registration gives our brothers a stronger legal basis to openly worship in the city.

input: A bá àwọn arákùnrin àti arábìnrin wa ní Azerbaijan yọ̀ fún àwọn ohun rere àti ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ mánigbàgbé tó wáyé nínú ìtàn wọn.
target: We rejoice with our brothers and sisters in Azerbaijan for these positive developments, including this recent milestone in their theocratic history.

input: Àdúrà wa ni pé kí Jèhófà bù kún ìsapá wa bí a ṣe ń gbèjà ìhìn rere, tí a sì ń fìdí rẹ̀ múlẹ̀ lọ́nà òfin ní ibi gbogbo lórílẹ̀-èdè Azerbaijan àti kárí ayé.​—Fílípì 17.
target: We pray for Jehovah’s continued blessing on the efforts to ‘legally establish the good news’ throughout Azerbaijan and worldwide.—Philippians 17.

input: Ní October 31, 2018, Ilé Ẹjọ́ Kòtẹ́milọ́rùn nílùú Ganja lórílẹ̀-èdè Azerbaijan fọwọ́ sí ẹjọ́ tí ilé ẹjọ́ kan ti dá tẹ́lẹ̀ pé Arákùnrin Vahid Abilov, tó jẹ́ ọmọ ọdún mọ́kàndínlógún 19 jẹ̀bi torí pé ẹ̀rí ọkàn ò jẹ́ kó wọṣẹ́ ológun.
target: On October 31, 2018, the Ganja Court of Appeal in Azerbaijan upheld a lower court ruling to convict Brother Vahid Abilov, 19, for conscientious objection.

input: Bó tiẹ̀ jẹ́ pé wọn ò rán Vahid lọ sẹ́wọ̀n, wọ́n fi àwọn òfin máṣu-mátọ̀ kan dè é fún ọdún kan gbáko, tó túmọ̀ sí pé oríṣiríṣi nǹkan ni ò ní lè ṣe.
target: Although Vahid is not imprisoned, his one-year conditional sentence places several restrictions on him.

input: Bí àpẹẹrẹ, ọ̀sọ̀ọ̀sẹ̀ ló gbọ́dọ̀ máa yọjú sí agbófinró kan, wọn ò sì gbà á láyè kó kúrò ní Azerbaijan.
target: For example, he must report to a probation officer each week, and he is not allowed to leave Azerbaijan.

input: Vahid máa kọ̀wé pe ẹjọ́ kòtẹ́milọ́rùn sí Ilé Ẹjọ́ Gíga Jù Lọ báyìí, ìpele tó gbẹ̀yìn nìyẹn tó lè gbé ọ̀rọ̀ ẹ̀ dé lábẹ́ òfin ní Azerbaijan.May 2017 ni ìṣòro arákùnrin wa yìí ti bẹ̀rẹ̀.
target: Vahid will now appeal to the Supreme Court, his last opportunity for justice in Azerbaijan’s judicial system.The challenge to our brother’s neutrality began in May 2017.

input: Kò pẹ́ tó pé ẹni ọdún méjìdínlógún 18 ni wọ́n ní kó lọ sí iléeṣẹ́ ìjọba ní Aghdam tó ń rí sí bí àwọn èèyàn ṣe ń wọṣẹ́ ológun, tí wọ́n sì ń múra sílẹ̀ fún ogun.
target: He had recently turned 18 and was required to report to the Aghdam District Department of the State Service for Mobilization and Conscription.

input: Nígbà tó débẹ̀, ó fún wọn níwèé tó kọ, tó fi ṣàlàyé pé òun ò ní lè wọṣẹ́ ológun.
target: There he presented a written statement explaining that he could not serve in the military.

input: Ohun tó kọ rèé Ẹ̀rí ọkàn mi tí mo ti fi Bíbélì kọ́ ò ní jẹ́ kí n lè wọṣẹ́ ológun.
target: My Bible-trained conscience prevents me from taking up military service.

input: Kì í ṣe pé mò ń sá, tàbí pé mò ń ronú àtisá fún ojúṣe tó yẹ kí n ṣe fún ìlú.
target: I do not evade, or even think of evading, the fulfillment of my civic duty.

input: Ohun tí mo kàn fẹ́ kẹ́ ẹ jọ̀ọ́ ṣe fún mi ni pé kẹ́ ẹ jẹ́ kí n ṣiṣẹ́ àṣesìnlú dípò iṣẹ́ ológun.Àmọ́ àwọn aláṣẹ ò gbà fún Vahid, nígbà tó di July 9, 2018, wọ́n fẹ̀sùn kàn án pé ó ń sá fún iṣẹ́ ológun.
target: I just kindly ask you to provide me with alternative civilian service instead of military service.The authorities rebuffed Vahid’s wishes, and on July 9, 2018, indicted him under the charge of evading military service.

input: Nígbà tí Ilé Ẹjọ́ Kòtẹ́milọ́rùn nílùú Ganja ń gbọ́ ẹjọ́ náà, Arákùnrin Abilov tún ṣàlàyé ohun tó fà á tí òun ò fi fẹ́ wọṣẹ́ ológun.
target: During the hearing in the Ganja Court of Appeal, Brother Abilov further explained his motives for objecting to military service.

input: Ó ka ìwé Àìsáyà 24 fún ilé ẹjọ́, ó sì ṣàlàyé pé àyẹ̀wò tí òun fúnra òun ṣe nínú Bíbélì jẹ́ kó dá òun lójú pé kò tiẹ̀ yẹ kóun kọ́ bí wọ́n ṣe ń jà.Láìka gbogbo àlàyé tó ṣe sí, ilé ẹjọ́ sọ pé ó jẹ̀bi.
target: He read Isaiah 24 to the court and explained that his personal examination of the Bible convinced him that he should not even learn to fight.Nonetheless, the court upheld his conviction.

input: A ò tíì mọ̀ bóyá Ilé Ẹjọ́ Gíga Jù Lọ máa fọwọ́ sí i kó ṣe ohun tó fẹ́.
target: It is yet to be seen if the Supreme Court will respect his wishes.

input: Nígbà tí orílẹ̀-èdè Azerbaijan dara pọ̀ mọ́ Ìgbìmọ̀ Ilẹ̀ Yúróòpù lọ́dún 2001, wọ́n ṣàdéhùn pé àwọn máa ṣòfin tó máa fọwọ́ sí iṣẹ́ àṣesìnlú.Àmọ́ wọn ò tíì mú àdéhùn náà ṣẹ.
target: When Azerbaijan became a member of the Council of Europe in 2001, it committed itself to adopt legislation providing for alternative civilian service.The government has yet to do so.

input: Èyí ń mú kí àwọn ará wa máa kojú ìṣòro léraléra lórí ọ̀rọ̀ pé ẹ̀rí ọkàn ò jẹ́ kí wọ́n ṣiṣẹ́ ológun.
target: As a result, our brothers regularly face the neutrality issue for their conscientious objection to military service.

input: Lọ́wọ́ ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ ọdún yìí, ilé ẹjọ́ kan ní Azerbaijan tún dá Emil Mehdiyev tó jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára àwọn ará wa lẹ́bi torí pé ó kọ̀ láti wọṣẹ́ ológun, wọ́n sì sọ pé kó wà lábẹ́ àyẹ̀wò fún ọdún kan.
target: Earlier in the year, an Azerbaijan district court found another one of our brothers, Emil Mehdiyev, guilty of evasion of military service and sentenced him to one year of probation.

input: Òun náà ti pe ẹjọ́ kòtẹ́milọ́rùn sí Ilé Ẹjọ́ Gíga Jù Lọ.
target: He has also appealed his case to the Supreme Court.

input: Yàtọ̀ síyẹn, ẹjọ́ mẹ́rin ló ṣì wà ní Ilé Ẹjọ́ Ẹ̀tọ́ Ọmọnìyàn ti Ilẹ̀ Yúróòpù lórí ọ̀rọ̀ àwọn ará wa tí ẹ̀rí ọkàn ò jẹ́ kí wọ́n ṣiṣẹ́ ológun.
target: Additionally, there are four cases pending before the European Court of Human Rights against Azerbaijan concerning our brothers who are conscientious objectors.

input: Láìka àwọn ìṣòro yìí sí, àwọn ará wa ò yéé gbára lé Jèhófà kó lè ràn wọ́n lọ́wọ́ láti má se dá sí ọ̀rọ̀ ogun.—Jòhánù 1519.
target: Despite these challenges, our brothers are continuing to rely on Jehovah to maintain their neutrality.—John 1519.

input: Lóṣù March 2019, Ilé Ẹjọ́ Gíga Jù Lọ ní Bọ̀géríà dá àwọn ará wa láre nínú ẹjọ́ mẹ́ta ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀.
target: In March 2019, the Supreme Court of Cassation of Bulgaria, the highest court of the land, issued favorable rulings in three cases involving our brothers.

input: Àwọn ẹjọ́ tó lápẹẹrẹ yìí máa wúlò gan-an láti dáàbò bo ẹ̀tọ́ táwọn ará wa ní láti ṣe ẹ̀sìn wọn káàkiri orílẹ̀-èdè náà.
target: These victories set vital legal precedents to protect our brothers’ freedom of worship throughout the country.

input: Nínú méjì lára àwọn ẹjọ́ náà, ńṣe làwọn ilé iṣẹ́ tó ń gbéròyìn jáde parọ́ mọ́ àwọn ará wa.
target: Two of the cases involved slander from media outlets.

input: Lọ́dún 2012, ìwé ìròyìn Vseki Den gbé àpilẹ̀kọ kan jáde tó fi sọ̀rọ̀ tí kò dáa nípa ohun tá a gbà gbọ́.
