target: In 2012, the newspaper Vseki Den published a libelous article about our beliefs.

input: Bákan náà, lọ́dún 2014, ilé iṣẹ́ tẹlifíṣọ̀n SKAT TV gbé ìròyìn èké jáde nípa ètò wa.
target: Similarly, in 2014, station SKAT TV televised false reports about our organization.

input: Nígbà táwọn ará wa sọ fún wọn pé kí wọ́n ṣàtúnṣe sí irọ́ tí wọ́n pa mọ́ wa, ńṣe ni ilé iṣẹ́ méjèèjì kọ̀ jálẹ̀.
target: In both instances, the media outlets denied our brothers’ requests to retract the negative statements.

input: Lẹ́yìn ọ̀pọ̀ ẹjọ́ tá a pè, títí dé àwọn ilé ẹjọ́ kòtẹ́miọ́rùn, a gbé àwọn ẹjọ́ náà lọ sí Ilé Ẹjọ́ Gíga Jù Lọ.
target: After a series of court cases and appeals, the issues reached the Supreme Court.

input: Ní March 18, 2019 Ilé Ẹjọ́ Gíga Jù Lọ dá ilé iṣẹ́ tẹlifíṣọ̀n SKAT TV lẹ́bi.
target: On March 18, 2019, the Supreme Court ruled against SKAT TV.

input: Ní March 26, Ilé Ẹjọ́ yìí tẹ̀ lé ìpinnu rẹ̀ nínú ẹjọ́ àkọ́kọ́, ó sì dẹ́bi fún ìwé ìròyìn Vseki Den pé ó lo ọ̀rọ̀ tó fi hàn pé ó kórìíra.Ẹjọ́ kẹta dá lé ìwà ìkà táwọn ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ òṣèlú VMRO-Bulgarian National Movement hù sáwọn ará wa.
target: On March 26, the Court used the ruling as a precedent to penalize Vseki Den, condemning what the Court characterized as the language of hatred.The third case involved the cruel persecution of our brothers by a political group called the VMRO-Bulgarian National Movement.

input: Ní April 17, 2011, àwọn ará wa pé jọ láti ṣe Ìrántí ikú Jésù.
target: On April 17, 2011, our brothers gathered to commemorate the Memorial of Jesus’ death.

input: Àmọ́, ńṣe ni Georgi Drakaliev tó jẹ́ olórí nínú ẹgbẹ́ VMRO kó ọgọ́ta 60 jàǹdùkú jọ, wọ́n wá ṣe àwọn ará lésẹ, wọ́n sì dọ́gbẹ́ sí wọn lára.
target: An aggressive mob of 60 people, organized by political leader Georgi Drakaliev of the VMRO, brutally attacked our brothers, inflicting injuries.

input: Àwọn ará gbé ọ̀rọ̀ náà lọ sílé ẹjọ́.
target: The brothers took the matter to the courts.

input: Nígbà tó yá, ọ̀rọ̀ náà dé Ilé Ẹjọ́ Gíga Jù Lọ.
target: The case eventually came before the Supreme Court.

input: Ní March 20, 2019, Ilé Ẹjọ́ Gíga Jù Lọ dá Ọ̀gbẹ́ni Drakaliev lẹ́bi, wọ́n sì ní kó sanwó ìtanràn fáwọn ará wa.
target: On March 20, 2019, the Court ruled against Mr.Drakaliev, who now must compensate the brothers.

input: Inú wa dùn gan-an torí bá a ṣe jàre nínú ẹjọ́ mẹ́tẹ̀ẹ̀ta yìí.
target: We rejoice because of these three favorable rulings.

input: Àwọn ilé ẹjọ́ lè lo àwọn ìdájọ́ tó lápẹẹrẹ yìí láti dáàbò bo ẹ̀tọ́ táwọn ará wa ní láti máa gbé ìgbé ayé tó pa rọ́rọ́ nìṣó pẹ̀lú ìbàlẹ̀ ọkàn, bí wọ́n ti ń fi gbogbo ọkàn wọn sin Ọlọ́run.​—1 Tímótì 22.
target: These decisions can now be used as a basis to protect our brothers’ freedom to go on leading a calm and quiet life with complete godly devotion.—1 Timothy 22.

input: Ní September 7, 2019, a mú Bíbélì Mímọ́ ti Ìtumọ̀ Ayé Tuntun tá a tún ṣe jáde lédè Czech àti Slovak.
target: The revised New World Translation of the Holy Scriptures was released in the Czech and Slovak languages on September 7, 2019.

input: Arákùnrin Stephen Lett tó jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára Ìgbìmọ̀ Olùdarí ló mú Bíbélì méjèèjì náà jáde níbi àkànṣe ìpàdé kan tá a ṣe nílùú Ostrava lórílẹ̀-èdè Czech Republic.
target: The Bibles were released by Brother Stephen Lett, a member of the Governing Body, at a special meeting held in Ostrava, Czech Republic.

input: Ibi tó ju igba 200 ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀ lọ ni wọ́n ti gbé àkànṣe ìpàdé náà sáfẹ́fẹ́ lórílẹ̀-èdè Czech Republic àti Slovakia, ẹgbẹ̀rún-ún márùndínlọ́gbọ̀n àti igba ó lé mẹ́rìnlélọ́gọ́rin 25,284 èèyàn ló sì pésẹ̀ síbẹ̀.
target: The special meeting included over 200 locations in the Czech Republic and Slovakia, with a total attendance of 25,284.

input: Ó ju ọdún mẹ́rin tí àwùjọ àwọn atúmọ̀ èdè kọ̀ọ̀kan fi ṣiṣẹ́ kí wọ́n tó lè mú àwọn ìtẹ̀jáde náà jáde.
target: These releases are the result of over four years of work by each team of translators.

input: Àǹfààní pàtàkì tó wà nínú àwọn ìtúmọ̀ Bíbélì tá a tún ṣe yìí ni pé, wọ́n rọrùn láti kà.
target: A primary benefit of the revised translations is that they are easy to read.

input: Ọ̀kan lára àwọn atúmọ̀ èdè Slovak sọ pé Àwọn èèyàn máa gbádùn Bíbélì yìí gan an, ó sì máa dùn-ún kà.
target: Many will find themselves immersed in the reading of Bible accounts.

input: Àdúrà wa ni pé kí Bíbélì tuntun yìí mú káwọn tó ń kà á túbọ̀ nífẹ̀ẹ́ sí òtítọ́ tó wà nínú Ọ̀rọ̀ Ọlọ́run.​—Lúùkù 2432.
target: It is our prayer that these releases will help Bible truth touch the hearts of readers to an even greater degree.—Luke 2432.

input: Ní July 19, 2019, Arákùnrin Stephen Lett tó jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára Ìgbìmọ̀ Olùdarí fi tayọ̀tayọ̀ mú Ìwé Mímọ́ Kristian Lédè Griki ní Ìtumọ̀ Ayé Titun jáde lèdè Icelandic ní àpéjọ àgbáyé tá a ṣe ní Copenhagen lórílẹ̀ èdè Denmark.
target: On July 19, 2019, Brother Stephen Lett of the Governing Body enthusiastically announced the release of the New World Translation of the Christian Greek Scriptures in Icelandic at the international convention in Copenhagen, Denmark.

input: Lówùúrọ̀ Friday àpéjọ náà, alága sọ pé kí gbogbo àwọn tó wà làwọn ìjọ tó ń sọ èdè Icelandic wá sí yàrá kékeré kan tó wà nínú pápá ìṣeré náà ní àkókò ìsinmi ọ̀sán.
target: On Friday morning of the convention, the chairman invited all in the Icelandic-language field to meet in a small lounge within the stadium complex during the noon break.

input: Níbi àkànṣe ìpàdé yìí ni Arákùnrin Lett ti fún àwọn ọgọ́rùn mẹ́ta àti mọ́kànlélógójì 341 arákùnrin àti arábìnrin tó wà níbẹ̀, tí wọn sì gbà á pẹ̀lú ẹ̀mí ìmoore.
target: During this special meeting, Brother Lett presented the Bible to the 341 grateful brothers and sisters who were in attendance.

input: Fún ọ̀pọ̀ ọdún ni àwọn ọmọ ìlú Iceland ti ṣiṣẹ́ láti tú Bíbélì sí èdè wọn.
target: For centuries, Bible translation has been an important part of Iceland’s literary heritage.

input: Ní ọdún 1540, Oddur Gottskálksson tẹ̀ Ìwé Mímọ́ Kristẹni lédè Gíríìkì jáde ní èdè Iceland fún ìgbà àkọ́kọ́.
target: In 1540, Oddur Gottskálksson published the first translation of the Christian Greek Scriptures into Icelandic.

input: Láti ọdún 2010 ni àwọn ará wa tó ń sọ èdè Icelandic ti ń lo Bíbélì tó ń jẹ́ Bible of the 21st Century èyí tí àjọ Icelandic Bible Company tẹ̀ jáde.
target: Since 2010, our Icelandic fellow worshippers have been using the Bible of the 21st Century, published by the Icelandic Bible Company.

input: Ní báyìí, ara àwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin wa tó ń lágbègbè tí wọ́n ti ń sọ èdè Icelandic ti wà lọ́nà láti lo Bíbélì tí a ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ mú jáde yìí láti sọ ìròyìn ayọ̀ náà fún àwọn tó lé ní ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́ta 300,000 tó ń sọ èdè yìí.
target: Now, the brothers and sisters in the Icelandic field are eager to use the newly released translation to share the good news with the more than 300,000 people who speak the language.

input: Arákùnrin kan tó jẹ́ ọkàn lára àwọn tó ṣe iṣẹ́ ìtumọ̀ náà sọ pé Ó fẹ́rẹ̀ẹ́ gbà tó ọdún mẹ́rin láti túmọ̀ Ìwé Mímọ́ Kristẹni lédè Gíríìkì sí èdè Icelandic.
target: The translation of the Christian Greek Scriptures into Icelandic took almost four years.

input: Ohun tó mú kí ìtumọ̀ yìí ṣàrà ọ̀tọ̀ ni pé, ó dá orúkọ Jèhófà padà sí gbogbo ibi tó yẹ kó wà nínú Ìwé Mímọ́.
target: What makes this translation unique is that it fully restores Jehovah’s name to its rightful place in the Scriptures.

input: Àdúrà wa ni pé kí àwọn èèyàn púpọ̀ sí i fẹ́ láti kẹ́kọ̀ọ́ nípa àwọn ohun àgbàyanu Ọlọ́run bí wọ́n ṣe ń ka ọ̀rọ̀ rẹ̀ ní èdè ìbílẹ̀ wọn.​—Ìṣe 211.
target: It is our prayer that many more will want to learn about the magnificent things of God as they read from his Word in the language of their heart.—Acts 211.

input: Ní July 2019, a ṣí ibi tuntun tí wọ́n kó onírúurú Bíbélì sí ní ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà tó wà ní Scandinavia, nílùú Holbæk lórílẹ̀-èdè Denmark, ibẹ̀ ò jú nǹkan bi kìlómítà márùndínláàádọ́rin 65 sí ìlú Copenhagen.
target: In July 2019, a new Bible museum opened at the Scandinavia branch office of Jehovah’s Witnesses, located in the town of Holbæk, Denmark, which is approximately 65 kilometers 40 mi from Copenhagen.

input: Àkòrí tí wọ́n kọ síbi tí wọ́n kó àwọn Bíbélì náà sí ni The Bible and the Divine Name in Scandinavia tó túmọ̀ sí Bíbélì àti Orúkọ Àtọ̀runwá Náà ní Scandinavia.
target: The museum theme is The Bible and the Divine Name in Scandinavia.The museum brings together a unique collection of rare and significant Bibles in the Danish, Faeroese, Greenlandic, Icelandic, Norwegian, Saami, and Swedish languages.

input: Níbẹ̀, wàá rí àtẹ kan tí wọ́n kó ọ̀pọ̀ Bíbélì tó ṣàrà ọ̀tọ̀ sí lédè Danish, Faeroese, Greenlandic, Icelandic, Norwegian, Saami àti Swedish.
target: More than 50 Bibles make up this display.

input: Bíbélì tó wà nínú àtẹ yìí ju àádọ́ta 50 lọ.
target: One of the most significant items is an original 1541 Gustav Vasa Bible.

input: Ọ̀kan lára ohun tó ṣe pàtàkì jù nínú àtẹ náà ni Bíbélì ìpilẹ̀ṣẹ̀ Gustav Vasa ti ọdún 1541.
target: It was the first complete Bible produced in any Scandinavian language.

input: Òun ni odindi Bíbélì àkọ́kọ́ tí wọ́n ṣe lédè Scandinavia.
target: The Gustav Vasa Bible became the standard for the Swedish language, establishing grammar and vocabulary.

input: Inú Bíbélì Gustav Vasa ni wọ́n ti mú èyí tó pọ̀ jù nínú gírámà àti ọ̀rọ̀ èdè àwọn ará Sweden.
target: It also became the model text for the Swedish Bible for the next 300 years.

input: Òun ni odindi Bíbélì àkọ́kọ́ tí wọ́n ṣe lédè Danish.
target: This was the first complete Bible in Danish.

input: Ìlànà tí wọ́n fi kọ Bíbélì Christian III ni wọ́n lò nínú èdè Danish, kódà ọ̀rọ̀ inú ẹ̀ ti di ara èdè tí ọ̀pọ̀ lára àwọn ará Àríwá Yúróòpù ń lò báyìí.
target: The Christian III Bible helped to standardize the Danish language, and it had a significant impact on a large part of Northern Europe.

input: Déètì July 19-21, 2019
Ibi Tí A Ti Ṣeé Pápá Ìṣeré Brøndby àti Gbàgede Brøndby Hallen, ní Copenhagen, Denmark
target: Brøndby Stadium and Brøndby Hallen, Copenhagen, Denmark

input: Èdè Danish, Èdè Adití ti Danish, Gẹ̀ẹ́sì, Icelandic, Èdè Adití ti Norway, Èdè Adití ti Sweden
target: Danish, Danish Sign Language, English, Icelandic, Norwegian Sign Language, Swedish Sign Language

input: Àwọn Ẹ̀ka Ọ́fíísì Tá A Pè Amẹ́ríkà, Australasia, Brazil, Central America, Central Europe, Colombia, Dominican Republic, Finland, Georgia, India, Japan, Poland
target: Australasia, Brazil, Central America, Central Europe, Colombia, Dominican Republic, Finland, Georgia, India, Japan, Poland, United States

input: Bá a ṣe jọ ń bọ̀wọ̀ fún ara wa tá a sì jọ ń fara balẹ̀ gbọ́ ara wa yé ló jẹ́ kí gbogbo ètò ayẹyẹ ńlá yìí yọrí sí rere láìka gbogbo àwọn ìṣòro tó yọjú lọ́tùn-ún lósì sí.
target: Through respect and mutual understanding for each other’s challenges in connection with a huge event like this, the entire planning was executed with a constructive approach to the entire project.

input: Kò wọ́pọ̀ láti rí iléeṣẹ́ tó wà létòlétò, tò sì ń ronú láti ṣe nǹkan fínnífínní bíi tiyín.
target: It is rare to meet a partner who is so well organized and has thought of every detail.

input: Nígbà tó sì wá di ọjọ́ àpéjọ náà, ò wúni lórí láti rí àwọn tó yọ̀ǹda ara wọ́n bí wọ́n ṣe ń ṣiṣẹ́ láti àárọ̀ ṣúlẹ̀ tí inú wọ́n ń dùn, tí wọ́n sì ń rẹ́rìn-ín músẹ́.
target: On the actual days of the convention, it was impressive to see all the volunteers who helped and worked from morning to night, and it was done with a very positive spirit and smiles on their faces.

input: Àǹfààní ńlá ló jẹ́ fún wa pé a kópa nínú ètò ayẹyẹ ńlá yìí, a sì fẹ́ láti dúpẹ́ gan-an lọ́wọ́ Ìgbìmọ̀ Àpéjọ yín àti àwọn tó yọ̀ǹda ara wọn fún ìfọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ wọn.
target: It has been a great event to be a part of, and we would like to give a huge thanks for the cooperation from your Convention Committee and all the volunteers.

input: À ń retí ẹ̀yin àti àwọn àlejò yín nígbà míì ní Pápá Ìṣeré Brøndby.
target: We hope to see you and your guests some other time here at Brøndby Stadium.

input: HELSINKI—Ní ọ̀ṣán Friday, August 18, 2017, afẹ̀míṣòfò kan pa ọ̀kan nínú àwon arábìnrin wa ní orílẹ̀-èdè Finland.
target: HELSINKI—On Friday afternoon, August 18, 2017, one of our sisters was killed in Finland in what is being investigated as an act of terrorism targeting women.

input: Ìwádìí ń lọ lọ́wọ́ nípa ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ yìí, àmọ́ ẹ̀rí fi hàn pé àwọn obìnrin ni afẹ̀míṣòfò yìí dájú sọ.
target: In addition to our sister, the perpetrator killed one other woman and injured eight people in an attack that took place in a market square in Turku, a city on Finland’s southwest coast.

input: Yàtọ̀ sí arábìnrin wa, afẹ̀míṣòfò yẹn tún pa obìnrin kan, ó sì ṣe èèyàn mẹ́jọ léṣe ní gbàgede ọjà ìlú Turku tó wà ní etíkun orílẹ̀-èdè Finland.
target: Immediately after the attack, representatives from the Finland branch office, the local circuit overseer, and local elders provided comfort and support to those affected by the tragedy.

input: Ẹsẹ̀kẹsè tí ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ náà wáyé ni àwọn aṣojú láti ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì Finland, alábòójútó àyíká àtàwọn alàgbà lọ pèsè ìrànwọ́ fáwọn tí ọ̀rọ̀ náà kàn, wọ́n sì tù wọ́n nínú.
target: Veikko Leinonen, a spokesman at the branch office in Finland,This is a very tragic and shocking event.

input: Èèyàn lè gbìyànjú láti sá fún ewu, ṣùgbọ́n nígbà míì èèyàn lè ṣe kòńgẹ́ ‘ìgbà àti ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ tí a kò rí tẹ́lẹ̀,’ títí kan ọṣẹ́ táwọn àfẹ̀míṣòfò máa ń ṣe.
target: We know that, despite all precautions, it is not always possible to prevent ‘unexpected events,’ including acts of violence and terror.

input: Síbẹ̀, àá máa báa lọ láti tu ara wa nínú lẹ́nì kìíní-kejì, pàápàá ìdílé arábìnrin tí ọ̀fọ̀ ṣẹ̀.
target: However, we continue to comfort one another, particularly the family of the sister who was killed.

input: Àdúrà wa ni pé kí Jèhófà tu gbogbo àwọn tó ń ṣọ̀fọ̀ nínú, kó sì fún wọn ní àláàfíà rẹ̀.
target: Our prayer is for Jehovah to grant inner peace to those who are grieving this painful loss.

input: Àá máa bá a lọ láti wà lójúfò, àá sì máa ṣọ́ra, síbẹ̀ a ò ní jẹ́ kí ìbẹ̀rù bò wá mọ́lẹ̀, àá sì máa fìtara wàásù nìṣó.—Oníwàásù 911 Róòmù 1513 Fílípì 46, 7.
target: We will also continue to take practical steps and not allow undue anxiety to overtake us while moving forward with our witnessing efforts.—Ecclesiastes 911 Romans 1513 Philippians 46, 7.

input: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì tún kọ lẹ́tà sí gbogbo àwọn ìjọ tó wà lórílẹ̀-èdè Finland láti tu àwọn ará nínú.
target: To provide emotional and spiritual comfort, the branch office sent a letter to all congregations in Finland.

input: Láfikún sí èyí, ẹ̀ka ọ́fììsì tún ṣètò ìpàdé àkànṣe láti pèsè ìṣírí fún nǹkan bí 135 arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin wa tó ń ìwàásù níbi tí èrò pọ̀ sí ní Turku.
target: The branch also organized a special meeting to provide encouragement for the 135 brothers and sisters who assist with the metropolitan public witnessing in Turku.

input: Àwọn aṣáájú ọ̀nà yìí fi hàn pé àwọn jẹ́ onígboyà bí wọ́n ṣe pinnu pé àwọn á máa wàásù nìṣó níbi tí èrò pọ̀ sí.
target: The pioneers have shown a courageous spirit and are eager to continue public witnessing.

input: Ẹ̀rù ba ọ̀pọ̀ èèyàn tó ń gbé ní Turku gan-an torí ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ yìí, ìdí sì ni pé wọ́n gbà pé orílẹ̀-èdè Finland jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára orílẹ̀-èdè tó ní ààbò jù lọ.
target: Many living in Turku have been deeply disturbed by the fact that the attack took place in Finland, a country often described as one of the safest in the world.

input: Láàrọ̀ ọjọ́ kẹjì tí ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ náà wáyé, ńṣe làwọn ará ń bá ìwàásù wọn lọ láti ilé-dé-ilé.Wọ́n ń tu àwọn èèyàn nínú, wọ́n sì ń fún wọn níṣìírí.
target: As early as the day after the attack, our brothers listened empathetically and offered spiritual comfort while witnessing in the market square and in the door-to-door ministry.

input: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa ní Finland dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ ẹgbẹ́ ará kárí ayé fún àdúrà yín àti ìtìlẹ́yìn yín.
target: The branch office in Finland is grateful to the global brotherhood for the many prayers and messages of support.

input: Pétérù 217 59 Àmọ́ ọpẹ́ wa tó ga jù lọ sọ́dọ̀ Jèhófà, Ọlọ́run tí ń pèsè ìfaradà àti ìtùnú.—Róòmù 155.
target: Peter 217 59 Most of all, we unitedly thank Jehovah, the God who supplies endurance and comfort.—Romans 155.

input: Tayọ̀tayọ̀ làwọn ará lọ́kùnrin lóbìnrin ní Jọ́jíà fi kí àwọn àlejò tó wá láti orílẹ̀-èdè méjìdínlógún 18 káàbọ̀ síbi àkànṣe àpéjọ Jẹ́ Onígboyà
target: Brothers and sisters in Georgia welcomed attendees from 18 countries to the Be Courageous

input: tó wáyé ní Tbilisi, olú-ìlú Jọ́jíà, ní July 20-22, 2018.
target: Special Convention held in the capital, Tbilisi, on July 20-22, 2018.

input: Ìgbà àkọ́kọ́ rèé tí àkànṣe àpéjọ máa wáyé ní Jọ́jíà, ọpọ̀ àsọyé tó ń gbéni ró, tó sì dá lórí Bíbélì ni wọ́n gbọ́ níbẹ̀, àwọn ará fìfẹ́ gba àwọn ará wọn lálejò, wọ́n sì ṣàfihàn àṣà ìbílẹ̀ wọn àti ìtàn orílẹ̀-èdè náà.
target: This theocratic event, the first ever in Georgia, was marked by rich spiritual food, warm hospitality, and displays of the region’s vibrant culture and enduring history.

input: Ibi tí wọ́n ti ṣe àpéjọ náà ni Olympic Palace, gbọ̀ngàn ìṣeré kan tó wà nílùú Tbilisi, iye àwọn tó sì péjọ síbẹ̀ jẹ́ ẹgbẹ̀rún méje ó lé méjì 7,002.
target: The convention originated from the Olympic Palace, an arena located in Tbilisi, with a peak attendance of 7,002.

input: Wọ́n ta àtagbà ìtòlẹ́sẹẹsẹ àpéjọ náà sí ibi ọgọ́rin 80 ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀ káàkiri orílẹ̀-èdè náà, èyí mú kí àpapọ̀ àwọn tó gbádùn àpéjọ náà lé ní ẹgbẹ̀rún mọ́kànlélógún àti ọgọ́rùn-ún márùn-ún 21,500.
target: The program was streamed to approximately 80 other locations throughout the country, bringing the total attendance to over 21,500.

input: Ọ̀kan lára ohun mánigbàgbé tó wáyé ní àpéjọ náà ni àwọn igba ó lé mẹ́jọ 208 tó ṣe ìrìbọmi tí wọ́n sì di Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà.
target: A highlight of the convention was the baptism of 208 new brothers and sisters.

input: Yàtọ̀ sí àwọn àsọyé tó dá lórí Bíbélì tí wọ́n gbọ́, àwọn tó wá láti orílẹ̀-èdè míì gbádùn bí àwọn ará Jọ́jíà ṣe ṣàfihàn àṣà ìbílẹ̀ wọn.
target: In addition to the spiritual program, the delegates enjoyed exhibitions of Georgian culture.

input: Àwọn ará ní Jọ́jíà jó ijó ìbílẹ̀ fún wọn, wọ́n kọrin ilẹ̀ wọn, wọ́n tún ṣe oúnjẹ ìbílẹ̀ wọn, wọ́n sì mú àwọn àlejò náà rìn yí ká àwọn ibi àtijọ́ nílùú Tbilisi.
target: Local Witnesses treated the visitors to performances of ethnic dances and music, tastes of the local cuisine, and tours of the ancient city of Tbilisi.

input: Tamaz Khutsishvili tó jẹ́ aṣojú ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì Jọ́jíà sọ pé Kì í kúkú ṣe pé a lómìnira ẹ̀sìn lọ títí lórílẹ̀-èdè wa.
target: Tamaz Khutsishvili, a representative at the branch office in Georgia,The landscape of religious freedom in our country has not always been so favorable.

input: Àmọ́ lọ́tẹ̀ yìí, àwọn aláṣẹ ìlú fọwọ́ sowọ́ pọ̀ pẹ̀lú wa, òun ló jẹ́ ká láǹfààní láti gba àwọn ará wa tó pọ̀ tó yìí lálejò ká lè jọ gbádùn àpéjọ yìí ní ìrọwọ́rọsẹ̀.A ò lè gbàgbé láé —Róòmù 157.
target: But in this case, with the fine cooperation of the local authorities, it was an unforgettable experience to have the opportunity to welcome so many of our brothers and sisters to enjoy this peaceful event with us.—Romans 157.

input: Ní July 1948, àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ṣe àpéjọ kan ní ìlú Kassel lórílẹ̀-èdè Jámánì.Àpéjọ yìí ni àpéjọ térò tíì pọ̀ jù táwa Ẹlẹ́rìí ṣe nílẹ̀ Yúróòpù lẹ́yìn tí Ogun Àgbáyé Kejì jà.
target: In July 1948, in the German city of Kassel, Jehovah’s Witnesses held what was the largest gathering of Witnesses in Europe in the aftermath of World War II.

input: Àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà wá ṣe ètò ìpàtẹ kan nílùú Kassel láti fi rántí bí àpéjọ náà ṣe wáyé ní àádọ́rin 70 ọdún sẹ́yìn.
target: Jehovah’s Witnesses held an exhibition in Kassel on the 70th anniversary of that convention.

input: Ní gbogbo ọjọ́ méjìlá 12 tí wọ́n fi ṣe ìpàtẹ yìí, àwọn tó lé ní ẹgbẹ̀rún méjì 2,000 ló wá síbẹ̀.
target: Over the 12 days of the exhibition, more than 2,000 people attended.

input: Kódà iléeṣẹ́ tẹlifíṣọ̀n kan gbé ètò náà sáfẹ́fẹ́, ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn oníwèé ìròyìn ló sì kọ̀ròyìn nípa rẹ̀.
target: The event was also covered by a local German television station and several local newspapers.

input: Àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà tó wà níbi àpéjọ ọdún 1948 sọ ìrírí wọn.
target: Jehovah’s Witnesses who attended the convention in 1948 share their memories.

input: Mánigbàgbé ni àpéjọ tó wáyé lọ́jọ́ kìíní àná ní Kassel torí pé àwọn 23,150 ló pé jọ, tí ẹgbẹ̀rún kan ó lé igba 1,200 sì ṣèrìbọmi.
target: The historical Kassel convention had a peak attendance of 23,150 people, including 1,200 who were baptized.

input: Bákan náà, ọ̀pọ̀ nínú àwọn tó sọ̀rọ̀ ní àpéjọ yẹn àtàwọn tó pé jọ ló jẹ́ àwọn tójú wọn ti rí màbo ní àgọ́ ìṣẹ́niníṣẹ̀ẹ́.Lára àwọn tó sọ̀rọ̀ ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ níbi ètò ìpàtẹ náà, ìyẹn Ọ̀mọ̀wé Gunnar Richter kan sárá sáwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà.
target: Notably, most of the speakers and many attendees were concentration camp survivors.

input: Òun ni alábòójútó ibi ìrántí tí wọ́n ṣe fáwọn tójú wọn rí màbo ní àgọ́ ìṣẹ́niníṣẹ̀ẹ́ Breitenau, nínú àlàyé rẹ̀, ó sọ bí ìjọba Násì ṣe fojú àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà han èèmọ̀.
target: In acknowledgment of this, the exhibition’s opening ceremony included a speech from the director of the Breitenau Concentration Camp Memorial Site, Dr.Gunnar Richter, who explained how Jehovah’s Witnesses suffered under the Nazi regime.

input: Nígbà táwọn ará ń ṣètò àpéjọ yẹn nígbà yẹn lọ́hùn-ún, pápá kan tí onírúurú bọ́ǹbù ti gbẹ́ kòtò gìrìwò sí láwọn aláṣẹ rí yọ̀ǹda fún wọn.
target: When our brothers organized the convention, the authorities could only make available a meadow pockmarked with large bomb craters.

input: Arákùnrin Kurt Rex tí àpéjọ náà ṣojú rẹ̀ sọ iṣẹ́ àṣelàágùn táwọn ará ṣe fún nǹkan bí ọ̀sẹ̀ mẹ́rin kí wọ́n lè tún pápá náà ṣe, ó sọ pé Iṣẹ́ náà gbomi gan-an.
target: Brother Kurt Rex, who was present for the convention,The work was physically very demanding.

input: A kọ́kọ́ fi garawa gbọ́n àwọn omi tó dá rogún sínú àwọn kòtò gìrìwò náà.
target: We first had to use buckets to get rid of the water that had filled the bomb craters.

input: Lẹ́yìn ìyẹn la ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí í kó òkúta láti àwọn àwókù ilé tí bọ́ǹbù ti bà jẹ́ ká lè fi dí àwọn kòtò náà.
target: Only after this was it possible to begin with the real work and fill the craters with stones and rubble from the destroyed houses in the neighborhood.

input: A ò ní ẹ̀rọ tó ń ki ilẹ̀, torí náà fúnra wa la tún bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí í ki ilẹ̀ náà kó lè tẹ́jú pẹrẹsẹ.
target: Leveling the ground was also hard manual labor, because we did not have any access to large machines or instruments for leveling.

input: Díẹ̀ lára àwọn tó ju 23,000 tó wá sí àpéjọ náà.
target: A portion of the over 23,000 attendees of the convention.
Déètì June 14 sí 16, 2019

input: Olympic Stadium in Berlin, Germany
target: Ibi Tá A Ti Ṣe É Pápá ìṣeré Olympic Stadium ní ìlú Berlin, Jámánì

input: English, German, Russian
target: Èdè Gẹ̀ẹ́sì, German, Russian

input: Brazil, Britain, Canada, Ecuador, Finland, Greece, Poland, Scandinavia, Slovenia, United States
target: Áwọn Ẹ̀ka Ọ́fíísì Tó Wá Brazil, Britain, Kánádà, Ecuador, Finland, Gíríìsì, Poland, Scandinavia, Slovenia, Amẹ́ríkà

input: Delegates toured the famous Pergamon Museum in Berlin as part of the activities surrounding the convention.
target: Ìrírí Ara ètò tí wọ́n ṣe fún àpéjọ náà ni pé káwọn ará lọ sí ibì kan tó lórukọ gan-an tí wọ́n máa ń kó àwọn ohun ìṣẹ̀ǹbáyé sí, ìyẹn Pergamon Museum nílùú Berlin.

input: After observing our brothers as they visited the museum,Many people are hopeless because they do not have any faith.
target: Ọ̀kan lára àwọn ẹ̀ṣọ́ ibẹ̀ kíyè si àwọn ará tó wá sí àpéjọ náà, ó sọ pé Ọ̀pọ̀ èèyàn ò nírètí torí pé wọn ò ní ìgbàgbọ́ kankan.

input: It’s very obvious, however, that you do have faith and love among yourselves.With visitors like you, time flies by and I’m happy to work overtime.
target: Àmọ́ ní tiyín, ó hàn kedere pé ẹ nígbàgbọ́, ìfẹ́ sì wà láàárín yín.Ẹ̀ṣọ́ míì sọ pé Irú àwọn àlejò bíi tiyin kì í jẹ́ kéèyàn mọ̀ ọ́n lára pé àkókò ti ń lọ, kódà ẹ máa ń mú kó wù mí láti pẹ́ sí i níbi iṣẹ́.

input: Ó tó igba 200 èèyàn tó rí àmì ìrántí náà.
target: He never returned home.

input: Àgọ́ ìṣẹ́niníṣẹ̀ẹ́ yẹn ni Max Eckert kú sí.Bó tiẹ̀ jẹ́ pé ìwọ̀nba èèyàn ló mọ Arákùnrin Eckert kó tó kú, ó ti wá di ọkùnrin tí ọ̀pọ̀ èèyàn mọ̀ sí ẹni tí ìgbàgbọ́ rẹ̀ fẹsẹ̀ múlẹ̀ ṣinṣin.
target: Though Brother Eckert died in relative obscurity, he is now recognized publicly as a man of unshakable faith.

input: Fọ́tò àgọ́ ìṣẹ́niníṣẹ̀ẹ́ ìlú Dachau àtijọ́ tí wọ́n yà láìpẹ́ yìí rèé, ibẹ̀ ni Max Eckert ti ṣẹ̀wọ̀n kí wọ́n tó mú un lọ sí Mauthausen.
target: Recent photograph of the former Dachau concentration camp, where Max Eckert was imprisoned before he was sent to Mauthausen.

input: Àgọ́ ìṣẹ́niníṣẹ̀ẹ́ Mauthausen, tí Max Eckert kú sí.
target: Mauthausen concentration camp, where Max Eckert died.

input: Àkọsílẹ̀ nípa Arákùnrin Eckert fi hàn pé ó pẹ́ tó ti jẹ́ adúróṣinṣin sí Ọlọ́run.
target: Records disclose Brother Eckert’s legacy of integrity.

input: Ní ọdún 1935, wọ́n ní kí òun àti ìyàwó rẹ̀ sanwó ìtanràn torí pé wọ́n ń sọ ohun tí wọ́n gbà gbọ́ fún àwọn èèyàn.
target: He and his wife were fined as early as 1935 for speaking to others about their faith.

input: Lẹ́yìn yẹn, iṣẹ́ bọ́ lọ́wọ́ rẹ̀ torí pé ó kọ̀ láti gbé àsíá tó ní àmì òṣèlú swastika.
target: He later lost his job because he refused to carry a flag with a swastika.

input: Ní ọdún 1937, ó pẹ̀lú nǹkan bí ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́fà 600 Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà onígboyà tí wọ́n jù sẹ́wọ̀n ní ìlú Dachau.
target: In 1937, he became one of the approximately 600 dauntless Jehovah’s Witnesses interned in Dachau.

input: Ní ohun tó lé ní ọdún méjì lẹ́yìn náà, wọ́n gbé e lọ sí ìlú Mauthausen níbi tí, ó kéré tán, ọ̀kẹ́ mẹ́rin ààbọ̀ 90,000 ẹlẹ́wọ̀n kú sí torí ipò tó burú jáì.
target: Over two years later, he was transferred to Mauthausen where at least 90,000 prisoners died from the brutal conditions.

input: Ní February 21, ọdún 1940, wọ́n tẹ wáyà ránṣẹ́ sí ìyàwó Arákùnrin Eckert, èyí tí wọ́n fi túfọ̀ ọkọ rẹ̀ fún un tẹ̀gàntẹ̀gàn pé Ọkọ rẹ kú lónìí ní àgọ́ ìṣẹ́niníṣẹ̀ẹ́.
target: On February 21, 1940, Brother Eckert’Husband died today in the camp.

input: Tó o bá fẹ́ àlàyé sí i, kàn sí àwọn ọlọ́pàá.Ọmọ ọdún mẹ́tàlélógójì 43 ní nígbà tó kú.
target: For further details contact the police.He was 43 years old.

input: Wo àpótí náà Ohun Tí Àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà Kojú Lábẹ́ Ìjọba Mẹ́ta ní Jámánì.Wọ́n bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí í ṣàfihàn yìí lọ́jọ́ Sunday, April 22, 2018, níbi ìkóhun ìṣẹ̀ǹbáyé sí ní àgọ́ ìṣẹ́niníṣẹ̀ẹ́ Ravensbrück tó wà nílùú Fürstenberg, ní Jámánì.
target: See box Persecution and Legal Challenges Under Three German Governments.The exhibition debuted on Sunday, April 22, 2018, at the Ravensbrück Concentration Camp Memorial Site in Fürstenberg, Germany.

input: Lọ́dún 2019, wọ́n máa gbé àfihàn yìí lọ sí àwọn ìlú míì bí Erfurt, Rostock, àti Potsdam.Nílùú Potsdam, ilé ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀ Brandenburg ni wọ́n ti máa ṣe àfihàn náà.
target: During 2019, the exhibition will be featured in the German cities of Erfurt, Rostock, as well as in Potsdam, where it will be hosted in the parliament building for the state of Brandenburg.

input: Ìtàn ìgbésí ayé Adolf Graf níbi àfihàn náà, òun náà wà lára àwọn tó jìyà lábẹ́ ìjọba Násì àti Kọ́múníìsì.
target: A biography of one of the double victims, Adolf Graf, included in the exhibition.

input: Àfihàn náà sọ ìtàn méjìlá 12 lára àwọn ará wa tí wọ́n jìyà lábẹ́ ìjọba Násì àti ìjọba Kọ́múníìsì ti GDR.
target: The exhibition features 12 biographical displays of brothers and sisters who were double victims, having been persecuted by both the Nazis and the Communists of the GDR.

input: Ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn èèyàn lásìkò yẹn ni wọ́n fi sẹ́wọ̀n nítorí ẹ̀yà tí wọ́n ti wá, ẹgbẹ́ òṣèlú tí wọ́n wà tàbí ìwà ọ̀daràn tí wọ́n hù.Àmọ́ àfihàn yẹn jẹ́ kó ṣe kedere pé wọ́n ju àwọn ará wa sẹ́wọ̀n nítorí ohun tí wọ́n gbà gbọ́.
target: The exhibition demonstrates that, unlike the tens of thousands who were imprisoned because of their ethnicity, political views, or perceived crimes, our brothers were imprisoned because of the conviction of their faith.

input: Nígbà tí wọ́n ń ṣayẹyẹ ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ ètò náà, òpìtàn kan tó ń jẹ́ Ọ̀mọ̀wé Detlef Garbe sọ pé Àwọn ọlọ́pàá Násì kórìíra àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà torí pé ìgbàgbọ́ àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí yẹn lágbára, wọ́n wà níṣọ̀kan, wọn ò sì bọ́hùn láìka ohun tí wọ́n ṣe fún wọn sí.
target: In a speech during the opening ceremony of the exhibition, historian Dr.From the beginning, the unwavering faith and confidence, the spirit of unity, and the uncompromising stand of Jehovah’s Witnesses made them a target of particular SS hatred.

input: Jákèjádò ilẹ̀ Jámánì làwọn àlùfáà ṣọ́ọ̀ṣì ti ń wá bí wọ́n á ṣe fòfin de iṣẹ́ àwọn Akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ Bíbélì, ìyẹn àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà.
target: Throughout Germany, the clergy attempted to take legal action against Jehovah’s Witnesses, then known as the Bible Students.

input: Láti nǹkan bí ọdún 1922 ni wọ́n ti ń fẹ̀sùn kan àwọn ará wa pé wọ́n ń ta ìwé láìgbàṣẹ, wọn ò sì san owó orí.Ìyà burúkú ni wọ́n máa ń fi jẹ àwọn tí wọ́n bá dá lẹ́bi.
target: As early as 1922, brothers were charged with illegal peddling and refusal to pay peddling taxes, and severe sentences were meted out to those found guilty.

input: Kódà láàárín ọdún 1927 àti 1930, ó fẹ́rẹ̀ẹ́ tó ẹgbẹ̀rún márùn-ún 5,000 ẹjọ́ àwọn ará wa tí wọ́n gbé lọ sílé ẹjọ́.
target: Between 1927 and 1930, nearly 5,000 court cases involving the Bible Students were instituted.

input: Lọ́dún 1928, àwọn àlùfáà ṣọ́ọ̀ṣì mú kí ẹ̀ka iléeṣẹ́ ìjọba tó ń rí sí ọ̀rọ̀ owó orí yọ àjọ Watch Tower Bible and Tract Society kúrò lára àwọn àjọ tí ìjọba fọwọ́ sí pé kí wọ́n má san owó orí.
target: In 1928, at the instigation of church leaders, the State Revenue Department retracted the tax exemption status for the Watch Tower Bible and Tract Society.

input: Àwọn oníṣọ́ọ̀ṣì yẹn tiẹ̀ sọ ní gbangba pé àwọn fẹ́ mú kó nira fáwọn Akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ Bíbélì láti máa wàásù.
target: The churches later openly admitted their goal was to negatively impact the Bible Students’ preaching work.

input: Àwọn ará wa gbé ọ̀rọ̀ náà lọ sílé ẹjọ́, ilé ẹjọ́ sì dá wọn láre.
target: The brothers took the matter to trial and the courts later ruled in their favor.

input: Ní November 1931, àwọn ọlọ́pàá nílùú Munich fòfin de ìwé àwọn Akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ Bíbélì ní agbègbè Bavaria.
target: In November 1931, Munich police banned the literature of the Bible Students in the region of Bavaria.

input: Nígbà tó di February 1932, ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀ Upper Bavaria fọwọ́ sí ìfòfindè náà, àwọn ará wa sì pe ẹjọ́ kòtẹ́milọ́rùn.Àmọ́ nígbà tó di March ọdún yẹn, Ilé Iṣẹ́ Tó Ń Bójú Tó Ọ̀rọ̀ Abẹ́lé ní ìpínlẹ̀ Bavaria fọwọ́ rọ́ ẹjọ́ àwọn Akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ Bíbélì náà dà nù, wọ́n ní kòlẹ́sẹ̀ nílẹ̀.
target: In February 1932, the government of Upper Bavaria upheld this ban, and in March of that year, the Bavarian Ministry of the Interior rejected the Bible Students’ appeal considering it without foundation.

input: Ni January 30, 1933, Adolf Hitler di alákòóso ìlú Jámánì, kò sì fàyè gba àwọn èèyàn láti máa pàdé pọ̀ tàbí kí wọ́n máa tẹ ìwé jáde.
target: On January 30, 1933, Adolf Hitler became chancellor of Germany and immediately began restricting freedoms of assembly and press.

input: Nígbà táwọn ará wa ń pín ìwé Crisis lákànṣe láti April 8 sí 16, ṣe ni ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀ Bavaria fòfin de iṣẹ́ wa.
target: During a special preaching campaign to distribute the booklet Crisis from April 8 to 16, the activities of Jehovah’s Witnesses were banned in Bavaria.

input: Lẹ́yìn ìwàásù àkànṣe yẹn, àwọn ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀ míì náà fòfin de àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà.
target: After the campaign, other states also banned the Witnesses’ work.

input: Ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn àlùfáà ṣọ́ọ̀ṣì ló gbárùkù ti Hitler bó ṣe ń ṣe inúnibíni sáwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà.
target: Many of the clergy supported Hitler and his persecution of Jehovah’s Witnesses.

input: Àìmọye ìgbà làwọn agbófinró tú ilé àwọn ará wa, ọ̀pọ̀ nínú wọn ni wọ́n sì mú.
target: The homes of brothers were regularly being searched, and many Witnesses were arrested.

input: Bó tiẹ̀ jẹ́ pé ìjọba yìí tí wọ́n tún ń pè ní ìjọba East Germany sọ pé ìṣàkóso àwọn kì í ṣe bóofẹ́ bóokọ̀ bíi táwọn Násì, síbẹ̀ àwọn náà fojú pọ́n àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà bíi ti ìjọba Násì.
target: Also known as East Germany, the republic identified itself as anti-fascist, yet their treatment of Jehovah’s Witnesses was similar to that under the previous dictatorial government.

input: Láàárín ọdún 1950 àti 1985, èyí tó jú ẹgbẹ̀rún márùn-ún àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí ní wọ́n fẹ̀sùn kàn pé wọ́n ń ṣiṣẹ́ lòdì sí ìjọba, wọ́n ń sọ̀rọ̀ lòdì sí ìjọba, wọ́n sì ń ṣagbátẹrù ogun.Ẹ̀wọ̀n ọdún márùn-ún àtààbọ̀ ni wọ́n sábà máa ń bù lé àwọn ará wa lọ́kùnrin àti lóbìnrin.
target: Between 1950 and 1985, more than 5,000 Witnesses were found guilty by the courts of anti-state activities, state-threatening communication, and warmongering.The average prison sentence for our brothers and sisters was five and a half years.

input: Àwọn ará tó jẹ́ méjìlélọ́gọ́ta ni wọ́n kú sẹ́wọ̀n lábẹ́ ìjọba GDR.
target: A total of 62 Witnesses died in custody in the GDR.

input: Àjọ Munich Documentation Centre for the History of National Socialism ṣàfihàn fọ́tò àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà àti àkọsílẹ̀ ohun tí ìjọba Násì fojú wọn rí.Ọgọ́ta 60 làwọn nǹkan tó dà bíi pátákó tí wọ́n fi ṣàfihàn náà, wọ́n sì gbé wọn kọ́ sára ògiri.
target: The exhibit at the Munich Documentation Centre for the History of National Socialism featured 60 panels that displayed documents and photos chronicling Nazi persecution of Jehovah’s Witnesses.

input: Àjọ kan tí wọ́n ń pè ní Munich Documentation Centre for the History of National Socialism ṣètò àkànṣe kan ní September 26, 2018, sí January 6, 2019, káwọn èèyàn lè mọ ohun ti ìjọba Násì fojú àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà rí lásìkò tí wọ́n ń ṣàkóso.
target: From September 26, 2018, to January 6, 2019, the Munich Documentation Centre for the History of National Socialism hosted a special exhibit designed to raise the public’s awareness of the experiences of Jehovah’s Witnesses during the Nazi era.

input: Kò ní yà yín lẹ́nu pé orí ilẹ̀ kan náà tí oríléeṣẹ́ ẹgbẹ́ òṣèlú Násì wà nígbà yẹn lọ́hùn-ún ni àjọ yìí kọ́ ọ́fíìsì wọn sí.
target: The Centre shares the same property as the former headquarters of the Nazi party.

input: Ìrírí Martin àti Gertrud Pötzinger wà nínú ọ̀kan lára ohun tí wọ́n gbé kọ́ náà, wọ́n sọ bí ìjọba ṣe mú àwọn méjèèjì, tí wọ́n sì fi wọ́n sí àgọ́ ìṣẹ́niníṣẹ̀ẹ́ tó yàtọ̀ síra.Bẹ́ẹ̀ sì rèé, kò ju oṣù mélòó kan péré tí wọ́n ṣègbéyàwó.
target: One panel related the experience of Martin and Gertrud Pötzinger, who were arrested and sent to separate concentration camps after just a few months of marriage.

input: Ọdún mẹ́sàn-án gbáko ni wọn ò fi fojú kan ara wọn.
target: They did not see each other for nine years.

input: Àwọn méjèèjì la ìpọ́njú yẹn já, Arákùnrin Pötzinger sí wà di ọ̀kan lára Ìgbìmọ̀ Olùdarí Àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà nígbà tó yá.
target: Both survived, and Brother Pötzinger later served as a member of the Governing Body of Jehovah’s Witnesses.

input: Ìjọba Násì pa Therese Kühner ní October 6, 1944.
target: Therese Kühner was executed by the Nazis on October 6, 1944.

input: Òmíràn ni ti Arábìnrin kan tó ń jẹ́ Therese Kühner.Ọdún 1929 ló di Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà, Akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ Bíbélì là ń pè wọ́n nígbà yẹn.
target: Another panel featured the story of Therese Kühner, who became one of Jehovah’s Witnesses then known as the International Bible Students in 1929.

input: Nígbà tí ìjọba Jámánì fòfin de iṣẹ́ àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà, arábìnrin yìí yọ̀ǹda pé káwọn ará máa ṣèpàdé nínú ilé òun láìjẹ́ kí ẹnikẹ́ni mọ̀.Yàtọ̀ síyẹn, wọ́n tún máa ń dọ́gbọ́n tẹ àwọn ìwé wa nínú ilé rẹ̀.
target: When Germany banned the Witnesses, secret religious meetings were held in her home and she began covertly printing Witness literature using a hand-cranked mimeograph machine.

input: October 6, 1944 ni wọ́n pa á.
target: She was executed on October 6, 1944.

input: Ohun míì téèyàn máa rí kà ni báwọn ará wa ṣe pinnu pé àwọn ò ní dá sọ́rọ̀ ìṣèlú àti ogun, tí wọ́n sì kọ̀ láti bẹ́rí fún Hitler.Ìpinnu wọn yẹn ló mú kí ìjọba dìídì dájú sọ wọ́n, tí wọ́n sì fimú wọn dánrin.
target: Other displays highlighted the politically neutral stand of our brothers who refused to give the Hitler salute—an act that made them special targets of the regime’s unrelenting hate.

input: Hitler àti ẹgbẹ́ òṣèlú rẹ̀ ni ò sí mọ́, àmọ́ àwọn ará wa ṣì wà nílẹ̀ Jámánì digbí, kódà wọ́n lé ní ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà ọgọ́rùn-ún kan àti márùndínláàádọ́rin 165,000.
target: Hitler and his party no longer exist, but our brothers now number over 165,000 in Germany.

input: A dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ Jèhófà tó sọ ìmọ̀ràn wọn dòfo, torí pé báwọn èèyàn tiẹ̀ ń pọ́n wa lójú, Ọlọ́run mú ká nírètí tí kì í yọrí sí ìjákulẹ̀.—Róòmù 53-5.
target: We are grateful to Jehovah, who turns our tribulation into hope that does not lead to disappointment.—Romans 53-5.

input: Ọjọ́ ọ̀hún rèé bí àná, ìyẹn ní ọgọ́rin 80 ọdún sẹ́yìn, nígbà tí ìjọba gbé Arákùnrin Minos Kokkinakis wọ̀ọ́ sínú ọkọ̀ ojú omi tí wọ́n fi máa ń kó àwọn ẹlẹ́wọ̀n.Lọkọ̀ náà bá forí lé erékùṣù kan tí wọ́n ń pè ní Amorgós láàárín agbami òkun Aegean Sea, lórílẹ̀-èdè Gíríìsì.
target: Eighty years ago, a prison boat unloaded Minos Kokkinakis onto the Greek island of Amorgós in the Aegean Sea, where he would spend the next 13 months in exile.

input: Ilé ẹjọ́ kan ló dá a lẹ́bi pé ó rú òfin tó ní káwọn èèyàn má ṣe bá ẹlòmíì sọ̀rọ̀ ẹ̀sìn, ilé ẹjọ́ ò sì gbọ́ tẹ́nu ẹ̀ kí wọ́n tó dá a lẹ́bi.
target: Without a trial, a Greek court had convicted Brother Kokkinakis of violating a new law that forbade proselytism.

input: Eré la pè é, bí ìjọba ṣe bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí í nawọ́ gán àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà nìyẹn o.Láàárín ọdún 1938 sí 1992, wọ́n mú ẹgbẹ̀rún mọ́kàndínlógún, ọgọ́rùn-ún kan ó lè mẹ́tàdínláàádọ́ta 19,147 àwọn ará wa.
target: His arrest was the first of 19,147 arrests of Jehovah’s Witnesses from 1938 to 1992 for breaking the law that had been imposed by Greek dictator Ioannis Metaxas.

input: Láwọn ọdún yẹn, àwọn ará wa lọ́kùnrin àti lóbìnrin ò dẹ́kun àtimáa wàásù ìhìn rere Ìjọba Ọlọ́run bí ìjọba tiẹ̀ ń fìyà jẹ wọ́n, tí wọ́n ń mú wọn, tí wọ́n sì ń jù wọ́n sẹ́wọ̀n.
target: During those decades, hundreds of Greek Witnesses braved physical violence, arrests, and prison terms for preaching the good news.

input: Ẹni ọgbọ̀n 30 ọdún ni Arákùnrinr Kokkinakis nígbà tọ́rọ̀ yìí wáyé, àtìgbà yẹn náà ló ti ń jà fún ẹ̀tọ́ tó ní láti wàásù, odindi àádọ́ta 50 ló sì fi ja ìjà yìí.
target: At about the age of 30, Brother Kokkinakis began a 50-year legal battle for the freedom to share his faith.

input: Ó lè ní ọgọ́ta 60 ìgbà tí wọ́n mú un, ó sì lé lọ́dún mẹ́fà tó lò lẹ́wọ̀n àti láwọn erékùṣù tí wọ́n ń kó àwọn ẹlẹ́wọ̀n sí.Wọ́n fi ojú òun àtàwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà míì rí màbo ní gbogbo àsìkò yẹn.
target: Arrested more than 60 times, he spent over six years in prisons and on penal islands, where he and other Witness prisoners endured unspeakable conditions.

input: Wọ́n tún mú un nígbà tó pé ẹni ọdún mẹ́tàdínlọ́gọ́rin 77.Ó pẹjọ́ kòtẹ́milọ́rùn àmọ́ ilé ẹjọ́ kò gba tiẹ̀ rò, ló bá gbọ́rọ̀ náà lọ sí Ilé Ẹjọ́ Gíga Jù Lọ ní Gíríìsì.
target: At age 77, he unsuccessfully contested his final arrest, eventually taking his case all the way to the Supreme Court of Greece.

input: Nígbà táwọn yẹn tún da ẹjọ́ ẹ̀ nù, Arákùnrin Kokkinakis gbé ẹjọ́ náà lọ sí Ilé Ẹjọ́ Ẹ̀tọ́ Ọmọnìyàn ti Ilẹ̀ Yúróòpù ECHR, pé orílẹ̀-èdè Gíríìsì ń fi ẹ̀tọ́ òun du òun bí wọn ò ṣe jẹ́ kóun sin Ọlọ́run bó ṣe fẹ́.
target: Brother Kokkinakis then applied to the European Court of Human Rights ECHR, arguing that Greece had denied him religious freedom.

input: Nígbà tí ilé ẹjọ́ yẹn máa kéde ìdájọ́ wọn lọ́dún 1993, ṣe ni wọ́n dá Arákùnrin Minos Kokkinakis, ẹni ọdún mẹ́rìnlélọ́gọ́rin 84 láre.
target: In 1993, 84-year-old Minos Kokkinakis won a resounding legal victory, marking the first time the ECHR convicted a country of violating religious freedom.

input: Ẹ wá rídìí tá a fi ń dáwọ̀ọ́ ìdùnnú, torí pé ọdún 2018 ló pé ọdún kẹẹ̀ẹ́dọ́gbọ̀n 25 tá a jagunmólú ẹjọ́ yẹn.
target: The year 2018 marked the 25th anniversary of this historic decision.

input: Àwa èèyàn Jèhófà níbi gbogbo láyé mọyì bí Arákùrin Kokkinakis ṣe ní ìgbàgbọ́, tí kò sì jẹ́ kí ẹnikẹ́ni ṣí òun lọ́wọ́ wíwàásù Ọ̀rọ̀ Ọlọ́run, ẹ̀kọ́ gidi nìyẹn jẹ́ fáwọn tó kojú àtakò àti inúnibíni lẹ́nu iṣẹ́ ìwàásù.
target: Brother Kokkinakis’ faith and persistence in the ministry is an outstanding example for our brothers and sisters who are facing opposition to their preaching work.

input: A ò jẹ́ gbàgbé ìtara rẹ̀ àti bó ṣe di ìgbàgbọ́ rẹ̀ mú ṣinṣin lójú inúnibíni.—Róòmù 18.
target: His integrity led to a powerful witness that still resonates today.—Romans 18.

input: ìpínrọ̀ 3 Minos Kokkinakis kú ní January 1999.

input: Lẹ́yìn òde ìlú Athens nílẹ̀ Gíríìsì, iná sọ nínú igbó, atẹ́gùn líle sì mú kó túbọ̀ ràn bí iná ọyẹ́.Iná yìí ṣèpalára fáwọn èèyàn, ó sì ba nǹkan jẹ́.
target: Wildfires, intensified by gale-force winds, have caused destruction to person and property outside of Athens, Greece.

input: Ó kéré tán, èèyàn mẹ́rìndínlọ́gọ́rin 76 ni ẹ̀mí wọn lọ sí i, àwọn ọgọ́sàn-an ó lé méje 187 ló sì fara pa níbi tíná ti ń jó.Iná yìí ni wọ́n gbà pé ó tíì ṣọṣẹ́ jù lórílẹ̀-èdè náà láti ohun tó lé lọ́dún mẹ́wàá sẹ́yìn.
target: At least 76 people have died and another 187 have been injured in the blazes, which are considered to be the deadliest to hit the country in over a decade.

input: Ìròyìn tá a gbọ́ láti ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà tó wà ní Gíríìsì ni pé ìkankan nínú àwọn arákùnrin wa ò fara pa, ìkankan nínú wọn ò sì kú.
target: The branch office of Jehovah’s Witnesses in Greece reports that none of our brothers have been injured or killed in this disaster.

input: Àmọ́ ó gba pé kí gbogbo àwọn ará wa tó wà níbi tí àjálù náà ti wáyé kó kúrò lágbègbè náà, àwọn ará tó sì wà láwọn ìjọ itòsí sì ti gbà wọ́n sílé.
target: However, all of our brothers in the affected areas had to evacuate and are currently being sheltered in the homes of those from neighboring congregations.

input: Yàtọ̀ síyẹn, ilé mẹ́rin tó jẹ́ tàwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ló bà jẹ́ gan-an, ilé kan tiẹ̀ wà tó bà jẹ́ kọjá àtúnṣe.
target: Additionally, four of the homes belonging to Witnesses sustained extensive damage and one was destroyed.

input: A ò dákẹ́ àdúrà lórí àwọn ará wa tí àjálù yìí ṣẹlẹ̀ sí àtàwọn ará wa tí ìfẹ́ ará mú kí wọ́n gba àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà bíi tiwọn sílé.
target: We are praying for our brothers who were affected by this disaster as well as those whose brotherly affection moved them to give shelter to their fellow Witnesses.

input: Jòhánù 13​34, 35 A mọ̀ pé Jèhófà á túbọ̀ máa gbé àwọn ará wa ró lásìkò wàhálà yìí.
target: John 1334, 35 We know that Jehovah will continue to sustain our brothers during this ordeal.

input: Ìrírí Òṣìṣẹ́ kan tọ́ máa ń ṣètó ìrìn àjò sọ pé Látìgbà tí mo ti bẹ̀rẹ̀ iṣẹ́ síṣètò ìrìn àjò, mí ò tíì rí ibikíbi láyé tí wọ́n ti ń ṣètò tó dáà bí eléyìí, kí wọ́n sì tún bójú tó àwọn arìnrìn àjò.
target: I’ve worked my whole life as a travel agent, and I have never seen anywhere in the world such a good way to organize and manage travelers.

input: Ńṣe ni mò ń wò yín lánàá, ẹ wú mi lórí gan-an
target: I watched you yesterday, and I could not believe it

input: Ẹ ṣètò ẹgbẹ̀rún méjì ó lé ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́fà 2,600 arìnrìn àjò láàárìn wákàtí díẹ̀ lọ́nà tó dáa ju ti àwọn akọ́ṣẹ́mọṣẹ́ lọ.
target: You organized 2,600 people within a few hours in a manner that is better than many professionals.

input: Èyí tó wú mi lórí jù ni ẹ̀rín músẹ́ tó wà lójú yín.
target: But the most wonderful part is your smile.

input: Kí n sọ̀ótọ́, ọ̀pọ̀ ọdún ni mo ti wà lẹ́nu iṣẹ́ yìí, mo sì máa ń mọ̀ tẹ́nì kan bá ń rẹ́rìn-ín látọkàn wá tàbí tó bá jẹ́ pé ẹ̀rín ẹ̀ ò dọ́kàn.
target: Believe me, I’ve worked for years in this field, and I can discern when someone smiles ‘professionally’ from when they smile from their heart.

input: Àmọ́, gbogbo yín lẹ̀ ń rẹ́rìn-ín látọkàn.
target: And you all smile from your heart.

input: Àwọn dókítà ṣèbẹ̀wò síbi ìpàtẹ wa níbi àpérò SIAARTI tí wọ́n ṣe ni erékùṣù Palermo Ọ̀pọ̀ dókítà ló ń dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ ètò wa torí ìsọfúnni tá a pèsè kárí ayé nípa onírúurú ìtọ́jú ìṣègùn àti iṣẹ́ abẹ láìfa ẹ̀jẹ̀ síni lára.
target: Medical professionals visit our booth at the SIAARTI conference in Palermo Many doctors have expressed appreciation for the worldwide network that our organization has established to provide information about medical and surgical treatment strategies to avoid blood transfusion.

input: Ẹ̀ka Tó Ń Pèsè Ìsọfúnni fún Àwọn Ilé Ìwòsàn lórílẹ̀-èdè Ítálì, tó wà ní ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà nílùú Róòmù wà lára ètò tá a dá sílẹ̀ kárí ayé.
target: Hospital Information Services Italy, located at the branch office of Jehovah’s Witnesses in Rome, is part of this worldwide network.

input: Ní October 10 sí 13, 2018, ẹgbẹ́ kan lórílẹ̀-èdè Ítálì tá a mọ̀ sí Italian Society of Anesthesia, Analgesia, Resuscitation, and Intensive Care SIAARTI ṣe àpérò kan nílùú Palermo ní erékùṣù Sísílì.
target: Late last year, representatives of Hospital Information Services Italy and local Hospital Liaison Committee members staffed an information booth at the National Congress of the Italian Society of Anesthesia, Analgesia, Resuscitation, and Intensive Care SIAARTI, which was held from October 10 to 13, 2018, in Palermo, Sicily.

input: A máa ń lo àǹfààní àwọn àpérò yìí láti pèsè àwọn ìsọfúnni tuntun nípa ìtọ́jú ìṣègùn láìlo ẹ̀jẹ̀ fún gbogbo dókítà tó nífẹ̀ẹ́ sí i.
target: Such conferences are opportunities to provide up-to-date information related to bloodless medicine to many interested medical professionals at one time.

input: Àwọn dókítà tó ń pa ìrora nígbà iṣẹ́ abẹ tí iye wọn tó ẹgbẹ̀rún méjì àti ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́jọ 2,800 ló wá síbi àpérò tí wọ́n ṣe nílùú Palermo.
target: The conference in Palermo was attended by 2,800 anesthesiologists.

input: Ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́ta àti ọgọ́rùn-ún márùn-ún 3,500 dókítà tó ń ṣiṣẹ́ abẹ ló wá síbi àpérò tí wọ́n ṣe nílùú Róòmù.Ó sì jọ pé àpérò àwọn dókítà tó ń ṣiṣẹ́ abẹ tó tíì gbòòrò jù lọ tí wọ́n ṣe lórílẹ̀-èdè Ítálì nìyẹn.
target: The conference in Rome, considered the largest surgical conference ever held in Italy, was attended by 3,500 surgeons.

input: Àwọn aṣojú láwọn ilé ìwòsàn tó lórúkọ ló pésẹ̀ síbi àpérò náà.
target: Representatives from a variety of respected medical institutions also attended.

input: Títí kan gbogbo àwọn tó wà nínú ẹgbẹ́ tá a mọ̀ sí Italian associations of surgeons àti American College of Surgeons ti orílẹ̀-èdè Ítálì.
target: This included members from all of the Italian associations of surgeons and from the Italy Chapter of the American College of Surgeons.

input: Ọ̀pọ̀ ilé iṣẹ́ ló sì ti ètò náà lẹ́yìn, irú bí Ilé Iṣẹ́ Ètò Ìlera.
target: Several national institutions, such as the Ministry of Health, backed the event.

input: Dókítà kan tó ń jẹ́ Vincenzo Scuderi láti Ilé Ìwòsàn Policlinico ti Catania ní erékùṣù Sísílì, wá síbi ìpàtẹ wa níbi àpérò tí wọ́n ṣe nílùú Palermo.
target: Anesthesiologist Vincenzo Scuderi, from the Policlinico Hospital of Catania in Sicily, visited our booth at the Palermo event.

input: Ní January 18, 2019, dókítà náà ṣe iṣẹ́ abẹ pàjáwìrì fún Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà kan tó ní àìsàn tí wọ́n ń pè ní aortic dissection.
target: On January 18, 2019, he performed emergency treatment on a Witness patient affected by an aortic dissection.

input: Dókítà náà ṣe iṣẹ́ abẹ tó díjú yìí láìlo ẹ̀jẹ̀.
target: He was able to complete the highly complex procedure without using blood.

input: Dókítà Scuderi ṣàlàyé pé Ìpàtẹ tẹ́ ẹ ṣe níbi àpérò SIAARTI lọ́dún 2018 ràn mí lọ́wọ́ gan-an.
target: Dr.Your booth at the SIAARTI 2018 Congress was instrumental.

input: Àwọn ìsọfúnni tẹ́ ẹ fún wa sì gbéṣẹ́ gan an.Ní báyìí, àwọn dókítà tó ju ẹgbẹ̀rún márùn-ún 5,000 lórílẹ̀-èdè Ítálì ti gbà láti máa tọ́jú àwọn aláìsàn tó jẹ́ Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà nípa lílo ìlànà ìtọ́jú ìṣègùn àti iṣẹ́ abẹ tí kò léwu, tó gbéṣẹ́, tí kò sì nílò ìfàjẹ̀sínilára.
target: The presentation kit really was of great assistance.Currently, over 5,000 doctors in Italy have agreed to treat patients who are Jehovah’s Witnesses with safe and effective medical and surgical techniques that do not require the use of blood transfusions.

input: Lọ́dọọdún, ìpíndọ́gba àwọn aláìsàn tó jẹ́ Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà tí iye wọn tó ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́rìndínlógún 16,000 ló ń gba ìtọ́jú láìlo ẹ̀jẹ̀ lórílẹ̀-èdè Ítálì.
target: Every year in Italy, an average of 16,000 Witness patients are treated in this way.

input: Lẹ́yìn àpérò náà, àwọn dókítà tó ń fún èèyàn láwọn oògùn tó ń dín ìrora kù àtàwọn tó ń ṣiṣẹ́ abẹ sọ ìrírí tí wọ́n ní nígbà tí wọ́n tọ́jú àwọn aláìsàn tó jẹ́ Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà.
target: After the conferences, anesthesiologists and surgeons shared their experiences of working with Jehovah’s Witnesses.

input: Ọ̀pọ̀ ọdún ni mo fi tọ́jú àwọn aláìsàn tó jẹ́ Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà.
target: For years Jehovah’s Witness patients have been a part of my professional experience.

input: Ẹ̀jẹ̀ tó sì máa ń dà tá a bá ń ṣiṣẹ́ abẹ inú ẹ̀dọ̀ pọ̀ débi pé ó lè la ẹ̀mí lọ.
target: It is two, three, or four times more complex compared to other transplants, and there is a high risk of bleeding.

input: Àmọ́, torí ẹ̀rí wà pé ẹgbẹẹgbẹ̀rún iṣẹ́ abẹ yìí ló wáyé kárí ayé, títí kan ọgọ́rọ̀ọ̀rún iṣẹ́ abẹ tá a ti pààrọ̀ ẹ̀dọ̀, a lè fi gbogbo ẹnu sọ pé a ti mọ ọ̀nà tó gbéṣẹ́ tá a lè fi dènà ẹ̀jẹ̀ tó ń dà lára.
target: Despite this, because we have scientific evidence from thousands of cases worldwide, with tens of thousands of liver transplant cases, we can say that we know the ‘tricks of the trade.’

input: Ká sòótọ́, a ti rí i pé ọgbọ́n wà tá a lè dá ká lè dènà ẹ̀jẹ̀ tó ń dà lára nígbà iṣẹ́ abẹ.
target: They are, in fact, proven techniques that help to avoid bleeding.

input: A ti mọ bá a ṣe lè ṣe é láìfa ẹ̀jẹ̀ síni lára.
target: We know how to avoid blood transfusions.

input: Ó fẹ́rẹ̀ẹ́ jẹ́ pé gbogbo iṣẹ́ abẹ inú ẹ̀dọ̀ títí kan iṣẹ́ abẹ tá a fi ń pààrọ̀ ẹ̀dọ̀ là ń ṣe láìsí pé wọ́n fa ẹ̀jẹ̀ síni lára.
target: The vast majority of our liver surgeries, even transplants, are performed entirely without the use of blood.

input: Ó sì jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára ohun tó jẹ́ kí n sapá láti ọ̀pọ̀ ọdún wá kí n lè ṣàtúnṣe, kí n sì ṣe ohun tó máa múnú wọn dùn.
target: And this is one of the reasons why, over the years, I have always tried to make adjustments in order to please them.

input: Mo gbà pé wọ́n yẹ lẹ́ni téèyàn ń bọ̀wọ̀ tó jinlẹ̀ fún.
target: I consider them people worthy of the highest regard.

input: Àwọn ẹ̀rọ ìgbàlódé tí wọ́n fi ń ṣiṣẹ́ abẹ ti ṣèrànwọ́ gan-an fáwọn dókítà tí wọ́n gbà láti bọ̀wọ̀ fún ìpinnu aláìsàn tó kọ̀ láti gba ẹ̀jẹ̀ sára torí ohun tó gbà gbọ́.
target: New surgical technologies are instrumental in respecting the will of patients who for religious reasons refuse blood transfusions.

input: Bó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé ọdọọdún la túbọ̀ ń rí ẹ̀rí tó fi hàn pé, ó léwu gan-an tá a bá fa ògidì sẹ́ẹ̀lì pupa inú ẹ̀jẹ̀ tàbí èyíkéyìí lára èròjà ẹ̀jẹ̀ síni lára.
target: However, the evidence related to the possible harmful effects connected to the transfusions of both concentrated red blood cells and the other blood components has increased each year.

input: Ní April 6, 2018, Ilé Ẹjọ́ Termini Imerese nílùú Sicily lórílẹ̀-èdè Ítálì dájọ́ pé dókítà oníṣẹ́ abẹ kan jẹ̀bi ẹ̀sùn ọ̀daràn torí pé ó fipá fa ẹ̀jẹ̀ sí obìnrin kan tó jẹ́ Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà lára.
target: On April 6, 2018, the Court of Termini Imerese in Sicily, Italy, ruled that a surgeon was criminally liable for forcing a blood transfusion on a woman who is one of Jehovah’s Witnesses.

input: Ìgbà àkọ́kọ́ rèé tí ilé ẹjọ́ ilẹ̀ Ítálì máa dájọ́ pé dókítà kan jẹ̀bi ẹ̀sùn ọ̀daràn torí pé ó fi ẹ̀tọ́ tí aláìsàn ní lábẹ́ òfin dù ú, níwọ̀n ìgbà tó jẹ́ pé èèyàn lẹ́tọ̀ọ́ láti pinnu ohunkóhun tó fẹ́ kí ẹlòmíì ṣe sí ara òun.
target: This ruling is the first time an Italian court has found a doctor criminally responsible for violating the fundamental right to have control over what is done to one’s own body in line with one’s beliefs.

input: Ohun tó ṣẹlẹ̀ gan-an ni pé ní December 2010, wọ́n ṣiṣẹ́ abẹ fún arábìnrin tá à ń sọ̀rọ̀ ẹ̀ yìí níbi òróòro, àmọ́ àwọn ìṣòro kan jẹyọ lẹ́yìn iṣẹ́ abẹ náà.
target: The case involved a sister who, after having gallbladder surgery in December 2010, began experiencing complications.

input: Bó tiẹ̀ jẹ́ pé léraléra ló ń sọ pé òun ò gba èròjà inú ẹ̀jẹ̀ sára, agbára ẹ̀ ò ká dókítà náà, ó sì fipá fa àwọn sẹ́ẹ̀lì pupa inú ẹ̀jẹ̀ sí i lára.
target: Even though she persistently refused to accept blood products, she was physically restrained and forcibly given a transfusion of red blood cells.

input: Dókítà tó ṣiṣẹ́ abẹ náà parọ́ pé adájọ́ ilé ẹjọ́ ló fún òun láṣẹ láti ṣe bẹ́ẹ̀.
target: Her surgeon falsely claimed to have authorization from a magistrate.

input: Nígbà tó yá, obìnrin náà àti ọkọ ẹ̀ fẹjọ́ sun Ọ́fíìsì Olùpẹ̀jọ́.
target: Subsequently, she and her husband filed a criminal complaint with the Office of the Public Prosecutor.

input: Ilé ẹjọ́ sì pinnu pé tí Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà kan bá ti dàgbà tó lábẹ́ òfin, tó sì ní làákàyè tó, .
target: The court decided that in the circumstance of a Jehovah’s Witness, of legal age and fully capable, .

input: dókítà ò gbọ́dọ̀ fún un nírú ìtọ́jú yìí tí onítọ̀hún bá ti lóhun ò fẹ́.
target: the doctor must refrain from providing this treatment if it violates the recipient’s will.

input: Ilé ẹjọ́ tún kéde pé Òfin Orílẹ̀-èdè Ítálì ò fàyè gbà á kí dókítà fipá fún ẹnì kan ní irú ìtọ́jú kan pàtó tó bá ti lóun ò fẹ́, kódà kí dókítà sọ pé ó dáa kó gba irú ìtọ́jú bẹ́ẹ̀.
target: The court also declared that the Constitution of Italy prohibits doctors from administering treatments without consent even if the doctor claims that the treatment is necessary.

input: Bí ilé ẹjọ́ náà ṣe sọ, ti pé dókítà rí i pé ìtọ́jú kan pọn dandan .
target: According to the court decision, the justification of the state of necessity .

input: Ní August 22, ìmìtìtì ilẹ̀ tó lágbára kan ṣẹlẹ̀ ní erékùṣù Ischia tó wà létíkun ìlú Naples, lórílẹ̀-èdè Ítálì.Ìmìtìtì ilẹ̀ náà ba ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ilé jẹ́, ó sì sọ nǹkan bí ẹgbẹ̀rún méjì ó lé ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́fà 2,600 èèyàn di aláìnílé.
target: On August 22, a magnitude 4.0 earthquake struck the island of Ischia off the coast of Naples, Italy, destroying numerous buildings and displacing some 2,600 people.

input: Ó lé ní ogójì 40 èèyàn tó fara pa, àwọn méjì ló sì kú.
target: Over 40 people were injured and 2 were killed.

input: A ò tíì gbọ́ pé ìkankan nínú àwọn ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́fà ó lé mẹ́tàlélọ́gbọ̀n 633 Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà tó ń gbé ní erékùṣù náà ko jàǹbá tàbí fara gbọgbẹ́, àmọ́ ilé àwọn ìdílé Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà mẹ́sàn-án ló bà jẹ́.
target: No fatalities or serious injuries have been reported among the 633 Jehovah’s Witnesses who live on the island, but the homes of 9 Witness families were damaged.

input: Àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà tó wà lágbègbè náà ti ń ran àwọn ará bíi tiwọn lọ́wọ́, ìyẹn àwọn tọ́rọ̀ yìí kàn, wọ́n sì ń fi ọ̀rọ̀ Ọlọ́run tù wọ́n nínú.
target: Local Witnesses are providing assistance and spiritual comfort to their fellow members that were affected.

input: Agbẹnusọ fún Àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà Kárí Ayé David A.Semonian, Ọ́fíìsì Agbéròyìnjáde, 1-845-524-3000 Ítálì Christian Di Blasio, 39-06-872941
target: David A.Semonian, Office of Public Information, 1-845-524-3000Christian Di Blasio, 39-06-872941

input: Ní May 15, 2019, Ilé Ẹjọ́ Gíga jù Lọ ní Ítálì fọwọ́ sí i pé àwọn ará wa lẹ́tọ̀ọ́ láti pinnu irú ìtọ́jú ìṣègùn tó wù wọ́n.
target: On May 15, 2019, Italy’s Supreme Court of Cassation, the highest court in the land, strengthened our brothers’ right to make decisions regarding their own medical care.

input: Ilé ẹjọ́ náà mú kó ṣe kedere pé aláìsàn kan lẹ́tọ̀ọ́ láti yan aṣojú fún ọ̀rọ̀ ìtọ́jú ìṣègùn, tó sì máa gbèjà aláìsàn náà kí wọ́n má bàa fa ẹ̀jẹ̀ sí i lára.
target: The Court confirmed that a patient has the right to select a health-care agent who will uphold the patient’s decision to refuse a blood transfusion.

input: Yàtọ̀ síyẹn, Ilé ẹjọ́ náà tẹnu mọ́ ọn pé ó bófin mu lórílẹ̀-èdè Ítálì kí aláìsàn kan yan ẹni tó máa ṣojú fúnni lórí ọ̀rọ̀ ìtọ́jú ìṣègùn tó bá ṣẹlẹ̀ pé aláìsàn náà dákú gbọnrangandan tàbí kò lè sọ̀rọ̀ mọ́.
target: Additionally, the Court confirmed that Italian law provides for the legal appointment of a health-care agent, even if, because of his health condition, he could imminently become unconscious or impaired in some way.

input: Arákùnrin àti Arábìnrin Cappelli Ilé ẹjọ́ ṣe ìpinnu yìí nítorí àwọn ẹjọ́ tó wáyé nípa Arákùnrin Luca Cappelli tó jẹ́ alàgbà nínú ìjọ.
target: Brother and Sister Cappelli The decision was the result of a series of trials involving Brother Luca Cappelli, a congregation elder.

input: Ó ti tó ọdún mẹ́ẹ̀ẹ́dọ́gbọ̀n 25 báyìí tó ti ní ìṣòro inú iṣan tí ẹ̀jẹ́ ń gbà kọjá nínú ọpọlọ.
target: For the past 25 years, he has been afflicted by an abnormality of the blood vessels in the brain.

input: Àìsàn tó ń ṣe Arákùnrin Cappelli le débi pé ó nílò onírúurú ìtọ́jú ìṣègùn àti pé nígbà míì kò ní lè sọ̀rọ̀.
target: Brother Cappelli’s condition not only requires multiple medical procedures, but also at times impairs his ability to communicate.

input: Kí wọ́n tó bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí í tọ́jú ẹ̀, ó rí i pé òun kọ̀rọ̀ kún káàdì Advance Medical Directive, ó sì yan ìyàwó rẹ̀ Francesca láti ṣojú fún un nínú ọ̀rọ̀ ìtọ́jú ìṣègùn.
target: In advance of his treatments, he conscientiously filled out an Advance Medical Directive and designated his wife, Francesca, as his health-care agent.

input: Àmọ́, adájọ́ kan nílé ẹjọ́ kòtẹ́milọ́rùn kò gbà kí ìyàwó arákùnrin yìí sojú fún un nínú ọ̀rọ̀ ìtọ́jú ìṣègùn, torí náà kò sí bí Arákùnrin Cappelli ṣe lè dáàbò bo ara ẹ̀ kí wọ́n má bàa fa ẹ̀jẹ̀ sí i lára.
target: However, a judge and a court of appeal refused to appoint his wife as his health-care agent, thus depriving Brother Cappelli of the legal means to protect himself from receiving an unwanted blood transfusion.

input: Wọ́n gbé ẹjọ́ Arákùnrin Cappelli dé Ilé Ẹjọ́ Gíga Jù Lọ ní February 16, 2017.
target: Brother Cappelli’s case went to the Supreme Court of Cassation on February 16, 2017.

input: Ilé Ẹjọ́ Gíga Jù Lọ sì sọ pé àwọn ilé ẹjọ́ kéékèèké yìí tàpá sí Òfin orílẹ̀-èdè Ítálì àti ti European Convention of Human Rights, tó fún aláìsàn kan lẹ́tọ̀ọ́ láti ṣe ìpinnu fúnra ẹ̀.
target: The Supreme Court ruled that the lower courts violated the Italian Constitution and the European Convention of Human Rights, both of which protect patient autonomy.

input: Kárí ayé ni inú àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ti dùn sí ìdájọ́ Ilé Ẹjọ́ Gíga Jù Lọ yìí.Ìdí ni pé wọ́n dáàbò bo ẹ̀tọ́ táwọn ará wa lórílẹ̀-èdè Ítálì ní láti má ṣe gba ẹ̀jẹ́ torí pé kò bá ìgbàgbọ́ wọn mu.​—Ìṣe 1529.
target: We rejoice as a united brotherhood that the Supreme Court has acted to protect the rights of our brothers throughout Italy, who continue to uphold their Bible-trained conscience regarding the use of blood.—Acts 1529.

input: Àmì ìrántí tí wọ́n gbé sí abúlé Risiera di San Sabba, ní ìlú Trieste.
target: The plaque installed at the Risiera di San Sabba, Trieste.

input: Àwọn ilé iṣẹ́ oníròyìn ti àdúgbò àti ti ìjọba náà wá síbi tí wọ́n ti ṣí aṣọ lójú àmì ìrántí náà, tó fi mọ́ Canale 5, tó jẹ́ ìkànnì tẹlifíṣọ̀n táwọn èèyàn ń wò jù lọ lórílẹ̀-èdè náà.
target: The unveiling drew the attention of local and national media outlets, including Canale 5, one of the most watched TV channels in the country.

input: Àsọyé kan tó dá lórí ìdúróṣinṣin ni Christian Di Blasio, tó jẹ́ agbẹnusọ fún àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ni orílẹ̀-èdè Ítálì fi bẹ̀rẹ̀ ètò ìrántí náà.
target: Christian Di Blasio, a spokesman for Jehovah’s Witnesses in Italy, opened the ceremony with a discourse highlighting loyalty.

input: Ó sọ pé Lára àwọn tí ìjọba Násì ṣe inúnibíni sí, àwọn ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà nìkan ṣoṣo ló jẹ́ pé kìkì nítorí ohun tí wọ́n gbà gbọ́ ni ìjọba Násì ṣe ṣe inúnibíni sí wọ́n.
target: Jehovah’s Witnesses were the only ones under the Third Reich to be persecuted solely on the basis of their religious convictions.

input: Àwọn nìkan ni sì àwùjọ tó ní àǹfààní láti ṣe nǹkan kan tí ikú á fi yẹ̀ lórí wọn.
target: They were also the only ones, as a group, to have the opportunity to avoid martyrdom.

input: Kí wọ́n wulẹ̀ sẹ́ ìgbàgbọ́ wọn ni, kí wọ́n sì sọ pé ti ìjọba làwọn á ṣe.
target: They merely had to renounce their Christian faith and support the regime.

input: Síbẹ̀, wọ́n ní ìgboyà tó mú kí wọ́n dúró lórí ìwà tó yẹ ká bá lọ́wọ́ Kristẹni, ìyẹn ni pé wọ́n ní jẹ́ adúróṣinsin sí Ọlọ́run, wọ́n sì tún nífẹ̀ẹ́ àwọn èèyàn.
target: Yet, they had the courage to stick to Christian values—loyalty to God and love for others.

input: Lẹ́yìn yẹn ni Arákùnrin Di Blasio fi fídíò ìfọ̀rọ̀wánilẹ́nuwò pẹ̀lú Arábìnrin Emma Bauer han àwọn tó wà níkàlẹ̀, nínú fídíò náà, Arábìnrin Emma Bauer ròyìn bi òun àti ìdílé òun ṣe fojú winá inúnibíni nígbà Ogun Àgbáyé Kejì.
target: Brother Di Blasio then shared a video interview of Sister Emma Bauer, who recounted the persecution she and her family suffered during World War II.

input: Ó ṣàlàyé pé àwọn Kristẹni tòótọ́ ò ní yẹsẹ̀ lórí ohun tó tọ́, kódà tó bá máa la ikú lọ.
target: She explained that true Christians will not relinquish their values even when faced with death.

input: Ní ìparí ètò ìrántí náà, olórí ìlú Trieste, Roberto Dipiazza, bá àwọn tó wá síbẹ̀ sọ̀rọ̀.
target: In closing, the mayor of Trieste, Roberto Dipiazza, also addressed the audience.

input: Ó ní Àmì ìrántí yìí dùn mọ́ mi nínú gan-an.
target: I am very pleased with this plaque.

input: A gbọ́dọ̀ wá nǹkan ṣe kí irú inúnibíni bẹ́ẹ̀ má bàa ṣẹlẹ̀ mọ́ láé.Ẹ̀yìn yẹn ni wọ́n wá ṣí aṣọ lójú àmì ìrántí náà.
target: We need to work so that such persecutions never happen again.The plaque was then officially unveiled.

input: Ọ̀pọ̀ ọ̀mọ̀wé àtàwọn ìlúmọ̀ọ́ká sọ̀rọ̀ lórí bí ètò ìrántí náà ti ṣe pàtàkì tó.
target: Many scholars and public figures commented on the significance of the event.

input: Bí àpẹẹrẹ, Giorgio Bouchard, ààrẹ àná fún Àgbájọ Àwọn Ṣọ́ọ̀ṣì Ajíhìnrere Lórílẹ̀-Èdè Ítálì sọ pé Yàtọ̀ sí àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà, kò sí àwùjọ ẹ̀sìn náà táwọn ọmọ ìjọ rẹ̀ tíì fẹ̀mí ara wọn lélẹ̀ tó báyìí rí nítorí ohun tí wọ́n gbà gbọ́.
target: For instance, Giorgio Bouchard, former president of the Federation of Evangelical Churches in Italy,No church has ever paid a blood tribute proportionately as high as Jehovah’s Witnesses did.

input: A nírètí pé àwọn èèyàn tó tó ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà ọgọ́fà 120,000 lá máa ṣèbẹ̀wò síbi àmì ìrántí pàtàkì tó wà ní abúlé Risiera di San Sabba yìí lọ́dọọdún.
target: It is projected that some 120,000 people will visit the Risiera di San Sabba historical site annually.

input: Ẹnì kọ̀ọ̀kan tó bá wá síbẹ̀ á ní àǹfààní láti wo àmì yìí ní ìrántí ẹgbẹẹgbẹ̀rún àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà tó dúró lórí ìgbàgbọ́ wọn tí wọn ò sì lọ́wọ́ sí òṣèlú, bó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé ẹgbẹ́ òṣèlú Násì àti ìjọba aláṣẹ oníkùmọ̀ ṣe inúnibíni sí wọn.​—⁠Ìfihàn 2⁠10.
target: Each visitor will have the opportunity to view this plaque in memory of the thousands of Jehovah’s Witnesses who, despite being victims of Nazi and Fascist persecution, maintained their faith and political neutrality.—Revelation 210.

input: Sergio Albesano Òpìtàn, ìlú Turin Ìgbà tí mò ń ṣe ìwádìí nípa àwọn tó kọ̀ láti wọṣẹ́ ológun torí ohun tí wọ́n gbà gbọ́ ni mo wá mọ̀ nípa àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà, ọ̀nà tí wọ́n gbà gbé ìgbé ayé wọn sì wú mi lórí gan-an.
target: Sergio Albesano Historian, Turin I came to know about Jehovah’s Witnesses during my studies on conscientious objection in Italy, and I was quite impressed by their lifestyle.

input: Luigi Berzano Onímọ̀ nípa ìbágbépọ̀ ẹ̀dá, ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n, Yunifásítì Turin olóòtú ìwé ọdọọdún náà, Annual Review of the Sociology of Religion
target: Luigi Berzano Sociologist, full professor, University of Turin editor of the Annual Review of the Sociology of Religion

input: Lẹ́yìn-ọ̀-rẹyìn, àgbàyanu ìgbàgbọ́ àti ìwà ọmọlúwàbí àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí tó lé ní ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́ẹ̀ẹ́dọ́gbọ̀n 25,000 tí wọ́n ṣenúnibíni sí lórílẹ̀-èdè Jámánì ti kúrò lóko ìgbàgbé.
target: Finally, the great testimony of faith and civil values of the more than 25,000 Witnesses persecuted in Germany has passed the wall of silence.

input: Ohun tó ṣẹlẹ̀ sáwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ti wá di ẹ̀rí tí kò lẹ́gbẹ́ pé, wọn ò fi ìgbàgbọ́ wọn nínú Ọlọ́run báni dọ́rẹ̀ẹ́, torí náà, wọ́n yẹ lẹ́ni àpọ́nlé, wọ́n sì níyì ju gbogbo àwọn míì tí ìjọba ṣenúnibíni sí lọ.
target: What happened to the Witnesses was, and remains, a unique testimony, totally religious, and therefore, even more rich and noble than that of all the other victims.

input: Yàtọ̀ sí àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà, kò sí àwùjọ ẹ̀sìn náà táwọn ọmọ ìjọ rẹ̀ tíì fẹ̀mí ara wọn lélẹ̀ tó báyìí rí nítorí ohun tí wọ́n gbà gbọ́.
target: No church has ever paid a blood tribute proportionately as high as Jehovah’s Witnesses did.

input: Àmọ́, ṣe ni ìrírí tó le koko táwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí ní yìí túbọ̀ mú kí wọ́n lágbára, wọ́n sì wá fìdí ẹ̀rí múlẹ̀ fáwọn èèyàn, àti fún Ọlọ́run pàápàá, pé àwọn ni ẹ̀sìn Kristẹni kan ṣoṣo tó ta ko èròǹgbà tí Ìjọba Násì gbé lárugẹ.
target: This harsh experience, however, has strengthened the movement, which presents itself to the judgment of history and we believe, to the judgment of God as the only Christian church that was opposed en masse to the idols of the Third Reich.

input: Giuseppina Celloni Onímọ̀ nípa ìrònú àti ìhùwàsí ẹ̀dá àti olùtọ́jú àrùn ọpọlọ, ìlú Trieste Ó pẹ́ táwọn èèyàn ò ti ka inúnibíni tí ẹgbẹ́ òṣèlú Násì àti ìjọba aláṣẹ oníkùmọ̀ ṣe sáwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà sí.
target: Giuseppina Celloni Psychologist and psychotherapist, Trieste For a long time, the persecution against this religious group under the Nazi-Fascist regime has been disregarded.

input: Àmì ìrántí tá a gbé síbi pàtàkì nínú ìtàn yìí, ṣe àpọ́nlé ẹgbẹẹgbẹ̀rún àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà tí wọ́n ti ní ìgboyà, tí wọ́n jẹ́ adúróṣinṣin tí wọ́n sì ní ìgbàgbọ́ nínú àwọn ìlànà rere táwọn Kristẹni ń tẹ̀ lé kí wọ́n lè máa gbé ìgbé ayé àlàáfíà.
target: This identification plaque, posted at a historically significant site, honors the thousands of Jehovah’s Witnesses who have had courage, loyalty, and faith in the noble Christian principles for the purpose of living in peace.

input: Maurizio Costanzo Akọ̀ròyìn àti olóòtú ètò orí tẹlifíṣọ̀n, ìlú Róòmù A ò jẹ́ gbàgbé ẹgbẹẹgbẹ̀rún àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà láti apá ibi ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀ lórílẹ̀-èdè Yúróòpù tí wọ́n rán lọ sí àwọn àgọ́ ìṣẹ́niníṣẹ̀ẹ́.
target: Maurizio Costanzo Journalist and television presenter, Rome We cannot forget the thousands of Jehovah’s Witnesses from various European countries who were sent to concentration camps.

input: Ẹ̀mí ẹgbẹ̀rún kan ààbọ̀ 1,500 lára wọn ló lọ sí i.
target: Among these, 1,500 lost their lives.

input: Abala pàtàkì lèyí jẹ́ nínú ìtàn àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà, torí náà, ó yẹ ká máa rántí rẹ̀ lọ́nà tá á fi hàn pé a mọyì wọn gan-an.
target: It is an important page in the history of Jehovah’s Witnesses, and it is therefore right to remember it with the highest of honors.

input: Annamaria Fiorillo Igbá kejì agbẹjọ́rò ìjọba ní Kóòtù Àwọn Ọ̀dọ́ ti ìlú Milan
target: Annamaria Fiorillo Deputy public prosecutor at the Milan Juvenile Court

input: Ó ṣe pàtàkì ká rántí pé Ìjọba Násì ò rí àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà bí ọ̀rẹ́ torí ojú tí wọ́n fi ń wo ayé, pé ìwàláàyè jẹ́ mímọ́, èyí tó ta ko èròǹgbà ìjọba Násì pé ẹ̀yà Aryan ló yẹ kó máa ṣàkóso gbogbo ayé.
target: It is important to remember that Jehovah’s Witnesses posed a danger to Nazism because of their view of the world, based on respect for the sacredness of life—undermining the plan of world domination based on the principle of supremacy of the Aryan race.

input: Àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà tó kọ̀ láti wọṣẹ́ ológun torí ohun tí wọ́n gbà gbọ́, bó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé ó lè la ikú lọ fún wọn, síbẹ̀ tí wọ́n kọ̀ láti sẹ́ ìgbàgbọ́ wọn, ò wulẹ̀ kù ikú ẹ̀sìn lásán.
target: Jehovah’s Witnesses, conscientious objectors who, at the cost of their lives, refused to renounce their faith—were not just martyrs of a religion.

input: Lónìí, bó ṣe jẹ́ nígbà náà lọ́hùn-ún, a lè sọ pé wọ́n jẹ́ onígboyà, tó kọ̀ láti lọ́wọ́ sí ìwà ipá tó sì gbé àlàáfíà lárugẹ.
target: Today, as back then, they can be defined as courageous champions of nonviolence and champions of peace.

input: Àpẹẹrẹ rere ni wọ́n jẹ́ láàárín àwọn èèyàn, wọ́n sì mú káwọn ìran tó ń bọ̀ lọ́jọ́ iwájú nírètí.
target: They represent a glorious example of human greatness and a hope for future generations.

input: Anna Foa Ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n Ìtàn Òde Òní, Yunifásítì La Sapienza, ìlú Róòmù Àárín ọdún 1990 sí ọdún 1999 ni àwọn òpìtàn ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí í ṣèwádìí nípa àmì onígun mẹ́ta aláwọ̀ àlùkò tí wọ́n sì wá ń rántí inúnibíni tí Ìjọba ṣe sí àwọn tó lo àmì náà.
target: Anna Foa Professor of Modern History, La Sapienza University, Rome It was not until the 1990s that historiography began looking into the purple triangles and remembering their persecution.

input: Ìdí pàtàkì tí wọn ò fi mọ̀ tí wọn ò sì rántí wọn ni pé, lẹ́yìn ogun, ìjọba ṣì ń bá a nìṣó láti máa ṣe inúnibíni sáwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ní Ìlà Oòrùn orílẹ̀-èdè Jámánì.
target: In explanation, this lack of both knowledge and memory is largely due to the fact that, in postwar East Germany, Jehovah’s Witnesses continued to be persecuted.

input: Wọ́n fi ẹ̀sùn kàn wọ́n pé wọ́n jẹ́ ọ̀tá ìjọba àjùmọ̀ní, aṣojú ìjọba agbókèèrè-jẹ-gàba ti ilẹ̀ Amẹ́ríkà àti amí, torí náà wọ́n tún pa dà jù wọ́n sẹ́wọ̀n, ìjọba ju ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́rin 4,000 lára wọn sẹ́wọ̀n, wọ́n sì fi ẹgbẹ̀rún kan 1,000 sẹ́wọ̀n láì gbọ́ tẹnu wọn nílé ẹjọ́.
target: Accused of being enemies of socialism, agents of American imperialism, and spies, they were imprisoned again—4,000 of them were sentenced to prison and 1,000 were imprisoned without trial.

input: Ẹ̀yìn ìgbà tí Ìlà Oòrùn àti Ìwọ̀ Oòrùn orílẹ̀-èdè Jámánì pa dà di ọ̀kan lọ́dún 1989 ní ìtàn wọn kúrò lóko ìgbàgbé táwọn èèyàn sì bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí í sọ̀rọ̀ nípa inúnibíni tí Ìjọba ṣe sí wọn.
target: Only after 1989 and the reunification of Germany did their story reemerge from oblivion and their persecution receive recognition.

input: Àwọn ọkùnrin nìkan kọ́ ni wọ́n ṣe inúnibíni sí, àmọ́ bí òpìtàn Adriana Lotto ṣe sọ, wọ́n ṣe inúnibíni sáwọn obìnrin náà, pàápàá àwọn tí wọ́n dìídì jù sẹ́wọ̀n torí kí wọ́n má bàa kọ́ àwọn ọmọ wọn lẹ́kọ̀ọ́ tí ò ní jẹ́ kí wọ́n fẹ́ wọṣẹ́ ológun.
target: This persecution included not only men but, as historian Adriana Lotto points out, also women who were mostly imprisoned in order to prevent them from influencing their children and pushing them to pacifism.

input: Nígbà tí èyí bẹ̀rẹ̀, lọ́dún 1933, àwọn yàtọ̀ sí àwọn obìnrin tó jẹ́ ẹgbẹ́ òṣèlú ìjọba orí-ò-jorí ni àwùjọ kan ṣoṣo tó pọ̀ jù lọ láwọn àgọ́ ìṣẹ́niníṣẹ̀ẹ́, pàápàá jù lọ, àgọ́ ìṣẹ́niníṣẹ̀ẹ́ àwọn obìnrin ní Ravensbrück.
target: At the beginning, in 1933, they represented second only to Communist women the most numerous group in the camps, in particular, in the women’s camp of Ravensbrück.

input: Maria Fausta Maternini Òjọ̀gbọ́n nípa Ìjọra Tàbí Àìdọ́gba Tó Wà Nínú Òfin Ẹ̀sìn, Yunifásítì ìlú Trieste
target: Maria Fausta Maternini Full professor of Comparative Law of Religions, University of Trieste

input: Bíi tìgbà yẹn, ṣe làwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà òde òní náà ń pa kún ṣíṣe ohun tó tọ́ tó sì yẹ, kí gbogbo èèyàn lè máa gbé ní àlàáfíà àti ní ìrẹ́pọ̀.
target: Today, as in years past, the ongoing mission of Jehovah’s Witnesses contributes actively to the dissemination of values that are a prerequisite for peaceful and harmonious coexistence.

input: Ẹ ṣeun tẹ́ ẹ pè mí síbi ètò ìrántí yìí, mo sì fi ìmọrírì hàn fún àlàyé tó ṣe kedere tó sì wọni lọ́kàn tí ẹ̀yin Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ṣe.
target: I thank you for the invitation to attend the ceremony, and I express my appreciation for the incisive testimony that was given by Jehovah’s Witnesses.

input: Marzio Pontone Agbẹjọ́rò, ìlú Turin Ọdún mẹ́ẹ̀ẹ́dọ́gbọ̀n 25 ni mo fi gbẹnu sọ láwọn ilé ẹjọ́ ológun àti ti ìjọba nílùú Ítálì kí wọ́n lè fún àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí ní òmìnira láti ṣe ohun tí ẹ̀sìn wọn fàyè gbà.
target: Marzio Pontone Lawyer, Turin I fought for 25 years in the courtrooms of the Italian military and civil tribunals for the freedom of religious thought for Witnesses.

input: Láì ṣiyè méjì, mo lè sọ pé ànímọ́ mẹ́ta pàtàkì láwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ní.
target: I can affirm, without a shadow of a doubt, that they have three fundamental characteristics.

input: Wọ́n jẹ́ 1 adúróṣinṣin nínú ohun gbogbo, 2 wọn kì í yí pa dà, wọn 3 kì í sì í ṣiyè méjì tó bá di pé kí wọ́n tẹ̀ lé ohun tí Jèhófà pa láṣẹ fún wọn kí wọ́n sì bọ̀wọ̀ fún un.
target: absolutely consistent, 2 loyal, and 3 unwavering in following and respecting what, for them, are the dictates of Jehovah.

input: Àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí kan tiẹ̀ ti gbà láti kú kí wọ́n má bàá sẹ́ ìgbàgbọ́ wọn — Àmì onígun mẹ́ta aláwọ̀ àlùkò ló jẹ́ ẹ̀rí tó ṣeé fojú rí nípa àwọn tó ṣe irú ìpinnu bẹ́ẹ̀.
target: Some Witnesses have even sacrificed their lives in order not to renounce their faith—the purple triangles are a demonstration of this.

input: Mi ò rò pé àsọdùn ni tí mo bá sọ pé tá a bá ń wá àwọn tó kú nítorí ohun tí wọ́n gbà gbọ́ àpẹẹrẹ tòótọ́ làwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí kan jẹ́.
target: I don’t think I exaggerate when I say that some Witnesses have been true martyrs for the faith.

input: Mi ò rí ohun àbùkù kankan sọ nípa àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà torí mo mọ̀ pé wọn yẹ lẹ́ni àpọ́nlé lọ́dọ̀ gbogbo èèyàn, títí kan lọ́dọ̀ àwa tá a jẹ́ ẹlẹ́sìn míì Kátólíìkì.
target: I can only speak well of Jehovah’s Witnesses because I believe they are worthy of respect even by those who, like me, have another religion Catholic.

input: Guido Raimondi Ààrẹ àná fún Ilé Ẹjọ́ Ẹ̀tọ́ Ọmọnìyàn ti Ilẹ̀ Yúróòpù
target: Guido Raimondi Former president of the European Court of Human Rights

input: Mo gbóṣùbà fún àwọn tó wà nídìí ètò ìrántí pàtàkì yìí, ó rán wa létí bí òṣìkà ìjọba Násì ṣe ṣenúnibíni sí àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà tó sì dá ọ̀pọ̀ lára wọn lóró.
target: I am very grateful to the organizers of this important ceremony, which recalls the persecution and torture of thousands of Jehovah’s Witnesses who were victims of Nazi barbarism.

input: Ọpẹ́lọpẹ́ ìwà akin wọn tó gún wa ní kẹ́ṣẹ́ láwùjọ tá a fi dá ètò ìgbẹ́jọ́ ilẹ̀ Yúróòpù àti Ilé Ẹjọ́ Ẹ̀tọ́ Ọmọnìyàn ti Ilẹ̀ Yúróòpù sílẹ̀.
target: We owe it also to their sacrifice that there was the powerful push in civil society that gave birth to the European project and also the European Court of Human Rights.

input: Gbogbo ọmọ ilẹ̀ Yúróòpù ló yẹ kó máa rántí wọn kí wọ́n sì máa ṣọpẹ́ torí ohun tí wọ́n ṣe.
target: To them goes our emotional remembrance and our gratitude as European citizens.

input: Bruno Segre Agbẹjọ́rò, akòròyìn, olóòtú ìwé ìròyìn L’Incontro, ìlú Turin Ní orílẹ̀-èdè Ítálì, mo jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára àwọn tó ṣiṣẹ́ lórí àbádòfin tó fàyè gba ẹni tí ẹ̀rí ọkàn rẹ̀ ò bá yọ̀ǹda fún láti ṣiṣẹ́ ológun.
target: Bruno Segre Lawyer, journalist, founder of the newspaper L’Incontro, Turin As promoter of the bills for the recognition in Italy of conscientious objectors to military service.

input: Mo ní àǹfààní láti ṣe agbẹjọ́rò fún ọ̀pọ̀ lára àwọn ọ̀dọ́ Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà níwájú ilé ẹjọ́ ológun lórílẹ̀-èdè Ítálì.
target: I had the opportunity to defend hundreds of young Jehovah’s Witnesses before the military tribunals of the Republic.

input: Mo lè jẹ́rìí sí i pé àìṣàbòsí wọn, ẹ̀mí ìmúratán wọn àti bí wọn ṣe fìmọ̀ ṣọ̀kan ló mú kí ìgbàgbọ́ wọn fẹsẹ̀ múlẹ̀ ṣinṣin, ìyẹn sì mú kí n gba tiwọn ní gbogbo ọ̀nà.
target: I can attest that the firmness of their faith, inspired by the principles of honesty, personal sacrifice, and solidarity, aroused my admiration.

input: Ilé tó wà nílùú Imola, níbi tí Ẹ̀ka Ìtúmọ̀ Èdè wà báyìí Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì orílẹ̀-èdè Ítálì ti ń kó láti ìlú Róòmù lọ sí ìlú Bologna àti Imola.
target: The Imola facility, where the Translation Department is now located The Italy branch is relocating their facilities from Rome to the cities of Bologna and Imola.

input: Ìlú Bologna wà ní nǹkan bí ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́ta ó lè àádọ́rin 370 kìlómítà sí àríwá ìlú Róòmù, ìlú Imola sì wà ní nǹkan bíi kìlómítà méjìdínláàádọ́ta 48 sí ìlú Bologna.
target: Bologna is located about 370 kilometers 230 mi north of Rome, and Imola is about 48 kilometers 30 mi from Bologna.

input: Wọ́n ti ń ṣe àtúnṣe sí ilé alájà mẹ́sàn-án kan tó wà ní ìlú Bologna èyí tí ẹ̀ka máa fi ṣe ọ́fíìsì.
target: Renovations have already begun on a nine-story building in Bologna that will serve as offices for the branch.

input: Láti ọdún 2018, àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ Bẹ́tẹ́lì tó lé ní ọgọ́ta 60 tí wọ́n ń ṣe iṣẹ́ atúmọ̀ èdè àtàwọn iṣẹ́ míì tó tan mọ́ ọn ti ń bá iṣẹ́ nìṣó nínú ilé tí wọ́n ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ ṣe àtúnṣe sí ní ìlú Imola.
target: As of 2018, more than 60 Bethel volunteers working with translation and related support activities have been operating in a newly renovated building in Imola.

input: Ká lè pèsè ibùgbé fún àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ ní Bẹ́tẹ́lì tí wọ́n ń kó lọ sí ìlú Bologna, a ti bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí í kọ́ ilé alájà-méje kan sí nǹkan bíi kìlómítà kan àtààbọ̀ máìlì kan sí ibi tá a kọ́ ọ́fíìsì sí.Ilé náà ní ibi ìgbọ́kọ̀sí abẹ́lẹ̀ tó jẹ́ ìpele mẹ́ta.
target: As part of the efforts to address the housing needs of the Bethelites relocating to Bologna, a seven-story apartment building with three levels of underground parking is currently being constructed about one and a half kilometers 1 mi from the office building.

input: A ṣì tún máa wá àwọn ilé míì sí i ní agbègbè yẹn.
target: Additional housing will eventually be located in the same vicinity.

input: Àwòrán bí ilé gbígbé alájà-méje tí wọ́n ń kọ́ lọ́wọ́ náà ṣe máa rí Ọdún 1948 ni àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ra ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa àkọ́kọ́ ní ìlú Róòmù tá a sì kó lọ síbẹ̀ láti ibi tá a ti ń ṣiṣẹ́ tẹ́lẹ̀ ní ìlú Milan.
target: Artist rendering of the seven-story residence currently under construction In 1948, Jehovah’s Witnesses purchased their first branch property in Rome and moved operations there from a previous facility in Milan.

input: Látìgbà yẹn wá, àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ti pọ̀ sí i lọ́nà tó pabanbarì ní Ítálì.
target: Since then, Italy has experienced extraordinary growth.

input: Ní nǹkan bí ọdún 1945, àwọn akéde tó wà lórílẹ̀-èdè náà ò ju igba 200 lọ.
target: In the mid-1940s, there were fewer than 200 publishers in the country.

input: Lónìí, àwọn akéde tó wà níbẹ̀ ti lé ní ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà àádọ́ta-lé-nígba 250,000.
target: Today, there are over 250,000 publishers, the largest number for any branch territory in Europe.

input: Orílẹ̀-èdè yìí ló ní iye akéde tó pọ̀ jù nílẹ̀ Yúróòpù.
target: As the number of publishers in the branch territory increased, so did the number of Bethel volunteers and branch properties.

input: Bí iye àwọn akéde tó wà ní Ítálì ṣe ń pọ̀ sí i ni iye àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ ní Bẹ́tẹ́lì àti ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì náà ń pọ̀ sí i.Ní ọdún 2006, ilé mọ́kàndínlọ́gọ́rùn-ún 99 ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀ là ń lò fún ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì ní Ítálì.
target: At its peak in 2006, the Italy branch office included 99 different buildings.

input: Tá a bá ti pa gbogbo iṣẹ́ pọ̀ sójú kan nílùú Bologna, iye àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ Bẹ́tẹ́lì máa dín kù, á wá ṣẹ́ ku ilé márùn-ún péré.
target: Once the consolidation is complete, the branch will have a reduced number of Bethel family members and consist of only five buildings.

input: Àdúrà wa ni pé kí Jèhófà máa bá a lọ láti fi ìbùkún rẹ̀ sórí iṣẹ́ ìkọ́lé náà kí àwọn ọ́fíìsì tuntun náà sì ṣètìlẹ́yìn fún iṣẹ́ tá à ń ṣe ní Ítálì, pápá tó ‘funfun tó sì ti tó kórè.’​—Jòhánù 435.
target: Our prayer is that Jehovah will continue to bless this project and that these new facilities will be a support for the work being done in Italy, a field that is white for harvesting.—John 435.

target: Arabic, Dutch, Dutch Sign Language, English, Papiamento, Polish, Portuguese, Spanish, Twi
