input: Ìkan náà ni Ọlọ́run, kò yí pa dà, à báà wà lómìnira tàbí a wà lẹ́wọ̀n.
target: God is one and the same whether we are free or in prison.

input: Kò fi wá sílẹ̀.
target: Therefore, we are not abandoned.

input: Ó wà pẹ̀lú wa níbikíbi tá a bá wà, tá a bá ṣáà ti jẹ́ olóòótọ́ sí i.
target: He is with us everywhere as long as we stay faithful to him.

input: Ìgbàgbọ́ tó lágbára táwọn ará wa ní máa ń fún wa níṣìírí bíi ti Arákùnrin Skrynnikov.
target: We are encouraged by the strong faith of our fellow believers, such as Brother Skrynnikov.

input: A túmọ̀ rẹ̀ láti èdè Russian
target: Translated from Russian

input: Lákọ̀ọ́kọ́, mo dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ Adájọ́ Àgbà Gleb Borisovich Noskov tí kò fi mí sátìmọ́lé kí wọ́n tó gbọ́ ẹjọ́ mi, èyí jẹ́ kí n lè wà pẹ̀lú ìdílé mi ní gbogbo àsìkò ìgbẹ́jọ́ yìí.
target: First, I would like to express my gratitude to Presiding Judge Gleb Borisovich Noskov for not imposing pretrial imprisonment on me, which meant that I have been with my family the entire time.

input: Bákan náà, mo fẹ́ dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ gbogbo àwọn ọ̀ṣìṣẹ́ ilé ẹjọ́ fún iṣẹ́ tí wọ́n ń ṣe.
target: Also I wish to thank all of the clerks for their work.

input: Mo dúpẹ́ gan-an lọ́wọ́ agbẹjọ́rò ìjọba, Ìyáàfin Nadezhda Gennadiyevna Naumova, torí kò ni mí lára nígbà tó ń wádìí ọ̀rọ̀ wò lẹ́nu mi, ọ̀nà tó sì gbà bi mí léèrè ọ̀rọ̀ bọ́gbọ́n mu.
target: I offer special thanks to the prosecutor, Madam Nadezhda Gennadiyevna Naumova, because no undue pressure was exerted on me and the questioning was conducted properly.

input: Mo tún dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ àwọn agbẹjọ́rò mi, Ìyáàfin Irina Aleksandrovna Krasnikova àti Ọ̀gbẹ́ni Anton Nikolayevich Bogdanov torí iṣẹ́ ribiribi tí wọ́n ṣe.
target: I would also like to thank my lawyers, Madam Irina Aleksandrovna Krasnikova and Mr.Anton Nikolayevich Bogdanov, for the tremendous work they have done.

input: Ìyàlẹ́nu gbáà ló jẹ́ fún mi nígbà tí wọ́n mú akọ́ṣẹ́mọṣẹ́ kan wá láti ìlú Chelyabinsk.
target: I confess to being very surprised when they managed to bring in a specialist from Chelyabinsk.

input: Mo dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ gbogbo ẹ̀yín ọ̀rẹ́ mi àtàtà fún bẹ́ ẹ ṣe ń wá sílé ẹjọ́ láti fún mi níṣìírí ní gbogbo àsìkò ìgbẹ́jọ́, bó tiẹ̀ jẹ́ pé ẹ mọ̀ pé wọn ò ní jẹ́ kẹ́ ẹ wọlé.
target: Thanks to all of you dear friends, for coming to all the sessions to encourage me, even though it was known that the sessions would be closed.

input: Màmá mi, ẹ ṣé o, bó tiẹ̀ jẹ́ pé ara ò le, ẹ ò yéé wá sílé ẹjọ́ láti fún mi níṣìírí.
target: Thank you to my mother, who, in spite of poor health, came to the court sessions to support me.

input: Ìyàwó mi àtàtà, o ṣé o, kú àdúrótì látọdún mẹ́tàdínlógójì 37, lọ́jọ́ dídùn àti lọ́jọ́ kíkan.
target: Thank you to my beloved wife, who for the past 37 years has supported me during good times and those more difficult moments.

input: Jèhófà, Ọlọ́run mi ni ọpẹ́ tó ga jù lọ yẹ, òun ló ń fi mí lọ́kàn balẹ̀, tó sì fi ayọ̀ kún ọkàn mi.

input: Ó lè ṣòroó gbà gbọ́, àmọ́ kò sí ìbànújẹ́ tàbí ìbínú kankan lọ́kàn mi, ayọ̀ àti àlááfíà ló kún ọkàn mi.
target: You may find it hard to believe, but in my heart there is no shadow of discontent or resentment about what has happened to me, only joy and peace.

input: Ọ̀rọ̀ yìí jẹ́ ká rí i pé wọ́n máa há àwọn ìránṣẹ́ Ọlọ́run mọ́, wọ́n á sì ṣenúnibíni sí wọn, àmọ́ iṣẹ́ tí Jésù Olúwa gbé lé wọn lọ́wọ́ ò ní dáwọ́ dúró, kàkà bẹ́ẹ̀, ńṣe láá tubọ̀ yára, táá sì túbọ̀ gbilẹ̀.
target: This tells us that not only will God’s servants be hard-pressed and persecuted, but also that the work that the Lord Jesus entrusted to them will not just continue, but will gain momentum and expand.

input: Ẹ wò ó Mo wà pẹ̀lú yín ní gbogbo ọjọ́ títí dé ìparí ètò àwọn nǹkan.

input: Ẹ̀mí Jèhófà ló máa ń darí àwọn Kristẹni, tó ń fún wọn ní agbára tó kọjá ti ẹ̀dá, tó sì ń mú kí wọ́n lè ṣe iṣẹ́ tí Ọlọ́run yàn fún wọn bí wọ́n tiẹ̀ ń kojú inúnibíni.

input: Àmọ́ torí pé Kristi ló ń darí iṣẹ́ ìwàásù, ní nǹkan bí ogún 20 ọdún lẹ́yìn náà, ó ṣètò nǹkan lọ́nà tí ìjọba Soviet Union fúnra rẹ̀ fi kó ẹgbẹẹgbẹ̀rún ìdílé àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà lọ sí Sàìbéríà lọ́fẹ̀ẹ́, kódà títí dé àwọn apá ibi tó jìnnà jù lọ lórílẹ̀-èdè náà.
target: But since the preaching work is directed by Christ, he arranged matters so that in the early 1950’s the Soviet government itself sent thousands of families of Jehovah’s Witnesses to Siberia into the farthest corners of the country without charge.

input: Ó ti fẹ́rẹ̀ẹ́ pé ọgọ́ta 60 ọdún báyìí tọ́rọ̀ yìí ti ṣẹlẹ̀, àmọ́ kí ló ti yọrí sí

input: Ní September 4, 2019, nígbà tí wọ́n ń gbẹ́jọ́ àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà mẹ́fà ní ìlú Saratov, wọ́n ní kí onímọ̀ nípa ẹ̀sìn táwọn èèyàn mọ̀ bí ẹní mowó àti olùdámọ̀ràn fún ìjọba Orílẹ̀-Èdè Rọ́ṣíà, Sergey Igorevich Ivanenko, wá sọ ohun tó mọ̀ nípa àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà níwájú ilé ẹjọ́.
target: On September 4, 2019, during the trial of six Jehovah’s Witnesses in Saratov, a well-known religious scholar and state advisor to the Russian Federation, Sergey Igorevich Ivanenko, was invited to testify under oath on behalf of Jehovah’s Witnesses.

input: Ọ̀mọ̀wé Ivanenko ló ṣe ìwé méjì tó wúlò fáwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ èyí tó sọ̀rọ̀ nípa àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà lórílẹ̀-èdè Rọ́ṣíà.
target: Dr.Ivanenko is the author of two scholarly works on Jehovah’s Witnesses in Russia.

input: Ohun tá a kọ síbí yìí ni ẹ̀rí tó jẹ́ níwájú ilé ẹjọ́
target: The following excerpts were taken from the testimony he gave under oath

input: Ìgbésí ayé àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà àti ìjọsìn wọn.
target: The religious life and practices of Jehovah’s Witnesses.

input: Ohun kan tó mú káwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí yàtọ̀ gédégbé ni pé
target: One thing makes Jehovah’s Witnesses unique

input: Àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà máa ń gbìyànjú láti tẹ̀ lé ohun tó wà nínú Bíbélì, ni ìbámu pẹ̀lú àwọn ìlànà tí Jésù Kristi àtàwọn ọmọ ẹ̀yìn rẹ̀ gbé kalẹ̀ ní ọgọ́rùn-ún ọdún kìíní Sànmánì Kristẹni.
target: Jehovah’s Witnesses try to follow what is written in the Bible, in harmony with the principles set out by Jesus Christ and his disciples back in the first century of the Common Era.

input: Ọ̀nà tí wọ́n ń gbà ṣe ohun tí wọ́n jọ gbà gbọ́, ìyẹn kíkẹ́kọ̀ọ́ Bíbélì, dídáhùn àwọn ìbéèrè nípa Bíbélì àti kíkọ orin tó bá Bíbélì mu, jẹ́ kó ṣe kedere pé àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ń sapá gidigidi láti ṣe gbogbo nǹkan lọ́nà tó bá Bíbélì mu.
target: With respect to the joint profession of their faith as manifested in studying the Bible, answering questions on Bible topics and singing songs that are also based on Bible texts, it is clear that Jehovah’s Witnesses make a concerted effort to base everything on the Bible.

input: Wọ́n tún gbà pé ìpàdé ìjọ wà lára ohun tí Kristẹni kan gbọ́dọ̀ máa pésẹ̀ sí.
target: They also believe that a Christian’s religious life must include a congregation.

input: Láwọn ìpàdé náà, àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà máa ń ṣe àyẹ̀wò Májẹ̀mú Tuntun, ohun tó sọ nípa Jésù Kristi àtàwọn ọmọ ẹ̀yìn rẹ̀, àwọn ọmọlẹ́yìn rẹ̀ àti ìgbà tí ìjọ Kristẹni ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ bẹ̀rẹ̀.
target: Here too, Jehovah’s Witnesses analyze the New Testament, what is said about Jesus Christ and his disciples, his followers, and the early stages of the development of the Christian church.

input: Àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà gbà pé àwọn gbọ́dọ̀ máa sin Ọlọ́run pa pọ̀ gẹ́gẹ́ bí ìjọ.
target: Jehovah’s Witnesses believe that their religious life must take place as part of a religious congregation.

input: Wọ́n máa ń tẹnu mọ́ ọn pé ohun tá a fi ń dá àwọn ọmọ ẹ̀yìn Jésù Kristi mọ̀ ni ìfẹ́ tí wọ́n ní láàárín ara wọn.
target: They emphasize that disciples of Jesus Christ would be identified by the love they have among themselves.

input: Iṣẹ́ ìwàásù àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà.
target: The preaching activity of Jehovah’s Witnesses.

input: A tún ń fi iṣẹ́ ìwàásù àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà dá wọn mọ̀.
target: Jehovah’s Witnesses are distinguished by their active preaching.

input: Mo lérò pé kò sẹ́ni tó ń wàásù bí àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà, kò sì sẹ́ni tó ní ìtara tó wọn.
target: I would put Jehovah’s Witnesses in first place when it comes to their preaching activity and zeal.

input: Gbogbo wọn gbọ́dọ̀ wàásù kí wọ́n sì lo àkókò díẹ̀ lẹ́nu iṣẹ́ ìwàásù.
target: Every believer must preach and spend some time preaching.

input: Wọ́n sábà máa ń sọ pé, ‘Ohun tí Bíbélì sọ nìyí.’
target: They generally say, ‘Here is what the Bible says.’

input: Ẹnì kan lè ṣí Bíbélì kí òun fúnra rẹ̀ sì yẹ̀ ẹ́ wò.
target: A person can take the Bible and check for himself.

input: Bó bá fara mọ́ ohun tí Bíbélì sọ, á dara pọ̀ mọ́ wọn.
target: If he agrees, he will join them.

input: Bí kò bá sì fara mọ́ ọn, kò ní dara pọ̀ mọ́ wọn.
target: If he disagrees, he will not join them.

input: Wọ́n kì í fipá múni.
target: There is no coercion.

input: Ẹ̀sùn tí wọ́n fi kan àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà pé wọ́n jẹ́ agbawèrèmẹ́sìn.
target: The accusation that Jehovah’s Witnesses are extremists.

input: Ohun tó mú kí ìjọba kọ́kọ́ sọ pé agbawèrèmẹ́sìn làwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ni pé àwọn ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n kan sọ pé àwọn ìwé wọn kan sọ pé àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà nìkan ló ń ṣe ìsìn tòótọ́ àti pé àwọn ìsìn tó kù jẹ́ ìsìn èké.
target: Initially, certain publications of Jehovah’s Witnesses were declared extremist because experts claimed that these publications asserted that the religion of Jehovah’s Witnesses is the only true religion and all others are false.

input: Àwọn ẹlẹ́sìn míì náà máa ń sọ irú ọ̀rọ̀ bẹ́ẹ̀, àmọ́ àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ni wọ́n fẹ̀sùn kan nínú ẹjọ́ tó wà nílẹ̀ yìí.
target: Other denominations make similar claims, but in this case the accusations were made against Jehovah’s Witnesses.

input: Wọ́n ka ohun táwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà sọ pé ìsìn àwọn nìkan ni ìsìn tòótọ́ àti pé àwọn ìsìn tó kù jẹ́ èké sí ìpolongo ẹ̀tàn.
target: The assertions that their religion is the only true one and all others are false were interpreted as propaganda of religious superiority.

input: Lójú tèmí gẹ́gẹ́ bí onímọ̀ nípa ẹ̀sìn, ìpinnu ti ilé ẹjọ́ ṣe yìí ò tọ̀nà, torí pé béèyàn bá yàn láti wádìí ọ̀rọ̀ náà wò, kò sí ẹlẹ́sìn tí ò ní sọ pé tòun ni ìsìn tòótọ́, ìsìn èké làwọn tó kù tàbí pé wọ́n ti ṣì wọ́n lọ́nà.
target: From my standpoint as a religious scholar, a weakness of the court decision is that a person, if so inclined, could find assertions by any religious denomination that its religion is the only true religion and that all others are false or have been misled.

input: Gbogbo ẹlẹ́sìn ló máa ń sọ pé tiwọn nìkan ni ìsìn tòótọ́, tí wọ́n á sì ka àwọn ẹ̀sìn tó kù sí ẹ̀sìn èké tàbí èyí tí kò fi taratara jóòótọ́.
target: To say that believers consider their religion to be the absolute truth and to consider other religions to be either absolutely false or mostly false certainly describes any religious person.

input: Bó ṣe yẹ kó rí náà nìyẹn àfi bí wọ́n bá máa ṣe àgàbàgebè ló kù.
target: It must be the case or one would be considered a hypocrite.

input: Àmọ́, àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà máa ń sapá nígbà gbogbo láti pa òfin ìjọba mọ́ bí kò bá ti forí gbárí pẹ̀lú òfin Ọlọ́run.
target: However, to the extent that God’s laws do not conflict with secular laws, Jehovah’s Witnesses diligently and consistently strive to obey secular laws.

input: Ìdí nìyẹn tá a fi máa ń gbọ́ pé àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà dá pọ́ọ̀sì tí wọ́n rí he pa dà, wọ́n sì sanwó ìtanràn tàbí owó orí bó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé wọ́n lè ṣàì ṣe bẹ́ẹ̀.
target: There is a reason why there are so many reports of Jehovah’s Witnesses returning lost wallets and paying fines or taxes that they could evade.

input: Ìpinnu àtọkànwá lèyí jẹ́ mi ò sì ní fi ẹ̀sùn kàn wọ́n pé wọ́n jẹ́ agbawèrèmẹ́sìn tó wulẹ̀ ń díbọ́n.
target: This is a conscious decision and I would not accuse them of any extremist pretense.

input: Àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà Máa Ń Lo Bíbélì.
target: Jehovah’s Witnesses and the Bible.

input: Ohun kan tó ṣàrà ọ̀tọ̀ nípa àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ni pé wọ́n máa ń lo onírúurú ìtumọ̀ Bíbélì fún ìkẹ́kọ̀ọ́ àti lẹ́nu iṣẹ́ ìwàásù wọn.
target: Something unique about Jehovah’s Witnesses is that they use various Bible translations for study and in the ministry.

input: Wọ́n rí i bí ohun tó ṣe pàtàkì pé kí wọ́n mú káwọn èèyàn ní Bíbélì ní oríṣiríṣi èdè.
target: They take great interest in distributing the Bible in different languages.

input: Wọn ò dà bí àwọn ẹlẹ́sìn yòókù torí pé wọ́n pọkàn pọ̀ sórí Bíbélì.
target: In this respect, they are uniquely Bible-centric.

input: Àwọn aláṣẹ ka ìtumọ̀ Bíbélì wọn sí ìwé àwọn agbawèrèmẹ́sìn .
target: Their Bible translation was actually declared extremist here .

input: Bóyá àwọn tó ṣe ìpinnu yẹn rò pé àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ti fẹ́ràn Bíbélì wọn jù àti pé wọ́n á ṣíwọ́ iṣẹ́ ìwàásù tí wọn ò bá jẹ́ kí wọ́n lo Bíbélì yẹn mọ́.
target: Perhaps those behind that decision thought that Jehovah’s Witnesses were exclusively attached to that translation and that Jehovah’s Witnesses would give up if it was eliminated from the game.

input: Àṣìrò nìyẹn jẹ́.
target: That was a wrong assumption.

input: Àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ò fọwọ́ rọ́ ìtumọ̀ Bíbélì kankan sẹ́yìn.
target: Jehovah’s Witnesses see the value in each translation of the Bible.

input: Lílo àjọ tó ń bójú tó iṣẹ́ wa lábẹ́ òfin.
target: The use of legal entities for practicing faith.

input: Ìpinnu Ilé Ẹjọ́ Gíga Jù Lọ ti Orílẹ̀-Èdè Rọ́ṣíà fi hàn pé.èyí tó pọ̀ jù nínú ìjọ àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà kò ní àjọ tó ń bójú tó iṣẹ́ wọn lábẹ́ òfin .
target: The decision of the Supreme Court of the Russian Federation shows that .the majority of congregations of Jehovah’s Witnesses did not have a legal entity .

input: Torí náà, kò tọ̀nà láti sọ pé olúkúlùkù Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà tó wà ní agbègbè pàtó kan gbọ́dọ̀ jẹ́ ara àjọ tó ń bójú tó iṣẹ́ wọn lábẹ́ òfin.
target: Therefore, it is not accurate to say that every one of Jehovah’s Witnesses in a certain area is automatically a member of a legal entity.

input: Ní ti àwọn àjọ tó ń bójú tó iṣẹ́ wọn lábẹ́ òfin ., mo fara balẹ̀ ṣàyẹ̀wò ìwé òfin tí wọ́n fi dá wọn sílẹ̀, wọn ò dárúkọ alábòójútó, alàgbà, aṣáájú-ọ̀nà irú àwọn ọ̀rọ̀ bẹ́ẹ̀ ò sí níbẹ̀.
target: As for the legal entities ., I carefully studied their charters, in which there is no mention of overseers, elders, pioneers such terms are not found therein.

input: Orúkọ àwọn olùdásílẹ̀ àjọ náà ló máa ń wà níbẹ̀, àwùjọ kéréje tí kì í ju nǹkan bí èèyàn mẹ́wàá lọ.
target: The charters usually refer to founders, a limited group of approximately ten persons.

input: Àwọn tí orúkọ wọn ò sí nínú ìwé yẹn kọ́ ló ń ṣojú fún òfin, ohun tó jẹ mọ́ ọ̀rọ̀ ẹ̀sìn àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ni wọ́n ń bójú tó.
target: When it comes to purely canonical activity, they represent not the legal, but the canonical aspect of the activity of Jehovah’s Witnesses.

input: Ohun táwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ń ṣe ò sì yàtọ̀ síra láìka orílẹ̀-èdè tàbí ẹkùn ìpínlẹ̀ tí wọ́n wà sí.
target: Their activity remains the same regardless of country or region.

input: Ṣe ni àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà gbìyànjú láti fara mọ́ ìpinnu Ilé Ẹjọ́ Gíga Jù Lọ tó fi òfin de àjọ tó ń bójú tó iṣẹ́ wọn lábẹ́ òfin yìí kí wọ́n má bàa ta ko ìpinnu Ilé Ẹjọ́ Gíga Jù Lọ náà délẹ̀délẹ̀.
target: Jehovah’s Witnesses took note of the Supreme Court decision that liquidated their legal entities only by trying not to violate this Supreme Court decision outright.

input: Torí náà, wọ́n ń bá iṣẹ́ wọn nìṣó gẹ́gẹ́ bí ẹ̀sìn tí àwọn aláṣẹ ò fi òfin dè.
target: At the same time, they continue their activity as a religious denomination that has not been banned by the authorities.

input: Wọ́n ń bá iṣẹ́ wọn lọ bí olùjọsìn tó wà láyè ara ẹ̀.
target: They continue their activity as private individuals who are practicing their religion.

input: Lójú wọn àti bí ìwádìí nípa ẹ̀sìn ṣe fi hàn, iṣẹ́ wọn ò ta ko ìpinnu Ilé Ẹjọ́ Gíga Jù Lọ.
target: From their perspective and from the standpoint of religious studies, their activity does not violate the Supreme Court decision.

input: Ojú tí àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà fi ń wo gbígba ẹ̀jẹ̀.
target: Jehovah’s Witnesses and blood transfusions.

input: Bíbélì sọ pé ‘inú ẹ̀jẹ̀ ni ẹ̀mí wà’ torí náà ẹ kò gbọ́dọ̀ jẹ ẹ̀jẹ̀.
target: The Bible says that ‘life is in the blood’ therefore, blood should never be used.

input: Ọ̀rọ̀ nípa irú oúnjẹ téèyàn ò gbọ́dọ̀ jẹ ni ibí yìí ń sọ, amọ́ wọ́n mú kí ìtumọ̀ rẹ̀ túbọ̀ gbòòrò.
target: The context is a dietary prohibition, but they interpret it more broadly.

input: Wọ́n gbà pé èèyàn ò gbọ́dọ̀ jẹ ẹ̀jẹ̀ ní ọ̀nà èyíkéyìí, yálà nínú oúnjẹ wọn kì í jẹ sọ́séèjì tí wọ́n po ẹ̀jẹ̀ mọ́ tàbí nípa gbígbà á sára.
target: They believe that blood should not be used in any form, not in food they do not eat blood sausage nor as a blood transfusion.

input: Ṣùgbọ́n, wọ́n máa ń lo àwọn ìpín kékeré látara èròjà ẹ̀jẹ̀.
target: They do, however, accept minor blood fractions.

input: Ẹnì kọ̀ọ̀kan ló máa pinnu ìyẹn .
target: It is up to each believer .

input: Kì í ṣe pé wọ́n fẹ́ kú ni wọ́n ṣe ń sọ pé àwọn ò gbẹ̀jẹ̀, ṣe ni wọ́n fẹ́ ìtọ́jú tó péye àti àbójútó ìṣègùn tó dáa.
target: By refusing a blood transfusion they are not choosing to die, instead, they want quality treatment and first-rate medical assistance.

input: Wọ́n mọ̀, àwọn oníṣègùn náà sì gbà pé ìgbẹ̀jẹ̀sára léwu torí pé ẹni tó gbẹ̀jẹ̀ sára lè kó àrùn Éèdì tàbí irú àrùn míì.
target: Blood transfusions, in their view and from various medical standpoints, come with a risk because a person can contract AIDS or something else.

input: Iṣẹ́ abẹ láìlo ẹ̀jẹ̀ ló fọkàn ẹni balẹ̀ jù, mo sì ti rí i nígbà tí mo ṣàyẹ̀wò àkọsílẹ̀ ìṣirò pé àwọn ọlọ́rọ̀ kì í sábà fẹ́ láti gbẹ̀jẹ̀ torí pé ìyẹn ni ò ní jẹ́ kí wọ́n kó àrùn tàbí kí wọ́n ní ìṣòro.
target: Bloodless surgeries provide a higher guarantee, and I see from examining the statistics that wealthy people often prefer to forgo blood transfusions because this guarantees better protection from infections and complications.

input: Ojú tí àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà fi ń wo ọrẹ.
target: Jehovah’s Witnesses and donations.

input: Ẹnì kan lè pinnu pé òun ò ní fi owó ṣètọrẹ.
target: A person can choose not to make any donations.

input: Ó ṣeé ṣe kí ẹnì kan fi gbogbo ọjọ́ ayé rẹ̀ lọ sí ìpàdé àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà kó má sì dá kọ́bọ̀.
target: Theoretically speaking, one can actually attend meetings of Jehovah’s Witnesses his whole life and never contribute a single ruble or dollar.

input: Ọwọ́ ẹnì kọ̀ọ̀kan ló kù sí láti pinnu bóyá òun á fi owó ṣètọrẹ tàbí òun ò ní ṣe bẹ́ẹ̀.
target: It is up to each individual whether to contribute or not.

input: Bó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé ọ̀mọ̀wé Ivanenko fi ìdánilójú jẹ́rìí sí i pé àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà kì í ṣe arúfin, wọ́n sì máa ń pa òfin mọ́, ilé ẹjọ́ kó àlàyé rẹ dà nù wọ́n sì ní kí àwọn arákùnrin mẹ́fẹ̀ẹ̀fà lọ lògbà tó yàtọ̀ síra lẹ́wọ̀n.
target: Although Dr.Ivanenko authoritatively testified that Jehovah’s Witnesses are conscientious, law-abiding Christians, the court ignored his arguments and sentenced all six brothers to various terms of imprisonment.

input: Ní February 14, 2020, Ilé-Ẹjọ́ ìlú ńlá Vilyuchinsk dá Arákùnrin Mikhail Popov àti ìyàwó rẹ̀ Arábìnrin Yelena Popov lẹ́bi.
target: On February 14, 2020, the Vilyuchinsk City Court convicted Brother Mikhail Popov and his wife, Sister Yelena Popova.

input: Ilé-Ẹjọ́ ní kí Arákùnrin Mikhail Popov san 350,000 rubles 5,508 U.S.owó ìtanràn, wọ́n sì ní kí ìyàwó rẹ̀ Arábìnrin Yelena Popov san 300,000 rubles 4,722 U.S., àmọ́ wọn ò fi wọ́n sẹ́wọ̀n rárá.
target: The court fined them 350,000 rubles 5,508 U.S.and 300,000 rubles 4,722 U.S., respectively, but did not sentence them to any prison time.

input: Àwọn méjèèjì máa pe ẹjọ́ kòtẹ́milọ́rùn lórí ìdájọ́ yìí.
target: They will both appeal their convictions.

input: Ìjọba mú Mikhail àti Yelena ní July 2018.
target: Mikhail and Yelena were arrested in July 2018.

input: Kò sì pẹ́ tí wọ́n fi wọ́n sílẹ̀, wọ́n sì ní kí wọ́n máa dúró de ìdájọ́ wọn.
target: Shortly afterward, they were released to await trial.

input: Láti ọdún 2019, ilé-ẹjọ́ orílẹ̀-èdè Rọ́ṣíà ti dá àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà méjìdínlọ́gbọ̀n 28 lẹ́bi nítorí ìgbàgbọ́ wọn.
target: Since 2019, Russian courts have convicted 28 Jehovah’s Witnesses for their faith.

input: Nínú oṣù méjì tó kọjá nìkan, mẹ́wàá nínú àwọn arákùnrin àti àwọn arábìnrin wọ̀nyí ni wọ́n dá lẹ́bi.Àmọ́, wọn ò tíì fi wọ́n sẹ́wọ̀n báyìí.
target: Ten of these brothers and sisters were convicted in just the last two months.However, these ten are not currently imprisoned.

input: Ní Friday, August 30, 2019, Arákùnrin Valeriy Moskalenko sọ ọ̀rọ̀ àsọkágbá rẹ̀ fún ilé ẹjọ́.
target: On Friday, August 30, 2019, Brother Valeriy Moskalenko delivered his concluding comments to the court.

input: Díẹ̀ rèé tá a túmọ̀ láti èdè Rọ́ṣíà lára ọ̀rọ̀ tó sọ níwájú ilé ẹjọ́
target: The following is a partial transcript translated from Russian of his testimonial

input: Ọ̀gá Àgbà àti gbogbo ẹ̀yin ọlọ́lá tó wà níkàlẹ̀, ọmọ ọdún méjìléláàádọ́ta 52 ni mí, ọdún tó kọjá yìí ni wọ́n fi mí sí àtìmọ́lé.
target: Your Honor and distinguished attendants, I am 52 years old and the past year I have been kept in custody.

input: Tàbí kí n kúkú sọ ní tààràtà pé ó ti lé ní ọdún kan báyìí.
target: To be exact, it has been over a year now.

input: Nínú ọ̀rọ̀ àsọkágbá mi fún ilé ẹjọ́ yìí, mo fẹ́ ṣàlàyé ṣókí fún yín nípa ara mi, ojú ti mo fi wo ẹ̀sùn ọ̀daràn tí wọ́n fi kàn mí àti ọwọ́ tí mo fi mú ìwàláàyè.
target: In my final words at this court session, I want to tell you briefly about myself, how I view the criminal charges, and about my personal view of life.

input: Ọ̀gá Àgbà, mo nírètí pé ẹ máa lóye ìdí ti mi ò fi ní sẹ́ ìgbàgbọ́ tí mo ní nínú Ọlọ́run àti ìdí kò fi sí ẹ̀ṣẹ̀ nínú kéèyàn gba Ọlọ́run gbọ́.
target: I hope very much that you, Your Honor, will understand why I will not renounce my faith in God and why believing in God is not a crime.

input: Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà kọ́ ni mí látilẹ̀ wá.
target: I have not always been one of Jehovah’s Witnesses.

input: Èèyàn rere làwọn òbí mi wọ́n sì kọ́ mi dáadáa, síbẹ̀ látìgbà tí mo ti wà lọ́mọdé ló ti máa ń dùn mí pé ìwà ìrẹ́jẹ kún ibi gbogbo.
target: My parents were kind and gave me a good upbringing, but even as a child it bothered me that there was so much injustice everywhere.

input: Mo máa ń ronú pé, ‘Kì í ṣe bó ṣe yẹ kí nǹkan rí nìyí, àwọn ẹni ibi àtàwọn ẹlẹ́tàn ń gbèrú, àwọn olóòótọ́ àti ẹni rere sì ń jìyà.’
target: I thought, ‘This is not the way it should be—evil people and deceivers flourish, and honest and kind people suffer.’

input: Nígbà tí mo wà lọ́mọ ọdún mẹ́rìnlélógún 24, mo ṣèwádìí gan-an nínú Bíbélì fún ọ̀pọ̀ oṣù, mo sì rí ìdáhùn sí àwọn ìbéèrè mi.
target: At the age of 24, having seriously researched and studied the Bible for several months, I found answers to my questions.

input: Àtìgbà ló ti jẹ́ pé kí n tó ṣe ìpinnu, mo kọ́kọ́ máa ń ronú nípa ojú tí Ọlọ́run á fi wo ohun tí mo fẹ́ ṣe, màá sì tún ronú nípa àwọn òfin àti ìlànà rẹ̀.
target: Since then, I have been trying to make decisions that take into account God’s feelings, laws, and principles, which are described in detail

input: Bíbélì ṣàlàyé àwọn òfin àti ìlànà náà ní kíkún, èèyàn sì lè mọ púpọ̀ sí i nípa wọn téèyàn bá kẹ́kọ̀ọ́ nípa àwọn tó sin Ọlọ́run nígbà àtijọ́.
target: in the Bible and are exemplified in the lives of worshippers who lived in the past.

input: Inú ilé kan náà ni èmi àti màmá mi ń gbé.
target: I live with my mother in the same flat.

input: Wọ́n ti dàgbà, ó sì yẹ kí n máa tọ́jú wọn.
target: She is elderly and needs my care.

input: Ní August 1, 2018, nígbà tí màmá mi nìkan wà nínú ilé, Àwọn Òṣìṣẹ́ Aláàbò ti Ìjọba FSB tí wọ́n ń ṣe iṣẹ́ ìwádìí sọ fún Àwọn Ọlọ́pàá Àkànṣe pé kí wọ́n fi ayùn rẹ́ ilẹ̀kùn iwájú ìta ilé wa kúrò lára férémù.
target: On August 1, 2018, when my mother was home alone, the Federal Security Service FSB investigator instructed the Special Forces to saw through the hinges of our front door.

input: Ọ̀nà tí ẹni tó wá ṣèwádìí náà yàn láti gbà wọnú ilé mí nìyẹn o.
target: This is the way the investigator intended to enter my flat to conduct a search.

input: Ẹ̀rù ba màmá mi gan-an.
target: My mother was very frightened.

input: Lẹ́yìn tí Àwọn Ọlọ́pàá Àkànṣe tó da aṣọ bojú náà já wọnú ilé wa, àyà màmá mi jà débi pé wọ́n ní àrùn ọkàn wọ́n sì ní láti pe áńbúláǹsì kó wá gbé wọn.
target: After the masked Special Forces broke into our flat, my mother had a heart attack and an ambulance had to be called.

input: Ọgbọ̀n ìṣẹ́jú lẹ́yìn tí mo gbọ́ pé àwọn ọlọ́pàá ti lọ sí ilé wa ni mo pa dà délé.
target: Upon learning that the police were in my home, I arrived 30 minutes later.

input: Nígbà tí mo rí ipò tí màmá mi wà, ìfúnpá tèmi náà ga sí i.Láìka gbogbo èyí sí, mi ò fi ṣèbínú, ṣe ni mo fọwọ́ wọ́nú.
target: When I saw my mother’s condition, my own blood pressure spiked.

input: Mò ń fi ìfẹ́ hùwà, bó ṣe yẹ kí Kristẹni ṣe.
target: Despite all this, I did not get angry and I tried to maintain my composure.I was kind—as befits a Christian.

input: Ohun tí Jèhófà, Ọlọ́run mi fi kọ́ mi nìyẹn, mi ò sì fẹ́ ṣe ohun tó máa mú un bínú.
target: My God, Jehovah, taught me that and I don’t want to displease him.

input: Ẹ forí jì mí, Ọ̀gá Àgbà, èmi kì í sọ̀rọ̀ nípa ara mi tó báyìí.
target: I’m sorry, your Honor, I usually don’t talk about myself this much.

input: Kì í ṣe ìwà mi, ọ̀rọ̀ ló bá mo-kó-mo-rò wá o.
target: It’s not my habit, but now I must do so.

input: Ó lé ní ọdún mẹ́ẹ̀ẹ́dọ́gbọ̀n 25 tí mo ti di Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà.
target: I have been one of Jehovah’s Witnesses for over 25 years.

input: Ẹ̀sìn tí mo fi èyí tó pọ̀ jù nínú ìgbésí ayé mi ṣe nìyẹn.
target: That is a large portion of my life.

input: Látìgbà tí mo sì ti ń ṣe ẹ̀sìn náà, kò sẹ́ni tó kà mí sí agbawèrèmẹ́sìn rí.
target: And all this time I have never been considered an extremist.

input: Kàkà bẹ́ẹ̀, aládùúgbò rere làwọn èèyàn kà mí sí, ẹni tó ń fi tọkàntọkàn ṣiṣẹ́ àti ọmọ tó ń tọ́jú òbí ẹ̀.
target: On the contrary, I was known as a good neighbor, a conscientious worker, and a caring son.

input: Ṣàdédé ni wọ́n bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí í pè mí ní agbawèrèmẹ́sìn láti April 20, 2017.
target: Suddenly, since April 20, 2017, I have been called an extremist.

input: Torí kí ni
target: On what grounds

input: Ìwà búburú wo ní wọ́n bá lọ́wọ́ mi
target: What has changed

input: Ṣé mo ti ń hùwà àìdá ni Rárá o.
target: Have I become worse No.

input: Ṣé mo ti di oníwà ipá ni àbí mo ti di ẹni tó ń fi ìyà jẹ àwọn míì tó sì ń fa ìrora fún wọn Rárá o.
target: Have I become violent or caused someone pain and suffering No.

input: Ṣé mi ò lẹ́tọ̀ọ́ láti jàǹfààní ohun tí Abala Kejìdínlọ́gbọ̀n nínú Òfin Orílẹ̀-Èdè Rọ́ṣíà sọ ni
target: Have I lost the right to avail myself of Article 28 of the Russian Constitution

input: Orúkọ mi ò sí lára àwọn tí Ilé Ẹjọ́ Gíga Jù Lọ gbọ́ ẹjọ́ wọn.
target: My name was not listed in the decision of the Supreme Court.

input: Kò sẹ́ni tó gba ẹ̀tọ́ àtilo Òfin Orílẹ̀-Èdè Rọ́ṣíà lọ́wọ́ mi, pàápàá jù lọ Abala Kejìdínlọ́gbọ̀n.
target: Nobody has deprived me of the right to use the Constitution of the Russian Federation, in particular Article 28.

input: Kí ló wá sọ mí di ẹni tó ń jẹ́jọ́ nílé ẹjọ́
target: Then why am I here at the defendant’s bench

input: Nínú ọ̀rọ̀ tí èmi àti olùṣèwádìí jọ sọ, ó túbọ̀ ṣe kedere pé torí pé mo gba Jèhófà, Ọlọ́run Olódùmarè gbọ́ mo sì ń lo orúkọ rẹ̀ nínú àdúrà àti ọ̀rọ̀ mi ni wọ́n ṣe mú mi tí wọ́n sì fi mí sí àtìmọ́lé.
target: From my conversations with the investigator, it became even more evident that I was arrested and held in custody because I am a believer who uses the name of the Almighty God, Jehovah, in my prayers and speech.

input: Àmọ́, ẹ̀ṣẹ̀ ò sí nínú ìyẹn.
target: But this is not a crime.

input: Ọlọ́run ló sọ ara rẹ̀ lórúkọ, tó sì rí i dájú pé orúkọ náà wà nínú Bíbélì.
target: God himself has chosen his name and made sure that it was recorded in the Bible.

input: Mò ń sọ ọ́ léraléra pé mi ò ní ta ko ohun tí Ọlọ́run bá pa láṣẹ lọ́nà tó ṣe kedere nínú Bíbélì.
target: I repeat again and again, it is completely unthinkable for me to go against the will of God that is clearly expressed in the Bible.

input: Bó sì ti wù kéèyàn yọ mí lẹ́nu tàbí kó jẹ mí níyà tó, kódà tí wọ́n bá dájọ́ ikú fún mi, mo fẹ́ kó di mímọ̀ pé mi ò ní fi Jèhófà Ọlọ́run, Ẹlẹ́dàá ayé òun ọ̀run sílẹ̀ láé.
target: And regardless of how I might be pressured or punished—even if I were sentenced to death—I declare that not even then would I abandon the almighty Creator of the universe, Jehovah God.

input: Ọ̀gá Àgbà, ibi gbogbo kárí ayé ni wọ́n ti mọ àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà sí ẹni tó dùn ún bá rìn àti ẹni tó nífẹ̀ẹ́ àlàáfíà.
target: Your Honor, Jehovah’s Witnesses are known throughout the world as friendly and peace-loving people.

input: Ní ọ̀pọ̀ orílẹ̀-èdè kárí ayé, wọ́n kì í fi ẹ̀tọ́ tí wọ́n ní láti gba Ọlọ́run gbọ́ dù wọ́n.
target: Their rights as believers are respected in the vast majority of countries around the world.

input: Ó máa wù mí pé ká má ṣe fi ẹ̀tọ́ àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà dù wọ́n ní orílẹ̀-èdè Rọ́ṣíà náà, kò sì ní yẹ kí ilé ẹjọ́ yìí fi ẹ̀tọ́ tí mo ní láti gba Ọlọ́run gbọ́ dù mí.
target: I would very much like the rights of believers to be respected in Russia as well and, in this instance, my rights as a believer.

input: Mi ò jẹ̀bi ẹ̀sùn tí wọ́n fi kàn mí, mo sì rọ ilé ẹjọ́ yìí láti má ṣe dá mi lẹ́bi
target: I am not guilty of the crime of which I am accused and I ask the court to render a not guilty verdict

input: Ẹ ṣeun
target: Thank you

input: Àwọn ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n lórí ọ̀rọ̀ òfin ti àjọ Ìṣọ̀kan Àgbáyé ti sọ pé bí ìjọba Rọ́ṣíà ṣe fàṣẹ ọba mú Arákùnrin Dmitriy Mikhaylov tí wọ́n sì fi í sẹ́wọ̀n nítorí ohun tó gbà gbọ́ fi hàn pé wọ́n hùwà àìtọ́ sí i, wọ́n sì ti tẹ òfin àpapọ̀ àwọn ìjọba lójú.
target: A United Nations UN panel of international legal experts has concluded that Russia’s arrest and detention of Brother Dmitriy Mikhaylov was discriminatory on the basis of religion and thus violated international law.

input: Àwùjọ àwọn ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n náà tún rọ ìjọba Rọ́ṣíà pé wọn ò gbọ́dọ̀ fẹ̀sùn ìwà ọ̀daràn èyíkéyìí kan Arákùnrin Mikhaylov mọ́.
target: They also urged Russia to drop all criminal charges against Brother Mikhaylov.

input: Ó tó ojú ìwé méjìlá tí ìgbìmọ̀ tí wọ́n ń pè ní Working Group on Arbitrary Detention WGAD fi kọ èrò wọn nípa Arákùnrin Mikhaylov, wọ́n sọ pé kò sígbà tó ṣe ohun tó dí àlàáfíà ìlú lọ́wọ́.
target: According to the 12-page opinion of the panel, the Working Group on Arbitrary Detention WGAD, Brother Mikhaylov’s actions have always been entirely peaceful.

input: Yàtọ̀ síyẹn, kò sí ẹ̀rí kankan tó fi hàn pé òun tàbí Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà èyíkéyìí lórílẹ̀-èdè Rọ́ṣíà jẹ́ oníwà ipá, wọn kì í sì í rọ àwọn míì pé kí wọ́n hùwà ipá.
target: Additionally, there is no evidence that he or indeed the Jehovah’s Witnesses in the Russian Federation have ever been violent or incited others to violence.

input: Ìgbìmọ̀ WGAD wá pinnu pé ńṣe ni Arákùnrin Mikhaylov kàn lo ẹ̀tọ́ tó ní láti ṣe ìsìn tó wù ú kò sì yẹ kí wọ́n fàṣẹ ọba mú un débi tí wọ́n á fi jù ú sí àhámọ́ láìgbọ́ ẹjọ́ ẹ̀.
target: The WGAD concluded that Brother Mikhaylov did nothing more than exercise his right to freedom of religion and should not have been arrested and held in pretrial detention.

input: Nítorí náà, ó yẹ kí ìjọba san owó ìtanràn fún un torí pé kò ráyè ṣiṣẹ́ ní gbogbo àkókò tó fi wà lẹ́wọ̀n, àti pé wọ́n jù ú sẹ́wọ̀n láì jẹ̀bi ẹ̀sùn tí wọ́n fi kàn án.
target: Therefore, he is entitled to compensation for his lost wages as well as for his personal loss of freedom while he was unlawfully detained.

input: Ìgbìmọ̀ WGAD tún kíyè sí i pé kì í ṣe Arákùnrin Mikhaylov nìkan ni wọ́n ń fìyà jẹ nítorí ohun tó gbà gbọ́.
target: The WGAD also recognized that Brother Mikhaylov is not alone in suffering injustice for his faith.

input: Torí náà, ìgbìmọ̀ WGAD jẹ́ kó ṣe kedere pé kì í ṣe Arákùnrin Mikhaylov nìkan lọ̀rọ̀ yìí kàn, ó tún kan bí wọ́n ṣe ń fi gbogbo àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà sẹ́wọ̀n láìtọ́ lọ́nà tó jọ ti Ọ̀gbẹ́ni Mikhaylov.
target: Thus, in an effort to condemn the broader persecution of our fellow worshippers in Russia, the WGAD explicitly stated that their opinion applied not only to Brother Mikhaylov’s wrongful detention but to all Jehovah’s Witnesses who are in situations similar to that of Mr.Mikhaylov.

input: Ọ̀dọ́ ni Arákùnrin Mikhaylov nígbà tó bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí kẹ́kọ̀ọ́ Bíbélì, ó sì ṣèrìbọmi nígbà tó pé ọmọ ọdún mẹ́rìndínlógún 16 lọ́dún 1993.
target: Brother Mikhaylov began studying the Bible as a teenager and was baptized in 1993, when he was 16 years old.

input: Lọ́dún 2003, ó fẹ́ Yelena, àwọn méjèèjì sì jọ ń sin Jèhófà.
target: In 2003, he married Yelena, and they began serving Jehovah together.

input: Lọ́dún 2018, Arákùnrin àti Arábìnrin Mikhaylov kíyè sí i pé fún ọ̀pọ̀ oṣù làwọn aláṣẹ ti ń ṣọ́ wọn ni ti pé wọ́n ń tẹ́tí sí ọ̀rọ̀ wọn lórí fóònù, wọ́n sì tọ́jú kámẹ́rà sílé wọn.
target: In 2018, Brother and Sister Mikhaylov discovered that the authorities had been tapping their phones and had them under video surveillance for several months.

input: Ní April 19, 2018, Ìgbìmọ̀ Tó Ń Ṣèwádìí ní Àgbègbè Ivanovo Lórílẹ̀-èdè Rọ́ṣíà fẹ̀sùn ìwà ọ̀daràn kan Arákùnrin Mikhaylov, làwọn ọlọ́pàá tó dira ogun bá lọ tú ilé rẹ̀ yẹ́bẹ́yẹ́bẹ́.
target: On April 19, 2018, the Investigation Committee of the Russian Federation in the Ivanovo region opened a criminal case against Brother Mikhaylov and heavily armed officers came to search his home.

input: Kò ju oṣù kan lẹ́yìn ìyẹn, wọ́n fàṣẹ ọba mú un wọ́n sì jù ú sẹ́wọ̀n, wọ́n fẹ̀sùn kàn án pé ó ń fi owó ṣètìlẹ́yìn fáwọn agbawèrèmẹ́sìn.
target: A little over a month later, he was arrested and detained, under the claim of financing extremist activity.

input: Wọ́n tú u sílẹ̀ lẹ́yìn tó ti fẹ́rẹ̀ẹ́ lo oṣù mẹ́fà lẹ́wọ̀n.
target: After spending nearly six months—171 days—in pretrial detention, he was released.

input: Torí pé ìwádìí ṣì ń lọ lọ́wọ́ lórí ẹjọ́ rẹ̀, àwọn aláṣẹ ò jẹ́ kó rìnrìn-àjò, wọ́n sì ń ṣọ́ ọ lọ́wọ́ lẹ́sẹ̀ bó ṣe ń bá àwọn èèyàn sọ̀rọ̀.
target: However, his travel and communication are restricted for as long as the authorities keep his criminal investigation open.

input: Ó ṣeé ṣe kó jẹ́ pé ìpinnu tí ìgbìmọ̀ WGAD ṣe yìí ló mú kí ìjọba orílẹ̀-èdè Kazakhstan dá Arákùnrin Teymur Akhmedov sílẹ̀ lẹ́wọ̀n.
target: A similar WGAD opinion likely effected change in the case of Brother Teymur Akhmedov from Kazakhstan.

input: Lọ́dún 2017, wọ́n fàṣẹ ọba mú un, wọ́n sì rán an lọ sí ẹ̀wọ̀n ọdún márùn-ún torí pé ó ń sọ ohun tó gbà gbọ́ fáwọn ẹlòmíì láìfi dí àlàáfíà ìlú lọ́wọ́.
target: In 2017, he was arrested and subsequently sentenced to a five-year term for peacefully sharing his faith with others.

input: Gbogbo ilé ẹjọ́ tó wà ní Kazakhstan ni wọ́n gbé ẹjọ́ náà lọ, àmọ́ kò lójú, ni agbẹjọ́rò Arákùnrin Akhmedov bá gbé ẹjọ́ náà lọ sọ́dọ̀ ìgbìmọ̀ WGAD.
target: Having exhausted all domestic remedies, lawyers for Brother Akhmedov filed a complaint with the WGAD.

input: Nínú ìpinnu tí ìgbìmọ̀ WGAD ṣe ní October 2, 2017, wọ́n ní ìwà tí àwọn aláṣẹ orílẹ̀-èdè Kazakhstan hù kò dáa, wọ́n sì ní kí wọ́n tú Arákùnrin Akhmedov sílẹ̀.
target: In their opinion dated October 2, 2017, the WGAD condemned the actions of the Kazakh authorities and called for Brother Akhmedov’s release.

input: Lẹ́yìn oṣù mẹ́fà, ààrẹ orílẹ̀-èdè Kazakhstan wá sọ ọ́ ní gbangba pé Arákùnrin Akhmedov kì í ṣe ọ̀daràn.
target: Six months later, the president of Kazakhstan pardoned Brother Akhmedov.

input: Ní April 4, 2018, wọ́n dá a sílẹ̀ lẹ́wọ̀n.
target: He was released from custody on April 4, 2018.

input: Yálà orílẹ̀-èdè Rọ́ṣíà máa ṣe ohun tí ìgbìmọ̀ WGAD ní kí wọ́n ṣe fún Arákùnrin Mikhaylov tàbí wọn ò ní ṣe bẹ́ẹ̀, ọkàn wa balẹ̀ torí Bíbélì sọ pé Aláyọ̀ ni ọkùnrin tí ó fi Jèhófà ṣe ibi ààbò.
target: Regardless of how Russia responds to the decision of the WGAD in Brother Mikhaylov’s case,Happy is the man who takes refuge in Jehovah.

input: Àdúrà wa ni pé kí Jèhófà máa bójú tó àwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin wa tí wọ́n ń fi ẹ̀sùn ìwà ọ̀daràn kàn ní Rọ́ṣíà, kí wọ́n lè rí i pé gbogbo ẹni tó bá nígboyà tó sì gbẹ́kẹ̀ lé Jèhófà kò ní ṣaláìní ohun rere.​—⁠Sáàmù 34​8, 10.
target: We pray that Jehovah continues to care for our brothers and sisters in Russia who face criminal action, so they will further experience how all who courageously trust in Him will lack nothing good.—Psalm 348, 10.

input: Ó jẹ́ ìgbìmọ̀ àwọn ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n ẹlẹ́ni márùn-ún tí àjọ Ìṣọ̀kan Àgbáyé dá sílẹ̀, kí wọ́n lè máa ṣèwádìí àwọn tí ìjọba rán lọ sẹ́wọ̀n lọ́nà àìtọ́.
target: A UN panel of five international experts mandated to investigate cases of detention that are inconsistent with international standards set forth in the Universal Declaration of Human Rights and other international documents.

input: Ìgbìmọ̀ náà máa pinnu bóyá ìjọba ti tàpá sí òfin tí àpapọ̀ àwọn ìjọba là kalẹ̀ bó ṣe wà nínú Ìwé Ìpolongo Ẹ̀tọ́ Ọmọnìyàn Lágbàáyé àtàwọn ìwé míì.
target: In order to establish the facts, the Working Group on Arbitrary Detention WGAD has the right to receive information from the authorities and nongovernmental organizations.

input: Kí wọ́n ba à lè fìdí òtítọ́ múlẹ̀, ìgbìmọ̀ Working Group on Arbitrary Detention WGAD lẹ́tọ̀ọ́ láti wádìí ọ̀rọ̀ lọ́dọ̀ àwọn aláṣẹ àtàwọn iléeṣẹ́ tí kì í ṣe ti ìjọba kí wọ́n lè gba ìsọfúnni tí wọ́n nílò.
target: It also may meet with detainees and members of their families.

input: Ó tiẹ̀ lè gba pé kí wọ́n rí ẹni tí wọ́n fi sẹ́wọ̀n náà àti ìdílé rẹ̀.Lẹ́yìn náà, ìgbìmọ̀ WGAD á wá sọ ìpinnu àti àbá wọn fún ìjọba títí kan Àjọ Ẹ̀tọ́ Ọmọnìyàn ti Àjọ Ìṣọ̀kan Àgbáyé.
target: The WGAD presents its conclusions and recommendations to governments, as well as to the UN Human Rights Council.

input: Bó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé ìgbìmọ̀ WGAD ò lè fi dandan lé e pé kí ìjọba tẹ̀ lé ìpinnu wọn, wọ́n máa ń jẹ́ kí gbogbo èèyàn lágbàáyé mọ ìpinnu tí wọ́n bá ṣe.Ìyẹn sì lè mú káwọn aláṣẹ tẹ̀ lé ìpinnu wọn.
target: Although the opinions of the WGAD are not enforceable, they are often publicized and can generate international attention, which may influence world leaders to adhere to international law.

input: Láti October 9, 2018 táwọn agbófinró ti mú Anrzej Oniszczuk, tó jẹ́ ọmọ orílẹ̀-èdè Poland àti arákùnrin kan, wọn ò tíì gbọ́ ẹjọ́ wọn títí di báyìí.
target: Andrzej Oniszczuk, a Polish citizen and one of our dear brothers, has been in pretrial detention in Russia since security forces arrested him on October 9, 2018.

input: Ẹ̀karùn-ún rèé tí wọ́n máa sún àkókò tó fi wà látìmọ́lé síwájú.
target: His detention was recently extended for the fifth time.

input: October 2 ni wọ́n ṣètò pé kó parí àtìmọ́lé rẹ̀, ìyẹn ọjọ́ díẹ̀ kó pé ọdún kan tó ti wà ní àhámọ́.
target: His new term is scheduled to end on October 2, just days short of a year incarcerated.

input: Arákùnrin Andrzej àti ìyàwó rẹ̀ Anna, ṣáájú kí wọ́n tó mú un lọ sí àtìmọ́lé.
target: Andrzej, prior to being arrested, with his wife, Anna.

input: Wọn ò gba Anna láyè láti rí ọkọ rẹ̀ láti oṣù mẹ́wàá sẹ́yìn
target: She has not been allowed to visit him since his arrest ten months ago

input: Àtìmọ́lé ni Andrzej wà látìgbà tí wọ́n ti mú un.
target: Since being detained, Andrzej has been held in solitary confinement.

input: Orí ìdúró ló máa ń wà láti aago mẹ́fà àárọ̀ títí di aago mẹ́sàn-án alẹ́.
target: From 600 a.m.to 900 p.m., he is not permitted to lie down.

input: Ẹ̀ẹ̀kan lọ́sẹ̀ ni wọ́n fàyè gbà á láti fi omi tó ń lọ́ wọ́ọ́rọ́ wẹ̀ fún ìṣẹ́jú mẹ́ẹ̀ẹ́dógún.
target: He is only allowed to take a shower with hot water once a week for 15 minutes.

input: Fún oṣù mẹ́wàá tó fi wà láhàámọ́, wọn ò jẹ́ kí Anna ìyàwó rẹ̀ rí i.
target: Andrzej’s wife, Anna, has not been allowed to visit Andrzej for the ten months he has been in detention.

input: Lẹ́tà ni wọ́n fi ń bára wọn sọ̀rọ̀.
target: They can only communicate by mail.

input: Ọ̀pọ̀ ìgbà ni Anna ti kọ̀wé sí àwọn aláṣẹ pé kí wọ́n gbà á láyè láti rí ọkọ rẹ̀, ṣùgbọ́n wọn ò dá a lóhùn.
target: She has submitted numerous requests to visit Andrzej, but each time she has been denied.

input: Bá a ṣe sọ ṣáájú, ìgbà tí àwọn ọlọ́pàá àtàwọn ológun tó fi nǹkan bojú fipá ya wọ ilé Andrzej àtàwọn méjìdínlógún 18 míì nílùú Kirov ni wọ́n mú un.
target: As previously reported, Andrzej was arrested after local police and masked special forces raided his home and 18 others in Kirov.

input: Wọ́n fẹ̀sùn ọ̀daràn kàn àn torí ó ń kọrin ìjọba Ọlọ́run, ó sì tún ń ka ìtẹ̀jáde wa.
target: A criminal case was opened against Andrzej for singing Kingdom songs and studying religious literature.

input: Lọ́dún tó kọjá, wọ́n mú Andrzej àtàwọn arákùnrin mẹ́rin míì nílùú Kirov ìyẹn, Maksim Khalturin, ẹni ọdún mẹ́rìnlélógójì 44, Vladimir Korobeynikov, ẹni ọdún mẹ́rìndínláàádọ́rin 66, Andrey Suvorkov, ẹni ọdún mẹ́rìndínlọ́gbọ̀n 26 àti Evgeniy Suvorkov, ẹni ọdún mọ́kànlélógójì 41 sátìmọ́lé láì tíì gbọ́ ẹjọ́ wọn.
target: Along with Andrzej, four other brothers from Kirov 44-year-old Maksim Khalturin, 66-year-old Vladimir Korobeynikov, 26-year-old Andrey Suvorkov, and 41-year-old Evgeniy Suvorkov were arrested last year and placed in pretrial detention.

input: Àtìgbà yẹn ni wọ́n ti ní wọn ò gbọdọ̀ jáde nílé.
target: They have since been placed under house arrest.

input: Ní báyìí, ẹjọ́ Andrzej àti tàwọn arákùnrin mẹ́rin yẹn ti wà ní Ilé Ẹjọ́ Ẹ̀tọ́ Ọmọnìyàn ti Ilẹ̀ Yúróòpù.
target: Andrzej’s case, together with these four, is pending with the European Court of Human Rights.

input: Lọ́dún yìí, ìjọba orílẹ̀-èdè Rọ́ṣíà tún ti fẹ̀sùn ọ̀daràn kan àwọn arákùnrin méje míì ní Kirov, Yevgeniy Udintsev tó jẹ́ ẹni àádọ́rin ọdún 70 ló dàgbà jù.
target: This year, Russian authorities have opened criminal cases against seven more brothers from Kirov—the oldest is 70-year-old Yevgeniy Udintsev.

input: Ní báyìí, àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà tí wọ́n ń kojú ẹ̀sùn ìwà ọ̀daràn ní Kirov nítorí ìgbàgbọ́ wọn ti di méjìlá 12.
target: A total of 12 Jehovah’s Witnesses in Kirov are now facing criminal charges for practicing their faith.

input: Láàárọ̀ June 7, 2018, mẹ́wàá nínú ìyàwó àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà mẹ́tàdínlógún 17 tó wà lẹ́wọ̀n lórílẹ̀-èdè Rọ́ṣíà fi lẹ́tà ránṣẹ́ sí Mikhail Fedotov, tó jẹ́ agbani-nímọ̀ràn Ààrẹ Putin àti alága Ìgbìmọ̀ Ààrẹ Lórí Ọ̀rọ̀ Aráàlú àti Ẹ̀tọ́ Ọmọnìyàn.
target: On the morning of June 7, 2018, 10 of the wives of the 17 imprisoned Witnesses in Russia sent an open letter to Mikhail Fedotov, adviser to President Putin and chairman of the Presidential Council for Civil Society and Human Rights.

input: Ní February 25, 2019 a kọ̀wé ránṣẹ́ sí Ilé Ẹjọ́ Ẹ̀tọ́ Ọmọnìyàn ti Ilẹ̀ Yúróòpù ECHR, pé kí wọ́n tètè wá nǹkan ṣe sọ́rọ̀ Arákùnrin Sergey Loginov, ọ̀kan lára àwọn arákùnrin méje táwọn aláṣẹ fìyà jẹ ní ìlú Surgurt tó wà ní ìwọ̀ oòrùn ilẹ̀ Sàìbéríà.
target: On February 25, 2019, an application for urgent measures was filed with the European Court of Human Rights ECHR on behalf of Brother Sergey Loginov, one of the seven brothers who was tortured by officials in the western Siberian city of Surgut.

input: Wọ́n ti tú àwọn arákùnrin mẹ́fà tó kù sílẹ̀, àmọ́ Arákùnrin Loginov ṣì wà látìmọ́lé látìgbà tí wọ́n ti mú un, bẹ́ẹ̀, wọn ò tíì gbọ́ ẹjọ́ rẹ̀, wọn ò sì jẹ́ kó lọ tọ́jú àwọn ọgbẹ́ tó wà lára rẹ̀.
target: The other six brothers who were tortured have been released, but Brother Loginov has been in pretrial detention since his arrest and does not have access to adequate medical care for his injuries.

input: Ní February 26, ìyẹn ọjọ́ kan lẹ́yìn tá a kọ̀wé sí Ilé Ẹjọ́ ECHR, wọ́n fèsì, èsì náà sì dáa gan-an.
target: On February 26, just a day after the application was filed, the ECHR responded with a favorable ruling.

input: Títí di March 11, 2019, ìjọba Rọ́ṣíà ò ṣe nǹkan kan.
target: The Russian government has until March 11, 2019, to respond.

input: Ẹ̀ẹ̀kan lọ́gbọ̀n ni Ilé Ẹjọ́ ECHR máa ń ṣe irú ìdájọ́ kíákíá yìí, ó sì máa ń jẹ́ tí ẹ̀mí ẹni tọ́rọ̀ kàn bá wà nínú ewu, tí nǹkan sì lè bà jẹ́ kọjá àtúnṣe.
target: The ECHR grants such requests only in exceptional circumstances, when an individual is at risk of imminent and irreparable harm.

input: Ó dùn mọ́ni nínú pé Ilé Ẹjọ́ ECHR tètè wá nǹkan ṣe sọ́rọ̀ yìí láàárín ọjọ́ kan péré tá a kọ̀wé sí wọn.
target: It is therefore encouraging to note that the ECHR took this step and so quickly—just a day after the application was filed.

input: Ilé Ẹjọ́ ECHR sì sọ pé wọ́n máa rí i dájú pé àwọn fojú sí bí wọ́n ṣe ń fìyà jẹ àwọn ará wa.
target: The ECHR has indicated that it will closely monitor the abuse suffered by our brothers.

input: Lọ́wọ́lọ́wọ́ báyìí, Ẹlẹ́rìí mọ́kàndínlógún 19 ló ń jẹ́jọ́ ẹ̀sùn ìwà ọ̀daràn tí wọ́n fi kàn wọ́n ní ìlú Surgut, mẹ́ta lára wọn sì ti wà látìmọ́lé láì tíì gbọ́ ẹjọ́ wọn.
target: Currently, 19 Witnesses are facing criminal charges in Surgut, 3 of whom are being held in pretrial detention.

input: Bá a ṣe ń bá àwọn ará wa bẹ Jèhófà, ẹ jẹ́ ká máa fi ọ̀rọ̀ tó ń tuni nínú tí Jeremáyà sọ sọ́kàn pé Ìbùkún ni fún ọkùnrin tó gbẹ́kẹ̀ lé Jèhófà.​—Jeremáyà 177.
target: As we continue to supplicate Jehovah in behalf of our brothers,Blessed is the man who puts his trust in Jehovah, whose confidence is in Jehovah.—Jeremiah 177.

input: Ní June 6, 2019, ìyẹn ọ̀sẹ̀ méjì lẹ́yìn tí Arákùnrin Dennis Christensen pàdánù ẹjọ́ kòtẹ́milọ́rùn tó pè, àwọn alákòóso Rọ́ṣíà gbé e láti yàrá ìtìmọ́lé tó wà ṣáájú ìgbẹ́jọ́ rẹ̀ ní Oryol, lọ sí ọgbà ẹ̀wọ̀n tó wà ní àdádó, ìyẹn Penal Colony No.3 nílùú Lgov.
target: On June 6, 2019, two weeks after Brother Dennis Christensen lost his appeal, Russian authorities transferred him from his pretrial detention cell in Oryol to prison—Penal Colony No.3 in the city of Lgov.

input: Ìlú Lgov jìn tó igba 200 kìlómítà sí ibi tí àwọn ẹbí àti ọ̀rẹ́ Dennis ń gbé ní Oryol.
target: Lgov is approximately 200 kilometers 124 mi away from Dennis’ family and friends back home in Oryol.

input: Nígbà tí Dennis kọ́kọ́ dé ọgbà ẹ̀wọ̀n náà, wọ́n fi àbùkù kàn án, wọ́n sì gbìyànjú láti mú kó sẹ́ ìgbàgbọ́ ẹ̀.
target: When Dennis first arrived at the prison, he was subjected to insults and efforts to break his resolve.

input: Àmọ́, ṣe ni Dennis gbára lé Jèhófà pátápátá, ó sì fi hàn pé òun jẹ́ alágbára àti onígboyà.​—⁠1 Pétérù 5⁠10.
target: Yet, Dennis has relied heavily on Jehovah and has shown himself to be strong and fearless.—1 Peter 510.

input: Ní Finland láti apá òsì sí apá ọ̀tún Mark Sanderson tó jẹ́ ara Ìgbìmọ̀ Olùdarí, Irina Christensen, àti Tommi Kauko láti Finland
target: In Finland left to right Mark Sanderson of the Governing Body, Irina Christensen, and Tommi Kauko from Finland

input: Látìgbà tí wọ́n ti ti Dennis mọ́lé ni àwọn ara ti ń ti ìyàwó ẹ̀, Irina, lẹ́yìn tí wọ́n sì ń fi ìfẹ́ bójú tó o.
target: Since Dennis’ arrest and detention, the brothers have offered loving support and care for his wife, Irina.

input: Ní June, Arákùnrin Mark Sanderson tó jẹ́ ọkàn lára Ìgbìmọ̀ Olùdarí àti àwọn arákùnrin míì tó ń mú ipò iwájú ṣètò bí wọ́n ṣe pàdé Irina ní Finland ki wọ́n lè fún un níṣìírí.
target: In June, Brother Mark Sanderson of the Governing Body and other responsible brothers were able to meet with Irina in Finland for an encouraging visit.

input: Ó ti tó oṣù kan báyìí tí Dennis tí wà lẹ́wọ̀n yìí.
target: Dennis has been in the penal colony now for over a month.

input: Láìpẹ́ yìí ni wọ́n gba Irina láàyè láti máa bá Dennis sọ̀rọ̀ lẹ́ẹ̀kan lójúmọ́ lórí fóònù.
target: Irina was recently given permission to speak with him, once a day, over the telephone.

input: Wọ́n tún ti fọwọ́ sí i pé kó máa ṣèbẹ̀wò sọ́dọ̀ Dennis ní ọgbà ẹ̀wọ̀n.
target: Approval has also been granted for her to visit him at the prison.

input: Irina ń tún àwọn lẹ́tà tó ń fúnni níṣìírí tí Dennis kọ sí i kà
target: Irina rereading encouraging letters from Dennis

input: Pẹ̀lú gbogbo ohun tí Dennis àti Irina ti fara dà fún ọdún méjì sẹ́yìn, ìyẹn láti igba tí wọ́n ti mú u tí wọn sì tì í mọ́lé, síbẹ̀ wọ́n dúró láìyẹsẹ̀, wọ́n sì ń láyọ̀.
target: With all that Dennis and Irina have endured over the past two years since his arrest and imprisonment, they remain steadfast and joyful.

input: Irina sọ pé àwọn lẹ́tà tí Dennis ń kọ sí òun lọ́sọ̀ọ̀sẹ̀ máa ń gbé òun ro gan an ni.
target: According to Irina, the weekly letters from Dennis have been especially uplifting.

input: Ọ̀kan wà lára àwọn lẹ́tà yẹn ti Irina fẹ́ràn gan an, Dennis kọ̀wé pé A máa ṣàṣeyọrí tá a bá ń fi ojú tó tọ́ wo nǹkan, bẹ́ẹ̀ sì rèé àìmọye nǹkan tó ń fún wa láyọ̀ la ní.
target: In one of her favorite letters from him,Staying positive is a key to success and we have so many reasons to be joyful.

input: Ó parí ọ̀rọ̀ rẹ̀ báyìí Torí ká lè fi hàn pé Jèhófà la fara mọ́ pé kó jẹ́ Ọba Aláṣẹ la ṣe wà láyé.
target: Upholding Jehovah’s sovereignty is the reason for our existence.

input: Mo mọ̀ pé ọnà wa ṣì jìn, a ò sì tíì ṣẹ́gun.
target: I know that our journey is a long one and we have not won the victory—not yet.

input: Àmọ́, mo mọ̀ pé bó pẹ́ bóyá, à máa ṣẹ́gun.
target: But we will eventually come off victorious.

input: Ìyẹn dá mi lójú hán-ún hán-ún.
target: Of that I am 100 percent certain.

input: Ní July 21, ní àpéjọ àgbáyé tí wọ́n ṣe ní Denmark, Arákùnrin Lett tó jẹ́ ọkàn lára Ìgbìmọ̀ Olùdarí ka lẹ́tà kan tí Dennis kọ.
target: On July 21, at the international convention in Denmark, Brother Lett of the Governing Body read a message from Dennis.

input: Apá kan nínú lẹ́tà náà sọ pé Ó wù mí kí n wà pẹ̀lú yín ní àpéjọ yìí, ṣùgbọ́n ìyẹn ò ṣeéṣe báyìí torí pé mi ò tíì parí iṣẹ́ tí a yàn fún mi.
target: Which said,I wish I could be gathered with you, but this is currently not possible since I have not yet completed my present assignment.

input: Àmọ́, ó máa ṣeéṣe lọ́jọ́ iwájú, mo sì ń wọ̀nà fún un.
target: But it will be possible in the future, and I am looking forward to it.

input: Nígbà tí Pọ́ọ̀lù wà ní àtìmọ́lé ní Róòmù, ó kọ̀wé pé Mò ń dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ Ọlọ́run mi ní gbogbo ìgbà tí mo bá rántí yín nínú gbogbo ìrawọ́ ẹ̀bẹ̀ mi lórí gbogbo yín.
target: While under arrest in Rome,I thank my God always when I remember you in every supplication of mine for all of you.

input: December 21, 2018 ni Arákùnrin Arkadya Akopyan, máa fara hàn kẹ́yìn nílé ẹjọ́.
target: Brother Arkadya Akopyan will have his final day in court on December 21, 2018.

input: Apá kan nílẹ̀ Rọ́ṣíà tí wọ́n ń pè ní Kabardino-Balkaria ni arákùnrin tó jẹ́ ẹni àádọ́rin 70 ọdún yìí ti wá, ó sì ti fẹ̀yìn tì nídìí iṣẹ́ télọ̀.
target: The brother 70-year-old retired tailor is in the Russian Republic of Kabardino-Balkaria.

input: Kò dájú pé adájọ́ máa dá ẹjọ́ rẹ̀ ní December 21.
target: It is uncertain whether the judge will issue a verdict on December 21.

input: Àmọ́ tí wọ́n bá dá Arákùnrin Akopyan lẹ́bi, wọ́n lè bu owó ìtanràn tó pọ̀ lé e tàbí kí wọ́n rán an lẹ́wọ̀n ọdún mẹ́rin.
target: However, if convicted, Brother Akopyan faces a heavy fine or up to four years in prison.

input: Arákùnrin Akopyan wà lára àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà tó lé ní ọgọ́rùn-ún 100 tí wọ́n fẹ̀sùn ọ̀daràn kàn ní Rọ́ṣíà nítorí ohun tí wọ́n gbà gbọ́.
target: Brother Akopyan is one of over 100 other Jehovah’s Witnesses in Russia facing criminal charges for their faith.

input: Àdúrà wa ni pé kí gbogbo àwọn ará wa lọ́kùnrin àti lóbìnrin tí ìgbàgbọ́ wọn ò yẹsẹ̀ máa ní àlàáfíà tí Ọlọ́run nìkan lè fúnni.—Éfésù 611-14, 23.
target: Consequently, we pray that all of our brothers and sisters who are standing firm in the faith continue to have the peace that only God can give.—Ephesians 611-14, 23.

input: Láàárọ̀ kùtù April 10, ọdún 2018, àwọn tó ń ṣèwádìí àtàwọn ọlọ́pàá àrà ọ̀tọ̀, tí lára wọn fi nǹkan bojú tí wọ́n sì gbé ìbọn arọ̀jò ọta, já wọlé àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí ní ìlú Ufa, olú ìlú Bashkortostan, lórílẹ̀-èdè Rọ́ṣíà, wọ́n tú gbogbo ilé wọn yẹ́bẹ́yẹ́bẹ́.
target: Early in the morning of April 10, 2018, investigators and special police forces, some wearing masks and carrying automatic weapons, raided and searched the homes of several Witnesses in Ufa, the capital city of Bashkortostan, Russia.

input: Wọ́n mú Arákùnrin Anatoliy Tolya Vilitkevich, àwọn aláṣẹ sì fì í sí àtìmọ́lé láì tíì gbọ́ ẹjọ́ rẹ̀.
target: Brother Anatoliy Tolya Vilitkevich was arrested, and the authorities are holding him in pretrial detention.

input: Àwọn arábìnrin márùn-ún láti ìlú Ufa, tó fi mọ́ Alyona, ìyàwó Tolya ròyìn ohun tó ṣẹlẹ̀ nígbà tí wọ́n já wọlé wọn.
target: Five sisters from Ufa, including Tolya’s wife, Alyona, recount how the raids have affected them.

input: Máà bínú, ètò tó o fi ń wo fídíò kò ṣiṣẹ́.
target: Sorry, the media player failed to load.
